reviews.review: Excellent tour recomended for all tourists visiting Budapest for the first time. This free walk tour around Budapest takes only 3-3.5 hours, but it still manages to cover all the major tourist attractions. I have visited both General and Connubist historical tours and I am looking forward to take part in Jewish District tour too. What I like most is a friendly approach of guides, their language skills and preparation. The tour creates an international atmosphere and the guide always tries to devote some attention to every participant. If you are interested in cultural / historical / architectural aspects of Budapest, you should not miss the opportunity to take part! Moreover, it is totally free (based on tips only), which will fit any budged.
good overview of the city. guide kept us interested throughout and gave us good understanding of where key things in city are. Glad we did this on our first day
A great introduction to the city. Our guide was very friendly and gave an interesting tour of some of the city highlights. A grear way to hear about some of the city history.
Informative and #views. Loved our tourguide and we learned a lot about the culture and history! Was a lot of walking, but worth it to see all of the most popular spots in Budapest.

Amazing free walking tour of Budapest. Our guide, Regi, was fantastic. She was friendly, knowledgeable, informative and enthusiastic with nice information regarding the sites as well as the country and city as a whole. A wonderful overview to this beautiful city and I would recommend this tour to everyone. I hope they would do a longer walking tour or another tour to cover Gellert Hill as well, so that we would be able to see the Citadella. But overall, fantastic experience. Thank you!

nice tour but not suitable for stroller. the tour is very nice and Brigi was nice and informativehowever, we came with a 9 months old baby in a stroller and she didn't tell us there will be (many many) stairswe were a bit disapointed

Engaging, Andras was clever and funny... kept us hanging on his every word.. Walked about 2 miles lots of stops to talk and see the views. Good overview of the city and general history/ bits about political situation.

Free walking Tour - Budapest. Brigi did a fine job. The history is very complicated and this tour provides a good introduction to the city. These trips run on a tip what you want basis. There were 30 or so of us and Brigi managed the crowd and kept us moving. Good value, for sure.
Excellent way to discover the main sightseeing.. Brigi was our guide, she has deep understanding of Budapest history and main attractions, go there and you will learn a lot and enjoy the city.

Amazing. I advice all people to try this walking tour, it's amazing you can see everything, and hear the story of every building, it gives you an outline to everything in Budapest so you can decide later what you should see in details and do next, my guid tour was a student nice girl, she was really nice and informative, I was excited when she told me that Rubik's cube is a Hungarian invention.

Free Walking Tour with Brigi. What an interesting and insightful way to spend a morning in Budapest. We were lucky enough to be shown around by Brigi, who was full of facts and fascinating information about so many aspects of the history of Budapest, the people, architecture, food, social change as well as helping us understand some of the more traumatic events to affect Hungary. This tour was a brilliant addition to our holiday and we cannot recommend Brigi highly enough, we have done several of these types of tours in other countries and found Brigi to be absolutely excellent and extremely approachable and very friendly. Thank you!!!!

Great tour !!!. Great tour - BRIGI our guide was brilliant and spoke excellent English -cannot recommend this enough!!! Walk took in all major sites and BRIGI covered the history of Budapest alongside info about monuments etc...Lasted approx 3 hours at a nice pace and even included short stop for coffee/ toilet break.

extraordinary!!!!. definitely recommend it, without this tour your budapest travel will missing really important facts. thanks to our guide Brigi, she even recommended important attractions, local restaurant, festivals, nightclubs etc. to see. she also explained budapest histıory very briefly and enjoyable. she shared memories that her own family lived. Thanks to her once more :)
Great walking tour. Laura was a great guide! A very good start to understand the city and Hungary history. Everybody should start the city visit here.

Budapest tour and Budapest Jewish quarter tour. I did the 2 tours in the same day, one in the morning, the other in the afternoon. The Hungarian guide, Ursula, knew very well the topics. Her English was very good. She was able to explain centuries of Hungarian History in a nutshell. Very good introduction to this fantastic city. I only wish I had taken the tour earlier in my stay, as it is a very good introduction to the main attractions of the city. At the end of the tour, the guide, Ursula, was available for personal guidance such as where to go to eat, dance, rent a bike....It is really free. A contribution of 10€ is suggested, but you can give any amount you want (really). I recommend these tours for first time visitors.

Start your stay in Budapest. These free walking tours are guided by enthusiastic knowledgeable young locals. They are happy to answer questions along the way and the tours provide a wonderful overview of the subject matter . Orsi was our guide for the general tour, taking us from City Center in Pest to the Castle in Buda,explaining along the way in a pleasant banter. We learned relevant history and interesting factoids. Andris tooktour us on the Jewish quarter . He is equally knowledgeable and interesting The subject matter is difficult but he was respectful in the description of the atrocities and included interesting facts about the neighborhood also.Be certain to be generous in your gratuity so these tourscontinue for others to enjoy.
Fantastic walking tour that was free!. Great Hungarian history introduction, a few commonly used words, very pleased with the English tour guide!

Good and informative tour. "George" was a knowledgeable and friendly guide whose unruffled style suited a mixed tour of between 10 and 12 people.Tour lasted about 3 hours but that was by common approval and 30 minutes longer than billed.Two young guests left without tipping part way through the tour but George made nothing of it and wished them a nice day!The tip is of course payment for the guides services but entirely at guests discretion.

A Fantastic and Comprehensive tour of One of Europe's most beautiful Cities. The Tour was absolutely fantastic and comprehensive covering all the major attractions that can be covered in a 3 hour walking tour. I would like to give a very special shout out to my guide "Fortuna" who was a really good tour guide and gave every attraction we visited a proper interval to soak in the vibe and enjoy the place.I highly recommend this great tour.

Great way to learn the history and see the sights. Our tour guide Ursula (Orsi) was great and with enthusiasm shared her knowledge of Budapest past and present. This was both interesting, informative and fun.
Fantastic tour. Was a very nice experience with a very knowledgeable guide (Gabor). We have a relaxed walk, learned about the history also some more recent facts. Plus good tipps for food and drinks.

Personal perspective. This was a great tour made even better by the personal perspective Orsi was able to give to the story. History comes alive when it's shared by someone with lived experience of the period. She crammed interesting history and detail into each stop of the tour which means you really get your money's worth, but the pace was sometimes a little hard to follow, even as a native speaker. Might not be the best tour for speakers of English as a second language, but it certainly delivers passion!

Great start to see the city. Erika was our tour guide and she is very articulate and insightful. A lot of anecdotes and historical tidbits were shared! This tour is a perfect way to get a sense of the city and how to go around. Hence, it is a highly recommended first day activity in Budapest.

Tour. The guide (Ursula) was kind and explained everything very well. There were bathroom breaks during the wall and she made sure we were all as comfortable as possible and enjoying the city. Besides, in the end, she took time to help each one of us figure out what we were doing for the rest of the day and gave tips about the city. If you are in Budapest and you don't mind walking a little bit, it's a wonderful way to know more about this wonderful place. And while the tour is free, remember to be generous when tipping your guide :)
Great tour. Took the free tour at 14:30. Very good tour and a great way to get to know the city. Got to see some magor attractions. Highly reccomend

Great general tour of Budapest with Niki. I can highly recommend the tour! Take it on your first day in Budapest - you will get a great starting point to discover the city more late. Our guide Niki was great! She was friendly and knew a lot about the city. We met in front of the cathedral and although the group was really big, everyone could hear what Niki was saying. It was very hot, but Niki always found us a place to sit down in the shadow. She even arranged for a bathroom and water bottle break in the middle of the tour. Thanks Niki!

Friendly and informative . Our guide, Ursula, is very friendly. She make a long walk up to Budapest palace seems much more manageable by breaking down into many timely breaks of history and information briefing. Very enjoyable leisurely walk.
Amazing. It is a good way to Know Budapedt. We enjoyed a LOT with Martina our guide. IT was a 2:30 Guided tour. If you can you must go.

Funny and informative - what you can want more?. I had many Tours but for this one with Krisztina I can say that was one of the best. Every minute was very interesting, funny and very informative. Especially about the interesting facts that you can't find just like that... on Google :-) I really recommend this Tour and Krisztina as a Tour guide.

Very good walking tour by knowledgeable guide. Our guide was Brigi - Very knowledgeable and informative, with excellent english and directions. The group was very large and this did lead to the tour being 'mass market' rather than feeling more personalised, but it was still very good overall. Please be aware this is not actually free, as with all these tours a substantial tip is expected afterwards - but is earn by the guide.

Really great English level, interesting and funny!! We even enjoyed a song at the end :). Sunny friday morning, even after 8h of train the tour did not suppose any boring or tiring thing thanks to the lovely guide which made the tour pleasant and tried to find all the shadows on the way.

Personal, Approachable, Informative. Tour was about 3 hours, nicely timed through the city with information on Budapest's history, language, culture, people and, of course, things to see and do.Orsi was so nice, spoke fluent English, and answered all questions - including ones at end of trip for people that wanted other ideas and recommendations. Was a great initiation for first morning in Budapest to get bearings on the city. Wish I would've had time to do the ghost tour.

Very informative. We had a blast. Our tour guide was awesome. It was around 2 1/2 - 3 hours long and the only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I think that they should do a pit stop in the middle to allow for bathroom break and we had a hard time initially finding the tour guide because all he had was a paper that said Free Budapest Tours (meet by the statue in front of Starbucks in Deak Ferenc ter). Other than that.....it was a GREAT tour! I would HIGHLY suggest that you tip your guide......sadly I saw too many people on our tour walk away without tipping or tipping VERY little.

Ghost tour - a must-do attraction !. We contacted "Orsi the Witch" via email and she responded promptly for a night tour even though our group was quite small. Fullly dressed as her fascinating character, she guided us through Buda at night time, delivering speeches about creepy and well-documented stories. She kept us entertained the whole time, fully in character, and interacting with us as we climbed stairs for an hour and a half - which went by so fast ! Orsi took time to answer all our questions, was really funny, careful, and did some recommendations in the end of the tour. This was one of the highlight of our stay in Budapest (which says a lot, considering how fascinating the city is !). I definetely advice you to join and share the experience !

Great way to see the sites. . The free walking tour was a awesome way to experience Budapest. Not too long so you don't get too tired, but it hits all the main things to see in about 3 hours. Our tour guide was Regi and she was really good. She's a born and raise local of Budapest and is very knowledgable of the city and the country. Great energy level and gave good info on places to eat, drink and visit that arnt the tourist trap places. It's definitely worth the time.
Very good and informative. The tour was very good, the guide friendly and well informed, we got to see a different part of budapest, and learn about it's history and culture

Rita was so enthusiastic. Our guide Rita was so enthusiastic and proud of her country, language, and history that she made the tour really interesting. She gave us all the information - without going into boring or too specific details - and helped me (and part of the 40+ group) fall in love with the city of Budapest.
Awesome experience. This free walking tour should be a must for those who visit Budapest, the guide was great, she make the visit interactive and I met fantastic people.

Great tour with Ursula!. I did the free walking tour with Ursula who was full of information and took her time at the end of the tour to answer all participants questions plus mark up their maps! Great tour!

AMAZING Free walking Tour. my friend and I were in Budapest for for two days and thought that we would kick of with a walking tour and learn some of Budapest history. We loved it SO much that we ended up joining the afternoon 'Red' communism tour. Well worth it and Ursula our tour guide was so knowledgeable and a local who could give you tips on anything you wanted for the rest of your tour. We would do it again in an instant!

Free walking . This tour was definitely worth it. Guide was amazing and gave us some good advice. got to see some amazing sights and gave you an idea of how to get around the city and what sights to see next

Fabulous 'Free' walking tour - well worth it! . This tour was a fantastic way to explore both sides of Budapest while learning heaps about the history. Our guide was enthusiastic, shared many interesting stories and brought the city to life. After the tour, as it had started to rain, she invited anyone who was interested to join her for lunch in a little hidden local restaurant that she frequents. The food was hearty and the cost low and it was great to end the walking tour sitting with other travellers and sharing our experiences. This tour is a must do if you want to get a solid orientation to the city and all that it has to offer. Budapest goes down as one of my top 3 cities in the world. Please take the time to visit - I have no doubt you will fall in love with it as I did.
Awesome tour of Budapest!. We would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who has just arrived to Budapest! Our guide Brigi was fantastic! Very helpful and knowledgeable! The tour was great fun!

Great Choice !. Me and my wife decided to go on free walking tour and we defiently did not regret that !We had amazing guide call REGI! She was enthusiastic and pasioned about hr City i recomend tha company in 100%! She left us with all info about places to go shops to buy souvenirs and how to avoid tourstic TRAPS :)

The best way to orientate yourself in beautiful Budapest!. We joined this walking tour early July and it was excellent. Our guide, a local Hungarian lady was informative and pleasant. Well worth joining!

A brisk tour of Budapest seeing some of the best sites. I would recommend this. It covered a number of the 'must-see' sights in both the Buda and Pest sides of town. It covered St Stephen's Basilica, Gresham Palace, Chain Bridge, Castle District and Fisherman's BastionThe guide, gave us a good feel for the history of Budapest and of Hungary through the years and recommendations for other places to visit.Plenty of opportunities to ask questions and some good money saving tips provided. At the end of the trip took the #16 bus back from the Castle to Deak Ferenc Ter as recommended by our guide.Recommended.

Very fun. Our tour guide Norbit made the tour fun and engaging, helping us get a real feel for the character and history of Budapest. He also showed us a cheap place to eat at the end. The tour also helped us plan the rest of our visit.

A wonderful tour through history.. Our guide, Regi, was very enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. She shared 2 hrs of Hungarian history with us in an entertaining manner and I would definitely recommend this tour.

informative tour with enthusiastic guide. My 12-y-o son and I went on this walking tour and really enjoyed it. The guide was very enthusiastic about Budapest and Hungary and did an excellent job of sharing her passion for the city. She was also knowledgeable about the history and was happy to share her personal stories.

Really nice walk to know Budapest!!!!. It is a nice walk of 3 hours (aprox) discovering the main points of this city. A very positive thing is also the comments of the guide that tries to help and support you recommending places to go.
Great Experience. I recommend This Tour. Good Option to get a little knowledge about this great City. Also Have a good TIme!

One good and one not so good experience. We did the July 4 morning tour of Budapest free tour and was a great over view of the sites in Budapest and a bit of history. You don't see anything in depth but gives good information for you to return and investigate on your own later. Our group began as a very large one - maybe 30 people - but they had two guides there to separate the groups should that happen which was very nice. We tried to hook up with the afternoon Jewish Tour and no guide showed up! Very disappointing as there are many free tours to be had so unlucky for us.

The route was very interesting as it went through some wonderful sites.. The walk was nice. We went from the town centre to the more hilly part of the city, visiting some beautiful sceneries. The explanation of the guide was clear and it varied from myths and jokes to the history.

Great tour. We had a great tour overall. We took the spanish tour, and it was very interesting but it felt like it was all memorized. You get a great view of the city, it was very hot but the guide made sure we were always on the best conditions available. She was very nice! It is a great way to spend your time and see the city!

Budapest Monuments and Building. You'll get to pass trough the main(coolest bridge) of Budapest, the chain bridge. From there you go up hill, though a green area, untl you hit the Budacastle area. Not only you'll see all the cool buildings up there, but you also will be able to enjoy a great view of the city.
Amazing tour guide!. She explained everything perfectly, giving us advice about anything we asked. I totally recommend it for any kind of group and tourists!

Good and a must have, but not as good as sandemen. Going there early on your visit gives you a good glance at the city and important places to visit, as well as a good glance at the history of Budapest and Hungary.Also, the guide is very nice and considerable.

Great introduction to Budapest and its history. We took the Pest tour one day and the essential tour to the Buda side the next as we enjoyed the first one so much. Both guides were very knowledgeable and friendly, with different styles and personal anecdotes. They made sure that we visited the highlights of the city, but also got to see a few secrets that we would have missed otherwise. They were also happy to answer any questions about what to see and do while staying there, or about city's history. Definitely recommended, especially for first time visitors!
Perfect guided tour. We took a guided tour through Budapest and we were told old the information in a very pleasant way. Very motivated guide knew all the relevant information.

Great tour ! Must do when you are here !. I came to this tour as it was my mum's first time in Hungary / Budapest and we really enjoyed this tour very much, despite it's my 4th time in Budapest so I am very familiar with the city and attractions already and already been on a different tour last year (different tour group to this one) but anyhow I really enjoyed this tour and nowhere near being bored of the city, our guide Orsi is very knowledgeable and informative telling us a brief history of Budapest/ Hungary and recommendation of what to eat / where to go and other point of interests in our own time, I would recommend this tour definitely if it's your first time in Hungary or like me if you already visited many times !
Smart guide. Big group, but despite that the tour was nice and the guide was very knowledgeable. A good introduction to the city.
Really good tour. The tour was really nice, full of history and curiosities, the guide was very nice and helped us a lot with our questions about the city and another things to do.

A must when arriving Budapest. A bit tiring tho. (Red umbrella Tour). The Tour is really informative and takes you through all the main spots in town. The guide I had was Brigi and although she is Hungarian her English is really good. Bad things to have in mind though, the tour gets a bit boring cause the guide tries to give to much information and is not very well paced in her speaking, that makes it a bit too long. Nevertheless she is super helpful and kind in giving recommendations about anything in the city.

Nice, informative, however slower pace than we would have liked it.. It was great to meet a local tour guide who cared about our stay and gave tips on keeping safe, where to go and places to avoid. This helped us over the next few days.Walk was slow, with too many stop and go, probably better to have had a smaller group of tourists. Recommend the tour as it gives you confidence over the city.
Excellent guide, very smart and kind. We went to many different places with our guide and she always tried to make us feel comfortable. Definitely I recommend her.

A gentle introduction to the city. It was a fairly small group, which was good. Our guide was informative but sometimes distracted with phone calls. Not as much 'fun' as similar walks I've taken in other cities. We were given tips on where to eat and about popular bars and attractions to visit later.The pace was gentle so not difficult to keep with the group.

Orsi's tour was really interesting and exciting!. I took part in a very great tour, which was guided by Orsi. It started at the Deak Square and we were walking to the Buda Castle over the Chain Bridge, the view was really impressing! Our tour guide, Orsi was very friendly and she told us lots of amazing stories about the city and the History of Hungary with excellent English. I really enjoyed this tour and highly recommend it to anybody. Thank you!

High quality with a lot of fun. I had visited Budapest already before but my recent visit was made exceptionally memorable by the free tours I have taken. I was lucky to have such an energetic and knowledgeable guide as Orsi, who has the amazing capacity to summarise the entire turbulent Hungarian history in 15 minutes without being boring and showing us how relevant all this is for the present. She rounded up the Castle tour with a beautiful folk song and recommendations for all generations - she even met us later in the evening in one of the bars for a fantastic folk dance party with live music, apparently a UNESCO cultural heritage! Don't miss out on the experience of her tour when you visit Budapest!

A really competent and interesting tour in Budapest! Thank you, Orsi!. With her profound knowledge of Budapest Orsi enables every visitor to get a wonderful insight. Her friendliness and excellent English makes it easy to learn more about this city. She is helpful and patient with any questions and she gives great ideas what to do.
Free tour Budapest. The tour in Spanish language was fantastic. It helped us to have an overview of the city. The girl who guide us was very nice.

Excellent Communist tour. On a very brief recent visit to Budapest I was recommended by my host to go on the communist tour as on previous visits I'd been on other tours with this company.All the tours were excellent but somehow this seemed to be excellent xl! The guide, Orsi, who I had been guided by before, showed a fantastic depth of knowledge about this dark but fascinating time of Hungary's history and it was obvious the amount of research of history and politics she had done and obvious too that she had spoken to many people who had experienced these times by the wealth of personal feeling and thought provoking detail she was able to convey. From the depths of the hard times of iron rule from Moscow to the thawing and eventual demise of Communism this tour is a real eye opener to anyone but especially those of us that remember those times from our side of the Iron Curtain. The lines from the poem 'One Sentence on Tyranny' by Gyula Illyes, a Hungarian poet and novelist, that Orsi quoted, are worth reflecting on and re-reading afterwards to recall Orsi's passion for this tour. Join it, learn, appreciate and tip well!

Free tour. The guide was really prepared and provided very interesting information about Budapest in a quite fun way. Loved the fact that he had small papers prepared with typical local dishes and he was always ready to answer all the questions that arose. Really a nice guy!

Worst experience ever.. After doing a number of walking tours all over Europe, we decided to check out the free walking tour of our own city, Budapest. As we are not natives to the city, we figured it would be so much fun to learn some fun facts and stories that only a tour guide could tell.Upon arrival, when the tour guide (Andi) realized that we are in fact Hungarians, the first response was that this tour might not be for us. A bit surprising, but we explained that we would like to see what the Budapest tour is like, after having done a lot of the other cities by free walking.After a while Andi approached us and asked us if we were tax inspectors, because if we are, then she would send all the folks away immediately.Shocked, we clearly stated that we were no tax inspectors, we just want to see the city, as we have been living here only for a couple of years. She nonetheless insisted that we are tax inspectors, and she does not have her receipt book with her at the moment, so we might as well just admit that we work for the tax authorities.After some further explaining ourselves that we are really not working for the authorities and have no intention to impose fines, just to have a good time, she was still unconvinced.We just decided to leave, and have a walk in the city by ourselves.Never ever have I felt more humiliated in my own country.

very nice tour!!. my mothertongue is spanish and I appreciate the fact that the guide was a local girl who speaks really good spanish!! not only that, she was nice and get your attention easily!! I´m not sure of her name, I think it is Martina or something like that but I do recommend this company!
Great tour with Andi!. We had Andi as our guide and she was amazing a very fun and happy person:) She told a lot of interesting things about the city and the history of the city.

Two wonferful hours with Andi. I was there with my friends and a special person carry us to visit the best things in Budapest, the buda hills, S.Steven, s. Mattia, the palace of president and a hotel in art nouveau style. It was very interesting and she's very kind. The guide is free, only a tip is enough!

Excellent tour. Very nice tour, and very friendly and easy going guides. They provided centuries of information in a nice and accessible way for us to understand. Totally recommendable, I would say it is a must. Thank you very much for such a great experience.

Nice experience!. Free tours are a really nice way to learn a little bit of Hungarian history,understand the statues and buildings around and meet new people who love traveling and learning.Brigi was really sweet and took us for a coffee and for a wine to great non touristic places.Great way to spent your morning!

Brilliant start to our trip!. A great tour to give us a comprehensive but accessible introduction to the city. Our guide was lovely and friendly, clearly passionate about her city and more than pleased to offer personal recommendations. So pleased we went along!

So pleased I did this. I forced myself out of my warm apartment on a cold and rainy day to do the Communist Walling tour. Boy, I am so pleased I did. Our guide was Brigi and she help me captive from the start. We were a small group of 6 brave folk from all over the world, by the end we were friends. I appreciated Brigi taking us to a retro coffee house half way through to get out of the cold and rain for a beautiful coffee and strudel, here she showed us relics from the communist era including little books on Lenin and Stalin and the badges people had to wear. After the tour she took to an underground wine bar which was an absolute highlight. I would have never have found this place without her. Thank you Brigi, I will recommend this and you to all of my clients who come to Budapest.

Excellent introduction to Pest. We opted for this walking tour immediately upon our arrival in Budapest. We thought it would be a good way to orient ourselves to the city and we weren't disappointed. Brigi, our guide, was excellent. It is impossible to separate the major "sights" in Pest from the countriy's tumultuous history in the last two centuries. In less than two hours with Brigi, not only did we have a sense of our location, but the beginnings of an understanding of the Hungarian people and the challenges they have faced.
Martina was amazing!. Thanks Martina for such a great free tour. We saw most of the beautiful parts of Budapest and we learnt a lot of interesting things about the city.

Interesting and enjoyable tour with Martina. It has been the first guided tour that I have done because was my first travel to a foreign country. I did not know how it could be and i am very pleased. The guide, Martina, was very enjoyable and told us very interesting information.I recommend this kind of tours because are very instructive and the guides are very nice.

Very nice guide. The guide was very nice and very interesting. A lot of information and very beautiful places. Ursula was very nice guide with a good english she explaid us a lot of stories about budapest

Fascinating tour with Ursula. It was our first day in Budapest and this walking tour was a great way to get oriented to the city. Ursula was a super guide, enthusiastic, knowledgeable and offering all kinds of information about the best way to enjoy Budapest life.

Informative, interesting and a great way to see Budapest. As someone who always goes on walking tours in European cities my expectations are always probably a little higher than people who do not regularly use them. Thankfully, this tour did not disappoint! The tour guides (although Hungarian) spoke excellent English and even adopted the dry sense of humour to go with it!It was a 2.5 (ish) hour walk and went from Pest over the Chain Bridge to Buda and the lovely historic buildings it has to offer (as well as beautiful views). Our guide (Norbert I believe) was very informative, passionate about his city and taught us a lot about Hungary's history, some of which a lot of us were not aware of. I came away having enjoyed a lovely walk around a beautiful city as well as having expanded my knowledge about Budapest. The only thing I would say is be prepared to walk up a fairly steep hill to see the beautiful views!

Great Tour with Andrea!. We did the Faith & Terror tour with Andrea and can really recommend it! We learned loads of interesting facts about Budapest and its history and enjoyed our 1,5h trip a lot! Andrea is both: very kind & friendly and knowledgable. She also gave us fantastic tips concerning activities in and around Budapest plus some advice on good restaurants and Cafés serving delicious Hungarian food. :)I can only recommend doing the tour! Thumbs up!

Great tour with mix of monuments and history. Excellent local guide Brigi, gave a coherent and interesting tour highlighting history and recent events with good recommendations of other activities in Budapest.
Excellent tour and guide!. We spent a really good time in the tour! We learnt lots of things about Budapest, it was a really good overview of the city in a perfect rythmic. Thanks a lot Rita! :)

A MUST if you visit Budapest. We took the English speaking tour with Andi and she was fantastic. The tour was informative, interesting and held our attention the entire time. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes.

Don´t miss it! High Quality guided tour. Thanks a lot Urszula. We really enjoyed the free guided tour with URSZULA! She is local and knows the city very good. We just can highly recommend this tour for guest from all over Europe because the guides are multilingual. Just look for the red umbrella at the Deak Ferenc ter, centrally located in Pest. Accessable with all kinds of public transport. Kössönöm szepen. Greetings from Germany, Dietmar & Anna

Knowledgeable and friendly tour guide!. Brigi was our tour guide for the Budapest walking tour today and she was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable. She explained all the important things thoroughly and was very patient with any questions we had. I highly recommend!

Ok but better to branch out on Own. We decided to do the free walking tour after a great one in Prague. Unfortunately the one in Budapest was not up to the same standard. I guess it depends on the guide, unfortunately ours was not good. She knew the sights we saw but the group we were with found the information too much and uninteresting. I guess personality plays a big part and unfortunately our group found the guide, dull and gave too much information about a few things. instead of a little about a lot.

Awesome. Ursula is a great guide! She is wonderful story-teller and kind, good person in general. Non-boring excursion with useful tips and stories. She knows a lot about her country and city - it is a pleasure to have a city tour with this kind of person, who loves the city so much! And in the end she sang a wonderful song in Hungarian. That was so so lovely! Despite it was a bit cold, it didn't spoiled the city tour. Lots of hugs to our wonderful city guide Orsi! No regrets by attending the tour. Guys are doing great job, thank you so so much, and thank you Orsi! Good luck to You, one of the best representatives of Hungary :)
Nice walking tour on a good winter weather. We were really lucky because weather was awesome for walking tour,guide was good talker,she told us a lot about Hungarian history.
Totally recommended. Great experience, great guide Martina in a great place! I totally recommended to do it if you wanna know Budapest.

A vibrant city. Take the time to see the Buda and the Pest parts. There are many places to view: the National Opera House, Heroes Square, the Parliament, the hilltop castle, and chain bridge to name a few. There are lots of shops and places for something to eat. A wonderful place to visit.
Very good. You go to the most famous city sights without become tired and you have the chance to meet new people. At the end you give to the guide any money you want there is not a specific fee.
Great communism tour with Brigi. Lovely company, awesome facts. An overall amazing tour. I strongly recommend it to anyone interested in learning fun facts about Hungary's history.

Best tour I have ever had!. It was first time that a guide making me feel that I never had a proper tour before. So I far I traveled to 21 countries in Asia, Europe and Africa. This tour was absolutely the best one I ever had. Orsi, yes, this is the name, I asked to write me the name because I really wanted to share the experience. Orsi was our guide, such a friendly person, answered all questions to the very deep levels, such knowledgable, dynamic and smiling person who made us feel very warmed and comfortable even when it was almost zero degrees in town. She always made sure everyone is following, listening, hearing, understanding, and surely laughing with her jokes. It was best decision in Budapest to take this tour. Too bad the video I recorded has problems with the sound but I really wanted to share how she ended the tour: she sang and danced exhibiting traditional Hungarian art (or Magyar as she explained the common worldwide mistake). The tour is highly recommended. Oris, thank you, you made our visit just perfect!

Excellent insight in to the city of Budapest. We joined this free tour on the first morning of our short break to Budapest. We were hosted by Andi who was an excellent guide for our 3 hour tour. She was full of useful facts and information and provided good advice for making the best of our remaining time in Budapest. This is a great way to start a visit. It is a 'free' tour but you are expected to provide a donation to cover the cost of the tour. This is fair enough and is a great way to take in the city with a real expert who is enthusiastic about her subject.

Great tour with Martina. We went to the most important places in Budapest. Martina told us very interesting things about the history of Budapest and others tips of the city, like restaurants, pubs, etc. It was a very good experience!!

Great introduction the sights and history of Budapest. We just turned up for this free walking tour on our first morning in Budapest as we thought it would be a great introduction to the city. Firstly the guide was easy to spot with her red umbrella. Ursula (?) was really friendly and knowledgeable and as we were a small group of only 4 tourists plus the guide, it was easy to engage with her and ask questions. She gave us a brief history of the city and country which helped us understand so much more about Budapest and its varied story. We started on the pest side and finished up on the Buda side of the river. We were taken to interesting buildings and shown some wonderful viewpoints of the city and river. Ursula gave us very good ideas for other things to see and do in the city. I think our favourite bit was the Fishermans Bastion and the Matthias Church but it was all very enjoyable.

Wonderful tour with Adam. Adam was a fantastic guide. He took us on a thorough tour of Budapest and even put up with us taking our tourist-y pictures. There is a lot more history to Budapest than I could have imagined, and Adam taught and showed us so much. There were many things I would have simply walked by if he hadn't been there to make us stop and actually look. Like I said, wonderful!
Free walking tour with Benjamin . Excellent interesting and enjoyable tour with an talented tour guideWe had a good 3 hours Guid which gave us a excellent historical and highlight of Budapest.

Thank you Krisztina!!. I have just discovered an amazing and cheap way to visit a city: the free walking tour.I met the tour guide Krisztina in Budapest, just by St. Stephen church at h 10.30.The visit at the main buildings (not inside) lasted around 2h30'. We received a lot of interesting information and had a lot of fun. We nearly forget that it was a rainy day.

Krisztina, a great guide and a new friend. We met Krisztina by chance at the start of our stay, when she approached us to help us find our accomodation, also giving us a great tip about a free concert in the first two minutes of our acquaintance...then she invited us for a three hour tour of the city the following morning, which of course we joined and greatly enjoyed - she is very knowledgeable, interesting and funny, and was able to involve all people present.Not only that, we have started a friendship with her which I am sure will last!

2 Day Private Tour With Orsi!. I have to admit that I completely failed to write this review two summers ago when we were in Budapest. My apologies Orsi! My family spent two amazing days with Orsi and a driver exploring Budapest and beyond. We went a few hours away to the Slovakian border and back visiting amazing sites along the way. It was money well spent and I am trying to find an excuse to go back to Budapest to do it again. Orsi is the best guide you can ask for. Her English in not only impeccable, she is humorous and friendly. I can't recommend her enough. You really will be doing yourself a favor by hiring her and having a driver because you get so much more done it less time than you would by walking or taking the metro. Trust me...Just hire her!

Good for first day in the city. It was my first day in Budapest.And .I am very grateful toour guide for great impression about town.We spent two hours walking :started on Pest side and finished on Buda side.it was informative ,good English and worst doing.

A must do in Budapest. Our guide Orsa told us a lot of interesting facts about the city, the country and the people in Hungary. Also she recommended us some places to visit, some places to eat and have desserts. She really helped us to have a great adventures in Budapest.

Walking tour of Budapest. Very knowledgable English speaking guide who gave us a good description of Hungarian history as well as details about the many beautiful buildings as we walked from inner Pest across the Donau up to Budapest castle.

Wonderful guide and so helpful and informative. Great tour with a wonderful guide who was so helpful and informative. This your showed us the star attractions of Budapest and gave us the various options for exploring on our own afterwards

budapest ghost tour. Orsi is a great guide and awesome actress who is able to bring history to life in a very unique way, so to explore the dark backstreets of Budapest with their haunting stories was incredible experience thanks to her. My friends and I all loved this night tour, and if we return to Budapest, we'd love to explore it with Orsi again :)

General Tour of City. An interesting and informative trip from Pest to Buda hosted by Ursula, the blue eyed, red haired Celt. As well as a good few miles walk, we had a speedy trip through 1,000 years of history. Well worth doing to get a feel for what makes the country what it is today.

Best way to see the Budapest sights. My friends and I did this tour on a beautiful sunny Sunday morning, the starting point is easy to find in the big square with the wheel in it. Our guide (Orsis? Think it meant Ursula) was a lovely girl, knew EVERYTHING and was a pleasure to spend a few hours with her. The tour moved at a good pace, stopped for bathroom breaks and even finished with a little song, amazing! They work on tips only so allow around 10 euro (or more if you can spare it)

Free walking tour of Budapest. Great introduction to Budapest. Guide was very charming and informed. It was much better having someone explaining the history of the city in a nutshell, being able to ask questions and listening to anecdotal facts about life, monuments, history, customs etc while walking around. Would have really liked to have done the other tours too, had time permitted. Guide very helpful and approachable and well educated.Told us anything we wanted to know about Hungary in general.

"Ghost Tour Bonanza". The Ghost Tour consists of a walk on the Pest side, while discovering some of Budapest's and Hungary's darker history of criminal's past and twisted murder cases.An English speaking tour guide met us and showed us not only some typical Hungarian places and cafés but also taught us about the history of Budapest and also included some scary stories embeded in an acting performance during the walk.Overall, it was an extremely enjoyable evening with a very friendly tour guide and some very interesting stories.I absolutely recommend this to anyone who: -enjoys a walk in the night -enjoys scary stories -wants to experience a little tour of the  different kind

Great English guide, but Spanish guide had a bad attitude. Our English guide, Andrea, was great. We did both the morning and evening tours with her. The first time we tried to do the afternoon tour, the person who was supposed to be the English guide did not show up, but the Spanish guide was there. When I explained that I speak Spanish too, she refused to do the tour because there were only two clients. She then asked us if we had made reservations, which is not possible on the website. The next day, there was one Spanish-speaking client at 10:30, but she sent him away and then immediately left herself. By 10:35, six more Spanish-speaking clients had showed up, but had to be turned away since the Spanish guide was already gone.
overview of the city. Got an excellent overall tour PLUS put many things about the Hapsburgs and Austro-Hungary history into perspective.

An amazing overview of Budapest ... and Hungary's history. I took 2 walking tours, both very informative and interesting and presented in such a professional, yet easy, manner. Brigi took the Free Budapest Tour "From Pest to Buda Tour" where we walked across the Chain Bridge and up to the Castle and Presidential Palace. Her knowledge of her country's history and development was excellent, and her manner of presentation was faultless. The views from Fishermen's Wall are amazing. I can heartily recommend this as an orientation to a beautiful city. A generous tip for Brigi is a small price to pay for the value. Next day I joined Daniel for the Free Communist Tour "Faith-Terror-Communism" and he proved also to be a fabulous guide, so full of knowledge and stories of this era ... recent history of which I realised I knew few details. We stayed on the Pest side, walking from the Basilica to the Parliament. He interspersed his knowledgeable talk with family stories, making this history very real, and very recent. We finished with a walk to Danube's riverside and the poignant Shoe Memorial, a tribute to the Jews who were shot at that place in 1944/45 by the Arrow Cross Militiamen. Sobering. Again, I can heartily recommend this company, and feel that a generous tip to guides such as Daniel and Brigi are monies well spent. Very well-paced, very professional. Thankyou, Brigi and Daniel.

Great orientation and insight. We went on the tour on Saturday 19 September, and enjoyed it very much. Brigi was charming, informative and enthusiastic, and her 10-minute history of Hungary quite amazing! It did overrun a little - there's not really a proper break - so I think it would be good for them to consider that as Sandeman's free tours do, as it was well over 3 hours. That's a minor quibble though - very informative and entertaining tour.

Informative, personal tour. My friend and I took the free walking tour with Andie (sp?) who was a wonderful tour guide, and the communism tour with Brigi who interlaced her tour with personal anecdotes which we appreciated. Highly recommended.

A great introduction to a great city. We were guided by Andi, a lady who so obviously loves the city and her country, and were treated to a wide range of history, stories and a lovely rendition of a traditional song on the southern ramparts of the castle district. Although I am well travelled, I have never been into much of Eastern Europe before and have always wanted to visit Budapest, and Andi gave us a wonderful introduction to the main parts of the city. Nobody could relate the whole history of this city in two and a half hours, but I felt we had a well balanced selection of the major events, plenty of stops and any questions were answered without hesitation. Thanks Andi.
Very informative free tour!. Our guide was very knowledgeable and informative, the tour took about 2,5 hours with enough stops and breaks. Highly recommended.

Great tour, look for Regi!. We did a free walking tour with Regi and she was amazing. She taught us a few phrases, told us great stories and kept us motivated to make it up to castle hill. Highly recommend!
Decent introductory tour. Our guide was a bit shy and insecure, the tour in itself was a good first introduction to Budapest but did not provide much in-depth information.

A worthwhile activity. We went on a tour with Orsi and had a good time, it was an excellent way to get to know the city. We did the Buda to Pest tour and learnt a lot about the history. The guide had good English and was interesting, and was particularly helpful at the end of the tour giving our recommendations of what to do and where to eat for the rest of our stay.

Good tour. The city is really nice!!! A lot of history!! The guide was good! Gave a good overview of the city. Maybe can say more specific histories about the city, she talked a lot about the history of the country, which is nice, but more details about the city, I guess is better!!! :D But in overall is good!!!

Highly insightful and entertaining walking tours. I did both the general and communist walking tours and was very, very impressed with both. The guides were very knowledgable and kept the tour at a good pace, the 4 hours just flew!! We all learnt so much about Hungary's past and present, giving us a real insight into how the country has changed throughout its history. I was also really impressed with the general info pamphlet that was handed out at the end of the tour, it provided everything a visitor to Budapest would require and was invaluable for my stay.

Fantastic!. We went on both the communist tour and general your both were amazing! Guides had great knowledge in subjects and ran the tour as more of a dialogue so were more that happy for questions. The second most important thing for free tours for me is that the tour guides aren't constantly dropping "hints" about tips. This tour is fantastic in that way as they explain how it works in the beginning and only once more where they leave a box or bug for you to subtly leave a donation. There is no pressure or even "suggestion" of what to give, just what you can afford. It is a must do in my opinion even in the nearly 40°C weather!

Great introduction to Budapest. Our guide Orsi gave us a great introduction to Budapest in a tour that covered both sides of the city and quite an expanse of history! She kept a good pace and really provided a locals perspective of the city. Friendly and helpful she was happy to give directions and restaurant recommendations for our stay.

A great tour. Orrsi gave us a great tour of the highlights of Budapest and a brief history. She even finished with a folk song.
We did another similar tour by another company that was good also, but Orsi's was more enjoyable and the time flew by.

Interesting tour. our guide Andi was really nice, very knowledgable about the history of Hungary and Budapest which is very interesting. The tour is a good way to get your bearings at the start of your holiday
Easy and Interesting Tour. Great way to get an overview of lovely Budapest! Tour guide, Ursula, was knowledgable and extremely interesting.
Must-Do. A great tour highlighting a beautiful town. The tour guide spoke passionately, with clarity and wit, and answered every question we had.

excellent freetour. Karina is an excellent guide, is a great tour, we learn a lot of new things, Budapest is a beautifull city, the tour have a 3 hours of duration and cover all of the most important places in the city

Historical city & interesting tour!. Informative and interesting, it'd been awhile since I did a walking tour and I was glad I did the 2-hour walking tour in Budapest. It's rich in history and has lots of interesting facts. The tour guides were fun and interactive, and didn't push that huge pressure over and over again re: tipping as I've had on other free tours (but YES indeed you really absolutely should be tipping this people who are trying to earn a living!). Loved the little tidbits (did you know the rubik's cube was invented by a Hungarian?). Worth doing!

Great free tour!. Orji was a friendly and passionated tourguide. She was knowledgeable, stopped at all the places to get water, in this hot weather.Simply excellent free tour guide!All should join, because the guides can talk all day long about Hungary. We also joined the communismen tour which was excellent as well.

Attractive, absorbing and helpful info told by a brilliant guide. Me and my boyfriend we were happy to be guided by Ursula. Nice and spontaneous guide who told us interesting info of Budapest and Hungary in an attractive way. She also gave us helpful tips for eating and shopping in Budapest. We walked from Pest to Buda with a break to refresh ourselves. She spoke to us personally and helped us. We enjoyed the walk a lot and we highly recommend it!

Excellent free tour of the city! . We enjoyed our tour with Andrea! She was very knowledgeable, but still kept the tour light with some jokes! This tour was the perfect balance of seeing the sights, while also understanding the Hungarian culture and what makes Budapest unique! Highly recommend starting out your trip to Budapest with one of these tours! We wish we had time for some of the other tours as well!

Excellent tours with Birgi. I've joined 2 tours with Birgi.1. From Pest To Buda2. Communist something [ forgot the full title of the tou:( ].Both were excellent !!! Birgi is very informative and a nice person :)She took her time with us, telling stories and giving great tips and some insights ...I highly reccomed taking tours with her. Thank you Birgi, Budapest was much more interesting with your highlights :)And thank you " Free Tours" it is a wonderful project, both for tourists and for guides. I wish every city in the world would have such wonderful tours.Good Luck !!!Eve :)

Great Tour!. We did the Free Budapest Tour "from Buda to Pest" in English. The first 30 minutes seemed like a warming up for the probably quite new tour guide but after that it turned out to be a great tour with lots of historical and cultural information and also fun facts.

Fun tour with Orsi!. Orsi was a great guide! Really personable and had some great stories to tell! She was easy to talk to and was willing to answer questions and mark places on our maps. She also gave us a recommendation for lunch just after the tour near the castle that wouldn't break the bank!

Good on history and culture, but not actually much walking!. We took the morning (10:30am) general tour and lasted just over 3hrs with 1 brief stop for toilets/refreshments. There was 15-20 people in the group, mostly 20 and 30somethings.This was my first experience of a free city walking tour and I would do it again but there was more talking and less walking than I expected. Still it was a fun few hours and you cant really complain when it is 'pay what you want' anyway.Generally we would walk for 5/10 mins then stop for 15/20 mins as the guide gave some history/culture info. There was actually a lot of interesting info about the origins, food, language and people of Hungary - although I would have prefered to walk more and see more of the city.The guide herself was very friendly and her English was good, she did not push for tips and was happy to answer questions people had.

Ursula was great, hospitable, informative, and fun. The tour with Ursula was fantastic! She gave us a brief, yet exciting overview of Budapest, including language, culture, and history. She was so kind and willing to answer all questions. At the end of the tour, she sang a traditional Hungarian song and then hung around after the tour to mark up everyone's maps with places to go. Specifically, she recommended a Hungarian folk dance event to my friend and I. We attended the event a few days after the tour, and our guide not only recognized us, but she also offered us a ride home! She was a fantastic guide to the city and I would highly recommend her to anyone who visits Budapest!

Hungary Through Literature. The Literary Walk we did with Orsi was one of the highlights of our weekend in Budapest. Through snippets of literature we discussed Hungarian culture, politics, history, economics and more as we strolled through Budapest streets we had not visited previously. Orsi is thoughtful, eloquent and engaging. Our two-hour tour lasted close to three hours. Highly recommended!

Great way to know Hungarian history. It's a good way to know a little bit of Hungarian history while visiting the city. It has been a really good choice and the guide explained everything very good as well as making entertaining.

Budapest free tour. Rita was an incredible guide, she is kind, open and lead us along the history and architecture of the city in an entertaining and smart way. We learned a lot and decided to know further things that she mentioned in the tour. This was the best way of starting the visit to Budapest as well as other cities. Thanks!

Excellent introduction to Budapest!. We had a basic city tour with Brigi from Buda to Pest. The guide was very knowledgeable about history and the different parts of the city and showed true enthusiasm in sharing all the little bits and pieces as we walked through beautiful Budapest. Highly recommend this tour for all travelers!

Jewish community tour. The guide Anna she is very knowledgeable and particular. She has told us some personal stories and what it was like back during those periods throughout the history. Highly informative and very interesting. :)
free budapest tour. We did the Spanish tour with Martina. It was very nice and she helped us to know Budapest much better.High recomendable

It's worth it!. We had an amazing time with Martina. We did the spanish tour. She's from Hungary, though, but her spanish is perfect! I believe that the fact she's Hungarian is a real perk. She told us interesting facts about Hungary and Budapest and we had a great time during the tour.This tour is a must-do for anyone who wants to get an insight into Hungarian history and its people's. I highly recommend it!

Nice overview tour, great way to explore the Buda side. Our tour guide Brigitte was nice, knew a lot about her country, and took us on a walk that wasn't too fast or too slow. I really enjoyed it and appreciate that she could answer my questions. She didn't push for tips but was worth everything she got from us, which I hope was enough as it was a small group today. I'd signed up previously for a free tour with another company (thought it was this one) that met in a different location (Oktagon station). This was on a holiday Monday, and although I got a confirmation of the reservation, a reminder of the reservation, and a "how did we do" email after the reservation, in fact this tour didn't happen. A guy showed up and told us it was cancelled (after we'd wasted our time getting to the spot early). So then I signed up for this one and was very satisfied. It's important to know exactly which walking tour you're using, and I was confused at first. But this one, that meets at Deak Ferencia, is the one I recommend.

Great tour with an informative guide. Our tour guide, Ursula, was friendly and very knowledgable about the geography and history of Budapest. She seemed passionate about her job and did her very best to answer any questions we had. For a free tour, this was about as good as you could get!

Free walking tour of Budapest. Our tour guide Erica told us she was nervous as it was the first tour she had ever done. However her English was excellent and she was very clear. Her knowledge was good and the tour very informative. The pace was about right for us and we managed the walk up to the Royal palace with no difficulty. Overall an enjoyable experience and one I would recommend.
Communist tour . My guide was Bridget and she was excellent. Very informative regarding the history of the city as well as its communist past. Highly recommended.

Great waking tour. This was a brilliant, informative walking tour that I would recommend highly to anyone visiting Budapest. I also done the communist tour of Pest which runs in the afternoon and together these trips gave a fascinating insight into the culture and history of the city.

Orientation Tour. We took the Orientation Tour with our guide, Dora. Excellent tor that starts on the Pest side of town and ends up in the Castle District in Buda. Dora was very knowledgeable and sopke perfect English. The tour took around 2 1/2 hours and carried out at a very relaxing speed. It was ideal for our first day in Budapest and we were able to ask loads of questions on our lists of places to visit.

Worth it more... Coming free of cost. The team is a set of energetic ppl, with much knowledge.. Their explanations and conversation are crystal clear..they speak good English and keeps us really interesting even if it was history. We can give them tips alone.. N the best part of advise on places is.. They inform us the market rate and provide comments on over price and pretty costly things. I m fully satisfied with the guide and her tips are helpful.. Her name is Ursula.

Budapest history comes alive. We took the original tour with Vickie and the communist tour with Ursula. Both tours were fabulous and our trip was more meaningful because of it. Even our children found the tours to be great. They are 12 & 16. Don't miss these tours.

Good but not great. This was the first tour I took of Budapest and though it did a thorough introduction to the Buda side it didn't really go over the Pest side at all. I also felt that this "free tour" had more pressure on it to tip than other "free tours" I've done and felt awkward tipping, no matter how much I was giving. The guide seemed emphasized the economic issues throughout the tour and though informative it felt like she was dropping hints about tipping the entire time.

Great tour around best part of Buda and Pest. It is always great to walk with a local.She told a lot of interesting, important stories about the Hungarian history and present day. It was very interesting for me.They have shown not only very famous places, but also some interesting or funny things, which I wouldn't find by my own.

great tour. We did the faith, terror & communist tour with Ursula. It was excellent, she is a mine of information and so enthusiastic about the subjects. I feel that I know so much about the history of Budapest that I would never learn from reading about it. She made it enjoyable, I would definitely recommend it and only wish we had done the Buda & pest one too rather than go on the hop on bus. If I return that will be the first thing I do.

The perfect introduction to Budapest. Andrea was our guide for two walking expeditions: around Buda and Pest; and for the two-hour 'history of communism' tour. On both occasions, she led us through the tree-lined streets of Budapest, told us of its checkered history, and helped us appreciate its rich linguistic culture. She was a minefield of information, and was most patient when we had (a whole lot of) questions. She took great care of us, and our stay in Budapest would have been incomplete without her comprehensive tour.

Interesting and informative tours. This was a great way to get to know BudapestWe did the 2 1/2 hour walk round Pest and Buda and also the 2 hour communism walk.Both guides were really friendly and spoke great EnglishIts a great local company (of 8 people I think)Would highly recommend their tour

spooky and creepy. An interesting look at the alternative history of Budapest, the guide is very involved and in character the whole time, so much so that I wasn't sure how much of her creepy antics was real and how much was just acting. You'll get a good walk , hear some creepy tales, get a few laughs and have an enjoyable evening out.

Must see (or, attend). Our guide was Julia - she told us a lot of interesting, funny and unexpected things about Pest and Buda, tought us to tell some hungarian words, told us a lot of facts from the history and was able to answer all our questions! I am excited!

Interesting, informative & necessary!. This is a must do on your first day. Get to know the city, its history, and then, in your own time, go back, or explore the other walks/tours, or sights.Susan was fantastic!

Excellent walking tour. Rita was very kind and sympathetic..He explained everything about Budapest, and was very open to awnser all our doubts and questions.I really recommend have a tour with Rita (In Spanish).

Not enough time? take a "free" tour. We didn't have enough time in Budapest so decided to take a free tour with this local company. If you like walking and the weather is good enough, don't hesitate to do it. The appointment is every day at 10.30 at the Deák tér metro station - in the middle of the square, under the clock with the grey satue at its bottom (at M1-M2-M3 metro exit)Here is the Itinerary: Danube Promenade - Szechenyi Square - Chain Bridge - Clark Adam Square - Royal Palace (outside) - President's Palace - Castle Quarter - Matthias Church (outside) & breathtaking panoramic views of the Danube and it bridgesDora, our guide that day, speaks perfect English and gives information about local buildings and so on, things you expect from a local guide! Thanks to that tour, we were allowed to see the change of guards of the white house of BUdapest at 12.00. Very impressive. The Tour is free, meaning there are no fixed fees, but you are invited to give a tip according to the tour you just did. I recommend it if you don't have enough time and want to see the most of it, with a local touch and local opinion of the city.

Great introduction to the City. We did two of the tours. On our first day we did the Budapest walking tour lead by Julia. It gave us an overview of the city, some anecdotes and lots of information about the buildings and history of the city. Julia is a resident of the city and very knowledgeable and good-humoured and she waited around at the end of the tour to offer advice on places to eat, and which baths to visit.The publicity leaflet implies that the tour is aimed at (young) backpackers. Perhaps this is because there is a steep flight of steps leading up to the castle in Buda. I think the tour would be suitable for anyone as long as they were aware of the steps. Don't be put off if you are not a young backpacker.We also did the Faith, Communism and Terror tour led by Andrea who again was knowledgeable and used some of her own family's history to help us understand the 20th century history and politics of the city. We did this tour on our last afternoon so were unable to make the most of Andrea's experience - also it was a bit disconcerting for her as we'd already been to some of the places she suggested. I would recommend both tours - do them as early as possible in your visit.

Put on your list. Informative interesting and personal guided tour of local history in downtown pest. Not too much walking nor too long. Our guide Dorothy was very friendly easy to listen to and was happy to answer questions. With lots to do this should definitely be put on your list!
Best. Ursula did a great job, giving us all the MUST info about Budapest. It would be great if the you could be a little bit longer (including Andraszy boulevard and the Castle, Arthall..)

Best way to see Budapest. . Susan was a great guide. Very informative and knowledgeable giving a basic history lesson on Hungary and Budapest. Made me want to find out more. Her spoken English was excellent and very clear. She was always smiling even though it was blowing a gale and cold. I would thoroughly recommend the walking tour.

You're the Buda to my Pest. We were a small group of 5 so we took the tour with Dorothy! She was a great guide, she even stayed with us after the tour to gives us some tips since she is a local. I really recommend it.

Amazing Walking Tour in Budapest!. Zsuzsa is an amazing tour guide. Thank you so much for introducing us Budapest through your eyes. Very grateful for all the inside tips and funny stories! If you're in Budapest, make sure to take this tour!

FREE BUDAPEST TOUR. Rita was very kind and sympathetic with us. He explained everything really well and later she helped us to eat something typical and economic in budapest.i really recommend have a tour with Rita in spanish. she tries hard with her spanish.Alex Martín.
Excellent!!. Susana is great, she I very kind and we can see she loves her city, very helpful and she knows a lot :)

City tour and faith/communism history tour!. My husband and I did both of these tours, the 10:30 City tour (Buda) and then the Communism history tour (Pest) at 14:30. Both were excellent with different guides. They gave a great account of Hungary's history and the main attractions. Both guides were patient and answered all our questions, they even handed out free maps and gave suggestions of places to eat/drink/day trips/other places to visit etc after the tour. One guide (Ursula) showed us a little local hungarian bakery where we enjoyed a cheap snack afterwards. I would definitely recommend these tours, they meet in an easy central spot at Deak Ferenc Ter. You give a tip at the end, usually 10euro, which is fantastic value!
Modern History Tour. Great way to get your bearings on the city, very informative and interesting! Zsuzsanna was a lovely friendly guide

Guide Andrea Kevei is great!. After the first whole week in Budapest, the free tour on Sunday actually was my first time to be like a tourist. I was never expecting that it was exactly the tour and guide I want. I like art, architectures, statues, monuments and the like a lot, but more importantly, the history and stories behind those symbols attract me the most. The tour guide on Sunday afternoon, Andrea Kevei, kept telling a lot interesting stories during the tour. I would like to join you again in the next six months during my stay in BP. I also hope you offer some tour guide outside the BP, and I'm willing to pay for those stories. Put it in one word, Great!
Excellent tour. Really enjoyed this historical yet spooky tour from our witch guide! Would recommend this tour if you fancy seeing a different side to Budapest.

Fantastic. So we did this tour on our first day and found it to be a great introduction to Budapest. Dora the guide was extremely friendly and knowledgeable.Definitely worth doing if like us you have not done a huge amount of research on places to see.

Ghost tour. Absolutely fantastic. Tailored perfectly for our children of 5 and 12. Orsha (I hope that is spelt correctly?) was a most engrossing and entertaining guide you could wish for. Only regret is that we didn't get a picture with her but then again I'm not sure witches images can be caught on camera! Highly recommended.

Our tour with Andrea. Had a wonderful tour with our guide Andrea with a nice small group. Her knowledge and wit made for an excellent look at just a small part of a beautiful city. I hope to return and see much more. Thankyou Andrea
Great tour and great guide!. Really enjoyed this tour, full of interesting information but the best thing of all was the great tour guide! If you like tales of horror this tour is for you!

Really interesting tour around Pest with Julia. We found the tour really interesting and enjoyed it a lot! We received some very interesting information about the Hungarian culture and especially about the communist era. And also many thanks to Julia for the tips about where to go and what to do.

Good scary fun! - May 2013. My girlfriend and I took the Ghost Tour and were a little unnerved at first as we were the only ones to show up. The Ghost took us down several side streets while muttering strange things to himself and singing, only to then tell us to STOP! He would then relate to us some of the darker tales of Budapest from ages past (I won't spoil them here) before telling us to follow him to the next haunted spot. A lot of fun, pretty creepy, and perfectly executed! Don't miss this!
“Faith, terror and communism tour”. Thanks to Dora we had very pleasant time for few hours during cold day. We also got basic information about city and country
Orientation Tour and political tour. Orientation tour was very good. Interesting and fascinating. Dora was a very good guide. We went back the next day for the afternoon tour.
Comunism tour. Dorothy is a very good guide. Very friendly and professional! Although the weather wasnt as good as we expected, we enjoyed the tour very much! Strongly recommend to everyone :)

two free tours to know more about my city and a perfect way to introduce Budapest to my friends visiting it. I decided to take the general tour on first full day with my friends from US were in Budapest. I raise in Budapest but I am not a guide. We were so pleased that we also took the faith, terror and communism tour. All were fantastic. The local guides, Julia and Andrea were obviously enthusiastic about the history of their city and encouraged questions and discussion. Highly recommended.

free walking tour. really enjoyed the walking tour with Andrea, really informative,interesting and definitely made me gain more in terms of learning about the history and culture in Budapest. Thank you for all your useful advice on best places to eat was really nice to sample some good traditional hungarian food. Thanks again really enjoyed my stay in Budapest will hope to return again!!

Informative thanks Julia. Julia answered all my questions made our visit very enjoyable definitely will go again. food great the spa is an excellent experience should be no'1 on your things to do in Budapest

Amazing Pest tour by Julia. We were a group of 10-12 with Julia to go over Pest tour and it was one of best guided tour. We had adequate time to see everything from St Stephen Bazillica to parliament. She passionately explains the historical significance with element of humor. Must to do.

Great tour!. I had a great time on this tour, and learned a lot about the history of Buda and Pest! Our guide Julia was very enthusiastic, and incredibly knowledgable! She even sang a Hungarian folk song for us, twice! I definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking to get a good overview of Budapest.
free walking tour. The tour is interesting and the guide is very good. There are beautful places and Zsuzsanna very did her best to give us the tour in Spanish..

A must when visiting Budapest. The Pest tour with Julia- We liked it very much. Julia was very motivated and told us interesting facts, we recommend this kind of tour to everyone. It was possible to ask questions, 6 people only. I definitely recommend this tour!

Rita, our tour guide, was very good!. We went to Budapest early in January and after taking an AMAZING free tour in Berlin, decided to do the same in Budapest. Rita, our tour guide was very nice and did her best to give us the tour in Spanish. You can tell how passionate she is about her city and how much she enjoys sharing it with visitors. Overall, we liked it very much. My only recommendation would be that the tour is a bit more structured and informative. After finishing it, I did not feel we left with a lot of factual or historical information, which we would have appreciate it...maybe this is something Rita can improve for next time.

Fabulous!. Can't say enough good things about this free tour! Our guide Andrea was very informative. This educational tour left me with a deeper understanding and appreciation for the beautiful city of Budapest and it's amazing people!

Highly Recommended. A friend and I took both the Buda & Pest tours and we were really happy we made the decision. Although it was cold, we really got to see Budapest´s beauty and also have its history explained to us. For anyone who is in Budapest for only a short while, I would definitely recommend taking part in these tours!
Well worth the frozen toes. We took the Free Tour on a chilly morning around New Year's. Having Andrea as a guide gave a more meaningful and deeper view of the city.
Free Budapest Tours. It was great. Our guide Andrea was very nice and full of interesting and useful information about city, history and entertainment.
excellent tour. The tour is really nice ! It was very informative to learn more about the history of Budapest. And we also see very beautiful scenery during the tour ! Thanks very much !
Free Budapest Tours. Everything was well organised. Tour guide was helpful and showed main attractions of the city.......

Very good Pest tour. We took the Pest tour with Eva and it was really nice. She told us lots of things about Pest and she never lost her smile though it was cold and snowing. It was very interesting because she told us about recent history of Hungary but also about the architecture of some of the buildings.We highly recommend this tour and this guide :)

Perfect Buda tour. We took the Buda tour in Spanish with Zsuzsa. It was really nice, her Spanish was perfect, she told us lots of things about the city and its history and she gave us many opportunities to make a pause to take some pictures.We highly recommend this tour, it's really interesting and the guide was very very good :)
Free Pest walking tour. It was a good choice to take this tour. Andrea was excellent in explaining the historic of Budapest. She also helped us in planning to visit a few places by ourselves.
Nice ghost tour. Realy nice stories that tells you a little bit more about the City! I recomend it to see the other side of the City, the dark side!

Vey nice and friendly guide!. The tour is really nice, gives an overview of the most important places of the city. Martina is an excellent guide, she is very interactive and friendly. I definitively recommend this tour :)

Not to be missed. We went on the afternoon tour with Ursula who brought us around a freezing cold city, explaining a lot about its history, from the Basilica to the Ronald Reagan statue. Loads of interesting information in a 90min tour. I think we'll try the morning tour tomorrow.

Very informative. The tour was really informative, she had lots of information for us! was very willing to help out after with recommedations and suggestions of things to do! Was nice to tour over to Buda from the Pest side, she gave many opportunities for pictures at view points! Wasn't rushed at all, which is nice compared to some tours.

Excellent. We are so glad we had this tour. Our guide Orsi (Ursula) was perfect. So frendly, so kind, always with a smile on. Told us about the city things we could not found on a travel guide. After the tour she spend time with each one of us, answering questions, informing us with anything we wanted to know. Were to eat, drink, about night life, what to avoid. She is just GREAT. (Please Tip).

Excellent. We did the tour today and it was really good preview of budapest and our guide Dora was super helpful and full of insight. Highly recommend it especially on your first day. Please be generous with your tips, it's only fair!
