Great!. The tour was great! Dorothy explainted us very well the history of the city and her English was very good! I really enjoyed it!

Really interesting tour, thanks Martina!. We loved the tour! We took the Buda tour in Spanish and Martina was our guide. Not only did she talk through all the interesting bits from Buda, but also she brought us traditional sweetd from Hungary to try, which was a great treat. The tour lasted about 2.30 h but they ran quickly. We took a group picture and in a couple of hours we got it sent to the email! Thanks for this! The tour was really good and Martina was very friendly and welcoming. Martina also provided her email address in case we had further doubts/questions regarding our stay in Budapest. I would strongly recommend it!

Highly recommended. Our guide (Dorottya) was absolutely excellent, her English was superb and she was not only very friendly and helpful but also very knowledgeable, giving us plenty of interesting insights. I really would recommend this tour, obviously these things give you information and history that you just cannot get from a guide book, but what was pleasing about this tour in particular was that it was tailored to the things we were more interested in, and she also made it engaging and we certainly didn't get bored (which can often happen on these kind of tours). She also gave what turned out to be an excellent recommendation for a restaurant!

Excellent tour, thanks Julia. I've been experiencing free walking tours, all around europe. Julia's tour, was definitely in the top 5, very friendly, very informative. She answered all of our questions and told us the best stories about Budapest. Thanks Julia

Excellent experience. I would like to thank Julia Kravianszky for coming out in a cold,wet, windy afternoon in Pest to take us around enthusiastically! She is very knowledgeable and kind. She gave me suggestions and tips on where to buy things, the best local restaurant est. It would have been a perfect trip if it was sunny and a little bit warmer.

Brill walking tour. Guide on walking tour Julia really warm and well up on her subject communist history and City's hotpots. Try to get the tour in early on your trip it gives you a great prospective of the city.Wrap up well its cold in December. Don't be mean with the tips they keep the show on the road.John Ireland

Don't miss Adam's tours. We recently took a tour from the BEST guide we've ever had. Adam is full of historical and political knowledge, funny and a joy to have as a guide. He lead us on a walking tour of Buda and were hoping to have him as a guide in Pest.Call Tourist Angel Smc. We wish we could have enjoyed more days with him as our guide.

Budapest express !. Fab tour .. Recommend you start your holiday with it and get a host of information facts and fun to keep you going for the rest of the trip .. Dori our guide was excellent .. Beautiful City .. Will be back ..God willing soon ! Thank you team !

Great tour and insights into life in Budapest. Our guide Orsi (Ursula) was really nice and did a great job!Besides showing us the sights on the Pest and the Buda side of the river, she gave us some interesting insights into life in Budapest an Hungary in general.At the end of the tour we could ask for special tips - like markets, restaurants - and have them marked in our map.We enjoyed the great tour - despite the rain ;)Many thanks!

A must-do experience. It was our great pleasure to join Orsolya for the Ghost Tour and Free Budapest Tour. Being a ghost tour enthusiast, I had the ghost tour booked as soon as we knew we would be in Budapest. On the night of the tour, we met Adam, who helped me schedule it. He warned us to be careful of witches when all of a sudden, one appeared! Adam left us to the mercy of "Mildred". She lead us through the haunted streets of the city, enchanting us with ghostly tales and dark history lessons. "Mildred" was a fantastic and enthusiastic story-teller. At the end of the tour, she encouraged us to take the Free Budapest Tour.Intrigued and looking forward to learning more about breathtaking Budapest, I joined Orsolya the next morning for another tour. Not only is she an experienced tour guide but she is a history teacher as well. I could not have asked for a more thorough introduction to the rich and varied history of the country. Orsolya was clear, concise, patient with all of our picture taking, and encouraged questions and dialogue. To conclude the tour, she sang us a lovely folk song so that we could hear how beautiful the Hungarian language can sound. Along the way, she did give us a few language lessons. I found the simple words and phrases helpful. Afterward, she offered suggestions for further sightseeing and even marked our maps.It was 2.5 hours perfectly spent.

Better than Free. Tour was great. Tour guide Julia was even better. Learned lots of great cultural and human history along with seeing the beautiful sights of Budapest. Usually you get what you pay for but this was better than most tours you pay for!

A great way to start. We joined the Pest & Buda walk on our first day and don't regret our choice.The sun was shining, the group was not too big and the guide, Dorottya, extremely friendly. On top of telling us about the city's history and sights she gladly answered all of our questions and provided a lot of useful suggestions for the rest of our stay.We would certainly suggest it to others...so much better than the tedious hop-on, hop-off bus tours.
Great. Having done a load of free tours I would say this one is on the top half. The only complaint is that the beginning was quite slow and somewhat chaotic, worth it though.

great tour. If you have just a short time for a visit in Budapest, this tour is great - it gets you throught the most interesting sights and you will learn something about the history of Budapest. The guides are really great and friendly so do not hesitate to ask them whatever you want! Even though this is a free tour the guides definitely deserve some donation from you!
Great. It was a very nice tour! We joined the spanish group and our guide Rita was very helpful and all that she explained was really interesting, Highly recomended!
Great way to spend your time and learn about Budapest. Great way to spend your time and learn about Budapest. There is no need to say more about this, which is very good. :)

Great. This was a very comprehensive and interesting tour. Orsi was very enthusiastic and made the tour enjoyable, regardless of the rainy Budapest weather! Definitely worth doing while visiting Budapest!

"Budapest Ghost Tour". Went to the Budapest Ghost Tour in one of the evenings of our visit.It was a great experience, very interesting stories, heard some fun facts, and Ursula (our guide) was absolutely great! She is very kind, funny and an excellent actress!Would definitely recommend to take this tour.Enjoy!Adi & Rafael

Was very very nice. I took the tour to the other side of the chain bridge with a very charming and special guide name Andrea Kevei. It was an English tour and lasted for over 2 hours.Although she look shy, she gave a FULL rich tour, and knew how to answer all of our questions. she was polite but real, and gave extra stories and tips, "behind the scenes" look from a Budapestian eyes. I liked her a lot.Make sure you give her, and the other guides good tips,because they are really doing a work of a payed tour, and this is how they make their living.Its really not easy to live there economically.great job!
Great and Enthusiastic. We did the communist tour and Orsonya with her enthusiasm and knowledge made it very interesting. A great tour to learn about the area. Can fully recommend it.
Very recommended and complete tour . Interesting points that Orsoñya mentioned and Her enthusiasm is nice in a 3hour tour. Recommended and also the other tours :)
Great tour of Castle District with Dorothy. Very informative and well worth the time. Gave us a very good introduction to the area. Dorothy is a very good guide.

Really Enthusaistic and Interesting. Free guided tour was great! - really informative and interesting. The walk around the city was nice and everything well explained. The best bit was the recommendations for traditional food and authentic nightlife - advice that you can only get from a true Budapest local. Thanks again. Lovely city, lovely people.

Free English tours in Budapest. A very interesting walking for 2 hours between Buda & Pest. The Hungarian guide was so kind and educated..............She told us about Hungarian History and architecture..........do not miss it! at the end you can leave a tip!

Great and kind tour!. Ursula was amazing, she's hungarian and she showed me great insites on the hungarian culture and Budapest. She's welcoming and kind. I recommend this tour! I learned more about the hungarian history that I didn't know much about!

well done. The tour was great, guides are very skilled to explain clearly and available to answer any question. I highly recommend both the morning tour and the afternoon one, for a complete overview of the city.

Great tour. Well what to say except the tour was great. It is about 2 hours and a half, walking slowly so we could take pictures and talk. Our guide was really friendly and we could talk a lot during the tour and ask any questions we had about the city, nice place to eat, spas and stuffs at the end. She took the time to answer every one under the rain! You can give whatever you want or can at the end, she didn't put any pressure on us, which is really nice.
Great! . Very friendly, very informative. Our great guide was able to answer all of our questions and tell us the best stories about Budapest. We loved it!

Wonderful Experience. The women who gave us the tour were so so lovely! Felt like I got such an interesting and personal tour of Budapest. Was so enjoyable and interesting, I'm not even that particularly a fan of historical sightseeing and I enjoyed it. Was so informative, and left me with great stories and beautiful memories. The ladies who took us were so polite and helpful and did not insist on payment but politely asked for a donation which they more than earned. If you're at all interested in more than a lazy hotel uk view of Budapest then I strongly recommend!

Amazing BUD experience. Know Budapest was one of The greatest experiences. The guides were very nice and The walking tour realy shown The best from Buda and Pest. Great English and interaction. In The end also The guides sing in hungarian-and it was amazing. Higly Recommend!
Absolute best. Thank you very much to our guide from Saturday 8.11.2014, I got know lots of new information about Budapest, and it was unforgettable experience.

Go on the free tour!. The free tour is a great way of finding your feet in Budapest. It is fun, useful and free. Our guide Dorottya (Dorothy) was full of information and pointed out things we would not have seen.
Excelent Tour. This tour was amazing and Ursula was a perfect guide. She tells a lot about history and shows the main points in Budapest.

Fascinating Introduction to Budapest - not to be missed. Orsi was our wonderful guide on our first day in Budapest; and what a fantastic introduction to the Pest side of the city. We left the 'Terror Tour' not only having had a very informed guide to some of the principal sites in Pest, but also with a feeling that we had begun to understand its history and what it was like to live in Budapest for today's generation, as well as for their parents and grandparents. We fully recommend this Free Budapest Tour to anybody interested in getting to know Budapest and its people.

Nice tour on both Buda and Pest. We went on this tour with Andrea. She was really great! It is a really nice tour, especially if you want to get a brief overview of both Buda and Pest. I mean it is true that you can't learn everything about them in just one tour of 2,5 hours, but you can get many and really interesting info from this tour. I totally recommend it.

Informative, personal, interesting and complete.. Susan had a lot of knowledge, and shared a very important part of her country's history with us. She took us places we would have not visited otherwise, and shared an insight into Budapest's culture we would have never known had we not toured the city with a local. Highly recommend it.

excellent guides. I went on two tours with Free Budapest Tours, one on each side of the river. The tours covered different historical periods and combined they gave me a good historical perspective.
They answered questions and showed both the usual and unusual sites. Thank you for a wonderful time.

Very informative!. On our last afternoon of a long weekend in Budapest we took the tour with Andrea. What a knowledgable lady!! She provided us with so much interesting information and was ready to answer any questions that we asked. She gave us the opportunity to try to understand the history of Budapest taking into account many different influences.Thoroughly enjoyable and would highly recommend!Thanks Andrea!
Great. I am really satisfied with this tour guided by Dorothy. She has a great knowledge and shared it in intresting way. I do recommend it for first days in Budapest.Good job!

Now credited to the right company!. Well done Andreea! We all met at 10.30 am and set out on an introduction tour of the history and architecture of Budapest. By 1 pm we had all enjoyed an information packed tour. No fuss, no pressure to buy into anything else, no taking you passed shops where they have a vested interest ... Open to any questions and eager to enlighten us about Hungary's history, Adreea had an unassuming delivery which belied her knowledge of this interesting city and country. Whilst the tour takes two and a half hours it is not a route march and there are frequent points of interest stops and photo opportunities. Thus us a relaxed stroll through stunning architecture and fascinating history.Probably the hardest decision comes at the end of the tour when you decide on the size of the tip! Judge us or judge us not we gave 2000 HUF and were amongst the first to pay. It seemed about the right amount and if the other 15 or so couples did the same .... well you do the mathematics.Would we recommend this tour? Yes we would. There are some slopes involved to get to the top but all who signed up had no trouble, including young children. Well done Andreea!

Budapest walking tour - Pest part. I really enjoyed the guided tour. Our guide was very friendly, speak very well english and not only provided us with historical and touristic information, she also explained the current local news happening related to the sites we visited. I really recommend this tours!

Free Walking Tour. I did the free walking tour in Budapest in June 2014 with Andi. It was a very educational and informative tour. Andi shared a lot of information about Budapest one probably wouldn't learn unless they took a tour. I highly recommend taking a couple hours out of your day to take this free walking tour once you arrive to the city. The tour will help you get acclimated with the city and decide what kind of attractions you want to visit.

Informative Tour & Friednly Guide. I was happy with this walking tour. Our guide, Andrea, was pleasant and answered a variety of questions as she offered us her insights into this stunning city. We walked and toured fo about two and a half hours as advertised. It was worth the donation and then some!

Walk n talk. We found Orsi accidentally when looking for a walking tour outside the metro courtyardWhat a gem!She speaks superb English, has good knowledge of history & current affairs, born & brought up in Budapest and of course knows the city well! Fascinating tales of communism!!!She is well travelled herself - makes the tour very interesting & engaging. The walk lasts 2 hours - is not onerous- despite diabolical weatherSTART THE CITY EXPERIENCE HERE!!

Amazing Tour & History of Budapest. We were only in Budapest for 3 days, and were looking for a tour to give us some insight into the sights and history. Andrea was AMAZING! She was enthusiastic, thorough and funny keeping the stories and history very interesting while providing a great background of the history and main attractions. We spoke with her after the tour and she gave great advice on restaurant recommendations and what sites to check out in more detail. Amazing for a free tour, highly recommended!

Highly recommended!!. I am so glad that we did this tour. We only stayed in Budapest for 3 days so we did not have so much time to visit all the places. Zsuzsa was a really helpful tourguide and she knows the place really well. We learnt a lot about the history of the city and also all the stories behind famous places. Highly recommended for the first day of your trip if you want to have a basic view on where to go and what to do and also if you do not have a lot of time!!

Nicest tour in Budapest. We visited Budapest last weekend. An amazing city with many places to be visited. We had few time, so we decided to join with the Free Budapest Tours and we could visit almost all the most important sites of Budapest in one day! The guides make the visit very interesting, with a lot of information, but they don't let it be boring. The long tour is available for spanish speakers too (Susana speaks like a genuine spanish). We joined for the both tours. I really recommend them if you visit Budapest.

Ursula gives you a great introduction to Budapest!. My wife and I started our 10-day Danube tour in Budapest and are thankful to have found Ursula (originally through Tripadvisor). The general tour in the morning was very informative and entertaining. We liked Ursula so much that we came back for the afternoon one, which explored the communist experience more, with a smaller group. She told us personal stories and more detailed explanations. Both are highly recommended. Great tips on places to see and eat as well (like the yummy strudel place). We recommended her to other travellers that we met along our tour that were heading to Budapest. Thanks Ursula for starting our trip off so well!!!

Great start to a city break - informative and good fun!. The walking tour was recommended to us by a friend who had visited previously. So on our first morning we went to the start point and met our guide, Adam. It was a beautiful morning and we had about 20 or so in our group. Probably the right sort of number. Adam was enthusiastic about the tour, very proud of his home city and a great guide. It was really informative about the sights and the history both recent and centuries ago. We covered a lot of ground on both sides of the river with the walk across the chain bridge and the views from Buda the highlight. The tour provided our bearings for the rest of the city break and Budapest is beautiful city. Adam has every right to be proud of his city. Would definitely recommend it

Nice informating walking tour in Busapest. This free (based on tips) tour is nice experience to get first impression on Budapest. The guide (Dora) is very kind, funny and informative. The group is small, which contributes to intimate experience. Great tour.
Great tour. Wonderful walking tour! Really enjoyed it and hit a lot of the highlights I wanted to see. Could not have been friendlier.
The perfect tour. Really engaged, nice guide with a lot of knowledge about the history and current situation in Budapest!
Cool and interesting. Good local hungarian guides, interesting history and beautiful sights! I did twice Buda and Pest side! Really cool

Wonderful Tour. We stumbled on this opportunity, thanks to Trip Advisor, and couldn't have been more pleased. As it developed we were a tour of 3--my wife and I and our terrific tour guide, Andi. Having just arrived from the States we wanted something that would be a good overview of Pest and provide some needed exercise, and we really got a lot more than we expected. Andi was extremely well informed and easy to converse with, especially as her English was very good. She also had an warm smile, a lively and engaging personality and was impressively articulate and thoughtful. All in all, our tour was a wonderful introduction to this beautiful city and one we certainly would recommend highly.

Worth paying for!. \We went on the free tour that came with the on/off bus ticket package. It would have been worth paying for, since Ursula knew so much about Budapest and its history. (We did tip her 5 euro for the two of us.) She encouraged questions as we moved from site to site. I wish we could have done the evening tour with her but we didn't have the time. I am checking "no fee" below, which was the case for us. I don't know what the charge would have been without our coupon booklet.

Free Budapest Walking Tour. Ursula was our tour guide this weekend in Budapest and I must say her warmth , enthusiasm and concern made our trip extra special. She knows a lot about the city and peppered our walk with interesting anecdotes and local flavor. She goes out of her way to make everyone feel at home ...giving our four year old a ride on her bicycle and making sure we all had a great time. Keep up the good work Orsi and see you soon ! The Sen Family, Anwerp

Great value for money. We took the 10:30 tour from Pest to Castle Hill in Buda with Adam last Saturday and learnt a lot. Adam was well researched, spoke very good English and, as a Budapest man born and bred, was able to add a lot of fascinating personal information. I would add that according to Adam's interpretation the tours are not 'free' as such - the amount you give is 'free', i.e. up to your discretion, but naturally some reward is expected in return for almost 2 hours of his time, which seems only fair. It is still less than the tours that have a fixed price tag attached, and we didn't think we missed out on any information. We would definitely do such a tour again. Thanks, Adam!

Budapest walking tour. I just returned from a weekend in Budapest during which I took part in a walking tour with Ghost Tours led by Adam. Adam proved to be a wonderful guide whose sense of humour married with his passionate knowledge of Budapest and his 'little' surprises as he led us on a two and half hour journey across both sides of this very interesting city. The group ,my fellow tourists, engaged fully with Adam and by virtue of his openness and easy nature this added greatly to the experience.My thanks to Adam, keep up the good workMatthew from Ireland 24/09/14

Budapest Tour. I had a really good experience on this tour. Orsi (Ursula) was very knowledgable about the city and very proactive with the group. She asked us questions and got us involved, which I enjoyed very much. I would highly recommend the tour.

Free Budapest tours-Ghost Tour & Multilingual Guides. I would like to let everyone know that the free Budapest tours- ghost tour tour guide Botta,Adam is a very entertaining,educational experience. He is very knowledgeable and he speaks English very well. My sister and I enjoyed it so much we decided to come back the next day for the communist tour. Excellent tour ,please give my friend a good tip he deserves it. I wrote a comment earlier that was on the wrong company.

Superb!. A free walking your (based on donation)? What a brilliant idea! I loved it! I took both 10:30 and 14:30 tour and they were both very informative. 10:30 guide, Adam, was so lovely; very friendly, personable and amusing.14:30 tour guide, Ursula, was lovely as well. I couldn't recommend it enough!

Great tour guides!. We took both the 10:30 AM tour "from Pest to Buda" and the 2:30 PM communism tour. Both tour guides spoke really good English and were a wealth of information! The tours were both worth the customary 10 Euro tip at the end. Highly, highly recommend.
Budapesht. The tour was very good. The guid explained very nice the history and the sights. The guid was very good and with a lot of pation to us

Ghost Tour & Free Budapest Tour. Hello vom Austria!I highly recommend both tours mentioned in the title. The (charged) ghost tour takes place in the evening (regardless the weather!) and is quite intersting :-)The next day I was suprised to meet the "witch-tour guide" again without make-up and we attended the Budapest Tour (charged on tip-basis) to see main-sights combined with a walking tour. Orsi is quite diverse and interested in every participant of the tour. If I come again I would attend the tour in the afternoon too because it's then focused on the "Pest"-side of Budapest :-)Thanks very much!

Excellent Tour. The guide was especially good!. Orsi (Ursula) was an excellent guide - lots of important information and Hungarian history given with great aplomb!Will highly recommend this tour and Orsi in particular.

Breathtaking city. Budapest is a beautiful city. I found myself here for a day and decided to do a walking tour. My guide was Atilla and he was amazing! I saw a whole in a short time and walked away with postcard quality photos due to the picturesque locations and rich architectural designs that are naturally around the city. Highly recommend a free walking tour if you have the chance.

Tour with this company and don't settle for the copy cats!. I so enjoyed Viki's communism tour on my last visit, that I saught them out again to attend their general tour. It was an excellent orientation for first-time visitors, but also worth it for those who already know the city well. Orsi was professional, personable, and a wealth of knowledge. She was also a great source for travel advice. Don't miss these tours! A 10 euro tip is customary, although the guides say to feel free to give more or less depending on your budget.
Excellent. Orsi was the best tour guide. A wonderful tour and the communist theme was fascinating thank you so much

free Budapest walking tour.. enjoyed the walking tour very much as Andrei is very well informed and takes great care to answer whatever questions from the floor.she does not have a fast pace unlike in Vienna walking tour where the lady does not bother with the customers following her.Overall , a truly enjoyable walking tour, Not pleasant to see people giving small coins for tips as Free, does not mean giving small denomination coins. At least appreciate her efforts in telling us stories of her country and her experiences.

Free afternoon walking tour of Pest. This company offers two free walking tours and the paid evening "Ghost Tour". We took the free (i.e. tips only) afternoon tour of Pest in English. It took us through Deak square, the Basilica, the old stock exchange, and the magnificent parliament building. The guide was a bit shy but knowledgeable and friendly. We had a good time.

Great way to kick off your time in Budapest. Orsi (Ursula) was an excellent tour guide. I was on the general free walking tour with her leading the way. She did a great job, and it's a perfect way to get your bearings of this fascinating city. The tour is free and that's awesome, but I hope people know that it is polite to tip for the service if you enjoyed it!

Amazing tour!. We took the two tours they were offering the same day: one that started at Deak ter (city center) and ended at Buda Castle and another on the Pest side. Andrea, our guide, was awesome! A very nice person, open to any question we had. The tour covers many of the main city attractions. So if you want to know the history behind all those impressive buildings, I strongly recommend you to take the tour!

Went Thrice!. My first time in Budapest was on their Independence Day in March, '14, coincidentally. I was with friends on a short weekend trip, and we decided to do the free walking tour as students on a budget. We really enjoyed the street-level view of the city and learning some of the recent history on the Faith, Terror, and Communism themed tour. Our guide was Kate, and she was excellent and knowledgeable, and friendly. She gave us great tips for dining and nightlife at the end of the tour. We especially enjoyed that we could hear the history of the city from a true local's honest perspective. In Budapest again this time with family, we took the 10:30 am tour with Dora, and enjoyed some history with a tour of both sides of the city. Her songs through the tour were wonderful, you could tell that she was enthusiastic about sharing Hungarian culture with the group. The next day, we caught the 2:30 tour on Faith, Terror, and Communism (my second time) and I was happy to see Kate again as our guide! We had another great experience with her. I would ask her to show you the Strudel restaurant, as we missed it my second time on her tour! 10/10 would do again :)
Great tour ! She even sang for us!. Great tour! Had Andrea and she was a blast. She even sang for us when she wa telling the story regarding folklore!
Great tour!. Very informative and easy to follow. Meshi was great, stop sometimes for a quick break. Really enjoy it!
Fun tour with great informations. I really loved this free walking tour. It was the basic Pest and Buda tour. Our guide was really kind with very nice insightful informations.

Did three tours in a day - great way to get your bearings on the city!. In one day with my wife, we did the morning tour, afternoon tour, and the evening the ghost tour. All three were great with Orsi doing the morning and ghost tour ones, and really gave a good background to the history of the city, and an idea of what is where, which really helped get our bearings quickly! Would definitely recommend.
Great tour. Historical and personal facts. We did the morning tour with Júlia and the afternoon tour with Vicky. They were vera cheerfull and great guides! Strongly recomended!

Much of Budapest in only 2,5 hours. This tours are really recomendable! .We made the tour with Meshi. She's really good! She explain many things about the city and also many other things around the actual political situation, economy, how live Budapest history the diferent generations from her experience...answering at this form at all our questions. She give us many interesting information, she allways was ready for any question o doubt.... really kind! Fantastic.We ask her too, about good restaurants for take one good gulash and we go there for dinner. Spectacullar!!! Thanks a lot Meshi!! We have a fantastic dinner at KIADO!
Great tour. We had a fun time. It was just the amont of information and fun detailsReally great for a first timer in budapest

Interesting and informative. This was our second " free" walking tour of Budapest , we had done the morning Pest + Buda tour earlier in the year, the format is the same as elsewhere you meet at Deak Square and locate your English speaking guide,( they also do a Spanish speaking tour). The previous tour ended up in the Castle area of Buda, whereas this concentrates on the Pest side looking into the politcal and historical aspects of the area.Our guide was called Dora who we had met on our first tour, she speaks great English, is very knowledgeable of the City .It is great to have someone point out the different sights and areas and their significance both politically and historically. The tour lasts approximately 1.5 hours and is an easy walk, my wife who walks with a stick found it quite manageable. It is also a good way to meet and chat with other tourists and exchange information and suggestions. At the end if you have enjoyed the tour you can give an appropriate tip. I definitely recommed both tours( freebudapesttours.hu)

Fun and informative walking tour!!!. Our walking tour guide was Andrea. She was brilliant. She gave us so much knowledge and facts I had no idea about relating to Budapest. She was very enthusiastic and took the time to speak to us individually about places to see after the tour and recommended places to eat. She made the tour extremely fun and kept us all entertained for the duration. This was a free tour and we were not pressured to leave a tip what so ever, but naturally we did as the tour was brilliant. A first class experience and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Budapest. She even sand a hungarian folk song for us which was great and very cultural. 10 out of 10 for this tour, keep up the good work Andrea!!!

Best way to get a snapshot of the city. I have just finished travelling from Gdansk to Istanbul, all around central and eastern europe, doing free tours in most cities, and I have to say Orsi's was one of the best I participated in. From guessing what things were invented in Hungary to her personal accounts of life in the city, the tour really gives you a good overview of Budapest. If you don't have much time, make sure you at least do this! (as well as the Gellért Thermal Bath!!)

Great guide, brilliant city.. I attended the general city tour as well as the slightly shorter afternoon tour that focuses more on recent history in Budapest. The guide Andrea was great; local, knowledgeable, and incredibly helpful... I was interested in exploring Budapest to find things relating to the Hungarian author Szerb Antal, and as well as recommending the city's cemetery Andrea took the time to ask around, visit the local literature museum, and get back to me about what was there - you couldn't ask for more! Unfortunately there was a bit of overlap on both tours so it probably makes sense to do one with a different company/guide just for a different perspective, but I completely understand why there was overlap, as most would attend just one. Overall, it was a great start to my time in Budapest.
Fantastic tour! . Orsi was a fantastic guide. I would definitely recommend these tours. Very informative and entertaining.

Just what I was looking for!. Orsi was our guide, she spoke very good English and told us a lot of fun stories about Budapest and Hungary. The tour was a really nice way to get an idea of where things are in the city and get a general overview. We tipped her 3000 HUF each (~10 euros each) which I feel is totally fair. Definitely worth it :)

Great tour of Budapest. Very well organized tour, ideal to get a first taste of the city and learn a lot about the history and tradition of Budapest. We did the tour with Ursula as a guide and she was really good, willing to share a lot of interesting stories and very passionate throughout the whole tour. I would definitely recommend this tour on the first day of your stay in Budapest!

Free and fun. Even though Budapest had plenty of rain that day, Orsi kept on smiling and made the day enjoyable. Lots of interesting history and buildings to be seen. A definite must if you are short on time and want to see a lot of Budapest.

Fun, interesting!. The tour guide falls right into the character of a witch and she does not falter at all. She takes you to interesting landmarks with stories very few people know behind them. Overall, a great evening tour!

Informative free tour in Budapest. This service offered by young Budapest natives are blasting. The guide knows a lot about their own city which makes the tour interesting. You get a real insider insight in this amazing city! Totaly worth to attend this tour! They also help you out with reccomendations where to go. You can ask for the best places to eat or to do some shopping. This is perfect if you have not considered any tourist guide before heading to Budapest!

Very interesting!. We did the Buda tour with the English guide Julia. It was very interesting and Julia was incredibly enthusiastic. The bits of information were sometimes serious, sometimes funny. She was all too happy to answer all our questions and always looked for shade for us during these boiling temperatures.
Quick and concise. Exactly what you want from a tour. Tells you all about the city and leaves you time to do plenty more.

scary, spooky and great fun!. whatever your plans in Budapest make sure you book one free evening to go on this tour, it is excellent! The tour goes round the city centre explaining all the blood curdling history of the sites and places that dark things happened all in the supremely entertaining company of a VERY realistic witch, played by a wonderful tour guide, in a way which will hold your fascination throughout. Even passers by step aside and seem spooked as she guides you around with an intimate knowledge of her subject.This tour is totally recommended!
Great!. Really lovely and detailed tour, the female guide we had was incredibly lovely and sang a Hungarian song for us! Really made the tour excellent, even in the pouring rain!

Insightful, historical and informative . We went on this free walking your on a day that it poured with rain! Still the woman who guided us (I think Ulga?) was happy and smiling the whole time and even gave us a short rendition of a Hungarian song! The information she provided was from the point of view of a local which is great when you have never been to a city before. We also were only in the city for 1 full day and so was a great was to see and learn a lot in a Hirt amount of time! Hungarian history in ten minutes was great!

The best way to experience Budapest!. I have been on several walking tours in Europe and this was by far the very best. Our tour guide, Katalin, was absolutely brilliant in her storytelling and sharing of interesting historical facts and she made the tour extremely interactive and fun. We had a very diverse group of participants and she continuously adjusted her pace and interaction to ensure everyone was comfortable throughout the tour and staying personally engaged. She even extended her time at the end to answer questions and give recommendations on additional things to see and places to eat noting everything on our maps. Budapest is already a magical city to visit but Katalin’s tour made it even that more memorable and special of a trip. I would highly recommend the tour and her as a guide specifically to anyone visiting Budapest and wanting to really experience the best that the city has to offer!
Brilliant. The guide was extremely interesting and insightful. She gave us a wonderful tour around the city. I would definitely reccomend this tour to anybody visiting Budapest.

Great way to start trip!. I was only in Budapest for a few days and presumed that a walking tour around the city would be my best way to get my bearings while learning some of the rich history of the nation. This tour did not disappoint. Our guide (Andrea) was just wonderful! She knew a plethora of information about the stops we made on both the Buda and Pest sides of the city and knew exactly where to take us to get simply STUNNING views off the river. We learned about everything from statues and monuments to the cathedrals and castle, as well as some Hungarian words! Andrea even sang us a bit of an old Hungarian folk song. We also got to see the changing of the guard at their "white house" which was quite unique. Overall, this little tour company does a fantastic job of orienting you to the city and making you feel welcome in Hungary.

Exemplary Guides. Our afternoon (Tourist Angel) Free Tour round the city with Dora was so interesting in every aspect that we have immediately decided to take another tour the following day. Dora took us around Pest explaining the colourful history of the city up to the present times and adding stories from her personal life to highlight events ot the more recent years. She was charming in every way and her English was impecable. The group was small and we felt like having a personal guide and could ask questions freely. The following day we have opted for a Free Tour with an alternative company. After just 10 minutes we have relaized that this was a mistake and have left. Luckily we were still in time to join the Free Tour with Orsi around the Buda part. Orsi was a great guide. Her love and knowledge of the city, country and culture, her energy and humour made our day.Thank you, Girls, for making us love Budapest even more.Advice to the reader: make sure you choose the right Free Tours (from Deak Square 10:30 and 14:30)

Excellent!!. Our free tour was led by a lovely guide whose name was Dora. She was very personable, knowledgable and spoke English beautifully! She also had a lovely sense of humor! We would absolutely recommend her for this tour or any tour that she might offer. The tour was well-organized and there was a reasonable number of people in our group. It is so nice that these free tours are available and we would encourage visitors to Budapest to utilize them. It is a wonderful city.
amazing walking tour with ORSI. The walking tour with "Orsi" was absolutely fantastic and informative. I strongly recommend to have a walking trip with her :)Ayman From Syria

Great orientation tour. The free orientation tours friendly, informative guide gave a good commentary while walking us around the city, which gave us good ideas of what else to see in our time in Budapest. A lot was crammed into the time and it was a good level of depth for an overview.

Wonderful way for city orientation. I participated in the Pest to Buda tour. It was a great way to walk around the city and learn about it's history, culture and architecture. Our tour guide, Orsi, was so incredibly knowlagale and sweet. as native to the city, she was able to add a personal touch by sharing about her family and her own experience. I definitely will recommend this tour to anyone who is traveling to Budapest!

Very fun and informative. Just took the walking tour yesterday, it was a horribly dull day because of the rain but the tour was excellent. My friends and I learned so much about Budapest that we never knew about, and the guide was super friendly and cheerful and answered whatever questions we had. Definitely a must try if you drop by Budapest, or you'll be passing by everything with little or no knowledge of how much history the place itself contains.

Excellent informative and interesting tour, even in the rain!. Orsolya was passionate about the City and Hungarian culture, always there with the history and an interesting story.It rained pretty much throughout but after some helpful hints (again from Orsolya) on where to get a cheap umbrella we were off and loved it.An afternoon well spent!

Walk with a friends =). I took both tours by Free walking tour in Budapest and all of them were perfect. I got a lot of interesting facts and felt as i'm walking in a company of the good friends =) Higly recommended!Было действительно очень душевно прогуляться отдельно по Буда отдельно по Пешту в 2 разные экскурсии. Всем рекомендую!

Excellent tour. Orsolya (Ursula in English) was so passionate about her country and her birth place of Budapest, that the tour became a wonderful history and informative two and a half hours. The walk is not a hard walk, Ursula takes it in stages, explaining the Hungarian historical culture from the year 1.000 enroute. An excellent free tour, we were more than happy to tip generously. The views from the Castle are magnificent down over Pest. Congratulations UrsulaYorkshire visitors

A Must First Thing To Do. A great introduction to the beautiful city of Budapest. A two and a half hour guided tour of the city with all the information you need for a great holiday from the beautiful and knowledgeable Orsi. She had a lovely personality and had an answer for every question, wether it be historical or where the best restaurants or bars were located. If these tours are not funded by the local authority then they definitely should be.

A must do in Budapest!!!!!. If you want to have a fun time, get some interesting historic facts and walk from Pest to Buda, then you must try this tour. We loved our tour guide witch Ursula who pro mess to reincarnate soon as Susy, We really had a wonderful time. Highly recommended this tour.

Really liked it!. We took the tour on our first day and it was a great start to our vacation.2.5 hours of the main places to be when visiting Budapest.Dora the guide was great, explaining everything in a fun, interesting way, and also shared useful tips on events and places to be during this week.I recommend it to anyone who come to budapest..Thanks Dora!
Free budapest tour-terror and communism. .The tour was very interesting.Dora,our guide,wae very nice,and we had a great afternoon.The tour started at deck's square

Excellent Intro to Hungary. The tour given by Orsoyla today expertly shed light on Hungary's complicated and turbulent history - she seamlessly wove in personal stories, funny anecdotes and poetry to deftly give an overview of several thousand years in an hour and a half stroll of the beautiful city of Budapest. Highly recommended!

Adam Botta Walking Tours of Buda and Pest. My friend and I went on Adam Botta's walking tour of both Botta and Pest on consecutive days;both were excellent.His tours were the highlights of my four day holiday in Budapest;informative,interesting amusing ,enjoyable in perfect English. He told us amusing anecdotes and added extra touches to his tours to make them extra enjoyable.If I return to Budapest I will definitely go on another of Adam's tours. Gillian Bathmaker , Sheffield, England
Can't go wrong. Certainly made a difference to my trip. Orsi is informative, knowledgable, patient, friendly, and passionate. What else can you ask for?

A wonderful experience. My friend and I had took a walking tour with Andrea and we really, really enjoyed the experience. We learned a great deal, et would have missed a lot of things if we had not taken it. She was very kind and patient with her explanations. We strongly recommand this activity. Anne and Danielle, Québec, Canada.

Free tour of Budapest. Orsi (Ursula) provided an informative and interesting tour of Budapest for us in 2 hours! The walking tour was educational and cultural. Orsi went beyond the usual expectations and arranged a private - and reasonably priced morning bike tour to Sentendre the following day. She even stayed longer to ensure we returned within our time frame.I would highly recommend this free tour- based on affordability you tip according to your means.Thanks Ursula Kerry & Don, Australia

Highly recommended!. Really interesting tour with a great guide. We had Kate who is really fantastic. Take the tours not because it's free, but because it's intriguing and you would just pass by places without knowing all the history they encompass if not for the guide.
Orsolya lovely, friendly, helpful lady. Our tour guide orsolya was brilliant, very hospitable, great knowledge of Budapest including history. Interesting and informative.

Great introduction to Budapest. We have joined the morning with Andrea. The group was quite big and diverse, but she managed to keep everybody interested. I've learned a lot of things that I didn't know yet, even though it wasn't the first time I was visiting the beautiful capital of Hungary. I recommend the free tours to everybody that wants to discover Budapest through the eyes of a person that actually lives there!

Excellent, free guided tour!. We did the Afternoon tour Faith, Communism, Terror from Deak Ferenc at 14:30. Our wonderful guide Andi told stories and background information about the Szent Istvans Cathedral, the Soviet Heroes' Monument, the US Embassy, and some former nuclear shelter, just as the former stock exchange and Hungary's three parliaments. Alongside the walking path, she gave great tips for dining and going out (not the touristy and posh places, and no, she doesn't get commision!) We were a small group (though she said we were a big group already), so the athmosphere was quite personal and she could react to all our questions. A good tour, also suitable with/for children and young adults from 10 years, recommandable to anyone on short or long stay to know Budapest from the inside!

Highly recommended. Loved the small interactive group during the communist tour (the orientation tour was a slightly bigger group). Kate was really awesome and insightful, sharing with us not only about the country’s history but a little more about her favourite food, and family etc. She definitely brought out a different view in looking at Budapest. The guides are really genuine and they love talking to people one-on-one as well. Everyone should go for it!

An absolute must in Budapest!. We had two amazing tours on our holiday - one in the afternoon and one in the morning. It's a lovely walk at a leisurely pace so everyone can enjoy it! The guides are incredibly friendly and energetic, very passionate about the history of the city. The tour felt really friendly and personal. Appart from learning about the history of the landmarks we were also told some local insights and urban legends. You can ask the guides to point you to nice cafes and quirky places that you may not come across on your own. It's a great way to meet other travellers too! An absolute must if you visit Budapest!

Introduction to Hungary and Budapest. By shear chance we met Ursula ("Orsi") on the first morning of our 5 day stay in Budapest and went on one of her orientation tours of the city. We could not have had a better start to our holiday. I would highly recommend everyone to undertake one of these orientation tours at the very start of their visit to Budapest. Orsi gave us an excellent tour, she is so knowledgeable and has so much information to give about the city. Her tour was well spaced out with plenty of time for stragglers to catch up before she started her explanations and descriptions for that particular point of interest. During the tour she gave us a summary of the last 1,000 years of Hungarian history and was very patient in answering all of our questions. From Pest we crossed the Duna and climbed up to the Fishermens Bastion to admire the stunning view over the Duna to the Hungarian Parliament and beyond. At one point Orsi paused and sang to us in Hungarian, what a pleasant surprise. Finally the brochure we had collected from her at the start of our tour contained recommendations of places to visit and, in addition, she marked on the city map other locations people had had recommended to them prior to their visit to Budapest. Everyone in our party of 13 agreed that Orsi had given us an excellent tour and scored 100%. In my opinion this is the way to start a visit to Budapest. Well done Orsi!!

Great introduction to Budapest. The meeting point for the walk was easy to find and our guide Ursula was fantastic. Not only did we get all the history and interesting information Ursula also included information from her family history. It was a very pleasant walk, we were not hurried along even when we walked up the stairs to the palace area. Would recommend as a great introduction to Budapest.

Highly recommended. The tour was very intresting and deals with budapests history and it's struggles in the post ww2 era and communist regime. Many parts of the tour are genuinely funny and Bear (out guide) really sets the scene and is an excellent guide. You visit many important monuments which admitatley I would have either missed or didn't have knolage of-in particular the monument for the Hungerian uprising. Can't say enough good things about the tour!

Wonderful local guides. We took two of the tours - the Pest tour first and then the Orientation tour. Adam was our first guide and then Ursula. Both were excellent. They gave us such an appreciation for Budapest and for Hungarian history and culture. We left both tours with a strong sympathy for this nation and a real real desire to learn more. Both guides have lived here all their lives and tried to give a sense for " real life" beyond the tourist spots. They were open, willing to talk about any topic and full of tips for what to do in Budapest. They tipped us off to several places our guidebooks didn't even mention. I would highly recommend any of their tours - try to fit one in on your first day in Budapest. It will make your time here more meaningful.

A warm welcome to Budapest. Had Orsi as our guide and she was amazing. So sweet with lots of knowledge and information. She answered all our question and also asked as question so it was kind of interactive. The tour we took was the Comonism one which was very interesting. At the end of the tour we got a map of Budapest with recomended places to go - so we got some very useful tips and advices for our rest of our trop :-)P.S not only Orsi was a great tour guide but also a great photographer - she took pictures of us and was super cool.

Educational and fun. I enjoyed very much the tour around Pest, a lot of historical facts (which I like) and even some discussion over the current system took place. The group was small so interaction with the guide was easy and pleasant. The guide also gave us tips to go around Budapest as a local.I hope to come back and be a part of the other tours, thank you!

Excellent tour !. We highly recommend this lively and informative tour. We were accompanied by Orsi (Ursula), a wonderful guide. She not only shared information on the city, but also provided very good tips for excursions after the tour (places to see, eat, go out, etc.). She even sang us a touching Hungarian song. Far worth leaving a nice tip.Nous recommandons vivement ce tour dynamique et intéressant. Nous étions accompagnés par Orsi (Ursula) un guide formidable. Elle nous a non seulement renseignés sur la ville, mais nous a également donné des indications très utiles pour des excursions après le tour (sites d'intérêt, pour manger, sortir, ...). Elle a même chanté un petit air hongrois touchant. Un tour qui vaut bien un bon pourboire.

very informative and entertaining.. i joined the buda tour and the communism walk. both were very entertaining and informative. the guides are excellent and anyone visiting budapest should take these tours if they really want an insight to hungarian life and history.

Great tour. Highly recommended!. Such a great tour. Perfect for the first day in Budapest as it covered all the important sites and helped us get our bearings.Ursula was very knowledgable about both historical and modern sides of the city. Thanks again!
Great free tour. Our tour guide, Ursula, was great. We did the orientation tour. Good overall tour of the city. Good stories and history. Was not read from a script.

Great Tour. Andi was very knowledgeable and loved her city. It was great to walk around and have a local show you the sites. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants a great overview of Budapest and it's history.

Lovely Budapest Introduction. My friends and I had a nice afternoon walk with Andrea trough Budapest city center. It was very interesting, Andrea is very friendly and we had chat with her about various topic.The tour is excellent choice for people who are for the first time in Budapest.

Great tour, but not for everyone. I've done several food/beer tours in different parts of Europe, but this was the first walking tour I planned on doing. My travelling companion and I did not know exactly what to expect, but we figured we would try it out. The meeting location is very accessible, and we met up for the 2:30 tour of the Pest side (the morning tour is of Buda). Sadly, I do not remember our guide's name but she was very friendly and knowledgeable! However, we quickly learned that this was the type of tour where you stop every 10 minutes and then listen to a history lesson for another 10-15 minutes. As we were on a time crunch, we decided that this was not for us and tipped her for the few minutes we had spent and then went our own way. Here are reasons you should go with this company: Guides are friendly and highly knowledgeable (felt like I was in history class). If you are staying in Budapest for a while and want to know a lot about the history, this is a great program. Here are reasons you should not go with this company: If you are only spending a short amount of time in Budapest (side note: 2 days is not enough time), you do not get to see a lot of different stuff on one tour. One of the reasons I like doing tours is to get to meet a lot of different people. I don't know if it just happened to be the group that showed up that day, or the time of year (just post-Spring break time), but it just didn't have that lively/chummy feel that some other tours have. Bottom line, it may be the perfect tour for you if you want a slower-paced, very informative one. If you are on a time crunch, not so much.

Interesting. My son and I took both the morning and afternoon tours with Andrea. She was very knowledgable and friendly and answered all of our questions. The meeting point was very accessible. We would both recommend the tours.
Great tour!. I went for the communist tour and it was very insightful! Not only did I know more about budapest and the history, I even shook hand with President Reagan!

Lovely!. I had a great time on the free walking tour of Budapest. The guide was very knowledgeable, and I feel like I learned a lot. It was a great intro to this wonderful city, and I would recommend it to anyone!!!! Seriously, all you have to do is show up, and you'll walk out with stories, facts and recommendations to start you off.

Free Budapest introductory tour. I went on the free morning tour, which began at Deak Ferenc Ter. This was a small group. Orsola took a great deal of time explaining Hungarian history as well as the sites, buildings, monuments and curiosities we saw as we went by. She also answered questions of all types, not just those about the tour itself. Finally, she invited everyone to sit for coffee for an informal chat at the end of the tour. I highly recommend this tour for people who want serious information, not just quaint stories and jokes, which sometimes is the case on free tours in Europe.
morning and afternoon tours. We were 3 students from Toronto doing an exchange in France. We did the morning tour then the afternoon one and both were great.

Excellent way to get started. We went on the free morning tour, starting from Deak Ferenc Ter at 10.30am. Being Easter Sunday, it was a fairly big group with people from all over the place.The lovely Katalin (or Kate to us English folk) was an engaging guide with plenty of stories to tell. Being Hungarian, from Budapest itself, she certainly didn't lack local knowledge. Over the 3-hour tour, she gave us a potted history of Hungary, from its founding through to the Austro-Hungarian Empire, the Communist era and the modern day.The tour started with some orientation about the city, basic Hungarian, and what to avoid as tourists. Katalin then took us through central Pest to the Chain Bridge, and then over it to Buda. After the walk up to the castle complex, we were given a good introduction to its open-access areas, with the tour ending at the Fisherman's Bastion -- a good point from which to look over Pest and plan our day. It was about 2pm by that point, so we'd definitely got our money's worth!At the end of the tour, Katalin was happy to stick around and give people recommendations for the rest of their trip.It was a really good tour, and I thoroughly recommend it to anyone spending their first day in Budapest. I think the same tour runs at 2.30pm as well.One thing that was quite different from a "free" tour we took in Prague, a few days earlier, was the lack of asking for tips -- at the end, a purse was handed round almost apologetically. Perhaps its not the done thing for a Magyar, but I think Katalin missed a trick by not pointing out, early, the importance of tipping. I hope she got a reasonable amount of cash from everyone, anyway.

Ghost Tour with Orsha aka Ursula. My friend and I backpacked central Europe Thanksgiving week 2013. We had a private tour with Orsha (Hopefully i spelled it correctly) It was such an amazing time! When i first arrived to Budapest, I didnt think it was my cup of Tea... after the ghost tour.. i was speechless... The history and the knowledge this woman had was incredible. She is very funny and super animated which made it fun. I am from New York, so i've seen it all. Orsha def impressed us. We've recommended this tour to a few of our friends and they enjoyed it as well! 2 thumbs up!
mostly enjoyed the tour. I generally liked the tours, had two of them. The Buda tour was more informative than the Ghost one (apparently there are not that many interesting ghosts in Budapest)

Awesome!. Ursula was really friendly, told the history about Budapest in a really nice andnot boring way ... which was helpful in the nest days of my trip since many things made sense after that ... totally recommendable!!!
Good orientation tour - friendly guide. Guide was very friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. A good way to orientate yourself when arriving in Budapest

Enthusiastic guidance. We used the basic tour around Budapest in Spanish. It is perfect to know main things that you can visit deeply afterwards. Guide gives you some notes about city history and even funny notes.It is a pleasure listen so enthusiastic turist guide. It is the second time we use these kind of Free tours (Sofia and Budapest) and we are very happy with the services. We'll continue looking for them in other cities.

Informative but boring. I have participated walking tours in various European cities, and this was one of the least engaging ones. I took the Faith-Terror-Communism tour, which is a short walk in the Pest side. The guide was rattling on about history with experience and ease, but I prefer a more entertaining approach with storytelling and humour. I also found the tip calculation at the end somewhat distasteful. I am sure we all know how these tours work, and will tip without prompting.Anyway, the guide seemed like a lovely lady, so all the best for her, this was just not really my cup of tea.

Passionate Local Guide, sharing their love for Budapest.. I was lucky enough to take this tour with the lovely Orsolya, who shared her knowledge and love of Budapest on a well personalised and paced tour. She covered politics, history, interesting facts and legends all with a theatrical tone and the added touch of her family history and own examples. Orsolya was not pushy about tips as I have found other free tours can be and was very good at making recommendations for good value restaurants, bars and thermal baths to avoid being sucked into tourist traps. I would strongly recommend taking this tour on your first morning in Budapest as it gives you a great orientation for the rest of your trip and warns you off a few of the common mistakes when travelling the city.

Great information on best ways to see the city and tips from local life!. My husband and I have been traveling a lot this year, and after doing our first free wakling tour in Prague with Sandemans, we fell in love with this way of learning the city! We looked for something similar in Budapest, and luckily found a daily free tour. We went to the 10:30 tour, and Orsi was our English guide. At first, it was only my husband and me, but she was happily willing to go with just us. Before we left, 5-6 more joined us, so we had a great small group to get a good grasp of the city. Orsi was a wonderful guide, full of information, great tips, best places to see, etc. She had great insights from a local's perspective for eating, activities, museums, transit, and even recommended a local Hungarian folk dance she herself attends on Friday nights. I would HIGHLY recommend this tour, especially if you are just getting into the city! Remember many paid walking your can be expensive, so tip accordingly!

Perfect introduction to Budapest. We did the pest to buda tour today with Orsi and it was wonderful! She was so knowledgeable and informative. A GREAT tour and in my opinion, a great alternative to the bus tours offered all over
Great walking tour. This is a great introduction to the city with personable and knowledgeable guides. You couldn't ask for more.

Budapest Free English Tour. Met by the lovely Kate and Anna who showed that they were both pleasing to chat with as well as knowledgable regarding the history of the country. Lovely weather coupled with lovely company. Thank you very much, will definitely recommend this tour to anyone looking to see the city on foot and learn the past as well as culture of the Hungarians.

Excellent tour, even more excellent tour guide!. My friend and I recently traveled to Budapest and started our trip with a walking tour led by Kate Boldizsar. Kate was AMAZING. She is incredibly knowledgeable about the cities, a Hungarian native, and very clearly loves what she does. Her love for culture, the cities, and history was evident and make a good tour great. Kate was willing to help us get the best bang for our buck in choosing other attractions as well and followed up with information via email - which I would consider above and beyond. I would HIGHLY recommend anyone starting a trip to Budapest with a walking tour guided by Kate. I couldn't say enough great things about her or the tour itself.

Our excellent guide, Kate. We recently took the free walking tour of Budapest with Kate Boldizsar. Kate was an excellent guide and she was very well informed on the history of Budapest. We were in the Pest part of the City. We were a very small group (only four) which meant we could ask lots of questions about the culture, politics and religion of the Country. Kate is an exceptionally friendly girl and we got a really comprehensive guide. The time flew and we think Kate's enthusiasm for her work was outstanding. When we next visit Budapest we intend taking another walking tour of a different part of the City.Meg & Ted, Ireland

A must do !. We had this very nice tour around Pest guided by Kate. Although it was our 3rd visit to Budapest, we still learned a lot of things. Kate manages to show the relationships between various historical events in an amazing way. She definitely is a top class guide !

Educational and engaging tour of Budapest. My friends and I actually did two tours with Free Budapest Tours. We did the general Budapest tour and the Communism tour. Our tour guides were Kate and Ursula, respectively, and they were both awesome. They were engaging, knowledgeable, helpful, and fun. During both tours, we got to see the main attractions of Budapest and learn about the history of the city. It was also a great way to learn more about the Hungarian culture. You do quite a bit of walking so make sure you wear comfortable shoes! Walking through the city was so much fun because you get to see the architecture of the buildings as well as observe the residents of the Budapest. The city has so much character that is highlighted and explained during the walking tours. Feel free to ask any and all questions because the tour guides know a lot about the city and will be honest if they don't know an answer. Therefore, they will not misinform you about Budapest/Hungary. Furthermore, our guides gave us recommendations for restaurants, wine bars, ruin bars, and other tourist attractions that were not covered in the tours, which we went to and had great experiences at. Lastly, the tours are free but it is customary to give a tip. It doesn't matter how much you give since the tour guide does not look at or count how much you give. Therefore, you are encouraged to give depending on how much you enjoyed the tour and how much you can afford within your budget. I highly recommend the walking tours not only in Budapest but in any city that offers them. My friends and I had a very positive and joyful experience.
Amazing!. Dora was an amazing guide! She explained us everything about Budapest! We hope to come back again to Budapest!

Very nice tour!!!. Dori was our guide during the free tour and she was brilliant. She was telling so many stories that you would never read in the books or Wikipedia, singing nice songs. We spent several hours talking to her after the tour. She is really very nice an out-going.We also visited ghost tour with Adam. Unlike ghost tours in other European countries this tour is telling Budapest bloody history, not just city legends. It was really scary, but worth-visiting.

A very good introduction!. Yesterday I joined the free Essential Pest Tour guided by Dori. It was a very nice and quick introduction not only to the city but also to Hungarian culture and history in general. The tour was very professional and funny in the same time. Dori even performed us a couple of beautiful folk songs and I have to tell that she is not only a very good guide but also a great singer! The tour was absolutely free, tipping was up to the participants without any pressure.

Fantastic Tour Covering A Lot of Budapest. The team at Budapest Free Tours do a great job - I had the pleasure of going on 2 separate tours: one in the morning covering Buda, and one in the afternoon covering Pest; I thoroughly enjoyed both tours and highly recommend them to anyone visiting Budapest.Both tour guides I had (Orsi and Andrea) were knowledgeable, enthusiastic, passionate, and funny; they were more than willing to answer whatever questions the group had. While there was a reasonable amount of walking (particularly on the Buda tour), the guides made sure to take an easy pace, and that everyone was keeping up.Great tour with great guides!

Awesome walking tour, Fantastic Tour Guide. Such a great tour! Saw many major landmarks, stopped for treats along the way. Had a very knowledgeable and sweet tour guide, Kate who was extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend this tour.
Amizing Walking tour in Budapest. It was an amazing tour, the guide, Orsi was very nice... The guides explained everything with enthusiasm.
Awesome Budapest Free Tour!!!. Very nice (super natuaral and symphatic girl) guide! You get a great overview. All in all 2 hours. Visit nice Places. Perfect (free) Tour!!!!

A great Budapest experience. Adam and Andi took us on an excellent walking tour. Their enthusiasm and love of Budapest was obvious and infectious; it made a bitterly cold day exciting and interesting.

Many local tips. The tour was interesting and nicely timed. We had a nice walk with a small group. We got to ask a lot of questions and received great local tips. Our guide even recommended a Hungarian dancing evening. It was an intense experience. There were no other tourists and we danced together with the friendly Hungarians to typical folk songs. Never to forget evening!

Nice tour!. I took the tour and Adam showed us around for a couple of hours. I really liked it because the guide had a lot of fun-facts / memories he could share with us. We also crossed the other free tour group, they were with 25-30 people (compared to us : 4) and I think that approach was a lot less personal (our guide really made an effort so that everyone could enjoy it). If you want a small group with a guide who knows his home city, take this one!
Great experience. We took two tours and enjoyed both very much! The guides explained everything with enthusiasm. I recommend it!

Amazing Tour!. We had a really great time on the tour with our guide Orsi! We actually showed up late at the second stop on the tour and she let us join, but also caught us up on what we had missed. She told us historical, interesting, and anecdotal stories about all of the places on the tour. All of our questions were answered and the places she recommended for food and drinks were really great! Overall great experience and I would recommend it as a really good way to explore the city.

Great way to see the sights. Did the morning tour with Adam. It was great, he was very informative and took us to all of the best sights in Buda and parts of Pest. He showed us very attractive buildings and not only that, but he knew all about the history behind them and what they represent. He had little stories about all of the statues and monuments, which was helpful because I usually just take a picture of a statue without even really knowing about it!The tour was timed so we ended up at the Presidents house right when the big changing of the guards show was happening (which happens once a day), and finished the tour at a hidden dining hall that the locals eat at, with great prices and authentic hungarian food! (Not tourist trap food). Would definitely recommend. Especially over other free walking tours as they tend to have groups of around 15-20 people which makes it less intimate.
Tour. It was an amazing tour, the guide, Andy, was really friendly and knows about everything she showed us!

The Dutch guys and Dora.. We had an awesome tour arranged by Dora and Adam. We saw a lot from the city and views of Budapest.Personally I would have liked to learn more interesting facts of the history of Budapest and how the city's infrastructure came about.. But we did see some nice buildings and architecture and did a great Hungarian dance (optional) near the Mathias church..Make sure you tip the guides because it is a nice way to see Budapest.

Buda+pest tour :) unforgettable. Was quite foggy and cold but Viki made out trip amazing, and unforgettable! Really nice experience to do to get to know the main sites of Buda and Pest! She gave also great advices about activities and restaurants ;)

Really enjoyed our morning with Kate. We took the walking tour of Pest and Buda with Kate in late December. Her English is excellent and she was able to communicate a lot of interesting perspectives on the history of Hungary and the city. She has a fun sense of humour and was very warm and engaging. The route was planned thoughtfully with some time out of the cold (!) and we got a great coverage of the major sights. We went back to a number of them...especially the strudel shop! Thanks Kate, you set a high benchmark for future tour guides!

Really good. Took the Buda + Pest Tour in the morning then the Communism Tour in the afternoon. Both guides, Orsi and Viki, were excellent. They clearly knew their subjects and kept us entertained, checking we were okay in the freezing cold and chatting and involving everyone along the way. I found out a lot about Hungary and Budapest through these tours and highly recommend them to anyone else visiting
Great guide, great tour. Took the Essential Pest Tour. Guide was amazing even though outside it was freezing. Highly recommend it!

Great tour with enthusiastic guide. We took the Buda+Pest tour with Kate, she was awesome. She speaks great English and is super friendly and enthusiastic. Kate made an effort to chat with whoever was nearest her on the walks between stops, and did a great job of trying to include everyone. The tour was also very informative and made me want to learn even more about the history of Budapest and Hungary. We did the Pest tour a few days later and Kate remembered us from the other tour. For the Pest tour we had a different guide. She was lovely and knew a lot of information, but she was a bit shy, and seemed reluctant to talk about some of the darker aspects of the tour (not people questioning her, but she would start to talk and then trail off).

Great tour! . Only having two days in Budapest, i took the Buda+Pest tour one day and the Pest Tour on the other. Great tours, covers a lot of the Budapest essential places and gives a historical background to the visit. Depends greatly on the guide you get, one was a younger lady with good english and very good at talking in public, the other was a bit older lady with basic english and a bit shy. Both knew the history of budapest very well.

The best guide ever - Adam Botta :). We came to Budapest after two free tours in Israel and the difference was huge. Adam was so charming, patient, so ivolved! What is more, because it was cold he kept on asking if we really don't need a break or something cold to drink. After the walk he went with some of us to the local restaurant and sat there for one hour or so. Amazing and friendly guy :)

The Essential Pest & Buda Tour. Essential in the sense that it's not only necessary, but it took the essence of Budapest and presented it to us to take home as a highly-cherished souvenir. The trip was amazing. I learned more than I did in history classes. And what's more important- I found out how similar Hungarian's history is to my own country's. Our guide Dora was amazing: constantly smiling, answering questions and as curious about us as we were about Budapest. And the best part: she sang a lovely Hungarian song on top of Buda. Spring winds sound lovely in December. I strongly recommend the tour! Budapest is such an amazing city. Go explore!

What more can you ask for?. This was simply a great tour, and to top it off it was free! The tour guide(Kate) spoke great English and knew a lot of great facts and history about the locations we visited. The tour was the perfect length and the locations we visited were the ones that you would expect to see. Would definitely go again if I ever visit Budapest again!

Communism Tour--a must. This free tour starts at 2:30 pm and is supposed to last an hour and a half. My friend and I were the only two people to show up, so we got a personalized tour that felt more like a conversation with an interesting new acquaintance than a tour! Our guide, Vicki Horvath, was excellent. She spent part of her childhood in the U.S., so had perfect English, and told us many stories about her own family and friends living in Hungary under communism as well as their experiences coming back for visits from the U.S. and her experience eventually moving back as an adult. She also presented an excellent picture of Budapest today and the challenges Hungarians face as the country recovers from communism. The walk is actually very short, with more standing than walking. Both the site and the guides recommend tipping "whatever you feel". We were not expecting to be alone, so we felt a little uncomfortable when it came time to hand over the tip. We wanted to give more than we would have if we had been in a large group, especially since Vicki spent more than two hours with us, but we couldn't really talk about it standing right in front of her. I believe that these guides' income comes only from tips. I would recommend deciding ahead of time how much you'd like to tip and planning for a few different scenarios. I will definitely try the other tour next time I'm in Budapest.
Excenllent ride. We received a lot of informations about one part of Budapest in the Walking tour in the afternoon. If it's possible I want to go in the morning in another time!Congratulations

Best thing I did in Budapest. We just came back from our ghost tour with Orsi. This was arguably the best tour I've done. The best way to see Budapest is on foot, many interesting and true grisly stories were told, the theatrics were delivered brilliantly and in perfect English and the suspense was nerve-wracking. We were constantly on edge for the hour and a half of the tour. We learned a lot about Budapest and Hungary, but the most interesting stories were those that you wouldn't normally be told on a sightseeing tour. Oddly, lights would either switch on or off as we walked past, a car alarm went off, all adding to the eeriness.Orsi is wickedly funny and a very engaging speaker. I laughed, screamed and got to walk through Pest on a beautiful misty evening.Thanks Orsi! I'll be back with more victims!

Ghost Tour with Orsi. I took the Ghost tour with Orsi last week and it was seriously one of the best tours I have EVER been on! She's incredibly knowledgeable, up for any question, a spit fire and just all around lovely and brilliant. I was SICK that I was leaving the following day and couldn't take all her tours! She is simply thee best!
