Kate was a great tour guide!. We went on the "Essential Pest Faith-Terror-Communism" free walking tour one afternoon and it was a very interesting and informative tour of Pest and its history. Our guide, Kate was very interesting, friendly and very knowledgeable about Budapest and its history. The tour covers many sites on the Pest side and is very informative but never boring. We also were taken into St. Stephen's Church where Kate had lots of interesting things to show us and many interesting comments. Her personal experiences and stories were also fun to hear. Overall....a great tour and a great tour guide! I would recommend this tour to anyone without any hesitation.

The perfect walking tour. I took the free walking tour to the Buda castle with Orsi today and it was an amazing experience. Not only the views and places are beautiful, but Orsi is an excellent guide. She's knowledgeable, lively, enthusiastic, and a really versatile person too! She also knows all the cool places in Budapest for eating out, drinking out, dancing, and what not. All within a budget. If you have the time, make sure you visit her ghost tour, which is a theatrical performance using the city as authentic decorations.

Knowledgeable guide, covered a lot. My 10-year-old daughter and I took a walking tour with Dora, and somehow Dora managed to pitch her tour so that it was rich enough with information for the adults, but also interesting for my daughter. We even went in to see St Stephen's miraculously preserved right hand. After the tour, Dora gave us great tips on finding vegetarian restaurants in Budapest. We went to a place she recommended, and it was fantastic. We'll be moving to Budapest in December and I plan to take Dora's tour again to help me get better oriented. I want to know my new city very well!

I learned things I wanted to know. To my opinion it was a good tour, the guides were, friendly and had a personal aproach towards us. We visited some of the important things to see in the city and there was space for questions and discussions. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to know something more about the history and culture of Hungary!

Ghost tour. I did the ghost tour a few days ago, and it was definitely a very different kind of sightseeing tour. The guide Orsi was dressed up as a witch and was very enthusiastic and believable in what she was telling. And walking through Budapest guided by a ghost is a very funny experience. ;-)But that's also why I can't give the 5 stars - it was nice and fun, but I really didn't think it was scary at all.

Excellent intro tour to Budapest. I had a lot of fun touring Budapest with Orsolya (Orsi). She was very knowledgable and managed to pack a lot of content and places we visited in a relatively short time. Overall I highly recommend this tour for those who wish to get the local perspective and a pretty good basic understanding of the history of Hungary and Budapest and the local culture.

Excellent tour!. Recently revisited Budapest and went on the ghost tour for a second time! the first surprise was the new female tour guide who had a very difficult act to follow from the previous guide who was extremely good and ghoulish. I'm pleased to say the new guide is EXCELLENT with superb knowledge and a charming way of portraying the explaining the ghostly history of this fascinating city. The walking is not too long, the storied very well told and the spookyness really chilling!Would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Budapest especially now the cold, dark nights are here, wrap up warm, let your imagination loose and absorb all the stories, bet you keep looking over your shoulder on the way back to your hotel afterwards!Think BethyT12 must have either been in the wrong city or on the wrong tour as my experience of this tour twice has been nothing but one that I can totally give 10 out of 10 for

Not overly impressed. Took this tour as I had read a lot of good reviews. Although we saw a lot of the city and the guide was informative I don't think when something is advertised as free and the at the end a suggest amount is given. That's what happened here. It was also noted a few times by the guide how hard things are for the people of Budapest and people like herself have to work three jobs in order to survive. Facts these May well be but when followed by a suggested tip at the end, I feel somewhat let down. This is just my interpretation. Overall the area covered was good, in terms of geography and history.

BethyT12 must by living on another planet- Excellent Ghost Tour. I don't usually write reveiws (this is my first) but I was so incensed by BethyT12 comments that I just had to write this one. The Ghost I went on was superb! well choreographed, a nice balance between TENish minute stories and walking. The Actress was faultless and stayed in character throughout the tour quite a few people were scared and there was a sprinkling of jet black humour. A surprising ending made this one of the best Ghost Tours I've been on and I've been on 9 so far. So if you like this sort of thing and even if you don't. make sure you do this tour and make your own mind up. As Mr Burns would say Exxcellent!

Ghost tour was more walking than talking. Unfortunately did not enjoy the ghost tour. While the tour guide was a very good actress, it was much more about the theatrics than any really good ghost stories. It felt like we were walking for ages in between each story, and whenever we did stop the stories didn't last more than a couple of sentences. Was very disappointed.

Great tours. I joined for two toura which are the 10.30am one (buda +pest side) and 2.30pm one (pest side). 10.30am tour is 2.5hours long. The tourguide explains well. She brought us on time to the buda castle to watch the grand changing of guard. She is the best tour guide that i ever met for my 2weeks europe trip. She is fantastic. For the 2.30pm tour, it was 1.5hours only. The history of pest side is well explained. She is willing to help us to take photos. Both of the guides are friendly amd willing to give some tips on food and sightseeing. This tour group is a must in budapest!

Two amazing free tours with Kate at Budapest. These free tours made my trip very special and joyfull! Me and my girlfriend just fell in love with Budapest after hearing it's history and seeing it's sights together with our guide Kate.The tour was both cognitive and fun. Kate gave us the exact ammount of information we needed, and if someone had any questions left, answering them with a great disire and enthusiasm.All that information and fun was free, which is amazing!Thank you for making our trip to Budapest so great!

Agreat way to start your time in Budapest. We stumbled on the tour by chance outside the President's building and really glad we did. The guide Ursula (Orsi) said we were more than welcome to join (we'd missed about 1/3 of the tour) and she gave us a quick update of the section of the tour we'd missed. She was very imformative in a relaxed manner and kept everyone's attention with loads of facts about Budapest. At the end of the tour, Ursula was happy to chat with people and recommend restaurants, bars, coffee shops we wouldn't of found otherwise. I'd highly recommend the tour.

Best way to know Budapest. My friend told me about Free Budapest Tours, so I didn't need more, I joined one group. That was a great choice; Katie the travel guide is amazing. Told me everything about Budapest, and she made jokes, smiled a lot, took pictures about the group, she made the tour interesting, fun. I got another informations like where to shop, go out, other cities. I hope I'll go back with my friends.

Enjoyed Free Budapest Tour. Hi guys,We could surely recommend you Free Budapest Tour, lot's of fun, not a regular&boring sightseeing. Great spent time and really nice guides Orszi&Koti. Hope to meet once again in your picturesque Budapest! Regards from polish group, Warsaw.

Highly recommended!. Visited this early October, Kate was great and very accommodating with great sense of humor!You will never be bored and she makes sure to get to know each and everyone in the group although we are a big group that time. I learned a lot from Hungary's history and enjoyed my very first free walking tour experience.First it just a tip you have to give them (which I think they deserve more really ) and secondly they will give you insider's tip where you can get good food that is not very pricey.I tried the resto that they recommended too! really appreciate this Group and hopefully the will continue this. Because of them Hungary is for me a good country to visit and my impression is that Magyars are really friendly people!

Faith, Terror & Communism tour. We took the Faith, Terror & Communism tour. It was informational but could have included more details & history and been a more animated tour guide. Overall OK for a free tour but not as exciting as some of the other tours I have been on in other cities.

Sunny day walk with too many people. First of all this tour was not bad. (It started downtown at the Deak and proceeded from there for two and half hours to various locations) Perhaps the comments made my expectations high, so I was very disappointed to see the huge crowd of fifty some people. (10/05). The young woman was cheerful and spoke good English but the tour was too slow with people stopping for photos or walking at a snail'pace. She was definitely not experienced in managing this size of group. I could not be close enough to hear her and to learn as much as I planned.
Wonderful Tour. I really enjoyed walking tour in Pest guided by Kate. She is really nice, and knows a lot about history.
Tour with Ursula. Really nice guide. Wonderful stories. Great tips! She even sang for us! I can only recommend the tour!!!

Indian summer with Kate!. Thank you very much for this valuable sightseeing tour with KATE! Budapest is a very impressive city, morover if you know the back stories about the buildings, statues, streets and other interesting thing during the tour.Kate, you were one of the best toursit guide of sighseeing tour which I participated in my life.Kate has got a good communicaton skill,she is kind, friendly, open mind, captivating and lovely!My favourite, She is so funny, you have a joke almost every station :DI hope we will meet in the future, and I wish the best to you!Köszönöm az élményt!

Turning the light on Budapest. My wife and I totally agree with Lisa T. As this was our first try at a personal tour, how lucky we were to get Adam Botta as our guide . His knowledge , insight and easy going manor made for a great day. There's a lot of history compacted in a very short span of time that Adam could explain in a way that could only come from a local perspective . Very,very good!

Budapest through the eyes of an Expert. My husband and I just got back from a trip to Eastern Europe. We began our trip in Budapest with the most incredible guide, Adam Botta. Along with my sister and her husband Adam gave us a view of Budapest we would surely have not gotten elsewhere. His love and passion for this city showed in the places he took us (which were often off the beaten path) and in how richly he presented the architectural and political history of this amazing and beautiful city. We learned so much about this city and had such an incredibly wonderful day, I can't imagine it could have been the same with any other guide. LJ Tessier

2 days in a row - most excellent!. Our guides Dora and Ursula were excellent, they were both experts about the history but also related some of the history to their own experiences in a very positive way. At the end of the tour, they went around to each participant and asked what they'd like to see on their trip, and took a few minutes to mark up maps with notes! For my wife and I this was perfect, we found ourselves following these tips for the rest of our trip. 5 stars! -Erich, Queens, NY

Nice way to see the city and learn about her history. Nice way to see the city and learn about her history.We took the tour on a rainy september eve, wich was a fitting setting for a "beautiful" ghost tour.The acting together with brilliant story telling, made it one of the best tours i'm ever been on!

Budapest free Tours with Kate !!. For my second times in Budapest, i decided to learn a little bit more about this beautiful city. I heard about this free tours, so i decided to try it and it was so interesting ! Kate my tour guide knew so many thing about all the thing we need to see, to know about all the famous place and attraction to go. She even knew the size of all the statue ! At the end of the tour, i knew a lot more that i expected and i had a great time with my group and Kate ! I recommend this tour !

Glad we stopped by. We had just arrived in Budapest and were walking past when we heard Ursula talking to a small group of people. We were interested so we stopped and are glad we did. It was a great intro to this brilliant city, and Ursula was energetic and interesting, chatting and offering individual advice on the walks between stops as well as marking our maps with places of interest at the end. Really great.

Budapest Ghost Tour. We recently returned from a weekend in Budapest, where we took the Ghost Tour in the evening based on the many great TripAdvisor reviews that we read. We were not disappointed! The tour guide/actor/ghost himself was top notch. He stayed in character 100% of the tour, never breaking once or cracking a smile (except his eerily creepy smile with accompanying devilish laughter!). He did an excellent job telling us an entertaining mix of ghost stories, urban legends, and historical facts that make up the creepier side of Budapest's history - both past and present. He made a few of us jump, particularly the girls! :) It was funny to see the looks on people's faces as he passed them on the streets. I know that if I encountered him walking down the street at night, I would be terrified! Overall a great time, a fun and entertaining tour. Absolutely worth doing while in Budapest for a fun and different type of evening activity!!

Interesting tour with a devoted guide. Took the tour in Spanish with some foreign friends and I learnt a lot about the history of the capital , although I'm Hungarian as well. Eva is a nice young lady with great knowledge, I definitely recommend the tour.

Impressive tours by local guides. We were in Budapest for 4 days and did two Free tours.We learned a lot about the Magyar culture.It's was a great adventage to do the tour with two local guides.So it was also possible to ask them questions about life now in Budapest en Hungary.It's nice to have some history but we also received a lot of information about actual things.That made it so real and intense.Keep up the good work!

nice experience with Ursula. very interesting walk around the city centre with Ursula, she is nice and knows lot of things about the city and its history. Maybe just a bit too direct in asking for the tips, I've already done such a tour in other capitals and find 10 euros each, a bit expensive for 1.5 hour tour, but definitely very very positive exeprience

Great ghost tour!. The ghost tour is a must do in Budapest. It was one of the most fun things we did there. The actor was amazing! The day after we saw the other couple of the tour and she even thought it was a bit to scarry; that good was the actor !!

Great way to discover Budapest. Thank you Dora for an excellent walking tour of Budapest. You told us so much about the history of your country, you clearly have a very good understanding of the political and social development of Hungary. We also enjoyed listening to your stories about your family and friends and how they coped with their lives throughout lots of changes.

Ghost Tour review. After reading a couple reviews about this famous ghost, me and my girlfriend decided to give it a try and we were not dissapointed!!The actor is really immersed in his role and knows perfectly how to balance the creepy with the humourous. It is even cool to see the reaction of people passing by when they see a creepy ghost followed by a bunch of people around the streets of Budapest.The tales the ghost has to tell blend in very well with the surroundings and history of the city and are very entertaining.The tour itself lasts about 1.5 hours and is a good mix of walking in narrow streets and stopping by a few known and not so well known buildings.So, if you want a night that is a bit different and a little more macabre; we can fully recommend this tour!K.D (The Belgians)

HIGHLY recommend this tour!!. Unfortunately, we only had 24 hours in Budapest, so we decided the free walking tour would be a good way to see the city. I am so glad we chose this tour! Oshi, our guide, was absolutely amazing. Her English is perfect, and her knowledge of the history of Hungary is fantastic. This 2 hour tour is the perfect amount of history and sightseeing. Oshi even sang a Hungarian folk song for us! We had a small intimate group which was perfect- you could ask anything and Oshi knew the answer.I have already recommended the tour to several friends who were heading back into Budapest this week. I highly recommend this tour! Budapest is easy to walk (assuming you can walk the steps up to the castle) and it's wonderful to see from a locals perspective! She also gives lots of information on where to eat at inexpensive, excellent restaurants. We had to rush to get our ride to Szeged so could not take advantage of her depth of knowledge of the city.The tour is free but you can tip your guide. They will let you know what would cover their costs (which is less than $10), but they do not require a tip. Given that tours can cost over $50, it was easy to be generous, but that's your choice.Thanks so much Oshi for taking such good care of us and providing an incredible tour!Visited July 2013

Friendly guide - great tour. I only had one day to visit Budapest so this kind of tour was all that I could ever dream of. My guide was Orsi. Very well informed in all details. She was able to tell me everything that I wanted to know about Budapest history. She also gave me some very good advice about places to eat some traditional food for a good price. She is a professionist. Highly recommended.

fabulous ghost tour. Went on the ghost tour with my husband last night I had read reviews about it at home so decided to go along we had a taxi from the zara continental it starts at 8.30 when we saw him we were amazed he looked so frightening and when he spoke it was so realistic we went around with 3 other couples we all loved it still thinking about today if you get the chance to this tour do it is worth it it has been the highlight of our holiday in Budapest so glad I saw it on trip adviser also I emailed them and they replyed ar once.

Great way to know the city (and the ghost tour is really good too!). Our city guide was Kate and she was phenomenal. Really friendly, knows a lot about the city, and gave us a lot of history facts. The tour takes an hour and a half and walks around both sides of the Danube. I really recommend it. (and feel free to ask about places to go - they have really good recommendations.Then we took the ghost tour at night and our guide was in full costume and totally in character. It was hilarious and also informative. It was also a great way to meet people!! (Other tourists were attracted to this group of people following a guy dressed like a monk with a white face!) Both tours are free and tipping is done at the end, at your discretion.

Great thing to do - definitely would recommend. We decided to do this tour on our first night in Budapest which was a really good idea as it meant we got our bearings and saw places/ restaurants/ bars we wanted to visit over the next few days. Apart from that though me and my friends (aged 24) all found this tour fun, educational and extremely entertaining. The guys organising it were very funny and helpful. Thanks very much :)
Highlight of our trip!!!. Awesome time! Best ghost tour we have ever been on!!! A must while in Budapest!!! Entertaining, theatrical, and a great history lesson of Budapest!!!!

Ghost Tour--best!. I’ve been on ghost tours in various different cities and continents so I have quite high standards in terms of spectral entertainment. I must say this was the GREATEST ghost tour I have ever been on and it surpassed my wildest nightmares. My friends and I arrived to the starting point of the tour and we could not believe what the guide looked like--a ghoul straight from the grave. The minute he spoke we almost fell over in terror, but we quickly learned that he was intelligent, morbidly hilarious, and well-spoken (he has perfect English so maybe he is from America or from another world)? He led us down dark streets of Budapest where we’d normally never traverse as ordinary tourists, and he told us about the brutal horrors that happened in seemingly ordinary buildings. When he told us the story of “the children” we were so terrified--it was one of the most disturbing stories I have ever heard. By the end of the tour, we all were relieved that we were still alive. Honestly, this is a must-do when in Budapest. By the end of the tour my friends and I were considering skipping our plans to go to the thermal baths and return again on the following night's tour. The guide is that good. He put so much effort into the tour which is rare these days and it was refreshing to see someone who really knows how to tell a story. So thank you to our guide! I definitely would recommend this tour for people of all ages (there were even children on our tour)--it was a real treat!

Ghost Tour. Ghost tour was great. Was a little surprised by the cost of the walking tour. I thought that it would be free since it was advertised with the free walking tours. For 2 adults and a 14 year old it cost about $50.00. Once the walk began, I soon got over the price tag. Despite the 89 degree temperatures at 8:30 at night, the tour guide was in full costume. A black polar fleece tunic that also covered his head finished off with white stage makeup in his face. His English was excellent and his story telling skills were quite theatrical. My 14 yr. old was very creeped out by the whole thing. We walked through the city listening to his tales for 1.5 hours and then he posed for pictures. It was great.

A great morning's introduction to the city. 6 of us turned up for the morning Buda tour - not really knowing what to expect and we were more than pleasantly surprised. Our guide Katie was professional, charming and fun. We had already done the bus tour but this really helped us to get to know more about the city and the people. All of us would all recommend Free Budapest Tours to anyone new to the city. Thanks Katie!

A spot in the shadow!. We took both tours; the essential Buda and the essential Pest-tour. The Buda-tour was with Victoria/Viki and she is by far the best guide we ever had during our free walking tour adventures in other cities. She cared a lot about the city and its history and she wasn't afraid to share many stories of it with us. She also almost constantly referred to interesting places we should also visit during our stay (ruin bar e.g.). The tour was quite the hike uphill but definily worth the while. The Pest-tour was way too short and actually quite dissapointing. The guide was 10min late and the walking tour itself was merely a 1km walk. The stories were not at all "communist history, terror and fear", as the flyer said, but a patchwork of different small anekdotes of which we could conclude that Hungary wasn't the most ideal place one can imagine. A bit sad if that should be our feeling after the tour, no?

GHOST TOUR BEST TOUR EVER!. We went on the ghost tour in budapest it was the most animated and exciting tour ever!! This is definitely a MUST if you visit Budapest. Our tour guide "ghost" acted his role so well and kept everyone in the tour enthralled. Not just a typical tour.. One that will really excite you and give you quite a scare! Highly recommended!!!

Ghost Tour -- Frighteningly good!!!. This tour was both highly entertaining and educational. The tour guide (aka The Ghost) was very professional and convincing. He truly put on a show for us and we were all captivated from start to finish. We got an eerie tour of the city, an excellent ghost performance and an unforgettable history lesson in Budapest's dark history. This tour was truly one of the highlights of our trip. Give it a chance and you will not be disappointed!

A truly unique way to see Budapest, scary but fun too.. He created a scary atmosphere from the very beginning. The tour was informative, creative and just the right balance of horror and humour. It was good to be given a short respite of a sit down half way through and where possible the sites were well chosen. Very well done!

Best Walking Tour I've Done. I took the Ghost Tour. It's not free, you have to pay, but it is WELL WORTH IT! I've done a good deal of walking tours, including some ghost ones and this one is the best! It's done by a professional theater actor, the stories are wonderfully written, and the storytelling is impeccable! You'll find yourself gawking, giggling, jumping and totally captivated. Great references to history too! Highly recommend.

The best and fun tour I ever been. From the get go, it was electric with Katie as our tour guide. She was professional and knowledgable of the city. Not to mention very energitic and made us laugh during the tour. Thanks Katie...

Fantastic tour - really worthwhile. This was a really great tour, our guide Andrea was very knowledgeable about Budapest and it's history and was able to answer lots of questions. The tour started in Pest and pretty quickly went across the river to Buda. It went at a very good pace that seemed to suit everyone. Would reccommend.

Really good tours. We are staying in Budapest for 5 days so I have done both this free tour and the other one. Both of them were quite good but the city tour of this one is really recommended compared to the communist tour of the other one.Our guide was Ursula, she did a great job ttelling the entire history and talking about the Hungarian culture.I really recommend the city tour that starts at 10:30 with this company.

HIGHLY recommend this tour!. Unfortunately, we only had 24 hours in Budapest, so we decided the free walking tour would be a good way to see the city. I am so glad we chose this tour! Oshi, our guide, was absolutely amazing. Her English is perfect, and her knowledge of the history of Hungary is fantastic. This 2 hour tour is the perfect amount of history and sightseeing. Oshi even sang a Hungarian folk song for us! We had a small intimate group which was perfect- you could ask anything and Oshi knew the answer.I have already recommended the tour to several friends who were heading back into Budapest this week. I highly recommend this tour! Budapest is easy to walk (assuming you can walk the steps up to the castle) and it's wonderful to see from a locals perspective! She also gives lots of information on where to eat at inexpensive, excellent restaurants. We had to rush to get our ride to Szeged so could not take advantage of her depth of knowledge of the city.The tour is free but you can tip your guide. They will let you know what would cover their costs (which is less than $10), but they do not require a tip. Given that tours can cost over $50, it was easy to be generous, but that's your choice.Thanks so much Oshi for taking such good care of us and providing an incredible tour!

Great way of starting to know the city. Orsi was a great guide through Budapest. She was not only very commited to her task, but fun as well. The tour itself was very complete and interesting, it helps understanding the city, finding your way and choosing interesting places to go back to later. But even if you don't, the tour is enough for getting a good idea of the place. I ended it having lunch with her and other girl from Morocco and thus getting more insights. By her recommendation, I also visited Szentendre (St Andrew's) the following day, a nice village outside Budapest. She really likes her job and it shows!

Great intro to coty. Our guide Vicki provided a pleasant and interesting tour of the city. She was willing to share family stories which gave us the personal side of historical events. I highly recommend one of these tours as an introduction to the city. Even if you like to explore on your own its a treat to put away the map fo a while and let someone show you their city.

History + Knowledge + Fun. Thank you Kate for a wonderful introduction to the history of Budapest. Can't fault the knowledge of the guide and her English was excellent. Went from Pest up to Buda discovering both popular and out of the way places of interest. Offered a personal opinion on the past and what the future could hold and definitely seemed to enjoy sharing both the views and knowledge with the group. Didn't mind my continual extra questions too (sorry!). At the end helped to highlight other places of interest on our maps before taking us to a local cafe to re-energise - it was a 2.5 hour walk! Overall excellent and free too - tip what you can afford.

Hidden horrors in Budapest... This was a delightful way to discover the hidden bodies under the city and their stories and also get a little taster of the fascinating history of this City. The ghostly guide (Celtic I suspet but you would never know from the Bella Lugosi look and soundalike) was mesmerising and very quick-witted, so we had to keep up at all times! We had a cake break too - Count Dracula's favourite.. pity we did not get a drop of his favourite tipple to go with it! Well done and highly recommended (although not quite free but worth every penny).

Great tour!. Orsi was our guide to the english buda tour and did a great job. She managed to keep it interesting, fun and informative the whole 2.5 hr tour. A great way to know the city, especialy if it's a first visit to budapest.

Spooky and great entertainment. This tour is a 'must do' on a warm evening to chill your bones! The guide is excellent in both presentation and knowledge of the historic events that give the tour true meaning.The distance isn't too far for anyone but the sites covered and stories told will give you a real feel of the darker side of this city. the time passes very quickly due to the vibrant nature of the guide.Thoroughly recommended for any adult and not just those with a leaning towards the ghostly side

Wonderful walking tours. We did 2 tours with this group while in Budapest:-the tour that crosses over to Buda with Viki as our guide-the shorter one staying on the Pest side with Kate as our guideI would thoroughly recommend both of these tours. The guides were very knowledgeable and happy to take questions from the group. Like everyone else, I suggest doing them early in your stay in Budapest as the guides can give you many tips about where to go/ not to go.Note: there are many walking tour operators in Budapest. If you know which one you want to do, make sure you don't get coerced into mistakenly joining another one! This nearly happened to us...

Honest locals wonderful tours. I took two tours:1. The ghost tourA unique nightly tour to the dark alleys of Budapest, with dark twist. Joyful and scary, a must try when you visit2. Buda tour. A 2 hours walking through buda side. You can see many things how royal were living. Plus a summary of 1000 year of Hungarian history. This tour was for free!

Ghost Tour. We really enjoyed the ghost tour!!!Full of sights and facts about the country and its spooky past!Actor was brilliant!!!! Very impressed!!The other guide was very polite and helpful.Would definitely recommend!!!!
Ghost Tour. I really enjoyed this tour. Budapest in night lights, tour full of legends stories, jokes and scary moments. I would recommend..

Free Tour - Essential Budapest Tour. We took the "Essential Budapest Tour" with Orsi (Ursala) as our guide. She was very friendly and knowledgeable about Hungarian history and gave a very thorough explanation of the sites in central Pest. She was able to answer our questions which went well beyond the basics,and gave what I felt was an unbiased account of Hungary's role in WWII and the events leading up to and following the 1956 revolution. I would highly recommend this tour to any visitor to Pest who has an interest in Hungarian history and culture.

Fantastic Tour!. We were in Budapest for only a weekend and wanted to see and learn as much as we could during that time. We went on the Pest+Basic Buda Tour and our guide, Adam, was awesome. He went above and beyond any tour guide I have ever met. He was so enthusiastic, funny, personable, and passionate about his city! It was such an enjoyable time! We not only learned a lot about the city and its history, but we also got to experience some culture events such as the changing of the guard and a parade. He really did a marvelous job and made it the best tour I have ever experienced! I highly recommend this tour company and their incredible guides like Adam. Thank you!! Our time on your tour was the highlight of our day!!

History shows it's complicated.... Enjoyed a nice afternoon tour with Andrea as guide. She told us lots about the complicated past with communism, Cold War, dividence etc. However, I do believe one should do the morning tour as well, since the 14.30 tour doesn't cover many sights. Or... maybe the problem lies in the fact that Budapest has too much to offer!

a wonderful afternoon in Budapest. We were lucky to be instructed by Orsolya Vegh from freebudapesttours that walked with us through the streets of Pest and saved no effort to intreduced the beutyful city and its history. We recomend to all visitors to take the free walking tour and we are grate ful to Orsolya.

Ghost tour. Although a new adventure for the company, the evening walking ghost tour which I joined in is well worth the experience. Had a fab time, interesting spooky facts, sights of the city under street lights, visiting the back streets of old buildings & cobbled streets. Great night of humour & scary moments all round & very friendly staff! Would recommend the optional "Brain" drink at end of tour.

A "free" walking tour. I did free walking tours in several cities,but have quite a mixed feeling about the Pest tour. We arrived on a rainy Sunday afternoon and the group was very small. The guide was friendly and showed us around interesting places in Pest. However we found the explanation of history strongly biased. The Hungarians were basically described as permanent victims of the events of the 20th century, there was no other view or reflection. Having done a similar tour in Berlin I believe it's possible to explain a complicated history in a simple way,yet remain somehow objective. I also felt quite uncomfortable about the way we were asked for tips at the end. I understand how these tours work and just don't need an explanation of what their costs are and how much I should give. It's just weird and counter-productive.

Free Tour in Budapest. We did the tours as well. In the morning with talkative bike-Adam and in the afternoon with Ursi. That was one day full of walking. Important sights were explained, a lot of questions answered (but don't believe all of Adam's stories) and the history explained in the important context. I liked most about the tours that after this day, we knew where to go first to explore the city a bit more - sights (from the insight), pubs and bars, restaurants and nice places to visit. Of course, the tours are not 'free' - tip well if you liked it and less if you didn't.And don't miss the Literature walk! If you like books, stories and poems - you will not regret it.

Budapest with Adam Botta. On a recent weekend visit to Budapest Adam was our tour guide for two mornings, one exploring the Buda side of the city the other on the Pest side. He gave us a great understanding of the city, its history and its arts. Adam has a tremendous knowledge of his city and can easily adapt his tours to include your particular interests. As well as speaking several languages Adam also carries out voluntary work in one of the art museums. It seems whatever your specialty is Adam know a lot about it and is very personable in the way he explains things. As well as acquainting us with the underground system, he also recommended good restaurants right across the price range from a Jewish self-service eatery, a strudel restaurant, through to a top end cake and coffee house.By the end of the tours it felt like you had been taken around Budapest by a friend and I have attached some photos of Adam at work.Adam if you ever come to England we would be more than happy to show you round Cambridge but don’t expect our knowledge to be a patch on yours … we had better start reading our history books now.Liz & Graham x

GO for it. I had a great time during this amazing almost 3 hours tour around Budapest. Our tour leader/ guide Orsi is very open, friendly, intelligent and talkative person and don't miss a free walking tour with her while visit BP no doubts it will be unforgeable time.

Free Budapest Tours. We took two of the tours offered. The first, The Complete Pest tour, was a fascinating look at religion, the city, life under communist rule and history. Eva did a great job! The Orientation tour led by Vicky was nothing short of fantastic...walking from the Pest side up to the castle district was fabulous.There were three of us on each tour and we all agreed well worth the time. No hard sell on other attractions or anything. We gladly tipped Fl3,500 each (about $15).

Good introduction to Budapest. I completed a Buda + Pest 2.5 hour walking tour with Viki in English and really enjoyed it. It was a good mix of historical information, current affairs and personal context.The tour started from near the central metro station and ended up in the castle district, including the newly introduced changing of the guards routine. Viki was a very good guide; enthusiastic, humorous and engaging.Recommended for a good introduction to Budapest.

Walking tour. Thoroughly recommend a walking tour early in your visit.Vikki kept us informed and interested despite the bitterly cold day, with insights into Hungary, Budapest history and every day life. It's the best way to get to know a place.There was no hard sell or hardship stories to push for tips but you would have to be the meanest person on Earth not to pay something for such a memorable and worthwhile tour. Thanks again to Vikki and all involved

A great introduction to Budapest. On a very warm day in June my friend & I met Adam Botta and Adam Marot for a new tour of the sights relating to Jewish Budapest. Among the narrow streets of Central Budapest there are many stories about their lives. We also stopped outside the Great Synagogue. This tour is new to this organisation who also offer tours of Pest, Sights & stories about Communism and a walk around the castle and hilly streets of Buda

The best walking tour in Budapest. My husband and I did a walking tour to the castle with orsi. She was great, told us so much history of Hungary and Budapest , and shared lots of personal history which bought everything to life. Great tour, fully recommend it.

You can't go wrong with these tours!. I originally posted this great review with a competing tour! Here it is in the correct place!I went on both the Orientation tour in the a.m. and the Complete Pest tour in the p.m. For a free "tip" tour both were great. The first one went more north of the city across the Danube River towards the Royal Palace. The second tour spent its time on the Central pest side.The Complete Pest tour seems to have a bit more walking and more to see and hear about. If you only have time for one I would recommend that tour. Nevertheless for "tip" tours both were great. They both went to different sites and had different content. The tour guides for both tours were very informed and fun.

Excellent tour. Viki gave us a very interesting and informative tour from Pest to Buda. We enjoyed the morning tour so much that we joined the afternoon as well. We did the Pest tour with Adam (with bicycle). He was an excellent guide! You can ask the guides a lot about the country and city and all the restaurants they recommended were very nice. It really was the best way to see Budapest and we would highly recommend these free tours to all visitors.Thanks a lot!

Excellent introduction to Budapest. Orsi (Ursula) gave a very interesting and informative tour from Pest to Buda. I particularly liked the history that she wove into the tour, and the very short introduction to the Hungarian language. Orsi also gave us lots of tips for other sights to see and restaurants and cafes. It was the perfect start to our three days in Budapest.

Highly recommended!. We had Ursula for the walking tour on New Years Eve and she was very friendly and informative! Although it was a relatively big group due to the holiday season, she was always very patient with us in terms of making sure we didn't lose anyone during the walking tour, asking any questions we had or need more time for photos. My friends and I knew nothing on Budapest and now we know what its history and culture. Even though she most likely say the same thing everyday on each tour, but she definitely presented the tour very passionately and professionally! In relation to the previous negative review with this particular tour guide, I completely disagree. I have also been on other free tours in other cities and the tour guide asking where you're from is usually the first question to break the ice, and obviously when you participate in such tours, you must be a tourist. We gave her tips at the end of the tour because it is definitely worth your while to know Budapest in detail!Thanks so much Ursula! Group of friends from Ireland x

Fun and Informative. I scheduled a private walking tour for 2 hours for December 8th and the tour was excellent. Adam and Andrea gave me a fantastic tour of the historical religious sites including the Basilica. They had a wealth of knowledge that was very interesting. We completed the tour at the Christmas market where they helped guide me to the vendors that were selling local products vs. mass produced items. No need to buy. They just were giving advice. Fantastic tour. Highly recommended.

What a disappointment!. This tour was a true disappointment and just for one reason... It didn't happened at all because the nice tour guide (I think her name is Ursula) refused to do it because it was raining and there were just two people for the tour - Us!According to the reviews and the Free Budapest Tours website there are free tours everyday. The message that is passed to customers is what? That there's tours everyday no matter what. You don't need to book and it doesn't mention a minimum of people to do it. At least I didn't read it anywhere and still don't find anything about it. Maybe I'm wrong but don't think so... There's lack of information about their modus operandus! That's just a shame...We arrived a few minutes early and waited, we met both tour guides but the one that was doing the tour was the one that stayed - Ursula.She was very nice at first and asked us to wait a few more minutes so more people could join us but as nobody showed up. As nobody showed up she first started to ask if we would like to see something in particular and we answered that we were expecting to get to know the city better in order to explore it afterwards. After this she started asking us several questions including one about where did we fly from... She already new we were Portuguese but in our opinion (mine and my husband's opinion) she was trying to know if we were emigrants to try to figure out how much she would get from us as tip at the end.Guess what? We lied... We told her we flew from Portugal and that was our mistake (or not!). The truth is that we don't like personal questions and being judged by our nationality (if that's what happened... I can't tell for sure, this is just my opinion and the impression that the tour guide gave us). After we provided her this information she asked us if we wanted the tour and we said yes but then she just said it would be a better idea to do it on another day with more people...She gave us a map and provided us some useful information of what to visit and where to go (at least she did that after refusing to do the tour! That was, actually, the only decent thing she did after refusing to do the tour!)We thanked her but obviously we didn't gave her any tip after the bad impression she gave us.Again, I'm telling you what happened because I feel it's my call to warn everybody visiting Budapest and looking for a free tour... If the weather is not nice and there's not enough people you might not get a tour with this company.About my opinion and impressions... They are what they are... impressions according to the person's (guide) behavior. I do understand that this company lives from tips and we were willing to give a generous one at the end as we always do when taking free tours. In this case we were willing to pay more because the guide's work would be more personal. That's just common sense. We made no offer at front because the way things were done didn't pleased us at all and if the guide was not willing to do it at first we wouldn't have a good time either.I did several city tours and from my experience paid ones like I did, for example in Berlin, are much better but to get to know the city a free tour can be good too. In Prague we had a good experience with a free tour and gave a generous tip. The Prague's Sandemans tour with Jacob was captivating.Unfortunately I can't tell the same of this one. The only thing I can say and advise to the company is that they should revise the way they work and provide this information on the website and also they should improve the way they communicate with people. Asking questions that suggest that the guide is looking for information about customers social and economical status might be uncomfortable and give a bad impression. Anyway, we were able to explore the city and enjoyed it as much as we could. This small episode didn't ruin our Budapest experience. We never let those things affect our vacation. We actually loved the city and had met some wonderful, polite and professional people along the way during our stay.

A must in Budapest. We just left Adam at Vorosmarty Ter after a 6 hour private tour. My wife and I arrived at Budapest without a clue of what to do and called Adam last night to see if he could give us a tour and, lucky for us, he was available. The guy has a profound love of his city and it shows in how he shows it to you. I am tired now, but in love with Budapest thanks to Adam.

One of our trip highlights. We had an incredible tour with Adam. I was motivated to try this tour after we'd had a bad tour with a disinterested tour guide in prague, because the guys on the free tours work solely for tips, and if they don't do a good job, they get nothing. well adam was absolutely terrific, spent so much time with us, was of a very positive attitude, fun, and enthusiastic. We got a lot of insight about what it was like to live in Hungary during the Soviet regime and also so much more color on the Hungarian people/ mindset than we would have gotten otherwise. After the tour, Adam was helpful enough to mark up our map with some great bar and restaurant suggestions. After his recommendation, we went to a ruin bar we never would have found otherwise. Really, really recommend this!

Fantastic tour. The guide I had on the day was Ursula. She was well spoken, knowledgable and very pleasant. The tour was well structured, informative and covered many years of the history of Hungary and Budapest. The guide took us to some great sites and provided plenty of time for photos. The guide provided a map at the end of the tour with great information on things to do and see. She even took us to a cafe after the tour to try some Hungarian foods. It is a tip based tour so you can leave and not pay if you feel it necessary, but I can tell you now, you will be very happy to tip a few thousand forint for the time, knowledge and experience you gain from this tour.

One of the best things I did!. Ursula was our guide on these free walking tours and bought Budapest's culture and history to life for us. Having been on many walking tips based walking tours, this is definitely one of the better ones I've experienced. Definitely a great way get to know the city whether you are a solo traveller or group. These walking tours are tips based and you pay whatever you feel is appropriate at the end.

Windy november afternoon. We had read about the free walking tours on Tripadvisor and on our last day in Budapest we decided to do a tour to meet a local and to hear what locals have to say about Budapest and Hungary.. A windy November afternoon so we were the only ones to turn up. Our guide took us on a very interesting and a very individual tour through the heart of Pest. athough we had already seen quite a lot of the city she showed us many interesting sights and listening to her made us realize what a complicated history and present Hungary has has and still has. The Liberty Square does get new meaning then! Do this tour by all means!

Highly recommended!!. When we arrived in Budapest we didn't really have a plan, we luckily stumbled across someone holding a 'Free Budapest Tours' sign on our first morning there. We decided this would be the best way to get our first glimpse of this city! This is the first free walking tour I have ever done, and I loved it! Budapest has such an interesting history and story, it would be a mistake not to do a tour with a local. Our tour guide was Orsi and she was fantastic - once the tour was over she gave us lots of suggestions on restaurants and other things to see in the city. We enjoyed her tour so much that we decided to do the Pest tour the following day - our tour guide for that was Adam (younger). We found this tour to be very interesting, and we went to areas we never would have found by ourselves. Overall, both of these guides had great English, were charming, and very knowledgeable. They both shared personal stories from their family's past that made the tour feel really unique. We were lucky that both of our tours only had 5 people, so it felt really personable and you could ask so many questions!

“Very good tours but if I was to pick one to go on it would be the Pest to Buda tour.”. Did the Communist tour and tour of the Pest to Buda tour. Both were very good but if I was to pick one to go on it would be the Pest to Buda tour, which was excellent. The Communist tour was good but I think there were too many times when we're walking for too long without any in depth explanations.

This tour is worth taking - excellent English speaking guide and best city map. My last review was meant to be for this group. As they all have very similar names it gets quite confusing. This is my correction as I really wanted to highlight how good my guide was from this group. My guide, Orsi, issued the green and red city map which was so much easier to follow than all the other city maps esp if you want to go further afield. We went on the 10.30am Pest to Buda tour in late September Orsi was just getting over a cold but she still had a lot of enthusiasm for the tour, and between sips of water gave us such interesting facts about Budapest and its history. My husband really enjoyed the political history and how much it had affected Orsi's parents' and grand-parents' generations. This kind of information we would have not got if we had just followed a guide book. The fact that Orsi's English was excellent made the tour the more enjoyable and she allowed us to ask her a lot of questions during the walk. We have been on other tours in other countries which we just switched off because we could not follow their English. Really recommend this tour, and if all the guides are like Orsi they do deserve their tips. Plus we were in a group of 6 and 2 were returnees from a different tour by the same guide.

Beautiful Budapest. My second time to this wonderful city and always new sights and experiences to enjoy. The weather was fair so walking was easily the best option.Orsi was my charming and enthusiastic tour guide for the Complete Pest Tour and her knowledge of the historical and architectural details of her city are excellent. The tour took us to the Jewish memorial giving time for reflection on the inhumanities suffered by them from the nazis and communists and, later in the tour, the information Orsi could give us on the hardships and persecution many ordinary Hungarians had to deal with from the communist dictators from personal family knowledge really brought home how lucky we were in the west during those Cold War days.Orsi's recommendations of places to see, visit, eat and drink are also worth noting to see the REAL Budapest that you would miss by not going on one of these tours. Would recommend going to the website www.freebudapesttours.hu and make the most of your visit.

Well done and worthwhile. Based on these reviews, i contacted Adam Botta (with only 1 day notice) to book a private tour of Buda and Pest. He could accommodate us despite the short notice, but ultimately asked his associate Eva to work with us. Eva was great. Good English. Knew the story of every building in town. Tireless. Friendly. loves Budapest and Hungary. Told a good story. In short, a great guide. Use these folks.
Excellent guide. Orsolya was our guide for the 10.30 tour of mostly Buda. Excellent mix of history, recommendations and fun. Highly recommended. Her English and knowledge is excellent.

We enjoyed the first walk so much, we did all three!. My two friends and I had Orsi for all three walking tours. We enjoyed her stories and passion for her city so much that we just kept going along each day!! Plus walking is the best way to see the city.Orsi was also great at recommending other places to eat, ruin bars and after one tour even went for lunch at a hidden place and invited the tour group to come along (which we did!) so make sure you ask her for some recommendations. She also gives out book recommendations too!The other thing my friends and I found helpful, in addition to all the rich history, was some of the language basics - that's always handy when you arrive to a new country.

So what. So what if the tour could have been made a bit more lively. So what if participants weren't as interactive as the guide (Adam, the one with the bike) had hoped them to be. These people are determined to do the right thing, on their own, without support from government or major travel companies, and they deserve all the credit for it. Besides, I couldn't have done it better myself. We took the 3-hour 14:30 Pest-only tour and found it fascinating, informative, extensive, comprehensive and practical.Tip generously.A word to management: we had a hard time finding Adam at first and the information desk at the corner near the meeting point sent us toward your competition at St Stephen's Basilica, where apparently another free Budapest tour begins at the same time. Quick cell-phone browsing helped us catch up with the tour at the last minute. A bright t-shirt or a tall sign that can be indicated on your website next to the meeting-point directions would do the trick.

Fantastic way to see Budapest. I spent over two hours on Saturday learning about Budapest with the help of our wonderful guide Adam (with the bike, AKA "the talkative one"). Adam put in a lot of context in addition to guiding the group - he had great stories about urban myths and real events, related to the sights we walked by. The group was relatively large in size and Adam matched his voice and energy respectively. Definitely recommended!

Great guide in Budapest. We didn't go with the free tours. We hired Adam Botta to be a private guide (he has that option in addition to his free tours). He's wonderful guide and we saw much more of Budapest than we would have otherwise. He helped us get train tickets to Vienna (believe me....if you're getting train tickets from Budapest to places outside of Hungary, you need help). We then went on an 8 hour tour using the trolleys and metro. He gave us restaurant recomendations and other places we should see. To give you an idea of his customer service, while we were still there, I emailed him to ask about antique shops. He answered. When I got back to the states and emailed about how much paprika cream (go to the market and learn what it is) I should add to a stew, he answered (I asked him to ask his mother to be sure, and he did). Either the free tours or Adam as a private guide, you can't go wrong.

free walking tours- a great way to see budapest. We found out about the free tour through our hostel and enjoyed the morning tour- mainly of the Buda side of the city- with a brilliantly honest and entertaining guide Vicky, so much that we decided to wander along and join the afternoon one-which would explore the Pest side of the city-after we'd had a very cheap and tasty traditional Hungarian lunch(recommended by our morning tourguide). As we didn't have very much time in Budapest it was a great way to get your bearings and learn about the history of the place. Ursula, the afternoon tourguide, was very helpful in recommending ruin bars to visit, and the atmosphere was so relaxed that we didn't feel compelled to stay with the tour, but did so out of choice! The guides are clearly passionate about giving visitors to Budapest an interesting and informed picture of life in the city.

Great Tours!. After touring with the Free Walking Tours in Prague and in Krakow, we looked for them in Budapest. We did a tour of the main part of Pest, which I believe was a new and expanded tour route and included the Jewish Quarter and some Soviet era history. I did not catch this guides name but she was excellent. We did the castle side tour the following day, which was St Stephen's Day, with Adam. He did an equally fantastic job of informing us of Hungarian history and culture. I came away with a great appreciation for the Hungarian people. We really appreciated Adam's insights and ability to look at things with a sense of humor. It is also so very wonderful how the guides make themselves available after the tours to answer individual questions on where to go, what to see, etc. Anyway, these are great tours and we were disappointed that they were not available in Vienna.

Pest - Buda tour with Adam-junior was awesome. We really enjoyed the morning tour with Adam-junior. It was nice to have another look on the city and the information he gave us was better than the usual boring tourist guide. The funny stories about the Hungarians were great. And it's nice to link the history from Budapest to every specific country from where the tourists in the group were. We followed his advice by going to a winefestival and we had an amazing evening there. Thank you for that one!As students we appreciate this concept of walking with great guids and to donate what we can.Thanks again!!

Recommendable tours. We took the morning and afternoontour on our second day in the city.The first part lead us uphill to Buda, the latter to Pest with emphasis on Soviet period.Great inside information from Vicky, our fluent English speaking guide.She points out points of interest and tells how to avoid the tourist traps, afterwards we 2 times ate for 6eu/pp instead of the previous 25eu the day before !short Medieval Intro with few dates and names, which we found to be great. Great background information on some monuments and statues. Time for interaction, beverage stops. Warning : tour is due to last longer than indicated, due to dedicated guide.Do this tour at the beginning of your stay.Highly recommended, wear good walking shoes !

Pitched just rght. Can't recommend these tours highly enough. I went on the orientation tour led by Orsi and the complete Pest tour led by Viki. Both tour leaders have taught and lived in the UK/USA and speak very well in English. As well as showing you the sights of Budapest (many of which are wonderous) they give you a pretty full historical account of the past 1000 years(!) and are not shy with their opinions which makes it more interesting. If you arrive on the tour with zero knowledge of Hungarian history you may get a bit overwhelmed with all the information (although the groups sizes were quite small - 6 and 10 in the groups I was in - so it's easy to ask questions), but if like me you've at least read the history section of your Budapest Lonely Planet and know a bit about European history (ie. know your Ottomans from your Hasburgs), you will find the tour pitched perfectly. Lots of practical information about the language and where to eat, bathe etc. too.

Excellent 'free budapest tour'. We went on the "orientation tour" and the "complete pest." Would absolutely recommend these to everyone, especially the former. The orientation tour is especially good to do as soon you arrive to get a sense of the city, see quite a few of the basics in one go and it might give you ideas as to how to prioritise where you want to go during your stay. The guides are extremely useful, answer any questions, and the ones we had were from budapest and so gave personal insights. I learned loads and loved it.Although the tours are called 'free' they run on tips, so you should offer something to keep these ace guides going :)One thing worth noting is that the tours are relatively long, and ours ran over the expected time. Which is fine because i found it so interesting. But I have lower back problems and my back was aching by the end! Although they do the question/answer/talky bits in seated areas, and the guides are accommodating so might be worth mentioning any problems like that to them at the start, and you can always leave early. But still Im not sure that older adults or my parents would be up for it, id be tempted to say these tours are geared for 'younger' travellers in that sense. Would suggest you are fed before the tour as although we had seated breaks, we didnt stop anywhere to eat, and you might get tired after walking on an empty stomach.

Best guide tours I've ever had!. We did both tours, the orientation tour and the complete pest tour, our guide was Vici both times. It was awesome, it was very interesting and funny with a lot of background information and of only the touristy stuff. We used the mal on their leaflet during our whole stay to get around and find places to eat or to go out! It was a lot of fun and you could really tell that Vici likes her job. The group size was 10-15 people which was great. So make sure to give a decent donation to the guides because they are doing a great job!

Great History Lesson. We had a young man, Adam, guide us to the Buda Castle. We stopped many times and were able to listen to many interesting facts about the country. Our guide gave our group many important tips and kept it interesting with the wealth of information he had to share. He also had a great humour! However, I didn't like that the tour went much longer than the we were told, but he warned us, however.

Good to get to know the city. We did the tours as well. In the morning with talkative bike-Adam and in the afternoon with Ursi. That was one day full of walking. Important sights were explained, a lot of questions answered (but don't believe all of Adam's stories) and the history explained in the important context. I liked most about the tours that after this day, we knew where to go first to explore the city a bit more - sights (from the insight), pubs and bars, restaurants and nice places to visit. Of course, the tours are not 'free' - tip well if you liked it and less if you didn't. And don't miss the Literature walk! If you like books, stories and poems - you will not regret it.

Awasome tour!!!. Great tour. Great history. They make it interesting. Covers a good part of budapest. At the end they fave us a paper with all the recommendations (bars, restaurants, cafes, museums, etc)I highly recommend it!

Very interesting!. I bumped into a flyer of Free Budapest Tours and I'm very happy it happened!I took part to the Pest tour that went through the history of the city, from middle ages to the cold war.Our guide was very competent and was able to involve us with personal stories and tales from the real world!Recommended!

“Best money spent in Budapest!”. Fabulous tour! Viki, our guide spoke English like an American because she'd lived in the US for several years. What a plus when there's so much sensory overload in a new place. I can't recommend this tour highly enough for getting a glimpse of this wonderful and beautiful city!

Very interesting & cheap!. I recently enjoyed both the General Orientation Tour with Adam Jr., starting at 14.00 from Vörösmarty Ter, (meeting point just in front of Gerbeaud), and the Pest Tour with Viky, starting at 14.30 from Deak Ter (meeting point in front of Hotel Le Meridien). They were really interesting and chap. The guides speak really good english. Recommended to all the tourists who come to Budapest for their very first time and also for tourists (like me) at their second stay in that nice & romantic city. Thank you.

free budapest tours - far from being dynamic. I did the budapest free tour with an older gentleman. We were about 15/20 people in our group. Our guide was quite informative, he knew his material well. He was however far from engaging. His voice was rather monotone.It mad me sleepy and it was not always easy to follow him. Most of the time he sounded lik he had learned the context by heart and instead of being natural or improvising he has been giving the very same speech to every of his group. We did tip him as he made an effort. It was more like a presentation and not as conversation up to the end of the tour.

Can only speak for Adam. I had arranged for a private tour of Budapest. The day prior, Adam offered to help me get tickets for the train to Prague (which was more complicated than it sounds). He met me at my hotel, took the bus with us to the station and made sure i was able to get my tickets. Free of charge.My boyfriend ended up getting travel sickness and we couldn't take our scheduled tour. I tried to pay Adam something for his trouble, but he wouldn't hear of it. Very, very nice man!

Great walking tour!!. We ( a group of 5 young girls) did the general walking tour on our first full day in Budapest after reading the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. The route was well thought out and took us to all the main sights in Pest and we were given lots of historical background information and fun facts by our lovely host Brigi. The tour lasted about 3 hrs with plenty of breaks and stops for photos however I recommend to wear comfortable shoes and bring water. Also we went on the afternoon tour so it was quite hot so wear sunprotection/ sun hats etc. The tour ended in the Jewish District and we were each given an information pack with personal recommendations for attractions/restaurants etc. We also had a little quiz at the end where we had the opportunity to win Budapest postcards if we answered questions correctly - a lovely touch. I'd highly recommend this tour especially early on in your visit as it gives a great overview of the city.

Great & cheap!. I recently enjoyed both the General Orientation Tour with Adam Jr., starting at 14.00 from Vörösmarty Ter, (meeting point just in front of Gerbeaud), and the Pest Tour with Viky, starting at 14.30 from Deak Ter (meeting point in front of Hotel Le Meridien). They were really interesting and chap. The guides speak really good english. Recommended to all the tourists who come to Budapest for their very first time and also for tourists (like me) at their second stay in that nice & romantic city. Thank you.

Excellent key to understand Budapest soul. Friendly and truly prepared guys bring you to undestand city history, people and curiosity. They also advice excellent restourants and pubs to enjoy at most the city nighlife.

Great tour, great stories. I've attended to Pest Jewish-Communism afternoon tour with Adam(I think). He was simply great with all the stories and honest answers. Very cheerful and perfect English. Thanks to the tour I know much more about Budapest and Hungary which I couldn't get by myself. Highly recommended.The hours mentioned on the app are however are(maybe were now?) outdated but luckily I've met Vicky and she led me to correct time and place.

Emily was a terrific guide!. Emily's knowledge and english were fantastic. She was extremely generous sharing her time, and expertise. Although we were new to Budapest, having only had a half day general tour, she zeroed in on our interests and gave us more of Budapest than we ever would have managed on our own. Well done and worth the expense which we considered to be VERY reasonable. Thanks again, Emily!

The best way to see Budapest. On July 24th my friend and I went on a free walking tour with the guide Brigi, we liked the tour so much that we did two more that week with two other guides Orsi and Adam with the bike. All three guides were great, good english, good spirits and interesting to listen to. After the tours they take time to answer all kinds of questions. We find it the best way to see the city and you get both the facts and the nice to knows.

Great introduction to Budapest!. My niece (age 17) and I took Orsi's tour our first afternoon in Budapest and it was a wonderful introduction to the city especially helping us get the layout of the city in perspective. Buda and Pest are large areas to cover but the 2-hour tour was sprinkled with breaks for shade while Orsi told us some of the secrets of the city and her presentation included history, romance and makes you glad you came to Budapest. The walking tour includes a lot of hills but it was a nice pace and the group included age ranges from kids around 7 years old to people in their 60's. Orsi had enough tales to keep everyone entertained and at the end of the tour she was kind enough to share her favorite spot to have a pastry and visit. Would highly recommend this tour -- it's not only free (but they do work for tips!!) but informative and great way to meet other travelers and have a local enthusiastic guide by your side as you enjoy spectacular views of a beautiful city.

Well worth the expense. Did this tour a few weeks ago, with Adam (with the bike). One of many Kiwi's on this particular tour. Really enjoyed it. Adam speaks perfect english - and a few other languages besides. Great sense of humour, good stories and a personal insight into Hungary's recent history. It's just a short walk through some of Buda - very relaxing really. Adam was very happy to help with travel tips for the remainder of our European tour. Thanks Adam.
Great tour for free!!!. Our guide spoke perfect English! She gave us a deep insight of the city and had a great knowledge about the history of Hungary in gerneral. I totally recommend this tour!

Excellent Russian Guide Nina. Great customer service from Adam.. Nina was absolutely OUTSTANDING! I mean she was professional, knowledgeable, passionate, diplomatic, helpful, friendly…I can go on and on. There were three of us, and we all tremendously enjoyed her company and guidance. She is something else. I haven’t run into such intelligent people like her for a while. Seriously, she is a STAR!Thank you so much for giving us Nina. And thank you for providing excellent customer service. The B&B you recommended was fantastic. We loved Budapest, and now I will be recommending you to all my Russian and American friends.

Great tour!. We took the tour on Monday 9th of July at 10:30 and it lastet about 2:30 hours. Our tour guide was Viki and she was really nice and helpfull. She lived in the US for many many years so she speaks perfect english and is smiling al the time. She knows a lot of interesting stories and can give you great advices about places to have dinner or visit.

Excellent walking tour!. Unfortunately I can't remember the name of the guide, anyway she's a very enthusiastic girl who knows every important thing and gossip about the town! It is a must-do on the first day to learn how to get around! Thanks:)

Walking tour of Budapest. This was one of the free walking tours advertised in the offers booklet given away with the HOHO green bus tour. There is no charge for the tour, but they are up front that they would appreciate tips to keep the tour going. Our guide was Vicky and as she had spent time in the US had very good English. We started at the square at the end of Vita Utca and ended at the Parliament building. Very interesting and well worth the 2 hours it took.

misleading name. I went on the "Mystic Jewish tour" by this company. The tour guide was nice, her English was good. The tour however had almost nothing to do with the Jewish Budapest. We went through the inner city and the promenade along the river, a big park etc, but had not gotten close to the Jewish District within an hour after the tour started, so I decided to leave the tour with few others. I would expect to see the hidden treasures of the Jewish Quarter including few small hidden synagogues, galleries, shops, bars and the ruin pubs Bud is famous for. I would recommend to change the title of the tour..

Hungary has been very unlucky. We went on the walking tour because we had no idea about Hungary! Adam (with the bike) was great! He had alot of knowledge regarding the very unfortunate history of Hungary and had a great way of telling his stories! Hot tip: it's an interactive tour so make sure you have a few questions ready! Highly recommend this tour (even if it's pouring with rain!).

Adam took wonderful care of us. In 2011 my family was escorted around Budapest for two wonderful (paid) walking tours by Adam. He took excellent care of all of us, despite us ranging in age from 5 to 77, and introduced us to sights and experiences we wouldn't have found on our own. Adam was friendly, enthusiastic and very knowledgeable - I'd recommend his tours any time.

Budapest walking tours. My husband, daughter and I did both the "pest" and "buda" walking tours. Vicky was exceptional. We learned so much history in such a short amount of time. We were only there for the weekend and did both tours on the same day. Once we left, we felt we knew the significance of the buildings and the struggles of the people of Hungary. Absolutely wonderful!

very nice city. I went around with these guys for their tours and had a great first view of the city and loads of info to work with. the weather wasn't very nice but our guide was fighting for us against the nature!.tx

Just great!. Although our tour is almost one year ago, we still remember it and finally review it!! Unfortunately we forgot the guide's name but he was just great in explaining so many details about the city without loosing his energy and enthusiasm. Thanks to his advices we visited a beautiful quarter he recommend us and spent a very nice time. Best city tour ever!!

2 tours, one great, one okay. We did two free tours with this company. We did the 10:30 AM Basic Pest Tour. Vicki was our guide and she was excellent. Lots of history, context for current situation in Budapest. Saw the major sights on the Pest side. Supposed to last 1.5 hours, lasted over 2 hours. Definitely recommend Vicki and this tour. We also did the Basic Buda Tour that leaves at 2PM. Eva was our guide. Not certain this is a good career for Eva. She was likable, and I believe has lots of information. However her English is still developing and difficult at times to understand what she is trying to say. Also, very timid and uncertain. Hard to rate this tour because of the guide.

Very nice and responsible team of guides. We had a guided tour around Budapest, their coordinator Adam came to meet us personally, that was very nice :-). We had a great tour, saw as much as we can in that time (4,5 hours). Very nice guide Nina (in Russian), many interesting stories, unavailable from guidebooks.We are very glad that we found that company befoure the trip. Also - they organize our tour for 24 hours, while other guides where already unavailable for that time. The next time we would use their services in Budapest.

Best Tour Ever !!!. I went on the afternoon Tour, it was so nice and lovely. The Tour guide "Young Adam" was so knowledgeable, I was really impressed. I think it is so great what they do. It takes a lot of time and energy to be giving tours everyday to people, especially for free. So I hope anyone who goes on this tour is generous and kind enough to leave a little donation. They definitely deserve it for all the hard work they put into this.

Awesome first hand look into Buda & Pest. My girlfriend and I really enjoyed our morning tour of Pest with Adam that we returned for the afternoon tour of Buda with Viky. Both Adam and Viky had great insight and knowledge of both Budapest and Hungary in general and were able to provide a very in depth experience. Furthermore, they gave us great recommendations of other activities and eateries to try out. These tours definitely helped make our time in Budapest a truly wonderful experience. I would strongly recommend these tours to everyone!

If u want to have a free tour THIS IS IT!. I took part to two tours during my stay in Budapest. One was Buda tour and the other one was Pest tour or something. I had two guides for both tours. Guides were nice and helpful. I got great tips from them! Tours were okay. I think they told us all the interesting things and some true stories as well that were really nice. Basicly the tours are free but after the tour i was ready to pay something for that :) If u r looking a free walking tour and useful tips u should join one of the tours! :)If u r travelling alone i think the tours are great change to meet some other people! :)
Great tour!. A great tour to discover Budapest provided by guides that are prepared to talk about all the traditions, characteristics and stories of this amazing city. I recommend for sure!

Knowledgable and interesting tours, sometimes a bit too verbal. We enjoyed meeting the guide, Vicky, for both the morning & the afternoon tour - which were excellent. Vicky combined informative explanations as well as her personal perspective as a local and useful tips on various topics. Although sometimes discussions were a bit too lengthy for some members of the group - it seemed like most participants enjoyed it. Vicky did everything possible to make the tour pleasant and inviting for all. We would mention that a slight yet consistent cynical tone of criticism in regards to politics, history and economics was combined in between her words and we found it unnecessary.

Highly Insightful and lovely guides!. My friend I went on the Pest and Buda tours, and we loved both! Young Adam and Viki were great guides, it was amazing getting to know so much about their beautiful city in such an interactive way. I would certainly take any of their tours any time again. 100% recommended!

This was an amazing and informative guide that showed us the REAL Budapest. Our tour guide Vicky was really informative on all topics and put everything we were seeing in the city into perspective.
