I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in the city. She truly loves her city and wants to show it off to all.

Fascinating tour in a fascinating city shown by a fascinating guide. There is no such thing as a beautiful sunny Sunday morning in the city of coffee and love, that seduces you with its buildings and people . I was lucky that I was shown around by a charming guide who knows all the little secrets of the town. A guide, who talked about his Budapest with passion and enthusiasm. Young Adam, you are fascinating! Thank you for the wonderful day! I’ll never forget it! ;) :* Wolverine

Visiting Budapest with you was a pure pleasure. Young Adam I have to admit that sightseeing with you was a pure pleasure for me. I had a really great time there. Budapest is wonderful and really worth visiting. Now I came back to Poland but I am sure that I will be back in Budapest soon. Thanks a lot for all information and interesting stories! :-)

Great way to explore the city with a fun and knowledgable local. The free tour with Adam was a great was to get a feel for the city from a local perspective as he shared his experience of life in Budapest. Adam was friendly and knowledgable with a real sense of pride and enjoyment in being able to show his city. Despite the cold weather it was a lovely way to spend the morning and discover a little more about the life and culture here. It was also nice not to have pressure of buying additional tours/packages that sometimes comes with tour companies. I would recommend it for sure!

Best Budapest-Tour ever. Don't miss Free Budapest Tours on your next trip! Our guide Àdám Botta told us so many interesting, funny and unusual backgroundstories about the main sights of Pest and Buda - a very special and enriching experience. I learned so much, even tough I had already lived in Budapest for a couple of months. The tour made me look at Budapest in a new way. Thank you!

Insightful tour. We did the general tour with Adam who is very passionate and knowledgable about his city. Considering he had experienced the communist times he was very knowledgeable and had contacts in the attractions and showed us places to eat and drink. Must do tour and don't forget the tip!

Excellence in Budapest. I visited Budapest for a long weekend in early January and took time to do the FREE BUDAPEST tour which was totally excellent. The guide, Orsi, was toally captivating with her excellent knowledge and very cheerful and friendly approach. Her personal and family history really brought home the contrasts between the communist era and now and made me realise how lucky I was to be able to visit this wonderful city and to have lived in 'free europe'. To do both the morning and afternoon tours is a MUST as there is so much to see and learn, would like to give this tour more than 10/10 as it really is that good. Go to Budapest and enjoy, you will not regret taking these tours. Already thinking of going back to do it all again in warmer weather!

Great way to get to know Budapest!. Thanks so much to Vicky and Ursula! We enjoyed the morning tour so much that we joined the afternoon as well. It was freezing cold, raining and windy, but our guides' engaging stories and personal approach made it a great experience...and they always managed to lead us to a warm spot just before the chill got too much :)

Very good humour guides with local and historical knowledge. Recommended.. I went with a group of 12 people inbetween 21-26 years old and we all had a great time in both tours: morning and afternoon. The only problem actually was that they were close in time and we had not much time for lunch, but that's because we decided to make both tours the same day. They gave us historical information, places to go to dance, places to eat, where to buy souvenirs, etc. Join them!

A short view to Pest. We covered a few interesting sites at a glance and got some background information. However, the tour must be complemented with other sites on Pest. It's a good way to cover a part of the Pest side.

Interesting and fun city tour. I recently visited Budapest with a friend and we decided to take the walking tour which goes through the whole Buda part of the city( but there is also a morning tour to explore Pest). I found it very nice and interesting, our guide was well informed and prepared and told us a lot about the history of the city, at the same time managing to keep the atmosphere of the tour light and fun.

Amazing Budapest. We had the Pest tour. Viky, our guide, was really very nice, frindly and well prepared. She gave us very good and intesting insigths, not written in the books. It's worth to go, no question about that!

Very caring and informative tour!. We joined the free "basic Pest tour" this morning and liked it a lot.Our kind and friendly guide made this tour a very pleasant event.Fluent and clear english, easy to understand and open for questions of all kind combined with an interesting timetravel through magyar history - highly recommended if you have some 1,5 hours to spent!Closing the tour with a tip was a matter of course for us.
Perfect intro to Budapest. We took the morning tour led by Vicki. A small group made it very intimate and easy to ask questions. Good pace and very informative.

Excellent, Informative, and Entertaining. We did the 1030 Pest tour with Adam (young with bicycle). He was an excellent guide! He seemed genuinely interested in teaching us of Hungarian history and the various sites. He made strong efforts to involve everyone on the tour and was a great introduction to Budapest. Strongly recommend the tour! Thanks Adam.

good insight. We did both tours and were so glad we did as it gave us a valuable insight into budapest. Vicki was our guide and was very knowledgable, friendly and approachable. it is a good way to learn about the sights and history in a short time. vicki also gave us usefull tips on other things to do in the city, I would highly recommend. Remember to take your camera, comfy shoes and dress warm!!

a budapest treat. A first class two hour walk. Brigi, our guide, was informative, extremely knowledgeable and provided a humorous and enjoyable commentary on the places we visited.The tour could have gone on and covered many more places which I am sure she knew about but, advertised as one and a half hours we were already over by half an hour when we finished.Excellent value and worth every bit of the 2500HUF I paid. Could not recommend it highly enough. Visited November 2011

Most interesting and informative tour recommended to every visitor to Budapest.. Thank you, Orsi, for the best tour possible of Inner City Budapest. We walked with you on our last day in Budapest, a cloudy and rather cold day in November, but we forgot all about the weather - and wished we had known about the tours earlier. Next time we'll do the Buda-tour. You had answers for all out questions plus some more and we felt very lucky to have met you, hoping to see you (and maybe your colleagues?) again. This tour should be on the schedule of every visitor! Thanks again. Cecilia and Ted

Excellent tour guides and great intro to Budapest. This was the first time to Budapest for my husband and I. We did both tours and had a great time on both. We started with the afternoon Buda tour in which there were only 3 of us with our guide Orsi. We had the chance to ask a lot of questions and felt we received very honest informative and personal answers. The next morning we did the Pest tour with a larger group of 15 or so. Hats off to Orsi and Adam who take the time to give you great recommendations and are honest enough to 'refund' your tip when you accidentally pay too many Hungarian forints!

Vauxhall Centre Trip. Our group of ten included two wheelchair users. Adam arranged us a City tour and one outside of Budapest. He arranged a Mini bus with wheelchair acess for us.Both Adam and Steve our driver were brilliant.

Excellent introduction to the City. We went on the tour with Adam on our first day there. Nov 13th. It made the rest of the visit more interesting as we had some background of everyday life, a bit of history etc. Adam loved sharing his knowledge of his City & it was well worth it. There were only 5 of us in the group so we were able to ask as many questions as we wanted. I would thoroughly recommend it. You give a tip at the end in payment.

Great way to get oriented in Budapest. I was in Budapest for only one day - took a day trip from Vienna while there on business. I was looking for a way to see the main sights in a quick and easy way, and this tour was perfect. Very easy to find the group at their starting point just outside the Deak Ference ter station for the morning tour. The tour covered Pest; the group does an afternoon tour that covers Buda, but I did not have enough time to do both. The Pest tour covers St. Stephen's Basicalla, Freedom Square, and ends at Parliament. This morning tour does not cover the Castle district. Our tourguide, Brigi, was excellent - very knoweldgeable about the city, and very engaging. The tour moves at a nice pace, and Brigi was very flexible in letting the group take pictures and spend ample time at the main sights. The tour makes money based on tips at the end of the tour, and this is handled very well - no pressure. Brigi was able to provide additional tips on other sights to see, including good restaurants and good places to buy souvenirs at reasonable prices.
Very interesting. It was a very interesting tour. It was simply explained and varied. The guide also gave a brief history of budpest which was fun.Greetings

Excellent way to fins out about the city and see the sights, thanks!. We took part in both the morning and the afternoon tours; originally we were only going to do one but found it so interesting that we decided to do both. The tour guides were brilliant, they showed us all the places we wanted to see and filled us in on Hungary's fascinating and turbulent history. I would happily go back to Budapest and would definitely go on the tours again. They were a highlight of the holiday. The personal insights that the tour guides shared made the holiday extra special.

Informative, entertaining, comprehensive - and inexpensive!. During my visit in Budapest, I attended both of the 'Free Budapest Tours' with Adam as my tourguide. The morning one is supposed to take 1.5 hours, the afternoon one 2.5 to 3 hours, so be prepared for some walking and bring clothing and shoes appropriate for the weather conditions. Also, don't forget your camera!! It was easy to find the meeting point thanks to the descriptions on the flyer and Adam standing there with a 'Free Tours' sign. We started the tours on time and saw sights in Pest and Buda - if you take the time to attend both tours I would say you are able to see all the main sights in just one day. Due Adam's encyclopedic knowledge and his enthusiasm and love for the city you will also get a broad, extensive impression on Budapest history, culture and people!During each of the walks, we had at least one short break next to a bakery/restaurant, etc. which gave us the opportunity to buy a snack and/or go to the restroom.At the end of the tour you are requested to leave only a tip, adequate to the value you think the tour is worth - this especially benefits listeners with a low budget, like students, backpackers, etc.If you have any questions for Adam during the tour or afterwards, don't hesitate! He answered all requests we had to our complete satisfaction, and went out of his way to walk us to a good restaurant after the tour.Thank you, Adam, for all your efforts and your enthusiasm!!
Lovely tour!. Really nice tour, with excelent guides, nice way to know about the city history and people of budapest!!

Great tour to learn about the History of Budapest and Hungary. This tour was really interesting! The guide gave relevant information about the city, the country and the people. We didn't only see the touristic part of Pest but other places, building, squares, statues between the Basilica and the Parliament. To do!
“imagin Budapest 50 yers ago”. we were at the free tour with Adam, a lovely guide.The explanations were splendid and the tips he gave us helpes a lot.kosonom, Adam!Visited October 2011

Free Budapest tour. This tour with Adam and Ursula was great. We could have listened to them for many more hours. They provided us with interesting facts about the history of the place linking them with buildings, streets, statues, etc.They were generous of their time and seemed very interested in sharing their knowledge with us.Also, they presented some information that are not presented by other touristic guides and books.What was presented provided a good view of the city and a good understanding of the major features of the city.We would highly recommend that tour!

Worthwhile Tour. We did the Pest Communist/Religion walk the morning after arriving in Budapest. (Go to where the hop on and off buses are loading to find the guide.) Our guide, Ursella, was a history major and knew her stuff. We enjoyed the walk so much that we joined the afternoon walk of Buda after enjoying a nice lunch at Gerbeaud's outdoor patio. The Buda walk starts right outside the restaurant so it was very convenient. The walks are a great way to learn the city. While much of the information can be obtained from guide books, you get much more insight from these wonderful young people. Our groups were small, so it was nice to walk with the guides and ask questions along the way. At the end of the tours they ask for a donation of 2500F/person to cover printing costs and wages for the guides. The guides work multiple jobs and we were more than happy to pay the requested donation.

Incredibly knowledgeable guides. I took both the Pest and Pest + Buda tours, with guides Adam and Orsi and was highly impressed. The first tour was small, and Adam answered every question I had with enthusiasm and enough details. I think you could go on the same tour dozens of times and learn new things each time with Adam. The second tour with Orsi was well-paced, highly informative, and very interesting. Also, she packs the tour with useful information, and can answer pretty much any question you can have.From what Adam told me, this is a small project with a few guides (all certified and from Budapest). I've never been on a tour with professional guides who were so enthusiastic. On my first tour two of the girls, for example, heard a song playing in the streets that they were interested in. Adam recognized it, told the story behind it, translated some of the texts, and even offered to send it by e-mail to them. I think it'd be hard to find as informed guides anywhere else in the city. I think it's the perfect way to start off a trip to Budapest if you know nothing, or even to go if you know the city well, as I did. I can't recommend the tour enough.
A superfriendly, interesting tour!. After easily finding the meeting place we met our guide. This friendly lady took us on a interesting tour and answered all our questions!

The walks were really enjoyable and the guides were very interesting and knowledgeable. My husband and I did the morning tour and because we enjoyed it so much, we took the afternoon tour as well. It was an absolute treat which we both really enjoyed, the guides were terrific and such good company, nothing was too much trouble, they really encouraged us to ask any questions to get the most out of our tour.It really was the best way to see Budapest and we would both highly recommend these free tours to all visitors. Remember to tip well, as the guides put in a great deal of work and really do put in a greeat deal of effort for the tourist. Thank you.

Completely Authentic. I originally went on the Basic Pest tour with my mother on September 25 in the morning and found it to be the best free tour we've ever had. We've been backpacking throughout Western and Central Europe and have been on plenty of free tours in places like Prague and Rome, but found Adam of "Free budapest tours" to be the most superb guide. He gave us a great lesson in Hungarian history and was eager to share details about all of the sites to which he took us. After finishing the tour we were so impressed that we followed him to lunch, where he took us to a local sandwich shop and told us where to find authentic Hungarian food. He then took us on the Buda + Pest tour, which was also equally as good as the first. Adam was always willing and able to answer questions that anyone had and welcomed people to ask. I would highly recommend doing this tour early when you get to Budapest!

Knowledgeable and friendly. It was hard to initially find the tour guide ursula due to using an old flyer but I'm glad we did. She was friendly, extremely knowledgable and even delved into the socio-economic problems of the country which was certainly eye opening if unexpected. Almost certainly take the opportunity after the tour to find out good places to eat or grab a coffee.

Taking away the tourist label with most friendly Vicky. I did this walking tour with my husband on september 15th. What a great way to discover the real Budapest, it's most interesting story and what I think is best people's life in the past, how things were and how things are nowadays. Our tour guide Vicky told us many many interesting things (so many things you won't find in your book guide), and also recommended us lots of places and gave us valuable survival info. It was a turning point to start enjoying Budapest. Thanks Vicky for this amazing walk. Adam be sure to tell her!

Brilliant Concept. This was a truly wonderful discovery in Budapest: a project that involved local university students showing off their city. All they ask is a tip ("donation", better expressed) at the end if you enjoyed yourself. Young backpackers handed in coins, workers like myself around 10-15€. Their posters are available in the hostals/hotels of the city. It's clearly well organised. We spent 3 days in intriguing Budapest, and enjoyed 2 tours of around 2-3 very interesting hours. Highly recommended. And what an interesting initiative. Best regards to guides Tommy and Adam! Pete. España.

Like walking with a friend through their hometown. I did the Buda-Pest tour with my boyfriend and we simply loved it. I was a little concerned about wearing flip-flops for a walking tour but it was no problem at all. The guide would always stop in the shaddow and included a little toilet-stop in the middle of the trip. Our tourguide Adam is really friendly and he created a very familliar atmosphere within the group. He is very interested in and knows a lot about the history as well as the present situation of Budapest and Hungary. Adam was eager to share his knowledge and personal hints for how to best discover your own Budapest. After the trip Adam took us to a unique re-enactement of a turkish-hungarian battle, which we would never have discovered on our own - an amazing experience! Only I wished we had done the trip in the beginning of our stay, we could have had more time to follow his advice.

if you want fell in love in Budapest. incredibly cool tour. Everything you hear here is not just boring dates, and really interesting information about the city, its culture and history. incredibly cool job guide that increases your interest, as they endlessly love this city and give you a chance to see it with the best side. Special thanks to Adam for an incredibly exciting tour!

THE way to do Budapest !!. I thought this tour was fantastic ! The best I've been on. The tour guide was brilliant and very friendly and it's a great way to meet people, have fun and learn a lot about Hungary and Budapest generally. Definitely recommended to anyone who is in Budapest :)

Fantastic tour, made by an Hungarian. The tour was great, I learned a lot about Hungary, the culture, the history, the people that have changed the country. Definitely it is a must do for who is visiting Budapest. The tour is free, but at the end of it you decide how much the guide deserve, very nice system!!Thank Adam for be such a good guide!!

The best walking tour I have ever been on!!!. This is the best walking tour I have ever been on (and I do one if its available in each city i visit). It was extremely informatvie and I think what made it so interesting is that history we were told was from the perspective of a Hungarian. The tour guide was extremely good at having each person in the tour feeling empathetic towards the Hungarian people and their history.This tour was the perfect length, amount of sites and the perfect amount of history to keep us interested.My friends and I kept talking about the information in the tour for hours afterwards (that has never happened before).A Must for anyone visiting Budapest!

Fun and enjoyable afternoon. Went for the Buda part tour and guide Tomi was informative, fun and humorous. It was a great way to discover Buda on our first day here. Tomi gave his insight about Budapest's history along with funny and amusing stories. There were a few rest stops for us to catch our breath and cool off in the shade during the time we visited Budapest, which was experiencing a heatwave. The whole 2+ hour tour seemed to just fly by. Definitely a must do when in Budapest.
Buda tour...with local guide. Our tour guide Tommy was really good. He gave us lots of interesting information about Budapest. Worth going.

Nice!. This was the first walking tour I ever had and made a nice impression. The guides are very friendly and made the tour interesting in various way. They are informative and eager to listen your views. One thing I noticed that they love their city very much and like to be loved by the visitors. All the restaurants and cafes they recommended was very nice and cost effective. I would definitely recommend this tour.

The best way to start your visit in Budapest. We have spent a very interesting day guided by Tomi (he prefers his nick name) both for the morning and the afternoon tours. If you have never make such an experience you should do it.It is the best way to be introduced to the wonderful Budapest and decide what to better visit during the following days.What a pity: there is no free tour organised for the Hero's square and the wonderful City ParkBe aware: do not confuse these tours with the OTHERS... they need to be avoided... especially the Jewish Quarter tour (better to visit the Synagogue by your own)

Faith/Terror/Communism - Extremely informative and interesting walking tour lead by very friendly, helpful tour guides.. My friend and myself took this tour on the last day of our stay in Budapest and wished we'd done it on the first! Ursula and Adam (the tour guides) were incredibly friendly and engaged with all the people on the walking tour, making sure that each individual understood what was being said (there were French and Italian citizens in our group as well as English, American and I think Canadian). Questions from the party were encouraged and all the questions asked were answered in detail. At the end of the tour Ursula and Adam spent a lot of time helping people with other unrelated questions about where to eat/where to see folk music/museums that would be of interest etc etc etc. There was also a young child in the group who was made incredibly welcome by Ursula and who obviously enjoyed it because he was extremely well behaved! Thank you for a fantastic insight into the history of Budapest and its very interestind and diverse past.

Wonderful. The tours are really great, because it has a personal touch. You can ask the guides a lot about the country and city, which is more enriching then reading just something out from a book! The both tours (Pest side & Buda side) are very nice. The tour is in perfect English, so, good to follow for most of the people. They take time to take pictures, to have a small break, to watch and enjoy the beautiful city....Thanks a lot!

Exceptional. I thoroughly recommend these tours. I went on the pest tour in the morning, and enjoyed it so much that i went to the buda tour in the afternoon! They give you so much information about the city - it is like having a free personal tour guide, with an almost unlimited knowledge of the city, history, culture and politics of Hungary. I learned so much while i was there. They even gave us recommendations about where to eat (including veggie restaurants) great bars and clubs, and local wines and specialities. I have been on many of the different free walking tours around cities in europe, but these stood out to me as the best ones!

Perspective makes the difference. Before I left for my trip I downloaded most of the lonely planet guide books to my phone lest I get in a mood to DIY. Thank heavens I did not. I had gone through the guide book and was sufficiently self confidant while taking this tour, but Adam, our explorer for this tour, did what no guidebook can. He showed around Budapest through a native's perspective, which made all the difference. 'To me, the sentence " Communism was widespread during xyz time" meant as much more when followed by examples about how our protagonist then had to wait in long queues for a pair of jeans, and how much joy anything remotely American used to provide to the populace then. Another point, no guide book would have told me Adam is actually pronounced Ad:aaam ( the "D" pronounced as th in The).Same for the monuments, local cuisine, folklore and general way of life. The walks in themselves were informative and relaxed, and thanks to Adam I could have lunch at a rather affordable authentic Hungarian place instead of the ever so conspicuous Mc Donalds that lures one with a familiar looking menu and works on the insecurities of the innocent unrisking traveller.Over all the walks are fantastic, and the explorer a pleasant gentleman with a happy disposition. PS: It can be difficult to find the start point if you don't have a flyer, because the advert on the local map doesn't provide the start point. Alternatively, note the point of origin down before hand.

Unmatchable!. To be honest, I did not really know what to expect from a free walking tour but our guide Adam, changed my view in a very positive sense. Thanks Adam! I did both the tours, the Communist tour of Pest and the the tour of Buda and Pest. For the latter, it would help if you're physically fit as there is a lot of walking to be done ;) On a day with good weather, it shouldn't be a problem as the beautiful sights and insights gained provide a good distraction ;) I'm glad to have Adam as the guide on both the days as he is very knowledgeable and provides you with extra tips and hints on how you could organize you Budapest trip better. All in all, he is helpful, understanding and very patient. I would recommend this tour to everyone, regardless if it's your first time or not in Budapest.

Excellent, professional, outstanding tours; a must for any visitor. The guides for both the morning and afternoon tours were very professional and provided an excellent summary of the key stages in Hungarian history and gave a wonderful insight into life in Budapest today. It was the No1 activity on our recent visit to Budapest!

Pretty complete tour. I really enjoyed the morning tour. Interesting and funny. I was so happy I also took the afternoon tour. She showed us Budha, Pest and we had lunch together. It was a great experience :)

very infomative, humorous, developed the theme, side stories pertinent, i would do it again.. Adam gave the Religion, Terror and Communism tour. I thought he was a history professor it was so good. He gave a very informatinve history of the birth of Hungary, and explain it in a way that I remember today. I understand why things are the way they are today in Budaest. His "side stories" were humourous yet pertinent to the culture of Hungary. I see why Hungarians are proud of their heritage even though they have not won a war in 550 years. Adam (english name) fully explored the theme he entitled the talk, his interpetation was exciting and relevant to today's life in Hungary and now can fully appreciate the life in Hungary. I went on two other tours, and his was the best by a long shot. I am sorry I could not go to the Buda talk and would highly recommend his tour. Tips are not necessary but well worth giving him and his company something for his efforts. He even invited us to lunch at a local diner to experience the common man's meal. A very personalble tour guide and it was so good, the 2 houres ran into 3 and no one left. Thanks Adam.

MUST DO. I did the afternoon Buda Tour. Our guide was Ursula . The tour begins on the Pest side of the city where a brief history and general info on Hungary are given. We were not bombarded with hundreds of names and dates, which you never remember, but given the basics as to what happend in Hungary the past 1000 years, what problems the nations is encountering at the moment. This is all that was needed. On the way to the Chain Bridge a couple of stops were made again giving short snippets about the architecture and history.Crossed over to Buda and climbed up Castle hill where the best views of Pest and the Danube can be enjoyed. Walked around the area with brief informative stops and finally ended the tour at St Matthews church. You have to make your own way back to Pest. There is a bus , number 16 which takes you back .Found tour enjoyable and worthwhile. Tipping not compulsory although this is what the guides rely on. Any amount is welcome. With the hop on -hop off bus and the river cruises this is the best way to see the city.

Fun and Interesting Tour. We happened upon this tour in the middle of Budapest once it had already started and saw the sign for "free tour". Our guide, whose name I don't know, was wonderfully animated, enthusiastic, and interested in our understanding of Hungarian history, politics, and landmarks. The tour conveniently took us just where we had planned to go that day, but gave much more info than we would have known by ourselves. A fortuitous coincidence! The only price is the tip that you'll want to give by the time the tour is over. By the way, we caught the afternoon tour.

Ursula´s free guide. We joined a free guided tour with Ursula (and Adam&Adam), and it was just perfect. She was energyzing and knowledgeable, she took care about everybody´s comfort, and gave us a lot of useful hints, too. Thank you! Iva &family

A good tour with no hidden agenda. My wife and I took an afternoon tour with Adam and Tomi on a baking hot day. They made sure we had plenty of stops for water and shade and Adam's enthusiasm won everyone over. As a couple of people pointed out, there was no attempt to get you to spend money in any particular shops or cafes. They did ask for tips at the end - the amount was up to you - but we were well satisfied and happy to give.

Great tour!. My nephew and I took the afternoon tour at 2pm. The guide was fantastic and very passionate. The tour lasted a bit longer than advertised. No problem though. It was free, but they did ask for tips at the end, but with no pressure. We tipped and were on our way with smiles and free postcards!Highly recommend this tour!

Very nice. Our guide spoke English very well and was great at answering all our questions. I asked about the hours of a certain museum and instead of staying I don't know he called his friend to find out! They do not push certain shops or try to sell you more things. I would suggest this tour for anyone!

Personal and professional - great tour and intro to Budapest and hungarian history. Thanks to Eva, we had such an enjoyable walking tour through Budapest and soaked up so many information about this place, its people and the country! We loved it - vielen lieben Dank Eva - and we will be back for sure :-)
Afternoon tour best ever. Tomi was the best guise we had in four cities in four weeks. FREE means you tip what you think it is worth. It was worth a paid tour.

Great Tour! Free and guided by locals. Really a must for Budapest. Adam Botta is an extroverted tour guide, really prepared (he carries a folder with old maps, and old arms-shield and other stuff). His advices are really good. When you've done the Sandeman's New europe free tours and you met this guys the n is when you really realize the plus of having a native that's been learning the history since school. Also check the Jewish Quartier tour, they start from the Opera @morning

a great tour guide - a great tour - well worth taking. my husband and I went to the square for our first ever 'tour for tips' in Budapest We met ADAM - our tour guide. We were the only 2 people on this tour this day Adam was born and raised in Budapest and is very proud and passionate about his city and country. Being only 2 of us - we asked a whole lot of questions and we received in-depth, knowledgeable answers with good humor mixed in. Thanks to Adam, we quickly learned 'tours for tips' is the best way to see a city in EuropeAdam speaks English very well and it was well worth going on his tour.

What a great intro` to Budapest. My partner and I went on two walking tours of the city. The morning tour was a fascinating insight into Pest with local history relayed by the very knowledgable Orsi.  The afternoon tour is longer and in our case was taken by Adam. he led us to Buda and again explained all the local history of the area and was able to answer all the questions put forward to him in a very friendly and fun way. He also took us to points where it was possible to get some great views of the city. I would strongly recommend that anyone who visits Budapest take these tours to meet some very genuine and hard working guides who are a lot of fun.

Great laid back afternoon of sights, info and hidden spots off the beaten track. Our guide (Tomi) was great. Knew heaps, great pace to the tour, saw heaps more than I thought we would and fab to finish with super cheap but awesome struddle

The best of budapest in one day tour. We had arranged with a friend to meet at the opera house at 10 in the morning. We didn´t expect to meet Adam there offering free budapest tours. We decided to go since we had just arrived the city.I can now say it was a very good decision we made.He took us to great places of the city and the explanations were really complete. It´s a great advantage when the tourist guide is native because understands and can explain the culture, and history of the place.

Facinating introduction to Budapest. This was a great way to spend a morning, hearing stories about Budapest, history, religion, politics, current affairs, the revolutions, language and all sorts from a very amusing and interesting guide. A great way to be introduced to a enchanting city.

Tailor made walking tour of the most wonderful places. I had Ádám guide a group the second time - this already shows I liked it the first time also. This time it was an art history club and Ádám prepared well to give interesting information to this demanding group, too.We saw places one wouldn't get into alone. The programme was also felxibly adjusted to our needs and even to the unexpected circumstances.The standard question below are not really applicable but I indicated bathroom facilities as they were careful enough that we also find them en route.

Hands Down Recommendation. My friend and I tried the "Jewish + Basic Pest" tour in the morning. We were the only folks who appeared for the trip as it was low tourist season. Adam (the owner of the company) brought us around with no extra charge even though it could essentially be considered a private tour. We were impressed with the quality of the tour that we immediately carried on to the "Best + Basic Buda" tour. It was truly an introduction to Budapest through the eyes of a local. Best of all, Adam showed us unique places which you couldn't have found out travelling on your own (eg. an inexpensive cafe serving local Hungarian cakes with a perfectly preserved baroque ceiling and hidden within a modern book store!).Tours of places outside Budapest is also available upon prior arrangement (though most probably for a fee).

Ádám an excellent guide. Thank you so much, Ádám for two very enjoyable days in Budapest. You were so pleasant and friendly. We were delighted with our private tour in particular your extensive knowledge and insight into the history of Hungary which we found very interesting. We got to know so much about Budapest during each period of history.We would highly recommend that visitors to Budapest should engage you as their guide.

outstanding native guide who truly provides an insider's guide.... i took two tours with Adam the owner/lead guide. he is funny, informative a great story-teller who provides great insight into the history and current goings on in budapest. he shares personal stories about his family (his parents survived the sieze of Budapest in WWII) and them many statues (and related legends) around town. highly recommend his personal and interesting tours.

Incredible and personal tour of Buda AND Pest with Adam.. Picked up flier for this free tour from my hostel and had free tour expectations. Adam delivered a personal and informational walk around this beautiful city. I left with an appreciation for Budapest's history, culture, travails, and beauty.

Faith, Terror and Communism Tour. I had an excellent tour of the city with Eva! Friendly, upbeat, and knowledgeable, I feel like I really learned a lot about the communist and religious history of Budapest! Even in bad weather, I still had a great time! I highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to leave Budapest more knowledgeable than they came! And, it's fun!

before you explore Budapest take a free tour. My birthday present was a trip to Budapest. We walked through this wonderful city with our eyes open and the book by hand. But afther we took the tour with Ursi of Freetours, we really saw Budapest. We were like sponches, she knows so much about the city , things you never find in a book. So I would like to advise every visitor, take a free tour first and than explore. You will meet the city, a qualified tourguide and nice other visitors.carla

Seeing the real Budapest through local eyes. Joined Adam for the city tour in February when we were there and the way he did the tour spurred my partner and myself to join two other tours conducted by his colleague Orsi who is also an English teacher.Have joined other tours in Prague and the US but Adam and colleagues totally blew us away with they way they introduced us to aspects of Budapest and the country's beautiful history.What stood out for us was that Adam and Orsi made us feel throughout the tours that they genuinely enjoyed sharing what they know about their country's history and the sights of Budapest. You don't always find this with tour guides who usually memorises the facts and can't wait to get over the tour with.Don't get me wrong. Am not saying this is the right tour for everyone. But for us, we like how Adam and Orsi know about the little nuggets of history which, to us, were not even in the guidebooks that we bought.No questions are too hard for them. I have read all about the empty supermarket shelves, terror Communist rule and did not hesitate to ask them about it which they answered with honesty and sincerity what it was like growing up under Communism. Must be painful to recall the past but I was just so curious about it.That's what we like so much about them and the tours. Sincerity and honesty with the way they conducted the tours. Always with a smile (and its genuine, not fake) to all the questions from the other travellers even after the tours have ended.Thanks to them, it made our stay in Budapest so memorable. Guys, good job and we are supporting you from sunny Asia.Just one note of caution: be prepared to WALK!Finally, the tour is free but tipping is encouraged if you think they done a good job. For us, was worth every penny for the three tours we joined.

Super Tour. It was certainly the best tour we've ever done. What is great about it is that you get to know better not just the beautiful buildings and places but also lots of things about the way of living and thinking of Hungarian people.Every little corner has some interesting little detail that make we understand better the country's story and the people participation on it. The staff is really nice.Thank You!Daniel, Renata and Juliana Lénard.

I totally recommend it!. I did two walking tours with this company, and they showed multi views from Budapest. The history, the cultural, the entertainment and the social sides of the city got very special for me after knowing with the the two girls that guided me. I totally recommend it for everyone!

The Best attraction ever in Budapest. One of the most good and nice free tour in europe, I`m recommend this attraction for everyone when you go to in there.And you will meet , Mr Adamm tour guide, one of the best, believe me!

Buda Pest walking tour Fantasia. Had a one and half day stopover in Budapest with 25 y.o. son Marc and took the castle tour with guide Adam. Had a large group, approx 40 pax and Adam proved a great raconteur and kept us all enthralled with the history of Budapest. Took a lot of photos and forwarded selected ones to Adam for his website. Plan re-visit in 2011 ans spend more time siteseeing. Will also take the Zoltan tour next time. Was initially unaware when arrived Budapest of the walking tours and "did it myself' on the first afternoon, which as it turned out covered the same area as Zoltan's tour. I therefore missed out on the guide information, regretably as not enough time to cover both East and West tours. Next time. Highly recommended. This tour, and Prague the highlights of our 3 week Eastern Europe sojourn. Having lived for 3 years in Turkey in the 1980s the Budapest stopover proved a highly interesting add-on to my understanding of Ottoman influence over the centuries. Budapest- a real cultural and religeous cross roads in east Europe

Excellent tour - a must on your first day in budapest. As the title says an excellent tour given by local knowledgable guides which is split into two tours the morning tour of pest and the Jewish quarter, and the afternoon tour which covers buda. It is well worth doing both. Not only a tour of the city but a history of the city and the country and highlights all the main sights with some good recommendations too.

One of the Best Tours in Europe. I visited Budapest this summer from Atlanta, GA USA. This city was so big and a little hard to tour on your own. I got in touch with Free Budapest Tours, and just like the name says, it's Free.. I was so lost and Adam came and picked me up from the location where I was..it was amazing service for a tour that is free. Budapest was amazing and I credit all the beautiful places to Adam and his crew.. I would not have seen all these things without their help... I took a lot of pics and have a lot of memories from that city.. I strongly recommend them their free tour service.

Fantastic far superior to others on offer. Do this but make sure you choose the right company freebudapesttours is definitely the superior package, the guide (Orsi) was brilliant, informed, bright, and spoke perfect English with a wealth of information about both Budapest and Hungarian history/ culture. I loved it and it wasn't full of half drunk 'Lads' only interested in a drinking tour.

The best way to explore Budapest - relaxed and with a local view. I spent a wonderful day in Budapest getting to know it through the enchanting stories and astonishingly professional behaviour of Orsi. It is good to know that such a great tour with a really committed people exists in Budapest. Very informative and precious. Thank you for your time, when I get back to Budapest I will surely take the tour again!!!

Adam Botta Walking Tour. In early September 2010, on my last day in Budapest, I took a personal walking tour of central Budapest with Adam, focusing on WW II and Cold War era history, but in fact going back to the establishment of Hungary. It was excellent. Adam is extremely well informed and conversant with this history. I have a greatly expanded appreciation for the Hungarian people and their country after the few hours I spent with Adam. Even months later I still recall this tour with great fondness and would highly recommend Adam as a tour guide to anyone with an interest in the rich history of Hungary and Budapest.

This tour is a "must see" while in Budapest. Orsi met us promptly in front of The Opera House and she was the perfect tour guide. You can tell she loves guiding tourists and was thoroughly knowledgable about the city. In addition, it was FREEZING cold that day, and she balanced out our morning as best she could so that we could also spend some time indoors to warm up. Orsi even took us to a great local restaurant and ate with us afterward.I also took the afternoon Castle Tour with another Orsi, and she too was a pleasure. She even had tea with us afterward.In conclusion, the guides are very knowledgable and personable. Please remember that this is a FREE tour, and I highly suggest you tip them well. These guides do not recieve a salary.

The best way to see Budapest. We are from London and visited Budapest for the first time in December 2009, during an extremely cold spell of weather. We were lucky that we found out about the walking tour, and my wife and I learned a lot about the two cities that we'd never have gleaned any other way. Despite the cold, it was an afternoon extremely well spent and we got some excellent photographs in the snow, whenever we plucked up the courage to take our hands out of our pockets. Adam chatted to us about his experiences since before the Communist era which we found most enlightening.As it happened, we returned to Budapest with some Australian relatives in September 2010 and the first thing we tried to set up was a walking tour with Adam or his colleagues. Unfortunately, my relatives were taken ill on a previous leg of their tour and we had to cancel. We're looking forward to another opportunity some time in the future.

Strongly recommend for any visitor to Budapest. If you really want to see and hear about sites and history of this wonderful city would suggest that you really consider this small tour company Visited places not normally covered and learnt more about the people and city that gave me a greater insight intoBudapests turbulent past. Could not fault any part of the full day that I spent and would have no hesitation in repeating again as I am sure there is much more that we did not have time to exploreKen HallPS I have travelled extensively and would consider this trip one of the highlights

Friendly and informative, these tours give a great local flavour to the usual history lesson.. Love this tour company, they're total sweethearts. Very friendly, they have good suggestions and great advice for what to do or where to eat. The tours themselves are good and informative, walking through the important sights of Budapest. I did two of their tours - the first covering the Pest side of the river, and the second covering the Buda side. I was there for the peak of the cold season, so the walking part was great (and the standing parts cold), but the tour guides were happy to accommodate my frozen toes so we stopped inside buildings to talk history or drink coffee. The walks themselves were a good length, keeping the distance reasonable while covering the must-see spots.Really good, I'd highly recommend them. Do it!

Wonderful informative tour. We went on a tour with a wonderful guide called Zoltan Nagy. Nothing was too much trouble for him. His observations and descriptions about old Buda and the castle were most enlightening. With out Zoltan we would have missed so much. Our tour ended quite late, but Zoltan was so inspiring the time passed very quickly. We paid 3000 HUF for the tour but it was worth it. We would recommend any tour with Zoltan and we intend to return to Budapest and we will make sure that Zoltan is our tour guide.

One of the best in Budapest. There is no better way to see a city than on foot, with a local. We had a large group of around 23 people in Budapest. Adam was our guide, and he did such a spectacular job. He's such a personal guy, and shared so much of the deep history of the city. To his point, one day is not enough, and multiple days of walking/touring would be recommended. One thing i enjoyed most about our tour was the many personal memories Adam added to his explanations of the many prominent places we visited throughout the day...as well as the secret lunch spot which no doubt was a place for the locals. We will for sure use Free Budapest Tours again if we ever go back.

Tour to remember. Traveling through Europe for the first time as an Australian, there is an incredible amount to see and do, and a lot of beautiful places to visit. I went on a few guided tours to help me get to see various cities, and some were great (and some not at all). This was definitely the best tour I was lucky enough to go on for my trip. The guide, Orsi, was really friendly and really knowledgeable. What I liked was to be in various spots and have her know both ancient history of the spot as well as more current events that have occurred. You got a feel for a lot of the changes that have occurred and how they have personally effected people. I was one of those annoying people on a tour that couldn't stop asking questions because I found myself wanting to know more at every stage, and she didn't miss a beat, she knew it inside out. I was really impressed with where she took us and what she knew. I got some great photos from where she took us as well. I'm not usually someone that recommends these things, but if you get a chance for this tour, give it a go, and if you get Orsi as a guide, then even better.

guide did not show up... On 25th, Thursday we - altogether 7 people - were waiting for the guide for about 20 minutes (till 11.20) outside the Opera but nobody showed up. Two fellows said they might join the tour in the afternoon, but we had no time to do that as we had to leave Budapest. We are back today and try to join a sightseeing tour finally. We also have a plan B. We think if they don’t do tours in wintertime they should inform us at their website.

Good Good Good. I went on the free tour during my stay in Budapest in November. I'm not usually into guided tours since I find them usually boring with info that you can easily find on a guide book or online, but this one was actually really good!. Our tour guide showed us the most interesting things to see in Budapest and gave us good background information. she also took us to places with great views for us to take pictures. At a point we actually set down and she made a quite good Budapest and Hungary history summary (but not like a boring history class but more like history from an insider's point of view, giving examples about her family and her own experience). She was also very easygoing, smart and you can tell she had a vocation for teaching and for communicating. Over all, it was a GREAT experience

The best and most useful tour in Budapest. This tour was a fantastic way to see the city of Budapest. Being out there on a university trip meant that we had limited time to get an overview of the city for an assignment that we had to write. It was just luck that we stumbled upon the Free Budapest Tours. Our tour guide Zoltan, was incredibly knowledgable and helpful. I would recommend this tour to anyone who visits the city, as it is incredibly flexible and gives you an brilliant view of the city as a whole.

the best and quickest way to get to know Budapest. The best city guide we hve ever had. His knowledge of local history, architecture, art and society is incredible and he delivers it with enthusiam and humour

This is definately the company that you should book your tours with!. This past summer my husband and I went on three amazing tours; one with Adam, one with Zotan and one with Eva. These were the best tours we have ever been on. We pre-arranged these private tours and paid for them, but it was well worth it. Adam is extremely knowledgeable about Budapest’s ancient history, which is something I was especially interested in. My favorite stories were about the witches hill and the nations that fell when they built structures on that hill. Zotan was incredibly knowledgeable about the roman history of the area and showed us some of the most incredible artifacts, including ancient instruments that were specifically used for cosmetics!!! I learned so much on that tour. My favorite part was the authentic wine cellar he brought us to. Zotan's friend makes the most amazing wine. It is truly the best wine I have ever tried in my life. It is so much better than any wine coming from France or California. We sampled several different kinds of wine at that cellar, along with homemade Hungarian sausage, peppers and cheese. This was the highlight of our entire trip. My husband liked the wine so much that he ended up drinking it strait from the barrel. I do not recommend this. Once we got to our hotel he had to actually crawl down the hall to our room because he was so intoxicated. I do however, recommend buying some bottles to take back home if Zotan can convince his wonderful friend to sell you some. We bought six. Last, but not least, Eva gave us a wonderful tour of Castle Hill. She knows so much about the history and the stories behind each area of the city. My favorite story was that of the Hungarian Prince who was imprisoned. He sent a raven to his mother with one of his rings in order to let her know that he was still alive. You can see this Raven with the ring in his mouth on the top of a church on Castle Hill. The whole trip was magical. I highly recommend this tour company. Do yourself a favor and book a private tour. You will not be disappointed. Just email Adam at info@freebudapesttours.hu He is very quick to respond to email and we had no trouble contacting him the day before and the day of our tours. (:

My husband and I spent over 4 hours.... My husband and I spent over 4 hours touring Budapest with Adam. We were so impressed with the tour- Adam clearly loves his city and passed on so much of the citys history, folklore, amusing stories and legends to us-. Adam went out of his way to ensure the tour met our wishes and although we had already spent 2 days in the city he gave us so much insight to areas we had been through already and opened our eyes to hidden secrets- would highly recommend this group- nothing beats local knowledge- thanks Adam!!!

Quite interesting. I agree with other travellers. The Free Budapest Tour is very interesting. The guide, Ms Orsie is very nice. She speaks good English and has a sense of humour. We did once to tour Buda in the afternoon.

A good but incomplete tour. I took the morning walk at 11AM with Orshee. The tour was nice, very detailed on historical events of Budapest, maybe even a bit too detailed so I could not really absorb all that historical info we were overwhelmed by. We saw the main historical buildings in Pest but not much in Buda, where we only reached the Fisherman Bastion.We walked along the main bus road to see the view and only got a quick brief on those buildings we were hoping to learn about. There was just one day for me to spend in the city so the majority of the sights of Buda Castle hill were missed.

FUN AND FRIENDLY. I had a great time with these people, friendly and informative , they know the best places for music , history , culture and the best places to eat and play and relax :) nice people to hang out with i recommended them to all my friends who visit Budapest

Extremely informative and enthusiastic!. My brother and I loved our tour with our extremely informative and enthusiastic guide! She was born and raised in Budapest and knew everything there was to know about the area...including some great recommendations for dinner and drinks!Would recommend this to anyone, best walking tour we have done in Europe so far (and that is saying a lot)!

Amusing afternoon with Adam. Free Budapest Tour is a tour made by Adam (or other tour guides) which takes about 3 hours in the afternoon (they also have morning and evening tours). If you decide to join him, please keep close to him even while walking from one place to another, talk to him, because he will tell you more than what he usually says. His English is not perfect and sometimes he repeats things too often but I have to say that I enjoyed the tour, it was fun and it cost me just few euros. Yes, you can leave tip at the end, so generaly all people leave tips, but in case you don't like it or you have no more money, you don't have to. People usually left him from 1 to 10 euros per person. I would strongly recommend this attraction.

The best walking tours in Budapest. I did both the tour that this company offers - both are which are interesting and full of lots of information about the different sights! They tak you to see all the best parts of Budapest and provide all the information that you need.

Fun, entertaining & informative - Excellent!!!. If you are want a great tour then this is for you. See all the major sites and pick up great ideas for what else you want to do on your stay. We did this our first day and perfect introduction to the city. Watch out for the free drink though, its got a bit of a kick =)

Best walking tour i've ever done. You see some standard sights (churches etc) but you also see some amazing out of the way places with some intense history that you woul NEVER find by yourself. Incredibly knowledgable guide who took us to a local hungarian diner afterwards (not for tourists, everything in Hungarian) great cultural experience.
Fantastic!

Absolutely superb. The company provide free tours relying entirely on tips to keep them going (no government fudning, grants, etc.). Consequently the tours have to be top notch for the guides to make their money in tips (unlike other tour guides who charge up front and therefore don't have to worry as much about the quality which folows). So remember to tip generously - it's all they get!Like so many of the people who have reviewed this tour - I was lucky enough to have Orsi as a guide. Her unbounded enthusiasm, apparently limitless knowledge and undeniable charm made the tour a real pleasure. She was also excellent at recommending things to do following the tour. An excellent way to be introduced to Budapest and to help you to decide what to do during the rest of your stay.

A great way to learn about Budapest sights and Hungarian history and culture!. This was a great tour! I have taken tours with other companies in most of the cities i've visited and this was BY FAR THE BEST! The tour guide (Adam) is from Budapest, is very knowledgeable about the sights and (obviously) the culture and brings a personal touch to it by telling his experiences of being under communist rule and the revolutions that brought them out from under 'the iron curtain'. I did the two free tours offered and we covered the majority of the sights to be seen so if you dont' have much time and dont' know alot about Hungary then these tours are PERFECT!

you must do this tour. Excellent tour and excellent guide, you can visit the entire city in only one day (2 tours, first Pest, then Buda). I highly recommed these tours to everyone who is gonna few days in Budapest. Also, by taking part of the tour, you can learn how to move through the city. The guide (Orsi) has an excellent english with a very understandable accent for those who are not english native speakers.Thanks a lot! hope this time nobody deletes my feedback.

Really awesme!. I went on this tour with 3 friends and we all agreed that it was well worth doing. You see so much more with a guide than trying to navigate your way around with a guide book.It was a fascinating tour, full of history and anecdotes.Plus, the guides are really charismatic.Bisous,Helena

If you wanna know Budapest.... I stayed in Budapest only 3 days and I enjoyed two2 free walking tours, first one I visited Pest and the next day we walk through Buda's side and I can say it would be impossible to visit too many places in such a short time without the help of these tours and Orshi (the guide). She is so helpful, smiley and friendly (quite pretty too) and her english is 100% understandable. I highly recommend to everyone to take part in these tours. Thanks a lot for everythingBest regards from Spain, David Suárez VillaP.D: French have been very stingy, 200 HUF each one, with this kind of contributions they cant even feed themselves! come on!

Great!!. We made the morning walk with Orshi and it was really nice, we learned a lot, had such a good times and get lot of information very useful for our stay at Budapest.It is highly recommended for everyone who would like to visit Budapest (also, a highly recommended city for visit)Thanks a lot ot the team of the Budapest walking tours, and hope to see u again in the near future!!

that was fun. Informative and funny, NOT TO BE MISSED !!! I did the 2 pm tour and it was just excellent. We had a 2 and a half hour easy walk with Orshi and Adam.They talked about history, architecture, culture, etc. in a really funny way so everybody can enjoy their styleand learn about their place at the time.They work only for contribution so don't worry if you are on low budget, but if you liked it be generous!

The best tour ever!. When I came to Budapest I didn´t know much about what to do or where to go. I was recommended by the hostel to go on the free Budapest tour, and decided that this could be a good way of seeing the city (or at least a part of it, as I went on the last trip of the day). As it was a free tour, I didn´t expect much, but as I soon learned, it was a great tour. Budapest itself is one of the most beautiful cities I´ve ever seen, but there´s so much more than just a pretty city. A good mixture of history, jokes, funny facts and loads of things to see, all put together by some of the nicest guides I´ve ever met. Orsi and Adam were amazing; after guiding the group we ended up on a hill in Buda, and then they took those who wanted to a small bakery to try some cake :) After that they showed me and my friends where to go next, and helped us with everything we needed. They were very helpful and made our trip to Budapest the most memorable thing from the 3 weeks of interrailing :) I´m definitely going back to Budapest and go on the other tour :D

Very excellent tour. It is a very good tour including all mainly attractions in Budapest. The guides are very kind and usually ready to answer your questions. And he also mentioned a lot of very interesting stories related to this city. You'd better bring enough drinking water with you since you need to climb a small hill. Don't forget to have a taste on the traditional cake the guide mentioned. It is very tasty. I will recommend this tour to others who will go to Budapest.

Best way to see Budapest's attactions. In beginning of rainy June I did the tour at 2 pm with Adam. I was impressed about all the sights and the stories he told us. Every question he answered, talked about Hungarian culture and, of course, the Hungarians themselves. While walking the tour I forgot about the weather and at the end I ate a great strudel in a very little café. Thanks Adam for this wonderful afternoon. Next time I'll walk the morning tour :-)Greetings from Berlin, Monique

A great way to see the city. I did both the morning tour with Marta and the afternoon tour with Orsi, and I got a great overview of Budapest's most important sights... and some fun places along the way. Wear your walking shoes, as especially the afternoon tour involves a good amount of walking, and don't forget to bring your camera.

This is how you want to discover a place.. I took a short trip to Budapest in early February from Vienna and on my very first day, wondering how I would tackle this city, I stumbled out of Cafe Gerbeaud on to this free English language walking tour. I said to myself, well that's for me! And it really turned out to be a wonderful, intelligent, funny and insightful tour. Serious tourists know the best way to discover a place is to walk and walk and walk. Add to that outgoing and knowledgeable guides and the secrets of your destination just open up before you. We had so much to see and learn about that the tour stretched well beyond the advertised length and our guide, Adam, was more concerned about sharing his city and history with us than punching his time card. Thanks Adam for your time and enthusiasm. NB it is a free tour but I think you’ll be more than willing to show your gratitude at the end, I was.

The best way to get to know Budapest. We were treated to a fantastic and very interesting few hours with Orsi, who was incredibly friendly, enthusiastic and extremely knowledgable. A huge range of subjects were covered and we were shown so many of the sights of Pest that the guidebooks we had brought with us to Budapest were made pretty much redundant. As the tours are run on a tips-only basis, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend these tours to any English speaking travellers, regardless of your budget.

We absolutely loved the tour!. We did the morning (11 am) and the evening tour (2pm) in February 2010 and Adam was our tour-guide. We chose this tour, because the starting times were later, which allowed us lying-in with still enough time to see everything. It proved the better choice - we got to experience the city by day and night.The atmosphere was professional yet familiar - Adam thought us a lot about the Hungarian culture and history while showing us around the city. We could also ask a lot of questions relating any topic and thus very interesting discussions came up. When coming to Budapest I wouldn't want to miss this tour! And big thumbs up for Adam - he does a great job!

This group of walking tour guides are in it for all the right reasons.. Orsi gave us a wonderful and genuine tour of Budapest! Even though it was rainy, they were there at the meeting spot and the experience was very pleasant. We had a small group of about seven, and our guide was prepared and knowledgeable. She made a true effort to explain a broad range of interesting topics, answering questions all along the way. Since all they ask is what you are willing to tip, anyone on any budget can take this tour. I highly recommend this tour to anyone who speaks English and is going to Budapest.

Awesome!!. I had visited Budapest in October 2009 and had taken the tour with Orsolya of Free Budapest Tours.. These guys know their history and are the originals! The tour starts from Vorosmarty square and continued to the Buda Royal Palace. The guides give you interesting snippets from history and the culture of Hungary, which is so important for any traveler to be familiar with.. Not just the tour, but they will even give you ideas on how you should spend your remaining time in Budapest and the good places to dine.. A must do and make sure u do it on the first day... what more... its based on tips so as a backpacker I really got a lot out of it! ;-)
:))). It was really nice and I liked it, he showed us wonderfull places of Budapest and also he told historical stories about these places, it was enjoyable to walk with Zoltan...

A Budapest classic walk – a low budget first-rate attraction. The initial conditions of a successful tour could not be worse: a snowfall, and strong wind, the temperature below 0 ºC… On the Chain Bridge half the group wanted go home, but just a couple of hours later we felt warmed up enough to cause the Fishermen's Bastion to melt down. How come? Well, partly the hardships of walking up the hill, of course, but if it wasn’t for our guide, we would never have done it. He made this Himalaya-adventure to an under open sky-party, mixed with an academic lecture, and a stand-up comedian act. Our well-being was his main concern. He also liked to surprise us frequently and in a pleasant way: like when he took us to a little artisan shop, full with beautiful stained glass, where I had a pleasant chat with the owner's friend, who spoke perfect Swedish, or when he courted a Russian girl in her own language, or when in the middle of the blizzard a waiter suddenly appeared with a small palinka glasses on a wooden tray… An attraction for every one and in every type of weather!

Great introduction to the City and its sights..really helpful & great tour guides Highly recommended !!. Great introduction to the City and its sights..really helpful & great tour guides Highly recommended !!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED if you go to Budapest. Outstanding tour by a good-humored expert, Zagy. The tour made our extremely short trip as enriching as spending days looking for spots and reading awkward descriptions in guide books. The difference was this tour was way more fun.

...been there, done that, I recommend.... In Christmas time i have visited Budapest with my wife and children. We have found out for the tour through our friends which have visited the city before and they highly recommended it.Tour was just great. Friendly guide, easy going atmosphere , informative and most of all FUN....

The quickest and easiest way to see Budapest. Georgia was an amazing guide with fantastic English skills and was full of useful and interesting facts. This is suitable for both experienced Segway users and newbies as there is training at the start. Its a fantastic way to see Budapest and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Awesome Segway Tour. Brit couple on holiday!! Our guide George was very knowledgable about both the Segways and Hungarian history. Felt very safe after the introduction to handling the Segways and following that when we zoomed around the city. Our group was small and very manageable, 4 in all. Specifically, we did the two hour tour from 3pm, which gave us a good amount of time to see the key sites and great photo opportunities at sunset. Dress very warmly, they provide a small amount of coverage for the hands but I would suggest bringing gloves and something to cover your ears. Worth every penny, can't recommend enough!

The best way to see Budapest!. While on an extended weekend with my partner we had a guided tour with Balint. The tour was excellent. Balint was very knowledgeable, funny and also had a good approach to teaching the basics of Segwaying. I would 100% recommend this tour company as the best way to see Budapest! Thank you Balint!

Excellent!. We booked a Segway tour in the castle district - there was confusion on our confirmation whether we were to meet at the castle or the office in the city. We went to the city and were told our guide had gone to the castle district! They were very helpful and said our guide would either wait for us to get to the castle district or come back to the city and give us a tour from there (we were the only 2 on the tour!). We decided to stay in the city and our guide, Daniel, came down to meet us. He was very patient with us as neither of us had been on a Segway before, and we still got the hour we paid for on the Segway, despite all the confusion at the start and taking a while to get confident enough to go anywhere! Daniel was really knowledgeable about the areas we visited and the history of Budapest - we both left having really enjoyed the tour and looking forward to the next one!!

Fun Fun Fun. This is a MUST to really appreciate and enjoy the City in a fun and interesting way. My tour guide was Kinga and she was fantastic. We started off with a training session and then we were away..... Kinga had an amazing knowledge of the city and we stopped several times for her to explain about the building/memorial, etc. I had a three hour exciting history lesson of fun. Strongly recommend - best part of the trip for me and left with a huge amount of information about Budapest that I will never forget. Thank you Kinga. One word of warning - there is a little headwind so wear warm clothes including gloves especially if you do this trip October onwards.

Fun way to explore the city . This was a really fun way of exploring the city. We had our little safety and practice run, then we were ready to by the road. Our guide was really cool and gave us lots of information as we rode around. We even were allowed to up our speed after a while, so this was amazing and I was able to get the need for speed I wanted. Really fun! Our guide showed us certain things we wouldn't have seen on our own and gave us lots of information about the history and culture. Would recommend this for anyone that wants to explore Budapest in a more adventurous way. Thank you for a great tour!!

Fantastic segway tour and great/friendly guides!. Came to Budapest for a fun weekend away and the segway tour is definitely the highlight of the weekend! A two hour tour with Balint was the perfect way to see the beautiful city! He was also very informative, interesting and friendly, and answered any questions we had!:) I would definitely recommend that anyone visiting Budapest should book a segway tour with Yellow Zebra, it is very very worth it!!
Super Segway tour. 2 h on Segway with private guide Eszter. Wonderful experience! Highly recomended. See Budapest and have a nice time.//Lisa

Great complement to a bus tour of the city. We had a bus tour of Budapest and saw the sites of Buda and Pest and are glad we did that. Buda was "budafull" but once we'd been to the Palace and Liberty monument there wasn't much else we were interested in. The bus also took us on a whirlwind trip through the Pest side and that was clearly more interesting for us. We've done many Segway tours before and always find they give us a different perspective than the bus tours because of the access to pedestrian ways and narrow streets that buses can't go down. The people at Zebra were friendly and efficient and our guide Peter was excellent and handled surprises we encountered very well. When we got to Hero's Square the area was closed off in preparation for some ceremony so he gave us a quick overview from the distance and took us somewhere else. We also ran into closures at the Parliament buildings because there was a visiting dignitary from India arriving and nobody was allowed close. Peter wasn't rattled by these unexpected interruptions to the route and we carried on to other destinations and he balanced the time well so that we weren't bored by hanging around killing time at these other spots. If you have limited time in a city and can't decide on a hop-on-hop off trip or a Segway tour, I'd recommend doing both. If you can only choose one, I'd do the Segway as it really does get you to the highlights and is way more fun than sitting on a bus listening to a recorded tour.

Best way to see and learn about Budapest!. A small, intimate group of 8, on bikes with Balint as our tour guide. We had taken a bus tour the day before and it did not compare with the information and up front and personal experience you get with a bike tour. The pastry and coffee stop mid tour on a beautiful fall day hit the spot. We recommend it and would do it again.

Excellent!!! A must do activity!!. We were a group of 6 (50 somethings!) who had never been on segways before and we had a thoroughly good time!!! very easy to do once we got our balance. Petra our guide was very patience with us and very informative. A must do activity.

Personal tour of beautiful Budapest!. Decided very last minute to just turn up and take the Segway afternoon tour and the guys here were very helpful and accommodating. As I was literally the only one on the tour I managed to get a 1-on-1 personal tour of Budapest with my fantastic tour guide Victor.He was extremely knowledgable and managed to answer every single one of my questions and always made sure the pace was good, giving a great balance of getting to see all the sites and also explaining the history.Thanks again!

Great fun!. Our bike tour with Yellow Zebra was brilliant. Christy was incredibly informative and has a contagious smile. It is such a great way to spend an afternoon. We had lots of questions and Christy had extensive answers for them all. The route is manageable yet thorough. We had already done the BigBus but this gave us a different perspective and more confidence. Definitely a great value with the yummy strudel break too!

Great way to see this beautiful city. We went on a Segway tour of Budapest with Balint as our guide today and it was fantastic! Great way to get an overview of this beautiful city while having fun! Balint gave us a short lesson first with a few helpful tips and we were away! Loved every minute - a must do in Budapest.

Brilliant day!. Great way to see all the sites of interest across the city. The tour is leisurely paced so you don't have to be Bradley Wiggins to keep up or feel safe. The tour takes you on designated bike routes and through parks and squares although sometimes touching main roads, but these are not as scary as you might think, motorists are respectful of bike users. Our tour guide Kinga was knowledgeable, friendly and happy to answer questions. The coffee and Hungarian strudel along the way was also a nice touch. This is a must adventure for the experienced bike riders and beginners alike! Awesome way to experience the city.

Fantastic tour with Balint. I did a city trip to Budapest for a couple of days on my own and did this bike tour on 14 October. It was such a good way to see the city and hear about its history. The group was a mixture of nationalities and of couples and singles. It was a really great day and Balint was an excellent guide. Thank you!

Bike Buda for in-depth lowdown on what makes it tick.. Had a great time getting to know Budapest via our guide; Levent's insider in-depth historical, cultural, political and geological knowledge of Budapest and Magyar history. Best way to get to know this city. Our group was small , 4 blokes and 3 girls and everyone bike fit. Highly recommend this tour. Hope Yellow Zebra will organise longer excursions along the Danube or whole day trips on bike and boat as it's fantastic.

bike tour Budapest. We had a great time cycling through budapest with our guide Lavente. We learned a lot about the city. We got intoduced in the history but also on the actual economic situation and developments in the city. He talked with such an enthousiasm that we also became huge Budapest fans !
Great way to see Budapest. Levente is a wonderful tour guide - knowledgeable, interesting and personable. Helped add to the Budapest experience. Highly recommended.

Amazing. A great way to see all the sites on a bike. We were a group of 4 and had an English speaking guide who was fantastic and new all the History about Budapest. I great way to spend 3.5 hrs. It's well worth doing.

Great Tour with Levente. We had a great morning with Levente our tour guide. He was ver pleasent and knowlageable he gave great instruction on the use of the Segway. I would highly recommend this tour.
Segway Tour great fun!. we booked for 4 people and had a private tour of Budapest. Levinte was extremely knowledgeable and his English perfect.
What a great time. Our tour guide was Esther we were the only people on the tour with her, she took us to the places we did not see. Had a great time. Highly recommend it.

Fun, laughter and sites. The three of us went on the 2 hour tour with out amazing guide Teodora.
