We passed a number of famous landmarks including the Parliament, the Opera building, Margaret Island and more. We had amazing fun, Teodora was a great guide and joined in all the laughs.We encountered a fiddle/flute playing trio on Margaret Island, they were sitting in the trees like fairies, it was great!Thanks Teo for the great tour!

Visited sights and had fun time on the Segway. Our guide Balint was excellent and assed our needs expertly.As a family group,of mixed ages from grandparents to young adults we spent part of the tour visiting the sights of Budapest . Our guide Balint gave us interesting and amusing facts about each one. He then took us to Margaret island to have some fun time out on the Segway whilst enjoying this beautiful island.Highly recommended.
A blast!. This was so much fun! I'm definitely adding "tour a city on a segway" to my list for every future city I visit. Dora was an amazing guide! Definitely recommend this for everyone.

Budapest Bike tour. We were in Budapest for 3 nights and went on the bike tour on our first full morning.Our tour guide was Kinga and she was fantastic. Knowledgable, interesting and informative.The tour lasted 4 hours with regular stops for photo opportunities and some facts and figures. The tour gave us a great insight into the city and we revisited many of the places over the next couple of days.Although we are cyclists, this is not that important as the route was flat with an easy pace.The strudel stop was excellent.Thanks Kinga

The best fun ever. My boyfriend and I took a 3 hour Segway tour around Budapest which was a great deal of fun and an excellent way to see the city. We had a wonderful guide called Balint. He was full of information about the city's history and other interesting things. He was also great at teaching us how to use the Segway's. After a shaky start (I was very nervous) I soon got the hang of using the Segway and the group I was with were whizzing around the city in no time. If you have the time then you should definitely book a tour with these guys. 3 hours sounds like a long time but it passed really quickly. It will also give you a good bearing on where things are located in the city.

Fabulous way to see city . We took the evening see way tour with Blaint and he had incredible incites into history and modern day life of Budapest. He was exceptionally personable and friendly, as we were a small group he tailored the tour to the areas we wanted to see. We couldn't recommend that you highly enough.
Great bike tour!. Viki was our guide! So nice, and so knowledgeable. The ride is a smooth one, you get to see a lot. I cannot recommend this enough.

Excellent service, beautiful city. My friend and I booked a wee bike tour at the company, since it was our first time in Budapest. Our guide Arpad was very knowledgeable, local at heart and he went out of his way to answer all of our questions and to stop whenever somebody on the group had a problem. A great experience, I can only recommend it, because it is for a really fair price as well!

Excellent way to see a lot Budapest . Yellow Zebra bike tours, and our tour guide Kinga, provide a comprehensive introduction to Budapest and Hungary. Kinga covered all the major sights and explained their historical importance thoroughly. She also had many pictures that helped tour participants understand context. We greatly enjoyed the variety of biking environments, including bridges, parkways, and town centers. Her personal insights and history made the tour even more interesting. There's a strudel stop...YUM!

Korova Kegelschwestern. We had a three hour top tour with a very cool guide. Thank you Hunor!We saw many parts of the city full of interesting history. I can absolutely recommend this team of Yellow zebra! The segways are in perfect condition. Keep on like this!
Fantastic way to see Budapest . Excellent investment of a morning. Detailed introduction to Budapest's historical landmarks, couple to a well informed personal account by Hunour, our amazing guide.

Awesome bike tour in Budapest . I only had 12 hours to visit Budapest so wanted to absorb the city as much as I could. I chose this bike tour because of the great review on TripAdvisor, and it delivered as promised. My tour guide, Kriszti, who is very knowledgeable and friendly, made the 4-hr bike ride a quick culture immersion and fun! The ride itself was pretty flat and we stopped at most of the key historic sites with quick history lessons and photographic opportunities. I was able to see the city at a glance through this tour and fell in love with this beautiful place and great people. I highly recommend this tour.
Friends and fun. George took us on a great tour. Learning the Segway takes a little practice but anyone can do it. Best way to see the city

Amazing Segway private tour. From the moment we arrived we were treated well, our tour guide Hunor was absolutely amazing. He was very patient and reassured those in our group that were apprehensive about the segway. the tour was really informative and got to see more than expected in the 2 hours we booked. It was well worth the money and we would definitely recommend the tour to anyone that visits

Amazing fun! Highlight of the holiday :D. My friend and I were lucky enough to have Balint as our tour guide. He was really friendly and funny but ultimately was highly knowledgable - he took us on a well paced tour and we got too see all the major sights whilst having lots of Segway driving fun at the lovely Margaret Island in the Danube.Overall had an incredible tour, well worth the money :)

3 hours tour of budapest. Very nice way of seen the city. They had organized the marathon the day we chose, but the company reorganise the itinerary and it was perfect. Dora our tour leader was fantastic; very knowledgeable and got us to really enjoy our tour; Thumbs up for Dora and the team at Yellow Zebra

Great way to see the City. The tours are reasonably priced, and the bikes are easy to ride. We always do a bike ride when we visit a new city as its the best way to see things. We did the 4 hour city bike tour with coffee shop stop in Budapest with Yellow Zebra bike tours. Our guide Christy was amazing, she is very knowledgeable and was very helpful, she is a delightful young woman.

Easy cycling and a great day out. We had a private tour led by the lovely Bogata. She took us through Pest, Margret Ilsand, Óbuda and along the tow oath of the Danube and through delightful woods the 27km to Szentendre a charming town to the nitro if Budapest. We stopped for drinks and lagos, explored the town and enjoyed the informative and relaxing day. 27km may sound like a long way but we had no hills to climb and the bikes are very user friendly and in very good condition.The relaxing return journey by river boat is also very scenic and is a lovely way to return to the city.10/10 thank you!

Great Experience. Second time on a Segway, and had a very good tour guide and tutor in Tomas. Having previously toured Budapest by bus, we asked Tomas to do a different tour, to which he readily agreed. Tomas changed the route to take us on St.Margarets Island, as well as some key areas and landmarks in Budapest. Made a game out of increasing our Segway experience, by driving in and around the timed water fountains near the Sinagogue.Great equipment, great tour guide. Will definately repeat if we ever come back to Budapest.

Novice on a Segway. A large group of 10 friends aged 50-60 ventured onto Segways for the first time in the Royal Palace area of Buda, our excellent guide Balint and his shepherd RP split the group and provided us with some superb tuition really clear instructions and a shed load of patience. With a bit of a shaky start we followed our leader Balint who had a great knowledge of the area was also funny to, by the end we getting really confident and relaxed, our thanks to Balint & RP great tour guys.Terry, East Sussex, UK
Great way to start a visit. We will always start a trip with a bike tour. it is a great way to get to know the city and its history.

Soooooo much fun!!!!!. My husband and I have just got back from a 2 hour segway tour of Budapest and we loved every minute of it! I was very nervous at first as I have never been on a segway and felt anxious about falling off. We were in a small group of four and Balint our guide was brilliant! He gave us all the right amount of training on how to use the segway, how to deal with kerbs etc before we left ensuring that we all felt comfortable. The actual tour was fab zooming around the city on segways, seeing monuments and beautiful buildings and learning the history of it all. Had a fab time - TIP - Ask for Balint as a guide! Very knowledgable, and a lot of fun!

The fun Trip through Budapest. We took a private tour. We had no idea how a Segway would work. After instructions and a few rounds to warm up we felt comfortable. The tour was awesome. Great fun. A must do: seeing the sights within 2 1/2 hours, getting useful info for the stay in Budapest and some fun facts. Our guide Györgyi was a great guide and a wonderful Sagway instructor. A great and lovely person making this day a perfect day in Budapest!

Our guide Adrian was fantastic!. Nice bunch of people, showed around the city with ease and fun! must go with them on the segway!It takes you around the entire Pest side of the city and you know almost all the best parts to visit.

Great Fun, Fantastic Guide!. We had no Segway expirience and I was beginning to get a bit worried for the safety of the Budapest pedestrians, however after brief instructions and training, we quickly picked up the technique and found it thoroughly enjoyable!Our guide Christy was very friendly and knowledgeable and I would rate this expirience as a fantastic way to see the city!
Great guided tour with segway!. Great reliable company, good prices.Our guide was really good and funny! Is name is Balint so when you book a segway tour, ask for him!

Segway tour of Budapest. We had an incredible Segway tour of Budapest with our fabulous guide, Dora. She gave good instruction on how to operate the Segway, and had us going up and down curbs in no time. The informational talks were interesting and not too long. We rode through a beautiful garden on Margaret Island, which was the highlight for me. Thomas was the original guy we talked to the day before to learn about the tour. He was also incredible and gave great service. I would highly recommend this tour to anybody visiting Budapest for a unique and fun experience.

Awesome way to see the city!. We booked a private tour for 8 (2 families with four teenagers between us). With a delayed flight we were worried about a late arrival but the staff was great when we called to let them know and delightful when we eventually arrived about 25 minutes late. The bikes were all well maintained and suitable for the terrain we covered. Our guide was friendly and warm and she took us on a great ride around the city pointing out important sites. I think a few of us might have enjoyed a bit more history and information than we were given but I still loved the afternoon and would recommend it to others.

Great introduction to the city. . A really good informative tour. I think we stopped off at all the landmarks. Our tour guide also gave some further tourist recommendations too. No real complaints but on the first couple stops it was quite difficult to hear the guide speak over the traffic. I'm not too sure what he could've done to remedy this? Perhaps talk a little louder?? All in all a very enjoyable 3 hours.

Great bike tour in budapest. I had a great tour of Budapest (and Prague and Vienna) with yellow zebra. Our guide, Adriana, spoke excellent english for us and was very knowledgable. I enjoyed learning about the history of Budapest while seeing many sights. i highly recommend this tour!
Sagway tour . Had a nice sagway tour! Our guide Hunor was fuuny and nice and made it even more fun... i recomaned to do the tour at the firs day of the vacation, to know the city better...

3 -4hr bike ride Budapest . Had an awesome bike tour of Budapest with our tour guide Kriszti, we did the 11 am ride, there was a massive 1/2 marathon bike ride which meant having to adapt our ride and skirt around the run, this added to the tour. Kriszti was very informative and fun, really enjoyed her explanations of the history that shaped Budapest and Hungary. Ended with drink and yummy Strudel on way back. Great way to see and learn about Budapest.

Best tour of Budapest. Went on this tour with 5 friends. The Segway was very easy to use and George was the best tour guide. He was very friendly and informative. Best thing we did in Budapest!! Thanks for the tour George!

A great way to see the city! . We went on the two hour segway sightseeing tour with a really sweet and helpful guide named Christy. I had never tried segway before, but she gave us a quick course. It was surprisingly easy and a lot of fun! She took us to see beautiful places and told us interesting stories. The only negative thing was that it was a little short, cause time flew by like it always does when you're having fun.

The very best way to become familiar with Budapest. In mid-August 2016, we took the 3-hour tour with Adrienn that included coffee and pastry at the end! This was easily the best bike tour I have ever taken. Adrienn was very knowledgeable and very personable, and the route covered many of the key sights. By the time we were done, we had a good sense of the city to guide the rest of our visit in Budapest. The bikes were so comfortable we went back the next day to rent for our own personal exploring. Highly recommended.

Great way to see Budapest . Balint showed us a great time learning how launch our Segways off ramps and get some serious airtime. I got 1 meter vertical before wiping out. I definitely recommend it for anyone staying in Budapest!
A great way to see the city. An informative and great way to see the city. Which ended in a complimentary Danish and a drink. Had lovely weather, really worth it!

Awesome tour. We ended up lucking out with a private tour. Our guide Ballint was awesome, he made us feel safe and directed the tour around our interests. He was very informative and we felt we had a good handle on the city after he showed us around. Although I was skeptical about the Segway part, I had a blast. I was really glad we chose a Segway tour as the city is huge and without one I'm not sure we would've been able to see it all. Highly recommended for anyone. Also recommend Ballint, he was great!

Best segway trip. We had a two hour segway tour around the city, our guide Balint was very professional and friendly, he answered all our questions and provided we new information, he even asked if we need coats because it might be cold.Overall it was the best of segway tours I ever had!

Informative and fun. My wife and I booked a private 3 hour tour for as soon as we arrived and what a fantastic way to get an overview, get our bearings and learn about the history of this wonderful city, and what a history!! Our tour guide was Billet as he was ace. He tailored the tour to our needs and was so knowledgeable and passionate about Budapest. We had a great laugh too. We had Sedway'ed before but it's so easy and natural. I would recommend this to anyone. Thanks Billet!!

Tour to Szentendre. A bike ride along the banks of the Danube, combining elements of both city and countryside.It's a route you could easily do on your own, as it basically follows the river, but is so much better in company. Our tour guide, Boga'ta was great. As a local, she was well-informed about key points on the route. We had a slightly longer than anticipated stop at Roman Beach, but actually this gave the group time to talk together. Pace is easy at c8mph and is 99% flat. Recommended for anyone who can ride a bike

Nice orientation morning. We used our 3 hour Segway tour as a way to get our bearing of the city on the first morning and for that purpose it was a good tour, I didn't feel we got too much info and was surprised that we whizzed by some interesting sights that could have been explained further. Also the whole tour was in Pest, we didn't cross the river once - which I also thought was a shame as there is so much to see in Buda too.On the whole good fun though.

Fabulous tour of Budapest with Georgia. This was my first Segway tour and the highlight of my trip. I saw more of Budapest this way than, walking or bus. Georgia trained us well and gave us interesting facts and anecdotes around the city. Had a great time, many thanks

Great experience. I've been living in Budapest for more than 2 years now, and yet the guided Segway tour was a whole new way of exploring the city. Driving on the Segway through narrow streets gives you a whole new perspective on your surroundings. Our guide Adrienn told us plenty of things that I didn't know yet. Plus, riding on a Segway and pirouetting around St. István tér is just great fun!

Amazing way to see the city . Our guide name was Dora . she is just too awesome knows everything loves her job . we took a segway tour for 2 hours we could cover the city really well and gain a lot of knowledge about the city . just do this tour if u want to see the city in fun way . without walking too much . haha .

Quick & friendly!. We rented bikes at yellow zebra for an afternoon of fun on Margaret Island and were very satisfied with both the quick and friendly service as well as the bikes! They were in a perfect state. We even got a deze upgrade: because bikes without gears were no longen available, we got some fancier ones for the same price. Would highly recommend it!

Perfect way to visit several attractions. We had a four hours of very relaxing and informative cycling tour in Budapest. Our guide, Adrienn was excellent. She gave a brief but detailed information about each attraction. The speed of the ride was relaxing even though it took four hours. At the end of the tour we were offered strudel and a drink at a cafe which was refreshing. I would not hesitate to recommend Adrienn and Yellow Zebra to every visitor to Budapest.

Great activity for a solo traveler. I took the 2 hour afternoon Segway tour. We had a small group of 6, which made it easy for us to navigate the route. Most of our trip was in bike lanes or large squares allowing us to explore without worrying about cars and crowds of people. Our guide, Adreine, was fantastic. She made sure we quickly learned how to navigate and off we went. It was great to hear her insights into Budapest's history and some of the current political and social challenges. She happily took photos and allowed for rest stops. Ps Bring a bottle of water.

Great way to see any city. Well organized, not the very best Segway tour I have been on but I think it still did an excellent job of giving us a flavour for the city and showing us a few places that we wanted to vist in greater depth.
Segway 3 hours tour. This segway tour is the perfect way to see this great city and learn all about the main attractions and their history with a very good guide.

Both Super-fun and Educational. This tour was a great choice, as you get the super-fun experience of riding a Segway as well as an infomative and exciting tour through the city's highlights. I went with my two teenage sons, who picked up the Segway skills in seconds and were soon zooming around at (for me) scarey speeds. Our guide, Adrienn, was patient, kind and very informative, and she was so pleasant I invited her to hang out with me on her upcoming trip to Spain. She explained a lot of interesting details about each major site and also gave her personal opinion about its relation to Hungarian history and politics, which provided fascinating insight. Yes, the price is a bit high, but it's worth it, as it's two things in one: a fun ride and an instructive city tour.

Highly recommended - ask for Georgia. Booked a same day afternoon tour. As it so happened I was the only one who signed up, so this was in effect a private tour. My tour guide, Georgia, could not have been any better - she's full of good info and is a genuinely friendly person who wants to make sure you're having a good time. Segway tours are definitely the way to go. I like to book them for my first day in a new city so I can see all the major sights, get the lay of the land and figure out what's worth revisiting. In short, thumbs up for Segway tours in general and two thumbs up for the Yellow Zebra tour led by Georgia!

Booked last minute and enjoyed. The morning of my tour I booked online and was confirmed. Showed up to their shop and we were all set to head out and see Budapest. Our guide was Frank and has a wealth of knowledge and stopped for all our questions. The tour was very relaxing at a comfortable pace (no rush).I highly recommend for first time visitors to Budapest to book the tour to understand all the landmarks.

Summer Bike Tour with Brigit. A group of 10 of us went to Budapest last weekend and had a really excellent experience cycling around the city. We met with Brigit and she was very friendly and informative from start 'til finish. We found 2 hours was just about the right amount of time and given that the city is quite flat there weren't any hills to tire you out. Thanks to Brigit's expansive knowledge of the city, and indeed the country, we can safely say we all finished with a much clearer image on the history of Hungary. Brigit was also very welcoming with regard to questions and recommended a couple of bars that we later went to that evening. All round it was a perfect tour and we learned a lot about the city of Budapest. Thank you Brigit
Great experience! . We had a great time with Balint! He's amazing and friendly :) we would do another tour with him if we had the chance again :)

Wonderful bike tour with guide Vicky. Very enjoyable almost 4 hour bike tour with Vicky. She shared a large amount of information about the many areas we visited, and gave us interesting insight into the lives of everyday Hungarians. We crossed 2 bridges going between Pest and Buda sides of the Danube. And the promised refreshments was the best strudel we had on our trip. The riding was never too challenging, about 11km spread over 4 hours, despite a temperature in the high 80's. A great choice for getting an overview of the city, as well as some exercise.

Segway tour . Enjoyed the Segway tour with George and Georgina. They were very thorough when it came to safety and with partying instruction in the usage of Segway. George was very friendly and shared a lot of history on Budapest and her people ! He was extremely knowledgable and had something to tell us about all the places we visited. Segway tour a must do in Budapest !

Beautiful Budapest By Bike. We were very fortunate to have Christy as our guide for the four hour morning bike tour. What a great way to be introduced to the sights of Budapest. Christy was excellent in the way she led the tour. She made the history of all monuments interesting in a very clear and engaging way. The bike ways are all very easy riding. We especially enjoyed the last stop for strudel and coffee and enjoying Christy and the groups conversations.

Best guide- Balint!. It was great fun! Our tour guide was simply amazing and gave good instructions right in the beginning to make us feel comfortable with the Segway. I highly recommend a private tour with Balint! :)

Andy was such a fantastic guide!!!. wow, couldn't have asked for a better guide to show us around Pest. It was really great getting to see parliament and the Basilica! only thing is I wish we could have gone closer to the chain bridge but otherwise it was a amazing. Andy is very informative and patient with people who have never gone on a Segway before. Also she was able to easily answer all of our questions about the city with ease and a smile. Thanks Andy!!

First time but definitive not last time!. Being in Budapest we finally decided to try for the first time a Segway tour! "Best decision ever "! We had booked a privat Tour so to have time to see the parts of the city we hadn't seen so far. Our guide and trainer was Dora and she was just great! Our daughters and we liked her right away. In a short training session she thought us the basics of Segway driving. Right from the start it is great fun. With the Segways you can get everywhere in an instant. The 2 hour tour flew by in an instant! Due to the stories about the city and its monuments told by Dora during the trip it was one of the best city visits we have done so far! A special thanks also to Yellow Zebra for their flexibility. In the morning of our marked tour it was pouring raining in Budapest and the forecast showed no bettering for the next hours. After a short call to their office they right away agreed that we could postpone our guided tour for one day, without any extra charges or problems - that's what I call a very good customer service and its the reason they get an Excellent in the review! Thanks!

No better way to discover Budapest. Yellow Zebra bike tours - a perfect way to discover Budapest (the flat part, anyway - no difficult climbs!). The ride is easy-paced and takes in all of the essential parts of Pest and a fantastic stretch of the Danube on the Buda side.Our Guide, Balint, was extremely knowledgeable with a great sense of humour and ensured that everyone got full value from the tour.Highly recommended - infact a "must do" - for anyone that can ride a bike.

Excellent way to get a City Tour. This was my 3rd time to use a Segway, first however outside the US. We wanted to give it a try while in Budapest and could not have made a better selection with Yellow Zebra. Tour guide was very informative in giving a brief history of Budapest of the their past and present.

Evening segway tour. During my stay at Budapest i took an evening segway tour offered by Yellow Zebra company.Although I was the only participant, the tour still took it's place, so it was like a private tour for a normal price.After a short section of learning how to ride a segway, my guide, Dora, proceeded to show me all the main sightseeings of Budapest.She was well educated in regard to the city's history and could answer all my questions.I was told about St. Stephen's Basilica, the Hungarian Parliament Building and the process of it's creation, the history of Margaret Island, the Hungarian Revolution of 1956, religion and origin of Hungarians and many other things.I really enjoyed the tour and Dora's company.

Monday morning fun in the rain . Great informative tour. I love segways. This is my third city tour by Segway and I will always look for similar now anywhere we travel ....Bernadette was great and with a sense of humour in the pouring rain. We were offered to finish the next day when the weather was better or carry on ...we had fun but were soaked, so going back to finish without squelching

Awesome tour. I would like to thank the professional team of yellow zebra for the segway tour.Everything went very smoothly from the booking to the tour itself.My guide Dora was more than knowledgeable about the city history, architecture, gastronomy and art.Great experience and fun Thank you again

Simply fantastic. This was easily the best tour I've taken anywhere. Our guide, Adrienn, was incredibly knowledgable, warm, and engaging. We loved it so much, we went back the next day to rent bikes and further explore on our own.

Great way to start your vacation in Budapest. We took a 2 hour private tour with Georgia -- who was a fantastic guide. Because we did a private, and already knew how to use the segway, we were able to cover a lot of ground in just 2 hours. Budapest has designated bike lanes throughout much of the city which make travels by segway easier and safer. Toured all over town -- Heroe's Square, Parliament, St. Stephen's Basilica... Along the way, Georgia gave us tips for what else to see and do during the rest of our stay. Definitely recommend!

Fun and interesting way to see the city. We took a bike tour with Christy and it was a really great way to see the sights in Budapest. We covered a lot of the city by using the bikes, and it showed us a lot of places that we wanted to visit. Although we did not ride at the same pace at times, Christy would regularly wait for everybody to catch up. We learnt a lot of interesting facts about Hungary, and history about the city. Would definitely recommend as a way to view more of the city, as walking the same distance would take a lot longer than two and a half hours. The office was also easy to find, and happily looked after my bag as I couldn't cycle with it.

Great way to see Budapest Highlights. Our guide, Kinga, was knowledgeable and provided insight into life in Budapest. This is a great way to see the city. The location is easy to find behind the Opera House. We thoroughly enjoyed the 3 hour tour.

Segway around Budapest. Segways are a great way to see a new city. The segways themselves are easy to master and become second nature very quickly. Budapest is small enough that you can see many of the sights on a two hour tour and our tour guide Tamas was very knowledgeable and entertaining.This is a cheap and fun way to see Budapest

Amazing. My husband and I had a wonderful bike tour through Prague with only one other couple and 2 awesome guides. Our lead guide, Bernadett (Dettie), was so pleasant, knowledgable, and engaged with her clients. Adam was the other guide who was in training, and our experience would not have been as rich without his thoughtful additions to our tour and conversation. My husband and I both agree that this is one of the best and most interesting tours we have ever been on. Thanks, Dettie and Adam!

Bike tour of Budapest . I went on this tour with my fiancee and it was amazing! Christy was incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and fun. I would HIGHLY recommend this bike tour to anyone visiting Budapest. Also, I would recommend doing it early in the trip because it really adds to your list of "things to do in Budapest" and you want to make sure you have time to do it all!

4 hours cycling with Adrienn en A'rpi. Perfect way to start your stay in Budapest. The guides gave a good overview of the important places to visit. Lots of info was provided. Also the bikes were ok. We all enjoyed the 4 hour.

Great tour of Budapest. My wife and I and a couple from Michigan were the 4 participants of an outstanding bike tour of Budapest. The pace is very doable, no matter the riding history of the participants. The tour stays away from hills and stops often for picture taking and a bit of history. It also stops near the end for a drink and some outstanding strudel. We were lucky to have 2 outstanding guides--Bernadette (Detti) and Adam. They really added to the tour, providing quite a bit of history and engaging in lively social commentary with the group. They were both genuinely interested in ensuring the tour was enjoyed by all and really made the tour outstanding. STRONGLY recommend this tour.

Card also accepted. After checking two other Segway rentals that only accepted cash, I met Yevgeny from Yellow Zebra and got an excellent private hour around the city. I've been on Segway before in other locations, but this was the best tour and the best guide so far!

Franks the man!! . Frankkkk, it's the Brit girls fromthe midlands near Shakespeare! We feel sorry for you having to put up with us two, but what a great job you did! Everyone ask for frank, his English is perfect and he helped us with all our enquiries which were 21 questions! Jess and Bali xx
Relaxed bike ride. Thank you Frank for your relaxed casual bike ride. Your history and introduction into Hungary as well as present day was appreciated.

Budapest bike tour with Frank. After having a great time in Berlin on a bike tour, my friend and I decided to go on another in Budapest. Unfortunately, this tour was a huge disappointment. The tour guide (Frank) was unenthusiastic and rode his bike so slowly that the group couldn't even keep their bikes upright, and not everyone could make it through the urban street lights in time. He did not wait for those who got left behind and did not apologize for doing so, either. He made a racist joke during the tour and then laughed about the fact that it was racist - my friend and I thought it was extremely inappropriate. The points of interest that we went to were nice, but their descriptions were very underwhelming and did not do the city justice. I would suggest a bike tour, just not this one.

Great way to see city. We had a great time with Frank today. He was a fantastic guide and being Hungarian gave us great insights. Would recommend to do something like this on your first day to understand some of the city and know all the hot spots!
Good fun . Frank was our guide and he gave us a great overview of the city. Really good if new in the city and want your bearings

Bike Tour with Frank . Frank was a great tour guide who knows so many languages! Had a ton of fun. Got a free yummy dessert. We went to the major spots. Not enough time to actually take pictures so we're going to head back to our favorite spots tmrrw.

Great bike tour, easy and fun.. Tomas was our guide, and was excellent! He had lots to tell us, and made sure we were all accounted for and safe at all times (there were 8 in the group). We rode all over Pest and along the river in Buda (no hills!). Then he took us to a pastry/coffee shop, where we chose a drink and two strudels each. There were a dozen kinds to choose from, and were fresh out of the oven. Yum! I highly recommend this tour and this company.

Perfect way to see Budapest !. The 4 hour bike tour was a great introduction to Budapest. The city is really easy to bike around, and the tour takes in most of the main sights. Our guide Christy was fantastic ! She made the history of Hungary come to life, and gave us lots of insights into Budapest that you could only get from a local. Thank you Christy !A stop for strudel and coffee topped off the tour. Definitely recommended.
Segways were great!. Done the fun segways tour that takes you round the parliament and to the island in the danube river! Segways were so strange but easy to get used to! Frank was an awesome guide!

First time Segway user on tour. Kinga, our extremely knowledgeable guide, spent 10mins teaching us to use the segways in the cobbled streets behind the gorgeous Opera House. As there were only two of us on the evening guided tour and using the Segway is fairly intuitive we were soon off for our two hour tour of the Opera House, St Stephens Church, Liberty Square, Parliament buildings, Margit Island. With stops along the way we had time to regroup, rest and after 30mins have our speed restricters increased. Kinga was super patient and her tour covered not only the sites but the social and political history of Budapest as well as restaurant recommendations. We loved it.

A Perfect Blend of Fun and History. Ballint was our guide. He provided a perfect mix of humor, history, personal anecdotes and insights into life in Budapest. Teens are a tough audience. Ours loved the tour. A great way to see and learn about the city without wearing out your feet.
Comfy bikes, great service. As a someone who is Dutch I guess I can say that they offer good bikes that are reasonably comfy. You also pay a fair, low price.
Great experience. We took a private tour with Frank and it was great:Frank was patient ,full of knowledge and walked us through the history and culture of the city.

刺激的な日本語ツアー It was Exciting Japanese tour!. 初めて訪れたブダペストで、日本では街乗りできないセグウェイ、そして何より日本語ガイドのハンガリー人によるタウンツアーがあると聞いてやってきました。セグウェイを街乗りってだけでもワクワクなのに、世界遺産の街並みをハイテクノロジーで駆け抜けるって言う爽快感もまたいいと思います。なんだかんだ言っても日本語ガイドのテオドーラさん。町並みの説明から歴史的な話から冗談まで全て日本語で対応してくれます。素晴らしい！彼女の日本・世界放浪記も聞き逃せませんよ！要予約です！It was so exciting experience.This was my first time in Budapest.I chose Segway town tour in Budapest.Because we can't ride a Segway on public road in Japan.And important reason.She is one of staffs Teodóra who speaks Japanese fluently!She explained architecture, history, and sometimes kidding in Japanese!You should ask her about story of her journey in the world.Excellent! I love her!Thanks so much Teodóra! Arigato!

See more of Budapest by bike. Excellent tour of Budapest led by Adrienn. She coped well with one participant who kept straggling.Good bikes. Covered a lot of ground. And the coffee and Hungarian pastry stop, included in the price, was a welcome bonus.
Great fun on Segway . We did a 1 hour privet tour of the castle district and loved it. Our tour guide was Hungarian and and was very informative. The sights were beautiful and would highly recommend.

Superb Segway Experience. Me and my wife had a great tour of Budapest thanks to an excellent tour guide Balint and the amazing Segaways. First time on a Segway so a little apprehensive about running into pedestrians and cars, but were so easy to use. Did the three hour tour on our first morning in Budapest which helped us to get our bearings in the city and see what we wanted to further look at over the next couple of days. Balint is a great guide with loads of knowledge without which we would not have had as good an experience. We will be going on more Segway tours in other cities as it is by far the best way of getting around so many places in such a short time. Cheers Balint from Martyn and Belinda.

Super fun! . We took the segway tour around the city and it was amazing! Our guide George was patient and knowledgable and regaled us with fun anecdotes and told us about the history and culture of the city! If you have time and are up for something fun, I'd definitely recommend Yellow Zebra!

Bike Tour was great. Buda and Pest have two different attitudes about bikes on the street and therefore there were parts of the bike tour that were challenging for the members of our group who were not super confident on their bikes. The tour was fantastic! Saw so much of the city and learned a ton. I'd do it again.

Seeing the beautiful sights on a Segway. At my age getting onto a segway and cruising around the busy streets of Budapest was a daunting task but Hunor, our patient and knowledgeable guide was stunning.Seeing all the sights closeup and then being given some of the history made for a memorable experience. I would do a segway tour now in any city that offers them.

Buda Hills Tour - Amazing views. Definitely fun thing to do, you'll leanr how to use a Segway in the hills and will most of the time be out of the sun in the woods . i went 10am in the morning and finished exactly on time. There is a mini restaurant next door which is nice to chill out after the tour

Great way to see the city. We did the Budapest bike tour on the recommendation of a friend and really enjoyed it. The tour covered by off a lot of the key historical sites and monuments as well as offering a view of the history of the city. We did find some parts a little rushed, with not a lot of time to take it all in as well as take some photos, but I suppose that is the nature of these things.. A lot to fit into only a few hours. The pastries and drink at the end were really good too!

Fun afternoon Segway tour. We had a great 2-hour tour + training with Tamas. Tamas was informative, great fun and careful with guiding us safely through the city. It was a perfect family activity for teens. We highly recommend it. We did it at the end of our week in Budapest. It might have been better to do it nearer the beginning of our week in the city.

Segway tours are great!. Our tour guide, Balint was very kind. We could take pictures anytime we wanted! He even bought my sister some water when she was feeling faint. You must be 40 kg to do it. I think it was a great experience!!!
Great time. We had a fun time with our tour guide Balint. There was a good little training session and Balint was very accommodating.

Awesome couple of hours Segway tour. We've been to Budapest as couple a couple of times but never with our daughters so thought a Segway tour would be a great way to get our visit underway and to give the girls a fun overview of the city. I had never been on a segway before and the girls had once. Our excellent guide Balint gave us first class tuition outside the office before taking us on a perfect combination of the key sights backed up with great knowledge before a full on blast around Margrit island.Absolutely loved it as did the rest of the family. Segways very easy to ride and feel second nature within minutes.Highly recommended

Great Segway Tour on Friday Afternoon. Our first time in Budapest and what a great city. Friday afternoon we, the four of us with another couple from Paris, did the the two hour Segway tour. Our guide Balint was excellent and very informative and we covered most of the sites. Balint even recommended a restaurant for that evening which was excellent and very reasonably priced. A great tour and a great guide.

Great tour with just a few crashes!. We had a great time on a tour of Budapest with Christy and Dan. Lots of history, lots of information. Go and visit the island in the middle of the river which is a park!

Nice 4-hour bike trip through Budapest, friendly & knowledgeable guide.. A nice bike trip through Budapest, with a guide who knows a lot, and is also not afraid to share her personal opinions about history, the current state etc. In other words: Hungary and Budapest are, like all other countries, not perfect....Thank you for the wonderful trip. Unfortunately the weather (tropical showers) cut the second part of the trip short... but still a great experience, definitely to be recommended to others!

Interesting and fun segway tour with Christy and Daniel. As a stag do group of 11 from Great Britain we were looking for a slightly calmer day out as an alternative to the late nights and irresponsible drinking common to Brits Abroad stag dos.What we didn't count on was the absolutely enchanting Christy as our tour guide. Her wit and charm were surpassed only by the most amazing smile with which inspired every one of us fell head over heels in love. The single ones that is. The others thought only of their lovely other halves back home. Just in case they're reading this. I'd recommend the Segway tour for any occasion. You'll laugh. You'll cry. You'll learn a thing or two. You'll definitely fall in love.

Excellent tour in the afternoon. We took the tour starting 18:00 and had a very nice time stopping at famous buildings and also a fun trip around the Margit Island. Our guide Balint made this fun and interesting.

Segway tour with Hunor. We booked a Segway tour for three people in Budapest. None of us had been on a Segway before and so we were all quite nervous. However after five minutes of tuition with Hunor we felt a lot happier, and by the time we had completed the little training exercises on the Segway (turns, and going up and down small kerbs) we felt happy to get started. If you haven't tried a Segway before - give it a go, it is really easy from young (14 years old) to middle-aged (48 years old) and I'm sure someone in their 60s could manage it easily.Because we were on a private tour and had already spent a few days walking around Budapest we asked Hunor if he could think of a route that would be more fun than a normal tourist guide tour. He took us on a great route through the city and out to Margaret's Island. We had time to tour most of the Island before heading back all with big grins on our faces!

very good tour, especially in the beginning of your stay.. Very interesting tour, especially as we did it in the beginning of our stay. We learned a lot about the history of budapest. Also very nice to have some orientation and gain some free tips for the days after. Very good guide and bikes.I would recommend it to everyone.

A very enjoyable tour on Sagway with the very interesting guide Victor Kish. My husband and I enjoyed a very nice tour of Budapest with great explanations on every site from the excellent guide Victor Kish. A tour on a Sagway is a very interesting, convenient and enjoyable way to explore the city!We returned after a few days to rent Bikes for 3000 Huf each and received a 20% discount on that .The helmut was included....We didn't manage to rent the "Mobi bobi" green bikes.
Segway Tour with Balint. Excellent tour, excellent guide (Balint), great way to see the city. Great instruction and we quickly got to grips with the Segway. Thoroughly recommended - we loved it!
Segway Tour with victor. Excellent Tour with Victor. Good sense of humor. Top guided tour with nice weather.Interesting historic overview.

Tour was great. We had a great time on the tour!We saw all the major parts of the city with detailed and interesting descriptions of each building!After the tour ended, our guide, Balint, even walked us over to the Basilica in his own time just to show myself and my friends how beautiful it was. The segways were modern and clean and easy to use and the venue is so easy to find, right behind the Opera house.Thank you for a lovely tour!

funny and interesting - totally worth going!!. Yellow Zebra bike tour was our choice. it was our Day 1 in Budapest and a smart decision to take a tour round the city helped a lot to shape our further stay and understand the best places to go to. We were very lucky to get Brigitte as our guide - she is so talented in what she's doing and has a great way of showing you around. Budapest is very bike-friendly and its a great fun to travel around by a bike, especially when you get to learn about the history of the place! Thanks a lot, Yellow Zebra and thank you so much, Brigitte, you are the best!!
Segway tour of Budapest . We did the grand tour for a group of 3 friends, loads of fun and our tour leader Daniel was really informative, knew loads about local history and a really fun guy too! :)
Tour. Awesome tour with Daniel (guide). Had never been on a segway so was a good combination on history and fun

Excellent intro to Budapest by Balin . Did the bike tour with guide Balin. His pride of his heritage, passion for tour guiding, and his education proved excellent ingredients to provide a good insight and background into Hungarian history and Budapest during this whistle stop tour. 1896 stuck as a rather important date! He managed to spice up the tour with plenty of anecdotes and jokes to give further colour and depth. Equipment is excellent, biking in Budapest not a great challenge. The strudel stop was also a highlight. Highly recommended.

Brilliant experience.....very informative guide. Took the 3 hour Segway tour of Budapest....the family throughly enjoyed the same....the guide Victor was very informative. Overall an excellent experience....highly recommended.

THE tour in Budapest!!. If you going to do one tour while in Budapest that's the one !! Adrienn took me and a family from US around the city on a bike and it was one of the best tours I have done in my travels! Thanks to Adrienn who was very nice and knowledgeable!

Best Biking Tour in Budapest!. I typically take biking tours in any major city that I visit. Last week I had an exceptional tour with a fantastic guide. While the bikes are not the best( a bit bulky & yellow), the tour hit all the major sights in Budapest and provided the most excellent overview of the city! Our guide, Brigit, was fantastic. Her knowledge and experience made this trip one of the best tours I have taken...anywhere! Ask for Brigit when you book your next trip to Budapest...and use Yellow Zebra!

Fabulous and informative bike tour of Budapest.. My husband, two sons and I thoroughly enjoyed our four hour bicycle tour of Buda and Pest today. It was the perfect way to see the city in it's entirety and narrow down what we wanted to get a closer look at in our following days on our visit to Budapest. Adrienn was our guide and a wealth of information. We were never bored and learned so much in the four hours with her about her colorful home country. We highly recommend the tour to anybody on their first trip to Budapest!!

One of The BEST Ways to see this Incredible City!. Just had a wonderful morning with Kinga and my family touring the city. She was an amazing tour guide, incredibly professional and really understood the history of the city and its people. Kinga kept everyone safe, entertained and incredibly engaged by her story telling.

A festive and engaging way to experience Budapest. We did a 3 hour Segway tour of the Pest side of Budapest. My 18 year old daughter was a bit intimidated by the Segway and it took her awhile to get comfortable but our guide and instructor Balint was patient and helpful and she soon caught on. My 12 year old son picked it up easily, as did my husband and myself. Balint was a wealth of knowledge and taught us so many interesting facts and stories of this beautiful town and its roots and past. My son was having so much fun he didn't even realize how much he was learning!!!! I would highly recommend this activity and more importantly this company as a way to discover Budapest. Getting Balint as your guide is a nice bonus.

Segway Evening Tour was fantastic . Did the Segway tour with 8 of my friends in the evenings and it was great fun and the tour guides were very informative and fun to chat to, would recommend. Thanks to Daniel & Rajmund who were our guides

Amazing - must do for youngsters. The best way to see the Budapest is on a segway! Even though we paid EUR 70 per person for a private tour, it's worth every penny. Brigit was our tour guide and she was brilliant! She gauged our interest and showed us places accordingly, stopping for the right amount of time at each place.For those of you who are unsure about segways, don't worry! It's very easy once you get some training from the people at Yellow Zebra.

Great Segway Tour of Budapest!!!. We took a segway tour of Budapest with our tour guide Adam. He was a very good tour guide and he was also funny. The segways were in very good condition and they were easy to ride. This is a great way to tour cities that you have never been to before!!

Segway Walking Tour with Christina. What a great way to start out the visit in Budapest. Christina was well versed in the Hungarian history and very gracious throughout. We learned so much more than I had hoped. We also incorporated the subway and a bus ride into the mix. It was a great experience. Well done, Christina.
EXcellent - highlight of our trip. We took a bike tour with Brigit as our guide. Awesome tour with bikes in good condition and an awesome guide!

Terrific Bike Tour. We just completed a bike tour of Budapest with Adrienne as our guide. Not only did she explain the history and culture of the town, country and important sites, but she genuinely cared about the happiness and comfort of all persons on the tour. The stop at the strudel cafe was delightful as well. Adrienne stayed after wards to answer questions about travel around Budapest by public transport, provided restaurant recommendations, and directions to other sites. She is a gem so if you can, take your tour with her!

Biking Hungary with Brigit is the best way to learn about Budapest. Brigit, being born and raised in Hungary, knows all about Hungary. We went on a 3hr bike tour which she enthusiastically customized for us since we had already taken a city bus tour and wanted to see different tourist areas and areas that typically only the locals visit, like Margaret Island. The short stop at a local restaurant to sample some strudel was something the other bike tours we had taken in other countries did not include. Brigit's English is excellent and she included humor and little known facts about some of the stops, like telling us about the many movies the Opera house area had been used for filming. The bikes are good quality bikes; all we did was show up with our cameras and took off for a casual trip around the city, and now we have a lifetime of memories.

Fabulous bike tour of Buda and Pest. We are two parents with a college age daughter. This tour was a grand way to see so much of this beautiful city! This was our first overview and Brigit did not disappoint! We got a sense of history, architecture and culture from our ride and her informative and sometimes humorous commentaries. Find out why 96 is a symbolic number and how Magyar relates to Hungary. Can't say enough great things about this tour from the easy cycling to the sights from the bridges to the great snack. Thank you, Yellow Zebra and Brigit!
Brigit is excellent. We had a bike tour of Budapest with Brigit and she is excellent. Try to get her when you do this tour. Fun trip; learned a lot about Magyar (Hungary).

Fun way to see Budapest with teen. My 13 year old son and I did the Segway for the first time with them. It was fun and great way to see Budapest. You cover a lot more and get to be in action while sightseeing and learning more about the city. My son particularly enjoyed it as compare to the usual walk and tour sightseeing. Dora was good guide. Patience with showing us how to ride the Segway and showing us around. My son had lots of fun with this Segway tour. We had so much fun that we had booked ourselves for the next one in Vienna with Yellow Zebra again.

Segway Tour Was Excellent. What an excellent way to see a capital city. Our tour guide was Balint and he was a very nice and knowledgable local guide. Unfortunately for us it rained heavily but that did not stop us from having a brilliant time on this Segway Tour. We got to see so much of the city. This is a must for sightseers.
The place to get your bike segway or tour in BP!. Lovely people, fast & friendly service, great bikes and segways, superfun and interesting tours. This is the place to be!

You'd be silly not to do a well-priced bike tour in such a bike-friendly city!. We did the 3.5 hour bike tour starting at 11am on a Thursday. It was a lot of fun and a very good value. Budapest is an excellent city for exploring on bike given many wide bike paths and mostly flat terrain (at least on the Pest side). Frank was a fantastic guide. He was extremely knowledgeable, kept a good pace, and was always careful to keep the group together and in the shade when possible! Frank taught us a lot about Hungarian history in an easily consumable way and provided interesting perspectives on life in Budapest today. I would highly recommend the bike tour in Budapest!!
Segway tour Krakow. Thanks Anna! It was a lovely trip Well spent money, a perfect guide and good forerunner. We will come back for sure. /Sofia and Mats

Loved this tour, loved Anna, and loved Budapest!. Thank you to Anna and Yellow Zebra for a great orientation to this wonderful city. My three friends and I did the 3 hour bike tour with Anna and we truly enjoyed it. Believe it or not, this was one of the few tours I've ever done (and I love doing bike tours) that had an employee bringing up the rear and taking pictures! A nice addition and helped us feel safe biking around the city. Anna had a great personality and did a really nice job of telling stories and providing insight into Budapest without giving too much information and making it boring. The strudel was great too! I highly recommend doing this tour on your first full day in Budapest so you know what you want to explore further. Enjoy!!

Highlight of the Holiday!!!. Easily the best way to see Budapest. Balint our tour guide was a great laugh and had a fantastic knowledge of the city's colourful history. The segways were really easy to handle. 100% everyone should try!!!!! Peace!

3h bike tour with Viktor. It was easy to find the rental place because iit was near one of the pricipale street in Pest side. The bike that they gave it to me was in good condition. The guide, Victor, was professional, nice because he took me looot of pictures (I was alone so I need it) and he did it also very good! More, to ride a bike in Budapest is very easy because there are very maintened bicicle lines. Some of those bike line are also got the European certification ood quality. In conclusion, I suggest this wonderful way to discover the city! :)
Great Tour and Guides!. Took the tour today and everything was great.....Balint is a great guide with excellent knowledge of the local history. Thanks for the fun!Tim

Excellent experience and see different side of Budapest. 謝謝導遊Dani 令我第一次玩Segway 都好開心， 他的英語很好， 我們4 個女生用了約20 分鐘就學會了。 Dani 問了我們之前去了什麼地方， 他就帶我們去我們没去過的景點，行程很有彈性，而且也很注重我們的安全， 十分滿意！！！ Thank you Dani for yesterday Segway tour. He is an excellent coach and tour guide. He taught us the way to get balance on the Segway for the first 20mins, discussed with us where we had been visit in the city and showed us the other places we hadn't visit in Budapest yet. We had visit a lot of attractions including the Hungar State opera house, house of terror museum, Heroes' square, Budepest zoo& botanical garden, Vajdahunyad Castle. Dani told us so many interesting information about Hungary and Budapest. I cannot be happier and more satisfied for the tour. Glad that Dani is our tour guide for my 1st Segway experience.

Best way to know Budapeste. Is fun and a easy way to know all in a confortable way, the company is really worry with safety and with the quality of they services so everything was perfect the company tourist guide Cristina was really nice and explain and speak about all tourist points of city so was a fun way to learn and know more about Budapest, recomend A LOT..

Brilliant way to see the city. I did a bike tour with Yellow Zebra last week and I couldn't recommend it enough. Thomas was our tour guide, he was funny and knowledgeable and kept our enthusiasm going for the whole 4 hours, even in 36 degree heat! I learned so much during the tour and really enjoyed myself, as did the three people I was with. It may seem too warm and sunny to be cycling for four hours (on and off) but once you're on the bike in the breeze it is extremely enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this tour to my friends. It is good value for money as well.

Money well spent!. Balint was our tour guide and was great! We opted for the additional hour "superior" tour and it was well worth it. Great sights seen and Balint was knowledgeable about them all. We would highly recommend and can't wait until we get to Prague to do it again with Yellow Zebra tours but now at a 20% discount!

Best way to see Budapest . We did a 3 hour cycle tour with them, our guide Anna was amazing. She gave us interesting information about the city and was lively & funny. My 10 year old son enjoyed the tour too. She gave us a overview of the history of Budapest as she explained the significance of the sites. The ride itself is beautiful & fun. I would recommend this company & tour to everyone who visits Budapest.

Great way to get a little history and have fun around the city.. We had a 2 hour Segway tour booked visiting some historical buildings and areas around the city.Our guide George was very knowledgeable and made the historical facts intersting not too long.This was very reasonably priced tour and I highly recommend it.Our whole party loved it.

Excellent tour of the city. We recently did a Segway tour of Prague and a Segway tour of Budapest and can assuredly say that the team at Yellow Zebra Segway Tours - Budapest is excellent. Our experience here was much better than our Segway experience in Prague.We took a two hour tour on the Pest side, our tour guide was Bernadett. Not only was she knowledgeable, but also very friendly.The tour guide, makes all the difference to a tour and we were glad to have an excellent guide in Bernadett.

Fun sightseeing. Sightseeing on a Segway is the best way. Yellow Zebra were excellent. We were a party of 10 ladies on a 40th celebration. We had two two guides who were excellent. The use, safety features of the Segway were described and demonstrated well and we each had a practice. The knowledge of Budapest was exceptional and put across in a very interesting way. It was a wonderful two and a half hours. Budapest is a really beautiful city and to explore and see it on a Segway was fantastic. I am over 60 and was a little worried I was too old to do this sort of thing. No way. It is better than walking! Hope to do it again.
Awesome Experience. Had a tour with Brigit. She was super knowledgeable and always eager to explain more about Hungary and the history. A must do for a first visit to Budapest!

Bike tour with lunch . Great way to discover some of the most important sights in Budapest. Excellent guides who give interesting information about the buildings and places along the tour. We had lunch at the market hall. With the local drinks and saugages.

A must do when visiting Budapest. From booking the tour to completion of the tour, the service was professional, friendly, straight forward and fun! The tour itself was brilliant. We were a bit nervous about using the Segway, but the 20 minute tutorial was great and our 2 guides, Kristina and Bernadette were brilliant. So patient, friendly and informative. It was a great way to see so much of the city but also, so fun! We highly recommend it.

Brilliant tour with friendly and helpful guides. We were a group of 10 celebrating a 40th and seeing Budapest by segway was a great adventure. Our guides, Christy and Bernadette were brilliant. They were extremely informative of their city and happily answered all our questions. The pace of the tour worked well for us and they were both very patient with us. A few of our party were a little nervous and apprehensive to begin with but that very quickly change after the short demo/instruction before setting off on the tour.We all throughly enjoyed our morning with Christy and Bernadette and would happily recommend the segway tour to other visitors.

Segway Tour in Budapest with Tomas. I am by no means a coordinated or athletic person and I loved this tour. Tomas was super attentive and funny as well as incredibly informative. We got to see some of the coolest parts of the city through a unique and entertaining perspective. The segway was pretty easy to handle once I got my bearings, my boyfriend was of course a natural and he enjoyed it even more than I did. We did the tour on our last day on a whim and I am truly glad we did because it created a really special memory of our time in budapest. Definitely recommend this to anyone traveling to budapest, ask for Tomas as your guide :)

So much fun and a great way to see the city. Out of a group of 10 none of us had been on a Segway before. After a little training it was fairly easy to get to grips with. Even my mother of 68 managed it! The tour guide was exceptionally knowledgable and kept good control of the group even when crossing roads. Its a must if you visit Budapest. The whole city covered in 3 hours and aching calves at the end! Probably not a good idea for young kids though!

Knowledgable and helpful staff. Frank was a great tour guide. Extremely informative and hit major and minor sites. Frank provided a lot of pointers and suggestions one where to go next and what to do. The strudel didn't hurt either (try the poppy seed one).

Day Bike Tour. Brilliant tour taking in all the main sights of the city (but avoiding the big hill!). The guide, Adrienn gave a brief summary of Hungarian history which really helped to understand the city. She tailored the length of time at each stop to our needs, she was happy to take photo's and answer questions. The stop for traditional Strudel was perfect, near the end of the tour, by which time you have worked up an appetite. The cycle is all on flat ground and relatively easy, although it is quite long there are plenty of stops to break it up and the time flew by. We felt very safe even though some cycling is on the roads. I really recommend this as a way of getting to know a city and much cooler than walking on a hot day. Tip: eat breakfast before you set off.
Best way to enjoy sightseeing . We just loved this afternoon with Dora. She is fun, we had great time. Instuction was fast and excelent, after 5 min we were up to anything :)Go for it!

Segwaying through Budapest. I received the perfect birthday gift: a Segway voucher for two persons. Yesterday we went on a two hour tour, with Dora, our excellent, funny, entertaining, very enthusiastic tour guide. We just kept going on 'rabbit speed', seeing the Opera (with the stories of the statutes and the Nazi's), the Basilica (with the collapsing dome - just forgot to stop at the best ice cream shop in town (acct Trip Advisor), the Parliament (with the unlucky architect passing out just before the opening), Margit Sziget (and the concert of David Bowie), slaloming through the crowd on the boulevard alongside the Danube... It was magical. Thank You Dora!

Fantastic Tour with Tamas. So we booked for the 3 hours on a Sunday morning - out your lasted almost 4! Tamas was thoroughly informative and lots of fun - listen to his history lesson because he asks you questions later and the prize is well with getting lol!! Lots of fun, very safe and a great way to get to know your way around Budapest! Thank you!

Great tour by Adam!. We loved our segway tour. Adam was knowledgable, attentive and overall a great guide. The city is stunning and he knew all the right places to take us to. Would do love to do it again!

I'd definitely go again. Me and two friends done a segway tour. First we had a tutorial on how to do it by our guide (Dora). It takes a few minutes to get used to it but then you're off without trouble. Dora was very nice and friendly and pointed out spots along the way with facts about the places. We had a choice between going through the city and going to Margaret Island, we chose the island. It was a great way to see things and hear about them from someone instead of a guidebook .Better than being on a stuffy bus!Even though I fell twice, I'd go again.

Good way to get a quick orientation. Had a nice guide, Christina, who was knowledgeable about the city. She was very sweet. I'm hard of hearing and so missed some of her talk because of traffic noise. Nice way to get a feel for the city.

Excellent tour. My mom and I popped in to ask if it was possible to get a private tour the same day. We discussed the options and were recommended to take a 1-hour tour (we had already seen most of the sights) that no-one else had yet booked. So we got a private tour (we got to choose the route) for the price of a normal tour. Plus our tour actually lasted more than 1,5 hours so that was great too!Our lovely guide Dora spoke excellent English (obviously, since she teaches English!) and was very entertaining and friendly. We were familiar with segways but my mom (who's a bit older) was a little hesitant about her skills. Dora was very attentive and made sure she was doing ok.Even the pouring rain (the last 5 minutes of our tour) couldn't spoil our wonderful segway tour. :)
Best way to see Budapest. We spent a week in Budapest last month. A great trip - and one of the highlights was a Segway tour. Such a great way to see the city - and such fun!

,/ JUST DO IT !. I have been on 4 different city tours & without a doubt this is the best 1 due in no small part to our guide Dora, what a star. Very professional, highly informative & great fun. There was only my partner & I with Dora as our guide so will felt like we had our own private tour. Once Dora knew we were compitent on the Segways she took us to see some her favourite places & I'm sure we went way over our 2hrs. The best segway team I've had the pleasure to ride with & I will be seeking them out in Vienna & Kracow, I recommend you do the same,5☆ .

Great city bike tour Budapest . The city bike tour in Budapest with Yellow Zebra was great. The guide was nice and very interesting tour. We had a coffee break at Strudel Bar. I can really recommend it.
Bike Tour with Frank. Excellent. Very informative. Well-Informed. Great stops Great guide. Easy going. Accommodating. Yummy Strudel.

Excellent. On my 2nd last day in Budapest,I took a tour with Yellow Zebra.I wish I had taken it on my 1st day as the tour could not have been better,for getting to know Budapest and how to travel around the city ,to all manner of information provided by our guide George.Great way to see Budapest and I now love Budapest strudel among other new things I tried in Budapest.Top marks.

Budapest to Szentendre and Back: Bike Tour. We would like to thank RE'KA our tour guide for the ride to szentendre, her passion and love for the city made our trip more intriguing. She had taken us for the most memorial journey that we will always remember for the rest of our lives. - Dipz, Raks, Raf

Great tour. We covered a lot of ground and our tour guide Christina was informative and very helpful! We got a great look at the Pest side and a peek of Buda. The stop at the strudel house was a highlight!

4 Saatlik Bisiklet Turu. İlk defa bir şehirde bisiklet turuna katıldım, oldukça memnun olduğumu söyleyebilirim. Bisikletler iyi durumdaydı, 3 vitesli olmasına rağmen iniş çıkış olmadığı için fazlasına ihtiyaç olmuyor, kask verilmedi (sanırım zorunluluk yok), tur rehberi oldukça güleryüzlüydü, şehrin tarihiyle alakalı kısa bir özet almış oluyorsunuz, turun bitişine yakın ikram edilen Strudel çok lezzetliydi.My first bike tour ever, I liked it and decided to attend at the other countries I'll visit. Bikes are in good condition, route is flat mostly so you wouldn't need more than 3 gears, no helmets given (nobody asked), our guide Christy was so nice, smiling all the time, this was a quick review of the city's history and the Strudel at the end of the tour was so delicious. It took about 4 hours (11:00 to 15:00)

Day out . Rented bikes for the two of us during a trip to Budapest. Budapest do have a 'boris bike' like system (Londoners will know what that means) that we spotted but the deposit on them was huge so we decided to go with yellow zebra. Prices were very good value for money and it was very easy to rent them. The shop is very close to the main cycle path and we cycled from the shop, up to the river and to the castle (a must for fantastic views) all along it without worry for safety! Locks are included with the bikes so very easy to stop off along the way! Overall fab, cheap day out

Great way to see a lot of Budapest . While some in our party were hesitant (initially), this was a great way to see a lot of the city. Bernadette was our tour guide, and she did a great job of informing, educating and entertaining us.I would definitely do this again, only change would be to to do a private tour...

Fantastic Segway Tour from Kinga. Spent 2 hours on a Segway tour with Kinga. She was knowledgable about the area and a great source of history. Despite the pouring rain and being the only person on the tour Kinga was infinitely patient with my endless questions and provided one of the most interesting tours I've ever been on. Thank you Kinga for providing a very enjoyable if wet afternoon.

Great fun even though it's raining!. I brought two colleagues enjoy the Segway during our weekend break. This is my third time experience Segway. Still it gave me wonderful experience.Before departing, it's raining outside. Anyway, everyone agreed we should do it. At the end, my colleagues appreciated a lot for the trip. The city of Budapest is an attractive place that lots of old heritage hidden inside. Our tour lady Kirga lead us from Opera House, Parliament, the bridge overseeing Buda Castle. That's awesome!Today we are leaving Budapest. May be someday, I'll bring my family to visit this nice city again. ~ Dixon

Push bike city tour w Bridget. Took a tour of budapest on bikes for a few hours led by Bridget. She was knowledgable and answered all the questions we had about this great city. Happy to recommend this to others. Only minor suggestion to the company would be to have an extra tour guide riding at the back of the group, especially for larger groups only for added safety.
Great Segway Tour!!. Andi was our guide, and she was stupendous! Definitely recommend taking a tour with here. Segway was a great way to see the city for a couple of hours. It's beautiful here!

Segway Tour. Did the 2 hour tour at 3pm with our guide Balint who was brilliant. We did it on second day of break as was raining on first day but highly recommended for a whizz round the Pest side of city to see what the city has to offer before you visit individual attractions. Ideally go early in as guides can also tell you where else to visit and also where the good bars and restaurants are.Thoroughly recommended.

Amazing 2 hour segway tour with our brilliant guide Tamas!. As it was all our first time on a segway, our group of five were slightly anxious prior to the tour but with our encouraging, friendly and hilarious guide Tamas we were taught all the manoeuvres very quickly and gained confidence by conquering our fears! So much fun and we covered a lot of main tourist attractions in our short 2 hour tour (I would recommend going for 3-4 hours if time allows). Tamas was brilliant with providing lots of insightful information of the sights, doing fun quizzes with us and keeping us all entertained (and safe!) It was the highlight of my trip and my friends and I highly recommend it!
Great tour with balint. Baliant was great and handsome he was the hottest tour guide I ever had very informative and very smart and very intelligent

Great bike tour. Would strongly recommend it as it covers a larger ground then walking tour and is very informative. The pastry stop also is very nice. The bike are great and anyone can do the tour as there's no hill to climb, it's very flat.
Great fun with professional Segway team. Our guide Andi took us to the park for a fast trip per Segway. Good instructions and a solid Segway. Great fun!

Great way to see the sights without walking all day!. We booked the Evening Segway tour online for €65 each and it was completely worth the money. It was a last minute decision and we booked on the day, given we had a few bits we still wanted to see close up but were flying home the next day.When we got there, we were the only two people booked on the tour so everything was worked around us. We had a Segway familiarisation to make sure we felt comfortable handling it before the tour guide took us touring round the sights. We visited all the main attractions and it was quite interactive rather than just being spoken at for two hours. The evening tour is the only one to visit Margaret Island, and the guide told us that it was normally quieter in the evening so the tour can be more customised to you, so if there are things you want to see that aren't too far out of the way, deviations from the normal route can be permitted.The only downside to the Segways, and it isn't anything to do with the company, is just that standing up for so long can start to ache your back and knees a bit. Our guide let us stop and stretch our legs whenever we wanted, so again, I cannot fault them for making sure you're as comfortable as you can be.If you're off to Budapest and want to be shown a few of the sights rather than have to go around and see them yourself, and be given a pretty decent history of what you're seeing, then I whole heartedly recommend taking a tour with Yellow Zebra. If Segways aren't your thing, they also do walking and bike tours.

Great way to travel. We had an excellent time on the yellow zebra bike tour of the City (4 hrs). Balint was very knowledgeable and friendly and kept the tour very interesting (such a dark dark history). A great way to see the City and cover a lot of ground, thank you! And the Raspberry and Curd strudel was amazing!
In cash!!!!. Prices are ok, bikes are nice to ride "didn't try the segways" the only thing that bothered me that they don't accept credit cards for deposits so keep some cash around

If Budapest, then on the bike!. We rented the bikes for two days. Had a super sunny days. The shop team is very helpful and fast. No long discussion but very professional! Good located shop in the old city. Negative: don't accepted any credit cards. Be prepare with cash.

Best segway tour for a first timer!. Had such a great time with Balint. He was relaxed, funny and friendly and made sure we were safe at all times. We visited so many places we wouldn't have done on our own like Margaret Island.Great views of Buda the Parliament and the Danube at dusk. Balint was very knowledgeable giving us an insight into a wonderful country's history, and answered all of our questions.Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to see Budapest at pace!

Yellow Zebra Segway Tour. We were a mixed group of fifty somethings taking the two hour Segway tour (lasted longer). Our guide Balint couldn't have been better, warm, friendly, funny and very knowledgable, he made a good tour great. The Segways are a fun way to get around the city, allowing you to cover a lot of ground in a short space of time. I would highly recommend this tour, and as for Segways, I'm hooked!

Average bike tour. We've been fortunate enough to do bike tours in many European cities but if we are honest this was our least favourite so far. That doesn't mean it's a bad tour by any means, you will still learn lots and see the lovely city of Budapest. We just felt our guide could have been a little more enthusiastic about his city and bring some of the history to life (something we've experienced during other bike tours). The ratio of cycling versus interesting stops is also quite cycling heavy (it's not difficult fitness wise but we just would have preferred more stops as we passed interesting looking sights). The drink and pastry stop is very nice though.

Exceeded Expectations & Amazing. My class of 11 took a segway tour with Balint and George. They were awesome! They knew a lot about the area, never bored us, they were very enthusiastic, patient and we all felt very safe which was really important to my classmates who were very nervous about riding the segways. Balint and George really exceeded our expectations and represented the company well. 10/10 would recommend to all of my friends. We will definitely come back next time we are in Europe.

Ideal Introduction to Budapest. I recently did the 4-hour Budapest cycle tour with Yellow Zebra. It was a small group of three. Tomaz was our guide on the day, and as he told us, he's a proud man born and raised in Buda. The Yellow Zebra cycle tour is an ideal introduction to Budapest. The tour covers about 20kms and begins at Yellow Zebra's shop near the Opera House. The team in the shop were very welcoming and helpful on arrival. The tour starts with a trip along Andrassy Boulevarde to Heroes Square. Tomaz likes his history and facts; at the Heroes Square stop he was able to give a potted history of Hungarian history that was very interesting to listen to. The tour then makes it way through beautiful City Park and past Szechenyi baths. The route then takes in St. Stephen’s Basilica, Libertrty square and Parliament. There is a then a cycle along the Danube to see Matthias Church, the Royal Palace and the Fisherman’s Bastion. We then crossed over to the Buda side at Margit Bridge. We then cycled along the river to the Liberty Bridge to get back to the Pest side. There was a stop along the way to eat strudel. I thought that this would be uninspiring, but the strudel was absolutely delicious, and the stop for a coffee and a rest was a pleasant thing to do. We made lots of stops along the way.
