Tomaz kept a good pace, both in terms of our speed and the amount of detail that he was able to give throughout the tour. He's a very open guy who answered every question put to him. He was engaging and charming throughout the tour. I learned a lot from Tomaz and was inspired to visit a a charming little bookstore on Kiraly Street to buy a couple of good English-language books on modern Budapest or Hungarian history. We covered a lot of ground on the day. Zebra's website says 16km. I wouldn't be surprised if it was a little bit more than that. Budapest is very flat so the ride was very doable. Yellow Zebra's bikes have three speeds and they are very comfortable to ride on. The tour was a great introduction to Budapest's history and the geography of the city. If you were only in Budapest for a short period of time this would be an ideal way to get a sense of the place. If you were there for a little longer, it would be a good activity to do on your first day. You see a lot and you learn a lot. At the end of the tour Tomaz made a point of helping each of us with things like restaurant and attraction recommendations. He really takes his role as an ambassador of his city serious. This is a well put together tour that is operated by a nice team of people at Yellow Bikes. Tomaz, thanks for a great day out in your beautiful city.
Segway Tour with our guide Balint. Excellent!We had a lot of fun. It was a nice tour through Budapest.Special thank to our guide Balint.

Great afternoon with Adrienn. We had a wonderful personal tour for 2 hours around Budapest this afternoon. We covered a lot of ground from park to parliament. Our guide spoke very clear English and was very patient with our 3 teenage boys who were keen to zip around!We were most impressed with the service of this company considering we had no booking and simply walked off the street. The bike Budapest event which closed many streets was a real bonus for access plus a spectacle for us to b part of. Thank u Adrienn.
Amazing bike tour. This is a great way to see the city. We had a great tour guide, Frank. He spoke really good english and told us interesting things about the city. Had a wonderful time :)

Highly recommend. Excellent way to find our bearings on our first day in Budapest. 3 and a half hours including a coffee and strudel stop but all on the flat. Guide Anita was very knowledgeable and friendly, and spoke excellent English. Recommended.

Segway great tour. We are 2 couples in the 50's. Had a great 3 hour Segway tour with George. More like 4 hours all together but plenty of stops with interesting stories. George was taking very good care of all of us, very patiently. Only regret was that the tour had to stop again as the Segway felt like a part of our body.

Fun tour. We did the bike tour of Budapest, guided by Frank (Ferenc? - excuse the spelling!). He was a great guide, very knowledgable and with lots of little anecdotes about the things he was showing us. We covered lots of ground but at a very easy pace. It was nice to have a free coffee and pastry thrown in at the end too! Would definitely recommend this tour and Frank as a guide.

Fantastic Bike Tour. I would have to say our tour guide Brigit was the most knowledgable guide I have ever had. As my friend and I arrived for the tour only to find out we were the only 2 people there, we were very lucky that our guide was so friendly and easy to talk to, making it a definite highlight of our trip to Budapest.

Great Tour of Budapest!. This was recommended by a friend and was one of the highlights of our trip. Our guide Balint could not have been better. Knowledgeable, funny, and kind, he made sure that we had an amazing time and we did. There is no better way to tour the city. I suggest this over a bike or walking tour as it allows you to cover more ground. Also, request Balint because he was the best.

Segway fun . Had an awesome time touring around Budapest yesterday with Bernadette, ripping around the city on a segway beats walking any day!!! And Bernadette was full of information, all in all great tour.

Bernadette and YellowZebraSegway. We had a top afternoon on our yellow zebra segways ably guided by the lovely Bernadette. If was fun and informative and a thoroughly enjoyable way of seeing Budapest. She even tolerated our fooling around on the segways!

Just great!. Really enjoyed our tour with Tomaz. I had a try on the segway but really felt more comfortable on a bike, he was fine to change over. The tour was professional, the guy was great at making us feel comfortable and really knew his stuff about the history of Budapest. Got the balance just right in terms of being interesting and not overloading us with info.

Segway tour . Excellent afternoon with Tomas great guid loved the Segway adventure ! A must for a fun packed afternoon !!Starting lesson really get you used to the machine. All beginners welcome ! Your really informative and with some amazing information he was just fantastic!
Best Segway tour ever! . What a great way to see the city and learn about all the sites! Thank you to our fantastic guide Balint for a brilliant tour!
Segway Tours With instructor Petra. Highly recommended tour fun and amazing, A great way to see the beautiful city excellent guide Petra!!!

Enjoyable couple of hours. Having been on two previous segway tours within Europe when we saw this tour we did not hesitate to sign ourselves up. As we were a group of ten we were split up into two groups, as three of us had experience & only needed a refresh the other two in our group were able to have extra instruction from our guide. Our guide was very informative, & gave us a tour around the Jewish Quarter. He was professional and caring making sure if there was anything we needed or anywhere else we wanted to go. We all enjoyed our two hour tour but found it expensive for what it was. £55 each.

One of the highlights of our trip!. We had an amazing time on the Budapest Segway Tour! This was one of the highlights of our trip. There were six in our party ages 12,14,15,16 and two adults. This was the fourth city we were visiting on our trip, so we decided to change things up and do a Segway city tour. This was the first time any of us had been on a Segway. The younger kids and the adults were a bit tentative during our training, but as soon as the tour started, we got the hang it of it and felt very comfortable. We did the two-hour tour, which was perfect for us. I will caution parents to ensure that all follow instructions. The 15 year-old in our group fell off in a very crowded area, primarily because he did not follow the instructions our tour guide gave. He was ok, but he or someone else could have easily gotten hurt. I would recommend this to all and specially to families with teenagers. Adam, our tour guide was great! We saw a lot of the key sites in Pest and Adam tailored the amount of information he gave us based on our level of interest.

Bike Tour of Budapest. Had a wonderful time cycling thru this beautiful city. My guide was Viktor and he was great, we had a great time, beautiful paths and a great friendly staff at yellow zebra bike tours. #JPCPOSE
Segway tour. We had a brilliant 3 hour Segway tour of Budapest with George. Hugely knowledgeable and entertaining guide. Loved it. A must do to get an overall feel for this fabulous city.

Great tour. We had a great tour in the city of Boedapest.Dora was a very good guide to tell us about the history of Boedapest. A segway tour is a very nice way to see the city and learne about it. Its fun.

Great introduction to the city. Arrived in Budapest this morning. Never having been here, we decided a bike tour would give us a good introduction. We missed the group tour but were able to book a private tour with just 24 hours notice. Our guide FRANK was excellent, spoke great English and gave us a few restaurant and bar recommendations were perfect. Spent 4 hours, saw most of the highlights within peddling distance. Highly recommend.

Awesome Segway tour. Finally broke down and did a Segway tour for the first time while visiting Budapest. Had I known how much fun and how easy it was to operate, we would have been doing Segway tours for years! The boys loved it and Budapest's wide sidewalks afforded plenty of room for us to maneuver and enjoy the sites. A big round of applause and thanks to our excellent guide Ferenc (Frank) for the great 2 hour tour around the city. He was very informed, told great stories, and provided lots of unique insight on the many places we visited. In short, I would highly recommend Ferenc at Yellow Zebra tours.Ps - he's also a concierge of sorts as he booked a table for us at a great Hungarian restaurant.

Excellent Afternoon. Segway Tour around the city was an excellent way to see the key attractions. We were all a bit hesitant at the start but after 10 minutes we were whizzing around ...Tamas was an excellent guide, tailoring his tour to how much interest we were showing at each location. He made it more interesting by throwing in a quiz to keep us all on our toes! Definitely a fun way to spend a couple of hours

Would definitely recommend! So glad we did it!. Was a really good way to see alot of Budapest in a short amount of time! Really fun and easy to use. Frank was a really good tour guide, they were able to recommend the best places to visit and made it really interesting!
Excellent. Very good way to get around, easy to use and we would definitely do it again! Frank was very easy going and flexible with the tour.

Most amazing Segway Tour in Budapest. We did a Private Segway Tour through Budapest and on short notice the Yellow Zebra Team accommodated us. We tried a lot of companies, but they took the cake in courtesy, promptness and price.Please ask for BRIGIT as your private guide as she really did the tour extremely well and the kids loved her!!!Anand, Anishaa & Saranya from India

HIGHLY RECOMMEND! . This was well worth the money! Our guide bernatte was amazing! Very knowledgeable and friendly. Went out of her way to show us extras she thought we would like. Defeats were easy and most of all fun to ride! Really glad we made to effort!

Bridget 💯💯(Excellent). Our tour was really good with Bridget & I will highly recommend her to others.I first felt I can't do it as the balancing on the Segway was a bit cross border for me but she stood by me with the training to ensure I was save and her knowledge around the Budapest was outstanding...the Segway tour was nice no need to walk when you got the Segway and Bridget 100% out 100%Looking to see you soon in the UK

We love Frank!. We had the GREATEST tour of Budapest today with Frank! Wow- we valued our trip SO much more after our tour wig Yellow Zebra and will certainly be telling friends and family to request Frank in upcoming trips. Bravo

FABULOUS BIKE TOUR!. Frank gave us the most incredible tour of Budapest. We as a family have taken oh so many tours of Europe of all prices and sorts, and this by far trumped them all. Frank is the greatest!

Absolutely fantastic!. My family arrived to Budapest after traveling thru Prague and Vienna, we were all tired and not sure if we wanted to go on yet another tour..... We arrived at Yellow Zebra and it all changed. We met Frank and he is fabulous. He showed us the town, gave us tips and insight into the local culture. We had a blast and would do it again! Frank is #1 if you can request him!

Sunday afternoon. My wife and daughter and I spent Sunday afternoon with Bridget on a fantastic tour.She was very knowledgeable and gave us some grey insight into the culture and history of Budapest....we had a great time...highly recommended!

Enjoyable Tour of beautiful Budapest. I would highly recommend this Tour if you are looking to get a flavor of everything Budapest has to offer. Bikes were comfortable to cycle and motoring up city center Budapest was exhilarating. The tour lasted 4 hours and we had lovely strudel about 3 hours into it. A special mention to our Tour guide Tomas who was very nice, mindful of everyone on the tour and knowledgeable on all things Budapest. He also made the tour fun and interesting playing quiz games along the way. All in all a great day.

Realy funny tour with Tamas. Biketour was great. We had a lot of fun with our guide Tamas. He gave us some insites about Budapest and concentrated the "try" data to a minimum.A bike tour is a good start to get an overview and to collect impressions and hints where to go and have a closer look.

Great way to see Budapest . We did a similar tour in Krakow and it was a fantastic way to see the city, get your bearing and understand some of the history. So we booked Budapest with some friends, there were 5 people in total on the tour with Brigit, again couldn't recommend highly enough, funny, friendly and informative. A much better way to see this beautiful city rather than being stuck on a coach or behind large groups on a walking tour.
Amazing tour. Brigit was our wondefull guide. She was warm and knew the historical facts of the Hungerian nation perfectly. We enjoyed the tour alot and we recomend it.

3.5 hour bike tour in Budapest. My friend and I booked this tour via viator web site. We got a confirmation quickly. The meeting point is easy to find. Its location is closed to an opera house. Our tour guide, Frank, was great. He give us a lot of history of buildings. The tour also had a complimentary local dessert at a coffee shop. The total distance to cycling was 19.2K.

didn't want to, glad I did!. My wife insisted that we do a Segway tour of Budapest during my 50th birthday celebrations and it filled me with dread. All I could see was me going home in a plaster cast. Was I wrong. It was so much fun, easy to learn and control and after so much walking nice to take the strain off the old legs. Cristina was lovely very friendly and knowledgeable about her country, city and its history. You're in very good hands with yellow Zebra. Can't wait to go back and see the rest of the city.

Budapest by segway. Did this today Adam was our guide he was very knowledgable and made things fun even though the weather was terrible he provided us all with ponchos to keep dry this is our second Segway tour our other being in Rome and we enjoyed this one as well the Segway's are so much fun and are easy to use would defiantly do another but would like dryer warmer weather the next time would recommend this company

Segway fun. Just like to say that the Segway tour was brilliant, it was a great laugh especially for my friends 21st. Very good English from the tour guide Brigit she made it more fun and was able to show us how the Segway worked and the wonderful parts of Budapest and had a lot of knowledge on it all.

Fantastic Budapest tour with Bogatá!. We took the 3,5 hour biketour around the city. Our guide Bogatá was very knowledgable and made the tour very nice! So much to see, many beautiful historical buildings and parks and an interesting history. We enjoyed this very much and can highly recomend this as a good experience!

Thank you!!. We took a tour in the morning with the tour guide La'szló! It was great to visit the city on a segway, we managed to cover the entire city center without getting tired! Thanks to the guide that illustrated the beauties of the city at our pace, giving us time for questions and pictures! Ciao ciao

Great fun and a very competent guide!. We had booked a segwaytour ind advance. The location was easy to find, and we were welcomed by good people! Before the actual tour, we got to practice on our segway-skills — it was easy to learn, and our guide, Frank, made ud feel comfortable and safe. The actual tour was perfect! A steady pace on the Segway at a well organized route. Frank was a very competent and capable guide with a very broad knowledge in history, politics, architecture, culture etc. He also made room for questions, tips and recommendations. This was a perfect way to start our holiday and to get a good overview og Budapest downtown, and not to forget: GREAT fun!

Great way to see the city with good knowledge of the history of Budapest. This was an excellent way to see the city and get a good insight into the history of the Budapest. The tour guides were very knowledgeable and accommodating. We had two tour guides, Frank plus one other.The equipment was good and safe to use.Would recommend it to anyone else with a couple of hours to see the sights.

Excellent Segway Tour! Don't miss it.. After having been in Budapest for five days, we decided to go for the Grand Segway Afternoon Tour by the Yellow Zebra Tours. We arrived early and spent 15 mins in their super cozy office choosing our helmets and bundling up before stepping out in the cold. Our guide, Robert was very friendly, well-informed and was possibly the best guide you could ask for. We had a 30 minute training session. Robert made sure we all were comfortable and had enough practice before we started the actual tour. The tour was brilliant. We saw Budapest in an entirely new light. I would suggest this for anyone who wants to experience a novel way of touring a city. After the tour, the office was kind enough to treat us to a nice hot cup of tea! Must also mention that the staff in office was also friendly and easily approachable. They took all precautions to ensure that no one had a bad Segway experience.

Super Segway tour. I had so much fun on this two hour Segway tour of beautiful Budapest. Our guide, George was do helpful and enthusiastic and made sure we were able to handle the Segways before heading out. The tour itself was great, light hearted, informative and most importantly, lots of fun. You very quickly get a handle on these machines and as a frequent city traveller,I have become accustomed to walking everywhere. So it was somewhat of a surprise to me that I found myself reluctant to part with my Segway at the end of the tour. Highly highly recommended. Thanks guys.

Segway experience around Budapest. My husband organised this Segway experience as a 50th Birthday Surprise .It was Fantastic!!!!Our tour guide Bridget was brilliant at making us feel at ease. We had a practise on the Segway before we were let loose around the streets of Budapest. We were given lots of history about the Monuments that we saw. We would recommend anyone to try this activity in Budapest! It actually made our visit special and I will always remember my 50 th because of this.If I can do it anyone can!!!! Thank you so much Bridget. Fantastic Experience

Great Experience and great tour guide. We went on our Segway tour on the 25th of February and we had the wonderful Frank as our tour guide.It was a great experience and way to explore Budapest, and the tour itself was very informative and interesting without being too much information. Despite the cold weather, we had a great time and would highly recommend the Segway tours and Frank as a tour guide!

Segway tours. Took a Segway tour with this firm. Well organised and an unrushed experience on well-kept equipment.The tour itself is less about the Segway riding than a bit of a history tour - although this could be more down to the individual guide. personally i would've preferred something a bit more fun than a school-type tour. It would also have been nice to been offered a photo opportunity of me and my partner. Admittedly we could have asked - but it wasn't until after the tour ended that we suddenly realised we didn't have any of us together.Overall though, a decent experience.

Such a great way to see the city. Took a Segway tour this afternoon and had a really wonderful time. Our tour guide, Brigit, was a real gem and was very flexible with the tour (as there were only two of us). She was both knowledgeable and passionate and this really came across, alongside being a lovely lady. Defeats are also massive fun too, so of your in Budapest give this company a go - you won't regret it.

Segway Tour of Budapest City. The experience was great. George was our tour guide and he has invaluable knowledge of the city and presented this is an interesting and humorous way. We were only in Budapest for 4 days and doing the Segway tour on our first morning was a great way to help us get our bearings, see the sights and decide our itinerary for the rest of the week.We particularly liked the parliament buildings and Szabadsag Ter. After the tour we sat in the office for around half an hour talking further with George about places to see as well as other staff members who all seemed lovely.We would have done the longer tour but unfortunately as we visited in February we were not able to. We would recommend wrapping up warm if it is a cold and windy day as it did get very cold! I wish I had have had a wind proof jacket and extra pair of socks!Thanks George, Pippa and Adam

Brilliant Budapest Segway Tour!. My husband and I did the Segway tour On Monday morning with Balint. It was one of the highlights of our visit to Budapest. Even though the weather was horrible, (it pretty much rained for all of the tour), Balint was so enthusiastic and friendly. He shared his detailed knowledge of his home city with us, and he was willing to answer the many questions I asked. His English was fantastic, even to the extent that he was able to joke in English. This was the first day of our holiday, and what a great start to the holiday it was.Many thanks Balint.

Great way to see Budapest. It was our first segway tour, but it won't be our last! The staff was very nice, and taught us well on how to ride.Budapest is a bit larger than most eastern european cities, so a segway tour is highly recommended. Our tour guide Rob spoke perfect english, and personalized the tour for our experience. You learn a bit of history, and see the important sites. One of the highlights of our trip.
Amazing . Just completed the Segway tour and it is the best way to see the city. Very very good value for money and our tour guide Bacint was awesome. He really made the experience.

Fantastic local knowledge. We had a fantastic tour with Frank the other day. It was fantastic to hear stories and facts about the city that you can't learn from Trip Advisor, only a local will do. Will definitely do one of the other tours should I return to the city! Note, make sure you bring plenty of warm clothes if you're doing an afternoon tour, it gets incredibly cold when the sun goes down.

Must do Segway tour!!. Great way to explore the city! We decided to do a Segway tour the first morning we were there. Tamas was our tour guide, he knew is stuff and took us to lots of interesting places. It was lots of fun but definitely wrap up in the winter months.

Lots of fun. TAMAS was great.....very knowledgeable....witty....very helpful and informative. Enjoyed it so much I will be trying it again...keep up the good work.....remember to wear warm clothes during the winter months....it's very annoying to have to worry about ignorant persons whom are not bright enough to know to dress warm in the cold. Otherwise great tour.

Wonderful Segway Tour. Though the weather was cold, we had a wonderful experience touring with our guide, George, who was so patient and friendly and offered us very interesting facts about the city. A very unique and amazing way to tour around Budapest!

Segway experience with a twist . We had a nice chilly tour today with George and it was thoroughly enjoyable. We watched others tour around on the Segways in Vienna so when we got to Budapest we decided to try it ourselves. It was a good history lesson and really fun riding a Segway for our first time. Highly recommend the company and George. Thanks guys!

recommended, great tour guide!. I had a segway tour beginning of January. The guys are very open and accomodating, the tour guide Adam is a great guide, he trained me very well about the segway and told me a lot of things about the city and the history of Hungary during the tour.

Great Segway tour. We booked a morning tour of Budapest and were pleased to find that as well as myself and my partner there was only one other person in the group.You start off with a 30 min training session right outside their office. We have been on segways before and only needed a refresher but the other member of the group was a little nervous being a complete beginner.Our Tour guide was Petra and she quickly put the other person at ease and soon had them zooming around. The segways are really easy to ride once you get the hang of them and are great fun!Then it was off to see the sites. The Basilica, The Holocaust Memorial, Parliament square, the river and the Synagogue.It is a two hour tour and Petra, our guide, was great: Friendly, knowledgeable and happy to help. At the end she made us all a cup of tea to help warm us up!This was a great way to see the city and a highlight of our trip. Tip: It is cold so wear gloves and wrap up warm.

Great bike tour!. I went on a bike tour of the city with my friend and it was great! We saw all the main attractions of the city. I would recommend doing the tour on your first day of a trip as we saw some places that we then returned to after the tour. The tour guide was friendly and knew a lot about the city. We had time to stop for a drink and cake too.

Cutest little bar!. This bar seems to have plenty on offer with the tours they have and food. We only came across this place on our way back to our accommodation and popped in for a last drink. The live music was great, the bar itself was so quirky and unique, the cocktails were perfect and I would definitely tell anyone to pop in if they are in the area in Budapest!

Segway tour was informative and lots of fun! Brigit was great!. My partner and I booked a 2.5-hour segway tour of Budapest through the Yellow Zebra website the day before we took the tour. The process was simple and they email your booking number straight through so you just quote your booking number when you get to their office.The morning of our tour was rainy and our guide, Brigit, kindly offered to reschedule if we wished but we decided to go ahead with the tour. Thankfully the rain cleared up soon after our training began. The rain meant it was only the two of us for the tour which was a bonus.Brigit took us to a number of sites around the city and we learned a lot from her about the history of Hungary and its landmarks. It was the perfect way to orientate ourselves with Budapest.We had lots of fun on the tour - riding segways is fun, but cold, so pack your ski gloves!I would definitely recommend this tour and Brigit. :)

Thank you!!!. It was a great tour, with an extremely charming, helpful and wit a lot of knowledge guide Cristina. She taught me to stand on Segway from zero in 15 minutes, and helped with every step during the trip. Thank you so much Cristina, we hope to see you soon again and have a Segway ride in Spring!

Fun time!. We really enjoyed our Segway tour with Kinga. We had a fun group of fellow travelers, and it's hard not to smile when you're riding a Segway. I will say, if you're doing the 3 hour Segway tour in the winter, wear triple the layers you think you'll need on your feet and hands. Since you're standing completely still for so long, you forget that you don't have the movement to keep circulation going in your extremities and your last hour might get miserable if you're distracted by cold. We got to see a lot of spots and learn some new facts about the city.

Segway tour with Frank. We had a morning tour with Frank and were lucky enough to have a private tour. Frank was absolutely amazing all throughout the tour and was truly knowledgeable and passionate about everything, giving us some great insight into Hungary and Budapest's intriguing history. Would highly recommend to anyone, our first try on Segways and a tour never to forget.

Segway tour with Tomas. The highlight of our trip to Budapest was our Yellow Zebra segway tour. Our guide, Tomas, was brilliant; a great combination of funny, engaging and knowledgeable. Thanks also to Vicky and the team for the lovely surprise when our tour concluded. Budapest itself was too beautiful to photograph during our short visit, so we'll definitely be returning and I look forward to another tour with Tomas and Yellow Zebra tours when we do.

Bicycle tour budapest. Full marks to the yellow zebra team for our tour. From the telephone talks to the actual tour this was a most organised affair ever. The booking was simple economical and well informed . The highlight however was our guide balint , who was well versed no doubt with his history but also full of quaint anecdotes from history and current events, taking a group of 5 Indians on a bicycle tour across the hot spots of Budapest through traffic and all could not be an easy job!! He made it look so , very patient and very amicable , through out. His knowledge on Hungarian history was a delight and all of us enjoyed the tour, all thanks to balint , highly recommend this organisation for their wonderful tours . Thank you balint and of course the yellow zebra team.Best wishes Rich
Very good trip. Had a very good time on the segways, git a very good taste of the cuty centre. Thomas was the greatest guide ever!

Splendid Segway. THIS is the way to see a walking city like Budapest. Tomas knows his subject WELL and kept the tour of Pest moving! He remained very safety-conscious throughout the 3 hour trip. I was very impressed with both Tomas' and the professionalism of Yellow Zebra.

Great Segway tour. Never used a Segway before, but would recommend it to anyone. Given good instrution to ensure safe use, felt very confident after this. Guide Ferenc was outstanding with his knowledge and friendly personality. Great service.

Best Tour in Budapest. Did the City Tour on Segway and absolutely loved it, we were a family of 4 and were in a tour of 5 with our wonderful guide Robert. He was so friendly and knowledgeable and this tour was the highlight of our weekend. We had a very good training session on the segways before tour and we did not venture out until Robert was sure we had mastered the art of Segway safely and we were comfortable the equipment and safety issues. We stopped on several occasions for photos and had a 10 min coffee break (which I loved) at a local Hungarian café. This was a great way to see this wonderful city and I felt I came away with so much information on Budapest from Robert that I would never have learned otherwise.A fantastic tour and a great experience for all my family.

Budapest Bike Tour. My friend and I ended up being the only 2 people on this tour, so it was kind of like a private tour and thankfully we had an awesome tour guide (Bogota)! Sightseeing in cities is always best done by bike and as we were riding with Bogota, it snowed for about 15 minutes which made the tour even more epic! Bogota took us to several different locations and gave us the perfect amount of historical information on each place. We were supposed to ride to the Buda side of the city, but it was cold and wet and Bogota was more than accommodating by granting our wish of going to the pub instead!! We wanted to see one of Budapest's ruin bars and she went out of her way to take us to such a cool one! That was one of the highlights of the trip! We then finished off the tour in a lovely café eating delicious strudel and drinking a tasty coffee. Thank you Bogota for such an interesting afternoon, you are an awesome person, we had alot of fun and will definitely do it all over again next time!

Fantastic tour - Great guide!. My husband and I felt immediately welcomed at the office, and comfortable with the segway thanks to the short training. The tour lasted 2 hours. If it's the cold season, think about wearing gloves and hat!Our guide Thomas paid a real attention to our safety and was really willing to adapt the tour to our expectations. His english was perfect and he knew a lot of interesting anecdotes. So he was really professional, but also kind and entertaining.The segway is really fun and easy to take in hand, it was a perfect way to discover the city! Moreover people drive carefully so we felt safe all the time.We highly recommend this company and especially Thomas.

Brilliant tour. Had a tour at the end of November and had a brilliant time. We had a guide called Ferenc who was really nice and very informative. He was able to tailor the tour to what we were interested in so he was never boring! The segways were easy to ride and the whole tour was very relaxed. We never felt rushed and had plenty of time to play with the segway while exploring the city. Thanks for a brilliant time.

5 star trip 👍👍👍. I went with my friend on Monday 30th November and had a great guide called Frank. The tour was great, very informative, relaxed. There were 4 of us in total on the 2 hour trip.We had proper training given beforehand and then we visited all the main sites and were given really good information. Do it it's well worth it.

yellow zebra - fantastic. i wad in budapest and i reserved a bike tour woth yellow zebra. the guide (ferenc) was an extremely nice guy, gave us a lot of info about the city history. he made the whole trip really fun and enjoyable. i highly recommend him and yellow zebra
Segway was great. Fantastic tour with Karel - careful induction and expert knowledge of city. Be sure to include this on your list of must dos in Budapest

Exceptionally Good Tour. When my husband and I arrived at the office we were made to feel very welcome by everyone there and although we have ridden Segways on many occasions we were taken through the full safety and training procedures, for which we were very grateful. Safety was taken very seriously. Our guide, Thomas, was fantastic. His knowledge and passion for the history of Budapest is second to none and he really brought it all to life for us. He even gave us a quiz with a prize for the person with the most points at the end! Thank you Thomas for a very interesting and fun tour. I would thoroughly recommend both the company and Thomas as a guide.

Segways were brilliant - tour guide was not.. We booked onto the segway tour as we thought we would see a lot more of Budapest this way then being on two feet. As we have travelled on segways before we thought we'd have lots of fun, and be able to see Budapest. However, the tour guide was a huge let down. There were two incidents which stood out during the two and a half hour tour. One was that during one trip through the Christmas market, one of the other members of our tour fell off his Segway and our tour guide didn't realise until members of the public alerted him. As we were in a busy market place this could be understandable however as an experienced tour guide you would think he would have noticed that a member of his group had injured themselves. He did eventually come back to help that person up, but by then the damage was done. Later on as we were crossing a busy road, another member of the tour had a problem with her Segway, which caused it to shut down. He had told us about this and had said to dismount the Segway and hold on to it. However as we were halfway across the road at the time assistance should have been available. When I saw this happen I tried to quickly turn around to help her and nearly fell off my own Segway. We managed to get the Segway next to the curb but couldn't pull it up as the wheels had locked. By this point the traffic had started up again, so I couldn't cross the road to try and tell the guide what had happened. My friend in front of me, meanwhile had seen what had happened and was trying to chase down the tour guide to tell him to go back. By that point he was about 300 yards up the next road. He'd carried on on his bike completely oblivious to what had happened behind him. As we were on a busy road at the time, this was totally unacceptable. We could have been in a dangerous situation and the tour guide would not have been able to get back to us quickly enough.I have been on a segway tour with another company in another city and not once did I feel unsafe. On this tour I felt that the tour guide was in his own world and didn't seem to be paying attention to where we were behind him. There were times when I was at the back of the group and couldn't even see him. There were other times when we had to wait on one side of the road (as we couldn't cross due to a red light) and he had disappeared on the other side!! I've never felt so unsafe as part of a group, and seeing as there were only six of us it shouldn't have been that hard to keep checking that we were all together and following behind him. Although I enjoyed seeing all the sights of Budapest, I would never want to go on a tour with this company again as I would like to feel that the tour guide was at least aware of what I and others around me were doing. On an unrelated note, I would also recommend trying to find a way to let us take photos of the sights. We were only able to get off the segways at two points in the tour, and I would have loved being able to take photos of the different sights.
Fun in the Rain! . Riding segways in Budapest in November Rain turned out to be a great adventure with our great guide, Ferenc. Highly recomendable.

Segways are awesome. Looking like a dork, rolling around Budapest is the way to go. You have a great time and learn a lot. It's very high level and you get to see a lot of the city without walking miles. I'd recommend it for everyone. A great, great first stop. Also, the building that houses this tour group is unforgettable.

Love love love Segways!!. We had a fabulous morning whizzing around Budapest with the lovely Anita. Segways are great fun and ideal for seeing the city. Taking in all the big sights and learning about the history of Budapest. Anita told great little storirs and really put things in perspective from the building of the Opera house to the amount of gold used in the parliament building and the queue when McDonald's first arrived. Really fun morning. Definitely recommend, especially as it's ideal to help you get your bearings :)

Travels with Ferenc!. It was hard to imagine what a 3 hour Segway tour of Budapest would be like but now that I've done it, I would recommend it to anyone-especially with Ferenc. Professional but highly personable, he made he 3 hours fascinating. I have never had a vacation where I've learned so much and it is all because of Ferenc's wealth of knowledge and his enthusiasm and love for his country. We really had fun! We received excellent instructions on how to ride the Segway, even though we'd used them before and Ferenc kept a close watch for us and our safety. It was an incredible tour and we recommend it very highly.
Awesome way to see budapest! . Just did 3 hrs with yellow zebra bike tours. Great way to see budapest! Our guide robbie was excellent! Highly recommend!

Segway tour. A group of 5 friends went on a segway tour with Balint. He was excellent and more informative than the Hop on, Hop off bus tour that we had done the day before. A highly recommended way to see this beautiful city.

Informative and friendly. The team were very helpful, especially our guide, Victor. A practical lesson straight-off and then the tour begins. Centrally located office. Given opportunities to have time on our own on the Segway (which we love!) to "race" around. A fun way to see a beautiful city.

Great tour! Highly recommend! . At first I was very scared of the Segway but at the beginning they teach you how to ride and really make sure you are comfortable with being on the segway. Budapest is very rich in history. I learned quite a lot during this tour and it was not boring thanks to our wonderful tour guide Anita! I highly recommend this Segway tour it's fun and informative.

Fun Segway experience. I really enjoyed my Segway tour in Budapest. It was raining a little but Balint still made it fun and informative. Segways are so much fun to ride and you see so much more than just walking around. I'd do it again in a minute. Thanks, Balint.

You need to try the Segway Tour. We tried our first Segway tour as a family and it was a great way to try something new and see the city in a unique way. Our guide was very informative and a great segway instructor. I will now try Segway tours when travelling where possible. This was the highlight from my trip in Budapest and I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Brilliant way to see the city. We decided to book this tour and it was fantastic! It just so happened that it was just me and my husband in the group so it felt more personal. We saw parts of Budapest that we wouldn't have seen on the tour bus so we are so glad we did it! Adrianne (hope i got the name right) was our guide and she was very knowledgeable, we couldn't have had anyone better..she gave us tips on places to go and eat in after the tour, let us have a break and some Hungarian street food whilst on our tour and also had hot tea ready for us when we got back..she was great! It was one of the best things we did whilst being out there! Ps once u get the hang of how to ride the segway, its a piece of cake.

Segway my beloved. Yellow Zebra. This is an amazing street adventure. I recommend for all adults. If you can stand and walk the streets of Budapest, you can Segway them. I took the tour of Pest with Tomas. An amazing guy. Makes the trips fun, exciting and educational. There should be a surcharge to book with this guy. Went again along the Buda castle. Segway makes it but no Tomas. Big points to yellow zebra for the hassle free bike rental too and all the advice. Plus you'll should get marketing kicks from Segway because I will be buying one now. Lol, I think Tomas sold it to me.

Good value for money. My boyfriend and I recently went on the bike tour with Petra. We ended up being the only two on the tour, so it was a little more personal. The bike seats were very comfortable and nice to ride. She was so informative and even changed the route because it started raining in the middle of it. We finished the rest of the tour after a short break for strudel and saw all the major places you'd want to see in Budapest. Well worth the money.

Great way to experience the sights. We took the bike tour of city and out to Szentendre with Bogata. The bikes were in good condition and comfortable to ride for the several miles we put in for the day. We stopped at various places around the city before venturing further. I was impressed by Bogata's knowledge and friendly nature, she helped make the day very enjoyable and looked after us. We had plenty of opportunities and reasons to stop for photos and I particularly loved Margaret Island, how could you not!Great langos in Szentendre and then some time to explore for ourselves was lovely, we found a very relaxed pub for a beer in the garden out the back, lavendar ice cream, plenty of souvenir shops and a very relaxed and social vibe. We then took the river boat to cruise back to Budapest so got to see things from a new aspect. Overall it was a very enjoyable day and I'd always recommend bike travel to see a city...and especially one with little altitude like Budapest!

Brilliant fun. Just got back from the two hour Segway tour - brilliant fun. Amazingly easy to use and a fantastic way of seeing Budapest particularly Margaret island. Group of six taken out by guide with a fifteen minute instruction first. For the next forty minutes or so speed was limited to 5 kph after that limit removed so you could do 20 kph. Tour guide was knowledgable about Budapest but also responsible in the way he lead the group. Highlight had to be Margaret island, beautiful at this time of year and n easy way of having a quick view of dancing fountains, Japanese garden and the general area.

2 hour Segway tour. Our tour guide George was fab! We opted for small group tour (4 of us) for 2 hours. George ensured we were all confident before setting out on the tour. We really had a fun time and would definitely recommend George as a guide :)

Well worth it!. My friend and I took a 3hr Segway tour last month and we loved every single minute! I'd never ridden a Segway before but our instructor, Adrienn, was so patient and kind - she made sure everyone in our group was comfortable with the machines before we headed off. The tour of Budapest was great and Adrienn was very informative, telling us all about the history of this beautiful city. Our hotel was based right by the Danube and it only took us about 10/15 mins to walk (casual stroll) to the opera house to reach the Segway tour offices. Would highly recommend it as a way to see the sights - we even became an attraction ourselves to some Japanese tourists who wanted to take our photos lol. Wonderful city, great tour guide, great way to spend a few hours. Many thanks so much Yellow Zebra!
A great way to enjoy the city. We had the best time during the bike tour throughout Budapest! Balint was a great tour guide and helped us to understand Hungary history!

Super Bike Tour and Guide. Really super tour. Exactly 4 hours of cycling around and getting an introduction to this fabulous city. It's a good way to orient yourself, and marking out the places you would like to see in more depth.The tour takes you north to Hero's Square, and then back south to cycle along the banks of the Danube in Buda.Ferenc was a very knowledgeable guide, who is obviously interested in the culture and history of Budapest and Hungary, and this comes across well in his commentary.For me it was a good mix of easy cycling and tour stops.Really recommend to do on your first day.

Recommend. We went for Yellow Zebra based on feedback from other members and did the 4 hour tour of Budapest by bike. We were pleased with the tour. George (pronounced Dijorge) did a pleasant job of guiding us around the city. His passion and knowledge of Hungarian history was remarkable and was willing to answer any questions which a few were thrown at him. He did not hesitate nor shy away from explaining the bad part of the Hungarian history and threw in some of his views which was refreshing especially being a local guide. Sometimes local guides tend to focus on the good things...not George.The tour also provided a stop at a cafe/restaurant where we had coffee and snack which is free and included in the tour. All in all we recommend Yellow Zebra and George as a tour guide. The only negative thing I will point out is sometimes George may forget to look back to check to make sure no one is falling behind as he goes from site to site but not really an issue to be honest. Price: 10/10 (we got it slightly cheaper by booking via an affiliate called Absolute Tours).Enjoyment: 9/10 Guide: 9/10Recommend: Yes and ask for George

What a blast!. My friends and I took the 2 hour Segway tour which covered most of the pest side of the city, and we had so much fun! Our guide, Adam, was knowledgable and such a good guy! This is the only way to really see the city, and it is particularly good if your time is limited. You cover a lot of ground!!
Great experience. Absolute must do in budapest..Takes you around the pest areaKinga our guide and instructor was a darling ladyIt is recommended to do this at the beginning of visit to Prague

Excellent tour, for all abilities. Fantastic and easy way to get an idea of the city layout and places to visit.The guide takes you to the main tourist locations and provides thehistory needed,Much better than a walking tour as you cover a lot more of the city.Bikes have 3 gears as you don't need anymoreGreat priceGive it ago and have some fun.
A fun tour. We had a great tour with George. We were surprised how much we travelled and saw in the two hours of the tour. A great way to see The Pest side of the city.

Easier than you think!. My wife and I recently did a Segway tour with Yellow Zebra. As luck would have it, we were the only people that booked at that particular time and had basically a private tour with Brigit. We spent the first 5 or 10 minutes getting used to the Segways. 15 minutes later we felt like old pros. The tour is a fast and fun way of seeing Pest. Brigit did a good job of educating us on Hungarian history. In the spirit of full disclosure, after two and a half hours of being on a Segway, you are pretty tired. It doesn't look like you're doing anything, but standing and balancing still wears you out. That said, we had a blast and would do it again!

Alternative and fun way to see the sights of Budapest. After a short training on how to use the Segways for those that have not used them before we set off on a tour of Budapest. Using the Segways is not only a fun way to get around but also allowed us to see lots of the main sights in a short space of time.Highly recommended especially for those with a short time to see Budapest. Our guide was really knowledgeable and funny. In the colder months remember to bring gloves for your Segway ride!

Anita was great! Best city tour EVER!. It was mine and my partners first time in Budapest and his birthday, so I wanted to do something special- and this certainly was!We had limited time in the city and I wanted to make sure we didn't miss any of the key bits. As it was a special trip I booked the private (one-on-one) segway tour, lasting 2 hours. As you can appreciate it was more expensive but it was DEFINITELY worth every penny. We were very early but sat in a lovely coffee shop- also adjacent to the opera house- and had a 'pick me up' before first time Segwaying (is that even a word??). Our tour guide, Anita, was great!!It was my first time on a Segway and Russell hadn't done it for years. We had a great tutorial and then headed off. I was a chilly day but the excitement of using the segway in between stops helped you forget about it. We saw all the main sites and Anita told us funny little stories and anecdotes as we went. On her advise we took in the panoramic views of the city atop the St Stephens Basilica- a must do!So thank you Yellow Zebra Tours and, most importantly, Anita. It really was a great introduction to a beautiful city!

Yellow zebra Segway @ Budapest . Wow:) our first Segway and what a fun!! Must try for a city tour of St least 2 hours. A great fun act!! Our guide balint was cool guy. Despite slight showers, he was never disinterested!!!

Segway tour. Riding on a Segway is something my wife has always wanted to do, so when I saw that we could do this whilst visiting Budapest we booked on line for Tuesday afternoon 13th October.When we arrived we where introduced to our guide Tomaz who was just top class from start to finish. Once we had done the safety bit and learnt the basics of the Segway (15 mins) don't know if this is normal but we just found riding the Seway very simple.The tour took around 2 1/2 hours and we covered all of the major sights in that time. Tomaz new his stuff a mixture of facts, history and humour is a winning combination, we even had time for just playing around On the Segway. But all this fun had to end and we arrived back at the office, even then Tomaz was keen to make sure we had no further questions.I would highly recommend this as a great fun way to seeing the sights and my wife was grinning for days and even started to look at buying a Segway on line, wish me luck.

Fun Time. Our tour guide George spend time orienting us with the Segways and spent time with each of us individually. After we had a feel for travelling on the Segways we were off on our tour. George gave a great tour and commentary. Being on the Segway gave us the opportunity to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time.

Great tour. I have taken thos tour twice, it is a very nice way to see the city. Our guide this last time was Anita, she speaks english very well, and tellsyou everything you want to know about the historic monuments and places in a very intereating way, it was great, highly recommended
Budapest by Seqway. Budapest Segway tour with our guide Balint was the best yet. If you select a Budapest Segway tour, this is your best choice as their overall quality was well above expectations.

Great guide, great tour!. Highly recommend the late evening tour, as the buildings look magical lit up, as does the Danube. Very informative tour, extremely knowledgeable guide - Balant, Learnt a lot about Budapest and had a great time. Glen
super guide. a good tour begins with a good guidethank you Bernadett, the only disadvantage was that the coffee stop at the end, they need to find some other place in the middle of the tour

A must!. Take the chance to have fun and at the same time learn some history. With excellent guides, speaking good English, and the Segway managing the transport you simply can't complain. It was a very nice and interesting trip with our guide Balint.
Good tour. Great way to see and learn about the city. Our guide, Adam was freindly, knowledgeable and helpful. Traffic was challenging at times and review of route is indicated.

Best Segway Tour so far and best way to see Budapest!. We booked this Segway Tour online before arriving in Budapest having been on previous tours in Prague as well as Nice and Berlin (with other companies). Booking was very easy and directions to the meeting point good. Although we had been on Segways before the guide took time to ensure all were competent before setting off on what was the best tour we have experienced. There was one person who had not been on a Segway before and he took time to reassure and encourage her and by the end she was as good as any of us!.We went for the superior tour that lasted over 3 hours but was very interesting and fun. Our guide, Laszlo was really informative, enthusiastic and relaxed giving us plenty of opportunity to experience the joys of the Segway. Being able to zoom around Heroes Square was wonderful.After 20 minutes the speed limiters were off yet all were fully in control and enjoyed probably the best way to see this beautiful City. I would strongly recommend this tour and this Company. We did see other "Segway" tours but they were not using proper Segways (they had Chunky Wheels) and some did not provide helmets, which is not something you want!Overall this tour made our visit and many thanks to Laszlo who clearly loves his country and this came across in his guidance, many thanks from the people from Scotland as our accents were a challenge. Overall rating is Excellent.

Adam is the best!. I visited in the yellow zebra to have a segway ride. Adam was my instractor he was the best!!! He will answer any question you have! Great guy thank you a lot adam we love you!! Yaniv and yuval

Cycling Magyar style. Yellow Zebra is conveniently located just around the corner from my hotel (K&K Opera), so it was an easy walk. I booked ahead to rent a bike for a couple of hours and so happy I did. There's a large selection of bikes, all sizes, with locks and helmets available. One of the best ways to see Budapest, an extremely bike-friendly city. The majority of all the city roads have clearly-marked dedicated bike lanes (something that ALL cities should have). I felt perfectly safe and would commend this activity to anyone who wants to see Budapest up close.

BIG THUMBS UP. This is only my second review on trip advisor and I've felt that I have to write a review for this! Me and a friend really wanted to try out Segways whilst in Budapest. The reviews on trip advisor were all really positive so we went with it. We turned up Sunday afternoon and got a space on the evening slot which started at 6pm.18,000 huf per person for 2 hours + 30 minute training. Works out about £40 roughly. We were greeted by Adam, who honestly made the whole experience amazing. Intelligent, friendly and welcoming with a solid knowledge of the city. The training Segway was difficult to use and we were a little unsure at first with how easy they were gonna be to use but once you're on the real ones they're surprisingly easy to use! Once you get the feelers it's quite natural. There were only 4 of us on the evening tour but this made it more intimate and I personally found it so enjoyable. We were so happy to have chosen the evening slot because the city looks stunning at sunset. So picturesque. My only regret is that we didn't rent Segways on our first day in the city as it is an amazing way to see the sites in a short amount of time and it's a real value for money. We visited all the big landmarks, stopped a few times at key areas and Adam told us facts and stories about the city. Would genuinely recommend doing this to anyone and everyone. My first ever Segway tour and I'll 1000% be doing this in other cities. Such a good experience, a lot of fun, good value for money and the high ratings are deserved. Seriously ended our visit on a high!

Great way to get a feel for the city and its layout. We had a Yello Zebra private cycle tour of Budapest booked for our first afternoon ithere, having arrived at lunchtime. It was wet and grey much like home! Despite the weather we had a great time and we saw parts of Budapest we wouldn't have got to otherwise as we had only a long weekend there. Christina our guide was lovely and gave us a lot of information about the history of monuments and buildings and the history of Budapest which was fascinating and really helped us to appreciate the beauty of Budapest. Great city and despite busy traffic this tour is interesting and a lot of fun.

The best way to see Budapest by far. We absolutely loved cycling aound the beautiful city of Budpest on these superb bikes. We couldn't believe how cheap and easy it was to hire the bikes. The staff were extremely helpful and I couldn't recommend this experience more, brilliant fun!!!

Great tour. We did the 4 hour bike tour with Adam and it was fantastic. Adam was very knowledgeable and an excellent guide. Since it was on bikes, we got to see a lot more of the city than we would by walking or Segway so it's an excellent introduction to the city. I'd recommend this to anyone that can ride a bike.

Budapest to szentendre cycle. small tour just the two of us and our guide boga'ta started off with a short cycle from the office to parliment building for a look around , went via freedom square which we visited the next day . after this continued to Margaret island which is lovely , loads of places to stop at and things to see , boga'ta knew about them all , down to the river bank with small cafes and resturaunts along the way , great cycling along the path and through the woods , we arrived early which gave us plenty of free time to look around , what a beautiful place it was , well worth the cycle to get here , coffee and marzipan then the ferry home , great day out with a superb guide .

Best tour I've been on in my 6 week holiday in Europe . I enjoyed a bike tour through Budapest with yellow zebra and it was by far the best tour as such I've been on in Europe during my 6 weeks visiting 11 countries. The guide was Brigit and she was excellent! Not only did she know what seemed like everything about Budapests history, and even current events, she was approachable, friendly, always checking on peoples safety (as a few where unsure on the bike) and did it all with a smile. She was obviously very passionate about her job and Budapest. She suggested a route we take to see the sights, but was happy to be flexible if we wanted to see something different. I couldn't speak more highly of her as a guide and would encourage others to do a tour

Første Segwaytour, verdt pengene!. I´m living in Budapest for a short period of time, and had a friend over to visit. We wanted to do something fun together, while at the same time see the city and we figured segway as the best choice. It was expensive, but well worth the money.We had a nighttour, which is the best kind in Budapest because this city is famous for its lights during nighttime. Simply stunning. Our guide Adam I truly recomend, great guide full of knowledge and intrest of the city, and also great at teaching segway. It was not difficult to learn and by the end it felt like we´d been doing it for a long time. You got to see everypart of the city, and you can also ask to stop when you want to and ask questions. Staff was super friendly and helpful, rainponcohes are provided if the weather is bad.Truly recomend it if you want something fun to do!!

Brilliant. Just brilliant.. First day in any city you should have a bicycle tour to find out a bit of history and where to go back to. This was awesome: well informed guide and city recommendations were stunning.

Fabulous way to see Budapest. We booked an early Segway tour of Budapest on our first full day. We have taken city tours by Segway in other cities. This a great way to get a comprehensive look at the city. Learning to navigate a Segway only takes a few minutes. We started with the Opera House, over to St. Stephens, the Parliament, Hero Square, around to the Danube. So much Fun!! Highly recommend this to everyone. Our guide was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the city.

Great Introduction to Budapest. We booked the tour for Tuesday but got the time wrong and mixed the tour. No problem the lady said just turn up tomorrow at 11 am- so we did.There were about 16 in the group and it was the 4 hr with strudel and coffee tour.Lovely day in Budapest for cycling not too hot.The staff were very good at setting the height of the saddle and showing how to operate the gears (but you really don't need to use the gears).The tour took us past all the major attractions but we did not go into any. It gives you a wonderful introduction to the modern history and also the ancient history of the city.The ride was very gentle but you do go along some of the major boulevards and streets which can be a bit tricky but the tour leader was excellent in managing this part of the tour.We stopped for a strudel and coffee (incl) and by the end of the 4 hours we had covered all the major sites (except the Jewish quarter).I real recommend this tour to anyone looking for a relaxing and informative guide through this beautiful city.

Best Idea I had. I booked the 9:30am tour the first morning after I arrived. Bernadette was our guide for 8 people. I am 60 years old and reasonably athletic. Our group was from 35-65 years old. It took 15-20 minutes to get accustomed to the Segway. I hadn't used one in a couple of years. Good instruction by the staff and by the time we were home 3 1/2 hours later, we were all Pros. We were able to visit many places because one can cover a LOT of ground on a Segway. We rode on curbs, the bike lanes in the street and went crazy around Hero Square. I am zipping around the walking Tour groups at about 20 mph and having a ball. "Detti" was great and I will do a Segway Tour my first morning in any City I visit from now on. We started at the OPera House and went all the way on the other side of City park stopping along the way. From there we went all the way back to the Danube and back up to the OPera House. We were gone for 3 1/2 hours and I enjoyed every second.

Site-seeing by bike with nice guide. Due to a festival in the city we couldn't reach all the hot spots. Together with the guide we planned the tour, we wanted to visit the citadel and climbed there by bike. Lots of information and room for jokes.

Great way to orientate yourself with the sights . Had a great afternoon cycling around the city with Brigit. It was great to hear a bit of the history and significance of certain sights from someone who is very knowledgeable and proud of their country. The included coffee break was a real treat too. This tour is a fantastic introduction to the city and highly recommended.
BUDAPEST SEGWAY. Our family of 4 age range 22-50 Just finished a Segway tour with Tamas, excellent guide with lots of knowledge and facts! Highly recommend with no age restrictions! köszönöm Tamas!!
Decent price nice staff. If you bring a voucher from cycle cities website then you get 20% discount. Polite staff and good quality bikes

Fun way to Tour. Our guide Bernadette was knowledgeable and fun. The Segways were high quality, and we found them easy to operate. We received a few minutes of instruction and practice before heading out. We enjoyed learning history along with viewing the sights. our Segway tour was a nice introduction to the city.

Segway Tour - great way to see the city in a short space of time. We did the morning Segway tour and had great fun! We had a little practice session at the beginning to get used to riding the Segway (really surprisingly easy to ride), and then our guide led us out through the city, making stops at all the important places to tell us more about them. He was a local and very knowledgeable and friendly - he knew a lot about Hungarian history and told us loads of interesting stories. We saw a lot in a short space of time, but didn't feel rushed because the Segways made it easy to get around and were quite speedy. Would highly recommend for anyone who wants an introduction to Budapest.

Best way to see the city.. Just behind the State Opera, this is a very friendly outfit which also doubles as a secondhand English bookshop.Budapest is a surprisingly cycle-friendly city and we hired bikes on two of our three days to pootle about visiting the places we'd identified as worth checking out. The great thing about the bike was that if it turned out to be disappointing you would soon be at the next place of interest.Only criticism was that if you get a puncture you're stuffed: you'd have to walk back! Also there were no lights offered even though the day hire was until well after dark.

A fun way to see Budapest . We considered a bike or walking tour around the city, yet we chose to do the Segway tour instead as neither of us had used one before and they looked like great fun. We chose to do the 2 1/2 hour tour which includes an introductory training session on how to use the Segway. The members of staff conducting the training were extremely helpful and patient and ensured everyone felt comfortable using the Segways before the tour began. Our tour proved a great way to see the city in one morning due to the abundance of sights that we passed and gave good insight into attractions we may have wanted to revisit, which we did throughout our trip. We covered a lot of the main attractions of Budapest during our Segway tour and we were provided with information from our guide surrounding the significance of each attraction to the city. Our guide Balint was great fun and taught us about the history of Budapest in a way which made us want to know more. During the tour, and after the tour had finished, he provided us with more information (location of ruin pubs, good restaurants and places that are popular with locals) which was also very useful.Overall, the Segway tour was a great way to see the main attractions of Budapest and we would recommend this tour at the beginning of a trip to Budapest as it allows you to decide what attractions you want to revisit. Additionally, if you have never used a Segway before then it is a fun way to explore a new city.

Segway Visit. We were two french women last thursday to visit Budapes on Segway with guide George. This was really good and very very friendly. a visit to recommend. George is a very nice person and the visit was really nice. An adress to recommend. The hot tea at the end was very much appreciated!!!! many thanks!! Nathalie and Martine

Great way to see Budapest. My husband and I were a little unsure about doing a segway tour as we had never done this before. Balint was our guide and he made us feel very comfortable right from the start. Once our nerves had subsided it was the best tour ever Balint was a great guide and very knowledgeable we saw and learnt alot about Budapest that we would not have seen on foot.Highly reccomend the three hour tour.thanks Balint for making the start of our visit to Budapest a memoriable one and for your reccomendations to resturants and sights.

Best way to see the city. Great and interesting tour saw much more than I would have thought. The tour guide was very interesting and kept everyone entertained with interesting stories of Budapest and Hungary. Can't fault anything about the tour it was set at a nice easy pace for cycling very relaxed. Learned lots about Hungary in such a short time and it was so so interesting. The city is very beautiful and we saw much more than would of been possible on foot or by a coach tour! Word highly recommend. If your struggling to find it it's located behind the Opera House.

Great value bike hire. Rented a bike for a day's sightseeing in Budapest. They offer a guided tour too, but I opted to simply hire the bike and go my own way - but the choice is yours. Thought they were outstanding value, it's a great central location and the staff are helpful and friendly (even when I changed my mind from booking and paying for the tour, to just going it alone!). The bike is basic - only a three-speed sit-up-and-beg, but it's perfect for zooming round Budapest and taking in the sights, and it's a bargain price too. I was served by a lady named Viki who was very helpful. I hadn't booked ahead - just called in on the off-chance, but was soon set up and on my way in no time. Oh and you can pay by the hour if you only want to rent for a short period, or by the day, or even overnight, so there are very flexible options to suit anyone's plans. There's wifi at their offices too. All in all, wouldn't hesitate to recommend these guys. It's a fun, economical and great way to see the city. Do it!

Great segway tour in Budapest. Nice overview of Budapest by Segway - we had a small group (6) which was very manageable. Our guide, Balint, was very friendly and knowledgeable - his English was perfect -

Great, fun bike tour. My husband and I really enjoy taking bike tours of new cities, and this one certainly didn't disappoint! It's such a wonderful and efficient way to get oriented to a new place. Adrienn was our guide of a group of 6 people. She was very knowledgable about Hungarian history and quite personable. We really appreciated her flexibility when we came across a festival and she changed our itinerary so we could walk around and enjoy the local flavor of Budapest. We got to sample some great food! The sights and pace were good for learning new information. Would definitely recommend.

Excellent 3 hour Segway tour. Just had an excellent 3 hour Segway tour of wonderful Budapest with Yellow Zebra Segway Tours. Loads of fascinating history and fantastic architecture. The guide, Balint, was excellent. He really knew his history, put it across extremely well, was not overpowering with silly jokes and generally made it really worth while. Had loads of fun and learnt a lot.

Great tour and good history of Budapest. Booked the 3 hour tour with Balint on Segways. First 2 hours around all the main attractions but only on the Pest side. You do however go down to the embankment and great view of Buda and all the buildings explained so no loss. A lot of history on this tour which was great. After dropping some guests off, headed up to Hero's square, baths and park so more time playing and covering distances on the Segways for the third hour.Great knowledge by Balint, really knew his history and city. Would recommend to anyone wishing to know more about Budapest.

Good tour of Pest. This was a good tour of the Pest side of Budapest. Our tour guide Balint was a good tour guide. However due to the large distances covered in the tour we didn't really get chance to chat to our guide as we have on other tours. Please note, on the three hour tour you will have to ride on cycle lanes on a busy road. This can be intimidating for some! Balint was a great help after the tour by pointing out some fun things to do in Budapest such as Hungarian restaurants, Ruin Pubs and more.

Amazing and worth every penny . Was easy to book and the email received after was very quick and had clear instructions as to where to meet.Tour guide (Adriene) was amazing so friendly and delivered loads of information made the tour really interesting. Stopped for struddle and refreshments before the end at a lovely cafe.After the tour Adriene also answered all our questions about different bars and places to eat.A brilliant way to spend a morning.

Best Segway tour in Budapest!!. I absolutely loved everything about Yellow Zebra! The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful and George, our tour guide, was so knowledgable about Budapest and it's history not to mention he also has an amazing sense of humor. I highly recommend everyone to go to Yellow Zebra and take the three hour tour its absolutely worth every penny! If I find myself in Budapest again I would go to Yellow Zebra again!

Very Good Tour with Balint. Booked last-minute in person and they combined me with a group of 6-7, with two guides. Balint recognized we had different interests and split us back up - the group was more interested in playing on the Segways so Balint took me on an individual tour. Despite the rain, he was happy to take me on the full tour and answer all my questions. Helped me to get to where I wanted to go after the tour ended and even gave me a bus ticket so I wasn't fumbling around with change. Great guide. Thanks, Balint!

Excellent bike tour!. We did the morning bike tour with Peter. We actually were the only people to show up so we ended up having a private tour which was even better. Peter was a great guide - he is very knowledgable about Budapest and its history. The tour gave us a really good overview of the city. The biking in Budapest can be a bit scarier than other places (we've done bike tours in Amsterdam and Munich as well) just because the city isn't as well designed for biking but Peter did a great job looking out for us and making us feel safe. We stopped at a cafe near the end and had delicious Hungarian pastries and coffee (included in your tour price). We highly recommend yellow zebra to anyone visiting Budapest!

Fantastic Segway tour. Our tour guide Balint showed us a fantastic time, he was charming, funny and informative and was able to take great photos for all of us. He taught us with ease how to ride the segways and I would definitely recommend a Segway tour with Balint to anyone
don't miss !. great way to discover the city , our guide Balint who spoke very good English is native from the city, he likes to share tales and adresses . i recommend big time!

Excellent Guide Made Budapest and Segways Fun!. This was our first time on Segways, and we had such a wonderful time with our guide. Even with a larger group (about 10 of us), we had individual instruction in the beginning, and enjoyed a young-person's perspective of Budapest. We had booked on Expedia, who offered only a 2 hour tour. The rest of the group had booked a 3 hour tour. For only 14 euros more per person, we upgraded to the 3 hour tour. Would consider booking directly, since the rates seemed lower than what we paid with Expedia. Great way to explore the city! We zipped by in the bike lanes, and had lots of fun going around Hero's Square. Would definitely recommend!
Segway fun. Our tour guide, Adam, was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. A lot of fun. Highly recommend the segway tour as a nice way to see Budapest.

Awesome cycle tour. . Friendly and articulate tour guide called Lazlo took us round the buda side of the city with a bit of time over in pest. Helpful, knowledgeable and accommodating he tailored the route to take in things that we wanted to see specifically. Good balance of local knowledge, ancient and recent history and some great sites. Highly recommended. Easy pace and the whole thing takes about 3 hours. Best to do the 5pm slot to see the sun set and avoid the mid 30's daytime temperature. City looks better in the sunset anyway.

Fun, thorough bike tour. The four-hour day bike tour was fun and very thorough. We hit all the main highlights of the city. I joined the tour on my first day in the city, so I felt like I got a good overview of everything, as well as a taste of places I might want to visit again later. Our tour guide, Viktor, provided interesting details about everything and even make historic events come alive by weaving in some stories about how they affected members of his family. The strudel shop we stopped at had tasty pastries.

Excellent bicycle tour. Had a terrific bicycle tour through Budapest. Our guide Adam spoke great English, was very knowledgeable, and being Hungarian himself was able to give a very realistic and interesting tour, not just the stuff of history books.Bikes were recent models and well maintained and the optional helmets were clean and fresh.

Thank you!. Brilliant time was totally worth the money and would recommend this too anyone. We had a great day, Probably my best day here so far!Our tour guide was AMAZING and taught me alot about the country and great places to visit. She was polite and able to hold a convosation and I ended up with abit of a crush on Bernaudett she was brill.Thank you Yellow zebra for my amazing experience in Budapest.

Segway Tour in the City. It was my family"s first experience to try the Segway. We were riding through Budapest from the Heroes Plaza to the Margaret Island to the Parlament. Our tour guy was so friendly and informative abaut the City.Highly recommended .... Thank you Balint !!

1/2 day biking tour of city of Budapest. Perfect way to see Budapest! Bridget was our guide; if you can request her. She had interesting stories as well as a great handle on the history. Bikes were excellent.Definitely a highlight of our stay!!g

Thanks Vicki! . Vicki was such a kind, helpful, and understanding attendant. She was well informed about the city and quickly gave us valued recommendations. Renting bikes in Budapest is a must, and this was the cheapest and most accommodating place we could find.
Excellent Segway Tour and Guide in Budapest. Great way to see the City. Even better was the fantastic, in-depth knowledge of our Guide, Balint. Can thoroughly recommend!

Great way to see Budapest . This was the first thing we did after checking into our hotel. It was the best decision we made as we saw all the major landmarks and got our bearings before spending the rest of the weekend in Budapest. Budapest is a big city so it's a great way to see everything without having to get public transport. It was a four hour ride but really easy for someone who hasn't cycled since she was a kid! Our tour guide, Bala'zs was fantastic and very knowledgeable. A must do!

Great way to see the city. Great tour guide, great tour, great way to get to know the place - we went on the first day and it helped us decided what to do for the rest of the holiday. Segways are easy to use and also a lot of fun!

Sedgway budapest great guide made it interesting and fun. First time Segway tour for us, we went with another couple who had been before. Our guide Tomas was the best, his knowledge of Budapest was fantastic. There was not one question we asked he could not answer and in great detail. He knows his history and everything about budapest. He made it a very enjoyable tour and also he was always preparing us for what was ahead , either sites or traffic and what to look out for . Totally recommend Tomas as number one tour guide.

Great trip in awesome atmosphere. we want to make a city tour in Budapest and found yellow Zebra bike on trip advisor. We've taken the Segway tour with Tomas who is an awesome guide. The training with the segways was quick but we learned how to manage these vehicles. The whole tour was pretty interesting and Tomas has a tremendous knowledge about the city.
