Thanks for the 2 great hours, should we book a tour again it will definitely be with Zebra and hopefully again with Tomas!

Excellent and fun tour of budapest!!. Travelled to Budapest with my best friend for 2 days and decided to make things a bit more fun and tour Budapest on a segway! Our tour guide Victor was so informative, chatty, safe and most importantly FUN!! We had a great day and saw all the highlights of Budapest on the best form of transport possible!! Definitely would recommend doing this using Yellow Zebra Segways!

Professional, friendly and good value. Kata provided an excellent bike tour of Budapest today. She was very knowledgeable about the points of interest in the city, and also responded to all questions willingly. She ensured that everyone used the bikes safely, and although we had a bit of rain this did not ruin the tour. Kata was mindful of everyone's comfort, and made decisions to make the tour as good as possible. She made a point of asking everyone's names at the start, and used them during the tour which made it more personal. Thanks Kata!!!

Highly recommend. My friends and I went on the evening bike tour for three hours and took in many different sites in Budapest. Our tour guide Victor made the experience very enjoyable and made the tour very personal by providing stories of his own from living in the city of budapest. This gave this bike tour something different from the other bike tours around the city. Victor was very honest and was a great guide for the day. All around it was an excellent bike tour and Victor helped me form a pleasant outlook on Hungarians and the city of Budapest itself. Highly recommended.
Budapest Evening Walking Tour & Bike Tour. Fantastic staff... Bridget was awesome (walking tour) and Rob was fantastic (bike tour). Both had great sense of humor... Loved every single second of it...

Great Fun & Informational!. We took an evening Segway tour around Budapest. A fabulous way to see the city, and Balint provided lots of interesting background on all the sights, and the history of the city. There is a lot to see in Budapest, and seeing it on a Segway is a very efficient and a lot of fun. I booked on my iphone the day of the tour, but I think that we got lucky. Suggest that you book a couple of days in advance if you can. It is easy to learn how to drive a Segway (it was our first time) and we learned quickly. Balint was very careful to give us proper lessons. Our son is 13 years old, and we felt comfortable with him on the Segway given the training. An evening adventure meant that we had an opportunity to take photo's of all the beautifully lit up buildings and bridges. We also saw a part of the light show at the fountain on Margaret Island. Strongly recommend this . . . ask for Balint - he was fun and very knowledgeable!

Really fun way to see the city. I went on one of the evening tours which was 3 hours long including the time to practice before you are let loose. The segways are really easy to master once you start and are a lot of fun. We booked in advance online so ended up paying 43 pounds each which we thought was a great deal. We went round st. stephens, liberty square and margit island as well as a few others and our guide, Tamas, was really knowledgeable on the history, telling us everything we wanted to know! I would really recommend doing this!

Excellent tour and guide. Four of us did the afternoon Segway tour, it was a fun way to see the sights and learn a bit of history from our excellent tour guide Christy.Do it as soon as you arrive to help get you bearings in this wonderful and beautiful city.Highly recommended.

Fun way to discover Budapest. We took a Segway tour of Budapest with Balint. We had a lot of fun!We had booked the tour from home over the Internet so, all we needed to do was to get to the shop. It is located just behind the Opera House on the Pest side. After some minutes spent reviewing the safety measures, we were on our way.We are a family of five and we have travelled in Europe for the last few summers. This to explain that we knew some of the history of Budapest, the Austro-hungarian history and the likes. Despite this, Balint took it in stride and hopped us around the city, testing our knowledge and making fun along the way. His comments were interesting, testing one kid or the other and generally making us understand the city and country more. We had a great time!We had forgotten to bring water with us, but the shop sold some at a very reasonable price. Bring your camera as there are bags attached to the Segway to store them. And, as one of kids said, the Segway tour is a good way to get A/C... It was 36 degrees Celsius on that day.

Awesome way to learn about the city!. We had an wonderful day with our guide Adam! He was very informed about the Hungarian culture and gave us fantastic tips about Budapest. We did it on our first day in the city so now we are ready to hit the streets with some knowledge of what we'll be seeing! Highly recommended!

Great segway tour (we do a lot!); Thomas was the best guide we've ever had. This was a great segway tour and good value (2.5 hours). We were a group of 7 (6 of us booked together and one guy on his own). The training section was comprehensive and not too long. It was also location specific, teaching us how to go up and down kerbs which I had never done before. The tour covered lots of famous Pest landmarks and our guide Thomas (I may have spelled that wrong) was superb; excellent English and very knowledgeable. He was also very good natured, good fun and friendly. He was animated, interesting, responsive to what we as a group wanted and made it a great tour. I've done lots of Segway tours all over the US and in Europe and this was honestly the best we've done so far; mainly because of Thomas' skills as a guide.

A MUST DO in Budapest!. We had never been on a segway before so it was a new experience for us. We absolutely LOVED it! After the initial 15min induction it was SO easy. The person that made it so amazing was Tamas our guide. He was funny, patient and made the tour interesting and relevant. Budapest is such a beautiful city it was a delightful experience to ride around the stunning architecture. My husband loved it so much he wants to buy a segway!P.S. Ask for Tamas!

Best tour ever (with Balint). We highly recommend this tour, when coming to Budapest! If you haven't been on a Segway before, it is a must. Balint was our tour guide, and he was quite fun and entertaining. He presented the Budapest history in a very interesting way!Thanks Balint!

Spontaneous private tour with Robi!. I booked an evening bike tour on August 7, 2015 via email. I got a quick response from the company and got the opportunity to pay in the store, including the discount. That was nice! Due to the hot weather in the city (36 degrees) I turned out to be the only costumer for that tour! And luckily they didn't cancel, but instead I got a private tour with guide Robi. He was the best! He took me to see almost every place of interest in the city centre and told me everything I wanted to know about the history of the city and about more recent happenings. He also gave me great tips for dinner and drinking places! I would recommand doing this bike tour as the first activity in the city. It gives you a good overview of all the sights and areas of Budapest. And I recommand Yellow Zebra because of the nice staff and great value for your money!

They make city tours cool! . My friends and I decided a city bike tour was the best way to start our short trip in Budapest and yellow zebra were the only well advertised bike tour, with their bikes all over the city. We booked onto the shorter cycle in the evening as the day time was too hot, and were incredibly lucky to have the tour to ourselves. The tour was well planned and our guide, Brigit, was really friendly and funny and extremely knowledgeable about the city. Most of the historical information was new to us and Brigit gave us lots of recommendations for places to visit for the rest of the holiday and even nice restaurants.

Segway with Balint!!. This is the best way to tour around Budapest. On our recent trip, we took the 2 hour Segway tour around the city. We got to see and learn about the history of Budapest from our guide Balint. He was very knowledgeable about the history and made the trip enjoyable. My sister was very nervous to ride the Segway, he was very patient with her and helpful, within five minutes of the trip she was in front of the line. This was my second time on a Segway, this was by far a much better experience than my first Segway ride. I highly recommend doing this when you go to Budapest, and I recommend this company, it was a great price for the amount of time. Due to time constraints we only did the 2 hour trip, if we could have, we would have done the 3 hour trip.

Segway with Balint. We took a 2 hour tour with the Segway, the guide Balint was so kind, nice, funny and knowledgeable. We enjoyed every minute!!!!took the Segway from lazar street behind the opera building

A Must!. This is a “Must” for your trip in Budapest. You can simply learn everything about the city in 3 hours with a funny way. If you haven’t driven a Segway, please do it. It is so funny!!! If you want to learn Budapest in a very short time, just ask for Victor to be your tour guide. He is the best. Kind person with very good knowledge of history and very good handling of English Language.Simply the best tour guide you can have…
Awesome . On a super hot summer morning this is the best way to tour a city and we love the experience, they first get you used to the segway and then you go on the tour.

Super fun segway tour. Had a wonderful Segway tour with David. We had 4 travelers and they were able to give us a private guide. Had never used a Segway before and David was wonderful in helping us get acquainted with them. After a brief intro, we had a lovely 2 hour tour and saw much of Budapest (stayed on the Pest side only!) This is a good company to rent from and I highly recommend them.

Budapest with Tamas. Touring Budapest by Segway, our guide Tamas was awesome, his knowledge of Budapest was exceptionally informative which gave us an insight of an excellent European city, wish we had booked longer. Thank you Tamas and keep up the great work.Darron n Kathryn Thatcher from Saudi Arabia

A great experience with our guide Adam! . We went on the 3 hour evening tour, on a very hot day, but it was a most pleasurable experience. Our guide, Adam, was very knowledgeable, funny and interesting. We stopped often to refill water and to talk about historical sites. Adam was able to answer all of our questions with factual detail. This was a perfect opportunity to familiarize ourselves with this beautiful city. The tour included both sides of the river and visits to parliament, the opera house, St Stephans Basilica and many many more highlights. The tour was in no way strenuous. Highly recommend this company. Book online for an extra discount.
Adam is the best!. The tour was excelent with Adam. His explanations and humor sense were funny. We enjoyed all we did during the 3 hours ride. Nice places, nice people, nice weather, nice views....
Superb, informative and amusing Segway tour with Tamas!. Good safety briefing and training. Amusing historical lour with quiz questions over varied terrain. Great fun!
Super Segway Tour with Adam. Safe ride thru Budapest after solid vehicle introduction. Great inside info, much fun, good jokes. The thing to to with teenagers.

History Lesson. Just finished our 3 hour Segway tour with our guide Christy around Pest. My wife and I enjoyed our tour very much and Christy was extremely knowledgable on all things historic of Hungary. If we had a complaint it would be that there was a bit of information overload but anyway we did manage to see most of the best parts. All in all it is great way to get around this magnificent city.

The best day in Budapest. Two adults and three teens (19-15) had a brilliant guided tour of the town with Viktor. He was fun and informative; really good value. Hot with Sunny skies mixed with hale storms, he found us free water and ponchos. Lots of history, and a pride in his tour, he took great care of us.

Best way to see Budapest. Renting bikes was a great way to see Budapest me and my friends. the price is good and they come with a lock, so we were able to fit in a lot seeing numerous sights. The staff are really friendly, especially Viki, who offered us discount on the third day sinxe we were a returning customer. Must do!

Great Way to See Budapest. This was the 4th city we did a Segway tour in this summer and one of the better tours we had! Our guide Christi was great. Went many places we thought were inaccessible to Segways so this was much more fun than previous "strictly sidewalk" tours that we had experienced before. Equipment is in good shape and regardless of your skill level on a Segway, they take the time to make sure you are ready to ride!

Highlight of Budapest. Laszlo was our bike guide in late June. Great tour! He shared so much history and added personal stories from his own family's history during the communist occupation, which made for a rich & more personal understanding. His love of Hungary was evident, and rubbed off on all of us. This truly was a highlight & a great first day activity in this beautiful city.

Excellent tour with Adrienn. Did the 3.5 hour day-time bike tour with Adrienn. It started off at 11AM, and what was supposed to be a 3.5 hour tour ended up being more like a 4.5 hour (yay). Had a great time. Adrienn really knew her stuff, was very friendly, and was good at explaining. She was even keen on making sure we got the best advice on the rest of our Budapest stay - pointed us areas with good foods and shopping.We were also very lucky - the weather was nice and sunny, but also cool. I highly recumbent this tour. For 33 USD, a 4.5 hour bike tour (though it WAS intended to be 3.5 hour) with high-end bikes and an excellent tour guide like Adrienn is a steal. To top it off, the tour includes a little visit to a coffee shop, with complimentary Strudel and drink. The Strudel was awesome. (We each got two, but partially because the group was small.) The group had a nice relaxing time at the coffee shop after biking around Budapest. Take all this into account - definitely a good price.I would highlight the following:- important to book on a day with good weather (if summer, make sure it's not too hot)- GREAT price- Adrienn did a superb job, and I suspect the other tour guides there are equally good- solo/family/couple, all groups will have a great time- bring water (especially if during the summer)- the starting point can be hard to find. The bike shop is right behind the Opera House, which is on Andrassy Avenue- highly recommend doing this on the first or second day in Budapest, because the tour gives you a good overview of Budapest, and you learn about places you can potentially visit. Further, the tour guide really helps you out (during the coffee break). Adrienn made sure we were informed where to eat/shop, where not to, what to do during weekends, etc.One word to summarize: awesome.

Couldn't fault it..... Had such a lovely day, biking is a great way to cover lots of ground and see the city! Tour guide was brilliant managed to answer everybody's questions and had a good sense of humor, I came away feeling like I had learnt and seen lots and had a brilliant day!
Informative and lots of fun. We did the bike tour and Robert was our guide.He was very good and guiding the group and obviously loved his city.Highly recommend

fun and informative. loved our tour with Adrian - she was funny and told us a lot about the history of the places we visited, also emphasizing that we could ask her more questions and she'd tailor the tour information to our preferences as much as she could. really enjoyed seeing so much of the city in a couple of hours - highly recommend!

Fun, informative and more fjn. It was just the two of us booked on the afternoon tour, so our brilliant guide Balint did a brilliant circuit just for my son and me. We had fantastic fun and learnt loads about Budapest. Thanks Balint (make sure he shows you the statue made of Lego )

Cycling Tour. Great way to spend 3.5hrs seeing some of the sights in Budapest. George was a great guide, very informative & made sure we all arrived back safely. Bonus was the coffee & pastries at the end of tour.

Excellent way to see the city. We pre-booked this bike tour on line with Viator shortly before coming to Budapest. A voucher is sent fairly quickly to your email account. Viktor was our guide. He did a great job taking us to many places around the city. We spent approximately 3 hours out. Very easy to find behind the Opera House.

Tamas was Informative and Funny. Our guide, Tamas, led a group of ten cycling adults through parks, bike lanes, city traffic, and across bridges. He always did a great job of keeping everyone together and orienting us to Budapest while giving some good history lessons. It was a fantastic way to see the city highlights, discover what we wanted to see in greater depth, and learn how to reach these wonderful attractions.

Excellent bike tour . Went on this with my wife, Viktor, our guide was excellent, explained the history plus gave us his real world, Hungarian citizen, view on it. Excellent way to see the city and safe for novice riders, the city has an excellent bike system. Bikes are all good and safe and helmets are available although not compulsory

Sunday morning spin around town. 12 riders (6 first timers) and 2 guides, very good equipment, good place to train, and good office operation - good start. The itinerary and guides were great - Sunday morning was a perfect time to Segway. Highly recommend.

Amazing Introduction to Budapest!. We had 36 hours in Budapest, and the 3 hour Segway tour was the perfect way to get orientated with the city fast. No walking, large distance covered and very informative. Our guide Balint was awesome. Excellent English and very knowledgeable. The Segway machines are so easy to learn and a blast to ride. Once we saw the highlights of the city we narrowed down what was important to us. I would highly recommend Zebra tours and especially "Sir Balint".
Best way to see the city. Such a fun experience!! We absolutely loved our two hour tour on the Segways. It was a blast, and the best price I've ever seen.

Segway tour with Laszlo. My husband and I spent a wonderful (but hot!) afternoon on our first ever Segway tour. Laszlo was patient with this oldish couple and made us feel so comfortable. Budapest history came alive with his interesting and informative narrative, as we buzzed down Andrassy Ut, to Hero Square and beyond to the Szechenyi baths. Laszlo even surprised us with an impromptu traditional lullaby played on a small wooden flute (?) while we rested. It was a day we won't soon forget. If you find yourself in the lovely city of Budapest, search out Yellow Zebra (behind the Opera House) and get ready for a real treat.

Great way to see the main sites of interest . Baling was our tour guide and was very knowledgeable about the sites we saw. He took care of us and ensured we we safely navigated through the streets of Budapest. A great fun afternoon.

A Must-Do Fun and Informative Introduction to Budapest. This is absolutely the way to go. We took the four hour bike tour starting at 11:00 A.M. and led by the brilliant Kati. She was very courteous and informative. The tour allowed us to get our bearings and receive an informative and interesting introduction to Budapest. The cycling covered an easy 10 miles on flat terrain in Pest and over the bridge to Buda, though honestly it didn't seem to be any where near ten miles. Near the end of the ride we had a lovely strudel stop and got to know our group which consisted of a total of seven people, including the guide. After the tour we knew what we wanted to explore in the limited time we had, and we understood Budapest more clearly. We loved the tour so much, we plan on booking a Yellow Zebra tour in Vienna. We hope they meet our expectations raised by the Budapest location.

Worth doing!. We did the three hour Superior Segway tour of Budapest in July 2015 and it was excellent. Even though we didn't specifically request a small group, we were never a larger group than four people including us. We saw lots of the city and its main sights with our very knowledgeable and friendly guide Balint, whose English was better than ours! He was happy to answer questions and take pictures too.It was very hot so I recommend you cover up or wear high sunscreen and drink lots of water as you're rarely in the shade or indoors. Also, wear comfortable shoes like trainers as Segways are not as easy/comfortable as you might think, especially after a few hours!We were visiting Hungary for five days, but three of those were at the Formula One Grand Prix, so this was an excellent and efficient way to see lots of sights in a morning and pick what we might want to return to in the afternoon for a longer visit.Thanks Balint!Heidi and Gary

Fantastic. A must do in Budapest.. We booked this for a group of four people prior to arrival in Budapest. When we arrived at the shop in the morning we happened to be the only ones booked for the morning and ended up having a private tour with George the guide.First up was the training. The segway when you first get on it feels totally alien and unnatural. By the time we had all finished our training session, we headed off with trepidation to the first stop on the tour. George was very patient with all of us and by the time that we were listening to his first speech in front of the opera house it started to feel natural. As we started to make our way through the city we were all smiling our heads off and thoroughly enjoying the tour. George is very passionate about his city and this showed in the knowledge and depth of his talks as we stopped in front of the major sights. By the end of the tour, we were all very proficient and confident in the use of the segway and would have liked more time.If you are thinking about this, from our perspective it is a must do as you get to see and feel the city and Yellow Zebra have the most current and up to date machines for use. We would definitely do this again and will now try it in Krakow next year when we go again. Thanks George for a very enjoyable trip.
Amazing. Our guide's name was Adrian and she was amazing. Very patiently taught us to ride the Segway and was very knowledgable. We had an amazing time!

Best way to see the city for the first time. We had one day and two evenings in Budapest and tired of using our feet tromping around Vienna, we opted for a Segway Tour. Viktor was our guide and very charming. He lent a personal perspective to the tour that is good for Westerners to hear. I can't think of a better way to get an overview of the Pest side of town. I don't know if this tour goes to Buda - we had a longer tour and just hit the Pest sites. We came away with a wonderful appreciation of this city and were able to see so much more than we could have by foot. Here are my minor reservations: you should be already comfortable on a Segway. They don't spend much time training. My husband and I are, so no problem for us. The history that you get is a very thin overview and in some areas really should be verified - local myth, holdovers from communist information control still exist. However, that is easily done - just be aware.

The best way to see the city. This was reasonably priced in comparison to some city segway tours - I booked through Viator. The office was easy to find and after a quick safety demonstration we were on our way with Viktor as our tour guide. It was a small group of just 6 which was good as plenty of time for questions. Viktor was great - very knowledgable and approachable with questions - we learnt so much from him and he had a joke and a laugh with us all. The tour lasted about 2.5 hours with stops for photos, drinks etc. Viktor was even able to give us all recommendations for food, drinks etc. Loved this tour and will be using Yellow Zebra again! thanks guys for a great city tour :)

Fantastic tour. With just a couple of days in Budapest this was a great way to start our trip and get a great overview of the city. Viktor was our guide and he was very informative and made it good fun too.

Great fun way to see the city!. Myself and a friend booked the 2 hour segway tour for our 2nd day in Budapest, to get some history on the city and help to get our bearings.Our tour guide was Balint, who introduced himself as we arrived and took us outside the office for a guide and practice runs on the segways. I was the only one in the group who had been on a segway before, admittedly only on another 2 hour trip, but the rest of the group picked it up really quickly. We were taught how to tackle kerbs correctly, and Balint made sure we could all do it correctly, without injuring ourselves or damaging the segway, before we set off on the tour. We were set on turtle mode for the first bit, until everyone got the hang of using the segway. Once we had been out for about 20 mins? or so, and we had got to St Stephen's Basilica, we were taken off turtle mode and let loose in the square to make the most of our new found speed freedom. Each group has a tour guide and a chaperone who stays at the back of the group to make sure no one gets left behind - which was good as my friend didn't make a corner properly as we left the square, crashing and ultimately falling off. The chaperone (sorry, can't remember his name!) Made sure she was ok and set off to rejoin the rest of the group.Balint was a really good tour guide; informative and interesting, making light of some of the city's history and background. Some tour guides can be stuffy and waffle on, but Balint had the right balance to make the tour fun and interesting... thank you Balint!After the tour was finished, my friend and I spent the afternoon retracing the route we had been on and revisited some of the sites like Parliament and the Basilica that we couldn't get too close to, or visit inside with having the segways.A really fun 2 hours, with a bit of a workout included! I would totally recommend this as a great way to see the city, learn some of the history and be able to zip about on a segway! Safe to say the American tourists we passed loved them!

Great fun, not at all historically informative :(. I was grouped with some American students, who were only interested in getting 'white-girl wasted' and finding the best clubs, so naturally the tour consisted of very fleeting looks at important Hungarian monuments and buildings . . The tour guide was a really nice chap though, he appeared to know much about the city its just a shame he didn't tell us anything!

Fastest way to see a city. This review is long overdue as my friend and I made this trip at the end of May. Our guide was Robert and he was great! We booked a 3 hour personal tour and covered a lot of ground during that time. Robert is informative, engaging and also very safety conscious. Although the tour was 3 hours long, he extended it as he wanted to show us the magnificent Parliament House and that was a little out of the way. We thought that was very nice of him. I highly recommend a segway sightseeing tour in any city that has it as it saves you so much time. Zip through all the major attractions and if you really like it, you can always come back on your own later.

Dissappionted. I reserved this for myself and two children aged 11 and 13. We arrived and were taken to the corner to practice / learn how to ride the Segway . My son went first he had no problems go to go I went needed a little more time than him but felt good. Then my daughter went she got scared and did not want to do it. The guide continued training the members of the group while I tried to convince daughter to give it another try. That did not work she would not go and though the company said she could sit with them my 11 year old daughter did not feel comfortable sitting in a foreign country with people she did not know for 3 hours. My son continued on the trip but I had to sit out with my daughter and was not refunded a cent so we got one for the price of three. Personally for me this is much to expensive to risk so unless you are experienced I don't know that I would risk that much money.

A great introduction to Budapest. We arrived in Budapest and this was the first thing we did. We knew very little about the city which made for an incredibly interesting and educating tour. We had VIKTOR take us around on bikes for the 3 hour evening tour, showing us the must see/do places and explaining the complicated history of the country/city. I've done my fair share of bike tours, and I highly rate my experience with this company. The bikes are good quality, the tour didn't feel rushed, and it gave a great foundation for further exploring the city.

Excellent evening ride with Viktor. We had a great introduction to Budapest with Viktor on a 3 hour cycling tour for our first night. We were shown all the best parts of Buda and Pest along with getting loads of personal advice and tips from Viktor as a Budapest local. Would absolutely recommend a Yellow Zebra bike tours to anyone visiting Budapest!

Segway Tour. As two 60 + travellers, I had cajoled my long-suffering wife into trying a Segway Tour of Budapest. The staff at yellow Zebra were friendly and helpful. After a brief familiarisation, we were off into a busy city centre on a Saturday afternoon. The segways are quite sensitive but relatively easy to operate if the balance is mastered, although the lack of a "brake" is a little disconcerting. Fortunately, personal safety is a high priority with Yellow Zebra, as, unlike some other providers in the city, a helmet is issued and is required to be worn. In the light of our experience, when (unfortunately) yours truly inadvertantly turned his own machine into that of his wife, whilst waiting at a pelican crossing, the helmet is crucial. Due to my carelessness, my wife fell and cracked her head on the pavement and would have been seriously injured without the helmet. She was able to continue, but I would urge all participants to keep a healthy distance between their own segway and those of other "riders," especially close relatives ! Our experience should not reflect badly on yellow Zebra Tours, as the issues were of my own making, but the need to steer clear of any obstacles should be stressed, particularly for the less mobile "senior citizen!"

4 hr guided bike ride. We knew straight away that this was going to be great when Brigit approached us with a warm smile, handshake and friendly introduction. They keep their groups small, no more than 15. The bikes were in great condition and baskets were available. Their office is super easy to find. Brigit took us on a very relaxed 4 hr tour - covering lots of ground. She gave us lots of historical information, enjoyed asking us questions and added in lots of personal snippets about her experiences. Brigit has a gentle, warm nature with a dose of humour. She is very friendly & professional and is happy to take detours or stop unexpectedly for photo opportunities. This is a great intro to Budapest and a great way to learn about its ancient & modern history. I highly recommend this most enjoyable half day - oh & the strudel and coffee just made the day even more enjoyable - we even got to see how the strudels are made. Thank you Brigit - it was lovely to meet you :)

Great way to see the City, to get your bearings, and feel connected to your surroundings. Christy was a delight! She is charming and despite her young age knows what customer service is and knows her history. I found the tour informative and fun.The tour is not about cycling so don't worry if you cant ride a great distance - however for those who are scared of city traffic then take note - however it IS safe if you keep your eyes open and follow the group.I loved the fact that we got to mix it with the cars, pedestrians and the "hub-bub" of the city. The coffee and pastry was very nice and also offered a chance to chat with and get to know some of your fellow riders. Bikes are great and the check in and out was so easy. This is a fun, and low-key operation - this good! They are relaxed but very professional. English is great too

Segway tour was amazing!. We did a 2 hour Segway tour in the afternoon and had an amazing time. We were in a small group with 8 people, so we were able to hear our guide and ask any questions we may have had. The training that was available at the beginning was beneficial and our tour guide, Balint, was very hot and helpful. He was an engaging and enjoyable guide that we all had a pleasure to follow and listen too.

Budapest Cycle Tour. Christy was a pleasant knowledgable guide who went out of her to make the tour enjoyableFound the tour a great way to get your bearingsFar better than the cattle trucks known as hop on hop off busesFree morning an add bonus

First day tour . Touring Budapest at rush hour made for an interesting look at a vibrant city with a huge history and amazing sights. A well informed guide made for a fun 3 hours although the 34 degree heat could have given us a little break.

Fantastic!. My husband and I take a bike toot in almost every city we visit. and I have to say the tour today with Thomas K was the best bike tour we've ever been on. Thomas is knowledgeable and funny and personable and his fabulous personality made a really interesting day in Budapest even better. If you like bike tours don't miss this one. It really gives you a fabulous overview of the history of this country and helps you understand all the beautiful surroundings of both Buddha and pest.

Great customer service. Did the Segway tour on Wednesday. Great fun. Small group of 8 and Thomas was a fantastic guide / instructor. Any company can look good day to day but a great company stands out when things get tough. These guys looked after us brilliantly when we hit the mother of all storms. Gave us all options to keep going or not, provided wet weather gear when we said to continue. Then Thomas kept us entertained and they even arranged hot drinks for our return. We got soaked which was unfortunate but really didn't take away from the fun. DO the Segway tour in Budapest. DO USE Yellow Zebra. DO NOT go anywhere else Thanks guys. Highlight of our visit. Apart from the Danube river cruise. DO THAT TOO!!

Segway - what a brilliant experience. My friend and I booked a Segway tour for three hours to see the City. Our guide - Balint - was engaging, informative and very caring, making sure we knew what we were doing and keeping an eye on us.A Segway is a great way to see the City, whizzing along the pavements, cycle paths and in the City Park. The route was easy to follow, with Balint helping us cross roads, negotiate traffic lights and deal with pedestrians. We'd stop regularly at the sights for photos and a history talk.You do sign a waiver and I understand why people would be worried. The Segways are sturdy but you do go on the road and it does take some practice. My friend fell off in the City Park when we tried to get up a particularly steep kerb. She was ok and Balint was a great help, but it was only after this that we though through other implications of an accident.Safe Segway riding!

A Great Way to Introduce Yourself to Budapest. My husband and I arrived in Budapest yesterday and booked this Segway tour prior to arriving. We knew it would be the best way to see a lot of the city to orient ourselves for the remainder of our trip. Yellow Zebra and Christy did not disappoint. I learned a ton of history (relearned for that matter) while seeing spectacular buildings. We also tacked on the "superior" tour, which included another hour to tour City Park and Hero's Square. Christy was delightful to lead us through her beautiful city. I highly recommend this tour for young and old alike.

Great- informing experience. The tour was very well conducted by our tour guide. He did a great job keeping the group together and safe. We toured both Buda and Pest and enjoyed a cafe at the end. What a great experience- very informative.

Best way to see the city. Just finished our segway tour, led by the brilliant Tamas, and I was tempted to immediately go back for more. Segways are an excellent way to see Budapest while sparing the shoe leather, especially when the temperature is 37C, and our guide was amusing, informative and spoke perfect English.Thanks for a great experience, can't wait to do it again in another city :)

are you insured for a segway. The segway looked great, but my insurance would not cover it and the waiver I would have to sign before going out, which was compulsory by the segway company, made me liable for all the damage to the segway I was on, no personal cover and if there was an accident I would have been liable for any costs incurred. There was an extensive list of waivers.They can be dodgy things, even if they are fun, and in England at least there have been accidents. Having said that the company gave me a complete refund when I said I was not happy with the situation and were very helpful. Apparently they can't get an insurance company to cover them.

Nice way to see the city. Nice bikes, great price. We rented 2 bikes for a full day - I think it came out to about $15-20 USD per bike. They include the basket, locks, helmets for free with the bike rental. They also showed us the best bike routes on a map and suggested some good routes for site-seeing. Very helpful staff.Keep in mind that you need to leave a cash deposit for the bikes (deposit amounts are on their website), but you can pay with a credit card if necessary upon return.

Segway. Easy to find just behind the Opera House, nice friendly welcome and introductions, training session first, would have preferred a Segway each rather than take and turns on one, Then the tour ,begins, Adam our guide was excellent watching over the groups safety and passing on his local and historic knowledge
Fun fun fun. I absolutely loved using the Segway to whizz around the city centre. The tour was fund and informative. I wish I had a Segway to use for my whole trip!

Cycling Tour. I wouldn't recommend that you take this unless you're very comfortable riding a bike in a big city. While the terrain is relatively easy, the traffic was heavy (pedestrian and vehicles). I had to ask for a helmet - while it was promptly provided, I felt it should be offered /recommended. If you want to ride a bike, rent one at Margaret island so you're not sucking fumes. It was impossible for the guide to keep track of the 9 riders. My strong suggestion would be to give one person/rider a discount and have them act as sweep - have a flag on their bike. It was really hard to hear the guide over the traffic.

Segway your Way through Budapest!!!. My son and I took a Segway tour while in Budapest last month from Yellow Zebra Tours and we loved it!!! After some initial trepidation we were quite pleased when Andi, our awesome tour guide, first had as practice how to use the segway and made 100% sure we were confident before leaving for our tour. Just by luck we were the only 2 on the tour that morning which made the whole thing even better!!!! We toured so many great places in Budapest as we were zipping through crowds and traffic. My son is 14 and he did great so I highly recommend this for kids in that age group. It was one of the highlights of our trip and thank you to ANDI for being a GREAT tour guide!!! We couldn't have asked for better!!!
Sooooo much fun and a fab city tour. I have never been on a Segway before and this was brilliant. So much fun and an amazing tour around Budapest. Def recommend and can't wait to do it again.

Yellow Zebra cycling Tour of Budapest. Fabulous tour and well worth the £15. Our guide, Adrienn, brought the city and its colourful history to life for us. Easy safe cycling once you remember to stay right.

Best way to see Budapest. Segway tours are always my favourite way to tour a city but I have to say my experience in Budapest exceeded all previous tours I have done.We had Victor as our tour guide and he was the nicest, friendliest and most informative guide. The remaining people in our group were running late but Victor stayed outside and chatted with us, asking us about our trip and recommending some bars and restaurants to visit after.We booked the morning tour and there was only five of us in the group so it really felt personal and it was easy to keep together as a group on the streets.The segways are so much fun and you get training before setting off to ensure everything goes to plan.Budapest is such a beautiful city and the Segway tour allows you to visit some statues, monuments and other sights that you may not be able to if you were to complete on foot.I really can't recommend these tours and Victor enough. I want to go back to Budapest already to do it all again :)

Bike Budapest. This was a lot of fun - Budapest by bike is a great way to see the city. We saw places that we wouldn't have visited like Hero's Park. Our guide was fantastic and very knowledgable. We didn't feel rushed and it was great having a local answer all of our questions.We were 2 families with 4 teens and one 10yr old. The traffic in Budapest is quite busy during the week so we were thankful that we took the tour on Sunday as it can be a little nervewracking for the parents watching their kids on the bikes in the traffic - even though they're in the bike lane. The tour is about 3.5 hrs and you ride from one side of the city to the other. So we were happy for coffee and 2 pieces of struedel that was included with the tour. It also gave us a chance to chat more with the other people on the tour.We also had taken the walking tour with the same company two days earlier and this was great too. Although we did cover a lot of the same places on both tours however the walking tour included a boat tour which was great to see further up and down the Danube and absolutely spectacular at night.The tour office is located just behind the Opera House so lots of great places to eat after the tour.Highly recommended

A Different Way to see Budapest. This is a great experience. Firstly the groups are quite small, 8 in ours and you are given half an hour training before the tour starts, which isn't included in the tour time so you are comfortable using the Segway before you are launched onto the streets of Budapest. Once you set off the Segway is in training mode until your guide feels you are a competent driver!Our guide was Andi who was really knowledgeable and ensured we stopped at all the key sites and allowed plenty of time for photos throughout. Her english was excellent and she was able to answer questions during the tour. We were given some "free time" to just drive the Segways around as we wanted which was great fun and we were shown some things which we definitely wouldn't have discovered if we hadn't have been on the tour. Ages in our group ranged from 20 year olds to 60+ year olds.The segways do vibrate through your feet and they can feel uncomfortable by the end of the tour so I would recommend trainers so they take the impact.

A fun way to see Budapest. We booked the tour at home on the internet, it was about £55 each, this isn't cheap but it was fun after lessons on how to use the segway!!! we persevered and eventually became quite confident ant on them.George & Balint were great hosts and showed us around in a group of 13.

Fastest I've gone on a segway in a city!. We did the Grand Budapest Sightseeing tour and found it a great way to see the Pest side of the city. Our friendly guide Balint started with a training session on the segway and then we spent 2 hours on the roads zipping across the famous landmarks. We enjoyed being on the segway but felt that the commentary script could have been more detailed to help us understand the city layout better. Tips:-- Do this on your first day- You don't really have the time or opportunity to take pictures while balancing on the segway, except at Basilica where we make a photo stop- Take note of the tour guide's recommendations as he is an informative Hungarian local eager to share tips- You get a 20% off for another tour if you book with them- Booking online saves you 10%- Be careful on the roads as it can be tricky to navigate pedestrians and cars on some streets- glad we did the tour on a weekday morning so it was less crowded

Norwich girls Segway Tour with Robert. The best way to see the city! Having never used a segway before we found the 'training' helpful in gaining confidence. Robert our guide was incredibly patient, knowledgable and accommodating. Loved the experience and would definitely recommend.

A three hours great segway tour. My husband and I were taking this morning a three hours Segway tour. Although we've already explored Budapest a bit, it was a great tour that enabled us exploring a large portion of Budapest, along with Segway motoric fun. Our guide - Balint - was very nice and patient, he gave us great tips as to what to do in Budapest and he was really considerate and flexible. The Segway is enjoyable since on one hand it is open and gives you the feeling as if you are a part of the city action (unlikely in buses) and on the other hand it is motoric and it makes it simple to have a long tour around the city with no big effort. We recommend this tour to anyone who is not afraid of motoric vehicles. We will surely try this again sometimes in other European countries. Balint - thanks a lot, Ran and Limor from Israel.

What other ways you can get so much out of 2 hours!?. I am a first time visitor in Budapest and for a conference. I wanted to see as much as I can one evening, so I hooked up with the good folks at Yellow Zebra for a cycle tour. It was a cloudy late afternoon but keen to see why Budapest been quoted as one of the extraordinary cities in Europe. I had the most informative by a very knowledgeable and lovely tour guide Brigit (one of the stories that told me about the Liberty Status will stick with me for life!) and breath taking 2 hours. I had learnt much and now can appreciate the vast history of this city.

Evening tour with Andi. Booked the evening before for the tour to Margaret Island and Parliament during the evening. It was brilliant - good basic training which was more scary than the actual tour. It was great racing along the bike paths and into Margaret Island, a really stunning place, full of life. We would not have had time to see it all just walking. Andie was a great guide and was lots of fun. A super way to see the City

What a great way to tour the city. We are on the 3rd leg of our Euro15 trip. We did Segway in Prague as well so we may have an advantage over others who might have done it for the 1st time. Our tour guide Balint was wonderful. He knew the history and mixed it up with several jokes and fun facts to keep us engaged and laughing along the way. Me and my wife had a great time. Ty !!!

Great guide and lots of fun!. My husband and I chose the Segway tour so we could get a great view of Budapest and save a little walking! (I had a sprained ankle, so this was a good idea!) We found our way to the Yellow Zebra Segway Tour (FYI..its the location by the Opera for the Segway tour) office. We were greeted warmly and met our guide, Balentine. He was very kind, and knowledgeable with great language skills. He spoke great English. He really knew the history of Budapest and was great at sharing stories and showing the best places and even taking pictures for us. If you want to see Budapest and save your feet, this is a fun and great way to do it. Be sure to ask for Balentine!!!
Best experience ever . best experience in Budapest, it was perfect, Balint our tour guide was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend !!!

Woooo hooo Segtastic. What an amazing way to see an amazing city. Balint our guide was great. he showed us all the major attractions of Budapest. We've been on over 10 Segway tours and this tour by far had the longest single run that we've ever done, approximately 5 km from start to finish on one section.... From The Ferris wheel to Hero's square. Balint was a great guide he told us about a bunch of great places to see in Budapest. So look at Zebra tours for all of your Segway needs....

Great fun Tour. Our first tour on a Segway and it was super fun! My son(15 years) and I had a great time. Our guides were fantastic , so friendly , patient with our learning and very knowledgable . We learnt a lot about Budapest and history and loved every minute . THANKYOU Balint & Adam for making it so special .
Easy and pleasant. Bike tours are a great way to get an overview of what a city is all about. Yellow Zebra were great. Our tour leader George was informative and entertaining. Well recommended.

Great way to see Budapest. A bicycle is great in this city because it covers the big area that a walking tour never could. Historic Budapest is huge! The city is set up for bicycles with dedicated bike lanes and many bicycles zooming around everywhere. A bicycle tour is up close and personal in a way that a bus tour never can be. Our guide, Adrienne, was outstanding: enthusiastic, extremely knowledgeable and interesting. The tour felt like a visit with a local distant relative showing us the sights. The music and light show at the fountain on Margaret Island was a thrilling surprise.

Good Tour Good People.. My wife & I booked an evening group Segway tour. Surprisingly no one else was booked for that time, so it was a private tour for us. Our Guide Brigit was excellent and knowledgeable and very friendly. She also had good recommendations for good palaces to visit in Budapest.

MUST DO bike tour!. Wonderful way to see Budapest. Our guide, Ana, did a fabulous job exploring the city and giving us lots of detail about the real Budapest. We enjoyed it so much that after our tour we rented bikes on our own the next couple of days. It was a small group, so all of our questions were easily covered. Thanks!Sue

Best way to get around the city, Fantastic tour guide. What a perfect way to experience Budapest. Our tour guide Briggite was super knowledgeable and a lot of fun. She also had great recommendations for how to spend our time outside of the tour. Yellow Zebra is great and definitely ask for Briggita!

Yellow Zebra Bike Tour - highlight of our trip to Budapest. Four of us booked the late afternoon tour. We were also fortunate to have Brigit as our guide. She was outstanding! For anyone that doesn't know the city this is a great way of getting your bearings. We were able to tailor the tour to our liking and Brigit was very happy to accommodate. She was friendly, patient and knowledgeable - we really enjoyed the experience

Great way to explore Budapest. The bike tour was fantastic! Budapest is spread out and this was a wonderful way to see the main sites, especially in the summer when it's really hot. Our guide did an excellent job explaining the sites and the history. Be sure to take water with you and be aware that the refreshment stop (the best strudel ever and drinks), is one of the last stops- around 2 pm.

Great start to Budapest . Just finished a wonderful tour with George. If you are considering this- I would HIGHLY recommend you do this. Let me answer the questions I had before going. You do not have to be a stud biker for this tour. I am 59 and have not been on a bike for 30 years- but I am in decent shape. Very flat terrain. Slow pace. Most of the tour is in bike lanes where you are not fighting cars. You will see so much of Buda AND Pest. I would do this first, then decide what to go back and see in more detail. You will be fortunate if you get George. His passion for his heritage, his knowledge of history and his consideration for tour members make him a wonderful guide. Thank you George, hope to see you again my friend... Steve

Great way to see city!. Brilliant way to explore the city!Neither of us had ridden one before and took to it easily - great fun and easy to control. Suggest taking a bottle of water with you as weirdly hard word - all that concentration makes thirsty work!The guide points out fun and interesting things along the way as well as general facts about Budapest - very informative.

Great tour from a local with a deep knowledge and love of her city!. The 4 hour bike tour hits all of the highlights of the city pretty quickly. We would highly suggest doing this tour on your first day in Budapest so that you have an idea of what to do and/or see for the rest of your trip. Our tour guide Barbara was AMAZING! She was born and raised in Hungary and has an amazing knowledge of Budapest and love for her country.The tour had a nice balance of historical information as well as current information and sight seeing. After traveling quite a bit through Europe, I don't go to a city without taking a quick tour to get the lay of the land. This tour was one of my favorites I've ever taken! Enjoy!

Scenic Segway 2 hour tour of Pest and views of Buda. Thank you George!. We had a really great tour of Pest with George as our guide today. nothing was too much trouble for him and his other colleagues who went out of their way to answer our questions and provide us with information both before, during and after our Segway tour. After ensuring we were competent riders we had a fantastic morning as George filled us with confidence as to our safety and his knowledge of the city and country. George's english was excellent, far better than our 4 words of Hungarian. We thoroughly recommend this, and we have undertaken Segway tours throughout a number of places in the world. Thank you. Clair and Liz

Great friendly service. We booked last minute for a private Segway tour. On arrival we were warmly greeted and were able to take advice on a tour that suited us given we has a walking tour the previous day. Andi was our guide and she did a great job, just the right amount of stops and very informative, thoroughly recommended and she should win at least 1 beer from the team!

Great way to see the city!. The 3-4 hour bike tour was the perfect way to see Budapest on the first day. Our tour guide Brigit was both informative and approachable. The stop off for drinks and strudel was a lovely touch. We found out a lot about Hungarian history and saw most of the main sights of the city. Couldn't recommend it more. We'll be doing the same in Prague!

Insanely fun! . I was nervous to begin with, worrying that I wouldn't be able to control the segway but, in no time we were all pros. It was easy to book and organised upon arrival. I would highly recommend it as a way to experience Budapest and our tour guide Balint was lovely, funny and a joy to experience the city with. I could not have seen Budapest any other way. So pluck up the courage and take the plunge you won't be dissapointed!

Had a great time!. We went to the 5pm bike tour and had a great time! Adrianne was very nice and knowledgeable. A highlight was going to the Margaret Island since we probably wouldn't have seen it on this trip if not for the bike tour. Really fun way to see the city and Adrianne was super informative on the history of the city.

A good way to see the city in short time. we took the 1 hour free ride (with instructor ), he was very kind and polite. I got fast answers to my questions by their internet mobile site. Recommended for all visiters.

Fantastic experience. We went on the 3 hour segway tour and it is by far the best way of exploring budapest I'd recommend doing this, the segway is so easy to maneuver. The tour guide is great and tells you a lot of information about the city. We Didn't want it to end. Fun experience.

Good way to see Budapest. Very good tour with yellow zebra bike tours. As on a bike you get to see much more than on foot. It was well organised and we visited many places, I don't want to tell you as it will give you something to look forward to. Bikes were fairly new and comfortable and a group of people about 15 of us. Our guide Adrienn spoke good English and was very informative. There are many cycle lanes in Budapest so don't be worried about cycling there.

wow! Best way to see the city!. The tour was a treat for my 50th birthday. What a great present! Our guide, Bernadette, was great, she made sure we were totally confident with the machines before we set off; she was extremely knowledgeable and very attentive and her English was faultless! An absolute must if you go to Budapest! Cannot rate highly enough!

Bike Tour. Was fortunate enough to be the only one on the tour, so my guide Brigit was able to customise the ride where we visited Fisherman's Bastion which has been removed fromt he tour now, due to some customers finding it to difficult to ride uphill. Brigit was extremely articulate about the turbulent history, architecture and general knowledge about Hungary and surrounding territories. I loved the strudel cafe stop where I tried cabbage and plum strudels and viewed them making the pastry. Great trip to introduce and orientate you around Budapest.

Great way to see the sights.. We took the 3 hour tour and have to say what a brilliant way to see the city. This is not the first time we have used this company. We took a tour with them in Rome and that was excellent too. Christy, our guide, was first class and made sure we were all confident on our Segways before we started. She is very knowledgeable about the city and answered all of our questions very well. She is also a very pretty young lady and very pleasant on the eye. lol This really is a good way to see the city and i cannot recommend the tour highly enough. The last hour of the tour was fun as we went up to Heroes Square and the surrounding park...loved it thoroughly enjoyable and best way to see the city

easy rental. . i wanted to try the urban bike share but it was hard to navigate the sign up. yellow zebra was right next to our apartment. i took a bike for a day and they were open til 10 making return super easy. gave a helmet and lock. great way to get around the city.

Segway through Budapest. Our family recently had a great tour of Budapest this past week despite the rain. Segways are a fun way to tour new places, especially when accompanied by very knowledgeable and entertaining guides. Tamas, our guide for the day sure fit the bill! Not only could he provide a lot of history, but talked about the unique changes in Budapest since the fall of communism and the vibrant city life that now exists.We had a great trip and encourage those interested in trying a Yellow Zebra Segway to step on with both Feet!

Bite the bullet and do it!. Booked on this with 4 friends all of which have never ridden a segway before. After the meet and greet we were set for our training. After initially watching a very nervous person step onto the mechanical marvel and it buck like a mule nerves kicked in. However fears are unfounded and after a few minutes on the wizardry two wheeled beast you take to it like duck to water. So quick that 5 minutes of setting eyes on one of the beasts all 8 people on the tour were whizzing around. The real star of the experience was the guide Balint. Not only did he survive a day surrounded by fools on segways he provided a great enjoyable tour, top guy! Keep up the great work. Totally recommend this experience to anyone. Yes nerves will kick in when you first step on but there's no need!

Amazing hostess and way to see the city. We took a segway tour around budapest. Our tour guides name was Kinga (I would recommend her as your tour guide if possible). Kinga gave a very thorough 1 on 1 training session for etiquette and riding techniques. The tour was very informative and great for all ages.
Great segway tour. Segways are a really great way to get to know Budapest. Despite the rain a fantastic time with our fun and informative guide Tamas. Would recommend to anyone going to the city.

Absolutely Awesome. This was our introduction to Budapest and I dare say, it couldn't be better. Our instructor (it's a pity I forgot his name, I'm so very sorry mate) was cheerful, knowledgeable and patient. He got us in sync with the segways in no time and off we went whirring away through Budapest. Our instructor was genuinely warm and passionate about his work, and his recommendations held us in good stead for the rest of our four day trip. Highly recommended...

Fun way to see the city. We went with our 10 year old, who loves Segways, really great way to see the city. Thomas our guide was great, fun and informative. Would definitely recommend to cut down on walking.The Segaway route is not challenging apart from the odd kerb.

The bike tour was amazing!. Barbara was our tour guide and she was so enthusiastic about her city! So knowledgeable and eager to share her knowledge. There wasn't anything she did not know! My mother and I were blessed with a beautiful day and it was tour, I never would have seen so much by walking! Highly recommend this tour!

The best way to know the city. I like a lot the experience. I wasn't sure to take it but a friend of mine encouraged me, and OMG it was one the best experiences ever. Funny, interesting and had a great guide called Thomas.

Experience breathtaking Budapest on a bicycle. Budapest is a charming and beautiful city -- but it's also big and there's a lot of ground to cover if you only have a few days. We took this tour our first full day in town, and what a wonderful way to get a sense of the city and a feel for the rich and intricate history of the area. Brigit, our guide, was friendly, personable and very insightful. She helped to make this a very enjoyable and enlightening experience. Our starting point was the Opera House and from there we biked down Andrássy Avenue, a world heritage site and the Champs-Élysées of Budapest. We visited statues, parks, gardens, and baths. We biked across the Danube and back on two different bridges and rode past the impressive Parliament building, all while gaining an understanding of the culture from Brigit. The bike lanes are wide and well marked which makes it easy to follow the guide and gaze at the sites. There's even a refreshment stop along the way where we sampled the many flavors of Hungarian Strudel.The company no longer bikes up to the castle in Buda, so you will only experience Pest, but it's well worth it and highly recommended.

The Best Fun!. I have to say I wasn't sure about this, having seen Segway tours before it didn't look like my cup of tea. This was absolutely brilliant. The tour guide Patrick was very knowledgeable and relaxed.All in all the most recommended thing to do in Budapest
Great Guide. A great company - used them in Prague too. Guide very competent, training good and Segways all well maintained. Most enjoyable way to see the city

Great way to see Budapest. My first experience on a Segway.... we all had a quick tutorial to get going but itd easy to pick up. The tour guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. This is a great way to cover a some fab landmarks and learn the history in a short space of time. Aside from how FUN the actual segways are (They a de-restricted - unlike in some other major cities!!). We traveled in late December and it was minus 6 that day! Safe to say we were very cold but the experience and tour is worth every penny
Very goid service . Recomend this sagway place good people and guids good equipment we had a nice rour of the city and tgey help us to learen for the first time

A great experience!. It was our first experience riding a Segway! We were too nervous and didn't know what to expect, out tour guide (Thomas) was great with everything! He had all the patience showing us how to ride the segway and the tour itself was great, he knows all interesting data of the city, deffinitely a must when visiting Budapest

Brilliant and fun!. Best thing we did in Budapest! If you haven't been on a Segway yet, what the heck have you been doing?! So much fun and such an easy and efficient way to get around all the best bits of the city. I would highly highly recommend the evening one, parlament and the basilica look BEAUTIFUL in the dusk! Our tour guide Andy was informative, funny and gave us a lot of great information and freedom on the segways! She was great!!! Thanks Andy, you made a great night even better!

Fantastic Tour. We took the 3 hour tour and agree with previous reviews...your feet are very sore at the end but well worth it...brilliant way to see the city. Christy, our guide, was first class and made sure we were all confident on the Segway before we started. She is very knowledgeable and answered any questions we asked, stopping several times at various sites whilst she told us some history and background info of the sites. This really is a good way to see the city and cannot recommend the tour enough. The last hour of the tour was fun as we went up to Heroes Square and the surrounding park...loved it thoroughly enjoyable and best way to see the city

Segway is the solution to speed-up city tour. Segway is always my choice of 'speed-up city tour' especially on short term country visits. So I had quite an experience in all around the world. I absolutely recommend the 3 hours tour over 2 hours. It can be a bit exhausting but I'd be sorry if I had missed the sites we visited the last hour. A word for the tour guide as well: George was very knowlegable about the history, city and even trends. He was a kind, communicative guide, I believe made the tour even enjoyable. Thank you for the experienced and professional service.

Fabulous Segway Tour. I took the Yellow Zebra Evening Segway tour. Our guide, Kriszti, was wonderful, informative and lots of fun. Yellow Zebra is very focused on safety -- we were given lessons on riding the Segways before we started the tour and had to wear helmets.This is definitely a great way to see Budapest!!!!

Entertaining and engaging . We were a couple on a tour with 10 others. Our guide, Tomas was a superstar.He was extremely knowledgable, passionate and entertaining. Throughout the tour he would explain the history and importance at all stops with clarity and feeling.Tomas made the tour fun by running a pop quiz related to the various locations and hungarian history.We would definitely reccomend this tour. A fun and informative way to explore Budapest and learn more about the city.

Segways are the best!!!. Segways are the only way to travel! Our tour guide Andi sang us the hungarian national athem in front of the opera house which was very cool and brave of her! She took us to Margaret island which would've been quite a trek by foot but super fun on a segway. The segways were so easy to use and such a great way to get around the city. Highly recommended!!!

Great way to see Budapest (Yellow Zebra Segway and Walking tour). I tried Segway for the first time, and Yellow Zebra made me an expert in a few minutes. I took their afternoon Segway Tour, the Evening Segway Tour and Morning Walking tours, and I believe the combination of these 3 were the best way to see the city. Extremely helpful guides and staff. I highly recommend Yellow Zebra. Thanks to George, Kinga, Brigit and all the staff. Keep up the good work. Huzayf

Excellent tour - fun and worth the money!. Me and my friend had booked Segway tour, 3pm one.Although it was a bit pricey....we really hoped it will be worth the money... and it was!Segways are safe and fun way to move around and we got to see quite a few different places + history behind it. It was very informative but also fun.Our tour guide was Józsi - what a legend!! He made sure if we had any questions, it was answered and he was very knowledgeable and a genuinely nice guy. He does such a good job.I will definitely be back in Budapest as I want to see more of the places he mentioned and pointed out during his tour and if anyone wants to have a tour of most important places to see in Budapest - book this!

Yellow Zebra Segway Tour. The Yellow Zebra Segway Tour was recently recommended to me by a close friend, and I couldn't have been happier with her for recommending it. From the first moment we arrived the staff were more than helpful (mostly helping by assuring my mother that the Segways were not at all dangerous). During the training session our guide was helpful, calm, and patient. Before long we were zipping along, feeling more comfortable with each passing minute. At each stop along the way, the tour guide shared some information that felt as though it was a little more detailed than your usual tour. It felt as though we were getting a behind the scenes look at one of the most beautiful cities in the world. The knowledge was specific, local, and, above all, interesting. I left the tour feeling as though I understood what Budapest was all about. I would highly recommend the tour for anybody who wants to a) scratch a segway tour off their bucket list, and b) anybody who wants to know more than they ever thought possible about the crown jewel of Central Europe.
So much fun . My husband and I have always wanted to go on a segways and what a great time to do it! Saw some lovely sites and had so much fun whizzing around the streets of budapest!

Bike tour, segway tour, and pub crawl in Budapest with Yellow Zebra. Last week we made online reservations directly with Yellow Zebra and signed up for a 4-hour bike tour of Budapest (11-3pm) and Pub Crawl (9pm-1am) on Tuesday, followed by a Segway tour (4:00-5:30) on Wednesday. We arrived for our bike tour on time and had a great experience with our tour guide Gabor Szabo! He was very well-informed and knows the city's history very well and makes it an enjoyable experience for everyone. Our group was very diverse and he was able to answer all of our questions and provide his opinion when asked about various political organizations in Hungary. He was kind enough to write down a few good Hungarian wine suggestions and authentic Hungarian restaurants near our apartment. We followed his suggestions which were absolutely perfect! The bikes were comfortable and the tour itself was interesting and not too exertive (for those of you that don't like to exercise too much...you will survive). I think it is best to do this tour on the first or second day of your trip. After the tour was over I double checked that the meeting point for the pub crawl that evening was "meeting point number 1" (as I was told when I made my reservation last week). It was lucky I asked because the meeting point was not where we were originally told and in fact we needed to go to a church (nowhere near the original meeting "point #1") and wait on the steps for our guide. I was then told that they don't do the pub crawl anymore so maybe they source it out...I'm not sure? Confusing and not very well organized ... The pub crawl itself was enjoyable and we had a VERY cool tour guide (I can't remember her name) who recommended various places in the city for us to visit based on our interests. The free drink provided at each bar was a joke (basically a tiny drop of vodka mixed with some form of fruit juice) as I was expecting something authentic/Hungarian etc... but it didn't REALLY matter as you can order additional drinks as you wish...but just need to pay for them. The bars they selected were pretty cool and provided us with a good sample of the local Ruin Pubs here in Budapest. Most of the people of the tour were in their 20's...we were by far the oldest...but it wasn't at all weird. Today was our Segway tour of the Buda side and we decided to go to the Yellow Zebra office again this morning just to confirm the meeting point - and AGAIN it was different from what we read when we made our reservations just last week. We had to change our afternoon plans because the meeting point was actually in Buda on the hill...not in Pest next to the Opera. In the end our tour guide for our Segway trip "Andi" created such a great experience that we will never forget. She was very professional and asked us a lot of questions so she could tailor the tour based on our interest level (i.e. more interested in history...or more interested in just having fun with the segway). It was our first time riding a Segway and she was able to show us quickly everything that we needed to know in order to be able to drive the Segway with confidence! :) She was super informative and able to provide all those interesting details and stories that make Budapest such an interesting place to visit. If you book a Segway tour with Yellow Zebra and want to learn a lot about the history - ask for Andi - she is the best! The tour guides on our bike tour, bar crawl, and segway tour were VERY good. However out of three tours booked with Yellow Zebra...they provided me with the incorrect meeting location and if it wasn't for the fact that I happened to ask them in person once we arrived in Budapest - we could have missed two out of three tours!!! When I kindly pointed out that other tourist like myself might be having the same problem - the girl at the front desk said she would be sure to forward the information to the people who are in charge of reservations. There was no formal apology that twice we were misinformed and no sign that they were sorry. I wasn't going to write a review, but I had to just because our tour guides deserve recognition for the great job they are doing. If I could.... I would give 5 stars for the tour guides and 1 star for the company, but that is not possible. So if you book with Yellow Zebra - just confirm you have the right meeting location! I think Yellow Zebra is overstretched and no longer deserves to keep the great reputation that they had in the past when they were just focusing on doing the bike tours. Now it seems like they are trying to do everything without the resources and have so many different companies covering so many different tourist entertainment/tour options that you don't know who you are really working with in the end.

Great way to see the city on bike. I have taken walking tours as well as bus tours but this was my first experience with a bike tour. What was I thinking in the past. It is such a fun way to get around and see the city with little exertion. Our Guide was excellent and was very knowledgeable about the history of the city and the region. This is a must when you come to Budapest!

A wheelie historic tour. Our daughter booked this segway tour of Budapest for us, something we wouldn't have booked ourselves but so glad she did, it was the BEST morning exploring, we had so much fun, laughing, enjoying the group and seeing the sights on two wheels. The segway is easy to manage, you're given a lesson and all ages can master it within a few minutes. Booked in the UK you pay commission but book it there (behind the opera house) is cheaper. Its safe and fun. The tour was 2 hours, extended to 2 1/2 by Victor who was extremely knowledgeable of the city and land marks but gave a deeply thought provoking touching talk on the last 100 years of Budapest and how his descendants from his parents back were affected by the communist regime, the wars, Nazi occupation etc, eye opening! This tour is great for the family, sensational historic tour with Victor who was the perfect guide. High;y recommend that you book this not only in Budapest but any city. Fantastic fun activity with history, it has it all for every age group. Than you Victor and we wish you well for your future.

Fantastic organisation and really friendly. The highlight of my recent trip to Budapest was the Segway tour with Yellow Zebra.. These guys makes you feel welcome, provide Segway training and off you around the city. They provide historical context in a fun context. Before long we were whizzing around town. We took the extended tour which was a good 3 hours. Well worth the extra payment and nothing was rushed. I'd strongly recommend Yellow Zebra and definately go with them again.

Segways Rock. The segway your is a great way to see any city. It's easy to do and good fun. The groups mostly comprised segway veterans and with one lady on her first experience who was a little nervous. With help from our guide George she was very soon whizzing around with the rest of us. George is a local and was open and honest about his city which he loves. It was a great tour which we very much enjoyed.

nice folks, variety of tours, used English and other language books. they will hook you up. there are bikes, several types of tours, maps and a used English language book store here. The staff speaks English and some French and is quite helpful. This is a good place to find.

Segway: nice introduction to Budapest. Very nice way to make a first contact with the city. The guide spoke a very fine English and she was very friendly and smiling. It's a sightseeing tour so you have to expect to stop regularly and explanations. I wouldn't recommend it if you are more interested in segway than budapest :-)

Segways!! What an amazing way to tour a city!!. Just come back from a long weekend break (4 days) to Budapest, Hungary. Our first full day we got up promptly and went off for our 3 hour Segway Tour of the Pest side of the city.Our tour guide was Balazs, and he immediately put us at ease. I was a little concerned I would not be able to pick the art of driving one of these quickly, but I need not have worried. There were only 7 people in our group including my husband and I and we all picked it up very quickly. We had about half an hours training, which was just right.We then set off on the 2 hour tour. I really recommend this tour early on during your time in the city as it allows you to see so much in a short space of time. therefore if there are any areas you feel you would like to re visit, you can at a later time.Our guide seemed to be very knowledgeable and was very patient with us never rushing us on before we were ready. He also spoke very good English. He also seemed to time the tour just right with getting at certain places at the right time!!!We returned to the shop after 2 hours, had a little rest etc. and said goodbye to 2 people in our group who had only booked 2 hours. They were told that they could continued if they wished, but they chose not to as they were cold. I should mention here that I was absolutely shaking with the cold but was having such fun, it really didn't seem to matter!!We then went on for the rest of the tour.We left him, wanting longer and wanting to buy a segway over here. If only they were legal!At the end Balazs, told us about the other cities they do this in and I only have one criticism of him, and that is he did not tell us we could do a tour on a segway up on the Buda side of Pest!!!! And we only found this out when we had already walked round half of it.To some up!! The highlight of our weekend!!!

Beware:Zebra's website itinerary and prices are wrong/outdated. After studying several bike tour companies, we chose Zebra tours specifically for it's 3 1/2 to 4 hour Budapest bike tour which goes all around town then "we ride up the hill to the Royal Palace...the old castle district streets to the Matthias Church...and Fisherman's Bastion..Next is the reward we all rode up for , the ride back down" (quote from their website) Though I am young and in good shape, I have a foot problem, but I can, and do, bike anywhere!
