So we chose this tour so we wouldn't have to walk all the areas in the above quote. About two thirds of the way through the tour we found out that we weren't going there. First they denied it was on their website. Then, once confronted with the fact that it is on their website, they claimed it was because their website is "under construction". The prices are off, too...Their website says if you book online it is 21 euros, but you are actually billed 22.50, that's not a big deal, but those two things together, to me, means either they are being purposefully deceitful, or just plain too lazy to correct their website. What a shame, because their tour guide was great, but I would have made other arrangements if I had known that I would end up missing the whole Buda side of Budapest..

Books, Bikes and More. Tucked in a side street behind the grand Opera House, this facility offers much in the way of rentals and patrons always seem satisfied. Over the years I have frequented Yellow Zebra to avail myself of the many used books they sell. They will also buy a book you have read during your stay and no longer wish to lug around. Books cost about 3 euro, kids books a bit more.The proprietor, Tunde, seems always eager to please. It is a delightful spot if you want to escape the hot sun as it is shaded and you can enjoy coffee, soft drinks and snacks.

Worth the wait. Since the Segway was introduced I have wanted to have a go, and finally 14 years later I could be bothered to actually do it. Great fun and so manoeuvrable! Plus the tour with George was illuminating and entertaining. 5 stars, would Segway again.

Segways are the way to see Budapest. A segway tour was something that we as a family had been wanting to do since we knew we were going to Budapest and this was not a disappointment.After a short training period, along with our guide we were let loose on the streets of Pest, making our way via the landmarks to Margaret island, where we were able to really let loose. In the two hours slot we saw the sights of the Pest side apart from Heroes Square, showing the speed and efficiency that Segways offer.It was not a cheap option, but Yellow Zebra was by far the cheapest in Budapest and it was a great experience. The staff were helpful and knowledgeable on the tour.I will be looking for a segway tour in every city i got to from now on.

The best tour I have experienced. We are a group in our early twenties and loved it. A fantastic way to see all the sites whilst not tiring your self out walking. The cycle was a perfect relaxing speed.George was our tour guide and he was excellent. Each talk was interesting and informative with the occasional funny joke. Hungary has such a rich history and the beauty of Budapest is second to none. I will now to every bike tour of the city I visit has one!

brilliant!. the people there are all very nice and helpful! the Ladies are really sweet and today we did a tour with Tàmas, and it was great! he was so nice, and ready to help, a real pleasure!les gens de yellowzebra sont vraiment cool et très sympas! ce qui aide beaucoup! les demoiselles sont sympa et Tàmas avec qui nous avons fait le tour est très cool! çà vaut le détour.

Extraordinary tour guide and experience for the whole family!. Victor the tour guide was wonderful, informative, friendly, interesting and was able to connect our family of 5 with the beauty, splendor and fascinating history of Budapest.
Great tour of Budapest. This tour was fun and a nice way to take in the city. Our tour guide, George, was very friendly and took us along the safe routes. I would recommend this tour to others!

Fantastic tour - thanks George. Brilliant way of seeing a lot Budapest quickly. I was worried that it might be a bit too long but time flys when your having fun! Our guide, George was really knowledgeable and was able to answer all of our questions. The pit-stop for strudels & drinks was a nice touch (included in the price of the tour) I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest.

The only way is Segway!. Fantastic way to see the city as well as being great fun and easy to do! Our guide Viktor was superb - really friendly and very knowledgeable, able to answer all our questions and make great recommendations. We did a tour from the shop, up round the City Park area and down to the Great Synagogue which helped us figure out where everything was. A definite must do!

Very disappointed. My friend and I had booked online before our holiday to go on the Segway tour. Arrived fine and had a practice for half an hour. We found it strange at first but had got the hang of it. We both were practising, however my friend got into a corner. The tour guide told her she had to get off and in front of the whole group was told she couldn't go on the tour. This was very strange as she'd just been practising fine when the guide had been tending to others in the group. It was very embarrassing and upsetting. No refund was given. So be warned you can get refused to go on the tour. We were offered bikes, however this was not what we paid for.
The only way is Segway. Great trip and great fun. We visited all the major sights on the Pest side. Lots of fun Segwaying around the city - you see as much as walking but get around much faster.

Excellent way to see the city. A very enjoyable tour. I would recommend it to others as a must do. It would be best to do the tour at the beginning of your stay as it will give you an idea of the city layout. The segways are very easy to drive and are great fun. George was our informative, helpful and funny gudie. He really did make the tour very enjoyable for us.

Awesome hen party activity. We had a brilliant time segwayying with bernadette. Her knowledge and conversational style about budapest was friendly and informative. Although nervous at first, the Segway lesson put us at ease and by the end of the tour we wish we could keep them all day! A great way of seeing the main landmarks of budapest and gaining some knowledge from a local tour guide. Also with a large element of fun!

Fun and entertaining. Definitely the best way to get introduced to Budapest, and learn a couple of things while enjoying those amazing Segways! Köszönöm to Bernadette, our adorable guide for sharing her interest for this city with us while looking after us!

Segway tour was AWESOME! Best way to see Budapest. We initially booked the 2 hr segway tour and had so much fun we ended up going another hr to see more of the city. This was by far the best activity we did in Budapest. Our tour guide was excellent if a little soft spoken, but her English and local knowledge was great.Automotive and pedestrian traffic were very respectful of our Segway tour and gave plenty of room. The machines are extremely intuitive and after 5 min everybody in our group was comfortable and having a great time. I can't recommend this tour enough, a must do activity if you want to see Budapast up close!

Amazing way to see Budapest . Fab way to see Budapest. This now has become the first thing we do, book a cycling tour. Such a good way to cover a lot of ground and get lots of interesting information.Thanks Laszlo, your knowledge was second to non, such an informative tour, it was great fun. Wish we could have carried on ......and on......Don't hesitate to do this tour, you certainly won't regret it.

Great tour and wonderful way of seeing the city!!. I booked this tour on Viator when I was visiting the city last September and I am so glad that I did! We rode around the main areas of Buda & Pest and half way through we stopped at a restaurant for a snack and some drinks. We had great views all around and our guide Thomas was fantastic! Will definitely recommend to friends that will be visiting in the future.

fantastic experience. We had seen the segway tours advertised and thought we would check them out. Some of us were nervous about being able to control the segway but decided to bite the bullet. Our tour guide, Anna, was fantastic and very patient and took the time to make sure we were comfortable before commencing. We took the two hour trip which is mostly pedestrianised. By the time it was over we felt like experts and have found our next Christmas presents lol. If you get the chance to try this out you won't be disappointed.

Segway tour of budapest. This the way to enjoy a lovely and historic city there was 6 of us and all in late fifties and are all now Segway fans yellow zebra were very good especially Anna our guide who was very attentive and knowledgeable .We would all do it again with Anna nuff said 5star

Fun filled feel for Budapest. With experience of Segway tours we (couple 40s-50s) booked in UK prior to arriving in Hungary via Viator.Easy to find using Budapest map app on mobile phone- but right by Opera House so not difficult to find.We were given a warm welcome and introduced to our guide and mentor Laszlo who took our previous experience in to account. We were incredibly fortunate to visit early in the season and be the only 2 booked in- so a personal tour- wherever we wanted to go. Laszlo gave several suggestions and we chose music/theatre/opera district and travelled to Heroes Square, Park and as far as the Zoo.We were out for a good 2 hours + after ensuring we were competent on the Segways. Adequate instruction given and helmets provided. If you can stand and shift your weight- you can Segway.Attraction for us is the amount of ground you can cover in the time - we estimate we covered 6 km in a couple of hours.The Segways are in great condition- we were not at all concerned for our safety due to the quality of the kit.Laszlo showed interest in us as a couple, our background and lives- judging what sites would interest us. He guided us around, watching for our safety, and giving educated, relevant information on various buildings, architecture, historic events and influential characters from history both political and cultural. What made it special was that it was tailored to our needs, offered- not forced- we did not feel lectured or talked at. We felt that we had fallen on our feet, meeting a friendly local, gifted with so much knowledge of his home city and culture and willing to share it with us.Great tour- would thoroughly recommend- all ages and would suit most abilities. Give it a go- so much fun and the envy of walking tourist!

Yellow Zebra - hidden Budapest Tour. I live here, but I always had a feeling that I am missing a lot from the beauty and interesting spots in Budapest. So, I decided to take The Yellow Zebra new tour of "Hidden Budapest". Well, I can only say that after this tour I love this city even more! You will see a real hidden treasures on this tour: architectural (hidden) "pearls of Budapest", interesting spots related to troublesome history and important people of Hungary, cool places to hang around... Tamas was our guide, and he was absolutely superb! He was friendly, passionate, enthusiastic... just what you want from your tour guide. Well done!

Segway tour. Our guide was George, he was very informative and spoke English well. Took only minutes to learn how to use the machines. If you've never been on a Segway before give one of these tours a shot .... You'll love it

A great experience. Booked with three other girlfriends. All a bit anxious prior to our experience but we were given a good introduction, safety advice and time to get used to the Segway prior to our sight seeing tour. The guide was brilliant, he showed us all the sights and shared interesting facts about Budapest. The Segways were great fun and we had a brilliant three hours. It got a bit cold by the end of the tour so wrap up warm and gloves are essential. A great introduction to Budapest whilst having great fun. Robert was our guide, spoke good English, was patient and informative. Highly recommended.

best wat to see the whole city!!!!. a must do tour! we got to see the whole city city. all the historical sites. on a segaway.. was the best idea our tour guide robert made stops at certain sites and showed explain ta little history or each stop. exellent and imformative.

Good bikes and service. We rented 6 bikes for a day, we received a lock, two baskets and 6 lights without charge. The bikes are a real good quality and the people of the shop where very friendly and helpful.Good service deserves a good review!Thanks we will be back!

Great Experience Thanks to Tour Guide TAMAS & Yellow Segways Budapest. Segway rental or Segway tour in Budapest was on our mind for a while. And finally on our weekend away I was presented with an option "we are doing it". I am always scared of unknown that involves speed and not standing on my own two feet, so sure enough I was really anxious. When we arrived, our tour guide Tamas (Thomas) greeted us with a friendly smile and great energy, that anyone could envy... First we went through 30 min training on Segways. One by one we were shown and had to repeat some exercises from simplest move forward to jumping on and off the barrier. Tamas was great teacher. Explained everything in detail wrapping it into a humour for everyone's entertainment. In things like that the professionalism of the teacher is very important. It did not take us half an hour, just 20 minutes later we were all standing on our own Segways ready for a Segway Tour of Budapest. After proving to be a great teacher, Tamas was even better as a tour guide. Knowing history very well, he was explaining it in entertaining manner, with a questions and quizzes in between joyful rides on the streets of Budapest. Later on, after the tour, Tamas recommended us some great restaurants in the area, we were staying. We have visited 3 out of 4 recommended and each was worth recommendation. The whole experience was really amazing. Even cold weather didn't affect us too much. All I can add is - I highly recommend it, even if you are afraid for step on a Segway for the first time. If you can get Tamas as your tour guide, you will absolutely enjoy it! Thanks to Tamas & Yellow Zebra Segways Budapest for this great Segway Tour & experience! Looking forward to doing it again, next time we are in Budapest. Jurgita & Kieron (Ireland)

Great fun and informative . We booked in advance and Thomas was our tour guide. It was our 1st time on a Segway and despite being very concerned about my ability, Thomas was reassuring and it was fairly easy to pick up once you've had a try solo (with supervision from Thomas of course). The tour was informative and a really fun way to view the sights! I cannot wait to Segway again and cannot recommend Thomas and his company enough!!! A must try!!!!
Fabulous and Must Try. Tried the Segway tour from Yellow Zebra ... Loved it .. Must try .. The staff are great and extremely helpful Incase u have any apprehensions !

Segway is the only way!. What an amazing experience! I have never been on a segway before but soon picked it up thanks to the short tutorial before we set off.Our tour guide (I feel terrible fogetting his name, he has a very small baby and has the same name as one of the statues in heroes square!!) Was brilliant, extremely knowledgeable and very friendly, he gave us plenty of time to take in the beautiful sights of Budapest as well as answering any questions we had.The tour was perfectly timed in the winter sun but you really need to wrap up warm to keep the draft away. This really is the only way to cover such a vast amount of the city and is such fun, I will never do a city tour using my boring feet again!! Thank you Yellow Zebra, you were awesome!!

Great staff, great tour!. My friends were in Budapest so we decided to do a segway tour. This is truely the best way to see the city.The staff at Discover Budapest was reall, nice with us. Reka and Szabi was really helpful!

Only way to Fly. I cannot understand why you would want to tour Budapest any other way. Everything is a 5 min bike ride away from the center of town. We kept our bikes for four days and were able to travel freely all over the city. We felt safe as there were plenty of bike lanes. We did use sidewalks often which did not seem to be an issue. the staff was friendly and suggested several routs for us to see the sites. We DID NOT get a tour but I would suggest getting one on the first day to get a lay of the land.

Fabulous. What a great way to start a holiday. Never been on a Segway before but that was no problem. Clear introduction and training given then off we went. Our guide Thomas was really knowledgeable and fun and spoken excellent English. Thoroughly recommend.

Enjoyable way to see the sights. The segways were awesome and made it so much fun to get around and see the sights! At first I was worried about them but after having a lesson on using them it felt just as natural as riding a bike! Our tour guide, George, had a lot of knowledge about the city and made us all feel at ease on the segways. Highly recommended!

Best Thing To Do. I can't remember her name but we had a lady take us (there was 6 in total) around the city centre sights including the Parliament building.We had a quick introduction and safety talk, then a quick learn on the segways and once everyone was happy off we went. It feels so unnatural at first but after 10 minutes you'll be grinning like a loon!Some segways have hand bar mittens so if it's cold, make sure you grab one of those, such as the one called Thomas!Our tour guide was easy to speak to, she took a few pics of us when asked to and knew a lot about Budapest.We're very happy we took this tour!

Awesome! . A really professional and fun tour. The segways are awesome and you get to see all parts of Pest. We had Christy and she was very good. Recommended things for us to do whilst learning more about the culture and history of Budapest. Would recommend and ask for Christy if you can. Don't worry about not knowing how to use one as you have training before going out!

So much fun!. Really good fun, first times on Segways and they were really good. The tour was interesting too, lots of interesting facts and got to see a lot of the main attractions in the city centre. Tour guide Tomas was very friendly and patient and made the tour enjoyable
Really enjoyable. We did this tour 2 weeks ago.. Our guide was Brigit. She was lovely and full of knowledge of your beautiful city. Would highly recommend :)

Brilliant Segway Tour. Had an amazing experience on Segways led by George, was so much fun and learnt so much about the city. The tour was fascinating, interactive and enjoyable and couldn't throughly reccomend it. Thank you for a wonderful experience. Alex & Victoria

Brilliant!. We had never been on a Segway before but after 20 minutes of excellent instruction we were off for a really interesting trip around Pest. Our guide, Robert was very entertaining and extremely knowledgable. Do not visit this lovely city without experiencing a Segway Tour, you won't regret it, whatever your age.

Bike Rental. With my friend had a spontaneous idea to rent a bike to see as much possible from Budapest in one day. Thanks to that nice girl who suggested this place (she gave out flyers for sightseeing tour bus on Andrassy ut.)There was nice and friendly girl who greeted us and in understandable language explained policy for bike rental. From my (as tourist) point of view prices are acceptable, especially the deposit amount.We were given comfortable and lightweight bikes (with zebra in the front wheel).Renting a bike was the best idea ever, we saw places from Opera till Vaci street, over Liberty bridge up to the top of Gellert Hill and then to the Royal Palace and Matthias Church, over the Chain bridge back to the rental (behind the Opera).What a ride!In the rental now we were greeted with a friendly guy, who was positively surprised for all the places we have seen.The warmest greetings from Latvia and best wishes in the New Year to Reka and Szabi.

Incredible Fun. Our instructor was Thomas who shared his vast knowledge of Budapest and it's history with humour and engaging enthusiasm.We were a group of 5 and all had a quick and efficient tutorial and once Thomas was satisfied we were all safe to operate the Segways off we went!There is a lot of flexibility in the tour as we were all asked what we'd like to do, see or learn about.I was terrified before hopping on and thought id made a terrible mistake but Thomas was excellent and re-assuring, always checking everyone was safe and out of danger.Would definitely use again, such a shame Segways cant be used on London roads !

Segways were fun, but the tour guide was unimpressive. My friend and I took the Segway tour of the Buda Castle area. We had a lot of fun using the segways and zipping around. However the guide for our private tour was not very knowledgeable. When we asked questions about the monuments in the area the tour guide could not give anything more than superficial information.

So much fun!. We had a Segway tour with George and it was brilliant! The Segways were easier to pick up than we expected and a fun way of seeing the city. George was an excellent guide, very knowledgeable and amusing too. I can definitely recommend a Segway tour and Yellow Zebra Tour company.

Brilliant way to see the city. We booked the bike tour for our first morning and had a great time. It was a cold morning and it turned out only myself and my wife were booked but that made it all the better. Our guide Robi was excellent and both passionate and enthusiastic about his home city and ensuring we had a good time. He made us feel completely at ease cycling through the city on the bike lanes and was a fund of information and facts. We went to Heroes' Square and the City Park and then across the Danube on the Chain Bridge and up to the Castle (not a hard climb). Our tour also included a welcome stop at the Strudel Shop for coffee and some strudel. All in all a great time that was well worth it and helped us decide on how to spend the rest of our time. The staff in the shop (just behind the Opera House) were lovely to deal with as well.

Nice way to cover the city in 3.5 hours. We took the Bike Tour around Budapest and covered a lot of ground in 3.5 hours. I recommend taking this ride on one of the first days you are in the city.The guide will give you history and show you the exteriors of monuments, buildings, etc. It's a nice way to figure out where you want to spend more time or what buildings you want to go back and see the interior.The bike ride is tailored to all skill levels and takes enough breaks that it's not strenous at all.Make a reservation as tours can sell out.

Segway tour - a great way to start your trip to Budapest. Anna, our tour guide, gave our group of 5 people excellent training on the Segways before we started the tour, so we all felt confident before we really got going. We covered lots of ground, and Anna pointed out many interesting sites along the way - a few of which we re-visited later in our trip. It was a great way to get a feel for the layout of the city, so it's a good idea to book it right at the beginning. We did feel really cold after a while, as you don't need to move very much to operate the Segways, so I would recommend putting on an extra layer of clothing. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Yellow Zebra Segway Tours.

Amazing. We arrived at the offices and found that my partner and I would be having a private bike tour with George, who was really brilliant with his knowledge of the history of the whole city. He then took us on a really rewarding ride through such a beautiful city, especially the climb up the hill towards the unbelievable castle. This is incredible value for the price, and not just for the reason above. The bikes are much better quality than any other bike tours we have done, and included in the price is a coffee and pastry break at a strudel house which was much better than we expected. Make this the first thing you do in Budapest, as it really makes sense of what can at first be a confusing city layout.

Fantastic!! Fab way to see the city!. My boyfriend and I went on the morning tour on Sunday and thoroughly enjoyed it! We were a group of 4 and Anna took us aorund. The Segway was great fun, and after the training it was really easy to use. We have the chance to explore lots of the city at a fast pace, as well as some time at the end to whizz around on our own. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Great fun and lots of laughs :-)

Great way to explore the city. Please note it is worthy to book the tour online, as there is quite a discount when you do so.The 4 hours tour covers most significant landmarks of the city and is of a great help in getting your first impression of the city. Also there is a nice stop for coffee + desert included in price. Gabor, our guide, was very fun and attentive to the group. When our friend managed to go missing, he returned back for her and even found her, which was very impressive =) If you enjoy riding a bike that would be a great opportunity to explore Budapest.

Wonderful overview of the city. My husband and I were part of a group of 8 on a bike tour on October 20, 2014 with George. We had a blast! It was a great way to get an overview of the city and George's enthusiasm was infectious. The snack stop in the middle was delightful and more than we expected. We will definitely do another tour with Yellow Zebra (and George!) next time we're in Budapest.

Excellent way to explore the city!. My partner and I had a 2 hour private tour with the lovely Christy. We actually missed the afternoon group tours but staff were really helpful and hooked us up with a private tour for a slightly high cost.The segway was really easy to use and Christy was a fantastic guide. We saw loads of the major sites and learnt a fair bit about the city- the time just flew by!In all a really great way to understand the layout of the city!

Great bike tour of Budapest. Took a 4 hour tour, I was the only one to show so had a private tour. Christy was my guide...it really shows when someone loves their work. She was incredibly knowledgeable in Hungary, history, culture , politics, geography. Very pleasant girl, excellent English and a real pleasing personality.Covered all major sights and adaptable if requested.Thanks Christy, see you in '96Dave

Sedways the ultimate fun way to see the city. We did the yellow zebra Segway tour of budapest. It was such a great way to see the city and have fun at the same time. The guide was very professional and made sure we all had individual training time and helmet were provided. One tip I would give is take so gloves to wear.

Yellow Zebra Bike Tour - Budapest. We had an awesome bike tour! Our guide, Tomas, was very knowledgeable and fun! And our group was perfect - everyone was on the same page and we were zipping all around Budapest. Not only did we get a good workout, we had a great time and learned a lot of Hungarian history!

Segway tour. Nice folks. I dont normally take tours, but accompanied others on this trip.Price is seemingly high, but it's 100% in-line with competing operators in the city. So no complaints there.Office located conveniently central. Right off of metro stop. All staff and tour guide very nice people, and knowledgeable.Only downside - and not particularly anyone's fault - is that there isn't much to digest in a 2 hours tour. You get some good information but it's barely barely scratching the surface.DO A LONGER TOUR if you truly want to start to learn about budapest.

Segway Tour of Budapest. Yellow Zebra Tours at Budapest provided excellent servce and a memorable segway tour for the family. Their flexibility in handling a last minute reservation and their overall customer servide was great. The tour, lead by Tomas, was great. Tomas provided excellent insights and information along the way, as well as great instruction in order to get the most out of the Segway experience as well as the tour of Budapest experience. Thanks to all at Yellow Zebra for making the tour a great part of our overall Budapest experience!
like : ). the service was great the price was decent and the bikes where excelelnt.you have to know that you have to leave cash deposit for each bikes (around 35 EUR)

Budapest Bike Tour. Our tour guide Anna was brilliant, she knew so much about the country's history and gave us a really good insight into the city's past and present which made our trip that much more interesting and put the monuments in context for us. I'd say that exploring the city by bike is best as you can cover a lot of ground whilst also receiving an individualised tour. Anna made sure we all had our questions answered and gave us lots of tips about where to go to make the most out of our trip. Learnt some really cool things that we just wouldn't have without a local person's perspective! Recommended, even in the colder autumn months (just remember to take gloves!!) :)

Perfect Introduction to Budapest!. We decided to take a bike tour on our first full day in Budapest. We have done this before and find it a great way to get the history and background of the city together with our bearings for the remainder of the stay.We booked our tour online to guarantee our places, this also saved us 25%. Instead of 28 euro for each adult we paid 21 euro after discount. This is for a 4 hour tour inclusive of a trip to a café for drinks and strudel. Children are 12 euro or 9 euro with discount.The daily tour starts at 11am and we turned up at 10.45am for an introduction by our guide Tomas who spoke impeccable English. All bikes are sized to suit and helmets are available. At first glance the roads of Budapest appear quite manic, but, there are extensive cycle paths and in many places cycles are separated from the main traffic system. We had our 12 year old daughter with us and we never had any concerns for her safety. Our tour consisted of 7 people plus Tomas. Tomas worked hard to keep the group together and ensured we were fully aware of any crossing points which were busy or difficult to negotiate.The tour lasted 4 1/2 hours and involved a lot of cycling interspersed with regular cultural/historical updates from Tomas. Thomas was quite happy to cycle at a pace dictated by the group however everyone on our trip was reasonably fit and the pace was brisk. The trip includes a visit to Buda Castle district which necesitates climbing over 90m in a relatively short distance. You need to be reasonably fit to get the most out of this tour and I would also recommend taking water as this is a 4 hour trip and it is easy to dehydrate, our group did stop to buy water half way up the hill to Buda castle.Thomas was an excellent guide, exceptionally knowledgeable, friendly and enthusiastic. We had a very enjoyable day and could not recommend this highly enough!

AWESOME TIME!. Just got back to the hotel after a really great bike tour in Budapest. Christy, our guide was brilliant. The group of 10 were all English/Irish and her use of the English language was superb. For someone so young her knowledge of Hungarian history was first class. We learned a great deal from her. Most of the tour was on quiet streets/cycle lanes and even when we had to ride on a main road, a cycle lane was clearly marked so we never felt unsafe. In fact the only dangerous moment came when we cycled in front of the Parliament building and were promptly told off by armed guards! I would definitely recommend this excursion.

Great time!. We had really good time on bike tour. Our tour guide George is full of histroic knowledge which he presents on humoristic and intelligent way. Its great to go around town with locals, adds other dimension to the city. And the "cookies" were absolutely kickass. Thumbs up from Croatians :)

The best day. We did a bicycle day your and had an amazing experience. The guide, Thomas, was hilarious, and took special care to make the day fun. He was also very professional, and knew absolutely everything about the history of the city. I couldn't imaging a better way to see Budapest.

Guides are passionate, hip, professional. Our YZ Segway tour was the funnest excursion we did in Budapest. Our teenagers and 11 year-old were happy as clams after this tour. We were all Segway beginners, but a quick lesson was all that was needed. Our tour guide, Thomas, was knowledgable, professional, passionate and witty. He did a great job of including both kids and adults in the discussion. His enthusiasm was contagious and we ended up rolling back to the office as the sun was setting. The Yellow Zebra team seemed highly motivated and clearly like working together. The office doubles as a used English book store- so it's a great place to pick up a used guidebook. Later, we wished we had engaged Thomas for a walking tour the following day. I would highly recommend any tour offered by this company...but the Segways were really fun for all ages!

Biking in Budapest was the Best!!. This is the 2nd time, we have rented from Yellow Zebra. The owners are just super people, spoke very good english and helped us a bunch. We even wanted to rent earlier than they opened on our last day and they came in early. The bikes were all in great shape with any sizes and shapes to choose from. There were 8 of us and we all had great bikes and it was relatively cheap too compared to the US. The bike Lock came with it and a basket to haul it in. It was very convenient location just around the corner from our hotel K+K hotels at the Opera. This location of the bike shop was a short ride from the paths on the Danube and the Basilca and the Baths. Try then out, we love this shop!

Loads of Fun. Our Segway tour with Tomas was the highlight of our trip to Budapest. We had a blast learning how to use them, then cruising around seeing the main sights and hearing Tomas' excellent and informative commentary. We were a group of mixed ages - this is a terrific way to do sightseeing with an 11 year old and teenagers. Highly recommend and thanks again to Tomas for a fun afternoon.

Fun way to go sightseeing. Did the segway tour with tour guide George. First you get familiar with the segway which is a wobbly experience at first. But ones you hit the road you quickly gain control and will have a big smile on your face the whole tour. George was a good segway teacher and a good guide keeping track of everyone. Had a good time.

Guide knew her history. It was nice to have an authentic Hungarian give the tour. Anna knew her history very well and she even added her own views into the mix. It was more than a rehearsed kind of tour that I am usually accustomed to. She was friendly and genuinely interested in Budapest.Went to the main highlights on bike. One downside was we did not stop at some pretty interesting stops to take pictures. I suppose there is just too much to see so we couldn't stop everywhere. At the end of the day, the tour is worth it especially if you have no idea where or what you are looking at when traveling Budapest. Gives you a good introduction into the city.

A Must Do When in Budapest. This Bike tour and its great guide Bogata opened our eyes to the history, culture, architecture and people of Budapest. With her local knowledge, great personality and people skills Bogata answered all of our questions while keeping the tour interesting and relevant. She also recommend additional actives like restaurants, the markets and cruises we could do throughout the city. I would recommend doing this tour on your first afternoon or morning in Budapest. It will give you a taste of the city and more things you want to visit or focus your time on. You see all the major monuments, areas, the palace, Fisherman's bastion and there is a coffee stop on the way to re-energise you. ***mostly the bike skill level you need is medium. You just need to know how to ride a bike, watch out for traffic and stop. The only part that is hard is the hill to the palace. But your hard work is so paid off when you get there. The guides will go at your pace and stop to wait for you on the hill. The bikes are comfortable, kept in good condition and helmets are available.

Amazing private tour with Robert . We booked a private walking your with Robert through our travel agency, and he was fabulous. Robert is a vivacious and engaging tour guide who speaks wonderful English. We spent a lovely afternoon with him learning about Hungarian history and culture as well as the local legends and stories that made the city and the country come vividly alive. The depth of his knowledge is evident, and clearly reflects his training as a historian. He went above and beyond both during and after our tour. He even gave us his email and took the time to follow up with us after the tour to see if we had any questions or needed anything else during our stay in Budapest. He is truly one of the best!!

Fantastic bike tour. We did a customized bike tour (2.5) hours which they did specially for us which was lovely. Our guide was Tamas and we was very informative and friendly- always checking we were traveling at a comfortable pace or had any questions. Tamas even offered to make the tour longer if we wanted but sadly we were out of time. Really great, def recommend these guys.

Such a blast!. We were guided by Lazlo, a very personable and knowledgeable chap who took us on a tour of the city and told us about Budapest's history.This was our first Segway experience and we were very surprised by how easy they were to ride - it's also a wonderful and fun way to cover distances effortlessly. During our tour, we had time for a few visits and were also allowed some time to 'blast around' on the Segways. We had such a great time that we now try to go on Segway tours at the start of each new city we visit. Tip: Wear flat shoes and keep your belongings in a backpack, not in a handbag.

A great way to see Budapest. My wife doesn't ride a bike so was not too keen on this tour, especially with a hill climb to the castle. However we had done a tour in Berlin which she enjoyed so we signed up for this. Unlike Berlin the guide was a local so was able to provide a more personal view of the sights that we saw as we cycled around. There was a stop for pastries and coffee half way which was a welcome refresher. The ride up the hill was not that bad and everybody made it. The scariest part was the narrow roads and the buses going past but like the rest of Europe people treat cyclists with some respect. The only complaint was that the guide did not keep an eye or stragglers so the group got split several times. The last time we had no idea where the group had gone so started to make our own way back with some basic navigation skills. It would not have been hard to keep everyone in sight. Despite this we had a good time and would recommend this tour

Great tour. For the equivalent of EUR 20, I got to see some of the most beautiful sights in Budapest. George, the guide, was very courteous and helpful like every single Hungarian I met during my stay in this beautiful country.

Fun and informative. The bike trip is a great way to see the beautiful city of Budapest and learn a little about Hungarian history. Balasz, our guide, combined the two aspects expertly and kept things moving at an easy, relaxed pace. Really good!

A great way to see a city with a time limit table!. My husband and I were in Budapest in August pre-cruise with Avalon. We have done segways before on another cruise. Because of limit time, this is by far the best way to see a city. The "Yellow Zebra Segways & Bikes" did not disappoint! Barbi was tour director, she was very passionate about her city of Budapest, she also made sure that everyone was comfortable being on their Segway, with a 1/2 hour of training before the tour began. It was fun, educational, and as mentioned before a great way to see and be a part of a city with time constraints!

Great way to see Buda and Pest... A bike tour is the best way to tour the city when you have a limited amount of time. Once completed you can then go back to those places that really interested you. Gabor was our guide, a wonderful spokesman for his cities and his country. Very knowledgeable and educated. We spent a little over 4 hours with him touring Buda then over to Pest. The bike ride up the hill in Pest was a little challenging but not too bad. You need to know how to ride a bike and you will need to dodge some traffic particularly on the Pest side. We stopped for a break at a lovely cafe for beverages and sweets. Bikes were very comfortable.

AMAZING!!! An absolute must. You HAVE to do this.We were a group of 8 and we all agreed this was the highlight of the weekend. It's a great way to see the city.The staff were so friendly. Our guide was Szabi and he was fantastic.
Great segway trip with Bernadett. Our very first segway tour what thanks to Bernadett was really GREAT. I can recommend this special attraction to anybody.

Fun cycle tour with Robert!. We recieved a recommendation from a friend to do the tour so we pre booked. Was not disappointed! What a great way to get yourself orientated with this wonderful city! Would recommend that you go on your first day. Our guide was Robert who was good fun and very informative :) he has incredible knowledge of the city and its history. He also gave us recommendations, we went with some of them and were were not disappointed ;). Thanks again Robert! :)
Bike ride with Thomas. Fantastic way to get to see and learn a lot about Budapest. Thomas was such a professionel guide. it was the most exiting bike ride Si have ever had in a big city.

Make sure you keep at the front of the group!. Had a great segway tour and our guide Anna was very informative. She gave lots of stops where we were able to race about on our own. Great tour of of the place. The only down side was if you were at the back of the group and trying to negotiate pedestrians and crossings although in saying that Anna did wait for us to catch up. I think I would have preferred to have been with a smaller group of perhaps just four people instead of eight. Well woth it though!

Great Segway experience!. Our first Segway experience was really exciting! We really enjoy it and that was the perfect way to explore budapest.A special thanks to Anna, very good segway teacher and superlative guide!Thanks to the Yellow Zebra tours!

Amazing way to see and learn about the city of Budapest. My dad and I had the pleasure of taking part in one of the cycle tours in Sep (I think it was with Barbi). Although it rained for most of the 4 hours, it was the best thing we did in Budapest. I had never done a cycle tour before, and didn't really know what to expect, but it was absolutely brilliant. We got to see so much, and our tour guide had such an extensive knowledge of the city and the history behind it - plus she was funny and made us laugh all day. There were 6 of us in total on our tour, and it was so much fun. The bikes were really easy to cycle and comfortable too, which was a bonus. Budapest as a city was also great for bikes, and there was plenty of cycle lanes for us to use. Stopping for a coffee and a pasty (included in the relatively cheap price of the extensive tour) was a really nice touch too, as we got to chat together as a group and learn more about each other. I took my SLR camera on the bike tour with me and there was plenty of opportunity to stop and take some snaps, as well as hear about the history of a certain area, building, sight etc. It is an excellent way to explore the city and I would recommend it to anyone. The staff were also great, and very kindly rearranged our bike tour twice, due to a delayed start to the holiday due to closed airports and missed flights.

An absolute must!. A group of 4 with our own tour guide (Brigit) - what a brilliant way to see the sights of this fantastic city. Brigit was a real pleasure and was great at sharing the history of her city and country. Clearly very proud. Excellent English and very clear in what she was telling us. 1896 is still engrained in my mind!If you have any doubts about jumping on a Segway - don't. They are very easy to ride and within 10 minutes you will be at one with the machine. Simply fantastic fun!

What a fantastic experience.. Segway tour of budapest. We booked a 3 hour segway tour as a way to see the sights and egg our bearings. On the day we turned up we were the only ones who had booked the tour. They did not cancel because there was only three people.... Instead they went ahead with the tour and catered to our needs. They do all sorts of tours and can organise personal tours too. Our guide Anna was well informed, gave us great points at which to take photos and you could tell she really enjoys her job. On returning to the office, she sat down with us and marked off all the things that had seemed to interest us on our tour... Including tram no's, metro lines, bus numbers, strudel houses etc. and how to get there and back from our hotel. What a great experience. Happy to recommend them to you.

Great way to see parts of Budapest. Took a two hour Segway trip which was interesting. Anna the guide was well versed in giving details of the history of the locations we visited. Although at some points you do have some busy roads to cross. Worth trying out if visiting the city.

A healthy way to see the city.... Instead of an open top bus tour, this is certainly a great way to get a feel of the city and cover ground quickly! Anna, our guide spoke perfect English, was pleasant and knowledgable! The cycle paths around the city were impressive and safe. Helmets provided! Highly recommend!

half day bike tour of budapest. The half-day bike tour of Budapest, Hungary with Yellow Zebra was great! We had a group of about 15 of us and a pleasant guide. (Kinga) It was a wonderful way to get acquainted with the lay out of the city before heading out on foot to the various attractions. I would highly recommend it early on in your trip so you can get an overview of what is available to do and see, and an understanding of where things are in relation to your hotel.

Excellent bike tour. We went on the 4 hr bike tour during our first full day in Budapest. Brigit was our guide and she was fantastic! If you want a great explanation of the sights and of Hungarian history this is the tour for you. The views at the fisherman's bastilion are amazing and the ride up the hill is not bad at all.

A great way to overview Budapest. in 4 hours of a great bike guided tour we got an impresive view of budapest. the guide was great, perfect english and good local knowledge and advises.strongly recommended.!!!

Segway Fun Around the City. My fiancé and I had Andie for our tour guide. She was brilliant, a lot of fun and let us know everything about the beautiful city of Budapest. I HIGHLY recommend her and this company. The fun of Segways are an added bonus, and we got a few moments a free time. Cheers!

Bike Tour. I went with one other friend on a bike tour with Yellow Zebra and we ended up having a private tour all to ourselves. We had an excellent experience and learned so much about Budapest. Bernadett was our tour guide and she was fantastic, going out of her way to find out information for us if she didn't have the answer, took tons of pictures for us, and made the experience a lot a fun.

3-HOUR SEGWAY TOUR of BUDAPEST! DO IT! You won't regret it!. I can't even begin to say how much hellacious fun this way! We did a private tour for 7, ended up being about 4 hours because we had to make a pitstop because one segway had a low charge. This is THE best way to get your bearings, and learn about this beautfiul, friendly city!Our guide BERNADETTE was super friendly and knowledgeable, and a lot of fun. She catered the tour to we wanted to see, and showed us many surprises along the way. She was also and excellent instructor, and the 7 of us only needed about 25 minutes to all get the hang of the tour.I highly recommend the private tours, because it's your own little adventure and memories this way. We saw so much, and we learned so much, and by the end of the 3.5 hours, we were having so much fun, we didn't want to get off!! It was 83* and we were wearing helmets, but we were not miserable at all! We kept moving, and that helped the heat. So I would say, even in the heat of summer, don't hesitate to do this! After 2 hours, BERNADETTE killed the "turtle mode" and we all could go a little faster. It's actually a little easier to handle the Segway out of the "turtle mode." By the end, we were tired mostly due to the heat, but I think we could have easily done another hour, that's how much fun it was! So easy to learn, and not intimidating at all. It's really about where you place your feet and getting a sense of your balance. We had members of our groups with tricky knees and heavier posture, and none of us had ever done this before. (weight limit on a segway is 280lbs).  The shop has water and softdrinks for purchase for your outing as well. The Segways themselves have no real storage on them, so leave your bags. This tour company is great. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This was the highlight of our trip, and we'd all do it again!

Nice tour - lots of fun!. This tour was a lot of fun, despite the first 45 minutes of it being in the rain. Our tour guide, Robert, is very competent and pleasant, and a native of Budapest so he knows and loves his city. I would have wished for more quirky insider stories, rather than the usual things one can read in guide books, but the tour did take us to many of the important sites in the city. It also included a refreshment stop at a coffee shop and the drink and pastry were paid for in the tour fee. The ride up the hill to the castle near the end is a little strenuous, but we had people on the tour who were overweight and out of shape and we just gave them a little extra time and they made it. Budapest is so large and sprawling that a bike is great way to see it, but I would recommend, if you can, do the tour on a weekend when the traffic is lighter.

Cycling: An excellent way to explore Budapest! Great tour!. I had a free morning in Budapest, and opted to take part in Yellow Zebra's 4 hour biking tour, led by Anna. I could not have been more pleased with my decision, and with the tour. The day was beautiful, the city is flat and easily explored by bike (with the exception of Castle Hill in Buda- BIG hill, but easily manageable in a low gear, and going downhill after was awesome!). Anna was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the area, and has excellent anecdotes and stories to accompany each of the stops on the tour. One of the best stop was a peek into the public baths in Pest- if you are going to Budapest when the weather is warm, and you have additional time to spare, be sure to pack a bathing suit and visit the baths, they looked amazing!Just a quick note: the tour includes a stop at a café, but the meal, which is at lunch time (and is included in the cost of the tour), only includes a beverage and dessert, so be sure to eat before leaving on the tour at 11 am- the tour is 4 hours long :) Also, don't forget your sunscreen if you're fair skinned- again, you'll be in the sun for 4 hours!Overall, this was one of the highlights of my trip, and was a great was to see a large section of the city, while learning about the local history and architecture. Great fun, and I highly recommend it!

Segway Tour with Tamas. Must do.. We booked a 2 hour afternoon Segway tour. We had a 20 minute lesson before the tour, A bit nervous initially but we were all confident in no time. Tamas spoke excellent English and was brilliant - patient, informative and fun. A great way to see and learn more about Budapest. Including our lesson, we were out for approx 3 hours. V good value. Thanks Tamas.

Cycle Tour. Budapest is a big place and there is no better way to take it all in than by cycling round it and seeing both the Buda and Pest side and their sights. The tour was about 5 hours, we got delayed by a puncture, perhaps the guide should take a repair kit with them. Our guide Viktor however was great and a pleasure to be with. Definitely recommend!

Very convenient for printing Ryanair boarding pass. I actually didn't use Yellow Zebra for their primary business - rather, I found out they offer a very convenient printing service. I had a flight boarding pass on my computer from Ryanair, and, Ryanair being Ryanair, needed a way to print the pass before departing to the airport to avoid a draconian 70 euro fee. I simply went in and asked about printing. They then gave me the Wi-Fi username and password and an email address that I could then forward my electronic boarding pass onto for them to print it for me. The whole process took about 5 minutes from walking in the door to having my printed boarding pass in hand and it only cost (at time of writing) 60 HUF for 2 pages. So thanks to the friendly staff here!

Budapest Bike Tour. Budapest is big! So what better way to spend your way exploring it than by bike. We had Gabor as our guide and he was fabulous. If you're tossing up whether to walk the city or bike - and you don't have much time - then biking is the best and this tour is worth it :)

Nice Budapest Bike Tour. I participated in the Yellow Zebra Bike Tour in the morning. Is a 4-hour bike tour in the Budapest main attractions. We also had a half-hour brake where we had some coffee or refreshments and cakes which were included at the price. The tour was very nice and our guide Kinge informed us for each of the attractions and about the History of the place. She also answered all our questions. Generally it was a nice tour recommended if you want a look to all the main attractions of Budapest.

Excellent Segway Tour: Rain OR Shine. We just returned from Budapest and our most favorite time there was the time spent with BARBI on our Segway Tour. We are so glad we opted for the 3-hour tour. We had almost decided NOT to go with this company because they didn't offer a trip up to the Castle Hill, but the other company's availability didn't match ours so we went with Yellow Zebra. BARBI was so cute and nice and friendly, we really enjoyed her perspective on the city. She took us all over Budapest, almost in a whirlwind of touring---it was hard to take it all in during the short time we were with her. Luckily, she told us the opening hours of many of the places, and how to go back and enjoy them ourselves (museums, parks, baths, ruin pubs, even where the bus stops are to go over to Castle Hill!) Oh, did I mention that we were FREEZING and WET? No worries, the constant pop-up showers did not take away from the marvelous time we had on this tour, as Barbi provided us with ponchos and jokes to help us make it through the rain! This is a totally recommended tour!They do NOT provide a bottle of water on the tour (as our Prague & Dresden tours did), so bring your own!

Segway is the best way!. For my birthday, my partner treated me to a three hour Segway tour of Budapest. I have to say that it was one of the best presents I have ever received as it was unbelievably fun. Segways are very beginner and user friendly so after the 15 minute intro, we all felt comfortable navigating through the streets of Budapest. Our guide, Szabi, was extremely friendly and spoke very good English. I highly recommend Yellow Zebra!

Best way to tour Budapest. Three of us booked a segway tour with Yellow Zebra for the 2 1/2 hour morning tour today. We had a great instructor, Anna, and got the hang of manovering in no time. As there were just the three of us we had a very personal tour with Anna who was knowledgable about the history, very informative and very personable. She made it a fun event that I would recommend highly - and ask for Anna.

Amazed at how fun and easy this was!. To fellow travellers considering the yellow zebra segway tour in Budapest---DO IT!! When I first saw this idea, it seemed kind of quirky, but potentially really fun, although I was a bit concerned about the fact that I had never used a Segway. Having now done this, I can honestly say that I can't think of a better way to see a city like Budapest. First, they gave us about a 15 minute lesson on how to use the device--very professional and carefully done. But honestly, it was hardly necessary. The device is astonishingly easy to operate--so effortless in fact, that it seemed only to take the mere thought to move forward or turn left, and the device would do it. It became so natural and easy within 10 minutes that I felt like I had be doing it for years. After doing it for three hours, I truly mourned having to get off and travel like other humans :) It's a perfect way of seeing the sights because (a) Budapest is mostly flat (we were on the Pest side), (b) this vehicle rides equally comfortably on sidewalks, over curbs, in streets--it's a little all terrain vehicle and is robust, (c) unlike a bike, it requires virtually no effort on your part, (c) you can travel up to 15 miles an hour and speed across town spanning distances to see far away sights that would cost a lot of taxi fare, or bicycle effort or tube navigation to see, (d) you can sightsee while riding, after about 10 minutes getting used to it, (e) people look at you with surprise and amusement and curiosity, which was kind of fun, (f) the method of travel between the sights becomes an end in itself because it is simply fun and effortless. In essence, the feeling of this device, after you get really comfortable--is that it is exactly like skiing through a city--it feels the same--you can solemn between people! Except that you are not limited by gravity. It is worth mentioning that the age range in our group spanned teenagers to people in their 60s--all of whom loved the experience. In fact for somebody with a bad foot or leg, it's pretty ideal--very liberating.  My only negative comments about this experience are as follows. First, although our tour guide was extremely nice, good natured, and fun--a very good host--the information he provided about the sights was a bit minimalist--enough to keep you interested, but the information was not really the highlight of the tour. But nobody on our tour felt that this mattered much, honestly. (if they wanted to make this even better, they would improve this element though). Second you should be mindful that the company does not carry insurance on its vehicles--and that if something happens to the vehicle, they will ask you to pay for it (this is in the contract you sign). I know this because I (like an idiot) tried to navigate between two narrow posts and ended up scratching the side of the segway. They charged me 25 euros for this, which seemed a bit excessive for a scratch. However, in their defense--these are expensive devices, and insurers won't insure them, and they definitely did not charge me as any kind of scam--in fact, they were profusely apologetic about having to do it. Despite this negative aspect, my overall rating of this company is superb--fun people, professional, good hosts, and responsible. I highly recommend it. It was easily one of the two best things we did during our 4 days in Budapest--exceptionally good.

A wonderful Segway adventure!. We decided to have a go at a Segway tour around Budapest and were delighted with the service, the length of time and the sights we got to see. Our tour guide Szabi was really friendly and knowledgeable, always open to any questions we had which made us feel comfortable throughout. It is an especially good tour if you've just arrived in Budapest or don't have much time in the city as it provides a great overview of main sites. When we finished the tour, he was great at recommending some places to go or things to do whether that be food and drink or a particular place to visit. Would definitely recommend this tour.

Yellow Zebra City Tour. I just finished a little over four hour bike tour of Budapest, Hungary. Barbi was an excellent guide. Very knowledgeable and gave us a lot of good information about the history of the city and the country and specifics about good restaurants and pubs and other sites in the city that we did not have time for in the tour. She obviously loves her country and her city a lot! I will be back there in the morning to rent a bike for some more exploring of this great city! Kurt N

An unmissable activity!. The segway tour in Budapest was one of the highlights of our trip; not only were the segways incredibly fun, but the history along the tour was wonderful to learn. Our tour guide, Barbie, was so sweet and lovely, and her knowledge of the city was inspiring. The session began with some basic training as most in our group had not used a segway before, but not long after we were all whizzing around on them like we'd been doing it for as long as Barbie had! The tour began at the Opera house in Budapest, and during the two hour tour, we ventured throughout the city seeing the biggest sights like the Synagogue, the Elizabeth Bridge, the Chain Bridge, Parliament, St Stephen's Basilica and the beautiful Danube. If you have the opportunity to do the segway tour, we would thoroughly recommend you do; it is an unmissable activity and suitable for all ages; the segways add to the fun of the history along the tour and allow for a real quick and fun ride around the city if you do not have time to visit each individual attraction during your stay!

Family friendly, excellent tour, and great guides (Brigit and Christi). Even though it's been four weeks since our family, with 2 teenage children, took the segway tour. None of us had any prior experience with a segway, but the 10 minute lesson was very excellent. The actual tour was the highlight of our time in Budapest. Stopped at the major sites in Buda, plus several others - all with good explanations with both history and general interest. We also did a hop-on-hop-off tour; it visited many of the same sites, but drove by some that were on the segway tour. The explanations provided by Brigit and Christi were much better than the pre-recorded ones on the bus tour. The children wanted to cancel our other plans and go on another segway tour. I'm sure we'll go on another segway tour on a future trip - Yellow Zebra has set a high standard!

The guides are fabulous. My father and I took two tours that Yellow Zebra offers. First the private, 3 hour segway tour with Barbi. What's great about this tour is that it takes you to sights that are a little far to walk from the main downtown area such as Heroes Square and the City Park. Other areas you see are St. Stephens, the Jewish district, Parliament among others. If you've never done a segway they provided adequate training. Barbi was a fantastic guide. After our great experience with this we decided to book their castle walking tour. This hour and a half tour provides the best views of Buda and the history of the castle district. Our guides name was Balazs and he too made great recommendations. Lastly, another guide named George helped us significantly in their office although never giving us a tour, he was still great. Definitely book this tour!!

Brilliant & lots of fun!. I did the segway tour around the city & had a fantastic time. I'd never been on a segway before but I highly recommend it! You are taught the basics & safety before heading out on the tour so you are pretty well taken care of. Our guide Tamas was awesome, very knowledgeable about the history of Budapest & hilarious on the segway! I would recommend this segway tour, our guide Tamas & this company to my friends with no worries.

Great bike tour and guide. We took the afternoon bike tour. Our excellent guide was Brigit. Yellow Zebra supplied good bikes and we were able to see a lot of Budapest. Brigit is extremely knowledgeable and fun to be with. We couldn't ask for a better introduction to Budapest. Highly recommended.

Bupapest, not being able to walk. Although I had troubles walking this long weekend I was able to really enjoy the city by Segway thanks to our great, knowledgeable, sympathetic, interesting,intelligent.... you name it tour guide Anne. Thank you very much and please stay in Humgary!!!
Great way to sightsee. Easy to master and great fun to ride. Kinda was a really good guide and we had a great time.Try it out if you get the chance.
Segway all the way. Took the 2 hour segway tour, sights galore. The segways were fast, we all had a blast. Bernadette was a great at touring all the points she is scoring. Conor

Excellent Tour!. Brigit provided a fantastic tour! She was very knowledgable and showed tremendous pride in her country and its history. She even fixed my husband's bike chain. She was very engaging, asking the group questions and as the tour progressed, gently quizzing us to check our recall. We made a nice stop for a snack at a lovely restaurant. Brigit conveyed a lot of information in a very accessible manner. P.S. she's also hot:-)
Fun way to see the city. An incredibly fun way to see Budapest. Our guide, George, was excellent. Would definitely recommend this tour.

Highly recommend 3 hour tour. This is an excellent way to see the main central sights in Pest in one morning. The Segways are so much fun to ride and make zipping from sight to sight very easy and quick. Our guide Kristin was a gem, very knowledgeable and helpful. The 3 hour tour extends to the city park and is worth the extra just to keep zooming along!

Very personal and informative. This tour is an excellent option if you have only one day to explore the beautiful city of Budapest as we did. It also might be a great start if you are staying longer there. It gives you a nice overview of the city so that you can easily pick the places you loved the most to explore in detail on the following days. We were so lucky to have the guide (Bernadete) only for ourselves since nobody else came for a bike tour on that day, what made an excellent value for us. Bernadete is local so her information about the city, history and hungarian culture was really valuable. She even offered to make our tour slightly longer than it's usual! Incredible! There is a short break in a nice cafe right at the foot of Parliament where you can have some complimentary cakes and drinks. Bikes are of very good quality, Budapest is a flat city and has really nice bike routes so it's easy to move around. Only the way to the castle is a little bit steep but it's almost insignificant part of the trip.There are so many positives to say about this tour...You do it very well, guys, so keep up a good job!
Lovely . Very interesting tour with George, and only us 3 in the morning. I recommend to do the tour as you arrive, since it shows the main things to visit.

Great way to see the city . Our guide, Josef, was very knowledgeable and made the tour interesting. It was a very hot day so lots of information to take in while standing in the heat but biking was definitely the best way to see the city. For such a busy city, vehicles were accommodating when we crossed the streets. Highly recommend this tour.

bloody great arvo!!. I high recommend the segway tour, not only is it super fun (and for a lot of people, a rare opportunity to have a go on one of these things) but it was an excellent way to see the city :) our guide (brigitt) was top notch and we learned heaps from her. It is well worth the money people.

Great guide, good tour, love the segways. The segways were great fun, easy to learn particularly as our guide, Tamas, was a great teacher. In fact, our guide's style, knowledge and comedy, and the segway riding were the highlights of the tour. The only reason this isn't 5 stars? I didn't feel like I saw as much of the city as I was expecting in two hours, but it was the best of the options - I would gave loved an extra hour round the Buda part of the city. Great tour though, highly recommended!
Great fun - good way to sight-see. Really enjoyed the whole experience.We were trained first which took about 30 minutes. Then 2 hours tour. We got to see all the main tourist sites in one evening.

Great tour, Unique way to see Budapest. My wife and I were given our tour by Anna (An). We did the night tour. It wasn't dark, but it was nice to be out when everyone in the city was relaxing instead of busily working. We rode by crowds dancing outside a church and watching the World Cup in a square. An was wonderfully informative for our outing. We only had a total of 3 riders in our group. This "private" tour was everything we had hoped. All 3 of us had previous experience and we were quickly on the road. An was very conscientious with us while all along showing us a great time. Above all, she was fun. We were able to get up to speed in the square and enjoy ourselves. This was our second segway trip. We have ridden in San Francisco but the Budapest trip was by far the best. An really knows the city and guided us expertly. Ask for he by name.

Great way to see this amazing city!. My husband and I had a great group tour of Budapest. Much better than sitting on a bus- weaving your way through this amazing city! Gabor our guide was fun, considerate and had a wealth of knowledge

We love Viktor. We went on a segway tour as a group of 7. It was a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Our tour guide, Viktor, was not only very informative but also allowed enough time in the training session for us to feel safe on the road. A completely unique way to visit the main attractions of Budapest, a must do for everyone visiting!

June Segway Tour. My wife and I took a Segway Tour with Andi on 06.13.2014. We had a great time and Andi tailored the tour to our group as we'd already seen some of the things that she was going to show us. She also got both myself (age 59) and my wife (much, much younger) comfortable on the Segways even though it was our first time on the electronic beasties. I strongly recommend the Segway for those of us getting slow afoot and Andi is a great guide and very knowledgeable. Have fun. Andy and Janet.

Budapest+Segway+Barbie= Perfection!. The best way to tour the city in a limited amount of time. During 2-3 hours you get to taste the highlights of Budapest history and architecture in the most enjoyable way you can imagin - riding a segway.Safe and easy to learn and handle -u would only wish the tour was longer.Our guide, the sweet and very knowladgable Barbie made it an experience we wont forget.

Don't even hesitate! Great value!!. We were a group of 10 and they supplied a lead guide and a tail guide to keep our group together (which comes in really handy on busy sidewalks!). They did a good training before we started to make sure everyone was comfortable with the Segway. Then off we went! The tour was 3 hours + and we covered all the major attractions with lots of opportunities for photos. We would HIGHLY recommend this outfit!!

Nice bike tour of Busapest. My wife and i did the morning bike tour and were more than hapy with the tour. Our guide was very informative and the overall tour itinerary was nice. Budapest offeed more bike paths than i had antaicipated, which meant the bikeing was safe and easy.

Great experience. This bike tour was the perfect start to our visit to Budapest. We always book a bike tour for our first day to get a feel of the city and after a bit of google research we picked Yellow Zebra as the best on offer and we were not disappointed. Laszlo was our guide and we were lucky enough to have no other bookings with us so it was a bonus private tour. The ride was easy and enjoyable and only a bit of a tricky hill on the buda side... which was a bit troublesome because of the heat on the day but Laszlo offered his water and was super patient while I got some energy back.The actual path we took was perfect, great sites, nice stop to eat and Laszlo was full of facts and info. Highly recommend!

A great way to see the city. We pre booked our tour online and were so pleased with the tour. Anna was an excellent guide, very informative and was able to answer any questions we had. Wish we had done this tour on day 1 of our trip. It was excellent and we were able to see all of the main attractions/sights Budapest has to offer.One thing to note- the 4 hour tour from 11-3pm stops at a coffee shop for a 15 minute break... Make sure you eat before hand or are prepared to try a Hungarian dish that I wasn't keen on. It wasn't so much a pastry on offer that was advertised... But that's me just being fussy.Would highly recommend and looking to book another one in Prague! Excellent!!!!

Great experience!. The segway tour was great and very informative. Our tour guide also made it very fun by including trivia in it and giving the winner a "grand mystery prize". We could design our own tour, plus nobody else showed up for our booked time and thus we could have a private tour! The only thing I didn't like was that at some point we were in the bike lane on the road, and a motorcycle came very close to me, thus I had to stop very quickly and almost collided with the tour guide, therefore I would recommend avoiding doing this if you can. Their office is also very pleasant, and they could call us a taxi to go home which was very convenient. Overall I am satisfied and would recommend this experience to others.

Excellent, Friendly service !. Friendly staff and cheap rates ! Even changed my bike as it the first one had a fault !
Only draw back is they don't have a pick-up service..at least in case of a break down !!!

Fantastic service and great experience. We are a group of seven visiting Budapest. We decided to do a Segaway tour at 5 in the evening and called these guys and they were very prompt in organising one at such a short notice. Three of us had not ridden a Segway before, and the initial training given by our tour guide Tamas and his colleague had us riding the Segway like we had done it many time before. The tour was on busy populated pedestrian footpaths and some sections was on cycling lanes. Tamas was very informative and yet funny. He kept checking time and again on us novices. At the end of the tour we all wished to do more... But alas as somebody had said all good things must come to end.

Brilliant way to explore the City. We saw people doing a segway tour when we were in Bruges, so were pleased when we saw that we could do a tour in Budapest. Didn't take long to get the hang of the segway, and soon we were whizzing along the streets. Our tour guide - Bernadett - was brilliant, very knowledgeable, excellent English, and obviously very proud about Hungary and Budapest, and her enthusiasm made the time just fly by - thank you Bernadett !! Will definitely look out for a segway tour in every other place we visit, as it was great fun.

expensive but very good. we took a private tour,2 person with a guide.The price for 2 hours is 150 euro. The guide (Tamas) was very profesional and knew a lot about budapest and the history of Hungary.A very good way to see the city.

Segway fun. Anna was our tour guide. She was fab. Knowledgable and happy to cater tour to the 3 of us on the tour. Loads of history in budapest with amazing views and multicultural architecture . Did help it was 32 deg so topped up tan also. Anna was great but highlight was segway. Nervous start with training before hand but after that i sped my way around.pulling doughnuts and overtaking pensioners in thier disabled transport. We did 3 hr tour, really enjoyed. Almost like a core workout though as uses your bodyweight to manouver. 5 star tour

Biking fun in Budapest. We took the bike tour on our first day in Budapest and it was brilliant! Despite being a bit rusty on a bike and a little nervous about cycling around a big city ,our guide Barbie put us at ease straight away and went out of her way to check we were OK and make sure we were keeping up! We got to see lots of the city and main attractions and Barbie was great at giving us a brief history and information about the city as we travelled around,in a fun,relaxed way. The drink stop was a good opportunity to chat with others in the group although it might have been better after our hill climb rather than just before!! We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and you don't need to be a hard core cyclist to take part. We had so much fun that we returned later in the week to hire bikes again!

Great way to see the city. We took the bike tour on our first day in Budapest, it was a great way to get to know the city and find places that we wanted to go back to. Our tour guide Barbie was excellent, she was very knowledgeable and provided good tips for our trip. Barbie made the tour fun and enjoyable.I would recommend this tour to all visiting Budapest, our group was made up of all ages and abilities, everyone seemed happy with the pace.We had a great time on the tour!

Great fun for first day in Budapest!. We booked this tour ahead of time before our trip, which I highly recommend! We have done several Segway Tours in other cities ( Berlin, Paris, etc) and this tour was wonderful. Budapest is a big, spread out city so we did this our first day to get a feel for the city and see some main attractions. We had a great time on our small tour which had 4 other people not including our guide. We did the extended tour which was absolutely worth it. Barbi was our tour guide and she did a satisfactory job. We prefer if the training is done for all guests simultaneously because it took almost an hour to do individually. Although we love history, the history she provided was slightly difficult to follow and very dry. It would have been nice to incorporate more captivating stories with some humor involved as was typical of other Segway Tours.

Budapest by bike - really cool!!!!. We enjoyed this tour a lot!!!!!Our guide Anna was not only friendly and funny but also willing to answer each and every question we had,even about the current political situation in Hungary and other things that might seem a bit delicate.Biking in Budapest is really nice,the infrastructure is very good and besides that pedestrians are very relaxed...(compared to Vienna where there's conflict everywhere a pedestrian and bike meet!)A coffe stop is included in the tour and you choose between some Hungarian pastries/sweets_I had Mákos Guba and LOVED IT!!!!!!!Our tour was supposed to be 3,5-4hs,in the end it was nearly 5hs but the passed soooooooooooo quickly!!!!Probably also because there was a lot of good chemistry within our groupand you could tell that our guide Anna enjoyed that too and so everyone was happy!

Great way to see the city. We did the 2 hour morning segway tour & our guide Brigit was personable, funny & very charming. It was a great way to get an overview of the wonderful city of Budapest. Brigit informed us about much of the city's history which was very helpful. It was a great way to spend a couple of hours.

Great Fun! . We had previously been on a Segway tour in Berlin so when we found out that we could do the same in Budapest we jumped at it. Budapest is quite spread out so Segways are perfect to see everything in a limited amount of time. There were 5 of us on the tour, not including Brigit, our guide. After a brief training ng session, brief because we had all ridden before, we were off. Bright, our guide, was very friendly and knowledgeable and gave us a lot of info about the sights on the route. She also made sure we had plenty of 'play time' when we could whizz around showing off to all and sundry! (apart from the unfortunate incident when I nearly fell off when riding backwards at speed!) All too soon our 2 hours were up and we returned to base with big smiles on our faces. It was a great way to see everything, so if you get the chance, go for it.
