Exellent segway tour. I had the pleasure of going on a personal segway tour with two very nice guides. The guides were informative and interesting, they took me to all the major sights for three hours and the time flew by. This was my first time on a segway but they explained the basics of segway ridin' in a Flash and off we went. Would highly recomend to others. They even gave me tips for several good restaurants for me to try during my visit to Budapest. Thank you for a great time.

Fun. We did the 11am bicycle tour and it was an enjoyable experience, however,our group had 14 people and it was far too many. We didn't book in advance so we were glad we got to join but what was a good experience could have been excellent with a smaller group. Only strenuous part was the climb to the castle on the Buda side and that really wasn't bad at all. We stopped half way through tour for desert and drinks. You can order a delicious beer but you will have to pay for that. Other is included in cost of tour.

Must try. We joined the segway tour in Budapest. Our guide was Gyuri who was very attentive and full of enthusiasm in his work. His humor made the trip full of fun. If you want to tour many attractions, the most comfortable and efficient way is the segway!

Best way to see Budapest!. We did a bike tour with Tomas. 4.5 hours and enjoyed every bit of it! Tomas was entertaining, informative and impressively knowledgable on Hungarian history. I'm the first to complain if there's an issue....but no issues here....hugely impressed!

Segway your way through the city!. I am not a big fan of doing touristy stuffs when on holiday, but this was the bestest touristy thing I have ever done in my life. Got on the segway, and spent about 3 hours whizzing through the city, to the opera house, hero square, st steven church etc. Anna and briggy were the best guides, giving us the historical insights to the city. This is the best value for money activity I have ever done when on holiday!

Best way to see Budapest!!. This is without a doubt the best fun way of seeing all the sights in Budapest. We went for the Superior tour which took in all the sights of the downtown area as well as Hero's Square and the City Park. The tour guides, Bernadette and Anna were absolutely brilliant, full of information facts & figures, funny and lighthearted when appropriate but also very down to earth when telling us of the occupation of Budapest and Hungry in general by the Nazis and Russians. Their English was faultless and we we're particularly impressed by their pride in their country and it's history. the segways are easy to use and just great fun. Much better than sitting on a bus listening to pre-recorded tapes.You will see all the sights and get lots of information on them from the brilliant guides.We can't recommend this tour enough.Truly a must do if visiting Budapestthank you Bernadette and Anna

Peddling in pest. Anna was lovely her knowledge of budapest insightful. We spent 5 hours peddling around pest and even made the hill in buda where we were rewarded with fantastic views over the city.Interesting to hear about the ancient and modern history from someone who experienced it, even if only as a small child. This was our first day in budapest which resulted in our covering the main tourist areas and knowing where to venture on our own.Thanks Anna we thoroughly enjoyed our day with you and the young doctors from Cleveland

Anna Juhasz, travel guide. This is the only way to see all historical and architectural masterpieces in Budapest city in one day : Opera house, Buda city, Parliament...In only 3,5 hours you can truly feel the spirit of the City, taste some of the traditional Hungarian deserts and get lot of interesting stories about Budapest and Hungarians as well.Anna, our tour guide gave her best to make this trip unforgettable. Thanks to her,now I know lot about this city and it was easy to remember because Anna can do it on an amazingly interesting way.I had visited Budapest many times but this was the best trip ever, especially because the tour is not tiring comparing to another ones.Lot of FUN ! Highly recommended !

Sedgway & Bike Tour 9th May. Tamas was our guide for this tour.We had an excellent day, Tamas was knowledgeable, funny and caring. He made the trip very memorable which I expect was the same for him as he had a group of 13 women to cater for! Budapest is an amazing place, just wish we had more time to explore. I would definitely recommend Yellow Zebra to anyone & I would definitely use Yellow Zebra again...Thank you for the memories x

Budapest bike tour a great experience. I only had one full day in Budapest and wanted to make the most of my time in the city - my wish was fulfilled with this bike tour! The bike tours begin at 11am and last for 3-4 hours - I lucked out and was the only one who signed up for the bike tour that day- so I had a private tour with my wonderful Hungarian guide Anita. The price of the tour is 6500 forints - roughly 32 US dollars. We hit the major sites of the city and rode our bikes at a leisurely pace. FYI you don't have to be "in shape" to go on this tour- most of the city is flat and there are many sites where you are stopping and learning about the history so you are never cycling for an extended period. One cultural aspect that I was pleasantly surprised by were the Hungarian drivers. They are so patient with cyclists and they never honk their horns- what a contrast to american drivers! Anita was a great guide - providing a rich history of the city and the country. Would recommend the tour in a heart beat!

We did another Segway ride!. We enjoyed our 1st tour with Yellow Zebra very much and decided to go back and do the extended tour of 2 & a half + hours. This tour is SO much better and very much worth the extra money you'll spend. This tour is divided in to 2 parts, (at different area of the city), a then a short break back at the office then off again for the remainder of the trip. Our guide Kenga (apologies if I've spelt this incorrectly) was absolutely fantastic and she was able to tell us so many historical facts about Budapest plus allow time to enjoy some free time on our Segways too (loads of fun). We were so happy to have been able to cover so much of this beautiful city in just a few hours. Thank you, thank you, thank you! Hopefully one day we'll be able to return to Budapest and do it all again.

Bicycle tour of budapest. Highly recommended -easy cycling but be prepared to climb a hill 2 thirds of the way through - but good comfortable bikes make it easy . Great guide Anita full of past and current information on past and present Hungary and budapest - give it a go you won't regret it!

Highly recommended!. Had a Segway tour which was absolutely fantastic. Our guide, Brigit, was very relaxed, fun, informative, and passionate about her city and it's culture! Brigit adapted the tour slightly to incorporate any places we particularly wanted to see, and we found her knowledge and history of the city very interesting. Thanks Brigit for a great day! I would highly recommend this tour, it was a fun and easy way to explore the city!

Yellow Zebra Bike Tours. Our group of 2 moms and 3 children (ages 11-13) loved our bike tour. We did a private tour which was very reasonably priced. The company worked with us to develop an itinerary that hit all of the sights we were interested in seeing. The girls loved it. Anita was a wonderful guide. She is very polite, interesting and entertaining. She knew the city well and offered great insights and perspective. We would definitely do another Yellow Zebra tour!

If there's a better way to see Budapest (although technically only Pest) we didn't find it.. With neither my partner nor I having ever ridden a Segway before, there was an air of trepidation prior to the test drive. The first time you get on it you wonder how on earth you'll survive and when, with no more than a brief trip up and down the street, you are unleashed on an unwitting public you will wonder how on earth anyone else will survive this. However fear not, for the Segway is an amazing machine and it is amazing how quickly you pick it up (if a chimpanzee can ride one then you can, right?!). After 5 minutes we were nipping in and out of crowds, hitting the speed limiter with regularity and nigh on begging Laszlo to unleash the extra 15 km/ph held in reserve for when you are no longer deemed a novice. Our tour guides were Laszlo (apparently also a "Luke" when he studied in the UK) and Kinga. They made the tour fun and informative, with great insights into the history of Budapest and Hungary as a whole. The tour takes in all the major sights in central Pest, save for the Parliament buildings, which are viewed at a distance. This is by no means the cheapest thing you can do in Budapest. The trip itself is around 18,000 HUF (60 Euros) pp but one must also factor in the 15,000 Euros that you will inevitably spend when you commit to going home and immediately buying a Segway. Given that within the budget of your average city break the trip as a whole is pretty inexpensive, this tour is approximately equivalent to an espresso and a postcard from the Champs D'elysees, it represents great value money. Especially as this, in my humble opinion, is the best way and most enjoyable to see central Budapest.

Worth it. The bikes are good, the guide has a very good knowledge of the city and political history of Budapeste. A bit expensive but worth it.In the end of the tour I asked the guide to take a picture of me, he made one, not good, so I asked to make a better one and he was rude and said NO! Apart from this was ok.
Absolutely amazing, tamas was really interesting and engaging. We had never segwayed before but tamas was really helpful and interesting very interesting and funny thanks for a wonderful experience.

Top recommendation. We thoroughly enjoyed zipping round this beautiful city full of fantastic and amazing sights with Kinga our guide.She was incredibly well informed and a really lovely person.We would tell everyone who is thinking of doing this activity to definitely book it and go for it.FAB

Thanks to Laszlo. Many thanks to Laszlo for a wonderful time on segways! We know Budapest well and we just wanted to ride around Budapest. Laszlo gave us the perfect mix of fun segway riding and a bit of tourism.
Fun segway tour. We had a fun segway tour with our guide Andi. Segway is the perfect way to explore Budapest! We had the standard tour that showed us most of the sights on the pest-side. Recomended!

Brigit!. Hey Brigit, I wanted to thank you for the nice personnalised visit of the marvelous Budapest.The easygoing style, (and your patience with unexperienced segwayriders like us) was a real treat.At first the tour was a nice excuse for the kids to have a ride with the magic machines, but it turned out in a nice afternoon for all of us.I spent a afternoon with my two teenagers, three girls from London an Bahrein, with a mix of adventure, fun and culture.We were really nicelly hosted for that afternoon. Our guide wasnot only professional, but also very commited in the way she talked about her city. It was not a lesson in local history, and facts, but a nice exchange of ideas, knowledge and culture. Thank you Brigit!!! We did really enjoy the journey you took us on.

Great experience!!!. My husband and I searched for Segway tours of Hungary when we came across yellow zebra. Greatest way to explore a city!Our guide, Brigit, was great!! Her calm demeanor and knowledge of the city didn't leave any room for doubt that we made the right choice with yellow zebra. We took the tour on our first day in Budapest, so we could get a sense of the city first. Best experience and awesome tour guide (Brigit)!!! Loved every second!!

Simply great!. We had so much fun (my wife and I) on the Segway tour. Bridget, our guide was very cool, with a great sense of humour. Segways are fun but she made the entire experience even better. Defiantly a highlight of the tour! Very recommended! Ask for Bridget ;)

One of the best parts of our holiday!. Im really mad that I've forgotten the name of our tour guide!! All I can describe him as, is that he had a blue jacket on; think his name beings with an 'L'. He is so awesome; really makes you feel at ease on the segways. Me and my boyfriend researched the segway tours before we went and knew it was something we had to do. Think it cost around 40-50 pounds for over 2 hours riding the segway and half an hour training beforehand. My boyfriend took to it really quickly but I was not so great at first. The segway almost becomes an extention of your body; after an hour you feel and look like a pro!!!!We had already been on a couple of tours so we saw a few sights we'd already seen on the tour, but our tour guide gave us some great info that we hadnt heard before so that was great.He also showed us a few attractions we walked past earlier in the week and were interested in but didnt know what they were due to the language barrier so that was helpful!!There was only 5 of us on the segway tour altogether (including the guide) and we had a few races near Fashion Street and around St Stephens Basillica, and the guide took a vfew videos and photos of us on our phones. You get no end of attention; however some Irish tourists thought it'd be funny to try and hatch a plan to get it off me not knowing I was English and could understand what they were saying; that was perhaps the only downside to the experience!It was so much fun and gave us some fantastic memories! The tour guide never pushes you to go really fast and you have to follow all in a line because he'll only take you the routes and up kerbs etc. that are suitable for segways; so although its major fun you have to be safe too!!Something everyone should try!!!!

Best way to see Budapest - by bike. I have toured several European cities by bike, however the Budapest tour with Yellow Zebra is by far the best. Our guide Anita was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining and clearly enjoyed showing us her city. I would definitely recommend this tour; it is not only the best way to get your bearings but gives you a good overview of the city layout and enables you to plan trips to other attractions. Thanks Anita +++ for an excellent day!

Great guide and fun Segways. The Segway tour was the best and fastest way to see some of the major sites and learn some Hungarian history. Our guide, Anna, was amazing and very knowledgable. This tour was one of the best parts of the trip and I would highly recommend getting on a Segway!

Save your feet and see the city y Segway. This was the third city we've toured on Segways and once again I am very happy we did. Our guide Anita was wonderful. She was friendly, informative and really good sense of humour. The tour was about 2 hours, which was just perfect.
Great guide :). I'd like to say thanks to Brigit for giving us an amazing tour !! Your really kind and amazing at your work :) well done Brigit you made my day yesterday !!! Koszonom !!!

No complaints. We did there city bikes tour with Anna and we very happy with the overall tour. small group size . safe bike paths, great guide and itinerary was perfect. we stopped along the way for snacks which was great for the kids and felt like we say all of Budapest. after the tour,the staff at Yellow zebra were friendly and offered great advice.

Good way to explore Budapest. We usually take these bicycle tours when doing the city weekends since it is such a great way to get to know the city and its history. The yellow zebra tour doesn't differ from that point of view. But from our perspective the detail level on some of the places visited was a bit too deep. We would rather have seen more places of interest and listened to more general information. We would also have preferred to have the coffee break in a typical Hungarian cafe rather than in a super-modern international bar. But to see Budapest by bike is great and the city is really beautiful!

The bike tour was a perfect way to see the city!. We were pressed for time on our last day in Budapest and hadn't seen any of the sights (had spent our previous 2 days at the baths and going caving) but our afternoon biking through the city was perfect. Bernadett (Dettie) was very entertaining and knowledgeable about her city. I'd definitely recommend this tour for your time in Budapest!

Highlight of our time in Budapest!. This way of seeing Budapest is highly recommended. The segway was a fab means of zipping round to get a good, detailed overview of Pest without pounding the pavements or getting lost. Laszlo was a patient segway teacher to all 6 of us. He then guided us round this beautiful city with much enthusiasm and a huge wealth of knowledge on all we saw and any question we cared to ask. By the end of the tour we all felt like we'd all made a good friend in him.

yellow zebra bike tour of budapest. Kinga was a great guide lots of information on the history of the sights and country, remember the facts as you may be questioned later ! Really good fun - do this early in your stay to give you a taste so you can decide where you you wish to explore deeper.

Great fun experience even though VERY cold in March !. Even though I am not young, the Segway was easy to ride and manoeuvre....so much fun! Tomas , our guide was knowledgable and interesting as well as able to have a laugh or two along the way. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to anyone !! Loved it ...

So much fun, the best way to get around Budapest (if you Ivan handle the curbs ha ha). I have lived in Budapest for 7 years, so I didn't go on the tour for the facts and info. However, our guide tamas was informative, funny, and made quizzes of the information he told us so we were always engaged. The tour starts with a training session until everyone in the group is confident. I was extremely anxious about whether I could handle the segway, but after a few minutes I was able to let the segway take me everywhere. It's a great experience and is certainly better than walking.The route is simple, you see great sights and get a really well grounded feel of the country's history and also an insight to more cultural and political views in a non biased way too. Tamas was encouraging, supportive and entertaining. This is not the first tour I have done with them, and I have faith that any tour you do will be the same quality. Perfect for newcomers to the city, or a great new way to see a place you have lived in for years, get on a segway!

Segwaying in Budapest. I love Segwaying and have done it in cities around the world.Guide Peter, is very relaxed and has extensive knowledge of Budapest.If, by chance, he did not know something: out came his iPhone to find out in what year building X or statue Y had been erected.For my 10-year old nephew the highlight of our Budapest break.For me another great Segway experience.Thank you guys :)

Great way to see the sights!. We went on the segway tour in earl February . Our tour guide Bridget was very patient with showing us how to use the segways and very knowledgable about the area. It was a small group which was better. A very enjoyable way to see the sights of Budapest. Thanks very much to all at Yellow Zebra Segways and Bike Tours for a very enjoyable experience.

Must to do! Fantastic experience!!. Great way to see the city. We were very lucky as we were the only two people in the tour. Our tour guide Brigi was very helpful and friendly. We would like to do it again!

Best part of my trip.. The tour was great and our guide, Kinge, was so well informed. She was easy to follow and listen to. The tour lasted about 2.5 hours. Was about 60 euros each but you get 30% discount with a Budapest card. This was also a great buy. We used it on all the public transport and plenty of discounts around town. The weather was cold in feb so wrap up warm. They even offer you gloves if you forget. We saw so much of the town and it gave us great ideas where to head next on our trip. Loved every minute of it. There is also a little bookshop at the location and toilet. They let you hire bikes too and serve a small selection of drinks.

A Excellent way of seeing City. Only had a couple of days in Budapest but the segway tour was a real highlight.
Kinga (tour guide) was very helpful, friendly and knowledgeable about Budapest.
My first time on a segway and she had me running up on it in no time.
A plus, will go back and do again.
Thank you.

Fantastic Way to Experience Budapest. I only had a few days in Budapest so I decided the fastest way to get up to speed with what there was to see would be by segway. I did a three-hour tour and was lucky enough to be the only one at that time, so had my own personal guide, Peter. Peter was excellent; he was very knowledgeable and pointed out many details I would not have noticed wandering around on my own. I had never been on a segway before but we had a practice session first and I soon found out it wasn't too difficult and was heaps of fun. I was glad we had three hours rather than the standard two; it gave us time to thoroughly explore the Pest side of the river without ever feeling rushed. The segways can't go everywhere you can go on a walking tour, but that didn't limit us; there were several times when we stopped and the guide looked after the segways while I went inside buildings or across uneven ground to take a closer look at the sights. We also took plenty of photos; the guide was willing to take as many snaps as I wanted. I also did a walking tour while in Budapest and while that was also interesting, this tour allowed me to cover so much more ground in a very short period of time. One nice touch was that the guide brought a book of historic photos with him, and showed me some of the places we saw at significant moments in their history. I would definitely do a tour with this company again. If you are going to try a segway tour, I recommend wearing comfy, warm clothing and shoes and bringing your camera.

Superior flexibilty and knowledge. Having very limited time between business obligations Yellow Zebra Segway and Bike Tours managed to set us up with a private tour within just 1 hour lead time. Our guide Peter showed great knowledge of the city and its history. With his delicate sense for customer satisfaction and interest he adjusted the tour to fit us perfect.

A must!!. We did a 2 hour segway tour around the main attractions in Budapest. It ended up being just the 4 of us so the tour was private but we did not have to pay extra which was great.I was particularly interested in learning more about Hungary (aka Magyar) and the tour guide, Peter was able to feed us with interesting facts and history about the place.The segway itself is so much fun and so easy to use. Would definitely recommend this tour!
Segway Company Tour. Excellent adventure - absolutely perfect & flexible in organizing a tour to remember as part of a company meeting in Budapest. 100% recommendable...

Good bike rental. Affordable prices, good bikes (new, comfortable, yellow :), friendly and helpful staff. Also we could leave our luggage there while we were ring around the city. Bike is definitely good way to surf around Budapest city center.

Good people and equipment, reasonable price. 1. We took bycicles for rent this winter and Zebra was opened, though most of bike rentals were closed during new-year holiday season.2. The bycicles are good - light and in good condition, we enjoyed using them, 3. The prices are reasonable compared to other European countries.4. We also took the segway tour - the equipment is in good working condition and there is training session before the start of the tour, this time does not count towards total tour time.5. The tour itself is interesting (though I presume it depends on the guide who accompanies you - please see below).6. There is possibility to book in advance - please use it, there is small discount + the availability is guaranteed.7. The guide Peter is simply the best!!! We asked to tell us more about the life in Hungaria and some most interesting facts of the history, something that is not well covered in ordinary printed guides. And thanks to Peter we enjoyed not only the segways, but also what we learned from him about Budapest and especially the insights of the quarter near synagogue.THANKS PETER AND THE ZEBRA TEAM!!

A great way to see the city. This was my first trip to Budapest and I knew I would be spending most of my time working, so we were looking for a way to see and hear about the city without riding one of the tour buses.This was my first experience with a Segway, but after a quick training session, I was comfortable and off we went!Peter was our guide and asked if we had any particular interests. In my case it was history, and Peter proved to be very knowledgeable about the city and it's history. Additionally, he was fun and witty.If you want to learn about Budapest and like being outdoors, this is the tour for you!

What cool fun.. Went on a tour with my friends in Budapest and Tamas took such great great care of us from YellowZebraTours. We had a blast and its amazing way to see the city. Do yourself a favor and do the same.

Budapest Segway tour. While on a business trip, I had a Sunday afternoon free to see the key sites in Budapest and get familiar with a European city I had not previously visited. Peter was our local host and guide for the you and gave us a fantastic overview of the history of Budapest, its main historical downtown sites - the Danube, the Opera house, Parliment, Freedom Square and others. it was a very well done tour by a friendly and well informed guide that enhanced the rest of my week's enjoyment of this wonderful city.

Great Fun, could have used more history.. I did the segway tour this morning and overall I would definitely do it again, the segways are fun and very easy to use, even if you are completely unco-ordinated like I am.We had a training session on them first which totally put my mind at ease and then we where off. Our tour guide was really and confidence instilling on the segway, but at the end I feel I did not see that many sites or hear that much history. Depnding on what you want the tour to provide a bus tour may be better. The segways are amazing fun though and I would do it again just for them.
Way to go. We had a very informative and extensive tour of Pest. Our guide was Nora whom I would recommend as a guide as she was very well versed in local history.

Great fun and excellent guides. Although it was raining we rented a Segway at Yellow Zebra. The guides showed us a large part of Budapest.The knowledge of the guides is very good and they are very friendly and in for a joke.

Fun and easy. This was my very first segway ride and I got to do it in Budapest! My guide Nora was extremely helpful and remained very cheerful despite the freezing temperature. I learned hw to ride in no time and it was the highlight of my Budapest trip. They have a cozy office in the heart of Pest.You get 30% off using a Budapest card and it is definitely worth it!

An unforgettable experience!!! A must do!. We booked a two hour Segway tour of Inner Pest for Friday 13th December and I cannot recommend it enough. Simply fantastic!!!!Our tour guide, Bridget, was knowledgeable friendly and patient. She immediately put us at ease as she carefully taught us how to control our Segways before she set us loose on Budapest! Although I have not used a Segway before it only took a few minutes to get the hang of it (and I wouldn’t class myself as adventurous or particularly well coordinated!!!).We took a tour around the main sights in Inner Pest and Bridget showed us where to visit the best Christmas markets. Bridget also allowed time to stop off at a quiet park area where we able to race around without having to watch for cars and pedestrians! Overall…fantastic. The office itself was easy to find, and Bridget made it an experience that we won’t forget! Thank you!TIP - If taking a tour in the colder months wrap up VERY warm! You will be standing still so lots of layers are essential!

Segway Tour. We booked an afternoon segway tour of Budapest. Great way to see the city, guide was really informative and friendly. The Segway was really easy to use and didn't take long to get the hang of. Definitely need to wrap up warm for this time of year.

Great tour of Budapest. Tomas took us on a tour of Budapest by Segway and it was fantastic! The Seqway was pretty easy to master. Tomas was a brilliant guide (very knowledgeable, good sense of humour). There were 5 in our group so we booked a private tour for a small additional fee, it was well worth it. I would highly recommend this tour.

Great way to see Budapest. We did the yellow zebra (not sure why it is called this??) bike tour of Budapest and found it to be a great way of see a lot of this city in a few hours.Bike were good and our guide Gabor was very helpful and knowledgable .Fun way of getting around and going to all the important places here.Highly recommend it!

Great way to see Budapest. We feel that bike tours give you a really good bearing of the city and sites so we like to do them early in the visit and this tour did just that. Our guide Peter was friendly, entertaining and helpful. He never tired of your questions. We were a smaller group, only 2 couples, so he was able to tailor the tour toward our interest, while not leaving out anything. The city is very bike friendly and I never felt in any sort of danger considering there is a a fair amount of traffic; we did the tour on a Monday.There was a scheduled stop for coffee and traditional pastry before you head over towards the Buda side of the city. That was a nice and welcome break.We would certainly recommend this tour and this company for anyone visiting Budapest.

Bike tour was Amazing. It was first time visiting Budapest and I wanted to make sure I did everything that I wanted to do and see. I knew from the beginning that I did not want to do the usual bus tour around the city. I saw the Bike Tour on Viator and new this was the best way to see and learn about the city. Boy, was I right. There were only three people in the tour with myself included. It made the tour more personal and our tour guide Nora adjusted the tour to our size. We saw everything from from Hero's Square to the House of Terror, the Opera House and more. The best was riding up and down Andrassy St and up the hill to see the buda castle, fisherman's bastion and crossing the chain bridge was amazing. Nora was very knowledgeable and her English was very good and her enthusiasm throughout the tour was great. She was a great guide and the next time I go I will definitely book my tour with her again. Thanks Nora.

Constant amusement!. Although I didn't join in the Segway tour with the Yellow Zebra, it was after all much better experience to join in a walking tour with an excellent guide, Anita, who showed me around the beautiful budapest half a day. She is obviously very fluent in Engilsh with great knowledge of the history of Hungary. She never forgets to add some jokes all the time and interesting news what happened recently in the city so you never ever get bored and time went really fast. On top of that, she has some creative way to keep this journey "unique" ,which you have to find out yourself by joining in the walking tour! Last not the least, it is a part of the tour (cost included) to rest in a very very nice cafe salon and enjoy the traditional hugarian sweet with drink. Thank you so much for the unforgetable tour again!!

Segway tour. The Segway tour with Nora was awesome! We went out in storm and pouring rain, were freezing and wet to the bone after the first half hour, but no way we would have agreed to go back early! (Even though our guide offered the option if we didn't want to continue.)Of course we didn't see as much as we could have in better weather, but Nora tried to find a dry place to stop at all sights and gave us lots of interesting information, in a very nice and enthusiastic way. This had been my third tour on the trip after the Hop on, hop off and the ghost walking tour, but it was by far the most educational and interesting! And of course the one that was most fun, because Segways are just awesome. :-)
Fantastic team event. We were in Budapest for work and I took my team on this. Lots of fun, and our guide Petee has great - lots of great information and a nice guy too!

Peter the tour guide was awesome. The Segway tour with Peter was one of the highlights of our European trip. Highly recommend it. When you first arrive in Budapest, the first thing you should do is book your Segway your with Peter.

Great day activity. Have just come back fromBudapest, which is a great city to explore. We went on a bike tour with Nora who was fantastic. She was extremely enthusiastic and knowledgable about the local area. Doing the bike tour also gives you an idea of where some of the main attractions are in the city and therefore you can pick and chose what you do the next day. It also finishes behind the opera house which runs tours at 3 and 4pm which we went into under Nora's recommendation and it was very interesting!!!

Brilliant!!. Took a segway afternoon tour with Yellow Zebra recently, and was really impressed. The office was easily found and we were received by a friendly staff. After an initial practice session, we were off on a 2-hour spin around the city with our guide, Brigid. She is a superb ambassador for her city, and gave us plenty of insider information and funny anecdotes. There was no-one else on our tour, so Brigid tailored the afternoon to suit our interests. This is an amazing experience and a lot of fun. We had never used segways before but they were really easy to use. Highly recommend this for everyone. Enjoy!! Thanks Brigid, amazing!

The best way to see Budapest with teenagers. We did a private tour with four teenagers, this was by far the best way to see the city, the teenagers were having fun and yet were learning about the city at the same time. Bridget was our tour guide, and she allowed us to choose exactly where we could go. We would highly recommend it.

Awesome tour!. I did this tour today and our guide was Tamas, he was excellent, great info, plenty of tips on what to do and friendly.I'd never been on a segway before but don't let that put you off as after 15 mins you'll be a pro!. You will see a lot of the pest side and views of Buda, really good thing to do on first day so you get an idea of where everything is.Also Tamas did a fun little quiz during our tour on Budapest and it's history, i found he kept the group engaged and involved which is much nicer than just listening constantly.Great job, would do one again in another city and hopefully get a guide as good as this one.
Great fun way to see central Budapest. Very informative way to spend a couple of hours touring a lovely city . Tour guide Peter really knows his stuff . Segway really easy to use and great fun

One of the best bike tours yet!!. Brilliant bike tour. Accomodated us perfectly when Budapest Bike tours let us down when they didnt turn up!! Victor was fantastic, great guide and great banter. We were a bunch of Irish lads, bit loud but no one seemed to be worried and the group were great. So much fun.Hello to christine, Emma, Adrian, The aussies and Bob and his bunch.baz.spence1@btopenworld.com

Segway fantastic with thomas. We were 3 friends in Budapest, thomas took us on 2 fantastic Segway tours, we highly recommend it:))) enjoy:))) you will have lots of fun & discover Budapest & save time:))

Budapest at it's best. We were a group of eight people of mixed ages on conference . We had a gap on Sunday afternoon and Yellow Zebra filled the spot with their Segway Tour. Our guide Peter had great geographical and historical knowledge and sense of fun which made the tour all the more enjoyable . A great experience!

Segway, the best way to see Budapest!. We had the tour earlier this month and it was great, safe and fun to tour a city. Anita the tour guide was great, she took more than enough time to train us to use the segway (was the first time for us, she made it so easy) and she had all the knowledge about the history/places in Budapest. Thanks Anita!.

Fantastic! Made our holiday.. We turned up on spec for a 2 hour tour of the city by Segway after seeing it advertised in the booklet that came with the Budapest cards that we bought at the airport on our arrival (which gave us a 30% discount off the price, so well worth having).As there was no-one else there at the time the tour was due to depart (9.30am on a Sunday in early October) we were treated to a private tour by Peter (who speaks perfect English) which was FANTASTIC. Really informative and great fun (I so wish Segways were legal to use on the road over here....). I can't recommend it highly enough - it really did make my holiday - absolutely wonderful. If you have them I would recommend you take gloves with you, even if it isn't that cold, as your hands can get a bit chilly on the Segway (as the weather was mild when we went I didn't take my gloves on holiday with me). I believe they have special mittens for use in the winter :-)

See it by Segway. I've done Segway before and it gets better every time. Guide, Andi, really knew her stuff. There were nine of us in the group and she wasn't phased at all. Highly recommended whatever your age - I'm the wrong side of 50.

Segway fun with Brigit. It was wonderful evening in my life, i took 2 Hrs of segway private tour, my tour guide was beautiful and sweet Brigit....She was so lovely girl and shown me the entire city of pest side...i have personally thank to her and my tour operator too. I started at 6 pm and ended at 8 pm...so i can watch the elimination of Budha castle and the Dune boating.

Great tour!. It was a great tour around Budapest! the advisor (Támaz) was very nice, polite and we got a lot of fun. He had a big knowledge about the history of Budapest and its places, besides, we were able to go into the Yellow Zebra place and see a room completely related to the communist era in Hungary. It was a super good and interesting experience.

Segway tour with Tomas. This is a brilliant concept for seeing the city, especially if you have limited time to see the sights. We had Tomas as a guide who was fantastic as both parents and children were able to take in the information. Both kids (aged 10 & 12) and parents had a ball. Do yourself a favour and take a tour, you won't regret it.
See Budapest in less than 2 hours. I think it`s a great way see to the city.Peter (the flying dutch man) was amazing, funny and entertaining. Segway is easy to learn and fun.Great value for money.

Segway - The only way to see Budapest. We scheduled a three hour Segway tour of Budapest. Yellow Zebra had a taxi pick us up at our vacation apartment, then off to their shop. Tamas greeted us in the office, he got us all set up with our helmets, and described where he was going to take us on his tour. After 30 minutes of hands on training, Tamas lead us down the streets of Budapest, pointing out all the interesting places that we came across. Tamas made the trip fun, he used his knowledge of the city to create an ongoing game to test our knowledge and to see if we were listening to him. The tour was a fantastic experience, and I hope that we will be able to tour with Tamas on our next visit.

Private Tour of Budapest via Segway. A great way to see Budapest!!Tamas was an excellent guide, taking 4, first time Segway riders, through the streets of Budapest. He made us each feel comfortable and safe while giving us a great tour of his city, with some great insights from a local. He did not rush us and we got our full 3 hour tour, maybe a little longer as we asked him many questions. Would do it again, worth the money!! Thanks Again Tamas!!!!

Excellent way to see the city. We had a tour with Peter last week and it was absolutely brilliant. If you're only in Budapest for a couple of days (as we were) then this is an excellent way to see some sights, get your bearings, do some exploring and learn some facts all in one. From the City Park and Heroes' Square to the Fisherman's Bastion, it was fantastic fun and informative too. And there's a cake stop in the middle! If you're nervous about cycling through the city, it's actually absolutely fine. There are a lot of cycle paths and Peter looks after you well. I couldn't recommend it enough - much nicer way to tour than on a stuffy bus and with somebody who is really passionate about their Hungarian history. Plus they have a tremendous bookshop at their headquarters to pass some time before or after the tour.

Great guided Segway tour experience at Budapest. We had a great 3 hours tour with Andi, an awesome tour guide which guided us through the history route and the current great Budapest.It is located behind the opera (Lazar st) and the Segway hesitations weren't necessary even for first time drivers.A great way to have a Budapest guided tour for those who prefer less athletic one then a bike tour and for those who wish to have a professional tour at Budapest (pest side only)Andi was happy to provide also tips for local restaurants etc... And let us departure fully loaded with her recommendations set on the map :-)

Loved the Sunday bike tour!. Leaving the Sunday morning breakfast at my hotel, I noticed the small flyer for Yellow Zebra. It was 10:30. The hotel reception confirmed space on the tour, and I made it over by 11:00. The location is central (behind the Opera House). There were 11 of us on this English speaking tour, distributed evenly from USA, Canada, UK, and Australia. The bikes are in great condition and well maintained (helmets provided, but optional). Peter, our guide, was a blast! Over the 4 hours we covered 15-20 KM total, with relaxing riding (except the uphill to Buda Castle which added a bit of strenuous pedaling, and a very rapid descent) and frequent stops at the major attractions. We were able to cover major parts of the city, cross the river on the Chain Bridge, and see all of the sights (from the outside, no visiting the attractions on this trip) in a single ride. As this was my first time to Budapest, it was a delightful way to get acquainted with this wonderful city, and to make a short-list of the places to visit. Peter shared the history of each part of the city, highlighting the contributions of various Hungarians to the world. We stopped for a lemonade and dessert at a very nice outdoor restaurant (included with the trip price- also very nice and handy WCs there).As an FYI, the bike shop does have sunscreen (just ask, they have a large bottle for customers to use).

Our coach and guide, Peter!. We took the Segway tour for 2 hours. Our coach and guide, Peter is such a blessing! He made it very easy to understand on driving a Segway, with a lot of patience, and humor. He showed us around with a lot of information on the various historical architectures, and the story behind them. Peter is very professional in his job, with his extended knowledge on other things of Budapest, we were having a profound tourist guide and a wonderful and enthusiastic coach at the same time.....a big THANK YOU to Peter, we had a great time and a good memory of Budapest!!

Segway fun with Peter. One of the highlights of our trip before hitting Budapest night life. Peter was such an nice and chill tour guide - knowledgable on the sights but super relaxed about us breaking away from the group to enjoy riding the Segway instead of listening to every word. By the end we we were flying the Segways across town. The tour was the of the day and was mostly at twilight and in the dark - a great time to see the cities sights. Segways let you cover a lot of ground in very little time. The tour was worth every euro! Would do it again next time I am back - thanks Peter for a great time! The 5 guys from Berlin
Brilliant way to see Budapest!. We went on the morning Segway tour and it was great.Highly recommended, very knowledgeable tour guide, good equipment! And if you book online you get a discount!

Could have been better. I booked the segway 3 hr tour and it was very informative, however, the guide did not take us to a few of the sites I was expecting and an additional site was eliminated due to road construction. I thought the tour was good but was expecting more when compared to other segway tours I have taken, I think all the guides need to visit a set sites. Overall I would do this again as it saves on walking and you can cover a lot of ground.

Night Tour and Danube River Cruise. Anita was an excellent historian who was friendly, interesting and knowledgeable and enhanced our visit to Budapest. Even though we had been in Budapest for several days, she shared new information and sites we had not visited.She is very proud of her city and made us feel honored to be a part of it for a brief period. Anita speaks several languages fluently and is very easy to understand. Following our tour we went on a beautiful night tour on the Danube River with wonderful photo opportunities. We would definitely recommend this tour to anyone travelling to Budapest.

Fantastic. Bike tours are a great way to cover a lot of a city and gain a a larger understanding of it. This was no exception. Peter was a great guide very knowledgeable and always made sure even the slowest of riders were accounted for (even offering to pull them up the Castle Hill).

Segway tour in Budapest w/ our guide Tomas. This was one of the funnest activities that I have ever done on a trip. Seeing the important sites on a segway, of course this couldn't be possible if it wasn't for our guide Tomas. He was very friendly, nice and above all knowledgeable about Hungarian history. He explained everything in detail and answered everyone's questions. He was funny and made everyone comfortable and at ease. I would highly recommend this company and especially this guide.

Great bike tour with a great guide. My son and I recently took a 3 hour bike tour with Yellow Zebra. Our guide, a sweet young guy by the name of Victor, despite his youth, was very professional and very knowledgeable about Budapest and its history. Part of the trip was a stop for cake and drinks. Due to religious dietary restrictions, we couldn't eat the delicious looking cake, but Victor did his best to find us an alternative. Thanks, Victor. I learned a lot about the city, which is quite beautiful (and sure has changed since 1986, the last time I was there). The bikes were good, and we even rented them again afterwards so we could explore the city more on our own.

Night Delight !. We had a great time with Peter, our guide to Budapest at night , this was a great way to get a guide to the city , the city is glowing with life at night and the Chain bridge and castle were spectacular photo spots . A must do in Budapest ! Easy to find behind the opera house. Thanks for a great night Peter !
Worth It. Our group (Intrepid) took a bike tour with Peter. He was awesome, very knowledgable, and gave us a great overview of the city. Definitely a great way to see Budapest!

A must !!!. My wife and myself took the cycling tour on our first day. Wow it was owsome our guide Peter was very interesting and helpfull even pushed my wife bike up to buda hill. If you are like cycling so you won't regret. Such a good opportunity to have an city overview. Thank you Peter and yellow zebra

segways tours. The tour guide Prter is very nice, friendly and experienced. We choose a segways tours for threes hours. This is a excellent tours include all the view sights in Pest. Use segway instead of walk is very interesting. It is very good and highly recommended.

Great way to experience Budapest. We spent our first morning in Budapest on a Segway tour of the city. I was very apprehensive about going on a Segway, but needn't have been. We had excellent, individual instruction from Tomas and then we were off. Within minutes it felt very comfortable on the Segway and we were able to see lots of the sights.Tomas was a great guide. He was passionate about his home city of Budapest and shared huge amounts of knowledge with us - lots of history, but lots of current information as well. He was an excellent communicator, good fun and happy to answer our questions.This was a brilliant start to our stay in Budapest - an amazing city.Would definitely recommend.

Yellow Zebra Segway tour and Buda walking tour were great!. We took the 3 hour Segway tour of Budapest. Our guide, Thomas, and his assistant, Sabi were really helpful, friendly and informative. It was a great tour and it was a lot of fun. The next day we took the walking tour of Buda offered free through yellow Zebra with the Budapest card. Viktor was the walking guide and he was also excellent.

Yellow Zebra Segway tour was great!. We took the 3 hour Segway tour of Budapest. Our guide, Thomas, and his assistant, Sabi were really helpful, friendly and informative. It was a great tour and it was a lot of fun.

Segway Tour, Budapest. Our group of two couples on Segways and guide Bala'zs on push bike had a great time touring the fascinating city of Budapest. As senior citizens we appreciated Bala'zs patience and enthusiasm in first training us, then letting us loose (with him as guide) around the city. It was a truly memorable experience and one we would recommend to anyone who wishes a guided tour without extensive walking. We estimate more than 5k was travelled over the 2hrs touring, a lot of fun for all, a great buzz. Thanks to all at Yellow Zebra Segways and Bikes.

Best tour of our European Vacation. Our guide Peter was fantastic! He made the tour fun, informative and relaxing. This was by far and away the best way to see Budapest! I totally recommend this tour to any Canadians (or other foreigners)! :-)

Great way to see the city. We took a bicycle tour of Budapest with yellow zebra. Our guide, Thomas, was brilliant. The tour was a lot of fun. It took us about 4 hours but we were able to cover most of the main attractions of the city on the bike and Thomas was able to fill us in with a lot of the history and interesting facts about the various things we saw. I generally love taking walking tours of any city but I thought this was an even better idea as we were able to cover a far bigger distance yet have the same one to one interaction with a great guide which really helps to experience the city.

A little disappointed given the reviews. It was an okay tour and our guide was friendly and very knowledgable but it wasn't great. Others on the tour seemed to enjoy it but I've had better bike tours elsewhere. The tour also overran by 45 minutes. The guide checked that none of us had appointments to go to but we were already behind schedule by that stage and saying yes would presumably have meant missing something out or maybe annoying the rest of the group.

Very nice private german segway tour. Thank you for this private german segway tour.Peter, the guide, was very friendly and explained us all the main Budapest monument.One of the best way to visit a city center.I will book later a segway tour in another europeen capital.Thank you.

Excellent Segway Budapest city tour. Brilliant afternoon touring the city on segways, one of our party couldn't get enough confidence on the Segway, so happily had a bike as an alternative even though the guide gave lots of help and encouragement- great to know if you're a bit wary of booking in case you can't get the hang of it and would be happy to cycle in the case of you 'bottling it'. The rest of us took to it like ducks to water. Victor, the guide, was friendly, informative, knowledgeable and speaks excellent English. A must do activity for anyone visiting the city; and they gave me a nice birthday gift. Thanks guys :D

Budapest via Segway. As you walk around in Budapest you will recognize Touristguide Peter on his Segway.So we also booked a 3 hours SegwayTour with Peter threw Budapest. We saw a lot and "knowledge Peter" told us everything we wanted to know about it.He knows his stuff. Teaching to drive a Segway, teaching about history of Budapest.Its like travelling around with a caring local you met at couchsurfing.Thank you, Peter!

Segway Tour in Budapest. What a fun experience! I took my son (11 yo) on a segway tour in Budapest, and it turned out to be the highlight of our vacation for him. Our guide Tamás was simply awesome. He made the tour for the adults as well as my son really enjoyable and fun. We learned a great deal about the history and visited places we wouldn't have discovered on our own while having a great time on the segways. I'd recommend Yellow Zebra Tours to everyone visiting Budapest or Praque. And don't forget to ask for Tamás - he is the best!

2 hours Segway tour. It was wonderful to discover Budapest with the Segway. We were 2 families with 3 young people (16, 13 and 12 years old) and after 40 minutes of training we had a tour of Budapest during 2 hours. Peter, our excellent tour guide, speak english very well. His knowledge of the city is great and he gave us a lot of interesting informations including a good restaurant for the evening.The tour is a little bit expensive (60 € per person) but you won't regret it. Very very fun !!!!!

Yellow Zebra Bike Tour Budapest. It was an OK tour and route covered the city well. I felt the guide, a native Hungarian woman, gave us adequate information, but nothing extra. Perhaps her lack of fluency in English was a problem. My biggest complaint though was as a tour leader she didn't look back often to keep track of her charges. One gal, who was a slow cyclist, was left completely behind and missed a turn. Then the guide didn't even go back to look for her, just waited for guests to call on cell or go back and search. So, poor marks for group safety. And group too large (about 13 or so) for one guide.

Excellent! Defo would recommend!. My boyfriend and I had Thomas a few weeks ago for a Segway tour around the streets of Budapest. It was a fantastic experience, and our tour guide, Thomas made the tour very fun and informative. His English was brilliant and his knowledge of the the city was great. Before we set off, he made sure we were all comfortable on the segways, which made us all feel at ease. He turned the tour into a quiz which kept us all engaged! Thoroughly enjoyed our experience on a Segway in Budapest, and it was even more enjoyable because it was through the streets and had history coupled with it! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who visits Budapest! Thank you yellow zebra and thank you to Thomas!

Bike tour with Balazs. We went on an evening bike tour with Balazs. He was a great guide with good insights. The tour took in the best sites of Pest and the riverbank of Buda. The only improvement would be bike maintenance, the bike I had didn't shift so well, but nothing some adjustment wouldn't fix. A good tour overall. Thanks!

Must-do experience, great fun!. Our guide was the lovely Brigit, and as we were the only ones on the 6pm tour she gave us the option of the usual guided tour or to take us down to City Park - so the Park it was! Absolutely great fun, Brigit was lovely company and recommended a few things to us including a restaurant for that night (seperate review for Belvarosi Lugas) and a guide we had previously spoken to, Thomas, had recommended the zoo which was fantastic. It may seem a bit pricey but believe me you won't regret it - brilliant fun!

Funny and nice way to visit the city!. We booked online this tour for the first day, we thought it might give an idea of what the city could be like and what we wanted to see better in the next days of our holiday, we weren’t wrong. When you arrive you’re given a nice KTM bicycle and you’re told how to operate if you don’t know how to. Guides are in english or hungarian, I find our guide Kinga, very easy to understand. The tour is very easy, mostly flat road apart from a small hill to the fisherman’s bastion, nothing too challenging though and I didn’t use a bicycle in 10 years. A break in the city centre it’s included with something to eat and drink, we find it very nice. I strongly recommend this tour to anybody, infact it was one of my favourite things in Budapest.

Wonderful!. We went on a Segway tour with Brigit and it was great! Would highly recommend this place. We saw many of the sights we wanted to see, and had a great time on the segways. It was one of the highlights of our trip

Awesome. As a nervy driver I was a little concerned that I would struggle to do this but with excellent training I soon became an expert and was absolutely loving it. Our excellent guides Thomas and Peter made sure we missed nothing and their knowledge of the local history was great. If you don't do any other tour you should do this-not just for the information and history and how much area you can cover in a short time, but because it is brilliant fun too-worth every penny

Bike Tour. A friend and I only had a little time in Budapest so we decided to take a bike tour to see and learn as much as we could in a few hours. Gabor was our guide and we had him all to ourselves since we were the only ones who signed up that day. He was very knowledgeable and really took the time to answer all of our questions. The bike ride was a great way to get out and move around while still being able to see many of the countries attractions in a short time.

Great for families with small children!!. We had an excellent experience with Yellow Zebra. Our 5 year old was on a tag-along with her dad, and our 2 year old was in a seat on mom's bike. We all had helmets that fit perfectly. The tour was comprehensive, but not overly so, so the children were happy the whole time. There was a break in the middle for some delicious strudel (rétes) and drinks - which was much appreciated on a sunny, hot day. Our tour guide was thrown a curve ball, access to Castle Hill was closed due to a WWII bomb being discovered in the vicinity. She talked with all the participants of the tour with several alternative attractions to visit for the remainder of the tour. The company is professional, equipment is great and location is easy to find. We highly recommend Yellow Zebra :)

A fun Segway tour with Thomas. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Budapest on Segways with Thomas. He was very knowledgeable about the city and made learning fun with his quiz questions. Even though we weren't experienced Segway drivers, our tour leaders were helpful and patient. Thomas seems to really enjoy his job and is passionate about his hometown of Budapest. We got a great overview of the city and had a lot of fun with the vehicles. We will Segway again in future travel excursions. Thank you Yellow Zebra!

Great way to learn a little about the history of budapest. Lots of fun.. My wife and I had just gotten into Budapest and wanted a tour of the city. Our bike-tour guide, Gabor, was fantastic. Even in a group of 17 he took the time to patiently explain the significance of many of the monuments, churches and even provided historical background on many of Hungary's great leaders (depicted in the statutes we saw on the tour). He was incredibly knowledgeble about the city, it's history and even the many of the hungarian symbols like the Turol, Raven and others. It was a great way to learn about the history and culture of Budapest and Hungary in a short amount of time with a knowledgable guide. Could not recommend it more.

Must get one of these. Our guide Mattias (Mat) was exceptional. His English was first class as was his knowledge of Budapest and its history. The Segways, after a very brief induction, were easy to use and a lot of fun. In a matter of minutes we were zipping in and out of traffic, both vehicular and pedestrian - be aware of pedestrians as they are generally unaware, and often quite suicidal, but no injuries were encountered.Mat always ensured that we were within eyeshot and managing the Segways competently. Once satisfied that we were, in fact, in control, he switched off 'turtle' mode, allowing us greater speed and manoeuvrability.I booked this from Australia well in advance and think this is a must do for everyone. Great value

Walking tour Buda with Yellow Zebra. Yesterday we had very nice excursion around the Buda with very creative, interesting and fun guide Thomas. It was discovering walking among the most valuable Buda's site-seeing that was transformed into historical competition by Thomas with really gifts for winner. If you have Budapest tourist card this excursion is charge of free for you.
Thank you Thomas and Yellow Zebra!

Budapest biking experience. My wife and I (aged 57 and 60) thoroughly enjoyed our evening biking experience around Budapest. We were joined by a dozen teenagers and young adults and safely zipped around the city (Pesh and Buda) during our 3.5 hour journey. All credit to our lively and informative biking guide, Anita. Her English was impeccable and depth of knowledge superior. I would highly recommend this experience for those who are active and want a quick view of the city while burning a few calories. Incidentally, the check-in process was a breeze-we paid and were off and riding within10 minutes. Do it if you want the breeze blowing in your face, while giving your muscles a good workout and filling your head with information that will enlighten you. Ask for Anita. You won't be sorry!

Affordable Tour by Segway. We took a two hour tour on Segway with Bridget and Lauren. Both were friendly and helpful. Bridget proudly shared lots of Hungarian history. Our group included 5 young German men who were more interested in riding than touring which distracted from the overall experience. This was no fault of the guides or the tour company, but it is a consideration when arranging tours. It can happen anywhere and I actually felt bad for our guides. I would definitely use Yellow Zebra again and appreciated the knowledge and expertise of both the city and the Segway.

Fabulous Segway tour!. Highly highly recommend - Bridget gave us a great intro to Segway riding and then took us on a fabulous tour of some of Budapest's key sites- a fabulous few hours, and the Segways made a wonderfully fun change from walking and bike tours. Not to be missed!

Segway around Budapest. Definitely the highlight of my trip to Budapest! Such a brilliant experience, I had Peter who was very enthusiastic and entertaining! Loved the history and information I learned about sights in the city. Absolutely recommend this to anyone and everyone. An amazing experience and shall be doing a Segway tour (with the same company) in Prague later in the year. Thanks Peter! Hayley

Bike Tour of Budapest. We took a tour of Budapest (Buda and Pest - two parts to the city) by bike with Yellow Zebra bike tours. Our guide was Bernadette and she is excellent! Friendly, her English is outstanding, approachable, knowledgeable. There is a lot of history in Budapest and Bernadette gave us the highlights without a moment's boredom. I especially enjoyed Heroes Square. Very good value too. I thoroughly enjoyed it and recommend it to all able-bodied tourists!

On your bike!. Straight across from the extraordinary Szimpla Kert is this treasure of a bike hire place. There is no other way to get around ALL of Budapest other than on bike (ain't tried the Segway thing, too touristy). Bike lanes in the city mean that now you can get around so easily and as there were no time limits for bike returns, your day is your own to explore. We thought we'd be back at 5 (Londoners...) but it was probably more like 11pm and no one battered an eyelid - no extra costs and a beer at the ready! Will use and recommend these lovely people again and again.

Night Bike Tour Not for the Faint of Heart. My wife and I did 5pm bike tour with Yellow Zebra and really enjoyed it. Not only did we get to see a lot of the sites very quickly, our guide (Barbie) was extremely informative from a historical perspective and helping us understand what it is like to grow up in Hungary. I would consider myself a very experienced cyclist (biked over 5,000 miles) and I found this ride to be intense due to rush hour walkers, bikers, and cars. While we tried to stay in bike lanes, everywhere was crowded with some local bikers riding extremely fast though tight areas. We saw one local biker crash into a pedestrian at 15 mph or so (I'm sure some bones were broken). Barbie was a very safe guide, went at a very moderate pace (8-10mph), and made sure the group stayed together. FYI - these are hybrid bikes, not cruisers other bike tours throughout Europe use, which is good for the terrain, but adds to the fact that this ride is a little more intense than other bike tours you may find in Europe.

Great value & jam packed Budapest tour. If you are stretched for time in Budapest or want a bit of a quick overview of many of the sites in Budapest, this is a fantastic tour. Since you're on bikes you're able to fit so much more of both Buda and Pest into the time. Our tour guide was really generous and we ended up having her for at least 4 hours, she was knowledgeable and provided us with great tid bits of Budapest and Hungary's history. Time was allowed for snapshots along the way and we stopped for the strudels & coffee about half way, which iI definitely needed for the ride up Castle Hill! A great intro to Budapest in half a day!

Awesome Segway Tour. We are a couple of Segway junkies having taken tours in Paris, Chicago, Boston, Barcelona, Berlin... basically wherever we can. I think they're a great way to see a new destination and learn more about places we've already been. So here we are in Budapest and wanted to do the same. We know the regular tours include "training:" important, but a little boring (and sometimes amusing) if you know how to ride one already. So we spoke with our hotel concierge and she called Yellow Zebra and asked if we could do a private tour. We were pleased when they graciously obliged. We arrived at the appointed hour and met our guide, Peter, who put himself completely at our disposal... "What would you like to see?" was his first question. Couldn't have been a better way to start a tour. Peter is a knowledgeable and humorous guide and he made the tour so much fun. I believe saw nearly every possible historical site during our 2+ hours together. I enjoyed his personality and good nature and would highly recommend Yellow Zebra to you when in Budapest!
Thomas. One of the best tours.. We enjoyed our time with Thomas , he was our guide. He's funny and he show us everything in Budapest

Segway city Tour. We booked this tour through our hotel. Initially I was a bit hesitant as it was going to be my first Segway experience. Our guide Balazs was extremely friendly and knowledgable. We received a short orientation on the use of the Segway and then took off for a 2 hour city tour. We covered almost all the important points of interest.I absolutely loved it! A must do in Budapest :))

Yellow Zebra gang did not disappoint. I was on a visit to Budapest with Intrepid Tour group and they recommended the Yellow Zebra for my bicycle tour of a Budapest. Our guide was Peter and in addition to being quite funny and witty he was knowledgeable and a great tour guide. He had a very genuine way to pass on the passion he feels for this beautiful city during the afternoon bike trip.I really really enjoyed the tour and would recommend it for anyone interested in visiting Budapest combine with a little bit of healthy exercise, bravo!

Perfect Intro to Budapest!. We just returned from our great trip! The tour was on our first morning in Budapest. This was the perfect intro to this great city! We viewed most of the main sights, and then was able to plan the rest of our visit! Our guide, Fanni, was extremely knowledgeable and helpful! Budapest has bicycle lanes in many areas. The ride is well-paced. There is a small challenging section to climb the castle hill, all in our group had no problem with this. Tips-The office is near both the opera house and the House of Terror Museum, we visited both after our tour. Check times of opera house tour to coordinate if you are interested.

budapest-vienna bicycle trip from Yellow Zebra. We biked from Budapest to Vienna at the beginning of May, using Yellow Zebra. They did a great job of providing good bicycles. The mechanics in Budapest checked everything over, and the equipment was great. There was one major flaw. Yellow Zebra had absolutely NO maps for the entire route from Budapest to Vienna. This turned out to be a huge deal as we got lost a few times, which slowed us down. More importantly, we ended up having to travel on high-speed roads with big trucks and lots of traffic. Fortunately, those stretches were brief, but they were very dangerous, and did not add any enjoyment to our trip. About halfway through we found 2 very good bicycling maps of the entire route. We discovered the first in the Sturovo Slovakia tourinform. It is a very detailed map of the route from Sturovo to Bratislava and was exactly what we needed. The second map, picked up at the Gyor Tourinform, was a complete map of the Danube bike trail from Vienna to Budapest and provided alternate routes through Hungary and Slovakia. Both of these maps should have been available for purchase when we picked up the bikes. Alternatively Yellow Zebra could have notified us where we could get them before we left the US. It would have saved a lot of headaches. If this happens to you, check out this website for the Vienna-Danube map: www.esterbauer.com There is no website provided for the Slovakia map, but try www.vku.sk, website or email vku@vku.sk. It was a great trip and I highly recommend it

Everything was wonderful Thankyou Fanni. We booked our yellow Zebra bike tour through our hotel and arrived to a wonderful place just behind the opera house. Fanni was our tour guide and she was perfect, friendly, informative, entertaining and spoke perfect English. We were lucky with the weather but she really did show us things it would of taken us a while to find. The bikes are really good and appropriate and the snacks we were given were very nice. Fanni also helped us with recommending places we should go and giving us directions. She dedicated a lot of time to this and we were really grateful.I would most certainly recommend Yellow Zebra Tours if I go back I would like to try out the Segways.

Segway and Communism Tour - Absolutely perfect. We booked two different events at Yellow Zebra Tours, one was the "2 hours segway" and the other was the "3 hours communism to democracy" tour. Both events were absolutely perfect, the guides Anita and Brigitte had a lot of information and were both absolutely friendly.5 stars!

Segway City Tour. Great experience! I actually already did a tour with this office a year ago and was impatient to renew the experience and bring my bf along! Our guide Mat gave us a warm welcome and was very friendly and knowledgable regarding the many sights we got introduced to. It was great to hear the history behind each monument but it's even better to hear the point of views of local hungarians and how they interpret things such as places and monuments. It was a perfect visit and Mat's humor was a perfect contributor. Definitively recommend!!

Great tour in an amazing city!. We actually booked this tour and arrived to find the tour was not running, they gladly provided us with a private tour at no additional cost. Our tour was incredible, and tour guide (Balazs Berenyi) extremely knowledgeable and friendly. A mid tour break for coffee and strudels in an old wine cellar really makes the tour that little extra special. At the end of the tour you receive 20% discount to any other tours with Yellow Zebra and any information of the city you would like. A must do in Budapest!

Went back to see Budapest by Bike. I booked this online and I could not say enough about it. My guide, Laszlo was awesome. It wasn't about the sights and location but his locations was funny and interesting about the people of Budapest and the historical places we visited. All the sights and locations was amazing and he kept it very funny and attractive during the tour. My personal favorite occasion was he pulled out a flute and played for us a Hungarian song that was his favorite that correctly describes the Hungarian people. The various biking locations was safe and with bike lanes all over the city, it really made the tour alot easier.Coming back we had a small snack and drink compliments of the company and that was SPECTACULAR!!! I tried the poppy seed type strudel and also an apple strudel and they were both excellent. I was a bit scared about the poppy seeds might pop up on a drug test but the guide assured me that I would have to eat at least one weeks worth of poppy seeds before it shows up in the system. After his reassuring words, I decided to have one more for the road being we have alot to see still.

3.5hour bike tour. We booked this tour on the second day of our 5 day stay in Budapest. We had a great time with our guide Peter who was both informative and fun. The tour took in all of the main sights and allowed us a good overview of the geography of the place. There were five of us, including our 3 children (aged from 10 to 15) and we all enjoyed this trip even including the challenging climb into Buda which gives great vistas of Pest. I strongly recommend this tour. Everyone at Zebra were very helpful - a great day out.
Great and fun way to see the City. We did the superior tour, and it was great fun. The guide was very knowledgeable, and gave us some local know-how on the city and daily life in Budapest.

Great way to see the city. We loved taking the bicycle guided tour, it was a great way to meet people and see the city. Much better than the hop on hop off buses. One bit of the trip is quite challenging (uphill) so you definitely should be fit to enjoy every part of the trip. I strongly recommend doing this

Great bike rental place. We rented bikes for 24h which was a great choice. Biking around Budapest is a great way to see the city, and it's nice to get off the beaten path a little. It's the kind of city that deserves to be explored what with the eclectic mix of architectures and buildings. The staff at Yellow Zebra were incredibly helpful. The day after we rented the bikes they let us leave our bags there so that we could go on a walking tour before heading to the train station!

Brilliant - something new to try. Arrived in Budapest having just got engaged the day before. Stayed for only two nights but the yellow zebra Segway tour was a really good way of seeing some sights with little time we had. Very good tour guide called Peter who had some very interesting stories and facts to tell about the city. We had our own personal tour as no one else booked, it was only 3 degrees c though.Very easy to pick up, after 5 minutes I wanted to go as fast as possible.

Fantastic day with yellow zebra. My husband and I were part of a group of six that did the 3 1/2 hour Budapest city tour. The meeting point behind the Opera was most convenient. There was a mixed age range from 20 to 70! The bikes were brand new with 21 gears very comfortable and easy to ride. Our guide Funli was very friendly and extremely knowledgable about her city. We stopped every 15 mins at different attractions where we would be given information. The second half of the tour involved cycling over the bridge to the Buda side and up to the castle at the top. Everyone managed the climb, coming down was alot easier! Funli was the most fantastic guide who recommended different bars and restaurants to us. This excursion was the highlight of our trip and it was a delight to meet Paula and Joe from Vermont.

Yellow Zebra Bike Tours; Budapest. We did the 3.5 hr. bike tour of Budapest with Yellow Zebra guide, Andrea Varga. The bikes were comfortable and easy to handle. Andi is well versed in the Hungarian history and has a pleasant, friendly and articulate manner. We visited most of the important sites to get an overview of Budapest including Matthias Church, Szechenyi Baths, Parliament, Great Synagogue, Opera House, Heroe's Square, City Park, St. Ivan's Basilica,the Danube and more. Riding a bicycle through the streets gives a true feeling of being in Budapest. This is a very worthwhile first day adventure. Ask for Andi. She is excellent.

just rented a bike: easy and okay!. We rented some bikes for 24h and rode along a tributary of the Danube to Szentendre, a little pittoresque village with galeries, shops and good restaurants. The road is somewhat marked with green signs (yellow letters). It's a nice trip (about 25km) that takes you away from the busy city centre. We came back earlier than expected and 'Yellow Zebra' only charged us for half a day.oh make sure you have enough money with you or credit card, because the guarantee of the bikes is pretty high (15.000 forints).

amazing!. We didn't end up renting bikes but the buys were sooooo accommmodating!They allowed us to leave our luggage there..we bought some cool books ...had great coffee...organised our walk thanks to their suggestions....and their location is simply the best!

Fun and interesting tour of the city. The Yellow Zebra bike tour of Budapest (booked online through Absolute Budapest Tours) was probably the best way to fill 3 and a half hours and get a feel for all that Budapest has to offer. I would recommend it as a way to begin your Budapest visit - you can then go back and visit the various attractions in your own time.One important thing - if you book online or have a voucher, you should print it out before arriving. They do have a computer and internet, so I was able to log on and print my email, but if you forget your email password or something else, it could be awkward.Our group was small (three people - me and a married couple who were in Budapest for a wedding), which was great as when we stopped it was easy to hear what Fanni (the tour guide) was saying - no craning over someone else's shoulder to see and hear. We made regular stops and in some places, Fanni looked after the bikes and gave us 10-15 minutes to wander. Fanni was very knowledgeable and had a good sense of humour so the experience was overall very enjoyable. I would advise that you should be comfortable on a bike in an urban setting and have at least a reasonable level of fitness, as the climb to the Buda castle would be quite difficult for anyone who is very unfit. You don't have to be superfit, but especially on a hot day like today, if you were very unfit I think you would struggle to get up the hill. Also, although Budapest is very bike-friendly, you have to keep your wits about you to adapt to the switches from main road to side road, to bike lane, to cycling on the pavement. It was easy enough for a small group of us to follow Fanni, but I can imagine in a big group, the person at the back might get left behind or be unsure of whether they have right of way.At the end of the tour, Fanni gave us some good recommendations for places to eat and drink and took into account what we said we were interested in (like pancakes!).The same company does bike tours of Prague and I wouldn't hesiitate to use them again (a good excuse to visit to Prague). Overall, I'd strongly recommend this as a fun way to get outdoors and see a lot of the city!
