Good tour. We were in a small group of 5 people with our tour guide which made it quite intimate. Our guide good information about each stop and kept us entertained for four hours. It gave us a good grounding on what was where in Budapest, and where we should visit on the other days of our trip. The day we did the tour was the hottest day by far, which the guide took into account with frequent stops in the shade, and to refill bottles at free water fountains.

In 2 minds about it. There was no getting away from the fact that it was a bargain price, the tour lasted for ages and we really did cover everything there was to see in the city center. Plus the group was small, just 4 of us. However our guide wasn't the most engaging, she knew a lot of things to say to us, but when the other couple asked questions, more often than not, she didn't know the answer, and sometimes struggled to understand what they were asking (translation problems perhaps). We were asked if we wanted to go up the hill and figured why not, but the temperature was pushing 40 degrees, and the day before we had been in London with a temperature of 17 degrees. That combined with the huge tour coaches puffing out fumes from their engines as they lowered their gears to get up the super steep hill was enough for me to have to pull over and take a breather, and some water. I think when going up the hill, the guide should be more aware of who their customers are, age, physical fitness and where they're from (i.e are they used to this heat/humidity) and plan a stop up the hill accordingly.However, all in all, it was a great way for us to orient our selves to Budapest and spot the places we wanted to go back and visit with more time to give to each attraction. I probably would recommend it, but if you think you might struggle getting up the hill - for whatever reason, don't assume the guide will be looking out for you... you must speak up before you begin to tackle it!

Cycling tour of Budapest. My daughter and I recently visited Budapest for a short break and, having never been there before decided to join Fanni on bike tour of the city with Yellow Zebra . What a great way to see the sights and sounds of a lovely city. we joined a small group of three hung overed Aussie lads and three Americans two of which were mother and daughter.The bikes were new and excellent quality, and very comfortable. Fanni was an excellent tour guide and very informative. Pest is excellent for cycling with Buda a challenging but achievable climb, and the views are well worth the challenge.The Budapest traffic is very cycle friendly which made the experience that much more enjoyable. This was a great way to get your bearings and discover the city in your own time in the future.The cost was 4500 HUF, excellent value. Thanks !!

Great and awesome way to see the city instead of the bus. The tour guide took us to various popular spots all around Budapest from the park to the various historical sites that is crested all over this city. The guide was nice and knowledgeable. I had more fun interacting with my fellow partners in the bike ride. There was some close moments here and there with traffic but otherwise it was fine. Took at break near the river and also near the park and it was all very perfect. Truth be told, my brother and I had more fun just interacting with our fellow travelers and talking about the sites. We were with a family from Texas and also another one from Florida so it was a nice American reunion.

Great way to see the city. My husband and I were in Budapest for our honeymoon, we did not have much time there. So the bike tour was a fantastic way to see the city. Our guide was wonderful and checked in to make sure we still wanted to bike since it was very hot that day.We got a great feel for the city and covered a lot of ground. We would recommend this as a fun way to see Budapest if you like biking.

Best way to see Budapest. We highly recommend this tour. Our guide was very nice and knowledgeable. She even spoke Spanish. In 3.5 hrs we were able to visit most of the main sites. We took the private tour which was only €120 for a group of 6. The tour is easy enough for a 70 year old lady.

Bike Budapest!. Heat aside, this bike tour of Budapest was a great way to see the city without riding on public transportation, driving or walking. Since it was 36 C that day, our tour guide asked if we were still up for the tour and we said yes, of course, she did not back down and the three of us toured the city. Definitely worth 3 hours, especially if you do it the first day to get an overview of the city and places you would like to re-visit.

Excellent intro to the city. I did the cycle tour today and loved it. It was 36 degrees and I was sweating buckets but it was definitely worth it. The tour covers a lot of ground and many places that I was considering looking at anyway - now I know which bits I definitely want to revisit, and our guide gave us handy info about tours at those places and other parts of the city that we might want to visit. The ride up the hill to the castle was a bit steep, but if you're in reasonable health I don't see why you'd have any problems.Our guide was funny, knowledgeable, and was able to answer all our questions - and her English was excellent. Definitely recommended.

Put this on your must do list. Such a fun way to see this stunning city. Although I'm a keen cyclist, you don't need to be very fit to do this tour. There are plenty of stops when the informative guide tells you all about the beautiful buildings and history. Our guide Fanny, was delightful and took everything at our pace. Be prepared for the heat however, pack plenty of sunscreen and water. There is one large hill on the second part of the tour up to the castle but the views are worth it as is the exhilarating ride down afterwards. Do this at the beginning of your visit as on the three hour tour you get to see all the places you will want to return to and our guide told us of all the passes and travel tickets we would need. If you aren't used to any exercise then take a bus tour or rent a Segway. It's very disappointing to read negative reviews on here which have more to do with the climate and fitness of the reviewer, than of this company.

Great way to see the city. What a great way to orient yourself with such a large city with so many sights that are rather spread out. It was hot and sweaty but "Funny" our guide carried on without complaint. There is a hill to get to the castle but the best bit is coasting down the road after all that hard work. Not reccomended for kids or people not comfortable on a bike. Check out their website but go straight to the office, no need to meet in the square and saves 10 minutes of walking to go straight to the office.

Great tour to see all main highlights!. Budapest is a fascinating city and if like me you want to do more than just scrape the surface then you should definitely consider doing this tour. Matt, our guide, was very knowledgeable and made sure the tour wasn't only informative but also fun! He also speaks several languages so whenever someone in our group needed some translation he didn't have a problem switching to Spanish. I definitely recommend Conquer Budapest if you are looking for a fun and interactive way to learn more about Budapest's main attractions.

Excellent free walking tour. We were introduced to this walking tour through the hip on hop off tourist bus. The tour was agreable and very informative, Matt is funny, energetic and it turned out to be much more fun than expected. Highly recommended.
Great tour. Matt is very friendly, we had a great time and learned a lot of things about budapest's history and culture. I recommend the tour.

Dedicated and knowledgeable guide. I am a kind of traveler who usually explore new places while talking to local people and try local food on my own. This time, I decided to count on professional input buy paying (actually tipping) a guide, and it was the best decision I made. Mat was a very professional, knowledgeable, and dedicated guide. He also had a cute sense of humour :) I thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour guided by Mat. Thank you!

Excellent (and free) walking tour - Highly recommended. This walking tour given by Matt is an excellent introduction to Budapest and its history. Matt's inclusive and friendly style makes learning about the city's history and its beautiful buildings great experience. The tour takes you to the key highlights of the city that help you understand and appreciate for further explanation. Matt does these tours for free (tips only based on your view of the tours value). The best tour we did in Budapest I would highly recommend anybody travelling to Budapest to make this a must do event.

Excellent free walking tour. Matt is knowledgeable and have the right sense of humor. We thoroughly enjoy the walking tour which lasted about 2.5 hours. The walking can be tiring and he ensures we have the right stop at the right time
Not only conquer but also know Budapest. Mat does a great job. He shows commitment, fitness and entertaining in the way he manage his tour. I strongly recommend it.

Excellent Walking Tour, Great Guide!. I'm not big on walking tours since I enjoy exploring cities on my own but saw this one and it peaked my interest, and I'm so glad that it did because it was fantastic. Mat is an amazing tour guide - he was full of interesting facts, and has such a bubbly and fun attitude, it made for really enjoyable day. I would highly recommend and add this as a must-do for Budapest.

Fun tour around Jewish quarter, street art and BP highlights. We hired him for a short tour of our office team building. Apart from being a very knowledgable guy he is also fun and he managed to tailor a tour that could cater to our needs in the limited time we had!Highly recommend :)

Excellent tour of Budapest. As part of our team building event we took a tour of Budapest. Matt is very knowledgeable of history and all things local and had presented it in the fun and engaging way. Highly recommended! Many thanks Matt!

a wonderful tour of budapest. matt was engaging and full of knowledge. he made our journey thru Budapest quite enjoyable and most informative.bravo for a great walking tour.save the restaurant references. bob's was such a disappointment. find something betterto send us off to if you are going to suggest some authentic restaurants.i would suggest matt for a great walking tour .cheers

Excellent Tour and Superb Service. Visited the Jewish District and the surrounding ares in September with Matt. Cannot recommend him enough. Matt was fun and so knowledgeable on everything related to Budapest and Hungary.

Walking tour in jewish quarter. The walking tour with Matt was fun. We were quite a large group yet he managed to cater the tour to engage and interest everyone. I loved the jokes he put in here and there whilst explaining the history and origins of budapest. Would really recommend this tour to anyone looking for an enjoyable yet informative way to get to know Budapest quickly ;)

Budapest walking tour. The best way to have an informative glimpse at the city was taking the walking tour with Mat. he was very knowledgeable and eager to show you the city in every step of the tour. Thank you for making the tour so interesting and fun for us.

Good introduction to Budapest. This was a great way to get to know some of the most important sights and facts about the city. Just the right amount of history told in an interesting way. Recommended for everyone visiting Budapest.

Excellent walking tour. We enjoyed this walking tour very much. Matt was very knowledgeable about the area. He was not to fast or to slow. He knows the best way to get to the top of the hill without too much effort. Thanks Matt.

Lovely tour guide who knows his history!. This was a lovely walking tour - just the right pace and detail and no impersonal microphones or umbrellas to follow. The group was small, so we were able to ask as many questions as we wanted to and Mat knew all the answers - would definitely recommend.

Greate experience . I am coincided my self as experience traveler and our walking tour with Mat was the best in my experience.The tour is very dynamic, interesting and at the same time relaxed. Highly recommended.Mat, he is professional of what he is doing, nice person and open for conversation!!!Good luck Mat, it was a pleasure to meet you.TEYMUR.

Awesome Tour.. I went sightseeing in Budapest with foot and food tour program in conquer Budapest.This program makes me to take a awesome and enjoyable. Because, He is extremely knowledgeable, has a great humour and is energetic. So, If u go sightseeing with conquer Budapest, You never be disappointed.

A gem of a tour. Mat was informative, friendly, and he kept us interested throughout our 3 hour walking tour. Three hours sounds a lot but the time flew in. Mat works on tip basis which is an excellent way to ensure that he provides a high quality tour. We were so glad that we noticed Mat's advert and went with him rather than booking with a tour company.

Awesome walking tour!. Matt provides an engaging and informative tour! He keeps you interested as you learn the history of Budapest. He's a local, and knows his info! We had a blast and covered alot of territory from the Opera Hose in Pest to the Fisherman's Bastion of Buda and everything in between! Give him a good tip, he will deserve it!

The best tour guide in hungary. Mat was informative, witty and very knowledgeable, he has an excellent ability to keep his participants engaged. The tour was fantastic and lots of fun at the same time giving us a great historical lesson with plenty of points of interest along the way.We would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Budapest.Mt even shared his favorite restaurant with us 'Bob's' where we had one of the best meals whilst in Budapest.

awesome. You will get every important information about budapest. He is a nice man funny person and very educated person. He speaks a lot of languages he gives you a lot of ingormation about the city.

Excellent. Well, I'm not a big fan of tours, mainly because someone tells you where to go, eat and rest in your vacation, but this one was a big exception. I will definitely recommend it to my friends.
Great walking tour through Budapest. Mat was very knowledgable of the area being a local to Budapest. It was the perfect introduction to the city.
Perfect!. We just came back from our night tour with Mat and had a very nice evening. Thank you very much again for the lovely tour. We can highly recommend it to everyone!

Great private tour through Budapest. Perfect way to discover Budapest, especially if you are staying longer in the city.Mat is a very good and professional guide who tells you many interesting facts and figures in a very clear and pleasant way.We would highly recommend it!

Walking tour. FANTASTIC tour, very informative and we came way with a lot of linked knowledge, which was great and easy to remember. Mat took the time to talk to all the members of the group, was humerous and gave us all pieces of information to remember for later on in the tour. It was a great way for us to talk to each other. The tour lasted a bit longer than the time specified, but the walking pace was just right for a hot day! I liked the fact that payment for this tour was based purely on how you enjoyed it and there was no pressure to pay a certain amount.

Walking tour of Budapest. Our walking tour of Budapest was very enjoyable and informative. Our guide Matt was very knowledgeable, had a good sense of humour, and explained many aspects of the history of Budapest. Recommended

Must Do Walking Tour. Matt was an amazing guide! He is extremely knowledgeable, has a great sense of humour, and is very personable. I appreciated that he took the time to get to know each of the people in our tour group. Definitely go on his tour - I learned so much from it. Very much appreciated his mini quizzes!

Had a good time!. Matt is a enthousiastic guide! Knows a lot to tell and makes the tour interactive. We heard some secrets about prinses sisi and what it had to do with Andrassy street, went to Saint Stephen s church, saw the chopped hand, academic of science, learned about important people, walked through the city and ended on buda hill. Meanwhile Matt told us about the buildings bridges etc. And how come the street is so clean.. ;-) Dont strawl the city own your own, do a tour with Matt! Makes sense of what you see.

Mat took us on a wonderful walking tour. We started at the Opera House in Pest and ended near Buda Castle. We learned so much and enjoyed every part of the tour. There was another well known bakery on the Buda side that I wish we had visited instead of the one Mat took us to but everything else was perfect.

Great Tour!. My Boyfriend and I visited Hungary for a wedding and had only limited time in Budapest. The Walking Tour was a great experience to learn about the city in a short period of time. Our Guide, Mat, made it fun to learn the facts and I will probably never forget them. Mat picked us up at the Hotel and walked us through the highlights of the city in about 4 hours. It was a fun and educational experience. I would definately recommend this tour!

Walking tour. Matt was a great guide, v informative and fun! Was a great way to see the sites of the city. Pity the 'hospital in the rock' wasn't mentioned so didn't get to visit it.. Learned of it afterwards from someone who has visited before

Awesome walking tour in Budapest, awesome guide. I decided to take a free walking tour in Budapest, and was a bit overwhelmed by the options so I checked on here and found Conquer Budapest. I'm so happy I did. Mat is the ultimate tour guide in Budapest (the world for that matter). Funny, positive and full of knowledge. Highly recommended!!!!

Fantastic, funny and informative!. Mat gets a lot of stuff into just a few hours! He effortlessly socializes with the group as he walks you through the city and explains its history in a simple, fun and informative manner. The tour also includes a coffee break where Mat will introduce you to the finest Hungarian cakes! (You pay for the cake!) The tour finishes at the top of the hill near the castle, so if your planning on visiting the castle during your trip to Budapest, then this probably best done straight after the tour. One of the best walking tours I've been on, highly recommended!

Walking Tour of Budapest. We had a small group with Mat as our guide. He gave us a great introduction to the city and was knowledgeable on the history. He speaks excellent English. We had an enjoyable 3 hour walk with a stop for coffee and cake. Nice morning in Budapest. The Hop on Hop Off Tour mentioned it and as it turned out Mat works for tips. It was a little difficult for us to determine what to give him. It would be nice if Ho Ho sponsored him and he wasn't dependent upon us. I hope he does well as he is very upbeat and fun to be with.

Highly recommended!. We booked the General Tour with Matt over the internet. From the first email, very professional. He picked us up from the hotel and off we went for a great discovery tour in Budapest! We all loved it. We were a group of five friends on our first visit to Budapest and therefore hungry to learn and explore the city. He explained us about the history, the people the culture. Matt is very friendly, helpful and easy going. And we got lots of additional insights and answers to different questions we had. If you go to Budapest and want to make the most of it, do not hesitate to book the tour with him. Thank you Matt, you rock!

Fantastic Guide. On a recent city break to Budapest, we went on the walking tour and were treated to a hilarious, informative trip round all the best sights. Mat was friendly, funny and kept the information light but with loads of facts about this beautiful city. Definitely the highlight of our trip. Our group was made up of one American, a Russian couple, an Australian couple and we two Scots so there was plenty of time for all of us to ask questions and Mat was never stuck for an answer. I would highly recommend his walking tour.

A must do in Budapest. One of my favorite things to do when I travel to a new city is to take a guided walking tour. Mat was hands down the best guide I have ever had. He was super knowledgeable about the city of Budapest and with a great sense of humor to keep it fun and interesting. My group had people from Spain, Italy, and the US (me) and I was surprised that he spoke fluently to all of us. We saw some great architecture, learned about the history of the city, and ate some delicious cakes with our coffee. I definitely recommend this tour to first time visitors of BP.

Mat is awesome!!!. We Read the amazing reviews on Tripadvisor and We decided to go ahead and explore Budapest with Mat. He arrived at our hotel with everything already prepared. He was extremely informative and quick to answer our questions. Not only did he show us the main attractions of Budapest, but he also gave us information on places to eat and how to use the public transportation in Budapest. We couldn't have asked for a better guide. Thank you Mat!!?

Budapest with Matias. Matias was a fun and informative guide. I had been to this beautiful city before, and I still learned a lot. He offered funny anecdotes and scandalous stories to go with the places we were taken. He was also very patient about time for pictures.

Good for learning. Good informative walk. Worth the nearly 3hrs of walking. Would like to have done more of these walks. If beautiful architecture and history is of interest, this tour is good. Matts also helps the group/party remember what they have seen by giving the group opportunities to voice their opinions. Make sure to take a good camera

Looking & Learning with Matias. Mat was an excellent guide. He showed us the beauty of Budapest, and helped us all learn a little history by getting us involved with the answers & giving us all a task. I highly recommend this tour. Mat is The Best !!!! Thank you Mat.

Budapest - the important things to see and know about !. Mat was great, very friendly and easy to talk to. He gave us lots of information without overloading us and we saw the key sights in the space of 3 hours, including time for coffee and cake! I always try to do a walking tour of a new city and this is one of the best I have done.

Walking tour. Fabulous tour... would thoroughly recommend! Best thing we did in Budapest... great guide, great route, just the right amount of information delivered in a fun and engaging way. Thanks Mat!
Budapest Free Tour. Excellent Walk Trip with a lot of interesting things, and very nice and proffesional Guide. 100% Recomended. My favourite visit in Budapest.

Entertaining glimpse into the history of beautiful Budapest. We joined Mat's morning tour of the city (which sets off from the Opera House at 10am) after seeing the tour advertised as part of the Hop-On-Hop-Off bus tour (giraffe).Mat gave his multi-national group of visitors an entertaining and informative tour of some of the city's highlights. Mat's knowledge of the city is excellent and his command of English is second to none.The tour lasts around 3 hours at a relaxed pace and includes time to go inside St Stephen's Basilica and for a coffee stop near the castle.Mat runs this tour on a tips-only basis ( i.e. he doesn't get paid by the bus company) and he were happy to tip him accordingly.Would recommend this tour is you're in Budapest for a few days.

Relaxed and interesting morning walk around Budapest. Matt was a great guide. Full of information . He made the tour very interesting and presented it in a way that involved everyone . The whole group were very relaxed and soon everyone was chatting . We managed to cover most of the most interesting sights in just under 3 hours at an easy pace .

A great walking tour. Matt did a terrific job of highlighting some of the sites of Budapest. He is very knowledgeable and has an engaging personality. At the end of the tour, he recommended some Hungarian foods we should try. He also recommended a restaurant we really enjoyed. (Bob restaurant). We certainly recommend this tour. It was the best part of our Hop On Hop Off experience.

Best city tour ever been on!. We absolutely hated Matt the guide (that's what you wanted to see wasn't it Matt?!)...not really we loved him he was the best!! So fun and made all the information really interesting. It was the perfect mix of walking and information there even though it was long we really appreciated the breaks in the tour I haven't had this before. Overall definitely this is the best Budapest tour for sure! The smaller group size was really perfect as well we really felt like we got to know Matt. Thank you so much!

An inspired tour from an inspiring guide. We has a walking tour around Budapest with Mat as the lead. He was quite the character, in a very positive way, with very engaging talks about Budapest, its history and very rich culture. It shows how much he loves Budapest, and we feel it in the way he lovingly describes the city and the country.For first-time visitors to Budapest, Mat's tour was very educational, and very interesting. Although it was quite a walk from the Opera House to the Buda Castle, the mix of historical information, trivia and insider anecdotes and well-timed stops combined to give visitors a great appreciation of Budapest, while getting some exercise And to Mat, yes, we tried the Langos for lunch, and we tried the Turò Rudi. Like the tour, we loved the food!Highly recommended! Go look for Mat, everyone!-Jas, from Manila, Philippines

A very effective way to learn about the attractions of Budapest. Our group of 4 took this tour since it was included in our hop-on, hop-off sightseeing tour of Budapest. For a free tour, we didn't expect anything great but when we met our tour guide Mat, we knew he was different. He didn't just introduce himself but he tried to get to know us too. He explains each sight well in an interesting way (not boring), thus, making him a very effective teacher. The tour was a bit of a walk but I guess it's the best way to see everything in the area. Mat made us rest though by taking us to a cafe at the Fisherman's Bastion which was a good idea after a long walk. He even lent me his umbrella when he noticed me trying to shield myself from the sun with my phone. That was so thoughtful of him. Our group agreed that he's a very good tour guide and he would be a good example for other tour guides to follow. We are so lucky to have met a great guide like Mat.

Excellent summary of a beautiful city. I had a chance to join a trip in the middle of May, 2016. As I live in the city from the time when I was born, I did not expect any newness during this 2 hours. Fortunately I was wrong. We enjoined the way up to the beloved castle, where the stories and informations Matyi provided helped the 'real tourists' to get a broad experience on the memorable places of the city and with his patience and kindness He made sure that they brought some knowledge with them (and at this point I have to highlight, that some stories also helped me to understand some parts of our history).Also the tour guide had no difficulties in switching between English and Spanish, so I would recommend for the speakers of both languages.P.S.: Make sure, that you arrive in time, the guide will be punctual, but also accurate and reliable during the time you spend together.

Budapest Walking Tour. It was superb and an excellent way to experience the city. Matt our Tour guide was sensational. A wealth of knowledge, no question was too much and he made everything entertaining and memorable. A must do in Budapest
Learning about Budapest. The tour was very informative and provided a good initial orientation to Budapest. From there, we felt more confident to explore more.

MAT WAS FANTASTIC BUDA GUIDE . Got to say from start to finish the guide mat was great knew his stuff very funny entertaining informative, nice and easy walking pace would say most people could do it the city must be seen this way you miss so much on the bus I'd thank to thank mat on behalf of my wife Fiona and me for a great experience
Great Tour. This is a must whilst you are in Budapest, very well presented with lots of history and information. Great Guide with a great attitude.

Personal walking tour of Budapest!. We ended up being only two that morning but Mathias took us anyway. He even personalised the tour according to our liking! He was just a talking book full of interesting information. He made sure we learned the importance of 1896 to Hungary. After the tour, he even recommended us some authentic Hungarian restaurants & dishes. You can ask him anything! We cannot be more satisfied with our walking tour. Go Mathias!!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR FIRST TIMERS TO BUDAPEST. Walking tour of Budapest.. We had the pleasure of experiencing the walking tour of Budapest with Matt on April 13, 2016. There were only 4 of us in the tour (plus Matt), so it felt very personalized. 2 of us from Las Vegas, 2 from Spain. Spoke fluent English, very easy to understand. Though the 2 people from Spain spoke English, Matt speaks Spanish very fluently as well, so he made sure to explain things in Spanish if he felt what he was saying needed clarification. Very considerate. We found out about the walking tour as part of the hop on/hop off bus tour, and it was free, just tip him afterwards for his work. We met at the Opera House at around 10AM. We did the hop on/hop off bus the day before to get a basic idea of the city (rode both the red line and the yellow line of the "big giraffe" bus- both informative and gave us basic layout and what we thought we wanted to see on our own. BTW, the hop on/hop off bus was great as well and we had the use of it for 48 hours so we used it as our public transport as well during the 48 hours). Having Matt give us the walking tour was a GREAT addition. From the Opera House, we walked all the way to the Buda side. Stopped at St. Stephen's Cathedral and looked inside. Stopped at various statues and plaques along the way and he explained the importance of the people who were memorialized (Liszt, Ibl, Andrassy, etc). Matt even told us where to find the relic of St. Stephen inside the cathedral. Walked across the Chain Bridge. Walked to Fisherman's Bastion for view of the Parliament, then passing by Matthias Church. Had a coffee break at a nice pastry shop where we tried some Hungarian pastries that Matt recommended. He also talked about Hungarian food and recommended restaurants and what to eat. We walked through Old Town Buda until the tour ended just by the Buda Castle. Along the way, he talked about Hungarian history, food, culture, and answered questions that we had. He was very informative (especially for such a young guy). He was funny as well, very personable and definitely provided great info on the city. After the tour, we felt we saw everything we wanted to see at Buda side including the ones that we thought about going to from the day before, thus saving us time and effort. Would definitely recommend. I think even if you do not have a hop on/hop off ticket, since Matt does this privately (he owns his walking company), you can just show up in front of the Opera House at 10 AM and do this with him. He'll be holding a sign so easy to recognize. Again, IT'S FREE, so just tip him generously! If this is your first time in Budapest, it's a great way to familiarize yourself with the city and learn about Hungary. Be forewarned though that it is a walking tour and so be prepared to walk for about 3 hours. Probably about 2-3 miles at the minimum. Flat surface in Pest side, hills and stairs on Buda side. THIS TOUR IS VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR FIRST TIMERS TO BUDAPEST.

Excellent in every way. This is a superb walking tour of Budapest. Of course, Budapest is a very interesting city, full of great buildings - but Mat made the experience so memorable with his stories, observations and tremendous humour. He really tries to involve the group during the walk, in such a friendly and informal way. And we definitely went away knowing a lot more about Budapest - dates, important people in its history and local delicacies. We would recommend this walking tour very highly; sometimes you just need someone, a local, to point things out.

Matt is the best!. Very interesting walking tour! Matt is very funny but in a professional way. We learned a lot about Budapest's history, but the guide gave us also good advice concerning thermal baths and restaurants. We can recommend it to everybody!

Must Do. We decided spontaneously to make this tour and did not regret it. In a very small group we went from the opera to the basilica and to the chain bridge. The tour ended at the castle. It was nice to talk with a local about life in Budapest and to have such a personal tour. The guide is open for ideas and wishes concerning the sites and a very sympathetic guy.

Really fun and informative tour!. This tour was really personal and fun as well as very informative! Matt went above and beyond to recommend lots to do in Budapest as well as local cuisine to try. Had a really good time on this tour and would definitely recommend it for anyone visiting Budapest :-)

Very informative and fun!. Matthias was an excellent guide - made everyone feel welcomed right away. He was funny and very knowledgable. We had a great time and were able to better enjoy our time in Budapest thanks to this walking tour. Definitely check it out :)

Great tour!. Really interesting informative tour. Matt was great, knowledgeable and very funny, gave great tips for the rest of our trip. And answered all our questions. Good to here a locals perspective. Definitely worth going on, would advise everyone who visits Budapest to go.

Must-Do tour in Budapest. It was my first time in Budapest and I can honestly say that I fell in love with the city thanks to Matt's super-friendly tour. I've attended to another walking tours in another cities and so far I can clearly see that Matt is very knowledgable, friendly tour guide with a good sense of humor. I even don't remember any boring second instead I had a really good time with the stories he told from a different perspective rather than like typical information-packed things. Whenever I go to Budapest again, I can attend to Matt's tours again! Thanks for the great tour !
Brilliant tour. We've been on a number of walking tours in a few cities before. Matt was one of the best we've had. Knowledgable, friendly and approachable throughout.
One of the best city guides. Matthias is one of the best city guides I have ever met :) He told the storys in a funny and interesting way which made me remember the most important things of Budapest.

Best selfie tour guide in Budapest. Best walking tour I've done thus far. Small interactive group with a guide (Matt) who knows a lot and who is eager to share his knowledge. He knows the best photo angles and is very willing to take a 100 or so photos to make sure you get the perfect 1! highly recommended!!

Excellent walking tour. Very informative walking tour of Budapest. I will highly recommend. The guide (Matt) was very friendly and knowledgable. Gave a number of very good suggestions as well like best places to eat, shop etc. and this is free but for the tips.

Best walking tour !!. I recommend, like all the others do too, the walking tours by "Conquer Budapest". It was a great day full of new information, thanks to Mátyás. He did the walking tour with good humour and made us memorize the most important facts about the city, like 1896, 96m or Ibl Miklós.
Best Walking Tour I've ever made. I absolutely recommend the walking tour "Conquer Budapest". It's funny, interesting and you get a wonderful tour to the best places in Budapest.

Walking Tour Review - University Trip 2016. Matt was very charismatic and informative and took the group of 40 of us around Budapest's attractions answering numerous questions and providing very good advice for the rest of our stay. Everyone really enjoyed the walking tour and would definitely recommend to future school/university groups!

Best walking tour!. We were 14 people from Vienna and had only one day at disposal to see the bloom side of Budapest. Mátyás met everyone's wishes - literally! Combined with an excellent humour and a very nice British accent, he made us remember the most important points of interest together with the related facts. If you plan on attending the tour, which I'd really recommend(!), try to keep 1896 and 96m in mind. But: Don't worry if you forget these numbers until you visit Budapest, Mátyás will make you memorise them like forever!
Budapest walking tour. One of the best walking tours we have been on. The guide Matt was very informative and charismatic. Definitely would recommend!

Super nightly tour!!. My boyfriend and I were in Budapest for only 3 days, so this nightly excursion fitted right in. Really friendly and funny tourguide (Mat)! It was a very laidback tour because we were the only 2 people who made a reservation. But Mat answered every question and was really cool!

Very funny and interesting excursion. On the last day of our trip we decided to take this free excursion across Budapest and we didn't regret. It was very interesting and exciting. Our guide Matt, a native Hungarian, told us many interesting facts about the city in a friendly and funny manner and we felt free to ask questions and got all the answers. So I recommend this excursion to any one who wants to learn more about Budapest and get tons of positive emotions! Thank you very much!!!!

Favourite spare time activity in Budapest. Number 1: Everybody should go to Budapest, it's an amazing city that will blow your mind. It's not the Paris of the East, Paris needs to try hard to keep up with Budapest!The Hungarian people are just awesome and so is the cuisine!Number 2: We just got to know about the conquer Budapest tour by a coincidence, and we were really happy about it afterwards. Our guide Matyas knew a lot of cool historical facts about the squares, buildings and the whole city. Still it didn't get boring with an information overload. When he saw that we were really interested and he didn't have any other plans he even extended the standard tour and showed us some more cool places. That was for sure one of our favourites in Budapest.

AMAZING Free Walking Tour. My sister and I didn't do too much research before choosing this walking tour, but after seeing an ad in a brochure we had no expectations and decided to go for this onet. It ended up being the best decision we made in Budapest! She had made a list of things to see/do in Budapest, and by the end of the 3 hours many of these items had been crossed out. Our tour guide (Max) was so knowledgable- born and brought up in Budapest (he even showed us his high school!) and the mini "quizzes" kept everyone in the tour group engaged. We honestly didn't want the tour to end! Thank you Max :D

Great tour with a fantastic guide!. We happened to stumble upon this tour by accident when we were looking for the Budapest Communist Walking Tour. First of all Matt helped us to try and find this tour. When he realised we had missed it he took us on our own customised tour since we were the only people there. The tour catered to everything we wanted to know about the city, was informative and Matt himself was very entertaining and witty.

Walking Tour with Matt was very informative. The walking tour with Matt was the best thing I did when I was visiting Budapest. Initially I was on the 'Hop On Hop Off' bus which was good for sight seeing. If you really want to know the history of Budapest definitely do a walking tour with him. You enjoy the sights and you learn as you go along.He even recommended chocolates for my kids and where to buy them.Pramod

Great guide!. Our guide showed us the most interesting places, in the most interesting and entertaining way! Our small group thoroughly enjoyed the tour and we would all highly recommend this method of learning about the city.

Great Tour, FREE, Great Guide. Really enjoyed this tour and felt like I seen all the best highlights of Budapest. Matt is very knowledgeable and entertaining. Would definitely recommend this tour to others.
Nice walking tour. We were a small group of 9, I enjoyed the walking tour, the guide was friendly and very informative, he interacted with everyone very well. The tour lasted 2hours and a half.

Hop on Hop Off Walking Tour Experience. Our guide.Zoli, gave us a marvelous two and one-half our walking tour of Budapest that we will always remember. My husband & i highly recommend that all Hop-On-Hop Off travellers take this walking tour. Zoli provided a highly informative tour that was relaxed and thoroughly enligjtening and informative. We hope you are lucky enough to get Zoli as a tour guide.

Incredible Walking Tour of Budapest. Two friends and I spent a wonderful 3 hours on a walking tour of "Buda". Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable about the history of both the city, the country and the people. His stories were entertaining and informative. We loved the small group size. We could see other tours of 20-30 people while we were just 8! We could see and hear easily and there was a lot of opportunity for questions. Our guide was also very helpful in guiding us toward other things we should/shouldn't do while visiting the city. We felt he helped us to maximize our time. Take this tour!

Walking Tour with Zoli. I just finished a 2.5 hour walking tour, guided by Zoli. The tour started at the Opera and finished at Buda Castle. Zoli was informative, humorous and spoke excellent English. I highly recommend this tour. Wear your walking shoes. There is no cost for the tour, however, the guide accepts tips. You will be very happy to tip Zoli!

A great way to start Budapest!. Our tour guide, Matt, was informative and made the journey interesting by helping us understand the history behind Budapest. He also provided us with a useful map and listed authentic hungarian cuisine that we should try before leaving (Unfortunately the restaurant he recommended was at best average).
Mat the Extraordinaire. Mat made the tour super fun! He has an awesome hold on the history of Budapest. Made the tour very humorous so flew by! Would recommend his tours to anyone!

Mat was amazing!. Really awesome guide, full of facts and really funny. Got a really good feel for the city and he gave excellent recommendations for food and other activities. A must do for Budapest!

Best Walking Tour. I'd just about had enough of walking tours, and vowed the next way I was going to see a city was by Segway. But I am so glad I decided to do this walking tour with Matt. He's an amazing guide with great passion for what he does and his beautiful city. Matt is a fun guy who brings a lot of humour and warmth to the way he delivers his information. I found him to be a great teacher whose interactive style made the information easily memorable and interesting. If you're tired of walking tours, make this one your last and end on a high note.

A Good Review!. Our guide did a good job of reviewing a lot of the information that we had heard on the bus audio guides in a way that helped us retain it. The walk looks really long on the map but our two kids (ages 7 and 9) had no trouble keeping up and keeping interested.
Best walking tour!. Best walking tour we've done - and we've done a lot through Europe! Matt was friendly, funny, engaging and very knowledgable - recommend 100%

Fantastic free walking tour. Fabulous tour around some of the major sights of Budapest. Matt, the guide, was very knowledgeable and friendly. It's the first tour that I've actually memorised dates and facts. We saw some beautiful sites and it felt like we were just having a meander with friends around the city.It's completely free to attend and only based on tips. So if you enjoyed it, you tip Matt and if you didn't enjoy it then you don't. I would definitely recommend this, lasts about 2-2.5 hours and sets off at 10am outside the opera house.
Walking Tour of Burcharest. The Guide Matt was knowledgeable, friendly and charming. The tour was interesting and fun. It was a great way to get to know the city of Budapest.

Matt the omniscient tourguide. We took the tour this summer and did not regret it. Matt is an excellent and friendly tour guide and seems to know just about every detail of everything that has the slightest connection to Budapest. The tour takes around 2,5 hours in which you see the main sights of the city and hear their underlying stories. At the end of the tour Matt also showed us some (traditional) hungarian dishes/candy.
Excellent tour!. Really nice tour, all important facts, first tour where i memorized important dates and people after the tour! I can totally recommend it!

Budapest walking tour. Our guide Matt was very informative and did a great job explaining all the sites. The tour covered Buda and Pest so we were able to see two areas on this tour.Just the right amount of time, not too long nor too short.
Walking tour. Our walking tour guy was really good and fun he explained everything and he was fun too and he made the whole walking tour fun

Must do!!!!!. Just came off this tour today and have to say out of easily 15 walking tours that I have done around the world, this one ranks among the top. Our guide, Matt, really knows his stuff about this amazing city and extremely personable and amicable. Made learning about Budapest fun and interactive by engaging his audience with questions and humor that sure will leave a lasting and memorable impression for years to come. Recommended quality restaurants for great value as well as went out of his way to resolve a double boat booking tour. Overall this was a fantastic tour and you will be sadly mistaken if you miss out on this opportunity to meet a great native and learn about this beautiful city. A+
Knowledge & Entertainment. Brilliant guide, interesting though necessarily short tour. Impressive the way of involving respectfully the participants.
Great time. I really enjoyed this walking tour. Great information and great recommendations. There are some steps, so be ready to walk!
Walking Tour. Great tour, your guide was excellent very informative and never boring. Interacted with everyone very well. Great job

Excellent, engaging and enjoyable . Matt was a very good tour guide and was very engaging, we loved the way he asked question and got the whole tour involved! We saw all the sights you would want to see and gave us advice after about places to visit in Budapest and local dishes to try!!

Best Walking Tour Ever!. If you get to Budapest, don't miss out on the 4 hour walking tour headed by Mat, a handsome young native of the city. We started at the Opera House in Pest, and ended up in the Castle District in Buda. Unlike many guides who speak heavily accented English which unfortunately is difficult to grasp, Mat's English was perfectly understandable, and we learned a great deal while having a good time.
Upbeat. Our tour guide Max was engaging and upbeat. The tour was not overwhelming but informative and relevant.

Absolutely worth your time. Not only did I learn so much, but the tour covered exactly where I wanted to go and Matt was so helpful with advice on everything in Budapest. He even gave us a voucher for free drinks (coffee/limonade) at a great place on Dob street. Highly recommended.

Great day out with Matt. A group of six of us arrived to meet our walking tour guide in the pouring rain. We were skeptical how it would go due to the weather but Matt was very professional and friendly throughout giving us a full and descriptive tour of pest and then over the bridge to Buda. The whole tour took about 3 hours. We learnt many facts and he kept us entertained throughout. Great company and was lovely to stop and have a coffee together in Buda at the top of the mountain. Would definitely recommend.
Ideal site seeing tour. Really engaging and lovely experience. I would recommend to all. Matt was very friendly and approachable.

Fantastic Walking Tour in Budapest. While in Budapest we took a four hour walking tour of the city starting at the beautiful Opera House. The tour was free, with a tip expected for good service. Luckily we got Mat (Mátyás Szira), the handsome young owner of "Conquer Budapest," as our guide. He was thoroughly knowledgeable about the history and culture of Hungary which we learned as we passed by points of interest (he even quizzed us on important facts he had emphasized). The tour was leisurely with lots of time for questions, and we were surprised at the end of the tour that so much time had gone by. But Mat's greatest asset was his excellent English. We've experienced some guides in the past who spoke such heavily accented English it was impossible to understand them. Believe me, we appreciate how tough it is to speak a second (or third) language, but it's such a shame to miss out on much of the information being given because we couldn't recognize the words the guide was trying to say. That's why it was such a pleasure to listen to Mat. If you're going to Budapest, contact Mat for a tour.

an interesting walk to with Conquer Budapest. we had it from hop on hop off offer. Its indeed a good one that you can't miss. Mattie(pardon me, I don't know how to spell) guides us with a short walk this can be the first thing you should have in your first day in Budapest as he will tell the history, introduce the city and show you something you might not get from guidebook. hope everyone enjoy Budapest as well. Karen

Great way to discover Budapest. Matthias is an excellent guide and will make you remember Budapest history super easily while visitiing the best spot in the city. We had a really good time !I recommend him to anyone visiting Budapest !

Excellent private tour with althe expert of Budapest. Matthias was a great great guide, took time to tell us al he knows about Budapest whilst making it very Engaging and making sure we asked questions and remembered what was being said. He also let us wonder free to take picture inside St Stephens ( which was just mesmerising in all its form) as well, showed us the famous fat belly man of Budapest who, when you rub his belly gives you good luck! We went on walking through the city and walked up to the fishmans bastin ( the easy way to walk up the hill ) ! Mathis as guide was very good as he shared stories about why he knows Budapest so well and paid attention to detail by engaging with his audience and speaking to them in their own language. He speak French, Italian, English and of course hungarian, which also added to the appeal of choosing Him. 2.5 hours did not seem like a drag and went so fast we were shocked when said it was the end! He was very approachable and you could ask him any thing which and again made the tour even better! If you intend to go to Budapest I personally highly recommend him and would go back and book a tour with him! Thank you Matthias for showing me your beautiful city

A fun and interesting tour!. Matt is warm, upbeat and taught us a lot about the city! Highly recommended for getting a lay of the land--we're glad we got to see and learn about the major sites/streets on our first day in Budapest with him, in a casual 2.5 hour walk with a small group of friendly travelers.

Budapest city walk. we took this wonderful city walk suggested by Hop on Hop off and found it most interesting and pleasant. Mat took us for this 3 hour walk to most interesting historic places and we learned a lot about the old Budapest. We would highly recommend this tour to everyone with good walking shoes !Paula
best tour in Budapest . the walking tour was the best!! so intective and u really lern about the city !! !!!also u can take it in Spanish !!! do it !! !!
very nice. it was really fun experience, the guide had a lot of stories about the buildings and monuments. Thank you Matt for everything.

Perfect way to see and learn about Budapest. This was my second time in Budapest, one of my very favorite cities in the world. This time we had the perfect guide. Our walking tour with Matthias was the best part of our time there. He told us the history of the city, all about the beautiful buildings and monuments, and most importantly gave us the feeling of the city. Thank you, Matthias for your heartfelt tour and for sharing the secrets of your amazing home!

Best way to know about Budapest. It was a great walking tour, with a lot of information!!! It was really cool that our tour guy Mathias actually cares about making us know about the place and its history!! Teach us a lot of things and give us a lot of interesting facts, that helped us a lot with our next city (Vienna), by knowing common austro-hungaro history!Super recommended!

Fantastic Tour!. This was an excellent tour, with lots of great details and anecdotes. Our guide Matthias personalized the tour for us, and was very knowledgeable and friendly. Like another reviewer said, it was like walking around Budapest with a friend who knows all the answers to your questions about the city! Thanks so much to Matthias for welcoming us to such a grand city!

Friendly and informative!. Mátyás is a very friendly and informative tour guide.He manages to,not only teach you how important certain dates and buildings are,but to actually memorize and understand how meticulous the symbolysm of the dates were apllied on certain buildings.He speaks at least 4 languages (english,hungarian,spanish and italian that I know of) when he perfomed a tour so he is surely able to communicate with almost anyone arounf the world.His tour includes a good variation of historic places and he gave me good advices reagrding where to try good hungarian cooking and where to go next.I would definately recommend his tour to everyone :)
Good walking tour of Budapest. The tour was around 3 hours and comprehended the main locations to visit in Budapest. Our guide spoke perfect English. Only the starting time was a bit odd, at 1pm.

Fantastic time, nice company, perfect guide. There was a great choice to choose this walking tour: friendly guide with good English, interesting manner to present you the main fact about the country and the city, enjoyable time. I would highly recommend to get the tour in the first two days of staying Budapest as you can have a personal recommendation about different things from Matt (the guide): best choices for sightseeing, thermal baths or anything else. Suggestion: could you add some Hungarian language class in the excursion? Like "hello", "thank you"... I would think there is cool to lean some local words/phrases ) anyway, there was fantastic time. I like the 3 hours of the tour.
Mat the best!. Mat knows how to entertain us as the same time teach and show all the important things about Budapest. I trully appreciated the tour and his behavior. He is awesome!

All the best of Budapest. My friend and I joined Matt on the walking tour after seeing it advertised on our hop on - hop off tour bus leaflet. Matt was very enthusiastic and obviously knew lots about his city. My friend and I were lucky enough to do the tour all by ourselves which was amazing. We walked from the Opera house, down Andrassy Street to the Basillica and then on to Freedom square and finally on to the Parliament building. All the time Matt was telling us about old and more modern history. He answered all our questions and was incredibly friendly.Well done Matt - I would recommend your tour to my friends and family.

Mat is an awesome guide!. We had an amazing time during our walking tour with Mat! I The tour was very informative as well as engaging! We totally recommend taking the walking tour more than hopping on and off the tour bus and listening to an audio guide of which you can barely understand & concentrate on. Great job Mat!

The best of Budapest. We took the walking tour with Zoli as part of the Hop on Hop off tour. He is an excellent guide who made the 2 hours pass in a flash. He provided fascinating details not only about the city itself but also made history come to life with the stories and folklore. He made us feel like friends and shared his experiences of Hungarian life. He is a great ambassador for Budapest!I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to enjoy this beautiful city. Thank you Zoli!

A perfect walking tour. We enjoyed this walking tour in the istoric part of the city.The tour covered all the key sights and the narration included not only the general historical facts but also some amusing stories and anecdota, with good quizes and links which helped us to remember a lot we left the cityMátyás showed himself as an excellent tourguide who knows a lot about the city, provides information in a entertaining manner and is very friendly and responsive.Our fault was that we went on the tour on the coldest during our stay in Budapest (or during the whole winter there)) but still the tour was a pleasure.

Best Budapest Walking Tour. This tour was phenomenal! If I don't know much about the city I'm visiting I usually try to start off the trip with a free walking tour. It was a rather chilly day so my friend and I were the only two that showed up that day. Matthias was extremely knowledgable and made learning about the city fun and intriguing without even trying. It felt more like we were walking around town with a friend who knew all the answers to whatever question you wanted to ask.I would recommend this tour to anyone wanting a locals perspective on the city. Thanks again Matthias.
Excellent Tour of Budapest. Great guide, very knowledgable and funny. He will entertain you through the long tour that covers majority of the sights in Budapest.

Welcome to Budapest!. Where do you begin when going a new city? This free, tip-based tour took me through the first barrier of exploration in Budapest, with great information from several fields like architecture, history, politics and more. The guide was a local from Budapest, with great english skills. The tour takes you to both sides of the Danube, covering several of the "must-see" when visiting the city. Highly recommended as a first approach, since you'll get a great impression and a good feeling of what to do next. Don't be afraid to ask questions, since the guide is very friendly and been doing this tour for years, mostly for fun as far as I could tell. Definitely 5/5!

Enjoyed every minute!. Matt is very accomodating to every participant; stopping to buy coffee in Xmas market, talking not too fast so non-native English speaker can follow and answering all possible question you might have about Budapest, even where to shop for shoes in my case!I highly recommend Matt for his knowledge about the city and also his warm character.

The tour was put together wonderfully and I would do it again!. I'm so glad I made it to this tour! I have to admit that I was a bit spectacle about walking for two hours but our guide, Matt, made everything so fun and interesting that I didn't even notice the distance we crossed. The tour was full of fun questions, jokes and facts and I would really recommend the tour to people of all ages and families. Matt was even kind enough to translate his tour to Spanish for a few guests who had trouble with English. He went above and beyond and you can tell he's passionate about what he does. I know I will visit Budapest again and when I do I will be sure to make it to another one of his tours!

Perfect - Highly Recommended - A Must Do!. I wish I had have done this tour sooner! Consider doing this tour as a first thing, you wont regret it, and you will learn so much about the city that will make the rest of your time in Budapest so much better. It was a great overview of the wonderful city. The sites were beautiful, he took us places I wouldnt have gone had I not joined to tour.Matt was very informative and loads of fun. I was never bored, he was friendly and a pleasure to tour with. Our group was small and it was lovely to meet other travellers. The tour is free, but based on tips. Matt never pushed to get money and seemed very happy to share his city with us. I wish I had more money on me so I could tip him more, he is worth every forint/euro.Very happy!! Seriously - DO THIS TOUR!! :)

Best tour ever. I saw the city of Budapest with Mat and I have to say his tour was one of the best I've ever been on. Great guy, really helpful, and even gave me the information I didn't know I needed to have. Highly recommended. In fact, this is my first time writing a review, Mat was just that good.

Conquer Budapest with Matyi. My two roommates and I went on a tour with Matyi and it was very enlightening. It was a bit cold so we were the only ones in the group, but I highly recommend it. Our tour guide Matyi took us to both sides of the city and was extremely knowledgable. He was also very kind and made the tour as enjoyable as possible. If you're in Budapest I highly recommend this tour!

A must do! Very informative guide. Did this after hearing about it on the hop on hop off tour. As it's ran by a separate company it is free but based on tips. Our guide matyis was very enthusiastic and informative and spoke English very well (apart from him saying bowl as bowel which was funny as we had to explain the difference).A very interactive tour as he would make sure we were paying attention by asking us questions about what we had just seen - if in doubt say 1896! Despite being a walking tour it wasn't overly exhausting as there was plenty of stops and easily done without getting out of breath! Learnt so much more doing this than doing the HOHO tour and even though it's based on tips the guide isn't too pushy to ask for huge amounts. Very highly recommended

Interesting tour, awesome guide. My friend and I were recommended this free walking tour by our hostel and we could soon understand why! We were the only two showing up and usually that would mean that the tour wouldn't happen but the guide was still very enthusiastic about showing me and my friend around. What I thought was really great was that he made sure we remembered the important facts by referring to previous stories during the tour and asking us questions to check if we remembered. This also made it more fun. As a guide he was very kind and nice, and it was clear that he enjoyed the tour as well.If you want a tour with a nice guide, and actually learn something this tour is highly recommendable!

Highly recommended. . I have always stayed will away from guided tours as I believe they take away from the enjoyment of new places. This however was very very enjoyable. The guide matt (mathias) was very friendly and informative and happy to answer questions even if they didn't really have much to do with his tour. He spoke several languages (English, Spanish, Hungarian, French and German). We visited all the main sites in Budapest and had a full explanation of the history of the city and the country. Free of charge but accepts tips if you think he did a good job. He even returned a 20,000 Huf note that was given to him by mistake. I would recommend this to everyone.

Very Informative / Excellent Guide. We really enjoyed this walking tour, the guide Matt was very friendly and knowledgible and happy to answer any questions.The tour lasted approximately 3.5 hours there was so much to see and take in.We took the walking tour after booking the 'Hop on - Hop off' City Bus Tour which was excellent value for money (also included at boat trip)Thoroughly recommended :)

Great tour of Budapest!. This was our first time in Budapest, and this tour was just enough to make us want to go back! The tour was very informative while also just being a lot of fun. The guide was born and raised in Budapest so it made the tour a little more personal while also giving us a lot of information. Also, the fact that the tour doesn't start until means that you can sleep in and be fully rested because you will be walking all over and seeing just about everything Budapest has to offer, the tour guide also had some great recommendations of where to eat afterwards and was more than happy to take pictures, which is always nice!

great tour. Fantastic tour with great guide and with excellent english accent and knowledge. Highly recommend it! They let you look around in peace and do not urge you to move on, even let you shop if you want. The guide is young and really friendly and knows a lot and speaks several languages, not just english.

Amazing time!. This tuk tuk tour was a lot of fun!!!!
It's a great way to see the city. The tuk tuk can get into places the busses and big red bus can't. I highly recommend this tour, my girlfriend and I had a wonderful experience. Daniel was a wonderful guide!!!! Loved him!

Awesome city tour. Very friendly guide, awesome driving and great sightseeing. Good selection of beautiful sights especially for people who haven't been to Budapest prior. Combined the Tour with a nice glass of wine and cheese platter afterwards. Keep it up.

Value for money. For 50 euro, this is a great way to see both Buda and Pest. The drivers/guides speak good English and will give you a quick lesson in Hungary's history and insight into each tourist attraction you visit.

Really good tour which great tour guides. These little machines can get through the smallest of gaps and traffic jams didn't cause any sort of delays. We hired 2 Tuk-Tuks for a group of 4 people they picked us up from the hotel and dropped us off at the 21 restraurantOur tour guides were Bertie and Adam, they both spoke great English and answered any questions that we asked. They dropped us off for a quick stop at the one of Budapest's Ruin pubs which we subsequently walked back to at the end of the tour.A big thank you to both of these guys as they could'nt do enough to help you.

Customized Tuk Tuk Tour -- Highly Recommended!. My parents, my husband and I took a 5-hour tuk tuk tour around Budapest on October 16th. The company was very easy to work with; we told them what we wanted to see, and they made it happen! They were happy to pick us up at St. Stephen's Basilica after Sunday mass, and we went from there. Peter and Paul were our drivers, and they were full of interesting history, facts, and stories; they knew Budapest! They were also extremely flexible: if we wanted to stop somewhere, or take a peek at something else, it was no problem. Peter and Paul were quite generous with their time, and both were extremely kind. It was fun riding around in the tuk tuks; we were able to cover a lot of ground quickly, something you could never do on a walking tour. We had just the best time, and we learned a lot, too. Thank you so much Peter, Paul, and Budapest TukTuk!!

Fun way to see the city. This tour was the highlight of our trip. The tuk tuk was able to wiz around with less traffic problems than a usual tour so we were able to visit more in the time. It was good that we were able to customise the tour to a degree, choosing where we spent extra time taking photos or visiting a site. We chose the tour ending in goulash as it left us near the fisherman's bastion with plenty to look at before a gradual walk down the hill to pick up public transport. Unfortunately I didn't enjoy the goulash but that was a personal preference, the restaurant was smart and helpful.

Best way to see the city!. Book a ride! The tuktuk tour is a great way to have a personal tour of so many different places in Budapest, along with learning some historical information along the way! With two children, 9&11, I cannot think of a better introduction to the city, see some great sights, and then it allowed us to pick a few other sights to spend more time visiting. Our tour guide was very entertaining, full of amazing history and stories, and so incredibly nice! I cannot say enough about what a great experience.
Nicest guy ever! Gave my mother 80+ years mother a ride, refused any payment!. This guy was energetic and sincere and knows the city and did a great job and is in a great location.
A lot of fun. This tour was this tourrecommended and it lived up to our expectations.Paul did a great job showing us around and explaining the sites.I would definitely recommend this tour.
short but sweet. We had only short time in the city but loved the Tuktuk service & Adam especially!He was so accommodating & helpful & made getting around a breeze. Would definitely use again!

Great value and stress free tour . I only had two full days in this amazing city. I was able to see all the spots in 2-3 hours. The city is so big and this is a great way to do it. I was able to quickly figure out where I should spend my time. I thought the we show everything package is a great value. The private driver/tour guy for approx. 2+ hours + free boat trip ticket is a nice touch. I did the night cruise next day. It was amazing.

Fabulous way to get an overview of Budapest!. Tuk tucks are so much fun, and this was a great way to get an overview of both Buda and Pest on our first day here. We signed up for the 2.5 hour tour ($135 for 2 people) and it was well worth it. Our guide, Daniel, was very flexible and knowledgeable. This was the perfect amount of time to see everything and figure out where we might want to go back and spend more time. We even helped participate in a tuk tuk engagement--a young man from England proposed to his fiancé at the base of the Liberty Statue in Buda, and we were there afterwards to offer our congratulations! All very fun.

Perfect city tour for foreigners. Our tour guide Bert picked up us on time at Kossuth Lajos metro station on the 1st of October.Bert was so excellent,friendly and informative,that we did see so much of Budapest and really enjoy this amazing city from a different way,.Everything's perfect!
Perfect City Tour. Enjoyed an amazing city tour our tour guide Barrabas have show us the best part of the city and made it so enjoyable with his story talent and flunet English. Suad

Piknik tour . Had a tour on Saturday with Bart it was a perfect way to start our Budapest trip allowing us time to see the city, get our bearings and tips for our later adventures. Bart was fantastic very helpful and extended our tour to give us time to take photos etc cannot recommend enough. The only negative thing I will say is the tour included a plate of meats & cheeses at the end with a bottle of wine. We swapped the wine for beers but the plate was disappointing - a few measly slices of 1 type of cheese and salami a few slices of bread and 5 olives! BUT the restaurant was fantastic, brilliant location and we bought the most amazing hot dog to supplement the plate so after all it worked well and we wouldn't have wanted to miss the place!

Touring in a Tuk Tuk. Thomas our Guide picked us up at our Hotel. We just had to walk out the front door and get into the Tuk Tuk. The weather was beautiful and Thomas asked us if there were any sights we wanted to see. I had a few requests and he also made some great suggestionstuff of sights we didn't know about. Thomas spoke very good English and was quite knowledgeable about the history of the sights we saw. He is a good responsible driver and had good command of the vehicle. I recommend Thomas and this private Tuk Tuk tour.
Great time with Bart.. Delightful way to see the sites. Bart was very interesting and filled us in on present day life in Budapest.

Tuk Tuk - a great way to see Budapest. Adam was a super tour guide - we didn't want the usual tourist tour so Adam took us off the beaten track. We saw so much more of Budapest than we otherwise would. Such a great experience, we would highly recommend it.

Great tour. Well worth doing, you see lots of Budapest and Peter our tour guide was excellent and very informative. I felt the tour provided a good point of reference for the trip so I would suggest doing it on your first day. We really enjoyed it.

Great Way To See The City. I went on this trip with several of my business associates and we had a great time. The trip was a little over 2 hours and we were able to travel through a majority of the city and see most of the key sites. We were provided adequate time to stop and get out at several of the key attractions and the guides were very friendly and knowledgeable. The TukTuk's fit 2 guests and a driver so we arranged for two since we had a party of 3. They are very mobile so they can navigate through the city easily and are open air. I have a much better appreciation for how beautiful Budapest is after this trip. I highly recommend it.

Great street level view of Budapest. So I needed a way to see all the main sites of Budapest, with limited walking involved and without the need to stand up all the time. Tuk Tuk Budapest offered the perfect solution. We decided to get one of their tours and add some extra time, which is nice as you'll get to see more, but you also need to make clear exactly how much you are willing to spend as you may end up enjoying Budapest a lot more than you expected. We had a great driver - Daniel - which took us all over. Gave us great details on all the main sites of Budapest and was more than happy to let us enjoy a bit of extra time at the sites and sounds of Budapest. Definitely a great option for those of you who don't have great mobility and need to limit your walking and still want to be able to be close to everything. Adding the extra time really worked for us. But people on a budget (money or time) should stick to the set schedule.

Brilliant Service!! Perfect organisation from them to help me propose to my girlfriend!!!. I visited Budapest with the intention to propose to my girlfriend. After scouring the internet for ideas I came across Budapest TukTuk. I had the idea to propose to my girlfriend at the top of Gellert HIlls, after surprising her with a TukTuk ride through the city.I was in contact with a lady called Bori - who could not be more supportive and genuinely excited by my idea. She briefed the driver (Mikkey) excellently and he helped keep it all a surprise.We was picked up from a river cruise and taken to Gellert Hills. I requested a bunch of flowers and champagne for after the proposal. Once I had proposed, Mikkey (the driver) came up and gave me the flowers in such a sly way I felt like James Bond. We then returned to the TukTuk where a bottle of champagne was popped and we continued the tour whilst sipping on the bubbly.Bori was a star in all of this. She was excellent with her communication and any query I had was promptly answered. The night went perfectly and a huge part of this must go to Bori for sharing over 30 emails with me really planned everything to the tee.Mikkey the driver was also fantastic and was briefed really well and kept the whole thing a surprise. Thank you to Mikkey, Budapest TukTuk and off course a huge thank you to Bori!Highly recommended and extremely good value for money. Planning on visiting Budapest on our anniversary and will certainty have another tour!

Not quite as exhilarating as in Asia. To me, Tuk Tuk, conjures up memories of fast and exhilarating rides I have done in lots of Asian Countries like Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Cambodia etc. Not here in Hungary...Very subdued as they probably have to be. The overall experience for our 100 minute tour was good. We did suggest where we wanted to go (we have been here before), so our Driver, Miki, was accommodating but not knowledgable of questions we had. Suggest the Company needs more drivers who are not only safe when they drive but also know a bit about their cities history and are familiar with tourism facts for those of us who are interested in this sort of thing.

Excellent way to see beautiful Budapest. We have visited many European Capitals as a group, and used many ways to see them,electric bikes, scooters and Segways to name a few, so this was another one to tick off the list, and we were not disappointed.Very knowledgeable and witty drivers Dan, Zol and Gabor Thank you !The end stop on top of the hill near the statue overlooking the Danube was quite a stunning view, of what is a beautiful City,one of the best we have visited.Gabor went out of his way to find us at the metro station as we were late due to unforeseen circumstances.Dont think about it.....do it!

Best tour!. This was our first time in Budapest, and the tuktuk is one of the best ways to see Budapest and learn the history of the city. Our driver Paul, was on time, very friendly, polite and very knowledgeable of the history of the city , willing to stop and take pictures, and showed us the best of the city. After he dropped us off at the hotel we had no problem walking around the city. We ate at the places he recommended, loved the soup bar! One of our best meals in Budapest. If you go to Budapest you must do the tuktuk, it's the best way to see the treasures of the city. Will definitely do it again.

Amazzziiiingggggg. Well what can I say... We went to koh samui in July and saw NO tuk tuks so when I found this company on google I booked straight away. The driver was early and his English was outstanding. We had Adam and he took us to the most relevant places and then to off the beaten track to see some awesome views of Budapest.He then dropped us off at a location specific to us what a fab idea. The only bad point would be they need to advertise more as this is an awesome experience thank you

Amazing experience . We took the "we show you everything" tour earlier this week and loved every second of it. Our driver Paul arrived on time at our hotel and brought us on the most amazing tour of Budapest. Paul was a really great driver and we felt safe and relaxed throughout the trip. His knowledge of the city and its history was fantastic. Our trip included a Danube boat trip and Paul brought us to the boat and sorted us out with the tickets. A truly magical day. Thank you so much Paul.

Sorry, but they didn't show up. Hate to give a bad review, but our experience wasn't great. In fact it was a non-event. We booked many hours in advance for a hotel pickup. We call them when they were late and they said the driver was 5 min away. 30 minutes into it we called again and the dispatch didn't answer. We then we're on our way to plan B.... poorly handled to say the least and ended up costing us precious sightseeing time. If you use this service, go to their meetpoint, not a hotel pickup. Hopefully you'll have better luck.

Perfect way to see Budapest. My wife and I took a 2.5 hour Tuk Tuk tour of Budapest with our driver/guide Peter. This was a great way to see the city and we were able to go to places that the tour buses could not reach. Peter, a university student, was very knowledgeable and obviously proud of his city. We were picked up and dropped off from our hotel which was a bonus for me as I walk with some difficulty. Thank you Peter. You made our visit to your beautiful city even more memorable.

Best of Budapest. Fantastic way to get a personal tour of Budapest especially if you are short on time, Adam and Zoli gave us lots of Historical information with passion, showed us the unexpected and made our tour fun. Thank You for A great Tour.

Awesome eperience. It is great to ride on the TukTuk, though it rides on the same road with all the cars, it is extremely safe to sit in the tuktuk and look around the city. The benefit of riding on it is that you can go through the paths that those big buses by other companies that cannot go through.
