Orsi pointed out all the historical points of interest along the way.. We then went to a ruin bar which was just super-cool! You got to go, a must see, words won't do it justice. Then we walked our way to a real nice wine bar. Orsi recommended the wine and it was outstanding! We were traveling with two other couples so we opt for the speed boat ride on the river to get our photos We got some great shots and then a great high speed boat ride to cap off our night. Thanks Orsi for making this one of the most memorable nights of our trip!

We higly recommend Orsolya and her team.... Wonderful Budapest was of course even better with a company from Orsolya and her colleague Adam!We visited Budapest for 5 days in early July 2016 and had previously agreed that Orsolya should guide us around this beautiful city for the first 3 days. Every day she should also plan a lovely place to eat lunch so we could experience the local cuisine and culture as well.Not surprisingly, Orsyla and Adam knew their hometown very well and shared a strong knowledge of the city and its history.Orsyla was our guide the first two days, but was busy on the third day. The third day we met her colleague Adam who gave us an equally great and enjoyable experience. We would heartily recommend Orsyla and her colleagues if you are planning a trip to this wonderful city.Nice to meet committed and great people who want to make a difference! That is how we experienced Orsyla and Adam and their acquaintances.

Amazing day with Orsolya. I don't know where to begin, other than to say this was one of the best experiences we have ever had, in our travels. We were picked up at our hotel promptly and time flew as we were taken through the beautiful countryside around Budapest. Orsolya answered our many questions, was very knowledgeable about the local history and took us for lunch at a restaurant with a stunning view on the Danube bend, where my husband enjoyed wild boar stew and I tried Elderflower juice for the first time (delicious!)

Fun evening with Orsi, a little bit of history, a little bit of wine and a boat ride. We spent an evening in Budapest with Orsi. She was very personable, knowledgeable and we felt very comfortable with her. Unfortunately some of our travel friends had to fly home from Vienna and never made it to Budapest so it was just the two of us but we still had an eventful evening with Orsi. We were interested in walking around the city at night, having some wine, seeing the Danube at night on a boat ride and experiencing a ruin bar and we accomplished it all. It was a long tour, we left at 7pm and got back to our hotel at 11:30pm with lots of walking but we felt that we saw a good snapshot of Budapest nightlife. On Orsi's suggestion we booked a private boat tour for 1 hour, in hindsight, 30 minutes would have been plenty to see the sights because the last 30 minutes were spent speeding up and down the river plus it was quite an expensive ride for us because it was only two people paying because we were missing some friends. But it was a minor detail and we did have a very fun time. The bonus was Orsi telling us about her favourite restaurant Kispiac Bisztro and we went the following evening and had a fabulous experience. I would highly recommend Orsi.

Traveling with a friend. We took several tours as part of our river cruise, but none of the guides displayed the passion and enthusiasm we experienced on a private tour with Orsi as she showed us around Budapest. She is warm, knowledgeable, and most importantly, fun. We felt as is we were traveling with a close friend and had a great time.

A great day with a great guide. Whenever we get to a new city we spend time with a private guide to get some local insight and history. We spent the entire day doing a walking tour with Orsi and enjoyed every minute. She was knowledgeable, easy going and completely flexible to ensure that the day focused on the things that we were interested in.We particularly enjoyed the little known facts and tidbits of information that brought so many of the places we visited to life. She showed us many "off the beaten path" places (like a small family run chocolate shop in a corner of the town with few tourists). She was quick to offer suggestions for restaurants and even set us up with a private boat tour one evening that was really special.Budapest is a big city with plenty to do and see. Orsi made sure we got the most of our visit and she did so in a fun and engaging way. I highly recommend her to anyone visiting Budapest.

Fantastic Day Tour with Attila. We were visiting Vienna recently and wanted to take a day trip to Budapest. Since we had never been before and had little time, we booked a 5 hour long private driven tour with Attila of Travel Guide Hungary. Of the 10 days we spent in Central Europe, Attila's tour was one of the most informative and fun. He wove history and stories into a seamless day of travelling throughout both Buda and Pest. We particularly appreciated the fact that we were shown not only the "must see" sights, but signs that were equally culturally-significant that the typical tour might not otherwise see. It started with him meeting us at the train station and returning us there in time for our departure back to Vienna. By the end of our tour, we really felt we had "seen" this great city (as much as one can in 5 hours, of course). Also, if there is any concern about a language barrier if you are an English speaker (like us), that is not an issue. Attila's command of the English language is excellent. In short, if you are considering a guide in Budapest, we do not think you could go wrong with Attila. We highly recommend Travel Guide Hungary and, in particular, Attila. Thanks again for a great day!

The Way to See Budapest. With only a short time to see Budapest my partner and I opted to split Travel Guide Hungary’s Budapest Explorer trip over two days. Splitting the tour simplified the process for us tremendously, as Kamauf collected us from the train station on the first day and took us back for our return on the next. On our first day Dora took us to several of the main attractions on both side of the river before giving us some suggestions to do on our own that evening and next morning. The following afternoon she collected us from our hotel and altered the itinerary to fit our tastes. This is exactly what we wanted from a private tour. Dora’s knowledge, personality, and ability to change the plan to what we wanted exceeded our expectations.

Amazing Day perfectly planned for US!!. We had an entire day touring the Lake Balaton area. It was one of the most delightful days of our entire two week trip to Europe. We saw so many things we would never see in the city of on a big bus tour. We tried wines and foods that were wonderful and learned a lot about the area. It was a treat to be able to choose the activities that we were interested in and to spend as much or little time as we chose. LOVED THIS COMPANY!

Judit is the guide to tour with! . We spent 2 days in the company of Judit. She is engaging...fun...quirky and offers a diverse perpective of Budapest....A city she is very knowledgeable about and has a deep passion for. Other than the historical facts or architectural comments she shares her knowledge thru stories and adds a valuable depth to ones visit. She will pace your tour around your needs and interests and time frames. Judit is the guide u deserve.

Fabulous Hungary. We spent a day in the Budapest area with a guide from this company. Dora was a wonderful guide and very enjoyable companion for the day. We had a private tour with Dora and had our own van and driver (George) also supplied by Travel Guide Hungary. We started the day by touring some of the countryside and finished by touring sites in Budapest. Dora's detailed descriptions of the places we visited were much appreciated and her knowledge was second to none. Dora's love of her country was very evident and we both felt very lucky to have been able to experience the area with her. Thank you Dora. Our first visit to Hungary was one we will never forget. We would highly recommend this company to anyone looking for a personalized, memorable introduction to Hungary. If your time in this area is limited, spend it wisely with Travel Guide Hungary. Dave & JudyParksville, BCCanada

Ask for Julia!. We spent two fabulous days with Julia. Her English was excellent, her knowledge was strong, and most of all, she was warm and engaging. Our two days flew by and we felt like we were leaving a friend behind on our last day. Travel with Julia and you will have a delightful time.

Panoramic Budapest Private Tour by Car. Orsolya and a driver took my family of five on a tour of Budapest by car in May 2016. My husband was born in Budapest, and we were returning with three adult children so they could experience Budapest with us and learn more of the family history. Orsolya collected us from our hotel and took us on a half day tour to provide an orientation and overview of the city and its major sites. Orsolya was knowledgeable about the history of Budapest and its people. She was also very personable and helpful in tailoring our tour to our specific interests, and providing recommendations for shopping and restaurants. I highly recommend her.

Oroslya M Budapest Guide. Who would wait 3 years to write a sterling review? Me! Like a fine wine our impressions of OROSYLA has morphed into one of the best experiences my husband and I ever had. So why wait? Well.. life, but then my sister and her husband were planning visiting Budapest June 2016, and they needed guidance, and yes.. I suggested they contact OROSYLA. I believe they shall be seeing her within the next week or so. Before continuing I want to note that neither my husband nor I fawn over people. We don't make-nice. We are quiet, honest reviewers. And we have travelled quite a bit. So we are not goo-goo over our first European adventure.My husband and two mid-thirty's children and I had Orosyla for 2 - 1/2 day tours, one of the city and one outside in the countryside. The third morning my husband and I toured with her once more in the city for another 1/2 day prior to sailing on our river cruise. We still recall her cheerful smile, and honest evaluation of the historical Budapest vs Budapest today. She was professional, yet humorous and quite flexible. Yes, she was knowledgeable re the history, but also about the shops, and culture et al. Even took us to the New York coffee café on our third day. Now that was an exquisite spot , very old world. Look out Starbucks. Our driver was pleasant and another member of our "troupe." What impressed us was that Orosyla and the driver took care to drop us off and pick us up at convenient locations re the tours - not just any old spot as some larger tour busses do.We celebrated my husband's birthday while in Budapest and Orosyla recommended two restaurants - BOCK - and another with Gypsy music whose name escapes me. We really had great fun at the BOCK; the gypsy music was haunting but the experience at BOCK was better for us. She also recommended a "ruin bar" another important cultural experience. Would we return to Budapest... In a heart beat if we could! Would we ask for Orosyla again? A thousand times over. Sounds like she is a member of my family... no, but I wish she were. We would be proud to call her our own. Don't mean to sound creepy, but she is / was the perfect hostess.

Well organized, personalized tour. We toured Budapest with Judit last week and learned alot about Budapest and Hungary. In our short time together, we hit the highlights of the city while also hearing about Hungary's history and present day life. I came away with more than a series of sites - but also a sense of this city's spirit.

6 hours tour of Budapest by Oroslya.. We were 17 people from Singapore pre booked Oroslya based on positive reviews from Trip Advisor. She was knowledgeable , humor , cheerful making our 6 hours tour enjoyable. We were also grateful to her as she surprised us by providing a 18 seaters van to bring us to all the sites which some of these sites could not be accessed by our big coach.

Andrew Illes. We had a 4 hour tour of Budapest with Andrew ahead of our river cruise. We asked him to put together an itinerary which did not duplicate the tour our cruise line was providing. He exceeded all expectations and showed us parts of Budapest that demonstrated its character and charm. He is knowledgeable and well spoken and clearly knows this city. We are pleased to highly recommend him.

Excellent 4 hour tour of Budapest. I researched about 6-7 private tour companies before selecting Travel Guide Hungary. I found the tour to be excellent, fairly priced and very flexible. We were a 4 person group of 60-70 year old Americans visiting Budapest for the first time. The tour could not have been better. The guide listened to interests and facilitated a very informative trip. I'm a history buff - she answered all of my questions very well and within context. Some of our party had mobility issues, the tour was then tailored to minimize steps - although we still walked a bit but not too much. The van was very comfortable, drinking water was provided and at one point one of our party became a little affected by low blood sugar - the guide walked them into a nearby shop to help purchase a snack (managed in Hungarian and even paid for the snack). Very highly recommended company

Budapest surpassed all my expectations!. We were guided by Judit, who was young and current in her wisdom. She had a great knowledge of Hungary's past and present. She was very informative. We walked for about 5 hours, never losing interest, and stayed on the Pest side of the Danube. We did the Buda side the following day on our own.

Walking Tour with Julia. Whenever we visit a city for the first time, we like to schedule a half day private tour so that we can get a flavor of the city and figure out what we might like to spend more time digging in to. We were very fortunate to have Julia as our guide. She was very knowledgeable about the history of Budapest and her obvious love of the city resulted in enthusiastic delivery of information and color about the sights we saw. Because of her use of public transportation (both bus and underground) we got to see a wide variety of sights and we were also able to see the city from many vantage points. Budapest is much more beautiful that we had expected and we highly recommend this tour company and, particularly, Julia.

Jewish Budapest with Adam. Adam picked us (party of 4--2 from USA, 2 from England) up at our hotel at the agreed upon time. We were impressed with his knowledge and friendliness. He walked us all over Budapest stopping to explain various sights and answer questions. Adam was amazing. I can strongly recommend Travel Guide Hungary. Thanks!

Sightseeing with Melinda. Melinda gave an insightful tour and provided much needed historical knowledge. She was flexible with her time and gave me the necessary breaks while getting a lay of the land. I highly recommend her if you're ever in Budapest because she's absolutely fabulous!

Amazing private tour. I have traveled to many cities in the world and have done private tours in a lot of them, but Adam my tour guide for 2 days was one of the best. Adam and driver meet me at my hotel for a 2 day tour of the city and the Jewish quarter. We first started with a overview of the history of Budapest, and then into the car for an overview of the city. Adam adjusted the tour to deal with the weather, my bad knee and my jet lag. I had an amazing time, and fell like I got to know not only about Budapest and Hungary, but of the people of Hungary as well. When I get back to Budapest I can't wait to do another tour with such a great company.

Walking Tour with Melinda. I spent four hours exploring Budapest with Melinda in April. Melinda is friendly; she likes architecture and history, and she likes to wander around and look at stuff, which makes her a great tour guide. I asked her to focus on "local Budapest," that is, I didn't want to go to typical tourist sites. I wanted to see what life was like for the people who lived in this city.We walked past monuments and through parks. We rode the subway and tram. We visited a church in a cave. We had some coffee in the courtyard of a renovated mansion. We strolled by some marvelous architecture throughout town. And we stopped at a Ruin Bar. There are a set of Ruin Bars in Budapest. They are basically dilapidated buildings (ruins) that have been converted into very hip places to meet and drink (bars). Melinda also took me though Széchenyi Fürdõ, the most famous of the local baths. She strongly recommended that I come back. And she promised me that a Speedo was not required—my North American trunks would be acceptable.The best part of my time with Melinda was that she helped me to understand the story of the Magyar people. I felt like I understood Hungry better after my time with her.Her English is excellent.

Foodie Tour was amazing. I can't recommend this enough. We had an amazing day with our guide Judit. My husband has no dietary restriction, but I am vegan and gluten-free which I knew would present its challenges. Judit did her very best to accommodate my needs and it made for an awesome experience. We started at the Great Market Hall. While it was a foodie tour, we learned a lot about the history too. She took us to traditional Hungarian food for my husband and then basically for me the few things I could eat. Downstairs where the pickle almost everything was awesome and very tasty. Next we walked the city and had fun drinking and eating along the way. Lastly we ended at a wine tasting shop and she gave us the history of wine in Hungary and was very knowledgeable. Overall it was a great day and well worth the cost.

Beautiful tour through Pecs. Orsolya made touring through Pecs on a very cold day in November the most fun trip of my family's stay in Hungary. It is a two hour ride from Budapest, but we made a nice stop in the town of Kakasd where we saw an ornate gate at the local community center.After getting dropped off by, Mikhail, Orsolya's excellent driver, we walked to the main town square where we escaped into a cafe for some much needed warmth and coffee. Though most of the Zsolnay tiled fountains and sculptures had been boarded up for winter, there was still plenty to see. The architecture of the town looks very light and airy. The Mosque of pasha Qasim the Victorious is beautiful inside and is a must visit. The Pecs Cathedral is also very interesting, with a flat, wooden roof.We stopped by the Zsolnay museum in the town and the Zsolnay factory quarter where we saw the artisans making the beautiful vases that grace the museum. And the factory shop was extremely affordable if you want to bring back a unique souvenir. Another good stop is the 1861 Glove Manufactory store where you can get extremely well-made handmade leather gloves. Now every time I wear my gloves, I remember Pecs.Trying to catch all the daytime possible, we had lunch very late in Villany, the local wine region. The Bock wine cellar and restaurant was very nice and gave us a wine tasting along with our meal.At the end of the tour, Orsolya and Mikhail dropped us off at the Szechenyi Baths for a soak. My mother still speaks very fondly of our trip and how much she loved Pecs. I hope we can come back in the summer when we can enjoy even more of the town's sights in Orsolya's company.

Interesting Tour Experience. Our tour guide Julia is interesting, knowledgeable and completely efficient. We spent 3 days with her and she has made extra effort to ensure we are well taken care of. Not only was she completely knowledgeable about all of the historical details she also took us through some of the hidden gems. Thanks Julia for the interesting time in Budapest.

Budapest at Night - Wonderful!!. We arrived late afternoon and were only in Budapest for 2 days so wanted to start our trip off right by getting oriented quickly. We met Adam at our hotel around 5 pm and spent the next several hours learning more about the beautiful city, history and culture. You just can't beat walking around with a knowledgeable local who is passionate about their native country - he was really great and helpful. We had some local treats at the Easter festival, saw the Danube at night and ended with drinks at the ruin bars. He followed up with a suggested itinerary for the next day as well which we used as a starting point - very helpful..! Highly recommend Travel Guide Hungary!!

Budapest, a hidden GEM!!!. We visited Budapest Hungry from April 1- April 9. Judit was our guide and because of her, we now have a better understanding of the Hungarian Culture, History and its people. My husband communicated the sites we were most interested in and Judit planned our days out perfectly. We toured all the major political/historical sites and she educated us at each monument and told us of the significance of each event and the impact it had on the people of Hungry. Although we did not get to the wine country (this time, we will be back) Judit made sure we had a wine tasting tour, set up at a local wine retailer and educated us on which wines came from which regions and what made them so special. We were really impressed with the Hungarian wines, as we never thought we would find any better wines than in Napa Valley.We toured the coffee houses, dessert shops and local markets (which were my husbands favorites). Our last night, Judit took us to the Ruin bars in the Jewish Ghetto district. We have never seen such varieties of beer, wine and food options in a few square miles, it was amazing! We all agreed that our trip would never have been as good if we had not had Judit as our guide. She is knowledgeable, flexible, intelligent and accommodating. She even went out of her way to make sure we had lunch reservations at a Michelin restaurant we were interested in trying. I can not recommend this group of wonderful people enough. We are already planning a trip back to Budapest next year and we will be calling Judit again!!!Thank you for a wonderful guided tour of Hungary,The Bodnar Family

Fantastic experience . Our tour guide Dora was fantastic. She immediately made us feel like a long time friend was showing us around the city she loves. We had a short time for our visit. Dora quickly learned our preferences and took us on a great trip through the city that perfectly fit our preferences. Our driver Imre was a pleasure and contributed to our experience with his own knowledge of and pride in his city. I highly recommend this team.

So personal and amazing! (Adam is second to none). We cannot say enough wonderful things about our tour and our tour guide Adam. He was friendly, knowledgeable and so personable! My mother is from Budapest, so he balanced the tour beautifully between talking with her about specific history and things she remembered as a little girl and giving the rest of us a general overview. (Turns out, Adam and my mom grew up in the same area, but years apart!) Organizing the trip was really easy, and even though it was so very cold (December 2015), Adam never complained or seemed like he wanted to be anywhere else aside from showing us this beautiful city! And, my husband was desperate to see a vizsla in its home country (we have one in the states), so Adam even called a friend to try and meet up with her and her vizsla. The timing didn't work out, but it just goes to show that he was willing to do whatever to make sure we enjoyed. If you're doing a walking tour, you should certainly do this one!

The Perfect Guide to experience the "Best of Budapest" and "Hungary Wine Tour". Our guide Orsolya Morvai was perfect! We can't say enough good things about her. She 100% listened to what we wanted and adapted our tour to fit our needs perfectly! She went well out of her way to make sure everything was great. We were having so much fun that we ended up going about three hours past our tour time. She also recommended great places to see and amazing places to eat. Orsolya even called restaurants and made reservations for us. On our way home talking about our favorite things all of us agreed having Orsolya as our guide was our favorite. She made us feel welcome and made us want to go back. Not that Budapest wasn't fabulous by itself but she helped us enjoy it to its fullest. When we go back we are definitely having her with us everyday!

Select Orsaly for your trip of a lifetime.. It had been a dream of mine to visit the country where my grandparents lived. I was traveling alone and found Orsalya through trip advisor. I will never be able to fully describe how wonderful the trip was and service I received from her. I wanted to see as much of the country as possible during my stay and relied on her knowledge and suggestions. She did an outstanding job, I left with a wonderful understanding of my heritage. In addition, Orsalya was a wealth of knowledge on the history of the country, she speaks perfect english and is just a joy to be around. If you are looking for a guide, go with Orsalya and trust her knowledge and expertise.

See Authentic Hungary...Perfect!. I went on tour with Orsolya for 2 days. We went out on the bend tour one day and the other day explored the west. While I was making arrangements prior to my arrival, I knew that I would have a wonderful time because of the way Orsolya organized our time and immediately understood my interests. She is efficient, compassionate, respectful, educated on vast number of topics, and enjoys her time with others. She is focused on you and she makes every effort to bring you into her world.We had a wonderful 2 days together full of nature, history, food, art, wine, music, science, politics...you name it. Orsolya and Miha were the most wonderful and knowledgeable hosts. I began to understand a bit about Hungary and its rich past and future. I completely enjoyed every minute of my time with them and learned so much. Even though the weather wasn't great, it didn't impact on our laughter throughout the entire two days. They truly made my experience special and I felt like I was traveling with two friends exploring Hungary. That is what engaging a guide is about. It isn't a business transaction, but a sharing of time. I was really sad to leave them and wanted to continue our travels. I never thought that when I left Hungary, the most important gift I received were two new lifelong friends! Thank you for the most wonderful experience!

Get the insights. I have very little time to spend in Budapest and decided that the best way to visit is to find a guide with good local insights to bring me around. Orsi is very helpful and is able to confirm my booking one day before the tour.Choosing Orsi to be my guide proves to be a right decision. Thru the private tour which last for 8 hours, i visited all the key sites of Budapest and each location was well explained. Orsi also shared many local secrets as well as answering all my questions on Budapest past and present political and living situations etc.Travelling with Orsi is a great way to travel and i feel like i have seen and know a lot about Budapest in 1 day. As Orsi is able to customised the tour based on your interest. I highly recommend her tour if you are short of time and does not want to waste your visit to the beautiful Budapest city.

Hungary the way it should be seen!. As this was our 1st trip to Hungary, we contacted Orsi a couple of weeks in advance to arrange 3 days of what we described as a relaxing tour of Budapest and the surrounding area. We couldn't be more pleased with the itinerary she put together. She met us at the airport and showed us her city by car which gave us the perfect cursory knowledge for the rest of our trip. The next day she planned a walking tour of the Budapest with an unforgettable start at the Grand Market. Her pace was perfect and her ability to adjust to our requests on the fly was astonishing. The third day was a trip along the Danube to the Danube Bend and the hills that run along side. The picturesque views coupled with the intimacy that you can only see when accompanied by locals was truly amazing. The final stop at Szentendre was the perfect ending to three days that seemed to flyby. We could never have experienced Hungary the way we did without Orsi and her driver Mihah's intimate knowledge of their country which made the experience totally unforgettable! Nagyon szépen köszönöm.

Great Tour: Highly recommend Orsalya. We took the full day Danube Bend tour with Orsalya, driven in a clean spacious car by Mikah(sp?). Orsalya was an excellent guide, knowledgeable and enthusiastic, always smiling and very accommodating. She knew the border between being informative and being too talkative so we had a great time- she gave us the right amount of information and also gave us space to be silent and enjoy the landscape. It was a nice change from guides who talk too much and you feel obligated to reply. She really is good at her job and clearly enjoys it. Always such a pleasure to meet someone like that. She chose a great place for lunch and had small surprises on the trip for us like a surprise view point and stopping to look at interesting buildings on the way. We were really disappointed to be able to see nothing at Visegrad due to very heavy fog that day but the company and overall tour was so lovely that we never felt bad. The day was well spaced and we never felt rushed. Orsalya would not mind while we looked into a shop or something and was very patient -even recommending which souvenirs to pick up. Mikah was also very nice and a great conversationalist as well. I would highly recommend Orsalya for your time in Budapest, its worth the expense and most certainly we had a very very good time with her and Mikah.

Wonderful tour, Orsolya is enthusiastic, knowledgeable and a great guide. Four of us went on a half day walking tour. Orsolya has great people skills, a wonderful sense of humour, very knowledgeable about Budapest and made everything interesting - I would highly recommend her services. We had a great time and she showed us the "real" Budapest - historical facts and how the underground works - and had lots of patience with our (probably quite stupid) questions, without getting flustered once...

Full Day Danube Bend Tour. Orsolya was a wonderful guide who lead my small group on the Danube Bend tour. It was a full 8 hour tour. She organized a beautiful van with a great driver to escort my group. It adds so much to a visit to have a knowledgeable and organized leader. We followed the Danube and Orsolya highlighted three lovely cities along our route. It was delightful and I highly recommend Orsolya's services.

Wonderful Tour in Budapest. Orsolya met our family of five on the first day of our trip (jet lag abounded). She was such fun and so delightfully well-informed that we didn't even remember that we were in a time zone nine hours ahead of our own. We toured the city with her for eight hours and had a blast. She knew just when to stop and give us a coffee, lunch, or snack break. We learned so much from her and found ourselves quoting her numerous historical tidbits for the rest of our time in Budapest. We were thoroughly at home in the city at the conclusion of our tour. A great way to start your stay in Budapest!

Afternoon in Budapest. Orsolya was friendly, informed, and displayed a great sense of humor...I learned much about Budapest from her, and enjoyed her company. Highly recommended and hope to use her again in the near future when I return to fascinating Budapest!

Great tour in Tokaj wine region. My husband and I took a personalized wine tour to Tokaj with orsolyaand it was truly unique experience.We visited two wineries -a small boutique winery and another winery which was a bit bigger operation , (but still not a huge one) and had a wonderful time.We had a opportunity to meet with winemaker - they were happy to show us their place,and wines and they were very informative one of them has spoke very good english and gave us an in -depth explanation of wine production . first we tour a beautiful cellar and tasted six different wines there, and not only sweet onesAt the next winery we had a wonderful home made lunch to tasting 8 different wines and here since the winemaker spoke little english Orsolya translated.by the end of the day ,we had a good understanding of the methods they use to make their wine in the regionthe day was excellent value for money . highly recommended!

Orsolya is a delight.. We were fortunate enough to have a full day culinary tour with Orsolya. She is knowledgeable and informative about Budapest and its history and she is also just a nice person with a great sense of humor who loves to entertain. So, it's a win win situation when you book a tour with her. I could go on all day about her. She was always willing to go the extra mile for us to make our stay in Budapest special and memorable. Thank you for your kindness and expertise, Orsolya. If we are ever in Budapest again we will give you a call.

First class, reliable organization and service.. Orsolya answered my eighteen inquiries patiently and comprehensively as we organized a day-long tour of Budapest for two Chinese-speaking couples. Although it is not easy to find first-rate tour guides in Eastern Europe who speak fluent Mandarin, she found Sándor for us, who met all the qualifications and picked the right places to visit, answering all our group's questions about history, politics and everyday life knowledgeably and with humor. Our driver always turned up at the right times and somehow found parking places to wait for us. Sándor had a plan, but was always ready to be flexible according to our needs. And the city of Budapest did its part to make this city the highlight of our four-week journey to five countries.

Could not have asked for more, it was great all the way. We spent 5 days with Orsolya and it was really great all the way.Orsolya let us have an in-depth understanding of Hungary, patiently explaining the history and culture, peppered with interesting anecdotes. She is also fun and has a very cheerful disposition to brighten each day. Her tours are very well planned to ensure a rich experience of places. For example, we visited vineyards of different sizes, from the small charming historical village of Palkonya to the well known Tokaj wine region. The vineyards were selected to represent different characteristics of owners and wines, much appreciated by us. We also toured the Danube Bend, Pecs and Villany and Holloko. Some of our friends did the Lake Balaton tour with Juli and they were equally delighted.Orsolya was forthcoming with suggestions of restaurants, sights and shopping. On our own on the last day, these suggestions came in extremely useful. I would highly recommend Travel Guide Hungary to anyone who needs a tour guide for Hungary.

Great tour - Highly recommend. My wife and I had a 4 hour tour of Budapest by car with Orsi in October. We chose Travel Guide Hungary because of the very good reviews here on tripadvisor and we were happy to discover that the reviews were accurate. Orsi is friendly, accommodating and fun! We really enjoyed our tour and definitely recommend her!

Highly recommended. As a family of 4 we travelled to Budapest in late September and it was the first stop of our 3 week trip. We always like to familarise ourselves with any European city we travel to with a private & local tour guide on the first day to maximise the visit. We found Orsolya through Trip Advisor and booked her in for a 3-4 hour tour. She met us at our apartment and was warm and welcoming. We walked the whole tour and this was the best way to take in this amazing city, there is so much to experience & learnt every turn. Orsolya was very knowledgable and her passion for Budapest clearly shows. It was lovely that we also had lunch with Orsolya at the end of our tour at a place she recommended in the Castle District, it was a great way to end the tour. We loved this tour and would definetly book again on our next visit.

Fantastic private tour. A couple weeks before arriving in Hungary last May I found Travel Guide Hungary online because I was looking for a more unique tour in Hungary instead of the free tour offered by Viking River Cruise. Since it was close to the date of the cruise, I wasn't sure if there would be any available tours. Luckily we heard back quickly from Orsolya who was able to provide us a guide for the day we were in Budapest. Our guide for the day was Juli who met us at our ship. Juli then walked us to the van, which was parked just right by the ship where we met our driver for the day, Emi (I'm sorry for the mispelling on the driver's name). The van was comfortable with enough room for 3 more people in the backseat. Emi had also brought a cooler of drinks for us as well for the day. We then headed out to our first stop.On our way to our first stop of the day, Juli would have Emi slow down along the way through Budapest so we could see some of the sites from the van. She would provide explanations about the sites, like the former Roman ruins in Budapest. Even though the van was honked at a few times by other drivers for slowly passing by the sites, Emi gave us enough opportunity to see them from the van. This was really nice to see some of the sites of Budapest from the van by going slowly. We then headed into the countryside.We stopped at a popular hiking spot for views of the Danube Bend, Esztergom, Visegrad, and Szentendre. At Esztergom we visited the Roman Catholic Church of Hungary. Before visiting the Church though we drove across the Danube to get pictures of the Church from Slovakia. Afterwards we headed to Visegrad, but never actually stopped in the town. We were supposed to have lunch here, but the restaurant was booked fully when Juli called. Instead we headed to Szentendre for lunch. After lunch Juli guided us through the town and we walked through two local Churches. After spending some more time in Szentendre we headed back to our ship in Budapest. Overall the tour was fantastic and a great way to see the Hungarian countryside. I would definitely go with Travel Guide Hungary again if I am ever in Hungary again. The driver and guide were both excellent and very helpful, probably one of the better private tours I have taken in a long time.

Wonderful private 8 hour Food and Cultural Tour!!!. Orsolya was a fantastic guide. We opted for an 8 hour Food and Cultural tour with driver. We basically saw Budapest in a day. We have two teenagers whom loved the tour as well. The food was great and by the end of the day we all felt like we had a very good grasp of the local culture. I highly recommend Orsolya!!!!

Wonderful tour experience - would certainly recommend. We travelled to Budapest in September. During that time we organised a tour with Orsolya. From the moment we contacted Orsolya communication was prompt and easy to understand. She listed to what we were after and provided a number of great suggestions.Our tour guide was Dora. We spent 2 days with Dora. This gave a great overview to Budapest. We caught public transport, trains, taxi's and walked. It really enabled us to have the confidence to enjoy our remaining 3 days.We also had a 4 year old with us and that was not an issue - Dora was very accommodating.Dora was very personable and open about her own life and experiences. It was great to have such a 'real' and 'genuine' tour guide.If you are going to Budapest, book ahead - you won't regret it.

Excellent private tour of Buda and Pest.. Rather than one long full-day tour, we opted for two 1/2 day tours, the first, Pest side and next day Buda side. Adam was our guide and was very professional, humorous and accomodating. He was very knowledgeable and upbeat throughout the tours.We found doing 1/2 day tours was more relaxing with lunch on our own at the end of the tours and the afternoons free to do whatever we wanted. Highly recommend this tour company. Orsolya was very prompt answering our emails and has a great team working for her.

The Best!!. Orsi is a fantastic tour guide and we highly recommend her. She is quite knowledgeable of the area and tailored the tours to our interests. She made our Budapest visit the favorite part of our 2 week trip. We spent 2 days with her touring. The first day was a tour of Budapest and then the 2nd day touring wineries (with lunch at one of them). Budapest is a beautiful place and with Orsi, we were able to see quite a bit of it in one day (we toured in a van and were able to jump in & out to see the sights). The wineries that she picked were beautiful and the wine was very (very) good. We can't wait to go back.

Budapest is better because of Julia!!. We coordinated with Orsolya whilst we were in Prague to fix up a City tour and one for the Danube Bend. She was very accommodating in adjusting times for my parents who are old, splitting a full day tour into two days. And we were given Julia as our guide. And what a fun and warm and knowledgeable person she turned out be!The first day it was four hours in a car and various places which were slightly at a distance - and getting on and getting off. The second day it was a walking tour punctuated with some travel on public transport. It was easy paced and the talk was honest. My parents - both over 75 - found it just perfect and fun!! The Danube Bend trip is such a delight. And we got to spend many hours with Julia and we shared tons of information about each other's countries and cultures. Julia became like family.Budapest was a treat because of Julia - and the professionalism of the Travel Guide Hungary!

Amazing Tour. Our group of 5 had a wonderful tour with Juli recently. She is so knowledgable, enthusiastic, and really fun to be with!!!! During 5 hours tour (combined walking and riding a car), we were able to learn so much about history and culture of Budapest.. I highly recommend this company!!! Good job, guys!!!

Amazing Guide!. Our guide was Orsolya. She spent 4 hours with us showing us Budapest. She was incredibly energetic, fun, and knowledgeable. She took us to a market for lunch, Halaszbastya Castle, and to both Buda and Pest. She was the nicest and most accommodating guide we've had.

Enthusiastic Zsofie brings life to Budapest tour. Six of us completely enjoyed our October 2015 full-day (8-hour) guided tour with driver that we arranged online and through email with Travel Guide Hungary. Not only did we have a terrific tour of Budapest with Zsofie as our tour guide, but we also had a lot of fun. She met us in the morning precisely at the agreed upon time in our hotel lobby. Zsofie helped to bring the history of Budapest alive and was an absolute delight. We were thrilled by her pleasant demeanor and her amazing knowledge. We especially enjoyed how she used her iPad to illustrate in more depth what we were seeing and what she was telling us. We appreciated her insight into the end of the communist era and the transition that Budapest has made in her lifetime. She took excellent care of us as she shepherded us around Budapest for the entire day. Zsofie helped us to see nearly everything on our extensive wish list and timed the tour perfectly - getting us where we needed to be exactly when we needed to be there. She was even patient as we worked out the final "high finances" of dividing the tour and tips among three couples and figuring out how to use the last of our Euros supplemented by US dollars. We had a wonderful time in Budapest with a tour that ran like clock work thanks to our reservation through Travel Guide Hungary. We would recommend the company to anyone planning to visit Budapest in the future and would encourage them to ask for Zsofie.

Judit is a great tour guide!!. Three of us had a wonderful experience in Budapest and Hungary and so appreciate that you connected us with Judit. She is SUPERB!!!! We felt comfortable and at home with Judit from the moment we met and that feeling continued throughout the entire three days with Judit. She has a very charming and engaging personality and explains so many different aspects of Hungary in a very understandable and interesting way - she made our time together so enjoyable as well as informative. And whether we then asked other questions about history, culture, locations, buildings, food, psychology, politics, art, music, natural surrounding, and on and on, Judit responded to each and every item in such a thoughtful way. We toured both within Budapest and took a full day trip to the Budapest Bend. While we needed to make adjustments (traveling with our 85 year old Mom) each day, Judit and the driver made it all so easy and enjoyable -- Judit was very accommodating and resourceful in changing the tours (even by the hour) as needed. We were so grateful to share our days with Judit and learn with and from Judit about Hungary. We think anyone would have a wonderful experience if they were able to tour with Judit.
Amazing Budapest. Funny, cultural, full of observations that can not find in books.I would definitely recommend use this excellent service.

A day with Zsofie on the Danube Bend Tour. I booked this trip with Travel Guide Hungary 3 months in advance. Was put in touch with Zsofie, who was at our apartment promptly at 9:00 am as arranged. I did not realize that there would be a separate driver, but he too showed up only 5 minutes later. We went to three towns on the Danube Bend tour with the last one, Szentendre, our favorite. Zsofie was very knowledgeable about the places on the tour, and spoke English very well. Not the best guide on our trip, but she did a reasonably good job. The only thing that I did not like, was the expectation that I was buying lunch for everyone. I thought that was handled poorly. The total cost of the tour ended up being $400 for the tour, $42 for lunch, another $20 or so in entrance fees, and I gave a $40 tip to be split between the driver and the guide. As a side note, Szentendre is reachable by public transportation, if that's the main reason you are booking the tour.

general tour in Hungary and the jewish tour. The tour guides are very friendly and nice to be together with and they have a lot of knowledge about their subjects!Orsi and Birgit are terrific guides:-)

Great Tour of Daunube Bend. Our guide Juli and her driver Miha were both very knowledgeable and were delightful people to spend the day with. The day trip was well-organized and very informative. Juli provided us with much informataion about Hungarian history. In addition, Miha was able to tell us about his own native country, Slovenia. The Danube Bend tour took us to three different towns along the Danube, all with wonderful scenery despite a rather gloomy day, and we enjoyed a delicious lunch in a hilltop restaurant where the clouds lifted enough for us to sit on the patio and enjoy the beautiful sights. As for practical details: our e-mails before the trip were promptly responded to; Juli and Miha showed up at our apartment on time as promised; and their 7-passenger van was very comfortable. We are so happy that Orsolya who was unavailable herself was able to arrange our tour with her partner Juli.

Orsi was the PERFECT guide!. We are so glad we found Orsolya through Trip Advisor a few months back as we planned our trip to Budapest. We spent two days with her walking the city, tasting the food, visiting thermal baths, the Central Market, a Sunday Farmers market, touring the Jewish quarter and riding the trams. We drove up to all the major viewpoints and felt that after our experience we really had a good appreciation for the vibrant city of Budapest, its history and culture. Highly recommend Orsi, she is relaxed, fun, flexible and very knowledgeable. It was a wonderful couple of days.

Very informative and a wonderful way to know Budapest. We met Anita at our hotel and she sat down with us to plan the tour. We were in Budapest for only a day and a half and wanted to put it into best possible use.She patiently enquired about our needs and interests and came up with recommendations. On this tour we covered Hero's square, St. Mathias church and river cruise.Anita was very knowledgeable and gave us a glimpse into Budapest's rich history and culture. She was a very friendly person and very mindful of our expectations from the tour. We also managed to find a strudel sweet shop outside the St Mathias church which I'll highly recommend for the cottage cheese strudel!The Danube river cruise was the cherry on the icing. The cold breezing slicing through your skin amidst the backdrop of the luminous Budapest Parliament will have to say was an amazing experience. I would definitely recommend this tour to anybody who want to know about the city and its rich heritage although the price is definitely on the higher side. Wholeheartedly endorse Anita's tour guiding skills!Note that we did half a day tour, and the river cruise was paid for separately.--Divya

Glad we stayed an extra day. After a typical quick tour with Viking, I am so glad we decided to plan for an extra day and scheduled an all day tour with Orsolya. We would have left Budapest with the wrong impression, but after spending the day with Orsolya showing us such an amazing city we left wishing we had more time to spend there. Orsolya was a pleasure to work with and tailor the day based on what we wanted to see. It was a very enjoyable day.

Cake, Chocolate and Coffee. Judit was amazing! A day-long food tour of Budapest for two vegetarians is not easy, but luckily she knew the city so well and adapted and developed a tour that really suited us. Cake, coffee and chocolate featured large, but we also got to experience local cheese, traditional food and some wonderful local sights. We experienced a coffee culture that was unbelievable - and really enlightening - thank you! We finished with wine-tasting and warm sugared cakes - a truly wonderful day.

Our best experience in Europe. Our best experience in travelling East Europe and covering Budapest, Vienna, Prague and Berlin, was with Julia. She enthusiastically showed us the highlights and history of Budapest on our first day and the interesting sights and villages around the Danube Bend on our second day. You couldn't wish for a more knowledgeable or likeable travel guide.

Excellent Grand City Tour of Budapest. My husband and I booked the Grand City Tour of Budapest which is an eight hour tour. We took it spread over 2 days, 4 hours each day. We are very glad we chose to see the main sites of Budapest with Orsolya. We feel that we have a much better understanding of Hungary's history, and the different monuments and buildings in Budapest. Budapest is a large city and the main sites are quite spread out. It is possible to use public transportation to get from one place to another. But when we looked at all the different places we saw and all the things with did on our tour, it was obvious that it would have taken us several days on our own, and we wouldn't have had the excellent explanations and stories that Orsolya shared with us. Each morning Orsolya and our driver, Miha, picked us up at our hotel and whisked us through the streets, and traffic, of Budapest. This was great because it was quite hot while we were there. The car was air-conditioned and we got water from out hotel. At the Great Market Hall we tried different types of Hungarian sausages made with paprika and ate Langos for lunch. Orsolya gave us helpful advice for souvenir and paprika shopping. On the Pest side we tried Hungarian strudel. After our tour we felt comfortable enough to navigate Budapest on our own and see some of the lesser sites. And we went back to the Great Market Hall to do all our shopping on the last day.We highly recommend Travel Guide Hungary. Having a guided tour greatly enhances your travel experience - you will better understand what you are seeing and the spirit of the people. And you won't find a better guide in Budapest than Orsolya and the team at Travel Guide Hungary.Be sure to book your tours well in advance so you get the tours and dates you prefer for your trip.

Best tour ever. Best thing we did was book the grand tour of Budapest with travelguidehungary.com our guide, Melinda, divided the tour into 2 mornings 4+ hours each. Melinda is an excellent guide, she planned the days based on our wishes, provided history of the city and country, shared personal antidotes, intelligent and just a wonderful person. Excellent! The driver is very professional, safe and courteous. The vehicle was clean and comfortable. The private tour of the opera house is memorable, don't miss it.

Pleasure to tour with. My wife and I recently had the pleasure of having Zsofi as our guide on a private tour of Budapest. Not only was she extremely knowledgeable she was also a pleasure to spend the day with. Orsolya set everything up since she was not going to be personally available and it could not have gone better, highly recommend.

Maybe the best all day tour in my experience. I have taken a lot of private tours in many cities throughout the world. Our tour for my family of four, lead by Juli was one of the best ever. Her knowledge, enthusiasm and energy was incredible. We had a Mercedes Van with driver and private guide (Juli) for eight hours for less than $400. They arrived promptly at the agreed upon time, picking us up and then dropping us off at our hotel. We absorbed a great deal of historical knowledge in a day with Juli. If you are traveling to Budepest, I highly recommend this company and Juli.

The best comprehensive, yet personal, tour of Budapest. Budapest is an amazing city with rich history and rich contemporary life. Our tours with Adam painted the complete picture of this dynamic place. Not only did we get a comprehensive history but also the contemporary vibe that is happening now. We were there this summer when the migration started from Syria, the prime minister of Slovenia visited and the Romanian soccer fans filled the streets - all in the same day!! and Adam explained how Budapest and its culture is positioned for all that and even more. I highly recommend Adam and Travel Guide Hungary.

Interesting, patient, and flexible. Our tour guide was Zsofi and she was delightful! She took our group of 9 on a walking tour of Budapest and kept the whole group engaged, from teens to adults. She is incredibly knowlegable about the history of the city without being dry. She answered all of our questions and gave us suggestions for the rest of our time. Would definitely request Zsofi again :-)

An Enchanting Evening!. We opted for an evening tour during our stay in Budapest and were fortunate to have Judit as our guide. We began by taking a short stroll through the Jewish Quarter while Judit explained the history and culture of the area. As nightfall fell, we visited several of the "ruin bars", each with its unique character and design. Traveling about with a locale was a great way to experience the area. Judit was informative and friendly, offering wonderful suggestions on street food, wine, and even ice cream. A wonderful evening filled with lifelong memories!

Perfect!. Just completed our Budapest tour with Anita. One word to summarize it would be: Perfect! She was great in answering all of our questions and explaining everything we wanted to see at our own pace throughout this magical city. We only had a few hours to do it and Anita and our driver Emerald were great. They were very accommodating to our schedule and needs. I highly recommend this tour and I only wish we would have had more time to spend in Budapest.

A Marvelous Tour and Guide. We were a party of four with a day to spend in Budapest. We contacted Travel Guide Hungary and set up a tour. We were met at our hotel by Dora with whom we spent the day. Dora is knowledgeable, personable, and charming. She provided us with a wonderful and memorable tour of Budapest. Thanks to Dora, we could not have had a better day!

Cannot imagine a better guide for Budapest!. Orsolya met our group of 8 at our hotel and gave us a wonderful 5 hour tour of the city, walking and using public transportation. We saw all of the highlights of the city and she suggested all the things we could do the later that day and the next day, as she got to know us and our interests. She added very interesting stories that were not in the guide books and made the city and its history come alive. We ended with wonderful tour of the opera house with her and felt as if we were shown Budapest by a very knowledgeable and entertaining friend.

Thank you Andi for a wonderful tour of Buda and Pest!. We had a wonderful two day tour of Buda and Pest with Andi, a lovely and thoughtful colleague of Orsolya's. I arranged the tour via Orsolya, who responded to me promptly and was very accommodating. Andi was very flexible with our schedule, and made it fun also for our two daughters, age 7 and 10, with frequent snack breaks and ending one day's visits at the Szechenyi baths. I highly recommend booking through Orsolya, and if you are lucky enough to be paired with Andi, then you will learn an amazing amount about Buda and Pest all while feeling very relaxed and cared for!

Highly recommended!!. This is going to be a long review because we have so many good things to say about Travel Guide Hungary.We booked our walking tour in advance. Orsolya paid attention to our particular requests and set up a tour that met our needs (a combination of the standard walking tour and the culinary tour). The communication was excellent.We went to Budapest for the day by rail from Vienna. We were to meet our tour guide (Adam) at Keleti station when our train arrived. However, we had to exit the train early because Keleti had just been closed due to the current refugee crisis. Orsolya immediately contacted us by email and arranged for a driver to come pick us up to get to the center city for our tour. It was a very confusing day for everyone in Budapest, but Orsolya stayed on top of things masterfully.Lastly, it was a pleasure to have Adam as our guide. His English is excellent. He's pleasant and knowledgable. We asked a lot of questions and Adam took time to answer them all. We were thrilled with him - it was like spending the day with a friend.We would definitely use Travel Guide Hungary again if/when we return to Budapest!

Turbulent and Tragic History of Budapest. Our guide Andi and driver Richard were excellent. We chose the private 4 hour overview tour in a MZB van. Despite the traffic difficulties due to Iron Man race that was going on, the tour was very efficient. My parents who had experienced war, and my teenage daughters all appreciated turbulent and tragic history of Budapest and the plights of its people. Andi was very respectful of our diverse group of 6 and was very flexible. Highly recommend.

Great tour of Roman and Art Nouveau sites. Judit was wonderful, we wanted to tour Roman ruins, as well as Islamic and Art Nouveau sites. She customized a day long tour that was great. We also had a private tour of the Opera House (she used to work there as a guide) and visited a closed Jewish cemetery that had monuments designed by well-known secessionist architects. The cemetery was quite moving on so many levels. In addition, we had a delicious, moderately priced lunch with Judit and our driver.

Budapest, a SPECIAL CITY...made more special by Orsi. Orsi met the six of us (friends traveling from Los Angeles) promptly at our hotel. She was friendly and energetic and we knew right from the start that we would have a great day. She introduced us to our driver, George who was equally as friendly as Orsi. It was a very warm day and we traveled around the city in a beautifully air conditioned Mercedes van. Orsi gave detailed explanations of all of the important sites....she was SO full of information. We went to the shoes on the Danube, saw the Parliament, visited the Opera House and learned so much about Budapest's history from her. We had a wonderful lunch at the New York Cafe and loved hearing more stories during lunch. We visited the marketplace and she was so helpful....guiding us to the least expensive booth for PAPRIKA. We LOVED our day with her!!! The next morning we met Adam for a tour of the Jewish Ghetto and a visit to the oldest synagogue in the world....he was "filled with information" and we were all "glued" to his explanations of what we were seeing. We crossed over to the Buda side and he continued to amaze us with stories and history of the two cities. Once again, George was our driver and he was excellent as well. TRAVEL GUIDE HUNGARY is an excellent company, very professional, always prompt in answering e-mails and SO enthusiastic about their country...we HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to anyone visiting Budapest.

Fabulous tour of Budapest with lots of flexibilty. From the start of the communicaiton to helping us get a van from the city to the airport for our family of five Orsi was fabulous. Her communicaiton was quick and always helpful. She was unavailable to serve as our tour guide but arranged for Adam, one of her colleagues to do 2 - 4 hr city tours. Adam was fun, flexible and incredibly knowledgeable. He has passion for the city and its heritage and it shines through. We had booked 2 - 4 hr tours on consecutive days. We hit some unusually hot weather which made touring a bit miserable. Adam was able to cut the second day to 2 hrs and then meet us on a third day for the last 2 hrs so we could take advantage of the cooler weather in the mornings. It really helped us fully enjoy the fabulous city of Budapest. Thank you both to Orsi and Adam for hleping tomake our stay so wonderful.

Would recommend Orsi for a Budapest tour anyday!. Orsi took our group of 20 ranging in ages from 3 to 70 on a full day tour of Budapest. She planned the places to visit, booked the bus for transportation and arranged lunch for our large group. She was very flexible with our requests and cheerful and patient with all the age groups. She is very knowledgeable about her beautiful city and is clearly happy and proud and to show it off to visitors. She also gave us a lot of valuable advice on places to see after the tour, including her recommendation for the Danube river cruise in the evening. You can't go wrong by picking her as your tour guide.

Learnt heaps and great local perspective. My family of 5 ( 2 kids, 7 and 10, and mother 70 yrs) took 2 x4 hr tours with Orsolya and Judit on consecutive days in mid August. The first day we spent with Judit, doing essentially a food tour but with lots of local knowledge and sights around the central district incorporated. We all really enjoyed the morning, as Judit was a very passionate foodie and by sharing her attitudes and thoughts as well as fabulous authentic food we felt we learnt a great deal about modern, young Hungarians. The kids especially enjoyed the food parts of the tour, unsurprisingly, which probably made the food part of the 2 day experience more interesting for them than the sight seeing part the next day, especially as it was incredibly hot on both days and eating/ drinking, indoors gave them somewhere to eat their legs and refill the fuel tank! Thank you Judit very much. Orsolya was also excellent and knowledgeable as a guide and we certainly saw and learnt heaps in a relatively short space of time which was fantastic. I'm not sure if Orsolya was as used to guiding young kids as Judit ( a teacher) and maybe we should have spoken up a bit more but we found the sightseeing walking tour pretty tiring for the kids with not many opportunities to seek respite from the heat. We certainly appreciated taking the metro with her and perhaps would suggest that even though walking is the best way to see everything, using occasional buses would also help keep little and old legs fresher for longer in the heat. Overall we all really appreciated Orsi's knowledge and happy approach to the day and found her both very personable and also efficient way of leading and seeing lots in her gorgeous city. Thank you both for your kindness in showing us around. Orsolya was also

Orsi is a fabulous guide!. We booked Orsi for the Danube Bend tour and the Budapest City tour last month. She was a fantastic guide and made our visit to Budapest exceptional. She provided an excellent driver and vehicle for both tours which made everything comfortable and convenient. She has excellent knowledge of all the sites she showed us, Budapest and its history, and Hungary. We had a great time and feel that we really experienced Budapest and its surrounds. We highly recommend Orsolya!

Great tour of Budapest!. My wife and I recently took a Viking River cruise from Budapest. We wanted to make the most of our limited time there, so after our included city tour I booked Adam for an afternoon tour. My wife was not feeling the best, so it ended up being only me taking the tour. What a fantastic afternoon. Adam showed me more in one afternoon than I could have seen on my own in days. He was very knowledgeable. His English was great and he was very easy to talk with. I learned so much about the economy and culture and life in Hungary today. Adam was terrific and in one afternoon he taught me to love Budapest and Hungary.....the most "eastern country in Western Europe!"

Well worth it!. Prompted by other reviews on Trip Advisor we booked a Cultural/Culinary tour for the day. As we were only in Budapest for 3 days we booked the tour a couple of weeks ahead and communication was great. We were advised the day before that Anita would be our guide. Well we couldn't have picked a hotter day to traipse round Budapest but it was worth it in everyway. Anita spoke perfect English and was extremely knowledgeable. The beauty of booking a private tour is that you can tailor it to your preferences so I won't list what we did. Suffice to say that Anita was great at adapting to our comments and preferences, the pace of the tour was perfect for the conditions (who wants to race round in that heat?) and she pitched it perfectly for our teenage girls.We learnt so much and our trip to Budapest would have been less rich without our tour with Anita.

First visit to Budapest. We visited Budapest 2 days prior to departing on a Viking River Cruise. Researching online I discovered Travel Guide Hungary. We made our requests and arrangements via email and the tours were absolutely perfect. Our assigned tour guide was Judit, who was very knowledgeable, entertaining and personable. She understood our preferences and the tours were very well coordinated. Day one we did a 6 hour drive/walking city tour of Budapest which included the Market, different sites staying away from the usual attractions and lunch at a delightful local restaurant. Day two was an 8 hours tour. We drove out of the city, enjoyed the scenic countryside, visited a vineyard that included a cellar tour, wine tasting and lunch at the restaurant on site. When I was booking the tours I was nervous they might be too long however they were just right. All very enjoyable!These tours have left a very memorable experience of our time in Budapest. I would recommend this company to anyone visiting Hungary. They are reliable, efficient and can cater to your personal needs.Thank you.

Hungary. I never had a desire to go but I must say it is a must!! It was beautiful!! The stories the food the scenery was beautiful. The shopping was fun and so many unique items.Budapest was absolutely wonderful!

Fantastic experience. My friend and I signed up for 2 half-day tour with Orsolya to explore Budapest in mid-July and it was a great experience. Orsolya picked us up from our hotel and showed us her beautiful city, she speaks perfect English and her joyous and friendliness make the tour more interesting and entertaining. Orsolya really helps us to have a better understanding of the history and the culture of Budapest and Hungary. My friend and I really had a wonderful tour with Orsolya and highly recommend her to any visitors or tourists to Budapest.
Budapest . The 8 hour your was just fantastic. Orsolya made the tour so memorable that after few weeks my wife and I still talk about it. We highly recommend a tour with Orsolya.

Fantastic 8hr discovery of Buda and Pest. My wife and I were privileged to spend the day we had in Budapest (privately outside of the organised tour we were on) with guide Dora Mesei and driver Imre. In 8hrs, we covered a fair amount of the major attractions. Dora paced the day with ease, and was a literal encyclopaedia of the city (and Hungary for that matter) and its history and attractions.. Dora's English was excellent. Imre was unflappable as he chauffeured us from location to location. When we told the other people on our tour what we had done during the day, they were amazed as to how much we had achieved - and most were extremely envious. We have no hesitation in recommending both of them to any future visitors to Budapest

Terrific personal tour of Budapest. We had a four-hour tour on Friday, July 17 with Dora, a native of Budapest. She picked us up at the gangplank of our Viking River Cruise ship, the Ingvi. From there, we were taken by Dora and the driver in a Mercedes minivan to all the most important sights of Buda and Pest. Dora had us hop out at the best sites, talked to us about their history, and then we got to meander through parks, city streets, or attractions to another point, where the driver met us. All along, Dora gave us not only the history of her city but also her own personal perspective on it. Our time with her was simply wonderful.

Spectacular half day view of Budapest. How lucky we were to meet and have Adam as our guide for a morning walking/driving tour of Buda and Pest. He is not only knowledgeable but proud of his heritage which gives you a great insight into Budapest. He is charming in his manner and we counldn't have been happier with our tour. It was great having our driver (also lovely) drop us off and pick us up so we didn't have to walk up as many hills.This tour is a no brainer.

Our trip to Budapest. My husband and I spent 4 nights in Budapest. We were lucky to find Orsolya. She put together an itinerary to fit our schedule and were able to see a lot of Budapest and the surrounding area. She made it fun and was very knowledgable about the history of the city and country of Hungary. Next time we visit Budapest, we will definitely hire her again. We highly recommend her to anyone visiting the city.

6 days in Hungary. Orsolya helped us plan our 6 days in Hungary after we picked her company based on her Trip Advisor reviews. We had 25 days in Europe and all the planning paid off. Once there, it was effortless. Orsi took care of everything! She let us linger longer where we liked and recognized when we were ready to move on. She picked up on our interests quickly and focused our days so we got the most out of every one! We saw castles, basilicas, wineries, art shows, incredible views and meals. The driver was always at the right place at the right time in the new Mercedes van. At the end of the first day, you know you've made anew friend! She'll even make dinner reservations at unique incredible restaurants and drop you off at the end of a wonderful day.Take her advice, sit back, relax and experience Hungary through the eyes of a proud energetic native.

Private Tour of Budapest Gets Highest Marks! The Way to Go!. Having a private tour during my first visit to Budapest turned out to be a big plus. My guide, Melinda, was absolutely wonderful. I saw so much and gleaned much more insight about the city of Budapest in the four hours spent with Melinda than I could have ever managed on my own and by studying my guide book. Having a comfortable air-conditioned minivan and a lovely and kind driver ( who wore the neatest "artsy* necktie) added to the pleasurable day. This private tour in addition to another great tour I added with this private tour group gets the highest marks! I absolutely loved both tours! The way to go, that's for sure!

Budapest City Tour - private guide / car and driver. The guide Attila was fabulous. Very knowledgable and friendly. We enjoyed touring the city with him. He covered all the important sites in the short time we had..

Budapest in a day. My husband and I were only in Budapest for a day and we're lucky enough to have orsolya as our guide. We managed to see all the main sites. We wanted to have a massage and she stopped off at the spa to book for us plus made sure she ended the tour near the spa. Orsolya was entertaining and informative plus it never felt like she was just going through the motions or on a script like other tour guides. My husband said orsolya was our best tour guide ever!

Great last minute tour. Due to a flight cancelation we missed our scheduled Viking River Cruise tour of Budapest. Since I was determined to see the city before our ship sailed, I emailed Orsolya just before boarding our delayed flight from the US and about an hour after we landed in Budapest we had Juli waiting for us at our dock. She knew we had to play catch up since we only had 3-4 hours and she really came through. Bus tickets in hand she whisked us around the beautiful city of Budapest like a pro. She was lively, engaging, and full of the historical and cultural information that brings such a city to life. Hands down the best tour we had during two weeks in Europe!

Fantasic personalised tour. We had a full day tour with Juli. Prior to the tour we shared information about some family tree research we had done. Juli went out of her way to take this information on board. She brought us to some of the villages that my great and great-great grandparents were from and to the churches they were likely baptised at. I really can't express how amazing this tour was and how grateful we are to Juli for, really, the tour of a lifetime. Thank you Juli! :)

Two fantastic days touring Hungary. We booked two private tours and Orsolya made both days highlights of our European trip. The first day focused on wine tastings in Tokaj, we were entertained with information about the history of the region as well as amusing stories along the way. We visited two small wineries both with fantastic wines. We were able to have lunch at the second one and it was like having lunch with my grandma once again; true Eastern European hospitality and more food then you possibly could eat. It was a quiet ride back to Budapest as all were full and satisfied. The second day included a city tour of Eger and the village of Holloko and one more wine tasting with a traditional meal made in clay ovens. We were told it would be one of the best meals we would have in Hungary and it was. I have never had goose that was so tender and juicy. Orsolya herself is a great guide, perfect English, very knowledgable and patient with all of our quirky and diverse questions. We would highly recommend her if you looking for a relaxing way to get out of Budapest and see some of the countryside.

Barbara Lang-Szabo, private guide. My husband and I spent a half day touring Budapest with Barbara and found her absolutely fabulous. She and her driver gave us a comprehensive overview, provided in-depth information about the history of her country and the formation of Budapest? Her English is flawless she is delightful. Upon completion of our tour she gave us suggestions for everything from dining to navigating certain sights on our own.

MELINDA was Nothing Short of Truly Outstanding as a Guide!. Melinda was our guide for the entire day, 9:00 am till 5:00 pm. There were four of us, two couples from U.S. Melinda was truly outstanding. She possesses all the prerequisite skills; English language, knowledge of culture and history, outgoing and friendly personality and a very strong storytelling ability. We saw many sights that day but it went past quickly. Having a car with a driver was an extra bonus. This allowed us to move quickly from one site to another without delays and without time used to walk back to the Mercedes van. The driver was always able to drop us a the door and pick us up at the door. The price was less than $100 pp for the day

Wonderful half day tour of Budapest. We had the very best spin around Budapest with Adam. He was friendly, engaging, completely fluent in English and could answer just about any question we threw at him. It was nice to have a driver as well so we could be dropped off in one spot, walk and talk a bit, and then be picked back up. I would recommend Adam to anyone who wants to learn a lot about Budapest and Hungary in a short amount of time. He would be great for a longer visit as well.

Amazing Experience!. This was our first time booking with a personal tour guide and it was one of our best experiences! Juli met us at our hotel in Budapest very early so we could have a full day touring the countryside of Hungary before boarding our ship for our Danube River cruise. She took us to some amazing sights and allowed us to experience the local Hungarian culture just as we had asked! Our stops included tha quaint town of Veszprem, the ruin castle of Nagyvazsony, the castle of Sümeg, lunch in Badacsonytomaj, famous for the great wines and the amazing view over the lake Balaton, and finally a stop in Tihany, home of the Paprika House. Juli was exceptionally knowledgeable on the history and local culture of Hungary and her enthusiasm and great personality made the day quite enjoyable! We definitely recommend Travel Guide Hungary!

Budapest's Best Travel Guide. Orsolya was our guide for 3 days in Budapest. She was fantastic! She's knowledgeable, nice and lots of fun. We saw everything from the palace, to the Jewish quarter, to a farmer's market, to the Great Hall, the park and bathhouses, and she had fascinating information to share about everything. We loved our time with her and recommend her to anyone wanting a tour. You can't possibly find a better guide. She's wonderful!

Excellent guide service. My wife and I spent a few days in Budapest. Based on our experience in some other cities, we decided to take a four hour walking tour of the city. We used Travel Guide Hungary based on Trip Advisor reviews, and it was a good choice.Our guide, Judit, was superb. She showed us some of the major tourist spots, but also explained the country's history, especially the period from the Second World War to today. It was fascinating.Further, she took us to the Old Jewish Quarter, through some interesting artist spots, to one of the new "coffee culture " shops and some market areas.It was a day well spent, and we would recommend it to anyone.

Life Changing. In May we stayed in Budapest for 8 nights with another couple and were fortunate enough to have Travel Guide Hungary for 6 glorious days. Every moment was filled with excitement, fun, learning and exploring. I definitely recommend their Pecs tour! Every tour we did was amazing but that was my favorite. Hungary now has a deep place in my heart and I know that is because of the passion and dedication that Travel Guide Hungary has for its clients. God Bless Everyone at Travel Guide Hungary and I know that you will have many great years of service ahead!Lynn and John O’BrienMyrtle Beach, SC

First class experience. We booked a full day tour with Travel Guide Hungary. The guide Judi was knowledgeable, friendly and we had a wonderful day. She picked us up on time and went out of her way to see that we enjoyed the day - highly recommended
