PREFECT!!! Hungary A to Z. I stayed in Budapest with my husband & friends for our vacation & was fortunate enough to hire a private tour guide. I cannot express how wonderful our vacation was and it is all due to this company. We explored so much of Hungary from the city to Lake Balaton to Pecs to St. Andrews and the list goes on. We went to places we didn't know about, we ate with locals and tried delicious wines. We would have never done any of it without their help. They are professional AND fun to be with. We just got home 6 days ago & we already miss them!! Book with them...you will not be disappointed!!

Excellent, excellent, excellent. As we had visited Budapest back in 2011, we had already seen all the major sites so we wanted to visit the countryside. Thus we did the Danube Bend Tour which took us to Esztergom, Visegrad and Szentendre - all three beautiful villages and unique in their own special way.Our tour guide was Orsolya and she was amazing. Orsolya was very knowledgable, friendly, funny and spoke perfect English. She made us feel so comfortable that it actually felt we were in the company of a friend not a tour guide.Orsolya had so many stories to share, had several recommendations and always checked in with us.Must also make a mention of Miha, the driver. Really nice guy, very friendly and also had a wealth of knowledge.Highly recommend you do a tour with Orsolya in your first/second day in Budapest as you will get so many valuable tips and first class service.

Great half day private tour. Three of us had an excellent city tour with Judi. Judi had an excellent knowledge of the city and great temperament for our endless questions. The van was comfortable with a super friendly driver and the weather was brilliant. As such, couldn't have been a better day in Budapest. Would recommend this tour to anyone.

Budapest Private Guide. We met our tour guide Adam at our hotel. He did an amazing job of explaining the history of Budapest and the hungarian culture. He spent over 6 hours with us showing us the numerous historical buildings and sights of Budapest. I highly recommend using this company to not only learn about Budapest but to also gain an orientation of the city. I call it a must on your first visit.

Zsofi was amazing - highly recommend.. I recently went on a team building tour with my four colleagues to Budapest. We took a private tour guide to show us around the city. We were recommended to use private tours by a friend who lives in Hungary. Zsofi was incredible. She knows so much and made an educational experience so much fun. Well worth taking the 8 hour tour. Thank you Zsofi for a fantastic insight into Budapest.

Enjoyable tours from Budapest. Orsolya is easy-going and friendly. She is very informative about the places we visited and made sure we cover as much during the day trips.Thanks to her and driver Miha, we had a good time visiting the little historical towns of Esztergom, Szetendre, Visegrad with the marvellous view of the Danube Bend and also the serene Lake Balaton & wineries at Balatonfured.We felt like we were travelling with old friends more than anything else.Highly recommended.

Great tour, great guide !. I booked the 4 hour walking tour of Budapest after reading the excellent reviews of Travel Guide Hungary on TripAdvisor. We were two couples visiting the city for a weekend at the end of April. It was our first time in Budapest so we wanted to get a good sense of the city, learn a little of its history and maybe get some tips about things to see during the remainder of the weekend. The organisation was done by e-mail and Orsolya who arranged our tour was very responsive and helpful. Dora, our guide on the day, has a lovely, relaxed manner and is very easy to talk to. She is from Budapest and is extremely knowledgeable about her home city. We found the tour both informative and fun and we liked that Dora invited us to choose between options on the itinerary. She also gave us some good suggestions of other sights to visit and a scenic route back to our hotel from where the tour ended at Fisherman’s Bastion.All in all, we would be very happy to recommend Travel Guide Hungary and Dora to our friends and TripAdvisor readers.

One of the Best Tours of a European City!. Orsolya's enthusiastic and informed tour of Budapest made our visit wonderful. She customized a tour to our interests and we couldn't have been happier. She helped us with transportation, restaraunt reservations and palace tour required E tickets. She even arranged for a private small speed boat ride on the Danube. Budapest is a European Gem and Orsolya is one of the best guides in Europe.

Best way to start your trip!. Orsolya was a fabulous tour guide for our group of 6. She picked us up promptly at our hotel and provided transportation throughout the day. She started on the Pest side of the Danube so the rising sun hit the Buda side for excellent views and photo ops. Similarly, we finished on the Buda side at the Fisherman's Bastion with incredible views of Pest. Orsy gives a good first day overview of Budapest, and made the city seem accessible. She provided invaluable history and information as we toured the city that you just can't get from a guide book. She also had helpful logistic suggestions for the rest of our stay. She is knowledgeable, friendly, and pleasure to tour with. The price was absolutely appropriate for the experience!

Informative & Interesting - gets your cuty visit off to a great start. I'm a great fan of guided tours, especially at the start of any visit as it adds so much value to the rest of your stay as you go back and explore things in greater depth. I thought that our tour with Orsi was up there with the very best. we saw many things that a casual visitor would have walked on by and her enthusiasm for her city is very apparent. It was also very noticeable that there were no set routines or time limits on the tour and it is tailored completely to the clients.Well done to Orsi and wholeheartedly recommended to others visiting Budapest.

Great tour for the whole family. Orsolya was already booked for our day and so we were placed with Attila. He was such a pleasure! We did an 8 hour tour -- half car/half walking. I really feel like we got to see a lot of the city. Attila was very knowledgeable and dynamic and we especially enjoyed his commentary on the architecture of the city. We had our three children with us (8,11,14) and he was careful to keep them entertained. The finishing touch was that he completely checked us in the Szechenyi Spa which was a relief after a long day of touring.

Great value.. We had booked a private four hour walking tour with Orsolya but this was extended considerably (at no extra cost) because we enjoyed her company and enthusiasm so much. In fact, we couldn't have asked for a better introduction to Budapest and found that all the information gave us a really helpful grounding for the rest of our stay in this splendid city. Orsolya is extremely friendly, good-humoured and considerate and, of course, has a vast knowledge of her country. Very good indeed.

Tour of Budapest and Danube Bend. We had a great time. Did 2 tours; one with Zsofi on a four hour tour of Budapest and the other with Julia on the eight hour tour of Danube Bend. Both guides were knowledgable and accommodating. We had a seven year old son with us and even he enjoyed. They entertained him with stories of the Hungarian national heroes and fun facts and we were pleased with the driver George who tried to make our eight hour trip comfortable. Thanks Zsofi, Julia and George - we had the most enjoyable and informative tour because of you.

Great tour of budapest!!. Last month a group of friends took a half day walking tour with Orsolya and we thoroughly enjoyed her tour! She was very informative and was really helpful with pointing out dinner places and coffee shops along the way. She helped us hit the highlights around town and we learned about the culture of budapest. I would definitely use her tour guidance again!!

Our very first and impressive visit to Hungary. During our long trip to southern France, Switzerland and Austria, our group of 6 friends (mid-60's) decided in last minute to extend our trip,our first time, to Budapest for 4 nights&days. We found Orsolya in the internet and decided to book her for our private tour guide. It was absolutely fantastic to have her with us all 4 days with private van and driver, the best driver we ever have. Orsi and her friends Eszter took very good care of us just like family, we got whatever we asked for and enjoy her full historic and cultural knowledge of every places we visited. With Orsi and Eszter, we visited Danube Bend, Castle Hills,Benedictine church, lake Balaton,Visegrad Citadel, Herend porcelain factory, Buda Castle, Jewish quarter,Szentendre town, Szechenyi Baths, Ruin Pubs, etc. Even took an evening private boat ride along Danube watching the parliament and places by night, watching cultural folk shows..enjoy Hungarian food like Chicken paprika, Hungarian Goulash and many other local recipes. Everything we experienced with her were wonderful and fabulous..We highly recommend anyone visiting Budapest-Hungary to have her as your guide...personally we wish to welcome her and her friend as our family guest if she would travel to Thailand. This short trip was one of excellent and unforgettable experience to have lovely Orsi and Eszter as our private guides. (a bit late review though, but impressive one)

Ten out of Ten - the best!. What a great day, the best one in Budapest was with our guide Orsolya! As a meeting planner who has hired guides and vehicles globally both for groups and for private clients for more than 20 years - I can say with confidence that - Orsolya ranks in the 99.9 percentile - she is EXCELLENT. You will leave Budapest with more knowledge, an interesting unique experience and the feeling that you have met a new friend - you cannot go wrong. We were surprised not only with her service but also our driver for the day - all in all TOP NOTCH! We even visited my mom's house which was first occupied by the Germans in WW II followed by the Russians - Orsolya rang the door and convinced the reticent owner to let us into the house, that was a personal highlight and above and beyond our expectations. We explored Budapest's highlights with Orsolya who made it all accessible, interesting and just plain fun - we LOVED it and will never forget this tour. Thank you Orsolya - ( my 15 year old niece was with me and she was spell bound)

Spellbinding!. Fabulous tour guide and tour! It was my privilege to have a private guided tour with Adam today. I am still talking about it eight hours later! This young man is incredibly knowledgeable about his Budapest and his anecdotal and personal connections to the areas we visited that held me spellbound for four hours. I feel that I know so much about the people of Budapest, their struggle and immense courage! This emotional journey transcended historical and geographical boundaries of learning for me. As a Humanities teacher in the US, I am now inspired to teach the story behind the story of this city!Definitely the best tour and tour guide I have experienced and I have been on many!Látogatás dátuma: 2015 márciusában

Fantastic Guide!. Orsolya did a fantastic job as my guide in Budapest. I took three tours, including the evening tour of Budapest with a river cruise, a full day driving tour of the city, and a 1/2 day walking tour of some of the other neat parts of Budapest. The evening tour was amazing. We visited a number of cultural attractions, but also dug into some of the hidden corners of the city, including some of the popular "ruin bars" and a cool microbrew venue. The highlight was the river cruise, with buildings on both sides of the city lit up magnificently. Orsolya was unavailable for the driving tour, but set me up with another fabulous guide and a driver who did a great job showing me sights all over the city. The walking tour with Orsolya was also wonderful, and we incorporated some public transportation to explore some distant nooks and crannies of the city.Orsolya is both very personable and very knowledgeable about the culture and history of Hungary and Budapest. She treated the tour like a conversation among friends, and was very responsive to my particular interests. I had a great experience, and would highly recommend her to anyone that would like to explore and experience Hungary and Budapest.

Best part of our trip!. We just visited Budapest for the first time. We arranged a 4-hour tour of Budapest on our first day. We were able to fully customize what we wanted to see and how we wanted to tour (walking, driving). Andi picked us up at our hotel with a driver. We toured the Pest side, followed by the Buda side. Our driver took us to an area, we explored on foot, and were picked up on the other side. This allowed us to conveniently cover a lot in a short amount of time. Andi was impressive with her history and immense knowledge which made this a wonderful experience rather than just sightseeing. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting -- it was so worthwhile!

Best Kept Secret in Budapest. I will always recommend Anita as a private tour in Budapest for anyone travelling there. Hands down the best way to see as much of the city as possible and truly get a locals experience. Don't miss the Central Market!

Fantastic Private Tour!!. Orsolya (Orsi) took my group all around Budapest over a period of two days. She was courteous and professional. Orsi was extremely flexible and knowledgeable, showing us all of the major sights over the period we had available. She made our experience wonderful! When I return to Budapest, I plan to use Orsi to take us around in greater depth. You cannot go wrong if you choose to book a tour with Orsi!!

Fantastic Taste of Budapest. While in Budapest for several days, we spent half a day with Orsi on a culinary tour. She was great! After meeting us at our hotel, we walked down Buda and across the Chain Bridge while Orsi gave us a history of the area. After plunging into Pest, we spent the next five hours partaking of coffee houses, chocolate shops, a regional food shop, as well as lunch in the Central Market where Orsi bought a variety of food items and shared with us how they are eaten throughout Hungary.Orsi took great pains to answer our questions and take us to well-known attractions as well as hidden gems. If you’re interested in the food of Budapest, then you can’t go wrong hiring Orsi. It’s well worth the time and expense to get an expert and local take on the region.

Perfect guide for Budapest!. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Orsolya in January 2015. We spent 2 days with her, one day by foot and the second by car (for Buda). She conveniently picked us up from our hotel each morning and was very accommodating at every point of our journey. We hit all the major sights and learned a lot in such a short amount of time. We would have never been able to cover Budapest on our own with such efficiency so we are very thankful we booked with Orsolya! She is a very kind, intelligent, and humorous person who is such a joy to spend time with. Thank you so much Orsolya!Book her, you can't possibly regret it!

Excellent tour. This was by far the best tour we have ever experienced. Orsolya was engaging, has expert command of her history and knowledge of sites visited and has a great personality. She was flexible and tailored her tour to meet our requests. She is extremely fluent in English along with a great sense of humor. We couldn't have been more pleased.

Grand City Tour with Orsolya. Great overview of Budapest with Orsolya, a friendly and knowledgable guide who tailored our full-day tour according to our wishes. We visited the largest thermal bath in central Europe, the Széchenyi Bath and came back by ourselves the next morning. Orsolya also brought us shopping at various stores and the market hall before viewing significant sights around the city. She also gave us an excellent hole-in-the-wall restaurant recommendation where we ended our tour. We were very satisfied and will definitely look "Orsy" up when (not if) we come back to Budapest.

Perfect way to see the city . We have come to Budapest in low season however I was still amazed to be able to book in last minute with Orsolya to show us round the city. I cannot recommend Orsolya enough, she is friendly, informative, tailoring each tour to your individual needs! We took the half walking and half driving tour and saw all the parts of the city we wanted and more! If you have struggled to locate the little gems of the city then Orsolya can uncover them for you! If you are looking for a private tour this is the one to choose!!

Great day in beautiful Budapest. Thank you Orsolya for showing us your beautiful city.We enjoyed both the tour and your company so much we could not recommend it highly enough to other travelers. Definitely the best way to introduce yourself to this grand and historic city and Orsolya you are a wonderful ambassador for Hungary.

Arranged Private tour through travelguidehungary.com was fantanstic. A few months before arriving in Budapest for a Viking tour we wanted to arrange for a private tour for our small group (5 adults). We were very impressed with this tour operator and their understanding of NON-Viking tour areas. Through just a couple of emails we developed a half day tour agenda that was wonderful. ANITA was our individual guide and we would highly recommend her to any group. She was easy going, happy to accommodate our interests in each location and adjusted to our pace with a couple of minor suggestions during the tour. Her English is excellent, and as a resident provided a very nice local flavor and background to everything we saw. Her driver was very accommodating as we had a nice 8 passenger van so able to drop and pick up close to each location. While in the Central Market ANITA arranged a small sampling of local meats, and a typical sweet cooking popular in Budapest. GREAT TOUR!

Terrific guide!. Anita was our guide for 3 days in Budapest during the winter holidays. She was knowledgeable, flexible, responded to our needs and was sensitive to the various ages of the members (9) of our family. She personalized our tours and made our Budapest visit most enjoyable. All booking was done through Orsi - everything went smoothly and all fees were stated up-front.

Get grounded in Budapest. Orsy was fabulous. She spent 8 hours with us and her knowledge of ancient and current history was impressive. A lovely and intelligent young woman with broad experience and great personality. She has a subtle sense of humor and separates fact from legend while giving you a tremendous history lesson. Together we covered much of the charming city of Budapest and left us wanting to come back----and see Orsy of course. Her restaurant recommendations worked out really well and we are grateful for the wine bar she suggested--wonderful Hungarian wine selection.She is doing wine tours which we will try next! Spend your first day with Orsy and then decide what to do next--she will help you!

Don't Hesitate; Book a Tour with Orsi. Our group of four booked the Tastes of Budapest tour with Orsi prior to our Christmas Markets cruise. Despite residual jet lag, we quickly warmed to Orsi's vibrant personality. She took us to the covered market, a shop specializing in the delicacies of Lake Baloton, a chocolate store for a tasting, one of the oldest cafés in Budapest for a cappuccino and a rest, a butcher shop which serves lunch (unfortunately we were too late and had snacked enough along the way anyway), and a wine bar for a wine tasting. Those were places we visited, and enjoyed, but what made the day special was Orsi herself. She patiently answered questions, adjusted well to the pace of our slowest group member, and always told us what she planned next to make sure that was also what we wanted to do. She spent more than a full day with us and at the end, she booked a table for us at a very small bistro near the U.S. Embassy that featured the pork knuckle dinner my wife was craving. The thing about touring with Orsi is that you start the day making the acquaintance of a stranger but end the day regrettably saying farewell to a friend whom you hope to see again very soon. Thanks so much, Orsi. Until next time,Dennis, Trudy, Margaret, and Alexandra

Best Way to See the Real Budapest. If you are not using Orsi and Travel Guide Hungary you are only skimming Budapest. Orsi is amazing and will show you places in Budapest you won't see on other tours. The day of our tour it was raining much of the day but it was an incredible day and didn't deter Orsi from giving us an amazing day. She took us to places we would have never found on our own like a bustling farmers/craft food market with a young, urban vibe in an old and hidden building. It was well worth it to be able to just stop and ask Orsi about something we saw and that resulting in her taking us somewhere unexpected. The day prior we looked for hours trying to find a bookstore and coffee house on the Andrassy and Orsi knew it well and we shared a wonderful coffee with her just chatting. The value you get from this company is well worth it, you can't get this experience with a large tour group. We loved our day with Orsi and look forward to returning for more exploring with this great company!

Best way to see Budapest. We loved our tour with Anita from Hungary-Private Tours! She split our tour into two 4 hour sessions on consecutive days. The first day was with a driver and the second day was via public transportation. We saw all the sights we asked for and much more! Anita is knowledgeable, professional and fun to be with. She showed us places effortlessly that we would still be hunting for. At the Opera House she helped us purchase tickets! She helped us shop at the market. We loved the Ruined Bars. I am still dreaming of Szechenyi Baths.

Secrets of Budapest Tour with Orsolya. On our recent visit to Budapest (November 2014), my mom, husband, sister and I booked a half-day private walking tour with Orsolya from Travel Guide Hungary. We couldn't have been more pleased with our tour. We were spending several days in Budapest before boarding a Viking River Cruise, and we wanted to see some sights that were off the beaten track and wouldn't be included in the standard tour we would get with Viking. Orsolya was able to tailor our route accordingly, and we feel like we saw things that we otherwise would never have even noticed. She was even able to take us inside the Ervin Szabo Library, which was stunning. During the course of our tour, she also suggested places we could visit on our own later in they day, and all of her suggestions ended up being spot on. I highly recommend taking a tour with Orsolya. Our only regret is that we didn't have more time in Budapest, as we would have loved to take one of her tours out into the countryside. Budapest was by far our favorite of all the places we visited along the Danube!

What a difference a private guide makes!. Just returned from a fabulous Viking River Cruise. Kudos to Viking for a good general overview tour of Budapest but we felt we wanted to really experience Budapest. Anita with Hungary-Private Tours made our visit so much more memorable. She was timely, professional and really went the extra mile to make sure our group really experienced Budapest! We took the full 8 hour Budapest Explorer tour. She was so nice to accomodate us with splitting the tour into two 4 hour tours over two days. We were afraid an extended 8 hour tour might be a little too taxing for us. She took us to so many special places that we would never have found by ourselves and definitely not in an 8 hour time period. She took us to the market and ordered many things for us to sample authentic hungarian foods, became our personal shopping assistant, schooled us in Jewish history and walked with us as we visited ruin bars and visited historic bath houses. For a close up and personal tour don't hesitate to spend a little extra and make memories that will last a life time!

Excellent Time in Budapest. We booked the full day city tour with Orsolya after our river cruise ended. We arranged everything online & we had 12 couples plus luggage & she gave a great tour of the city. We covered both the Pest & Buda sides. It is a beautiful city especially when some one like Orsolya is showing you the sights.

Wonderful Tours!. We booked 3 tours with Orsolya for our first visit to Budapest in September. She was very nice to work with on-line and arranged for Dora to meet us in the lobby of our hotel for the first walking tour of the city. Dora was an excellent guide. She has great knowledge of the city and its history, and really enjoys her job. That night we were supposed to meet again for a city lights tour which included a ride down the Danube by boat, but my husband wasn't feeling well enough to do the entire tour. So Orsolya was very flexible and understanding about the change in plan, and instead reserved 2 tickets on the boat for us so we could have that experience. It was beautiful to see the city at night from the river. Our third tour was the next afternoon with Orsolya. She met us in the lobby for our Jewish Heritage walking tour. It was wonderful! She is a delight and we learned so much about the history and the people of Budapest. Thank you Orsie!!

Excellent Tours. We visited Budapest recently and booked a half day tour of the city and a full day tour of the Danube bend. They were both excellent - very efficient and very interesting. Orsi and Adam were a delight to be with. well informed, courteous and flexible iwith what and how we toured. I couldn't recommend Travel Guide Hungary highly enough. We shall be going back to Budapest....Many thanks.

Enjoying the Danube Bend outside Budapest. We had several days in Budapest before a river cruise and decided to take one day to see what the countryside outside the city was like. There were 5 of us and we contacted Orsi about a private tour. She answered promptly and confirmed our tour. Since there were 5 of us, the cost per person was very reasonable. She was unable to do the tour but suggested another of her guides, Juliana. Juliana met us at our hotel with a van and driver and we spent a glorious day exploring the Danube Bend. When our whole cruise was over, everyone agreed that our day with Juliana was the highlight of our trip. Why?Juliana gradually (and painlessly!) taught us a huge history lesson over the day that gave us a context and understanding for the country of Hungary and its people. On our way out of the city we passed Roman era ruins under and around modern freeways and next to Communist Era apartment blocks. We heard about events and then found ourselves standing where they occurred. We stood in a municipal park overlooking the spectacular Danube Bend and understood why this part of Europe was so attractive to invaders. (Later in the week, it was fun to sail by the same spot on our cruise and point out where we had been.) We were willing to climb the 400+ stairs to the top of the largest cathedral in Hungary in Esztergom and look out at Slovakia and travel to it across the river to Slovakia, giving thanks for the open borders of the European Union. We had lunch in a lovely local restaurant outside the ruins of a medieval castle in Visegrad, with Juliana giving us guidance on Hungarian cuisine. Finally, we walked through the artists colony in Szentendre and found local craftspeople and a charming village. Although this sounds like a lot of travel, it did not seem that way since Juliana had us organized but at the same time she asked what we were interested in and adjusted accordingly. For example since we wanted to climb the cathedral stairs, we spent more time there than at other stops. Overall, we would do a bit of driving, then stop, do some walking and then have time to relax. We felt that we had a full but relaxing day when we got back to our hotel that afternoon. We also were able to travel the countryside with a native, who answered all our questions and observations and translated the language so we could focus on learning and enjoying. At the end of the day, Juliana gave us recommendations about what else to see in the city and good restaurants. We thank her for her advice to get a tour of Parliament - it was not what we would have thought to do but we were lucky to get tickets and have that experience!Although we had good tours on our cruise, by necessity, they were with more people, with less chance to adjust if something interested you. We all felt that our time with Juliana gave us a more personal and memorable experience of Hungary. If your group has a day in Budapest, I would highly recommend a private tour with Juliana and TravelGuideHungary.

Andi is one in a million!. Thank you Andi for being the highlight of our time in Budapest! We got to visit local artists (one even in her own home) and had a great side trip to Szentendre which had lots of shops open on the national holiday (10/23). Andi was incredibly open and informative - we felt like we were chatting with a dear friend. Her driver was a lovely gentleman who clearly had a great sense of humor despite our language limitations. Mission Luggage was accomplished! Ask for Andi - you won't be disappointed.

One amazing trip!. I would like to highly recommend our travel guide, Orsolya. From the time I contacted her she was very prompt about getting back to us. She listened to what we wanted to do and all of her suggestions were highlights of our trip. Orsolya provided us with a driver to and from the airport to our hotel. We loved the sights of Budapest and have listed it as one of our all time favorite places that we visited. Orsolya was very knowledgeable and made our time with her fun. She is a delight and the four of us feel that we have now made a lifetime friend. If you plan on visiting Budapest please ask for Orsolya to be your tour guide. You will not be disappointed!! Rosemary

Best Trip Ever. Anita Barta was recommended to us by a guide company in another city. SERIOUSLY, if you want to get the most out of your travels and see Budapest in the most comprehensive manner, chose Anita. She was on time, dedicated, authentic, informative, and engaging. We loved our trip, and Budapest, because of her! Please, look no further, we hired other guides in other cities and they were great, but Anita was amazing. She was flexible, but covered everything about the city we wanted and much more. We learned so much about the city and country, from culture to food and economics, politics, religion...

Great tour!!. I am very late writing this review, but it should not reflect on the tour. Anita was awesome! She took me all over Budapest, showing me all sorts of wonderful things and taking me to fun places to eat. I saw so much, it is hard to describe how much I enjoyed my day. I wanted to shop, but did not want to use up valuable tour time, so she gave me great advice on where to go for linens, spices and other things I was interested in. I love to cook and wanted to get a cookbook,as it turns out,she is also a chef, and knew exactly what book I would get the most out of. If you are looking for a fun, informative day,book this tour!

Great group for private tours. Our guide (Anita) and driver picked us up at hotel and, in 8 hours, we saw all the top sites in Budapest. The guide was highly knowledgeable and entertaining, and more than happy to modify the tour to accommodate any request. We have taken tours in many major cities, and this is one of the best. Very enjoyable way to spend the day, and a good overview to go back and explore sites of interest on your own on the remaining days of your holiday.

Excellent choice - highly recommended!. We decided to splurge and arrange private tours for the Budapest and Prague portions of our two-week trip to Europe. It was a matter of not having enough time to plan our own touring and wanting to try something different. We wrote Orsolya and she was very responsive and based on my e-mail she recommended two half-day tours, one overview tour and one Jewish tour. We took each tour on separate days and it worked out perfectly for us. Our guide Anita was friendly, knowledgeable, engaging and simply a delightful person to spend time with. She was flexible to our interests and even worked with us to track down the apartment my parents lived in almost 50 years ago! The only minor hitch was that our Jewish tour was a bit limited because the synagogues were closed to tourists due to the Sukkot holiday period but Anita compensated in other areas. Private tours are a relatively pricey way to go but in this case it was worth every penny.

Budapest tours. Orsi is a GREAT guide.She made our visit to Budapest the highlight of our Danube River cruise.The evening walking tour of Pest following a boat tour was fabulous. An all day tour of the countryside on the following day was excellent.Orsi adjusted to our itinerary changes with ease and she obviously loved what she was doing.Our party consisted of old and young adults and Orsi made all of us happy.

Evening tour with private boat ride followed by Danube bend tour. After researching private tours and reading other reviews I am so glad that Orsolya was our choice! I echo all other reviews. We needed a english speaking guide as we were on a cruise that only offered excursions in German. That turned out to be a unforeseen positive as Orsi provided a much better tour option!!We had a group of 7 on a family trip and reached out to Orsolya to help us with a private tour. She replied with extremely flexible options and very reasonable prices that met our needs. On the evening tour Orsi found out we had only a short time in Budapest before meeting her. She quickly modified the following days tour to include a quick trip in town before the bend tour. She was very considerate and flexible to assure we had a great experience. The van and driver rented for the bend tour was comfortable and well sized for our group.We were on a river cruise and she was able to accommodate the boats schedule and change of ports. Orsi was a wealth of knowledge and showed us many parts of the area we would have never seen without her. It was a great addition to our trip and I found myself missing the insight she provided when we were on the rest of our trip. The flexibility allowed for un stressful and fulfilling experience!To conclude if you want a truly private tour that is fully customized to your needs select Travel Guide Hungary you will not be disappointed!!

Best private guide tour!!. This September we visit London, Budapest, Prague, Amsterdam and Brussels. We hired a private guide tour in every city we visit and we found this were the best. Andrea was indeed very knowledgeable and made us feel quite comfortable. She tailored the tour to our particular interests and gave us not just the basics of their culture but also many stories and details that a regular tour guide won't mention. I would definitely recommend this private guides!

Very informative and relaxing tours of Budapest.. My husband and I booked two full day tours with Travel Guide Hungary. We toured Budapest the first day with Adam and a driver. He was very interesting and did a great job of hitting all the highlights of the town. The second day we took a tour of the three towns on the Danube bend with Orsolya and a driver and thoroughly enjoyed it. The towns were charming and Orsi and the driver did a wonderful job of explaining the history and nuances of each place. We would highly recommend Travel Guide Hungary for tours.

Orsi is Awesome!. Four of us took a private half day walking tour with Orsi (Orsolya) on our second day in Budapest. She met us at our hotel in the morning then customized our tour on the spot after hearing where we had already been and what we had aleady seen. She had great recommendations. Orsi was extremely knowledgeable and very enthusiastic to tell us everything she knew about the sights. She also had some interesting stories to tell. I would highly recommend Orsi to anyone looking to explore Budapest in a small group setting. She is also alot of fun to have a cup of coffee with!

See Budapest with this company!. After booking our tours based on Trip Advisor ratings, I wanted to add my own "thumbs up" to this company! I emailed back and forth with Orsolya, and while she personally was not available (which she told me in advance), she set us up with Zsofi, who was fabulous... Knowledgeable, professional, enthusiastic, and just plain adorable! We learned so much while totally enjoying our time in this beautiful city. Thank you Orsolya and Zsofi!

Walking tour of Budapest. Orsolya met us at our hotel on 9-15-14 which I had arranged via email a few weeks earlier. We were able to customize our tour as we had already been to a number of places with our Viking tour. We started at the Opera House and she was able to get us in before the big tour groups which was great. The next four hours we walked thru Pest, over the chain bridge and up to Buda Castle. She is very knowledgeable, funny and we had a great time with her as our private guide. I would highly recommend her and the next time we get to Budapest, we plan on taking the wine tour. She recommended a nice white wine and we had it had dinner that evening. What a treat!

Orsolya is fantastic!. We had the pleasure of spending a day of sightseeing with Orsolya (Orsi), and it was really great! Orsi is a very knowledgeable and entusiastic guide, and she made a really good trip for us where we seamlessly switched between bus, walking and boating. Orsi loves her city, and we strongly recommend her to anyone gong to Budapest!

Anita Barta conducted a refreshing tour of Budapest!. Not familiar with the Tour Guide situation in Budapest, we relied on views contained in Trip Advisor. It was a good way to go!Our good fortune was that Anita was assigned to our group of 4. Arriving at the appointed time instilled some confidence, and after a brief tour of Heroes Square she instinctively zeroed into our interest in multiculturalism which is uniquely Hungarian after centuries of foreign influence, be it Mongolian, Ottoman, Greek, Roman or Austrian, which is not dissimilar to the mixed culture existent in our part of the world.Expecting a standard recitation, we were instead pleasantly surprised by her diving into a more personal insight of Buda and Pest, ranging from religious significances to gastronomic delights.For the latter, we were guided to a strudel shop located in a lane near Matthew's Church in the hills of Buda. The treat was repeated next morning in a quiet lane in Szentendre when she nudged the grumpy owner to open her pancake shop as it was already past the advertised opening time. Our taste buds gratefully attested to her persistent effort.I will not hesitate recommending Anita to be your personal travel guide for Budapest...

Well done!. We took a tour yesterday with this company. On very short notice, Orsolya was able to link us with Dora to guide us--what luck! Dora showed up in our hotel lobby promptly to collect my husband and me for our four-hour driving and walking tour. A charming and capable chauffeur, Imre (whose name I know I must be misspelling), and a lovely air conditioned van were waiting for us. Dora has a perfect combination of skills for guiding: a sensitivity to client interests plus a great passion for Budapest and general history! We loved talking with her about the original settlement of this area, the Huns, Magyars, Romans, and so on. In fact, Dora was well-informed and interested in a great variety of topics, which made for a very engaging time with her. We walked in some lovely parks, visited a huge historic bathhouse, and saw beautiful Danube vistas everywhere. A highlight for me was visiting the Cave Church, once a monastery, tucked away on a hillside. We entered to hear singing from deep within--a mass was being held--and that was a sort of magic. Dora also offered suggestions for lovely restaurants as well as other places we might like to visit. It is a testimony to Dora's skills that she was able to keep us entertained and and energized on our day of arrival after a very long overnight flight! We had a perfect time. Five stars for Dora!

Ten star, Andras Illes, superb tour guide. On 7.1.2014, Andras Illes, 'Andrew' picked us up at our hotel promptly at 9.30.am, as arranged via email. His beautiful and immaculate Citroen was a pleasure to be in. I had never had a private tour guide before and I was dazzled. He was intelligent, charming, knowledgable about local and global history. He began right away, describing where we were, the history of the place, with a focus on art and Jewish sights.We spent 7 hours with him. He showed us all the highlights of Budapest. He made it so easy for us re the rockstar parking spots. He fully described, charmingly and interestingly the beautiful city. There was an emphasis on Jewish history in the region and we didn't miss a thing. There were, surprisingly to me, a lot of Jewish places of interest. Best of all, he found the house my mother lived in. She immigrated to the us in 1921 at age 8. I had given him the address which I found on the ship's manifest and the apartment building was still standing and occupied, subsidized by the government for low income people. Andrew was perfect and delightful to be with and learn from. He spoke English well and speaks a number of languages. Love him.

Orsolya & Miha were wonderful………. We had the pleasure to spend our 3 days in Budapest with Orsolya as our tour guide and Miha as our driver. We could not have made a better choice. This was our first trip to Budapest and they could not have made it more enjoyable. Orsolya arranged for Miha to pick us up at the airport and to be our driver for our tours with her. When we arrived in Budapest Miha was waiting for us at the airport with a sign with our name on it. On the way to our hotel he pointed out sights we would not see in our tours and told us interesting facts as he drove. That afternoon Orsolya met us at our hotel and took us on a half day tour of Budapest. She was very knowledge on her country's history and had wonderful stories to tell as she showed us around Budapest. We were taking a river cruise from Budapest so Orsolya made sure she took us to places we would not see with the river cruise tour. On day 2 we took the Danube Bend tour to visit historical towns and see the countryside. Again the day with Orsalya and Miha was throughly enjoyable. On day three we boarded our ship early and spent a half day touring the city by car rather than just sitting around the boat. It was a great way to make the most of our short stay. We would highly recommend Orsolya as a tour guide and to help you plan your trip to Budapest. Her tours are interesting and fun.

Orsolya is FANTASTIC. My group of ten people did an evening and daytime tour with Orsolya in August. She arranged a mini bus for us to use for part of the tour. Also she arranged a beautiful nighttime tour finding the perfect restaurant and to top it off a boat ride to see Budapest at night. She is a great tour guide and knows her information.

Absolutely loved these tours!. My first ever trip to Budapest was made very special by two tours my friend booked with Eszter who met us at our hotel. Our first was a half day walking tour of Budapest, where we saw many sights that got us acquainted with the city and its rich history. We were able to fit in Matthias Church, St. Stephen's Basilica, Buda Castle, Heroes' Square, the Parliament Building, a ride down the funicular, and much, much more. Eszter really knows the history of her homeland and her love and pride in it shows through. She was absolutely delightful and I came home wanting to read and learn more about Budapest's past. She is also very well acquainted with the transportation systems and made it "look" easy. If we had more time there maybe I could have figured it out as well!Our second tour with Eszter was a full day trip outside of Budapest to Esztergom, Szentendre and Visegrad on the Danube Bend. Breathtaking views! Eszter treated us to a surprise (which I won't spoil) that made my day! I loved each stop - the Basilica in Esztergom; lunch overlooking the Danube River with a view of the Citadel in Visegrad and shopping in the lovely town of Szentendre. I could have spent another week travelling around with Eszter seeing and hearing more about her amazing city and countryside.

Danube Cruise and Ruin Bar Tour. In mid-July 2014 me and my family, consisting of my wife and two kids and mother did a evening tour with Orsolya. She met us at our hotel on time and we began our tour by first walking through some notable sections of Budapest. They included visiting Liszt Ferenc Square followed by walking through the Jewish section. We made our way to the Danube where we took a river cruise that passed the Parliament building. The cruise was absolutely wonderful as it was in the evening and the Parliament was lit up as well as the bridges that we passed. The Parliament at night is absolutely breathtaking as is Budapest as a whole. During the cruise, Orsolya provided commentary and interesting facts. She is very easy going and quite bubbly. After the cruise we visited the ruin bar, Szimpla, where we all had some beer. It is a fun, funky atmosphere and the kids loved it. On our way back to the hotel Orsolya recommended we stop at one of the street vendors where we purchased delicious hot dogs and a couple of drinks. If I go back to Budapest, I would not hesitate to seek her out again. Orsi, thanks for a great evening

Highly recommend!. Orsolya and her team were exceptional and made our tip to Budapest (and transfer to Vienna) very special. Zsofi (our guide for two half days) was extremely knowledgeable and fun to be with. Helped us understand Budapest's (and Hungary's) past, present and future. Miha provided our transfer to Vienna (with stops along the way) and was a pure delight. Everything was handled efficiently and professionally - the best.

Falling in love with Budapest!. Cities can be beautiful but a great guide makes you fall in love with it! Cant thank Adam and Eszter enough for two memorable walking tours exploring Budapest. The sights are wonderful and if jewish heritage is your thing, be prepared for a treat. Köszönöm (hungarian for thank you!)

Wonderful Tour; Adam was excellent. Adam was our guide for this tour. He was excellent - very knowledgeable about all things Hungary! Adam also regaled us with fascinating stories, including quite a few personal ones. We got to know him well on this tour too. He mentioned that this job as a tour guide is a passion of his and this came through very clearly - we could see that he certainly loves what he does. We learned a lot on this tour and it was an absolute pleasure being shown around by Adam. Also, we were driven around in a luxurious sedan for this tour - it was nice going around in style and comfort!

City Tour at it's Best!. Our entire experience of planning our visit with Orsolya and touring with our guide, Anita, was delightful in every way. Orsolya arranged a city tour, complete with a van and driver for our group of six. Later, we enjoyed a private boat ride she arranged on the Danube for an evening view of the city ~ basking in its glow. Anita was perfectly delightful, making every effort to give us extra samplings of the city she loves. Thank you Orsolya and Anita for making Budapest a beautiful memory!

Budapest, Hungary. Orsolya was fantastic! Although she was not available for our tours, one of the other guides was for both our walking tours. Anita, our guide, was very well prepared and was excellent! Orsolya was also extremely helpful for other parts of our trip as well. She was able to arrange a van for our family to get to and from Lake Balaton and gave suggestions on what to do while we were there. I highly recommend Orsolya and Anita!

Wonderful Day with Zsofi. My wife and I hired their guide Zsofi for a half-day morning walking tour of Pest, and a half-day chauffeured tour of the Buda (hilly) side in the afternoon. Zsofi met us at our hotel near the Opera House and we discussed what we wanted to see and we took off. Learned a tremendous amount about Hungary and Budapest, and learned about the huge transformations they have gone through in the last hundred years or so (Empire, Democracy, Nazi state, Communism, and finally the modern Democracy they enjoy today. Zsofi is a very personable guide with perfect English language skills. In the afternoon when it started to get quite hot out, we were picked up by a nicely air-conditioned modern car and driver. Zsofi did a superior job and was just what we needed. Our Budapest experience would have been much less enjoyable without her. Highly recommended.

Good tour!. I contacted Orsolya several months in advance but she was unavailable on the day we wanted to do the tour. So she arranged the tour with her colleague - Eszter. We were greeted by Eszter in the morning along with the driver George. Eszter was very cheerful and took us for the 5 hr communist walking tour. Part of the trip was in a minivan since the memento park is a bit outside the city. Our first stop was at the Gellert Hill. Eszter had specially kept it a secret to surprise us and she successfully managed in it. The views from the citadel were simply amazing. After capturing several pictures we drove to the memento park. Eszter explained the pre and post communist history of Hungary while walking through the park. Our last stop was the House of Terror museum. The only part of the museum that sends chills down the spine is the basement where the prisoners used to be tortured. The first and second floor are simple displays of videos from the Nazi and Soviet occupations. I must say I was a bit disappointed in the House of Terror as I was expecting something different. Overall it was a good tour. 5 stars for the guiding skills of Eszter!

Great way to get a taste of Budapest. We visited Budapest for a couple of days in June, while doing a rail journey through Europe. We choose to take a private tour as a way to see as much as possible in the time we had, and because my wife has some back problems which makes groups tours difficult. We were shown around by Adam - who was brilliant. A great guide, full of stories and tales. Much better than going around on our own with a book. Adam also gave us lots of restaurant recommendations.

Two fine tours with Orsolya. We just returned from a couple of days in Budapest at the end of our cruise. We toured for two days with Orsolya and her driver Imre. On the first day, they picked us up at the cruise ship and took us to our hotel to drop off our luggage. We then took a full day excursion to the Danube Bend sites. It was a very relaxing trip and very informative in a beautiful area. After visiting Visegrad we had lunch at a lovely restaurant on the side of the mountain with great views of the Danube. We particularly enjoyed the stroll through Szentendre. On the second day we asked Orsolya to take us to all the places we would not visit on the standard cruise ship tour which we had taken the previous day. We did a morning walking tour on the Pest side. We particularly enjoyed our private tour of the Opera House. (Orsolya was a guide at the Opera House for a year before starting her own company.) We strolled through the city visiting many out the way places, also visited the beautiful New York coffee house and had lunch at a sidewalk cafe. In the afternoon, Imre picked us up and we visited Gellert Hill, the Gellert Baths, city market, etc, etc. Orsolya is also very knowledgeable of Hungarian wines and had some excellent recommendations for our dinner that evening. Maybe the next time we visit we will go on a Hungarian wineries tour with her.Orsolya is a delight to be with. She is extremely proud of her city and has an in depth knowledge of the history and art of Budapest. We enjoyed her anecdotes of the various places we visited. She has a degree in cultural anthropology which gives a great insight on the people and culture of a fascinating country. "Közi," Orsolya! Our thanks for two enjoyable days.

http://travelguidehungary.com/. First time visitors to Budapest this year and felt like we had lived there for years..Our Guide Orsi and her driver Micha, couldnt be more informed and or enthusiatic about their country. We were so lucky to visit Budda and Pest and all the hidden treasures found in this beautiful and historical city. What made it so special for the four people traveling in our group , is that we experienced the country, the people and the food , atmosphere shared by Orsi. Would do this again in a heart beat and two of the nicest young people filled with knowledge you could ever meet. Now I will play their guide when they come as our guests to Las Vegas. Love you both and thank you for all the extras you did for the Tenner's and the Gelfands.. Lisa Tenner August 7 2014

Private Tour of Buda and Pest. Orsolya and our driver were a great team. We had time only for a short visit on a day trip from Vienna, but it was time well spent. We did not at all feel rushed, and we had a terrific overview of both Buda and Pest and the history of this intriguing city. Don't miss the opera house and Sisi's story!

Wonderful Guide Ms. Orsolya!. We had a wonderful whole-day tour with Ms. Orsolya. She was very friendly, accommodating, and passionate about her beautiful city! She loved to tell little stories about the places we visited and that always brought the places to life! She was always smiling and the entire time we felt like we were touring the city with a good friend! We just can't speak highly enough of her! She was one of the highlights of our trip!She and her driver met us at our hotel. We stopped first at the Synagogue and visited the Weeping Willow memorial before heading to the amazing Budapest Opera House where she used to work as a guide. Sitting in the Opera and listening to her telling little stories about it was just fascinating! We then stopped by at a really beautiful hidden coffee house and the charming Liszt Ferenc Square before heading to the grand Heroes Square and the incredible Szechenyi Bath! For lunch place, she suggested New York Cafe which is called the Most Beautiful Cafe in the World! The cafe was stunning and the food was wonderful as well. We really liked it. In the afternoon, we did the Castle Hill which was enormous with the National Gallery, Fisherman's Bastion, the Royal Palace, church, and cobblestoned streets. And before she took us back to our hotel, she drove us up to the Gellert Hill where the entire city with her beautiful Chain Bridge, the Parliament, the Castle Hill, and the Danube unfold before us! The view was absolutely breathtaking! It was wonderful.We booked our tour with Ms. Orsolya through emails. She always responded the same day. She also arranged our train station to hotel and hotel to airport transfers for us.

Great tour!. Spending a day with Eszter along with our teenage daughters was just amazing. She was extremely informative , funny and patient with my daughter who wanted to know everything about Budapest . We had such a great time strolling along this beautiful city with her.I definitely recommend this tour !Thanks Eszter :)

We spent two wonderful days touring Budapest. Dora was our amazing guide and we cannot say enough great things about her..so knowlegable and so much fun, we felt like we made a wonderful friend while she got to know the non-stop talker Canadians!. We did both the driving and walking tours of the city, and even in the sweltering heat Dora kept us informed and entertained. I would not hesitate to recommend both Dora and this tour company. Excellent on all counts.

GREAT TOUR OF BUDAPEST. A group of 4 couples completed a Danube River cruise in Budapest and I was responsible for booking a driving tour one day and a half day walking tour the next. Orsolya (Orsi) was a complete delight to us and made our time in Budapest an incredible stay! She is very well educated and informative, personable and energetic- she made our trip to Budapest! On the first day she and a driver took us to sights we had not seen yet from the River Cruise tour the day before. She was very flexible to change the planned tour given what we had seen- and took us to Jewish Great Synagogue, the Szechenyi Baths, the Palace at their City Park, a special coffee break at the New York Coffee House, then a private tour of the Opera House (she is a licensed tour guide for the Opera), lunch at a neat café and then to Gellert Hill to see Lady Liberty. She gave great advice for where to eat that night and the following night. All 8 of us loved her. On the second day, four of us did a walking tour with her- there is so much to see in Budapest and we never would have taken in these sights without her. From a special walk along the river to show us the bronze depiction of beginning to end of the Danube River and each of the original Roman settlements with excavations of the ruins in Budapest visible -- to a really neat area with bars with old (the real "retro stuff) furniture and fun gadgets called "ruin pubs." I would highly recommend Orsi to any traveler wanting a private tour in Budapest!!

Fantastic Visit!. Zsofi was an amazing tour guide for our family. My 11-year-old son was unfortunately was not feeling very well that day, and she made special accommodations to allow us to keep the van for the entire day. She was also very flexible with his interests and concerned about his well-being. She went out of her way to make this tour work for us. She gave us excellent suggestions for dinner. Thanks to this tour I felt that I left with a good overview of the city.

Private walking tour. We booked an extended walking tour for our first full day in Budapest. We had come several days in advance of a river cruise and didn't want to waste precious time floundering around by ourselves. What a smart move it turned out to be. Orsolya was not available but put us in the capable hands of Eszter, a charming young Hungarian who LOVES her country. She met us at 9am at our hotel and showed us the sights until almost 4:00. We started with breakfast so we could explain to her what sights we would be seeing the next day with the included city tour from AMA Waterways, our river cruise company. Orsolya already had Eszter very well briefed as Orsolya and I had e-mailed several times prior to our departure. According to my travel companion's fitness device we walked six miles that day. Not only did we learn so much history from Eszter but she put it into the very personal context of her ancestors. In hindsight I wished that we had asked her to jump on the metro now and then because it was not necessary to actually WALK everything! We were charged $195 for all four of us for more than six hours. We considered it money well spent.

Brought the City to Life!. We booked a four hour walking tour with Orsolya, originally to be done with one of her colleagues, but when that lady's plans had to change Orsolya herself rearranged things so she could personally guide us.She was fun, informative, helpful and energetic even though she as still suffering from a recent accident, and in our time with her we learned a great deal in a most pleasurable way. Orsi also very kindly suggested how we might best spend the remaining two days in this great city, and rearranged our self- planned trip to Szentendre so we sensibly went out by train and back by speedboat - a great experience.All-in-all,we would thoroughly recommend you use her services - she is reliable, knowledgeable, very pleasant, speaks excellent English and good value!

Excellent!. Zsofi was a fantastic resource for my first visit to Budapest. I could not have asked for a more knowledgeable and helpful guide. I had an excellent tour of Budapest's city center complete with historical background and useful details about everything from architecture to cuisine. I also had a lot of questions about the political and social situation in Hungary as well as the general impact of the country's recent history. Zsofi was consistently thoughtful and left me with a far deeper understanding of Budapest and Hungarians. I seriously doubt any guide could do a better job than Zsofi.

Wonderful Experience. Orsolya was not available, but we had Melinda and a driver. Melinda was wonderful, knowledgeable and full of personality. We learn a lot about the city and went to places that I suspect most tours don't get to such as the market in the Jewish section. Having a driver made all the difference since some in my group have mobility problems. Highly recommended.

Four Days Was Not Enough. Orsolya picked me up at the airport together with driver, Miha. They gave me tips on what to see around Budapest. I was supposed to go to Holloko with Orsolya but too bad she had an accident and was taken to the hospital. Orsolya, hope you're fine now! She was really apologetic for what happened and even sent the driver to my hotel to deliver the sad news. So the rest of the day was free to see more of Budapest and I must say my four days was not enough. Orsolya booked me a transfer going to the train station on my last day for free! And for that thank you, Orsolya!

Great experience in Budapest. My husband and I were on a river cruise on the Danube. We could tell that the time allotted to Budapest would mean that we needed extra days there and needed to make the most of that time as well. Orsolya was the perfect answer. She arranged our time to compliment the things we were doing with the cruise tour without a lot of overlap. She was very informative and honestly discussed the recent history of her country and the challenges the people have faced.The cost was quite reasonable. I did one four hour tour with her and wish I had done another on a different day. She was very pleasant and entertaining as well as informative. She did a good job of adapting to my interests and the pace I wanted to follow. My impression was that she was quite capable and willing to adapt to a variety of situations, groups and interests.

Outstanding!. Based on tips in Travel Advisor we had originally contacted Orsolya about a full day tour of Budapest. We only had 2 1/2 days to try and cover the many things we wished to see. Orsolya was already booked during our dates and she suggested we contact Eszter Odri to help us combine our different interests.....how lucky we were to share an 8 hour day with Eszter. We had also chosen to work with a driver and van. This turned out to be a life saver during the very hot day of touring. Eszter helped us combine the highlights of a "Taste of Budapest" with a beautiful tour of the Jewish Quarter as well viewing and learning about the the more traditional sights in this beautiful city. Eszter was a bright, energetic and most knowledgeable guide. She combined historical background, modern lifestyle and was even willing to add some personal stories and comments while sharing information about her own life in Budapest. It was a very full and simply wonderful day that could never had happened without her background work and help. Eszter was in touch with us via e-mail in order to help us define and organize the many things we wanted to see and do. She made it all happen.

Very interesting afternoon. Orsolya took us on her Communism tour covering a range of sights in and around Budapest. She has a deep knowledge of the history and people involved and was able to impart this in a very engaging way. She also made recommendations of films, which I'll be taking up. And she made arrangements for picking us up and taking us back to the airport after our stay. Don't visit Memento Park without Orsolya, she brought the place to life.

First Class Professional Tour Guide!!. Orsolya was very helpful, via emails, to help us set up two 1/2 day walking tours of Budapest as well as a day trip to Eger. Unfortunately Orsolya was already booked for our stay and she was able to source Eszter Odri to be our guide for the three trips. We had a great time with Eszter!! She was full of energy, very professional, answered all our tourist questions ( even if it meant doing some research overnight ), and, on our request, showed us meat shops and fabric shops along the tour route in Budapest. The pastry shop by the castle in Budapest had the most divine poppy seed strudel!!! Eszter did a magnificent job of planning and scheduling our route in Eger. Many of the Eger avenues are being reconstructed so proper planning was required to get us to events on time. Eszter chose the Macok Bistro, just below the Eger castle, for lunch. This was the best meal we had on our entire 2.5 week European vacation!! On the way back to Budapest we stopped at the St Andrea Winery, had a cellar tour and tasted wines for a couple of hours and then had the owner come out and share some of his most excellent, exclusive Bordeaux creation. The end to a perfect day. Thanks so much Eszter!!!!

Awesome tour guide. Our group of 4 had the pleasure of having Orsolya show us the sights of Budapest during our recent Danube river cruise. We did the "Taste of Budapest" tour split over 2 days- visiting the Great Market Hall, a boutique chocolate shop, a classic Budapest cafe (and more) --- tasting and learning about local specialties along the way on the first day. On day two, we did a more traditional walking/metro tour of Budapest with Orsolya sharing her knowledge and passion for her hometown. I would highly recommend her services- she is an engaging, knowledgeable person who will help you get the most out of your visit.
Orsolya fulfilled our expectations according to tripadvisor's recomendations. And I have nothing more to say. She is really a great guide. Spent with her 5 days, and every day was great.

Amazing tour guides-HIghly recommended. We (My wife, 11 year old daughter and I) visited Budapest recently and contacted the company for assistance with city tour. Orsolya was very responsive and prior to arrival we agreed to do two tours. One full day and another evening walking tour of the city. For the full day tour, we had Andrea as our guide. She took us over the main sites in Buda and Pest in a car and then in the afternoon we walked through the streets seeing most of the sites. Andrea is an excellent guide and explained the sights very eloquently. She starts with the importance of the site, the historical relevance and add many amusing facts about each attraction. She is very friendly and knowledgeable about the city and its history. She covered most of the important sights, including the Jewish quarter, Opera house, market hall, royal palace and change of guards, baths, and other major landmarks of the city. She took us to the Market hall and introduced us to Hungarian cuisine and an afternoon coffee break at an elegant book shop cafe in the middle of the city!For the second part of our tour, we met Orsolya and she took us through the heart of the city and the evening life in the city. We covered mostly the Pest side of the city, but took a wonderful boat ride with well lit beautiful sights on either side of the river. Orsolya explained the details of this amazing city with passion and took us the more unique aspects of the city including the innovative ruin bar made up of discarded furniture. We were able to enjoy most parts of the city including the Jewish quarter, market areas, shopping areas, and other important sights. We were all pleasantly surprised over Orsolya's knowledge, passion and patience with introducing her city to us. The one difference with this tour company and many others we have used all over Europe is that they take you through every minor details of the city and explain their part of history with pride and passion. It is really touching and at the same time extremely informative.There is a personal touch to this tour, which I would highly recommend to anyone who is visiting Budapest. They are very responsive, polite, professional and I admire them for continuing to perform high quality work, which obviously require long days of hard work. We are really indebted to both Orsolya and Andrea for making our visit an unforgettable one and we are looking forward to another trip to Hungarian countryside and guess who will our guides be?

Outstanding Guide. Orsolya was our guide for a half-day in Pest. She was very knowledgeable and entertaining; she made the city come alive for us. Many of the things she showed or told us we would have missed without her guidance. We appreciated her openness, wealth of information, and sense of humor, and we recommend her to anyone who wants a personal tour in Budapest.

Budapest in a nutshell !. It is really all you need to know about Budapest...the history that everyone knows about and the hidden places that everyone wants to know about ...we had an evening tour with Orshi and three days with Zsofi and we really enjoyed them a lot ...Budapest is not that big city but it has so many things to see and do.we hired the Trabant which was one of the highlightes and went to a couple of shows arranged by Orshi..both ladies were very pleasant and funny and they know their history very well :).

Two Great Days in Budapest. We met Orsolya the morning we arrived in Budapest after our transatlantic flight from the US. Our family (husband and two children ages 4 and 5) took a walking tour of the Jewish Quarter and museum. We visited the largest functioning synagogue in Europe and several of the smaller area synogogues. Orsolya was very pleasant, knowledgeable, and patient (with our tired children). We made our way through the streets, alleys and hidden walkways where the locals eat, drink and hang out. She also guided us to a restaurant for lunch where she helped us to try Hungarian cuisine. We continued our walk through Pest and ended up alongside the Danube. We ended our tour for the day, so we could recover. The following day, my parents joined us, and Orsolya contracted a driver who was very professional and courteous, as well as careful. We started our day at the Opera House with a private tour by Orsolya. She shared the legends and royal secrets of the Opera House with us with enthusiasm and flare. We continued to walk and drive through the city. She even took us to a public bath house to show us local Hungarian customs. We then went to drink thermal water like the locals. We stopped for lunch where she helped us order traditional Hungarian food again. We then made our way to the Buda side where we drove up to the Liberty monument and visited fisherman's bastion; she took us through the Matias church. Orsolya is very knowledgeable about European and Hungarian history, both modern and classic. We had a great time learning about the people, the art, the wine and the city. We finished back on the Pest side with a walk through the Grand Market. We even bought Hungarian paprika! Orsolya and her driver then drove us to our cruise boat, where we were boarding a river cruise that evening. It was a great two days in Budapest and we would recommend Orsolya again without hesitation.Thanks again Orsolya!Adriana & Rich, and two little girls

Fantastic and best guide! Numero uno in budapest!. We spent a full day w Orsola and her chauffeur friend Miha. In the morning, we drive to the small town of Szetendre before the tour groups come in the afternoon. It was a quaint and historical town, filled with arts, crafts, little churches, quiet and pretty corners. Then we drove back to Budapest and covered all the major highlights if Budapest incl Fishermans Bastion, Gellert Hill, Andrassy Ave, Heroes Sq, City Park and an extensive inside tour of the opulent Opera House. Orsola was very knowledgeable, professional and easy-going. She kept to our leisurely pace and never hurried us from place to place, which is what a personsl guide should be like. Also gave us an indepth understanding of Hungarian history, culture and food. She spoke perfect english. Would certainly highly recommend her as a fantastic overview and historical devt of Budapest.

All you need to know about Budapest. We (me, husband, and 19-year old son) just completed full day tour with Orsolya and received interesting, funny, and comprehensive education about Budapest and Hungary. I hope to come back and explore area beyond the city and especially the wine with Orsolya. P.S. Her driver, Michel, is amazing and very tip worthy too.

Superb and personal. We had a full half day tour of Buda and Pest. We got a superb commentary and overview of the city, its history, its art, and the people. We saw the important well publicized spots as well as some interesting anecdotal spots. It could not have been more fun or better!NW303

Exceptional private tour of Budapest. Orsolya provided my family with a wonderful tour of Budapest - perfectly tailored to our interests. She (and her fantastic Driver Micha - or Michael for the language challenged) covered all the well-known things to see with a deep knowledge of history, cultural, and politics. She combined vignettes of culture and character, and her personal experiences... and also gave us an up close, more insiders view of special places not otherwise covered in the guidebooks. Her easy going manner and excellent presentation was delightful for all ages. The time went by too quickly and I look forward to returning to Budapest and seeing them both again!While I will select the recommended length of visit as 3 hours or more (Budapest deserves it!) - Orsolya can accommodate whatever time constraints you have. She managed our tour exactly to the time we had available with great care and efficiency without us ever feeling hurried or rushed in any way!

Two days in Budapest. I've traveled with private guides all over Europe, the US, South America, and Asia. I always have lots of random questions about everything, and I want to try all the foods and visit all the markets, and I often need advice for good restaurants, etc. I often make impossible requests during the initial planning because I don't know the local situation. Orsalya (the tour operator for this guide company) did a very thoughtful job organizing our itinerary, converting my impossible requests into something feasible, answering my many ad hoc questions, and giving me good advice for what to do at night after the tours (and on follow-up tours to Hungary). Highly recommended.

Wonderful day in Budapest !!. Our group of 10 only had 1 full day to explore Budapest so I searched the net and luckily I found Orsolya. Aside from being knowledgeable, she is also very warm and accommodating. She was sensitive to the interests of the group. She opted to bring us to special places she thought the group would enjoy even if it was not part of our itinerary and it certainly made our day more special. She shared her knowledge not only about their history but also about food, culture and everything else in between. The mini bus and driver that she provided us for the day helped us see more of the city in such a short time. I highly recommend Orsolya as a guide. It doesn't take long for one to feel like you made a friend in Budapest.

Budapest Food, Wine and History. I was in Hungary for a few days exploring the Food, Wine and History of this beautiful country. Having Orsolya as my guide certainly made my trip all the more organized, fun and importantly gave me the local insights to the local food, culture and places not found in guide books. Orsolya is friendly, knowledgable and did everything to ensure that my trip was memorable.

Thank you Orsoyla. We were in Budapest for 3 days prior to our Viking River Cruise and hired Orsolya to show us around. She did a wonderful job by not repeating those places we would see on the Viking River Cruise City tour. We think we saw everything of interest in Budapest (on both sides of the Danube) both inside and out and learned about each place as we went which included history, architecture and the stories or items of interest. We felt like Orsolya was efficient so that we would see everything but also we were at each site as long as we wanted. She is very nice and accommodating and we are so pleased that we had her to show us around. We would definitely recommend her if anyone is visiting Budapest. Be sure, if you have time, to go the “Best Coffee Shop in the World” for a break. She took us there for a cup of coffee and it is beautiful.

Budapest experience.. Orsolya is an excellent guide that knows all the detail about the areas to be visited and has the ability to present facts in an interesting, friendly and comprehensive way. She has made our visit to Budapest a pleasure from the planning phase to the actual visit. we are honoured to regard her as a friend and can recommend her without any hesitation. Orsi, thanks for a wonderful time with you in Budapest.

Magical Memories in Budapest with Orsolya. If you want to create Magical memories there is no better way to do it than to tour with Orsolya. Orsolya's knowledge of Budapest, command of the English language, and her sparkling personality combine to make the most wonderful touring experience. We spent two fun filled days with Orsolya and plan to do it again!

"Great Time in Budapest". We visited Budapest for 3 days in December, and wanted to experience the city with a local tour guide. We were so lucky to find Travel Guide Hungary and Orsolya and Brigi.Orsolya was not available on the first day, so her colleague Brigi took us for a 1/2 day walking tour. We covered a lot of the highlights of the city, including Andrassy Ave, Hero Square and City Park. Brigi was very knowledgeable and pleasant, and we enjoyed our time together. We then spent 1-1/2 days exploring the city with Orsolya. We had such a good time. Orsolya was very flexible and adjusted the itinerary often when she better understood what we wanted to experience in Budapest. Besides the customary sites, Orsolya took us to awesome cafes and a wonderful local Hungarian restaurant, that we never would have found on our own.She saved the day, when we realized we left our camera in the taxi at the Great Market Hall. Orsolya went tearing down the street to catch up with the cab and rescued our camera. We were so grateful since there were 3 days of touring photos on it!This was our first time using a private tour guide and we really enjoyed the experience.

Great time with Orsi. we made a one-day tour with emphasis on communist history. Orsi has shown me all important places and could tell me some nice and meaningful stories. We also had good talks about Hungary nowadays.I had a great time, the day passed so quickly!Meeting with Orsi is a nice way to explore Budapest and to learn and experience Hungary!Kind regards,Michiel

EDUCATED, INFORMATIVE VIEW OF BEAUTIFUL BUDAPEST. We were in Budapest for three days and toured two days with Orsolya. She gave us both a walking and driving tour that was informative,fun. and planned to our wishes.

Perfect Two Days in Budapest. My husband and I were in Budapest for two days as part of our Viking cruise. We had looked forward to visiting this city for a long time and decided we wanted a private guide to get the most out of our vista---and we hit the jackpot with Orsolya. She's bright, interesting, knowledgeable, and such a joy to spend hours with exploring her city.
