She tailored the tour to our interests--including an insider's look at the Opera House--but also made sure we saw things we wouldn't have known about. Thanks to Orsolya, we had a truly memorable immersion in everything Budapest has to offer.

Great way to start you visit to Budapest!. We scheduled a city walking tour with Brigi our first day in Budapest. It was the best way to start our trip. We got a great overview of the city. Brigi is a GREAT tour guide! Our second day we went to Szentendre with another guide. I cannot think of her name but she was also very good. These private tours will always be the first thing I recommend to anyone traveling to Budapest. We were traveling with 3 generations and our tours were tailored to fit all of us... which is a challenge in itself. Brigi also gave us some great restaurant recommendations close to our apartment.

Great day in Budapest with Orsolya. My friend and I were visiting Budapest only for one day and we wanted to get a taste of the city. Orsolya and her driver were so accommodating, friendly and very informative. We were able to experience the cafe scene, traditional local foods, and all the "A" listed sights.Orsolya's English is excellant and she is definately willing to please. The pickup and drop off at the train station was most helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend her and I will definately utilize her services once I return to the lovely city of Budapest. Thank you, Orsolya.

THE BEST Tour Guide in Budapest. We spent a wonderful day with Orsolya in Budapest. The tour was "A Taste of Budapest" and it combined all the wonderful sights of the city with a sampling of all the wonderful culinary delights the city has to offer. Orsolya was very knowledgeable about Budapest's history and culture and the information we learned from the tour really guided us through the rest of our time there. It was wonderful to spend the day with someone so passionate about her city and someone so personable that we parted feeling like we had made a dear friend. She exceeded our expectations and we would highly recommend her.

A WONDERFUL GUIDE IN BUDAPEST. oN nOVEMBER 16 & 17, Orsolya showed us the special places in this charming city full of history. We spent 2x4 hours with Orsolya and she deserves all the compliments one can make to a tour guide: pleasant, easygoing, extreme knowledgeable, courteous, punctual, excellent English etc. We had 2 most enjoyable and memorable days. Thanks Orsolya and good luck for your future! James S

Best Guide We've Ever Had. My husband and I had a full day Communism Tour with Orsolya recently, and without a doubt she is the best tour guide we have ever had. She is friendly, knowledgable, energetic and the passion and pride she has for her country is obvious. It goes without saying that her English is excellent. Prior to our trip I had emailed her several times, and she put together a tour for us to encompass everything we wanted to see. She thoroughly explained everything, and was patient with my many (many, many) questions and need to take countless photos. I'm embarassed to say how ignorant I was about much of Hungary's recent history despite being a history and political science major in university, but I now feel much more educated. I'm so glad we decided to take a private tour with her. It was absolutely worth every cent, and even though we took a tour exploring the communist history of Budapest/Hungary I'm sure that every tour she offers would be just as good. She even gave us several suggestions for other sites to see, and places to eat and marked them on our map. All of her suggestions were spot on. Quite honestly I can't think of a bd thing to say about our tour, and our time with Orsolya. We very highly recommend her and Travel Guide Hungary!

A great guide for your tour of Budapest!. We highly recommend Orsolya as a tour guide. She is very knowledgeable about her hometown, including its history and it's current day events. She is punctual, friendly, energetic, and very passionate about Budapest. She definitely helped to make our visit to Budapest that much more enjoyable and memorable! The 4 hour walking tour she offers is very reasonably priced and worth every penny! Or should I say forint!

A Memorable Day in Budapest. Orsolya took my wife and I on a full day's walking tour (8 hours) of Budapest on a beautiful Sunday, September 29, 2013. She met us at our hotel in central Pest and we proceeded leisurely (we're not young) on foot for a mile or so, as she explained every sight along the way. Then she called a taxi and we crossed the Danube to the Buda side and proceeded up to Castle Hill, working our way up the river to Fisherman's Bastion, where she took us to a touristy but very good restaurant with an imposing view of the city (see photo). We had a light lunch, and I got to sample an excellent (but inexpensive) Hungarian wine. We took the funicular back down the hill and crossed the bridge to Pest where we spent the rest of the day wandering from place to place. What was unique is that we went wherever we wished, at our own pace, with expert guidance on what to see, and it was interpreted by a very talented historian who made it exceptionally interesting. If we needed a cab, she called one. If we needed a tram, she knew which one and where to get the tickets. We ended the day at the opera house, where she had previously worked and was able to take us on a special insider's tour. The best part of all this was Orsolya herself. She is an enthusiastic, personable, and completely professional guide. What did it cost? Not nearly it was worth.

Great private guide in Budapest. We booked Magdi Pelech for private tours with a car and driver to show us Buda one morning and Pest the next morning. Since Budapest is so spread out, I recommend using a guide with a car and driver. Magdi is a licensed private guide and speaks excellent English. She will modify the tour to see exactly what you want. She knows so much about the interesting history of the city, making the tour one of the best we've ever taken in Europe. You can book her services at magdi.pelech@gmail.com . We went in mid-September which is a very busy time in Budapest, so we were very glad we booked her in advance.

Knowledgeable guide and courteous driver for 4 hours in Budapest.. My friend and I had a lovely 4 hour personal tour with Melinda and Emerich. They were able to accommodate us on relatively short notice and make a last minute extension because we wanted to extend our day by an hour. Highly recommended from an avid walker because sights are very far apart and parking is difficult. My only wish is that we had booked another day!

Our Budapest tour guide Orsoyla. Our tour guide in Budapest was Orsoyla Moravai. We found her through Trip Advisor and corresponded via email several times prior to our trip. We had some concerns: We only had 24 hours in Budapest. We wanted her to customize an afternoon tour for us that would fill in any spaces left by our morning tour provided through our river cruise company. Also, there were five in our party which included our 98 year old Mother who would be in a wheelchair.After "Orsi" found out what,our morning tour consisted of, she planned our afternoon tour. The Opera House on Andrassy Ave, St. Stephen's Basilica, The Great Market Hall, and The Liberty Statue on Gellert Hill. The four venues were perfect and made our overview of Budapest complete.Orsi met us after lunch at our ship with her driver and a van. The van she provided was spacious and comfortable for all 7 of us.At the Opera House, Orsi arranged to take us on a private tour. She even gained access to a non-public elevator for our Mother. Orsi has a wealth of knowledge about the Opera House and shared it with us in a most entertaining way.We enjoyed The Great Market Hall and seeing the variety of products of Hungary. It is a wonderful place to shop for gifts to bring home. She arranged for a taste testing of Hungarian sausages from the meat market which the men in our group enjoyed especially. St. Stephen's Basilica is a magnificent church. It was closed for a special private concert, but seeing the outer areas of the church was appreciated.The Liberty Statue is worth the trip up Gellert Hill. From that spot you get a panoramic view of the two cities, especially Pest. It is also a great place for a photo shoot. We have wonderful pictures that Orsi took of us with Budapest in the background.Orsoyla has lived her whole life in Budapest. She has the background information and passion for sharing the beauty of her city to make her an excellent guide. She is warm, friendly, energetic and knowledgeable. The afternoon spent with her was delightful. She was one of the best guides on our whole Danube River cruise.

What Else Can be Said? Excellent Guide. I'm not going to repeat all of the other reviews - suffice to say we had the same experience with Orsolya. Two 1/2 day tours in mid-September, built around our interests. As someone else has said, it was like being shown Budapest by a new friend, a very knowledgeable friend. We had such a good time interacting with Orsolya on our tours, we asked her to join us at the New York Cafe for an extended conversation. If we go back to Budapest, I mean, when we go back to Budapest, we've already decided to spend more time having Orsolya show us more of this great city.

Great day touring Budapest with Orsolya. Orsolya was such a nice person that we arranged to have her guide us around for a second day and invited her to have dinner at a restaurant she recommended, which turned out to be an excellent place. We saw such a wide range of both historic sites and local hang outs that we were able to really get a sense of the place. Definitely a highlight of our trip to Europe.

Two delightful days in Budapest. We spent some time in Budapest with a small group of friends prior to a Danube cruise. Orsolya arranged two days of private tours for our group. Both days were very interesting and informative and gave us an opportunity to see Budapest and the Danube bend areas in good depth. Zsofi was our guide for a day touring the Danube bend. Her knowledge of the area, the language and culture were impressive. Even more impressive was her enthusiasm for sharing her knowledge. On the second day Orsolya toured us through Budapest and led us through parts of the city and sights that were not covered in the highlights tour offered by the cruise line. Orsolya brought us through Opera House, a very special treat. Her knowledge and enthusiasm made it a special day. She was also very attentive to our needs and when we needed a break for coffee, she found a nice place for us to rest. Both women spoke English very well so communication was always easy for us. We have used many private guide services in the past and Orsolya and her colleague rank among the best.

Would give 6 stars.... I wanted to see the opera house and some spots I hadn't seen when on a riverboat. Orsolya was recommended when I asked another fabulous guide In Prague, Marketa of Caputi Regni. i was confident I would be in good hands. Little did I know when Orsolya met me at the riverboat with our driver that i would be getting a private tour of the opera house, not shared with groups- as Orsolya used to be a guide for th Opera House. We did not need to go at 3 or 4, but could utilize the rest of the afternoon to see and enjoy my now favorite cafe in the world, New York Cafe. I got to view the interior of St. Stephen's Cathedral, purchased paprika and salami for gifts, tasted real Hungarian moments and did not feel like a tourist, but like someone sharing time with a new friend in her city.

A day in Budapest with Orsolya. I had just 2 days in Budapest so I decided to take a comprehensive tour with Private Tours. Orsolya is the owner. There was good correspondence before the tour. I let her know what I was interested and she did a great job integrating what I was interested in with what she thought what highlights I should not miss. She did a wonderful job plus she has a very pleasant easy going personality. I really enjoyed our tour and I thought it was a very good value.

Outstanding Private Tour Guide - Orsolya Morvai. We just returned from a family trip to Hungary and the day we spent in Budapest with Orsolya was one of the highlights of the visit. We had half a day with a driver and half a day walking. We visited several sites and Orsi's explanations and descriptions gave us context and a much deeper appreciation for what we were seeing. The day was well-planned and we covered a lot of ground but never felt rushed. While she is extremely knowledgeable, her style is very easygoing and we learned so much without ever feeling like we were being lectured to. She was quite frankly a joy to have with us, and we were sorry to part ways at the end of the day. We recommend her wholeheartedly.

Excellent tour guide-0rsolya Moravai. When visiting Budapest, I highly recommend booking a private tour with this guide. She is intelligent, very pleasant, quite knowledgable about local history, culture, and geography. We took two local tours with her and enjoyed them both. You can design whatever tour type you prefer and hire her for a half or whole day at a reasonable price.

30th Anniversary Trip. Our guide went well out of her way to provide us with a unique and highly customized one day tour of Budapest. She arranged everything from meeting us at the train station, providing the driver, pacing the tour so we saw the best highlights of the city with our limited time, understanding the history and culture, introducing us to the local gourmet scene, shopping at the bazaar, and finally arranging our massage and swim at Széchenyi Baths.It only made us want to come back for a longer visit.

Thank you Orsolya. We had a wonderful two day private tour with Orsolya and a driver. An excellent and very efficient way to experience Budapest and the Danube Bend. A great tour - informative, fun and insightful.

Great time. We spent the day with Brigi walking the city of Budapest. She has an excellent knowledge of the city and its rich history. Her ability to share her knowledge and some of the folklore is remarkable. She tailored the tour to our needs and interest .it was a perfect way to start out stay here and helped us plan our week stay. Well worth the time and money!!!!

Great guide for Budapest. We had an all day "Taste of Budapest" tour with Orsolya when we were in Hungary in August 2013. With a car and driver picking us up at our hotel, we then visited many cultural locations, as well as the Great Market, New York Cafe, and had lunch at a local restaurant. Orsolya was extremely knowledgeable, as well as being a very pleasant person to share the day with!Skrogymom

Outstanding Experience. We started our Danube River Cruise in Budapest and wanted a more detailed overview of this charming city than our cruise tour offered. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we booked both an airport transfer and a half-day city tour with Travel Guide Hungary. Orsolya’s firm proved deserving of every kind word written about it and her attentive service made our time in Budapest a highlight of our trip.Our airport transfer was in a spotless, well air conditioned mini-van. Our driver was pleasant, professional and an interesting conversationalist. After a long flight it was such a treat and we were extremely pleased that he was the driver for our city tour the next day.We wanted as broad a view of Budapest as we could achieve with our tight schedule and the driving tour was a great choice. Orsolya set our itinerary based on a discussion of our interests and what our cruise tour had covered and we received insightful commentary on a variety of Budapest highlights. Orsolya expertly incorporated mini walking tours into our schedule and continued her entertaining and informative narrative as we shuttled between points of interest. Our driver always found convenient and safe drop-off and pick-up spots and this greatly enhanced the experience.Orsolya is a delightful, knowledgeable and flexible tour guide who made outstanding restaurant suggestions when asked. We give her our highest recommendation and our only regret is that we did not book a full day tour. Budapest is a gem and Orsolya makes it sparkle.

Delightful tour guide. We has the real pleasure of having Orsolya as our guide to regions outside of Budapest.. She is knowledgeable, accommodating, and willing to modify each itinerary to the interests and needs of the client. And, she is wiling to do this on the spur of the moment. We value this flexibility greatly. Our tours were to Eger and to Lake Balton, and we asked Orsolya to skip the ceramics part of the tour to Balaton and put in wine tasting. She not only did this (and we tried some really lovely wines), she anticipated our wanting to try wines on our Eger tour (we had not asked her) and she took us to a brilliant winery that had an amazing lunch and really great wines (Trummerer winery). Indeed, while Tripadvisor has no ability to add a review of Trummerer winery, we strongly recommend that anyone using Orsolya specifically ask her to take them to this winery for lunch and wine tasting.

Great Overview of Budapest. Our group was in Budapest recently for one day. Based on the great reviews on tripadvisor, i decided to book a walking tour of the city. We were not disappointed. Orsolya met us at the hotel promptly at 0930 and we were off. She spent 5 hours with us sharing history of the city and interesting stories of the many sites we saw. We started with a walk up to castle hill and ended up at the Szechenyi baths (including an introduction to the Budapest subway). Her English is excellent. Everyone in the group thoroughly enjoyed the tour. I would certainly book another tour with Orsolya in in Budapest again

A view of Budapest 1939 to 1989. A great tour of Budapest in the era of 1939 to 1989 lots of things learnt from during that time , 5 Star tour and Orsolya is a very good guide going that extra mile to give you a great tour and seeing things that you would not see on the normal tourist routes , Orsolya command od English is also excellent

Budapest- Fabulous City and Wonderful Guide. I recently visited this beautiful city with my wife and 2 friends. We booked Gabriella Torok from NY to be our guide and driver.What a wonderful experience with her. Her mastery of English is quite amazing. There wasn't a fact she didn't know about her country's history including all the pertinent dates. She was very easy to speak with and I felt that we were with a friend who we hadn't seen for a year. Her car was very comfortable for 4 people and also immaculate. I would recommend her highly and additionally her rates were very fair.David J

Brilliant introduction to Budapest in one day!. Orsolya picked our family of 6 up at our hotel with a car, and we toured sights in the morning by car and continued in the afternoon on foot, ending up at the Szecheznyl baths late in the afternoon. Orsi is a wonderful, enthusiastic guide who loves her city and knows so many interesting stories about its history. Our children - ranging in ages from 19 to 10 loved her. It's hard not to like her exuberance and appreciation for Budapest and its amazing past and present. We saw so many sights in our day with Orsi, and felt that we were experiencing them with a friend. The driver we had in the morning was professional, courteous and made getting around to the various areas of the city so easy. The entire day was affordable, compared to private tour guides and cars in the more crowded destinations in the western part of Europe. We highly recommend Orsolya and her company Travel Guide Hungary.

Highlight of our time in Budapest. We recently spent five days in Budapest, and had the pleasure of spending one of them with Orsi. She met us at our hotel with her driver, and we toured with them most of the day. The driver was extremely prompt, courteous, and drove a very nice car with good A/C and cold bottled water. I recommend that, because you can get around more quickly and see more of the city. Orsi took us not only to the major historical sights, but some other attractions that we otherwise would never have known about. She is extremely knowledgeable, and has such a sweet personality. She was born and raised in Budapest, and her enthusiasm for it's beauty is delightful to be around. We saw much of the city in one day, and at the end had a great appreciation for Hungarians. Orsi's love of her people was contagious. Don't go to Budapest with spending some time with her. She is amazing!

Great guide!. Orsolya guided our group of 38 people in and around Budapest 7/4 through 7/6. She was very knowledgeable about the architecture, culture and history of her city. Her English is very good and she interacts very well with the group that she is guiding. Questions are encouraged and repeated so that the entire group can learn. I would definitely use her again!

Great tour guide - knowledgeable and flexible. Brigi was our tour guide for the Szentendre tour, and we had an awesome time. She was prompt in showing up on time and was very knowledgeable on many things about Budapest. She spoke perfect English and was entertaining to interact. She also worked with our scheduled and customized the tour so there was a mixture of shopping for the ladies and some history lessons for me.I would definitely go with Brigi again the next time we go back to Budapest.

Wonderful guide!. We spent 2 days with Orsolya this spring. one in Budapest - doing her Jewish tour and the Communist tour and one along the Danube.She knows so much, is fun, interesting, and had just the right pace of information to keep everyone in our party absorbed. also found us some delicious restaurants! Fascinating to understand the "change" in the country when the communists left and to see the country through the eyes of someone who loves it and also understands all its different phases. She is an anthropologist by training, with excellent English.We totally recommend her!!!

We fell in love with Budapest, and Orsolya!. Our group of 5 Canadian seniors hired Orsolya for 2 days in Budapest, one day with a van and driver and one day without. She picked us up right where we asked and right on time, an excellent start indeed. This was the beginning of 2 wonderful, informative, age appropriate and fun-filled days. Orsolya has an amazing ability to tune into the needs and interests of her clients and tailor the tour to suit them. We saw places that we never would have found on our own including memorable coffee houses, bars, and restaurants. As any traveler will tell you these are often the heart and soul of a city and we felt as if we got to know the beautiful city of Budapest intimately during our time with Orsolya.This is a person who loves her home city and after spending time with her, so will you! We all felt as if this was the best money we spent on our trip and we recommend Orsolya to anyone lucky enough to visit Budapest

Warm and Real Guide Experience in Budapest. We travled to Budapest as part of a river cruise, arriving 3 days early to hopefully really appreciate and understand the city and its environs. We had a private tour all three days, the last one with Orsolya. You would think that after two days a guide would have trouble finding new different and enlightening things to show and experience. Not so. Orsolya provided our best day yet in this great and beautiful city on the Danube. We would recommend her without reservation, as she went above and beyond to make us feel the wonder of this great jewel of a city.

Great tour and great guide in Orsolya. Had a wonderful night tour with Orsolya that ended witha delish traditional Hungarian dinner complete with the music of a gypsy band. We had an equally fantastic day tour the following morning with Orsolya and her team driver. ( sorry, forgot his name ) Orsolya is very pleasant, vibrant, knowleagable, friendly , patient and informative. Only positives for this great guide. Thanks, Orsolya, for showing us the beauty Of Budapest. Wished , we had more days in Budapest... Highly recommended... Five stars!

Great experience. As we arranged the tour on short notice, Orsy was unavailable. She arranged tour with driver for our party of five with Brigi, her associate.It could not have been better, Brigi was a delight, very knowledgeable and passionate about her city and country. Brigi and the driver were in perfect coordination, and we were able to see so much more of Budapest than I thought was possible.The four hour tour with Brigi was the highlight of our recent european trip, I can recommend without any reservations.We were so impressed with the tour , we tried to get Brigi or Orsey the next day, both both were booked. Orsey, however, arranged us a tour with Gabor and driver, and this was equally enjoyable. Through Brigi and Gabor, I felt we were able to get an insight into the hungarian people and their history, two great afternoons.

The Best!. We arranged a tour on short notice.Orsy was unavailable so we toured with Brigi a partner with Orsy.We did a four+ hour tour with a driver so we were able to see a lot of sites and save our feet and backs!Brigi is very knowledgeable with a bright, cheerful personality. Her flexibility was very much appreciated. She also speaks perfect English which was important as the only hungarian phrase we know is, "Egészségedre".... Cheers,(egy for short). We were so impressed with Brigi we decided to do a second day. Brigi was unavailable so Orsy arranged for a tour with Gabor. This was an equally wonderful day that highlighted the Jewish quarter, etc. As a teacher Gabor is extremely knowledgeable. He is a wonderful person with great insights and historical perspective of growing up during the communist regime. He also speaks perfect English.Budapest is a hidden gem in central Europe that Brigi and Gabor brought to life.It was an unforgettable experience.

Thre tours in Hungary. In mid-May we visited Hungary. One of the gals in our party had arranged for tours with Orsolya ( Orsy ). The first was a 6 hour waling tour of Budapest. It was excellent. We saw so much and Orsy's knowledge of the city was incredible. We also took a tour to Egar. Orsy arranged for the driver and we spent the day in Egar touring around - she also arranged for a local wine tour. Overall our experience with Orsy was excellent. Her English is very good and her knowledge of Hungary was outstanding. I would highly recommend her.

She makes Hungary come alive!. Orsolya knows Budapest and her country. This knowledge and her excellent English skills show you a Hungary you could not see without her. We toured with friends and family and she made our trip interesting and exciting. City sites, the baths, restaraunts, wine tasting in the countryside; all were visited and enjoyed. We looked forward to seeing her each day and beginning each new adventure. We highly recommend Orsolya. You can't replicate her abilities with a tour book. She brings an enthusiasm to her work that's infectious. Hire her and you will never forget your visit to Hungary. Thanks Orsolya.

A great introduction to Budapest. This is my first time in Budapest, and I wanted a guide to help me get my bearings and learn a little about the city. I could not have done better than having Orsolya be that guide. Her English is excellent, she takes time to explain what you're seeing, and the walking tour included the team and the metro, both of which I wanted to try so I can get around on my own. She has a variety of tours, and if they are anything like her basic walkin tour, then they are excellent.

Excellent, charming Orsolya. I found Orsolya in Tripadvisor. I noticed everybody praised her with many fine words. I found no bad opinions. This waked my interest - how exellent she is. And I did`nt need to regret.Our group. consisting of 16 participants made 5 hours city sightseeing tour in lovely Budapest with Orsolya. We planned our tour conscientiously with about 20 emails.Orsolya explained us alternatives to select together. Orsolya gave us good tips for other program of our 3 days visit in Budapest too.We got a good picture of Hungary and Budapest now and in the past. Orsolya was very professional and at the same time very charming and natural. We felt she wanted to be like one of us. She did`nt need some manuscript to tell us everything possible about her beloved home city.I think Orsolya is the best possible Budapest guide for you too.

Travel Guide Hungary with Orsolya. If you are looking for a guide in Hungary, I highly recommend to contact Orsolya. There are 5 people in my group. We spent 2 days with her. 1 day tour of Danu Blend which we visited 3 small towns outside Budapest.. If you have time and would like to see nuture.. I recommend this 1 day tour.Another day is driving tour in Budapest. Orsolya and her driver took care us very well. She is calm, knowledgeable and always smiles and flexible to arrange and respond to your request.

a great tour to Eger. I found Orsolya on Trip Advisor.She's very responsive when we exchanged email.One the day of tour, the 11 of us were picked up from Budapest hotel.Orsolya put together a thorough tour in Eger and pre-arranged a superb lunch/wine tasting at winery. Everybody was pleased.Orsolya is very knowledge, charming and accommodating,I would definitely contact her next time when we visit Budapest.

First Class Budapest Tour Guide. We went to Budapest for our Spring Break week and after visiting some sites on our own the first few days, we decided to seek a guided tour as we knew there was so much to see. Of course I went to Trip Advisor and I reached out to Orsolya to arrange a tour, on a last minute basis. We are a family of five and we requested a 5 hour tour with a car. Orsolya was already booked, so she set up our tour with Brigi. We had an amazing tour with Brigi that ended up being six full hours. I and my family were amazed at the passion and depth of knowledge that Brigi had about Budapest and Hungary. She was a delightful tour guide that we would HIGHLY recommend. Now I understand why Orsolya gets nothing but top reviews on Trip Advisor. 5 stars !!Frank from Washington, DC

Orsolya. Orsolya, or Orshie was our lovely guide in Hungary for both Buda and Pest. We were a family of five, with kids in tow between the ages of 15 and 23. Every family member was pleased.Orshie was so charming, sweet, and knowledgeable. She put together a thorough tour for us for two half days, and even prolonged the tour because we could not get enough of Hungary. The weather had dropped so low before our arrival, that before we even got to Hungary Orshie had arranged a car for us. How thoughtful was that! We all highly recommend Orshie for your future trip to Hungary.Amy from New York!

exploring hungary with orsolya. It was our great good fortune and thorough research that led us to Orsolya. Orsi asked what we wanted before we ever arrived and was ready when she picked us up at the train station to begin with an overview of both Buda and Pest. She gave us the history of both Hungary and Budapest and took us to monuments and churches that brought her words to life. Her warm and engaging style had us wanting to learn more about this history. My husband is Hungarian and I really wanted to know about his country and she was so well versed that I was excited to take home to him my new information. She even helped me with pronunciation of our name and town of his ancestors and recorded a pronunciation for him on my phone. He loves it - we can finally really pronounce our name! Even though the weather was not ideal - make that it was pretty awful with rain and snow and very cold temperature, Orsi was always positive and upbeat and took us to warm places for tea and Hungarian sweets just when we needed it most. We got out of town one day and she was equally well versed on the history and knowledge of three little towns I had previously known nothing about. In sum - Orsi was so warm, so genuine that each day with her was a specail treat and I will be back with my husband and we will arrange for her to be our guide to let him learn more about his homeland.

The best way to enjoy the sights, sounds and tastes of Budapest!. We can't imagine Budapest without Orsolya! My friend and I had 2.5 days in this city and enjoyed every moment of it under her attentive care and guidance. Our Hungarian adventure began when Orshi picked us up from the train station with a driver and provided a great overview of Budapest. We saw Heroes Square, Széchenyi Bath, the beautiful parks, Buda Castle, the Fisherman's Bastion, a Danube evening cruise and more. Information about each sight was thorough and informative, yet provided in a fun and casual manner. She was attentive to our special interests and all of our silly questions. Day two was a lovely walking tour. It was quite cold and rainy, but her cheerful soul distracted us from any weather issues. The walking tour included top sights around the city as well as hidden treasures. Ah, the coffee shops too! She described each delectable pastry to satisfy of curiosity and fascination. Day three we trekked out of town to see the Danube Bend and a bit of the country. Even the conversation in the car was enjoyable. My friend and I had different interests and Orshi kept us both in the moment... every moment. I would HIGHLY recommend this very charming and lovely guide. Thank you, Orsolya!

Amazing guide. I knew nothing about Hungary until I visited it in person, which made it interesting, my guide who was so impressive, active and helpful. Briggi had so much knowledge about the Hungarian history, Turkish, Austrian and the Hungarian kings...The city itself tells you the story and when u have a guide who has great knowledge and willingness to teach the tourists the history of this country....I strongly support you guys to experience such guides and I am confident that you will love it ....

Above and beyond. Orsolya was a fantastic, kind, accommodating, and patient companion who was more like a friend than a guide. I had requested for a food and wine tour, but given that Sunday was my only availability, she had to make adjustments to account for the closed markets. The places she found were excellent, including a wine bar, cafes, and a local flea market/farmer's market where I got to taste cheeses, jams, and juices, as well as ask questions to the vendors through Orsolya, who was so patient. In the end, she spent more time with me than she was required to, leaving me with an immense appreciation not only for her, but also for the city.

Reliable, funny and trustworthy local guide. I had to plan a 3 day tour of Budapest for a group of 10 ppl and came across Travel guide Hungary, the reviews on trip advisor were encouraging and Orsolya made a plan for our 3 day trip. With day 1 being a tour of Budapest, 2nd day was the Danube bend tour visiting  eztergim, visegrad and Szentendre. And for the 3rd day it was a tour of Eger followed by an excellent wine tasting tour. Orsi was a great guide, friendly, knowledgeable, funny with a great attitude. And considering the size if our group, was always willing to make adjustments for the comfort of everybody. Definitely have no problems recommending her to anybody. You can completely trust her to take care of you while you're there.

One of the Best Tours Ever!. Budapest would not have been the same without our private tour with Orsolya! My wife and (live in New York City) and like to take a private tours in most every city we visit. Many tour guides are great in that they point out the major sights to see and give a good background and history of that city. This is generally our expectation of a private tour.However, Orsolya exceeded our expectations in every way! Her knowledge of the Budapest (both its history and future) and her ability to communicate this throughout the tour is truly remarkable. Never once did she look at her watch to see when the "tour would be over" or ever rush us and not take the time to answer any questions we had. We really had one of our best tours ever, and most importantly, we had a really fun day thanks to Orsolya!You can tell from the moment you meet her that you are going to have a very special time... And we had just that! She really made our trip to Budapest one of our most memorable travel experiences. We will definitely be back to Budapest and have another tour with Orshi.

Rock Star of Budapest Travel Guides. Orsalya("Orsi") provided our family - including 2 teenage girls- a perfect visit to Budapest. She was extremely personable and sweet. We felt as if we met a family member. She was prompt and professional. She tailored the trip to our interests. The City is very "walkable" and she was enthusiastic and funny. She allowed us to make excellent use of our time. She was also very generous with her time. Never felt like she was on a clock or in a hurry.Her knowledge was deep but she made the rich and complex history very relatable for all of us (no easy task with 2 teenagers!). We are all still remembering that vacation so fondly and have Orsi to thank!!

Orsolya - Great guide and a great tour. The wife and I combined 2 of Orsolya's tours to take the entire day seeing and learning about Budapest. She was knowledgeable and fun to be with, Her enthusiasm for her country and Hungary's new freedom were almost as impressive as the sights and her knowledge of Budapest. See if you can arrange for her to take you on a tour of the Opera House when it is closed to the general public, or to the private room at the baths where the minnows will eat the dead skin from your feet. We loved Budapest, and we feel like we had a really good guide in Orsolya to show us around.

all expectations were met!. Orsolya made whole trip worthwhile! Her knowledge of the history...not just Hungary, Europe was so impressive... Any questions I had, had been answered! I would recommend to travel with "Travel Guide Hungary - Private Tours" to anyone. It worth every minute of your time.As far as me, I am coming back to Hungary, to see more of it with Orsolya!

Custom tour in Budapest. It was my first time in Budapest and I wanted to see and learn as much as possible from the city. We did two custom tours, on each day one.With Orsolya we seen the best places of Budapest. Orsolya is very motivated, informative, has a lots of knowledge, knows the history and a great sense of humor.We had a great time and lots of fun. I would definitely recommend Orsolya as your tour guide.

Orsolya Sets The Bar For Excellence. Simply put, Orsi is exceptional. Her command of English is excellent, her personality is outgoing and engaging, and her depth of knowledge second to none. We had all of three or four hours to tour with her including specific requests. As a result, she tailored our tour to our interests, making the time we spent with Orsolya all the more meaningful. Having said that, she went the extra mile by, showing us additional sites Orsi felt would be of interest.We made arrangements ahead of time exclusively by e-mail and everything came off without any glitches.In short, when considering a Budapest tour guide Orsi unequivocally is the best!

Wonderful Tour!. Orsolya gave our family of 8 a fantastic tour of Budapest, full of insights and interesting nuggets of information. She was very accommodating and flexible and adjusted the tour according to the group's interests. I would not hesitate to recommend her services to others planning a tour of Budapest. Wonderful day in a fabulous city!

Beautiful City. Beautiful city as seen on Mission Impossible 4 movie. Evening Cruise on Blue Danube River, with Johan Strauss backgroud music, dinner with local traditional food: Hungarian Goulass. Very Amazing !

A Sunday with Orsi. After traveling on the Viking Odin we(4 of us) contracted with Orsolya to walk us around Budapest on a beautiful Sunday morning. We are glad we did!! Not only was she very pleasant and well informed she gave us insights from her generation of the historical events that are affecting present day Hungary. It is very difficult for Americans to understand the complexities of being conquered and subjected by a suppressive foreign entity. Orsi gave us an enlightened perspective of not only the buildings and history of the city but a modern day outlook of a younger generation Hungarian to the pressures facing the evolution of their country. We strongly encourage future visitors to contact her and enjoy a wonderful tour.

Orsi is the best in Budapest!. Orsi (Orsolya) is an absolutely delightful young lady who will make your tour both fun and memorable! She is so engaging, and helped us understand Budapest in a unique way. She has the perspective of youth but the knowledge of a much older person - she is incredibly well read and has mastered the history or her beautiful city. Our favorite parts of our evening city tour were the walk through the Jewish Quarter, the view from Buda hill and of course our "private" boat ride along the Danube at night. The view of Parliament from the water at night is spectacular! She also told us how to get to other sites such as "Memento Park" which we highly recommend. Orsi is simply the BEST in Budapest!

Personal and flexible. 6 of us had a wonderful time in Budapest and the highlight was our tour guide, Orsalya. She was knowledgeable, flexible and clearly passionate about sharing her city with others. Her English is excellent, and she was always willing to personalize the tour depending on our needs and desires. She was also fun and it is a pleasure to spend the day with someone whose company is so enjoyable!

Budapest City Tour. A buddy and I shared the cost of a private tour with Orsolya [Orsi] and what a great day it was! She guided us to all the important sites by foot and public transfer, then called in a cab when the feet needed rest. While the historic information was plentifull, it was the little touches of coffee shop gems and fine restaurants that completed the day. Orsi becomes one of the group as opposed to traditional guides; her personality is well suited for this. Even as the day ended she left us with enough information to take care of a second day, such as a Danube Cruise (#7 pier!) and a half day at the public baths. This is a beautiful young lady who loves what she does, loves her city and loves life................and we would encourage others to seek her out. We found her on 'Toursbylocals'. Doog & Mikiman

Outstanding private tour by Andrew Illes. We spent two outstanding days touring the countryside in Northern Hungary and then visiting Szentendre and Skanzen in the Budapest area, with Andrew (Andras) Illes of budapesttours@gmail.com. His professionalism and skill in conducting such tours, knowledge of Hungarian history and culture, English and Hungarian fluency, seeing the beautiful countryside in his very comfortable air conditioned car, recommendations of local places to stop for lunch . . . it was all wonderful! Arranging the tour by e-mail in advance was easy, and Andrew was very flexible in tailoring the tour to our particular interests. Andrew added greatly to our visit in Hungary, and allowed us to explore and experience areas beyond Budapest in a relaxed way and within our limited travel time. Definitely a five star experience!

Budapest on it s best!!!. If you'd let me give Orsolya more than 5 starts I would. She was the absolute BEST guide I've ever had. Here knowlede of Budapest and really all of Hungary is encyclopedic. On our next trip there we will use her again. She understands people and seems to have a knack for feeling what the interests are after a short time and then caters here itinerary to her guests. My familiy and I absolutely addored here!!!

Excellent Budapest Private Guide. I was in Budapest in June 2012 and wanted a half-day tour to introduce me to the city. I found Orsolya on the internet. She had wonderful reviews and seemed to be very competent. Orsolya arranged for a driver for us, which was very comfortable and allowed me to see most of the highlights of the city. They picked me up at my hotel. Both Orsolya and the driver were incredibly nice and gracious. Orsolya's English is perfect, she is charming and has a university education that provided her with a wealth of knowledge about the history of Hungary, Budapest and its people. She loves to tell stories and historical anecdotes, which are really interesting to listen to. I would absolutely recommend Orsolya to any group, large or small. She can also give you tips on shopping and restaurants that are very useful. I left time to explore Budapest at the end of the day by myself, and Orsolya made sure I was pointed in the right direction.

private tour of budapest by Orsolya Morvai. Orsolya Morvai's tour of Budapest was so good. She knows so much about her country. Her enthusiasm was wonderful and you could tell she loved it. I would recomend her tours to anyone! You can google her or go to local tours.com for her tour listings. Bdapest was a great place to visit and Orsolya made it even better

Two wonderful Half-Days in Budapest. We spent 5 days in Budapest this past May, 2012, and thought due to the language we would hire a private guide for two, 4 hour excursions. After reviewing all the various guides online, we chose Orsolya Morvai (Orsi to her friends :). She...was....AMAZING!!! So much energy, knowledge about history, architecture, and culture. She took us into places we would have never found, and even got us into a few places we didn't belong (like a wonderful Art Nouveau apartment building).Her English is excellent and if the excursions in the City of Budapest are typical of her skills, you will have a great time with her as your guide on any trip she offers. I only wish we had the time to do the Wine Tour! So much Tokai, so little time :(Reid Addis

Private Tour Guide. Enjoyed our three tour of Budapest with professional guide Joel Rappaport. Joel was a pleasant guide with a nice vehicle and fluent English. Provided a broad perspective, history, high points of both cities recommended attractions and food options.http://www.budapestprivateguide.hu/

Average tour - Not that much about Jewish history. Our guide was Petra. Although she was very well informed about the Jewish traditions and places in Budapest, during the tour she didn't cover the historical aspects. Our expectation, according to the tour description, was to review the history of the Jewish community in Budapest. However, the tour was more focused on Jewish traditions.
Budapest Jewish Heritage Tour. Our tour guide was fabulous. She was extremely knowledgeable in her Jewish history. Highly recommend.
Fantastic & interesting tour. We had a wonderful tour with Petra. She was insightful, interesting and engaging. Worth every cent and more.

Worth Your Time. We were in Budapest for just a few days and I wanted to make sure we spent some time in the Jewish Quarter - very glad we found this tour company. Our guide was very sweet and knowledgeable. It was a relaxing walking tour that highlighted all of the spots that are listed on their website tour description. There were about 13 people in our group which was very manageable. We did the short tour (2.5-3 hours) and it gave us just enough of a feel for the area to decide on our own which areas we wanted to give more time later in the day. I was very pleased with our decision to book this company.

Fascinating insights.... We are not Jewish. Most of our fellow tour participants were..from Canada, USA and Australia. We signed up because we thought it might give us a different perspective from the regular walking tours of Budapest. We were right! This specialized focus brought this section of Budapest to life. We saw the specialized architecture, unique (kosher!) coffee shops, graffiti art, and the lack of a ghetto found in other European cities. Our guide told us of her own familiy's Jewish history, was full of anecdotes and humour. The tour includes admission to the magnificent Synagogue, paid for by the Emporer and designed by a Christian architect...no wonder it resembles a Cathedral! Also included was a personalized tour of the Jewish Heritage Centre where a very intense local curator took us through the exhibits in detail. The highlight for me was the memorial honouring Holocaust victims , a wonderful willow tree made of metal with names inscribed on every leaf. Heroes who helped to rescue Jews at great personal danger were also honoured (Wallenberg, Sir Nicholas Winton, local Catholic clergy etc).An unusual, educational, fun and satisfying tour!

Past to Present. We took the tour to see the synagogues but the tour turned out to be much more than that. It was a delightful experience to see the history and learn so much in such a short time. The past met the present and intertwined beautifully. Our guide was OUTSTANDING and the knowledge we gained was unbelievable. Amazing and wonderful tour!!!

Wonderful experience. We were very fortunate that there was only one other couple in or tour so it became a very intimate tour. I did tell everyone that it was a wonderful experience not to be missed . Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and spoke English well. It was the highlight of out time In Budapest . I also enjoyed meeting our museum guide.

Comprehensive, Balanced, Professional and Engaging. I took the Jewish Heritage Grand Tour with Petra this morning. She was experienced and personable and she tailored the tour perfectly to suit our small but diverse group. As a tourism industry professional, I would heartily recommend this tour to anyone and everyone.

Tour with Petra. We took this tour with Petra and learned so much information. We were able to visit a number of synagogues (we took the extended tour), and even had a yummy dessert at a local bakery. Petra was very friendly, funny, and knowledgeable. I highly recommend a tour with her.

Very motivational & uplifting!. We were lucky enough to have our tour with a lovely guide called Petra last week.She was not only incredibly knowledgable, but she was so upbeat, friendly & always smiling!Petra's knowledge was city wide & not just focused on the subject of the tour.We would definitely recommend this tour & ask for Petra!

Jewish heritage tour very moving and insightful. Booked through Viatour, excellent guide in Fatima who led the small group through the former ghettos, great Synagogue and other places of significant interest. Well paced and very insightful.

Top Marks. Great tour, VERY informative, Victoria was not only extremely knowledgeable on the subject, very engaging and pleasant - and spent extra time with us at the end to help with some research issues. Five Stars Plus

Informative and emotional. Our guide of the tour was Petra. She was very knowledgeable and articulate. The tour itself was interesting. It's a must for those who care about the history of the Jews in Hungary.

Jewish Heritage Tour not to be missed. I bought a bundle ticket at the synagogue that covered an English speaking guide for the synagogue, Jewish culture walking tour (about 1 hr) and entrance to the museum on your own with an audio guide (must leave ID with musuem desk so bring card with your name like an AARP card..) Allow 3 hours. Closed on Saturday and avoid Sunday (very long lines.) At the ticket counter it is confusing since I was not sure if I could purchase a bundle without the walking tour. (others shared my confusion) so ask. I suspect not. I also recommend the Viator Budapest Jewish Cuisine and Culture Walking Tour (reviewed separately.) Enjoy!

Jewish Heritage Tour. Most informative walk with Fatima. Be sure to request her. She met us at our hotel and then strolled with us to the Jewish Quarter. She is very knowledgeable and passionate about her work. Best way to understand the Jewish history and presence today in Budapest! Take a 2.5 hour tour or more.

Excellent Jewish Walking Tour. We took the Essential Tour which consisted of the basic Jewish heritage tour and an interior visit to the Dohany Street Synagogue and the Jewish Museum. It was excellent and very informative. I highly recommend this tour.

I would give this six stars if i could!. Other reviews have really said it all in terms of the coverage of the tour and people's emotional response.I am not Jewish and have never been in a synagogue before, but clearly I understand the history of persecution. So, I wanted to understand more about Jewish traditions, the experiences of Jewish people in Hungary and to visit a synagogue.The tour did not disappoint. Our guide - Petra - was simply marvelous. She was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about her subject and guided us around the various sites with absolute professionalism. The history lessons as we walked along the tour were superb. I found the visit to the Dohany Synagogue really interesting , especially as our guide was brought up as a Catholic but had been to a synagogue a number of times and was able to talk about many of the differences. Discussion around the tree of life was very poignant. I also leaned about the generosity of people like Estee Lauder and Tony Curtis.The visit to the museum - all included in the ticket price - was given by a different guide. This was also excellent, explaining some of the traditions in a little more detail than usual for the benefit of those who were not Jewish. It was also just the right length - 40 minutes.The entire tour is billed as 2.5 hours but lasted about 20 minutes longer.I would highly recommend the tour - a real 'must see' when visiting Budapest.

Take the tissues as this is very emotional. Amongst the incredible beauty of Budapest is a violent and brutal history. The Jewish Heritage Tour was heartbreaking, emotional and uplifting. The tour started at the shoes on the Danube....if you don't cry here then you have no heart. The history of the extermination of the Jewish community is very pre leant in Budapest. The synagogue stands proud and tall....many bombs tried to flatten this building but it was rebuilt thanks to Este Lauder and Jerry Lewis. Here brings together the old and the new. An incredibly beautiful building. It's the gardens that more the moist eyes to uncontrollable tears......mass graves of those locked in a ghetto during winter to starve and freeze to death. Take the time and show them your compassion as you wander the gardens and read through more than 2 thousand names on the wall of remembered everything. The tree of souls...it's impossible to be stirred even further......each leaf has a persons name on it and there are thousands upon thousands of names here. It's an emotional tour but history that we should never forget. Humanity's darkest hour!Well worth the time to take this tour.

Excellent tour. We thoroughly enjoyed the Essential tour with Fatima of the Budapest Jewish Heritage Tour organization. She was very knowledgeable, spoke clearly and was easy to understand. At the end of the tour she left as at the Dohany Synagogue where a guide there explained the building and you could visit the small museum on the premises.

BUDAPEST JEWISH GRAND TOUR. My wife and I learnt a lot on the Jewish Grand Tour of Budapest. We toured the Jewish district and really valued from the knowledge from our tour guide. The three synagogues were very inspirational to visit and also you could almost feel the history when sitting in each of they synagogues, very spiritual. Fatima who was our tour guide was AMAZING, very informed and also especially great at retelling the amazing history with humour and insight. We learnt a lot about Raoul Wallenberg and Carl Lutz which we really enjoyed hearing from Fatima. We finished up by having amazing cakes at Frolich Bakery. We would highly recommend the tour and it is must to do when visiting Budapest.

Fascinating and Absorbing. This is a must-do for anyone interested in Jewish history in Hungary and a should do for everyone else. It involves three restored synagogues, a museum, and a loving memorial for those who were lost and those who saved others. We booked through Viator and had a most wonderful guide, Petra, who was delightful and engaging, and a wealth of information

Unforgettable Tour. Petra, knows how to transmit her passion about the Budapest Jewish history. The group is small and u have the chance to meet another guide who survived to the Shoah thanks to Raoul Wallemberg passport. I hardly reccomended this tour

Good once we made it there!. Our booking confirmation email didn't state the meeting point of the tour. We arrived at the marker given on the website at the allotted time and waiting for 15 minutes. No one showed. We called their office and after some confusion they rearranged our tour for the afternoon at 2pm.We arrived at 2pm and just managed to catch our guide who was about to leave. Apparently the tours start 15 minutes before the time they tell you so watch out for that. The tour itself was incredibly insightful. Budapest has so much history to offer and is extremely complex. I would strongly recommend anyone going on this tour to read and understand a summary of Budapest's history from 20th century onward in order to get the most out of it.

Grand Tour. We did the grand tour with Petra and it was very interesting look into the Jewish history of the area, from when they settled in the area to the present day. It was also great to be able to go into the different synagogues and into the museum as well.

Important History. Those who don't learn from history are doomed to repeat it. So much to learn about the Jewish community and their place in Hungary. Petra was a very knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide.

More than we expected, in many ways.. Petra lead our tour and did a wonderful job. She told stories about Jewish history in Budapest which include triumph, survival and horror, and for a young non-Jewish woman, she was thoughtful and respectful. The Grand Tour added just a little bit more, but I was already satiated by the time we got to this part. Highly recommend this tour company.

Grand tour. We did a grand tour with Fatima, she was brilliant, a very knowledgeable and friendly guide, gave us lots of history and added the personal touch. I would recommend her and the tour to anyone going to Budapest.
Great information. Petra did a fantastic job of telling us about the history of this amazing city. We enjoyed her story telling and humor, and we definitely learned a lot!

Important part of visiting Budapest. When visiting a new city, it is always interesting to learn about it's history. Although Budapest can be a very beautiful place, it has a history of persecuting Jews and other individuals. It is important to learn from history or it will repeat itself. The Jews have lived in Budapest for many many years. They made valuable contributions to the city and to Hungary. They built beautiful synagogues However, they were also herded into a ghetto. The Jewish ghetto was mostly destroyed by the Nazis. The Jewish community was decimated. However, there are still many important sites from the Jewish community that remain . A tour of the history of the Jews in Budapest is an important part of visiting Budapest. Remember. Never again.

Excellent!. Ursula took us on a tour of the Jewish Quarter and 2 of its synagogues and explained the history of Budapest Jewry. She was extremely knowledgable and we're very glad we took the tour. I agree with other people that it's not necessary to pay for the Grand Tour. We went to the Orthodox synagogue on our own and was given a tour by someone at the synagogue. It is also beautiful. We also visited the Conservative synagogue on our own which has a historical display of synagogues in Eastern Europe.

Much more than I expected. Joel was our knowledgeable guide throughout the Jewish quarter -- and its surrounds. He never rushed us and patiently fielded our questions, all the while bringing history to life. He even suggested a post tour kosher restaurant...a portion for one could easily feed 4.
A professional, and thoughtful experience. Highly recommended.

Enjoyed by this non-Jew, just dress modestly. We heard the Jewish quarter was not to be missed, so we headed here and ended up taking the walking tour and touring the synagogues. All the proceeds go toward the Jewish community and their post-WWII rebuilding efforts so we felt good about supporting this local organization. The Holocaust history in Hungary is horrific and shocking. I've toured several Holocaust memorials around the world. That dark moment in history is candidly and respectfully discussed here, with an expected local focus. However, it was so much more than that too, touching on post-war Hungarian-Jewish history, rebuilding, and the modern Jewish culture in Budapest. We are not Jewish and still found it to be fascinating, accessible, and well with the time. The synagogue was also worth touring. It is the 2nd largest in the world, the largest in Europe, and has a unique cathedral-like design that reflects local historical context. Ladies, one thing to note: you can't tour the synagogues unless your shoulders and knees are covered. We weren't dressed especially immodestly but one person in our group couldn't go in because her shorts were too short--a few inches above her knee. They do sell pashminas you can use to wrap around your waist as a skirt.
Great Jewish Heritage Tour with Petra. I had a wonderful time with Petra. She has a lovely smile, a vibrant personality and many stories to tell. She is a great guide, her tour was a real treat.

Outstanding and informative tour!. Our tour guide, Joel was outstanding. His knowledge, command of English, and ability to explain all the sites we saw was wonderful. I had booked this tour but the date was wrong and hadn't checked my last email from the company due to traveling and no wifi service but David was so understanding and at the last minute gave us the tour with the guide Joel even though it had been my mistake. I so appreciated their understanding as we were leaving on a river cruise ship just after our private tour ended. They main synagogue is gorgeous and we gained so much information by having a tour of Jewish Budapest. This is a great company to work with.

An amazing tour with a phenomenal guide!. Petra led us through a great tour and told us much about our locations. There was never a boring or dull moment during the tour and we all learned so many new things, and learned even more about facts we already knew. We definitely recommend going on this tour, and Petra!

Great, informative tour with guide Petra. I was traveling with my wife, mother and sister and we had a great tour with our tour guide, Petra. She was really well informed, spoke impeccable English for a non Native speaker, and managed to find a perfect balance between humor and the seriousness that the historical events demanded. Ultimately we were glad we had gone with this tour, as it we would never have known all the places to go or the background behind them, and it was great to get a real local's perspective on things at the same time.

Petra rocks. We really enjoyed our tour with Petra. She was extremely knowledgeable and professional yet informal and responsive. Petra gave us great background info and answered our questions, was very understanding and considerate of our feelings in these emotional settings. I was with my mid-thirties daughter, son & DIL, and we all agreed Petra was the best tour guide we encountered in Budapest and Prague. The Jewish Heritage tour added greatly to the experience of visiting Budapest.

Wonderful insight into Jewish history in budapest. Petra was a vibrant and knowledgeable guide. A visit to the museum was great but without her talk we would have missed many many parts of history. Both my husband and I loved it. We also did a Jewish quarters tour in Prague and this was much different. Both were good. We also visited Trebic in Slovakia. All were insightful and different. I highly recommend this tour in budapest

Family history. My husband and I had a private 2.5 hrs tour of the Jewish Heritage in Hungary. Our guide, Petra, was very knowledgeable, answered all questions we had regarding the Austrian-Hungarian Empire, as well as details about WWII and the jewish population. No answer was left unanswered. Very professional. Petra gave us insight on all important aspects of jewish life in Budapest before, during and after WWII. Definitely a great tour. We were also lucky, that another couple didn't show up.

I wish I Liked it More. My husband and I signed up for the extended walking tour. While I am not regretful of this decision, I also not think it was worth the extra money. We visited a handful of of stops which were nearby, but I did not feel like we gained much more information. There was a Kosher bakery we were scheduled to go to which ended up being closed. Our guide, Joel was trying to find an alternative location, but we instead decided to end the tour and ho on our way, to no fault of our guide.Joel was very knowledgeable about the sites we visited and answered many questions from our large group (about 20 of us, if not more). The majority of our time was spent at the Dohány Street Synagogue. There is a museum with many donated Jewish artifacts, which a different scheduled guide told us about. It was OK, but there were detailed placards that we could read as well, which would have been my preference - free time to select the items that we were interested. For the amount of money that we paid, I didn't feel like I was walking away with a bigger wealth of knowledge. However, this may be in part due to being in a large group.

Fantastic Tour. Just completed the Jewish Heritage Tour and what a fantastic experience. The tour guide was a young lady called Petra whose knowledge seemed encyclopaedic. This combined with her excellent English and genuine enthusiasm made for a truly remarkable tour and one that I would willingly recommend to anyone.

Knowledgeable guide!. Fatima was my tour guide and she was amazing. She knew so much about the history of Jewish people in Budapest and Hungary. It was great to get the guided tour of the Jewish Museum and to get Fatima's commentaries on the development of the Jewish Quarter, the Wollenberg memorial park, and the Dohany St Synagogue. She really made it an amazing experience. A couple of people even "accidentally" joined our tour because she was so informative. They were disappointed to find out that it was a private tour!

Interesting history and sites. We went with Petra on a walking tour of the Jewish ghetto area and the Dohany Synagogue. It was a 2 1/2 hour tour packed with information. Petra was very knowledgeable about the area, Jewish practices and history of Hungarian Jewry. She made the tour interesting and paced it to the group. We were seven unrelated people so you can go as a couple or a single and feel equally comfortable. Her English was perfect. Don't miss the tour or Petra.

Good experience. We did a Grand Tour with Jewish Heritage Walking Tours. We had Fatima. She did an excellent job leading our tour. She gave a great overview of Jewish History in Hungary leading us to many sites. What we really liked was going in to the Temples as opposed to just being outside. This prevented us from having to go back later. E enjoyed our tour and would recommend them.

Fascinating Jewish Heritage Walking Tour in Budapest with Fatima. The tour was very informative and interesting. Fatima is a young, personable guide with a great passion and knowledge base regarding the subject matter. The tour was well paced and Fatima answered all questions our small group presented to her. Compared to the cost of the same tour offered through Viking River Cruises, we paid only 1/2 price per each of us. I would highly recommend this tour to my friends.

Important Window into History. The Jewish Heritage Tour provided really excellent information regarding the history of the historical Jewish area of Budapest. Our guide, Petra, was exceptional - bright, knowledgeable, and fun. The tour visited many of the locations of historical importance and remembrance, with interesting details associated with each one.

Our time spent with Petra. Our tour with Petra was excellent. She met us promptly at the Sztehlo Gabor Monument and away we went. Her English is excellent and her knowledge is great. Over a 2 1/2 to 3 hour period, we walked and talked as she passed us by the Rumbach St Synagogue and then on to the Dohany St Synagogue where she left us in the capable hands of Esther for an hour or so to tour the Jewish Museum. Petra subsequently met us again to show and explain the buildings and the courtyards of the Synagogue including the Heroes' Temple, the Raoul Wallenberg Memorial Park and the Jewish Cemetery. It's an easy tour over relatively flat and stable cobblestones. Bring your camera and gentlemen, bring either your hat, or a bobby pin to keep your paper Kippah (Yarmulke) from flying off of your head.

Interesting and informative tour. We did the essentials tour on the last morning of our visit to Budapest. We found the tour really interesting. Our guide Fatima is extremely enthusiastic and her English is perfect. She presented a really good insight into the history of Jewish life in Budapest. She managed to present a positive story of Jewish life in Budapest while still discussing the terror and sadness around the holocaust.I would thoroughly recommend this tour

Fascinating Jewish Heritage Walk with Fatima. We just did the essential Jewish tour of Budapest's old Jewish quarter with Fatima Korok and have to say this was a most fascinating and enjoyable tour around this both historic and now funky district. Fatima is down to earth and very knowledgeable with a keen insight into a compelling element of Budapest life - both past and present. Would recommend this tour to everyone.

Outstanding tour and guide. Both fascinating and disturbing, the Jewish Heritage Tour was made exceptionally interesting by our guide, Fatima, who is lively, engaging, knowledgeable, and passionate about Jewish heritage. Happily, the tour lasted longer than advertised because of Fatima's enthusiasm and the keen interest of our small group.

Budapest Jewish Heritage Tour. We took a private tour with guide Fatima and it was an excellent, albeit often sobering, experience. Fatima was knowledgeable and articulate and provided context we needed to understand what we were seeing (we are not Jewish). We valued that Fatima shared her personal experiences and opinions. We are especially grateful she told us about her appreciation for the Shoes on the Danube Memorial and we made it a point to visit based on her recommendation. We had not learned about that memorial in our advance research about Budapest and it was one of the most moving experiences of our visit to this amazing city. Our guide in the museum was also very good.

Budapest Jewish Heritage Walking Tour. I took the Grand Tour today with some friends. Our tour guide was Fatima and she was simply amazing! The tour was four hours long, and covered the Grand Synogogue, the Jewish Museum, the Orthodox Synogogue and the old Jewish Quarter. Fatima was extremely knowledgeable, personable and entertaining. I cannot recommend this tour and Fatima enough! Fascinating, I learned quite a lot about the Jews of Hungary!

A Tour Well Worth Doing. I recently did the Jewish Heritage Grand Tour during a 6-day trip to Budapest. It was a really enjoyable thing to do. The Grand Tour is about 4 hours' long. On the day, the tour was a group of about nine. Our guide was Petra, a delightful person to spend a few hours with. The tour makes it way through Madách Square, the Rumbach Street Synagogue, Dohány Street Synagogue, Jewish Museum, Martyrs’ Cemetery, Raoul Wallenberg Memorial Park, Tree of Life, Heroes’ Temple, Jewish Center, the Carl Lutz memorial, the Gozsdu Passage, and the Kazinczy Street Synagogue. The stop at the Rumbach Street Synagogue included a very interesting talk and guide of their exhibition. The Kazinczy Street Synagogue is very pretty and I probably wouldn't have found it without doing the tour. The tour was well timed. Petra was full of interesting information and her presentation style was friendly and informative. She didn't stop smiling from the start to the finish of the tour. I really enjoyed the tour and recommend it as part of a trip to beautiful Budapest.

Very worthwhile tour !. I took the grand tour and my guide was Fatima, she was well spoken and very knowledgeable of the Jewish Quarter, its history and synagogues. She seemed to be well connected in the community. This tour is highly recommended and very worthwhile. Thank you Fatima and good luck to you
Great Tour with Petra. A very fascinating tour of Jewish history in Budapest with Petra. She went out of her way to inform us.

Ms Fatima Korok. Fatima gave us the most memorable experience touring the Jewish quarters. Her knowledge and enthusiasm was truly amazing!I recommend anyone visiting Budapest and interested in a private or group tour to request Fatima.

A fascinating and enjoyable tour. We enjoyed the essential tour. It was a great insight into Jewish history and culture. The trip to the main synagogue and the Jewish museum was fascinating, and our guide Fatima was both charming and knowledgeable.

Fantastic tour and guide. We were a group of 8 and had booked the grand tour which was 3 and a half hours. Our guide was Fatima and she was fantastic- very knowledgeable and explained clearly the history of the Jewish people in Budapest. The whole tour was excellent and the history was brought to life by Fatima. It was also wonderful to meet a survivor who was rescued by Raul Wallenberg, who showed us round the museum, and we would have all loved to have time to ask him some questions about his experience. The only thing we would have liked would have been slightly longer in the Dohany St synagogue so we could look in the shops.

Very nice tour!! . I was so lucky I managed to get almost a personal tour with a very nice guide!! She took me to the beautiful synagogue and showed me around the most hidden and fascinating corners of the Jewish district behind! Absolutely recommended :)
awesome!. I have joined to jewish tour in budapest and it was really awesome. the guide was funny and cheerful

Excellent tour. HiI was in Budapest last MondayI make the Jewish grand tour with Fatima korokWas incredibleHer guiding was full of information, she show me a lot of places even those that not every time are openHer way was gently and sympathy all the timeShe give also tips for the next day and call to arrange to open places for me, even was a national holiday in HungaryI strongly recommended the Jewish tour with FatimaMenashe Zugman

So good we did the tour twice!. My husband and I found out about this from our B&B and so happy we did the tour. Joel was our guide and was informative and engaging. I learned so much about the area and history of the Jewish culture in Budapest and Hungary. I am not one who remembers much about the history when I do tours but Joel did such a great job I still tell about things I learned from him! We loved it so much we took my mother and her partner there when they arrived later in the week and they were equally thrilled with the tour!

A wonderful experience and must-see for all!. Even though my husband and I had toured the Great Synagogue and surrounding Jewish Quarter during a prior visit to Budapest, we thoroughly enjoyed our 4-hour tour with Joel. It was like having a private tour since we were joined by just 2 other lovely young women from the Netherlands. Joel was so knowledgeable and passionate about his city and its unique Jewish Heritage. I was particularly impressed with all of the research he had done to make the tour more interesting and authentic, and the photos he shared from his tablet throughout the tour were just fascinating. The 4 hours+ just flew by. We would highly recommend this tour to people of all ages and backgrounds but it does require a lot of standing and walking. We also want to mention that the tour within the Synagogue was conducted by an "in-house" guide and ours was exceptional. Sandra made an effort to connect with everyone on the tour and make each exhibit seem relevant to our daily lives. Truly a must-see for anyone visiting Budapest.

Lenyugozo!!. Joel, Zsolt was my guide during the Jewish Heritage Tour today. It was amazing!! I was amazed by these beautiful sites even though they described quite a sad event and period. I was really happy to get the chance to visit the Great Synagogue, the garden of it, the Temple of Heroes, the Jewish Museum, and even the Kazincy Synagogue. This latest was my absolute favourite. It is simly amazing, inside and outside. So great that we have such enthusiastic people to talk about all these sites/happenings and spread the knowledge. I have learned so much during this 3,5 hour tour even though I have already had basic knowledge of the Jewish Community and the Holocaust.Great idea to finish the tour at the pastry place. The "flodni" is the absolute favourite. Totally worth every minute of the tour, well structured and "enjoyable" if we can say that concerning the sad events eg. ghetto..Thank you!!

Budapest Jewish Heritage Tours. I found this tour incredibly informative and interesting. The 2 1/2 hours flew by. The history of the Jewish Quarter, the museum, the holocaust exhibits, the Synagogue, all engrossing. Our guide Petra's level of knowledge is quite astounding. She was exuberant, articulate and engaging. Take water and a camera (no flash).

Moving. A must for all. An experiance in history.. Learned many things that was not in my world. We should never forget ourhistory!!! The museum just scratches the surface of the lives of the Jewish people of Budapest. Extremely unforgettable.

Great Eye opener. Petra was a funny, charming and highly informative guide who managed to mix history, humour and a wealth of knowledge into an action packed 2.5 hour tour. Her enthusiasm shone throughout a tour which was brilliant from start to finish. I would recommend that anyone embarking on this tour does a little research in Jewish practices first as you will get so much more out of the vast amount of information you are treated to,

Easy to Overlook. In the basement of the Dohany Synagogue, there is a small museum where photographs of some major events and people of the congregation. These included rabbis who served as well as other distinguished visitors who came to Budapest to view the synagogue. The black and white pictures serve as a means of communicating the events that were important to members of the synagogue. There was only one other person there. If you visit the synagogue, I recommend you take the time to go into the basement to view the photographs.

Charming and informative . Petra was a warm charming and most informative guide .. Happy to answer questions and very engaging .. The area covered and the detail was brilliant .. Loved every minute of it ! Very highly recommended ..

Highest grades for this tour. On a dreary day Petra, our guide, truly brightened things up with her knowledgeable and interesting tour. The Dohany Synagogue was beautiful and we were most impressed with the guide at their museum... The Jewish holidays were so well-explained and the artifacts were fascinating. It took one back in time to an infamous period in Budapest's history and brought it to life.
