The different areas outside the synagogue were really worth the visit and all in all, we recommend this tour most enthusiastically.

Great synagogue and Jewish Heritage museum tour. My mother and I signed up for a tour of the great Budapest synagogue and the Jewish Heritage Museum. Our tour guide, Joel, was really knowledgeable and made the two and a half hours of the tour fly by. He shared both lots of information and his obvious love for the Jewish faith. Our tour group was an English speaking tour. It had people from several different countries and faith backgrounds. I recommend both the tour and the tour guide. Don't miss it. The inside of the synagogue is breathtaking. The history shown in the museum of what happened to the Jews in Hungary in WW2 is still heartbreaking.

The BEST Walking Tour. I'll keep this short. Petra is fantastic. She knows EVERYTHING about the Jewish Heritage of Budapest and is very passionate about the subject.I would give her 6 stars!!She is the BEST..................

Essential Tour was excellent. We were lucky enough to be in a small group of only 4 people and had Petra as our guide for 2.5 hours. The tour is very informative and heart wrenching. The initial part of the tour is a walk to the jewish neighbourhood, with stops on the way. Once we arrived at the Synagogue and museum, we were handed over to a guide who took us through the museum. She was also very knowledgeable and well spoken. We then went into the synagogue and then onto the garden with memorials and the tree of life etc. Very interesting and definitely worth the ticket and time. Petra is amazing and incredibly knowledgeable for a young person. I really enjoyed my time today learning about Jewish heritage.

Both tours excellent. Joel was an informative guide & the tour was both fascinating & heartbreaking. Extended tour was useful though not essential if time limited as highlights were well covered on the basic tour. If you prefer a smaller group & have lots more questions to ask, then the extended tour may be helpful. Alternatively, you can see more by returning to the Great Synagogue and walking round the Jewish quarter on your own afterwards. Either way, highly recommended.

The Grand Tour. Our guide Petra was a knowledgeable, articulate, and enthusiastic source of all things Jewish in Budapest. And as we toured, she kept the historic synagogues, museum, and other landmarks in perspective. We were impressed with the depth of Jewish history in Budapest, saddened by the reminders of the Holocaust, and moved by the vibrance of the present-day Jewish community. The Dohany Street Synagogue is spectacular, and one cannot believe that during Nazi occupation it was used as a stable and the headquarters of Eichmann. We saw in the museum Torah scrolls desecrated and used as tops of drums and articles of clothing. The monuments--the Tree, the monument to Raoul Wallenberg, Sir Nicholas Winton, and Chanah Senesch--were all moving, and we did not even see the shoes on the Danube. We also visited the Orthodox Synagogue which, like the Dohany, is still functioning. Petra, though a patriotic Hungarian, did not excuse her country's choosing the wrong side during WWII--a theme we heard often in Budapest. We concluded the tour with a treat at one of the several kosher restaurants in the Jewish Quarter.

Extended tour is a must. Our tour guide Joel was exceptionally knowledgeable and multilingual. He went out of his way to show us one off sites including location of Gloomy Sunday movie site. Completed tour on October 7, 2015. The extended tour includes the orthodox synagogue which is as spectacular as the well known Dohany synagogue. Two special restorations.

Fascinating. On October 6, 2015 our party of 4 took the deluxe Jewish Heritage Tour. The places to visit are wonderful but as always, the guide makes or breaks the tour. Our guide, Joel was outstanding. He is knowledgeable, discreet, easy to understand, and kept us moving in a kind but firm manner. A definite MUST DO in Budapest.

Bringing Back History. I did some research before taking the tour, I sure created a more impactful tour, little moments that you could put to a location, an act of bravery that took place at that location...a yellowstar house, the Obuda brick factory, the tree of life....they carry more emotional weight when associated with a story. Look at the dwelling, the lifes that were ingrained there and what was lost.

Informative Tour. We had already taken a bus tour and driven by most of the sites covered in this tour. But driving by a place and walking to it with a constant patter of information is not the same thing.Our tour guide was Petra. She is personable, enthusiastic, and speaks English well if with a slight accent. Although not a practicing Jew, she recently discovered she had Jewish ancestors and sought out to learn more about her religious roots. Thus, she is knowledgeable and speaks with great enthusiasm.We felt like we had plenty of time at all the sites we visited. Petra patiently answered any questions and we did not move on until she was satisfied that we were ready to go. I learned a great deal about the Jewish experience in Hungary throughout the centuries.In summary, Petra was a wonderful guide, we learned a great deal, and are glad we added this tour to our itinerary. I strongly recommend it.

Walking tour of the Jewish quarters. Petra was our tour guide. She was very informed, knowledgeable of the Jewish history of the area and very approachable. We learned a great about the Jewish influence in Budapest as well as the tragic mass genocide during WW ll, Would certainly recommend taking a tour with Petra. Bob and Joanne G.

Well worth it - excellent tour guide. Petra was our guide . There were 8 people in the group. 2 were not Jewish, and I think they found it very interesting as well. Petra was extremely well versed in Hungarian and Jewish history, and the history of the city as it related to the Jews - long ago and now. We took the longer tour and it was nice to have a nosh 'o cake at the pastry shop - covered in the tour. Good cake, You will see beautiful synagogues and learn much. We feel that this tour is not to be missed, for both Jews and non Jews.

Our wonderful guide, Petra, made Jewish Budapest, old and new come alive for us.. It so well worth taking this tour of Jewish Budapest, though centred in this area it touches some many more historical aspects , a wonderful city to immerse yourself in past times. All of our group enjoyed the experience which was enhanced by our tour guide, Petra, who was so well informed, enthusiastic and good humoured. Rosemary from Dublin, Ireland.

Wonderful guided tour. Can't praise Petra enough. She was fantastic. Offered great stories and lots of information on Jewish plight in WWII as well as Jewish life in general. Really enjoyed the tour through the synagogue, museum and cemetery. Highly recommend.

In depth look at a tragic piece of Hungarian history. we had a wonderful guide who was a great teacher. We came away with a feeling of having deeply understood what happened to the Jews in the country and in Budapest during the Holocaust. So worth while--one of our favorite experiences in Budapest.

Grand Tour was Memorable. We took the grand walking tour, which provided an excellent overview of Jewish life in Budapest past and present. Much of the tour focused on Jewish history during WWII, which was one of the reasons we took this tour. Our guide, Petra, was excellent, and full of knowledge. We were able to see several synagogues, including the Grand Synagogue complex and memorial garden (very moving), as well as a working Orthodox shul which was co-opted by the Nazis and used as a stable during the war. All places were lovingly restored following the war. The tour ended with a slice of kosher cake, which was also enjoyable.

A morning to remember. We decided to do the Jewish Qtr walk on our last morning in Budapest our Guide a young lady who knew her stuff and was bright and bubbly on our 45-50 min walk. We visited a virtually derelict synagogue and were given the introduction to the Holocaust and the low down on the Hungarian situation in 1943/5. As usual the facts were really shocking but I think everyone expected that.Our walk took us past another orthodox Jewish synagogue and round the boundary of the old ghetto where hundreds of thousands were squashed into tenements. Here and there were buildings from that time one tall "end of terrace" building was a moving site, now derelict.We returned to the Main Synagogue where there is a museum to the holocaust and the graves of 2,200 odd souls found at the site and in buildings where they were discovered by the Russians when they reoccupied the city.I didn't enter the synagogue by this time I was really uncomfortable.We were told that very few Budapest Jews actually still regularly practice their faith. I found this quite sad being a Christian.This is a good walk for the historian, Jewish folk and for the young. Our guide outside was superb in her knowledge.I can away with very mixed emotions. Through the marriage of a relative my family "touched" the holocaust and I have been deeply saddened by it. My strongest thought was that Jewery worldwide needs to harvest the young and especially those like our guide, who are fresh, bright, enthusiastic and full of life. 70 years one we should remember the horror of the past but embrace the potential of the future rather than dwell there?
Budapest Jewish Heritage tour. Fatima was an excellent guide, she made history come to life! The tour was well organised and interesting. We really enjoyed it.

A memorable 'essential' tour. I joined the Basic Jewish Heritage Tour in the afternoon on 17Aug2015. Two lovely senior ladies from The States and I were the only participants in the tour. Our tour guide, Petra, was caring and thoughtful. It was not a fine day, occasionally with heavy showers. Petra even provided raincoats for the two ladies. Her English was very fluent and she spoke very clearly. The poor weather did not diminish our guide's enthusiasm for the elaboration of the subject, nor our interest in the Hungarian Jewry's history and the visit. The highlight was the interior visit of the Dohany Street Synagogue. Magnificent! During the whole time, Petra demonstrated her professionalism and her understanding of what she was presenting. I feel that I was so lucky to encounter a guide who was actually immensely enjoying what she was doing. A very informative and memorable tour!Special thanks should also be given to the lady who guided us in the Jewish Museum. Unfortunately, I did not recall her name. With her presentation, I learnt so much about the history and the everyday life of the Jewish.Considering the price I paid, I have gained much more than I given. Highly recommended!

Fatima was excellent!. We had a great experience with Fatima when visiting in July. She met us at our hotel, and gave a tour all along the way to the Jewish Quarter. Well-informed and engaging, she made the tour very interesting and enjoyable. Total opposite of our Prague tour experience! Highly recommend

Great tour with Petra!. My sister and I went on a tour with Petra last week and had an excellent time. It was just ourselves and two couples in the group, which made for a more intimate experience where we were always able to hear was Petra was saying and she was able to chat to us a little. Her English was perfect and although she wasn't Jewish, she did have a very thorough understanding of the Jewish community in Budapest, both past and present. The tour itself was good although I felt as if we didn't necessarily have enough time in each location. For instance, we visited the Holocaust Memorial Garden behind the Great Synagogue but didn't have any time to look around ourselves or reflect at all. Likewise a little more time looking around the Great Synagogue would be good. The guided tour of the Jewish Museum was excellent and I felt as if it was also very necessary as there was very little information in English about the artefacts. Again, however, the time there was quite limited so my sister and I chose to return later to take our time looking around.Overall, I would recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in learning more about the Jewish history of Hungary in a small group environment.

Great tour with eurama and Ester as EXCELENT travel guide.. We did the 3 hours walking tour with Ester ,she is wonderful guide and knows lots about Hungarian Jews history.
Highly recommend to do this tour.
This is one of a must go tour.

Jewish Heritage Tour. The tour was okay. The tour guide was not Jewish and did not have Jewish family, which limited the personal experiences of the guide. Sometimes she spoke to softly and it was hard to hear. The history was done well but felt that pieces were missing - that said, we did the basic tour and perhaps the longer tour was the better option.

Fatima did a great job!. I have wanted to do this tour for some time so was glad to finally have the opportunity. Fatima, our guide, did a wonderful job. She was quite personable and friendly, and was extremely knowledgeable about Jewish history and events in Hungary. I signed up for the Grand Tour which was approx 4 hours. It was quite hot, but still enjoyed this very much. We had various ages on the tour and she did a good job of accomodating the speed of those who were a bit older- very nice, as not all tour guides are doing that.

Good and thorough tour of the Jewish quarter in Budapest. Our guide, Fatima, led us through the Jewish quarter of Budapest. It was a long and thorough tour, and Fatima had visibly done her research. She provided many interesting details about the area, the buildings, the culture, religion and way of life of Budapest's Jewish population before the second world war, and of the reconstruction efforts since the war.

A Great Tour of Jewish Budapest. We were on an organized tour of Central Europe, so we given a generalized tour by bus of the Jewish area of Pest. Being Jewish we wanted a more in depth look at the Jewish sites in Budapest. Our guide was Petra, a lovely young woman, who had a great deal of information about the sites we visited on our walking tour. You have to get off the bus and do a walking tour to really get the feel of the Jewish area of Budapest. We took the grand tour, the extra time was well worth it. As the tour ended we had lunch in a kosher restaurant near the Kazinczy Synogogue.
Wonderful tour!. Fatima led me, my brother and parents through the Jewish history of Budapest in one afternoon! She was lovely and we learned a great deal!

More praise for Fatima. Her tour of the Jewish quarter of Budapest was one of the highlights of our holiday to the Great Imperial Cities - together with the tour of the Museum in the Great Synagogue by a charming girl whose name I did not make an note of. I would recommend this tour to anyone wanting to find out more about Jewish history in Budapest and in general too.

Fantastic tour with Fatima. Fatima is a passionate guide who lead my me, my husband and 16 year old daughter through a tour of the old Jewish area of Budapest. Her knowledge is unsurpassed and filled with such passion that we learned so much about the history of jews and the synagogues that were build. I can't imagine going on a heritage tour with anyone else.

TRIP TO BUDAPEST - Free Budapest Jewish District Walking Tour. I was on vacation with two friends in Budapest and we did two of the free walking tours offered by TRIP TO BUDAPEST - Free Budapest Walking Tours: The Original and Jewish District Tours. The tour meeting point is Vorosmarty Square (Hard Rock Cafe is also in this square). Daniel was our tour guide and it was very friendly, informative and I learned a lot. During the walking tour, we visited the Great Synagogue, a memorial, cemetery, Tree of Life, birthplace of Theodore Hertzl, the Rumbach Synagogue and the Orthodox Synagogue.

FANTASTIC TOUR!. This was one of the highlights of our trip. The guide - Fatima - was wonderful! She is a wealth of information with a great personality. We toured the Jewish quarter, learned the history of the area including the ghetto during the war, we visited the Jewish Museum, the Dohaney St synagogue (the largest in Europe - this is the non orthodox shul) and the orthodox shul. Both shuls are beautiful with the Dohaney St shul particularly stunning - holding up to 6,000 people. I highly recommend the tour!

Great Synagogue and Museum Tour. Our Guide Petra did an outstanding job of recounting the history of the many historical sites we visited on her tour. She a had a very good understanding of Jewish tradition and a deep feeling for the events and people associated with the holocaust as it applied to this area. The Synagogue, built in 1855, was amazing in size and interior design. The museum and memorial area is a moving tribute to the those that suffered under Nazi rule. If you go to Budapest, don't miss this tour with Petra. She is the best.

Vacation . We had an incredible 4 hour tour with Petra as our guide, who was very knowledgeable and accommodating. I would highly recommend this tour with Petra and I'm sure if she is not available that the rest of the staff would be at her level.

Great introduction to the Jewish history of Budapest. Our guide Petra was very knowledge and very nice. Obviously there is much more to learn about the Jewish history of Budapest, but this tour is a great way to an initial idea.

Walking tour with Petra. It was a great tour and was very informative. We had Petra, as our guide, throughout the majority of the tour. She was well-informed and was ready to answer all of our questions. It went for a little longer than expected but, fortunately, didn't affect our plans.
So much I didn't know. Particularly enjoyed the tour and guide at the museum. Great to have a small group; only two couples.

Fascinating area. On the down side, our tour guide had not been told where to meet us, and we waitied quarter of an hour before ringing the office to find she was waiting there. On the plus side, we had the whole tour to ourselves, the Great Synagogue and the Jewish Museum were beautiful and fascinating, with an especially enthusiastic young guide for the Museum, and we had a chance to explore the area afterwards, full of quirky little cafés and historic buildings.

Amazing, thought provoking, and beautiful. Julianna met us at our hotel and guided us to the Jewish Quarter of Budapest. We requested a private extended tour and our expectations were more than met by our wonderful guide. We started at the Orthodox Synagogue, where she gave us a wonderful accounting of the condition of the synagogue after WWII, how it was restored to the beauty that is is today. Although only 80 families belong to this lovely synagogue, it is being taken care of by tthe Jewish community. We next went to the Rumbach Synagogue, which is no longer acting as a functioning house of worship, but it is slowly being rebuilt. After a visit to a cafe in the area for coffee and a sweet treat, we went to the Dohany Street Synagogue. this is the largest synagogue in Europe, surviving WWII and beautifully restored to the splendor it is today. We also spent time at the Raoul Wallenberg Holocaust Memorial Park, as well as a tour of the Jewish Museum.Julianna shared her experiences with us, which were incredible. She is a remarkable woman and I appreciated what she went through to survive and how she continues with an incredible attitude toward the world.This was one of my favorite Jewish Ghetto tours! It was one of the most personal tours I have taken and I hope that 'more people will have the opportunity to meet this remarkalbe woman who shared her Jewish Budapest with us. This is a MUST tour for anyone with Jewish roots, and anyone who wants to see this side of Budapest.

Excellent tour. We were shown around by petra who was excellent. Her knowledge was outstanding and the tour itself was very imformative. Highly recomended for anyone who is interested in jewish history in budapest before during and after the holocaust..

Absolutely great tour!. We were a small group and our guide Fatima was fantastic! Not only she was incredibly knowledgeable about Hungarian Jewish history, but her depth of insights into the traditions and life of the Jews was amazing. She patiently responded to all our questions, always smiling and with patience. Highly recommended. Thanks Fatima!

A Must have tour in Budapest. We did the private tour. We were picked up personally by Fatima from our hotel. She was extremely polite, well educated and courteous. She speaks very good English. Her knowledge about the history is exceptional. We also enjoyed her humor very much and would recommend her to everyone. Ty !!!

The most important tour to do in Budapest....with the best guides ever !!!. We were a group of nine from London (UK) and were led on this private tour by Fatima K. Her knowledge is immense, her delivery in English is flawless and her personality was simply lovely. She engaged with us "oldies" in the most friendly manner and ensured that the content of her mini-lectures was pitched at the right level of detail.The guide within the Jewish museum part of the tour (Malke ?) was also first class - she too recognised that we were knowledgable on Jewish matters and so was able to present some fine and intricate detailed information about the exhibits.All in all, when you visit Budapest this is a tour to put on the "must do" list.Thanks Fatima and Malke.

A "Must do " tour. Just come back from beautiful Budapest, the highlight was a superb walking tour with a great guide, Fatima. Her knowledge & presentation could not be faulted. A word of praise also for the wonderful Miklos who was our guide for the 45 minute visit to the Jewish Museum. We strongly recommend the full grand tour as it includes an extra synagogue plus the included cake at a kosher cafe. If you book this tour & get Fatima as your guide you will not be disappointed!

A " MUST" tour for everyone visiting BUDAPEST !!!!!!. Where do we start ??? Pretty hard to put into words.. about the Jewish Heritage Tour !! It all started with our ( it seemed to us . our personal guide) guide FATIMA KOROK.. who picked us up and PERSONALLY guided us through the most knowledgeable and enjoyable tour of our whole trip to Eastern Europe.. ( can't we just adopt this beautiful young lady ????? )...We,being Jewish, and somewhat knowledgeable about Budapest Jewish history, we listened carefully as FATIMA filled in EVERY gap and then much more, in depth !!! We felt that were, actually, there and experiencing the history... There was not any nook and cranny in the Ghetto district that she did not have knowledge of.. period... Not only was she a GREAT guide but a better listener to our comments and questions..... How do we rate the tour ???..... 11+ on a scale of 10 and the numbers are not high enough to rate FATIMA. !!!!! Toby and I both love this young woman !!!!! Toby & Rich Hoffman

Fantastic Tour. Fantastic tour to learn about the history and culture of the Jewish people of Budapest. It also tied in WWI, WWII, and Communism, which was great because we found many other places did not want to talk about Hungary's history in those areas. We had two guides - Fatima for the broader tour and Milka at the synagogue. Both were very knowledgeable and personable - I would strongly recommend this whether you are of Jewish Heritage or not.

Budapest Jewish Heritage Walking Tour. We are almost 2 weeks back from our visit to Budapest and we are still talking about the fantastic Jewish Heritage walking tour. We took the essential tour and on the day, we were fortunate to be the only 2 people booked in, so it was a very personal tour. It lasted 3 hours and our guide was Joel. He was brilliant! His knowledge of the history & culture of the Hungarian Jewish community was very extensive. However he did not give a lecture as some guides do, rather his approach was an interactive, conversational one. He shared some of his own experiences and helped us to gain an insight into the Jewish heritage that is an integral part of Budapest. He was very friendly and his English was excellent. Our tour included entrance into the Jewish Museum where the museum guide took over temporarily and into the second largest synagogue in the world. Joel was licensed to guide in the synagogue so we had a very interesting tour of the building and of the memorial gardens adjoining it. We highly recommend this walking tour - be sure and include it on your Budapest itinerary. Dorothy

Visit to Jewish Quarter. Our guide Petra was excellent, she was very cheerful & energetic. We were the only two people on the tour that evening and she really gave us a lot of information that let us enjoy the tour immensely. Our interest in Jewish heritage has been kindled by this trip. Thank you Petra !

Well worth doing the Grand Tour. A very interesting tour, well-balanced to cater for the different levels of knowledge within the group, which included those with minimal Jewish knowledge as well as those at the more religious end of the spectrum. Fatima was a pleasant and personable guide and the second guide, Milka, who guided us around the Jewish museum, brought the exhibits to life with her vivid descriptions.

Three guides for the price of one. We were very lucky---no one else was on our tour, even though it was not booked as a private tour. We had three guides---Ann got us started with some general background and delivered us to Esther at the Jewish Museum. Esther did an excellent job giving us a sense of Budapest then and now and explaining the exhibits of Judaica and on the Holocaust. She then delivered us to Vatima (sp?), who took us to three synagogues and the memorial garden behind the Dohany. She had a very engaging style---asking us questions about what we saw so that we had to think first. All were delightful, intelligent, and knowledgeable. A great experience.

Excellent tour in Jewish Quarter - Budapest. My daughter and I and two friends took the Grand Tour of the Jewish Quarter of Budapest with an excellent guide Petra. She was knowledgeable, courteous and very attentive. Her English was excellent. We felt the pace of the tour was perfect and the sites visited wonderful. We would recommend this particular tour and guide to anyone.

Budapest Jewish Heritage Grand Tour - Excellent!!. My wife and I took the grand tour today with Anna, an excellent guide.The tour was amazing. We learned a lot about the history of the Jews in Hungary thanks to the vast knowledge Anna has on the subject. She always had the right answer to every question and she was also very kind.We won't forget the nice experience and we will recommend the tour to our friends.Alberto and Edith ImarFrom Buenos Aires, Argentina

A must-do walking tour, led by a brilliant guide!. A really informative, interesting tour providing an insight into the history of Jewish settlement in Hungary (200AD) right through a series of historical events (including the Holocaust) to the present day. You definitely don't have to be Jewish! Our guide, Petra, was excellent. Apart from her extensive knowledge, her enthusiasm and warmth made this one of the most memorable experiences of our trip.

Great tour, excellent guide. Did this tour mid May, i think our guide might be Fatima or Andrea, sorry I forgot but she was excellent. the Jewish museum intro was done by an elderly gentleman who was a Holocaust survivor, a rare treat. The tour lasted till 6 pm and the guide accompanied us back to the offices for the start of the boat cruise. Overall a very satisfactory afternoon.

A must do!. A really informative and enjoyable tour. Fabulous friendly guide, Fatima, who brought the past to life. Her knowledge, empathy and sense of humour made this a tour to remember. Highly recommend!

Jewish Heritage Walking Tour (Grand Tour). Fatima was a great guide. I did not think the extended tour was worth the extra money so I recommend the "Essential" tour. A downside to our Grand Tour (we were the only two people on it) was that we were given a 10% discount voucher to the Orthodox Hanna Restaurant but were taken to a different restaurant at the end of the tour. Unfortunately we did not realise this and only found out when we went to pay the bill and could not use the voucher. We also discovered later that the restaurant that gave the discount was practically next door so why we were not taken there in the first place we will never know.
Jewish walking tour. Fatima was a wonderful guide. She is young and very knowledgeable. We really enjoyed our time with her

Jewish Heritage Walking Tour. Fatima presents a comprehensive tour of the Jewish quarter which includes visits to the Dohany Street Synagogue, Kaszinczy Orthodox Synagogue, and Jewish Museum among other things. She is knowledgeable and enthusiastic and provides not only historical information but insight into Jewish life in Budapest. We highly recommend this tour.

A absolute must: Essential Tour. Our guide Fatima gave us a wonderful tour that lasted 3 hours in which there was never a dull moment. With typical liveliness she offered so much insight into Budapest and the importance of the Jews in its history. The tour also took in the Jewish Museum where the guide was also excellent at explaining Jewish customs and traditions. The Great Synagogue itself is the most beautiful I have seen.
synagogue and jewish museum tour. A beautiful synagogue with history related by a charming guide named Fatima.The museum tour was very informative and a heart rending experience.

Walking Tour with Fatima. An excellent private tour (4 adults) given by an enthusiastic, personable young lady; she did not fit our preconceived idea of a woman named Fatima. I can not say she is the best guide ever for a Jewish Quarter tour, but I wouldn't risk using someone else. She clearly used our knowledge, experience and background to find the right starting point. Her explanations were clear and easy understood. The Dohany Street Synagogue is a must see and the Kaszinczy Orthodox Synagogue was an interesting contrasts.

Private tour with Fatima Korok. The guide speaks good English and does a good job explaining the Jewish history of Budapest. She picked us up at our hotel, drove in a cab to the starting place and then walked through the Budapest WW2 ghetto.

So much history in the Jewish Quarter of Budapest. Esther led us on our Jewish Heritage Tour, 4 hours, covering the Dohany St. Synogogue (huge), Jewish Museum, Kazinczy Orthodox synogogue, Rumbach St. Synogaogue, Holocaust Memorial with its metal weeping willow tree and little cemetery. Then a car ride to the Shoes Memorial along the Danube where Jews were lined up along the river, shot and dumped into the water. Recommend that you read up on Hungarian Jewish history, how Jews were treated pre, during and after WWII and this tour will have a huge and lasting impression on you.

Jewish Heritage walking tour. We were in Budapest the week of March 10 and took this tour with Fatima. It was a wonderful experience and she was a fantastic tour guide. I would recommend this tour to everyone and use Fatima. She was very knowledgeable and really made it a perfect day. The History and the Synagogues were very interesting and especially the 2nd largest Synagogue in Europe.

The Basic Jewish Heritage Walking Tour. We took our group on a basic Jewish Heritage Walking Tour as part of a 3 days conference. We wanted to offer something exciting and memorable to our group and the tour offered exactly that. The tour was very informative and our tour guide, Fatima, was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommend this tour with Fatima to help explain the history of the museum and the points of interest around the synagogue.

Excellent. Put this on your list to see!. The largest Synagogue in Europe (seats 3000) and 2nd largest in the world. A beautiful structure. The museums and points of interest around the synagogue are worth seeing too. I recommend a tour guide to help explain the history of this amazing building and all it represents to the Hungarian Jewish community.

The Basic Jewish Heritage Walking Tour. The Basic Jewish Heritage Walking Tour Budapest, HungaryThere has been of resurgence of interest in European Jewish communities as they existed prior the WWII. In Krakow, Warsaw, and Prague, historical Jewish sites and synagogues enjoy numerous visitors daily as tourist flock to these venerable sites.For Jews and gentiles interested in the Hebrew traditions of Hungary, this is the tour for you. It is a walking tour so get ready with comfy walking shoes for this adventure. The tour operators describe in their publicity brochures that the Jewish walking tour of Old Budapest was created for those who would like to get an overview of the past and present history or the Hungarian Jewry and additionally would like to gain a perspective between the major religious wings of Hungarian Judaism.This walking tour requires the ability to walk between 2-4 hours depending on the tour selected. There are two types of Jewish heritage tours: (1) the essential basic tour which last about 2 hours; it costs 4900 or about ± $22.00 HUF (Hungarian forints); and (2) the grand tour an expanded Jewish Heritage tour which lasts between 3.5-4 hours at a cost of about 9900 HUF. or about ± $40.00 depending on the current exchange rate. I recommend taking the Grand Tour—An Expanded Jewish Heritage Tour, however, I recommend doing so in two installments as I did. Walking the 4-hour complete tour is not recommended in the cobblestone and uneven terrain of Old Budapest. The tour company will gladly accommodate you so that you can do the basic tour one day in the morning and the second part of the tour on a following day in the afternoon.In this review I will focus on the morning tour. In my next review I will focus on the second tour hours of the tour in order to provide a complete review of the Grand Tour—An Expanded Jewish Heritage Tour. The main stop of the basic morning tour includes: (1) the Dohany Street Synagogue with a guided tour featuring the interior and exterior features and storied history of the second largest synagogue in the world, (2 ) a Jewish museum of photographs various artifacts including antique Jewish-motif dinnerware and a stunning collection of classic menorahs of varied constructions and sizes, and (3) the Martyr’s cemetery-Holocaust museum park. The latter includes the “Tree of Life” exhibit. These three are part of the same gated complex. Noteworthy, is the fact that in this site was the apartment where Theodore Herzl, founder of the political form of Zionism, a movement to establish a Jewish homeland, was born and lived for a while during his childhood when Hungary was part of the Austria-Hungarian Empire.Main stop and points of interest are 1-14; 1-7 basic tour; all 14 part of the grand tour. Here follows the description of the items by the numbers assigned by the tour operators with my annotations.The Basic Tour 1. The Jewish Museum with local professional guidance was an phenomenal part of the tour. Conducted by a knowledgeable Judaica scholar who significantly raised the cultural and educational level of the tour, the local Jewish Museum Guide provided an expert explanation of the numerous antique Judaica and historical artifacts exhibited in the museum. Examples of artifacts include antique paintings of daily Jewish life in old Hungary, preserved ketubahs (marriage contacts) as old as 1681 are exhibited in the museum. Additionally, an outstanding set of antique ornate menorahs are displayed and other artifacts of historical significance to the Jewish people. The tour guide did a terrific job of providing important historical details of the place which collectively provides a significant education on Hungarian Judaica.2. The visit to the interior of the Dohany Street Synagogue is truly inspiring religious experience. Whether one is Jewish or gentile, one feels a profound religious experience visiting this great temple which is difficult to verbalize. It is just that kind of a place. It is an awesome site to be present and behold this great synagogue. Its grand interior architecture, its majestic construction and its reverent decorum is palpable. Christians and especially Jewish visitors cannot but marvel and take pride in this symbol of spirituality and resilience of the Jewish people who survived the Hungarian Holocaust. This synagogue with its unique architectural features and its reverence for Judaism is a place to be experienced by all who visit Budapest.3. The Martyr’s Cemetery is a monument dedicated to thousands of Jewish martyrs killed by the Nazis from the nearby Hungarian Ghetto. The headstones of these known victims and those yet to be documented are added frequently are memorialized here with the decorum of engraved black marble headstones bearing their names, and their estimated dates of birth and death.4. The Raoul Wallenberg Memorial Park exhibits a fitting life-sized dedicatory plaque memorializing the work of the Swedish businessman and diplomat, Raoul Wallenberg, who is best known for saving thousands of Hungarian Jews during World War II. 5. The Tree of Life Exhibit is constructed out of stainless steel whose more than 70,000 “leaves” commemorates the names of those who died in the Hungarian Holocaust during the final stages of WWII under the Nazi occupation of Budapest. It is a beautiful and unique exhibit honoring the life of the Hungarian martyrs who perished here. 6. An outside tour of The Heroes’ Temple built in memory of the Jewish soldiers who gave their lives for Austria-Hungary during WWI concludes the tour. 7. After the tour, it is possible to visit the Jewish Center with movies and exhibitions about Jewish history. It is fitting to note that it was through the Emanuel Foundation for Hungarian Culture, founded by the great American actor, Tony Curtis, in honor of his father whose focus on Budapest and the aforementioned complex that helped restore the ancient Dohany Synagogue, built a Jewish Centre, erected the Holocaust memorial tree on its grounds, and built a Raoul Wallenberg Park, to honor righteous gentiles who saved Jewish lives. This is a truly worthwhile tour and I highly recommend as a satisfying cultural and educational experience.John Orta, La Cresecenta, CA, USA, 12/22/2014 jorta@pacbell.net
Grand tour with Fatima our guide. We took the long tour with Fatima , the tour was very informative and existing I highly recommend this tour with Fatima as a guide
Very interesting. Very informative. History fans will enjoy. Guides with good knowledge. Important stop regarding Budapest's history.

amazing. I had Fatima as my tour guide. She was very very knowledgable and friendly, I thoroughly enjoyed it. I can honestly say she was the best tour guide I've ever had, she definitely knows her stuff.

We need to do this. The history of the Jewish quarters in central European cities tell us much about some of the most important events of our era. I find it illuminating and compelling to see and hear about what happened here up-close.

Budapest sights. Assisted by the very knowledgeable Andrusz( excuse spelling) we spent a very enjoyable and educational 2 hours in the synagogue (largest in Europe) and surrounding buildings. Included in the tour a memorable discourse on the holocaust from a Hungarian perspective described very movingly by a female guide. The Raoul Wallenberg was also incredibly moving.

Excellent 'Grand Tour' of the Museum, Synagogues, and Neighborhood. We did the half-day "Grand Tour" and thoroughly enjoyed it -- it introduced us to a fascinating mix of synagogues, the main Jewish Museum, local shops, and other bits of local color.Both of our guides (Fatima led most of the tour, while Esther escorted us during the visit to the Jewish Museum) were very knowledgeable young people from Budapest. They pitched their material just right -- not too basic but not too detailed, either -- and both of them were very open to fielding questions.After visiting the Dohány Street Synagogue with Fatima, we spent about an hour with Esther in the Jewish Museum, where there were many well-presented objects on display from both Hungary and Austria. We appreciated that the exhibits told much more than the story of the community during the Holocaust, and we were especially intrigued to learn how active the community is today (about 80,000 to 100,000 members in Hungary).In the second half of the tour, Fatima brought us to the Carl Lutz Memorial, as well as to several shops and restaurants in the still-scruffy-but-gentrifying Jewish Quarter. We appreciated that this part of the tour was very low-keyed and not at all a "hard sell" pushing particular products.The "Grand Tour" was a great introduction to the history of the Jewish community in Budapest. We highly recommend taking the time to do the half-day version with these very knowledgeable guides.

Interesting, Informative. This two hour tour via guide covers little ground in terms of steps but it makes up for it in history. The synagogue on Doheny Street in the city center is the second largest in the world and the largest in terms of capacity. First you meet with the guide outside, then another person takes you on a tour of the Jewish Museum, which is small but interesting. The original guide then takes you into the synagogue itself and then into the garden outside. Throughout, it is an informative, worthwhile and reasonably priced tour, even if you are not Jewish. Recommended.

Worthy visit. We booked this tour through the reception of our accommodation In Budapest. We chose the “Essential Tour” which included the Jewish Museum and the Great Synagogue. Our guide, Ambrus, an energetic, knowledgeable guide with excellent English, had explanations and answers for everything. We spent 1 ½ hour, time that went unnoticed as we enjoyed descriptions and stories.
Historic trip. This Synagogue was bombed 27 time during WW2. The tours are well worth the price. The silver tree with over 200,000 leaves is a memorial to the Jews of Budapest killed by the Nazis.

A memorable experience. We took the Jewish Heritage Tour in Budapest on October 2, 2014 with a group of 10 including ourselves and our tour guide was Fatima a very pleasant and informative young lady. She was well informed on the topics we were covering and talked very clearly in beautiful English and kept a perfect pace for our viewing. We were truly impressed at how she handled an unruly gentleman who kept straying away from out group. We would highly recommend Fatima and the Jewish Heritage Tour or any other where Fatima might be guiding you around. We sincerely hope that one day we will cross paths with Fatima again in another tour. We particularly liked the fact that this young lady was very cheerful and helpful.Canadian/Hungarian visitors from Calgary

Don's miss this.. We toured several synagogues including the very beautiful Dohaney synagogue and the adjacent cemetery and museum. We toured the Shoes on the Danube and other synagogues in the area as well. The Dohaney is a beautiful testament to hope and a beautiful monument to the Holocaust victims.

Incredibly Informative well worth the time and cost. Arranged with Viking River Concierge for "semi private" tour of Synagogue and Museum. Our Guides, Fatima (the Synagogue) and Esther (the museum) shared their knowledge about the history of the Hungarian Jewish population, explained the many (saved) religious articles in the museum and beautiful "Cathedral like design) Synagogue.Well worth the time..beautifully done, great tour and highly recommended. Be prepared to learn!Out tour was 4 terrific hours....as the guides took time to answer many of the questions we had.

Informative and Sad. Part of a riverboat cruise down the Rhine, we stopped here in breathtaking Budapest, coming in all lit up in the evening. The Jewish Heritage Tour was informative and interesting not being Jewish ourselves. Sad to learn what happened during WWII here and everywhere else.

Touched my heart. This is one of the best tours I've been on - and I'm not one who normally likes tours. This one was very informative. We went to the important places in the quarter - none was a waste of time. Go. Let yourself be touched.

Small Group Tour. We recently took the 3.5 - 4 hour Jewish Heritage Tour excellent our guide a young woman Fatima was so knowledgeable. Part of the tour was the museum where Fatima handed us over to Joseph to show us around, wow what a delightful old man with beautiful sparkling eyes and a cheeky sense of humour! Well worth taking ever the short tour if time is a problem!

she MAKES the visit memorable. If you really want to experience Budapest, you really need to hire a private tour guide and in my opinion, Anni is the best. We’ve used them in cities all over the world, and I can’t think if one as good as Ann anywhere. She arrives on time and has a new van that can easily hold six. She’s a native and her English is perfect with just enough accent to be fun. She has quite a sense of humor. She lays out a tour having already purchased the needed tickets and knows preciously when to go to some things, when a matter of minutes will reduce the crowd size dramatically, etc. She’s skilled at reading her clients and quickly learned which things we’d like to see, which we’d likely pass on , which we’d like to pause at and which we could move thru quickly. Her stories are full of critical historical facts which give one a whole new perspective on the critical events in time, all presented in an engaging manner. If you want to experience Budapest, be sure to make advance reservations with Anni Fischer.

Jewish Heritage Grand Tour with Fatima. The tour was one of the highlights of visiting Europe. Our tour guide Fatima was excellent as was our museum guide Miklos (spelling?). The tour was informative, personal and educational. Highly recommended.

Fabulous learning experience. The tour was moving and at the same time very informative. The museum guide has survived the Budapest ghetto as a five year old. Our main tour guide, Roland, was very knowledgeable about both the buildings and the history of the area.

Interesting and informative. A great history lesson in a short time...part one of a two part tour.First The Jewish Museum. ..our wonderful guide walked us through the Holocaust years and a collection of European art and beautiful pieces with the history of everything.. Next we went through the Dohany Temple largest Temple in Europe with guide Roland who explained the interior, exterior and history of the Temple .Outside we viewed the Martyrs Cemetary and The Tree Of Life Recommend for all religions. This small group tour has been around since 1995 for good reason.

Interesting tour and great guide!. Fatima Korok really knows her stuff, and is enlightening without being too technical in her approach. She managed the group really well, despite vastly differing levels of knowledge within the group about Jews and the Holocaust in Hungary. She has an engaging way of asking questions, and is happy when someone knows the answer, but equally happy to provide it if not. The tour covers the main sites in the ghetto, and after the Wallenberg Memorial Park I was lucky enough to have the rest of the tour as a private one. This enabled me to ask many more questions, and Fatima is patient and happy to explain minutiae. The history is fascinating, in particular the 3 radically different streams of Judaism that built their synagogues here, and the architecture reflects their liberalism or not accordingly. The Jewish museum offers a great insight into Jewish life for those less familiar with Jewish ritual and customs.Don't just visit the Dohany synagogue and think you've seen Jewish Budapest - I would really recommend Fatima as a guide, and recommend the tour as offered by Hungaria Koncert Ltd.

Worth the time. We did a private tour of the Jewish area of Budapest. Fatima was our guide and Sandra in the museum. We learned so much about Jewish life in Budapest in the past and now. I was relieved to see that the anti-antisemitism I was expecting to be rampant was not. This doesn't mean it doesn't exist, but it was less than I had been led to believe. The Dohany Utca Synagogue is lovely and very interesting. The rest of the walking tour helped us understand history. Don't forget to go see the shoes on the Danube while you are there.

JEWISH HERITAGE AREA WALKS. Any visit to Budapest is incomplete without taking a walking tour in the Jewish Town Area of Budapest. The sheer magic of this area with nice synagouges is sheer mismerizing. The old buildings are worth taking a look at with nice motifs on walls etc.

Seeing Jewish backgrounds and historical facts. I enjoyed this trip because i lived in Israel for many years and i lived in Jerusalem.Though Judaism doesn't interest me any more due to religious and political corruption in Israel it was still fascinating to learn about Jewish congregations in other parts of the world.I thought some of the facts were interesting especially during the holocaust as i am a 3 descendant from that period.The tour guides were professional and only requested a tip at the end of the tour.This was not obligatory and they accepted euros.One of two facts about Judaism which i didn't agree with but on the while i highly recommend it.

Very interesting window into important aspect of Budapest history. This guided walking tour of Pest's old Jewish Quarter provides interesting insights into the impressive architecture, history and culture of this once-vibrant (until the Nazi-Horthy period beginning in the 1930s), and now reviving, minority community in Budapest. Very worthwhile, as are other guided walking and bus tours of Budapest generally. But I do NOT recommend teh Europa Tours company; they are not customer-friendly.

Sue. Went on the tour this morning with Fatima. There were about eight of us on the tour and it was well worth taking the time. Fatima is very knowledgable about Jewish life in Budapest...past and present. Would highly recommend this tour.

Budapest tour with Anni Fischer. If you are looking for a terrific day in Buda and Pest with a private guide, contact Anni Fischer at +36 (30) 297-7670. She has excellent credentials, has lived through the history of Budapest and knows the tourist and non-tourist sites to visit. Four of us spent 9 hours with Anni and it was terrific. From growing up under the Communist regime to life in present day Hungary, Anni provided a narrative of sites, new and old, from a personal perspective. She provided an inside look on what it is to be Jewish in present day Hungary. While she was excellent on the historical sites, she was over the top on the Jewish Quarter. If you are looking for a guide in Budapest or surrounding area, I strongly recommend Ms. Fischer.

Thorough, informative tour. My wife and I opted for the extended 4-hour tour of Budapest's Jewish Quarter which we booked through our hotel. Our guide, Roland, met us at the Great Synagogue along with one other participant who joined us only for the first 1.5 hours. We began with an informative tour of the Jewish Museum conducted by a member of the museum staff. From that we learned a great deal about the history of Budapest's Jewish community both past and present. After spending some time in the Great Synagogue, Roland led us on a 3-hour extensive exploration of the neighborhood, its monuments and other synagogues and ended up in a wonderful neighborhood pastry shop. We can't say enough good things about our guide: he was very well informed, enthusiastic and flexible. We highly recommend this tour to other visitors.

Excellent Tour. We did the extended hour tour with Larina in July 2014. For the 1st part of the tour there were 4 of us, but only the 2 of us opted for the extended tour, which took us to 2 additional synagogues and through the Jewish Quarter. Larina was very pleasant , spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable(especially for a young person) . The tour included a stop at a local bakery in the Jewish Quarter.

Thorough, Interesting Tour!. Excellent tour! Excellent tour guide! Andrus was very thorough and knowledgable and very likeable. His English was excellent including the ability to use subtle ironies. The Grand Tour included an excellent 45 minute tour inside the Jewish Museum inside Dohany Synagogue and 1-1/2 hour tour of the neighborhood. The walking is light.
Worthwhile tour. I highly recommend this tour, which I did today. Roland was our guide and he was informative, helpful and did a great job of answering the questions of everyone in the group.

All visitors to Budapest should visit this memorial. This tour starting at the Great Synagogue on Dohany Street where 20,000 Jews took refuse from the German and Hungarian Nazis and where 7,000 died in the winter of 1944-1945. These victims are buried in a mass grave in the courtyard.A Weeping Willow sculpture with many of the names of those who died there is in the center of the courtyard. Your tour can continue through the streets near the Synagogue which were inside the Budapest Ghetto walls.A second memorial can be found near the Parliament building on the shores of the Danube where shoes mark the location where Jews were shot and drowned in the Danube as the Russians were on their way to liberate Budapest.

Comprehensive tour of Jewish History. We booked a private tour of the Jewish Quarter in Budapest through Logistics Tour Organization for 8 people. The tour was extensive and a van was provided for the group. We had an excellent tour guide (Agi Salgo) who speaks English, Hungarian and Hebrew. We found her to be very knowledgeable and sensitive to our questions. I think it helps to have someone who grew up in this community. We visited the Glass House which provided shelter and safety for the persecuted in Budapest. This is a must if you can do this on your tour. Additionally we toured the Synagogues, Memoral Museum, streets of the jewish quarter as well as the Holocaust cemetery. There was a great deal to digest in one afternoon but found it to be very moving.

An insight into Jewish history. A small group of people gathered outside the synagogue to meet our guide Ambrus who took us into the synagogue and then the museum, where a museum guide gave an excellent history of the articles on display. Ambrus then explained some of the history of the Holocaust cemetery and the Tree of Life memorial which was funded by Tony Curtis. The tour took almost 2 hours and cost 4500HUF. I have mixed feelings about whether this tour was worth the money or whether it would be just as good to pay the entrance fee to the synagogue and museum and see the rest independently. Ambrus seemed rather bored with the whole tour.

Terrific. A crowded day in front of the synagogue --- I had prebooked the Grand tour, arrived late and Roland Hajd, the guide waited and found me in the crowd.A wonderful experience, both within the synagaogue "complex' as well as the private tour throughout the old ghetto area.Most interesting part was there were 10 Jewish people including two Israelis as well as a number of non-Jewish. Only at the end did Roland volunteer that he wasn't Jewish! he knew EVERYTHING--obviously the history of the Jews in Hungary and as well, most of the Jewish customs and traditions that I will guarantee most Jews don't even know. A knowledgable and gifted young man as he "negotiated" with the orthodox volunteer at the shul to let me in and look at a Siddur to note similarities between the Hungarian service and the one that I knew growing up in the US.....note : they are the same service and siddur (minus the English language) except for the front page that stated "published in Brooklyn, USA" Quite funntI recommend this tour especially Roland Hajd--a real mensch.

Essential to take the Essential Tour. We pre-booked this tour and were joined by 11 others outside the synagogue. We were taken into the museum and shown around by the excellent Ester who was only too happy to explain and answer questions with a sense of humour. We then were transferred to our guide for the Synagogue and Memorial visit. This was the rather good and professional Ausurg (sorry about the name, 841206 may help to ID). as a tour guide he did everything right and we were allowed time in the Synagogue and Memorial. An excellent visit and well worth doing by all denominations. There is very little walking involved and the tour is mainly inside. Being a tour guide I was really impressed with our guides.

Jewish Heritage Tour. My wife and I recently visited Budapest from the USA and decided to take this tour as we knew very little about the history of Jewry in this part of the world. The tour led by Fatima was truly fantastic. Her knowledge, enthusiasm and passion for her work was truly an added bonus which really made this a worthwhile experience. I would highly recommend this excursion for visitors of all religions

Budapest Jewish Heritage Tour. Regardless of your faith and beliefs, this is a wonderful tour that everyone can enjoy. This visit includes the world's 2nd largest synagogue, built in a Moorish style. This synagogue is also part of the community and is used by Jews and non-Jews. Of course the horrors of the Holocaust are part of the tour, and the emergence of non-Jewish heroes is also acknowledged. I think the uniqueness of this Hungarian Jewish history is not to be missed. The young tour guides (Fatima and Esther) were very knowledgeable and informative

Company gave me wrong information about start of excurtion. I bought Jewish heritage tour for Budapest May 11th. In payment confirmation I received information that excursion starts at 11:00. 10:45 I was at the meeting point, but there was no one from the company there. Waiting until11:15 for tour guide I needed to find some cafe with telephone to contact company. After calling to tour guide office I received information that person from the office sent me wrong starting time and I missed excursion because of their mistake, for money back I needed to visit the office which is was not convenient for me as I has very limited time in the city. The result of everything: disappointed mood, 3 hours lost in nowhere and I did not get the tour.P.S. After 30 min discussions/argue in company office I received compensation - voucher to Gelert baths.....But I would just prefer to visit tour at correct time :-)

Lots of talking not much showing, one of the guides lacked enthusiasm. We spent lots of time sitting and standing in one or two spots for history context, which was much appreciated. I wish it was told over a couple more locations and showing more places than just the great synagogue, the tree of life and 2 other synagogues. But good context. One of guides didn't have much enthusiasm, hard to hear her too. Found it hard to focus. I tuned out sometimes to look around the block

Jewish synagogue tour. Via Hungary Koncert Day Tours, you can book a guided visit to the Great Synagogue, the Jewish Museum and the Wallenberg museum. Depending on the time and the money you want to spend, an essential and a grand tour are available. You sure can book via other ways too but I don't know, consult trip advisor or the net. I guess the guides are independently working forone or another internet buro.Ask anyway for the guide named "Blonda", a very enthusiastic young business student, pretty well informed and "involved" with the jewish history of Budapest. She's very fluent in english, very friendly and has the gift to make alive what happened during world war II. Not a summary of historical places and data but a real movie bringing you back to the thirties and the forties. During the visit to the jewish museum, guides of the museum accompany the visitors. A mustif you want to understand something of the jewish culture and reasoning and their very explicit views and insights on life and death and history. I quickly understood I will never understand them perfectly : almost another planet. Walk around with Blonda in the old jewish ghetto andtry to convince her for lunch or some beers in the many restaurants and hidden places youcan discover. A must to go.

Expanded Grand Tour. I took the Expanded Grand Tour and Fatima my tour guide really made the history of the area come alive with small facts and anecdotes. The tour included a private tour through the Jewish Museum with a museum tour guide who was able to tailor the information on the group's existing knowledge and expand upon it. The Duhany Street Synagogue is just stunning in it's architecture and size and unlike other places, you can take pictures. The tour included entry into a synagogue that has not been restored to really see and appreciate the damage WWII and communism did to this neighborhood. And the yummy local pastry at the end of the tour was fantastic.

Highly recommend...a fantastic experience in Budapest!. I haven't been one to typically take time to document reviews like this, but felt compelled based on the amazing day I had in Budapest last Saturday. I had the opportunity to spend a weekend (with a single day to tour) in Budapest and wanted to make the most of it. After doing some research online, I selected Budapest Locals to help me tour the city and I could not have made a better choice.From the initial contact with Anita, it was great. She was super responsive and asked great questions that would help match a guide. As it turned out, my guide and friend for the day was Detti and she was a perfect match. Detti, a teacher of English as a second language to HS students AND teacher of Hungarian as a second language to foreign university students, was super knowledgeable about the city, Hungary's history, and its traditions. She was flexible and tailored the day as we went - spending more time in some places that proved of interest and moving past others. We ducked into off the beaten path places for strudel, some typical Hungarian street food, and capped the day with some goulash. She was able to help me translate (and piece together some memories) of things my Grandfather said to me in Hungarian when I was little. I got great pictures of the must see stops and she made sure we did so at the right time (like seeing the Parliament from the Buda side at night). She was patient and totally went out of her way to make sure I got the most out of my day.This was the first tour like this I've taken and I was really really pleased. Anita, thanks for making it work on 1 week's notice and Detti, thanks for making it exactly what I was looking for....a connection to my Hungarian heritage!

Incredible and authentic Budapest tour!. Overall, I can't say enough about the wonderful email communication, helpful suggestions, and the personal interactions provided both on the tour and getting everything setup. Anita was very prompt in answering all of questions, providing suggestions, and customizing what we wanted to see in Budapest. Our tour was awesome! Bridget was a very sweet person and a wonderful tour guide. At the start of the tour, we sat down over authentic strudel and finalized our plans for the day. Bridget was very knowledgeable, friendly and provided a great overview of Budapest. We loved the personal interaction along with all the history and insight she provided. Today felt less like a tour and more of a friend showing your around. We can tell she sincerely loves her job and is proud of her country and heritage. Also, come hungry as you will get plenty of authentic food and really good food to eat throughout the day!

Excellent tour....can't recommend highly enough!!!. From the minute I emailed enquiring about the tour to the the minute we finished the tour, Budapest Locals are great! I dealt with Anita by email and then was taken on a 7-8 hour tour with Barbie (it was nearly 9 hours in the end!). Barbie was sooooo knowledgeable about the city and filled us in with interesting facts. She also takes a great photo! It was great to have Barbie show us around the city on our first day as that evening we went to a great bar (DiVino) that Barbie recommended and also felt like we knew our way round the city! We also went to a restaurant for lunch the following day that Barbie had recommended called Menza and that too was fab! Even the small things of jumping on the Metro, it was so handy that Barbie had shown us how it all worked for when we used it the following day on our own.If you do the 7-8 hour tour with Barbie, please do not eat breakfast! You have so much food throughout the day as Barbie likes for you to experience all food things Hungarian (I also think she could be a secret feeder!). My favourite food was the Hungarian Chimney cake.....it's a must try! Even once the tour had finished, both Barbie and Anita offered their help with anything else we needed whilst we were in Budapest, which was a lovely gesture. Great value for money and I can't recommend this company highly enough - it made our time in Budapest such fun.

Great guide, highly recommended!. We were on a 4-hour private tour with Budapest Locals. Our guide was Orsi. She is very knowledgeable, professional and sweet! We booked the tour with Anita only a few days beforehand and it all went very smoothly. A private tour is DEFINITELY worth the money, you got to see much in just one day. Highly recommended!

Great choice to see what we wanted. Myself and a work friend had a fantastic customized tour with barbie our tour guide on October 23rd 2016. Saw all of the things we wanted at a very reasonable price. Also, the team was offered us help with all things Budapest after the tour. Anita actually booked us a cab from our AirBnb to the airport for our trip home. It was a great experience with genuine people.
Great tour and great guide!. We were 6 persons who had a wonderful tour guided by Barbie, highly recommended! We ate many different treats and tried nice drinks.

Great chance to see and learn about Budapest. My wife and I had an amazing time with Barbie on our Budapest Delights tour. We always prefer the "behind the scene" style tours that are more intimate and give you a real local view rather than the big touristy stuff. This was exactly that, and Barbie was so fun to hang out with and knowledgeable we felt like we were hanging out with an old friend all day. I defiantly recommend this tour if you visit Budapest.

No better way to start our stay in Budapest. We emailed Anita the day we left for Budapest and by the time we arrived we were completely set for a private tour as requested for the very next day. Bridget was our guide for the entire afternoon into the early evening. She met us at our hotel, listened to what we had already explored on our own and from there devised a customized tour. In the 5-6 hours we spent with her we explored both the Buda and the Pest side, saw both tourist and local sites, learned the history of Hungary & Budapest, local culture and even the public transportation system! It was a fantastic way to start the week from there we knew where we were going and what we wanted to explore further. No matter what we asked Bridget she had information and answers, she was fun and adventurous. When anyone has asked about our trip I've repeatedly said that we started with a personal tour and would do it all again without changing a thing!

Our trip was so much more authentic and memorable with Barbie!!. My husband and I only had a weekend to enjoy Budapest and thought it would be best to have a private tour guide highlight what the locals loved about the city. We are both big foodies and were excited to find a foodie tour. Our guide, Barbie, made us feel as if we were meeting up with a friend! Her energy, enthusiasm, and love for her city is evident and it made us just as excited. The tour lasted 5 to 6 hours, but time always flies by when you're having fun, right? The wonderful food and places she picked out along the way were places that we would never have discovered on our own. From sweet/savory strudels, fresh market sausage, pickled veggies, cakes, and of course, palinka! You will NOT be hungry at the end of this tour! It was nice to walk it off by exploring the different quarters of Budapest and getting some interesting facts and history along the way. We felt comfortable enough to ask Barbie about past and current political sentiment as she is a native. If we ever have time to explore Budapest again, we hope Barbie will join us to go back to the "Danger Zone!" (inside joke about all the amazing hidden trinket stalls that just suck you in as a tourist) =)

Sightseeing for the Foodie. Our wonderful guide, Bridget, picked us up at our B&B and for the next 6 hours took us all around Budapest to see the sights and sample local Hungarian food. First, she asked us where we had been and if there were any places we would like to see. We mentioned that we hadn't seen St. Stephen's cathedral yet, so we went there and she gave us a guided tour of the inside of the cathedral and the up outside the dome. After that we went to the Great Market Hall, as it closes early on Saturday. There we sampled salami, pickles, pork fat, goulash and rolled cabbage. Then we went to a pastry shop and had four different kinds of cake, including the Birthday Cake that won the competition this year of the best in Budapest. Now, wanting to walk off some of this food, we headed to the Jewish corner to see the Synagogue and experience the Ruined Bar. Bridget asked us if we wanted to try some strudel at her favourite place, but by that time we were too full to eat anymore (We didn't need to eat dinner that night!).In between and during all the eating, Bridget explained a lot interesting information about the local history, culture and people. There was so much that we gained from this tour that we could not have found out on our own. She really was flexible in terms of accommodating our wishes for what we wanted to see, do, and eat. There was a fair bit of walking but we also got to experience riding the Metro and trams in the city, which we appreciated.All in all, this was well worth our time and money (all the expenses during the tour are covered by the cost of the tour) for our own private guided tour of Budapest. Köszönöm, Bridget! And thank you, Anita for your quick responses to our emails.

most interesting day in Budapest. We emailed Anita the day after we arrived and she could not accommodate us that day but did send suggestions with map co-ordinates to follow but set us up for the next day. We picked Budapest Locals from all there excellent reviews and they did not disappoint.We were picked up by Bridget at our hotel and she easily navigated us around town using local transit all the time explaining history, conflicts and Hungarian culture. We stopped for coffee and pasties early in the day and cocktails at the end in the Jewish district. She was extremely well informed and we enjoyed our time with her very much even to point that after 4.5 hours we had to catch our transfer we didn't want it to end.

Made our trip in Budapest!. To start it off, Budapest Locals made our trip in Budapest. We did the Budapest delights and Budapest Overview tour. Barbie was our host for both of our walking tours. She was great with our 4.5 year old daughter. The passion she showed for her country history and culture was wonderful. She took care of us, like we were part of her family. We enjoyed experiencing the different foods, public transportation, sights, and culture. Absolutely would recommend this company to anybody going to Budapest. If we had another day, we would have booked another walking tour with them.Budapest Locals - Korsonom!

Köszönöm Szépen Barbie! . My boyfriend and I had an amazing experience with Barbie. The amount of food was very generous and we asked a million questions, she was able to answer everything and had a sound knowledge of Hungarian history. We couldn't recommend this tour highly enough. This was my favourite experience out of 5 european countries so far. Köszönöm Szépen!!

The Best Sights in Budapest. We had an amazing experience with Budapest Locals. This was one of the best tourswe have ever had, and we have had quite a few. We saw so many wonderful sightsin Budapest such as Heroes' Square, City Park, Opera House, St. Stephen's Cathedral,etc. The city itself is very clean especially the Underground. The locals are friendly andthe food is great, especially The Strudel House, which we visited on our tour. If youwant an amazing tour this is the place to go, Budapest Locals.

Private tour. Hands down the best private tour you will get! Barbie was not only super knowledgeable but she was great with our three year old son. I planned the entire trip with the help from Anita over email. The business they are running is top notch!
Excellent tour . Barbie is great, she took us on a tour of the main sights all in one morning. I would recommend Budapest Locals to anyone visiting the city for the first time.

Great tour of the city . Me and my wife had a great day around the city with Bridget. We dont like the bigger tours so this tour was nice and relaxing, we ate good food, learnt a lot about the country and visited a lot of interesting places we would not have done otherwise. Great value and highly recommended!

Food tour. We highly recommend the food tour. If you're fortunate enough to have Bridget as your guide, you won't be disappointed. She's fun, knowledgable, and very accommodating. We left Budapest with an appreciation of the local food and a greater insight into the history of this beautiful country.

Budapest Locals are winners. Gaby, our guide on September 9th, took us to places of interest in both US and Hungarian history, including the Jewish synagogue and the solemn remembrances of the Nazi attack on the Jews. Topped off by showing the Hungarian statue of President Reagan, thanking him for "tearing down this wall." At our request, we visited the first Ruin Bar in Budapest.All transportation and "goodies" were included in the fee. Gaby was very knowledgeable, patient, thoroughly personable, as though we had known her for years.

Amazing Tour with Delicious Cuisine. For the four of us, this was a perfect combination of a history and food tour! Bridget was our guide and she did an outstanding job! We were met at our hotel and through the use of public transportation (included in the tour cost), we were able to visit many areas of Budapest that we never would have done on our own. The more than generous sampling of strudels, sausages, langos, and desserts etc. were delicious. We ended our tour at a very unique Ruins Bar with beer and Palinka...couldn't have asked for a better experience. Thanks, Bridget (and Anita) for coordinating this hidden gem of a tour!

Wonderful culinary and informative tour . We enjoyed a wonderful private four hour tour of Budapest with Barbie from „Budapest Locals“ yesterday. The tour was tailor made to our interests which included culinary delights, jewish quarter and some main sights. The organization and communication via mail worked flawlessly!The tour itself was very interesting with many historical facts and interesting tidbits, Barbie having answers to all our questions. And the food we tasted along the way was just amazing! From strudels, gulyas to cured meats and palinka. In those four hours we discovered so much about Budapest we would never have found out on our own. Thank you to Barbie for being such a wonderful and fun host and „Budapest Locals“ for the organization!

Hidden Gems Tour. We booked the 4.0 to 4.5 hour Hidden Gems tour and it was terrific. We were extremely happy with our tour guide, Gaby. She is very knowledgeable and is simply a lovely person. We enjoyed the tour and appreciated Gaby's tonsights and assistance. We definitely recommend this tour.

Great tour for a short visit, well worth the price!. My husband and I booked with Budapest Locals for a short stop in Hungary. Anita was super responsive and helpful in planning, leaving us confident we would get to see the best sites during our visit. Due to plane issues, we arrived in Budapest later than expected. Anita responded quickly to our email and we were able to adjust our start time the night prior, which was much appreciated. Bridget, our tour guide, was lovely! She met us in the hotel lobby and we reviewed the plan to ensure everything we wanted to do was on the list. At each stop she was insightful to share history, stories and details about the area. We really enjoyed taking and learning the public transportation, which was easy with her help! Bridget was pleasant, fun to be around and very flexible. We were thrilled with our decision to book this tour and highly recommend this to anyone visiting this great city. Especially if you only have 1-2 days, it is hands down worth every penny!

Great local's insight to Budapest!!. Our family of four had a great day with our guide Barbie!! The combination of our guide's wonderful personality and her great knowledge of the city and food made this day one of the highlights of our time in Budapest! We would STRONGLY recommend this tour to anyone who would enjoy good food and great company! It's relaxing, interesting, educational and thoroughly enjoyable. This is a "must do" in Budapest!!

fantastic tour company. We booked this tour from Northern Ireland ,Anita replied immediately to our email . We booked the 8 hour tour and were picked up from our hotel by Bridget . My partner and i spent the next 8 hours with Bridget and it flew by . She has a fantastic knowledge of her city and its history. She was very informative and was more like a friend than a tour guide. She gave us a great orientation to the city and its transport system. Thank you so much Bridget we would have been lost without you. Ps we cant find the sissi film xx

Amazing Day!. I had the most amazing day with Brigitta. It was customized to fit my unique interests. It combined shopping with cuisine and culture. The pace was perfect. We were able to stop for ice cream at her favorite spot. Her knowledge of the city, both past and present, was really impressive. It was an overall great day and one I would not hesitate to repeat!

Personalized Tour With A Local Flair. We did this tour in September during our visit to Budapest. From the initial contact with Anita to the culmination of this tour, this tour was a home run. By the time we did this tour, we had been in Budapest for a few days, and we wanted to see more of the Pest side with a few highlights of the Buda side. The tour was fantastic, and Barbie was an amazing tour guide. The tour is quite detailed and not rushed at all, as it took around 8 hours to do the complete tour. We enjoyed the logistics of the tour as we were able to walk but also used the city public transportation during the tour. Barbie is quite passionate about the history of her country and provided insightful recommendations about places to visit such as the House of Terror. The tour will take you to places of interest that you would not think of exploring on your own; such as the local market. The entire tour was excellent, and we highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to experience Budapest a little deeper than the surface.

The Elek family tours Budapest. Our tour was informative, varied and sparkled throughout with jems, both the visual and the epicurean.
