Barbie deftly guided us through Hungarian history, social customs and modern day life as we willingly walked and rode the 'utcan' and 'utakat' of the city. Budapest Locals is THE tour guide service to use when in town. A big 'nagyon koszonom' to Barbie and the whole company!!

Budapest Overview tour. This was one of the very best tours I have ever experienced and I know the folks with me share my thoughts. Anita was great to work with setting up the tour and Orsi our guide was incredibly knowledgeable about the sights in Budapest and the history and significance of the memorials and buildings. It made for the most informative and thoughtful tour we could have imagined. We are so grateful we found the Budapest locals and the fine folks that work there.

8 Hour Tour. Amazing tour with Bridget. Everything was perfect. Bridget provided a great day of sightseeing and mixed in exciting explorations to places we would never have seen without her. She exceeded our expectations in every way. I highly recommend her if you are looking for a wonderful day in Budapest. Doug and Cheryl

Best personalized tours!. Bridget was available last minute for a three hour private tour. We were so pleased with her knowledge and her thoughtful planning of our tour, we could not have been more satisfied. It was not an inexpensive way to see Budapest but we only had a half day and wanted the most for our money and we got it with this company! They went out of their way to provide a high end luxury car for our tour and it was an unexpected surprise and pleasure. This company will not disappoint!!!

Excellent Service - Before, during and after!!. Found this small company from other Trip advisor reviews. My email enquiries were handled quickly and courteously by the proprietor Anita who tailored a tour to our specific requirements as we had done some of the main sites the previous year at the end of an Emerald river cruise. All my questions and helpful advice given freely even before confirming my booking.On the day Brigitta (Bridget) met us at the Opera Hotel by K+K at the agreed hour 10am (she was already waiting for us and had already picked up our 24 hour local transport passes (included) to avoid us having to wait in line. Brigitta was excellent and the pace was gentle without being slow. All refreshments strudel, coffee water and fabulous lunch in the market were included in the agreed price for our 6 hour tour. On our return we received the promised recipes and a most courteous request for feedback on our day.Being retired hoteliers and still hotel consultants we really do appreciate excellent service and Budapest Locals know exactly how to provide that. Would recommend them most highly. We felt really safe exploring areas we otherwise would probably not have felt comfortable exploring on our own. Brigitta even helped us negotiate a good price on some beautiful Hungarian linen in the market. Budapest is a beautiful city and we will probably be back for more. Thank you Anita and Brigitta.

Insiders Budapest tour. I must say that this isn't the cheapest tour but it was well worth it. My tour guide was Barbie and she was very adapting to my needs and incredibly hospitable. We were out all day and saw all the wonderful sights, sounds and tastes of Budapest. I may have been able to find the most famous landmarks on my own but the insight I received along with all the different foods we got to try, made this tour well worth it. I would advise doing this tour early in your visit and use the remainder of your days to further explore the sights that interest you. I got to try everything I wanted in regards to food and drink and Barbie was very flexible in staying for longer or shorter periods of time at certain sights. This small company is very well run and organized so do yourself a favor and book a tour with Budapest locals. You will not regret it!

Absolutely Wonderful!!!!!. This tour couldn't have been better! This was a perfectly run operation from beginning to end. I was here on business visiting Budapest for my first time. As this was a business trip, I had not done a lot of pre-planning. I contacted Budapest Locals on Friday seeking a private tour on Saturday, not sure if this would be possible. Budapest Locals (Anita) quickly replied and had my tour guide, Orsi, lined up for me on Saturday. She asked me what type of tour I was interested in and what time I would like to start and gave me options of tour ideas in the initial email. It made it easy for me to select the tour option and start time I wanted. Orsi was right on time the next morning to meet me in the lobby of my hotel - she started by showing me the map and the plan she had made for us and asked if I wanted to make any changes. I didn't and off we went. I can't say enough about Orsi - my interest whenever I go to a new city, especially those steeped in culture, is to really understand the history. Of couse I wanted to see the sights, but when you are with someone who knows so many details about the statue or building you are standing in, it adds that much more to the experience. I was amazed at Orsi's knowledge about the history of Budapest and Hungary. It was clear that she loved history and loved being a tour guide. She was so friendly and attentive to my questions and focused on ensuring I was getting what I wanted out of the tour. We took a little longer in some areas and were running out of time, but Orsi stayed with me an extra hour to cover the items on the list. She even left me with recommendations with what to do with the rest of my time in Budapest and typed in local restaurant recommondations on my phone so that I could locate them later in the weekend with Google Maps. Orsi went above and beyond - I couldn't have asked for anything more!!! Anita also followed up with me after the tour was completed making sure I enjoyed it, letting me know Orsi did as well and offered email assistance for any further advice I needed for the rest of my stay here - just ask. That is customer service! Orsi was a wonderful, wonderful guide - I can't recommed her and Budapest Locals enough - I was already giving verbal recommendations out to fellow American travellers I met later that same evening in Budapest. Thank you Orsi and Anita for such a wonderful and fulfilling experience!

Definitely the Best! Don't miss out!. My husband and I had a private tour with Barbie in Budapest prior to our Viking river cruise. Barbie was the BEST!! She customized the tour for us as we had already seen a few of the sites. When Barbie arrived, she sat with us and went over the routes and sites and asked our opinions. We stopped every few hours and she would get the map out again to show us what she wanted to us to see and ask our input. Barbie covered everything you would want to see in Budapest and More! She was very knowledgeable and any question was always answered in great detail. Barbie not only gave us the history and sites, she was passionate about her city and by the end of the tour, she became part of the family. By far, this was the best tour we had in Budapest. In fact, we were able to share our knowledge with fellow passengers on the river cruise, and many of them were disappointed that they did not get a chance to do one of their tours. In fact, if we had more time, we would have loved to do another one of their tours. I would highly recommend doing the tour.

Thrilled with Budapest Locals. We booked extra time in Budapest before our Viking Danube River Cruise. There were 4 of us and none had ever been to Budapest. We got some ideas from friends who had been there but had no clue how to navigate from place to place. Our neighbors had just been to Budapest and shared the website of Budapest Locals with us. Anita had been the organizer and Barbie the tour guide. They came with high recommendations so we signed up by email before we arrived in Budapest. They worked with us combining our ideas and adding their suggestions. It was a wonderful combination of food tasting at the strudel place, local market and ruin bars along with learning the history and seeing the highlights of Budapest. Barbie was so delightful, informative and answered our many questions. She even met us the following day for a shorter additional tour. We all had a wonderful time and will remember it fondly for many years.

Excellent tour . I couldn't have asked for a better tour! 7 friends and I traveled to Budapest and lined up a private tour for the day after we arrived. Barbie was our tour guide and if I could give her more then a 5 rating I would. She customized the tour so we could get a good overview of the city while also seeing behind the scenes because some of us had been to Budapest while it was the first time for others. She is incredibly knowledgeable about Budapest history and customs. Very kind and patient will all of us. The tour included local coffee and strudel and 24 hour public transportation pass, you can't beet the price and personal attention - forget all other tours! Our tour was 4 hours, but she stayed later with us so make sure we got to see the shoes because it was important to us. We can't say enough good things about her. Also, Anita at Budapest Locals was very responsive organizing the tour and made it very easy!

Spectacular Tour Guides. My wife and I spent a short weekend in Budapest on our way home and had made no plans beyond our hotel reservation. A 1/2 hour prior to taking off from Heathrow, we went through TA, identified 2 well rated tour agencies and shot out quick e-mails.Within the 1/2 hour prior to take off, Anita from Budapest Locals had already responded. We asked, half expecting a negative response, if we could secure a tour within 2-hours of our landing crafted to our specific passions; Food and history. Not only was Anita quick but she was impressively constructive suggesting a guide who is passionate about food and working to make sure she could accommodate us as she was currently on tour. By the time we landed in Budapest 2.5 hours later, we were confirmed to go which was pretty impressive. Our guide, Barbie was absolutely phenomenal! She quickly led us to the Great Hall market where we started with a wonderful Hungarian Ghoulash and Spritzer. This was just the start of our culinary adventure as we wandered the market and had all sorts of exotic treats including cold cuts, an assortment of pickled vegetables (who knew these could be so scrumptious) and several other local Hungarian dishes. What I loved about Barbie is her knowledge of Hungarian geography and culture really complemented the tour as she peppered our tour with all sort of tid bits about the foods origins, regions of consumption, local preparation techniques etc. The rest of the tour consisted of a visit to coffee and confectionary shop which was an inspired choice and where we feasted on a variety of cakes including the Hungarian national cake. We finished our tour at Simplza Kert, a ruin hangout (think of alternate artsy hangout that would have been vogue in Willuamsburg a few years ago, but probably now in Bushwick, Brooklyn). Barbie hang out with us way past her 'official' time and led us back to the hotel after an exhausting but wonderful afternoon (all this took place between 2:30pm and around 9pm). Anita (who owns Budapest Locals) and Barbie have been wonderful with follow on e-mails including recipies of the dishes we sampled. Great after sales service! One final aspect we really appreciated was Barbie's knowledge and candidness around Hungarian history. The 20th century was a tough one for Hungary and Barbie led us by sites of historical significance and gave an informed, thoughtful and balanced perspective of the country's history and how it is dealing with ramifications today. Overall, and we do not say this lightly as seasoned travelers, one of the most memorable and personalized tours we have ever taken.

Budapest with the PITA Group. We travel every year a group of us to different parts of the world. We chose a river cruise this year on the Danube and it was great. We were told about a tour in Budapest, as we were all staying there for 3 days before the cruise and my friend recommended Barbie for the tour, She was absolutely fabulous, she took us to all the places we needed to see and experience, the Jewish Ghetto, The Market, The Holocaust memorial, Turkish Baths, she explained everything so well. she is so full of spirit and you can see she loves what she does. I would recommend Budapest and Barbie to the Max. Love Budapest!!!

Best walking tour ever!!!. We were recommended for the Walking tour with Barbie from Daniela and her family who took the tour a few weeks earlier. The best decision we ever made. We were a group of 14, everyone felt the same way. Barbie is very knowledgeable about the history of Hungry and made the tour very delightful.. We visited placed we wouldn't have if we had not taken a tour. We ate authentic Hungarian food that was delicious. Love the goulash and the strudel but my favorite was the pizza at the market. Barbie was very attentive to everyone needs and she is the sweetest person to deal with. By the end of the tour she felt like she was my best friend. I would recommend this tour with Barbie to anyone going to Budapest. Once you do the tour you can find your way around the city and feel right at home. Loved this tour!!!!! Thanks Barbie you are the best.

Insider's Budapest tour. We had Barbie as our guide. She was amazing and very knowledgeable in Hungarian history and well organized timewise!! We were a group of 14 family members, and we did all we set out to do and then some! Barbie organized an exceptional tour for us, she was very prepared for her time with us! We went everywhere and tried food and shopped and learned about Hungarian customs!! It truly was a trip of a lifetime!!

This tour is amazing in rain, hail and shine.. I booked this tour about a month before I arrived in Budapest. I wanted a tour that went into depth of the history, its food and a perspective of what there is to do, as I was going to be there for a week. So I booked the 8 hour tour. It was the best decision I made, as it made the rest of my stay so much more interesting and fun!On the day, it was pouring with rain, this did not slow us down. I met Brigitta in the lobby armed both with umbrellas and we were set for the 8 hour adventure! The trip was all planned out and she had a wealth of information to share. If I had already seen something she was also flexible enough to change the course to add something else into its place. We also visited places that I would never have found on any tourist map. That made it even more exciting to experience it like a local. There was so much food to also try on the trip! If you every get the chance try the Cabbage Strudel i'm now addicted to it.I highly recommend this tour and would use them again in a heartbeat.

Best tour ever. My husband and I took the 8 hour tour with Barbie. She was a wealth of information. I had s list of things I wanted to see and she had already planned on showing us every one of them. We also had a variety of the local foods for our lunch. We tried some things we never would have tried. All in all a wonderful experience.

Guided Tour, Jewish Secrets. A very dear cousin made arrangements for me to take a tour when I was in Budapest yesterday. She made all the arrangements with Anita via Internet and my tour guide, Barbie, was at the pier where my AMA Water cruises ship was docked. Precisely on schedule. I chose the Jewish Secrets tour and was very happy with it. Barbie is very knowledgeable about Hungarian history and the Jewish quarter aside from being a delightful and charming person to be with. She was also most considerate about asking if we were moving too fast. Her English is impeccable and she also speaks French and planning to learn Spanish.I wish I had planned on spending a few more days in Budapest. Beautiful city, delightful people.I highly recommend Budapest Locals Guided Tours.

Make the bachelors party something special. When I searched for personal guided tours in Budapest, the Budapest Locals were the most sympathic and friendly looking offeror. Just after the first 5 minutes I knew it was the right decision to choose these guys. I was looking for a combination of sightseeing and some other funny stuff which cannot be missed on a bachelors party. The Budapest Locals made up an individual program which was just great. We have seen the most beautiful sites of Budapest and tested many local specialties of food and beverages. Our two tour guides entertained our group of 12 people in every second and let time of 6 hours go by in a flash.If I will ever go back to Budapest, I do not need to look on Tripadvisor again – I know already who I have to contact!Thanks a lot!

budapest holiday. we were two nights in budapest and bridget of budapest locals made all the difference in the world . she took us for a walking tour around budapest and by the evening had shown us the best of budapest. my wife and bridget became best of friends and though the next day bridget was not supposed to come , she made a special effort and came took us around the city. i thank you both anita and bridget for the small personal touches you gave us , made us feel as if we knew you for years. i do hope that you continue to grow and do brilliantly.anita please accept our best wishes and blessings for the young baby. all the best

Great Overview, Very Friendly and Informative Guide. We spent an entire day with Barb as our tour guide and thoroughly enjoyed seeing all of the attractions, including an introduction to various Hungarian foods and snacks. Barb is a very friendly and informative guide and managed to get us to all major attractions in our day long tour. We toured at a relatively quick pace, which was our preference, although this company is very flexible on both pace and visiting the attractions that are of most interest to yourself. I would definitely recommend Budapest Locals to anyone looking for a complete overview of Budapest, its history and cuisine, all wrapped up in a one day tour.

Insiders Budapest. Our guide for the day was lovely Bridget. She arrived at our hotel 10-15 mins ahead of schedule. We discussed the program for the day. This was an 8 hour tour. She was personable, gentle, thoughtful and mindful of when a break was appropriate or when to push off. We walked, hopped on trains, buses and trams. We tried local treats as fruit strudels of many varieties. But we particularly loved the cabbage strudel. At the Central market she bought us lunch and other yummy delights as exotic sausages and pickles. Have you had a watermelon pickle? Go with these folks and they'll show you. We had the best goulash in the market. At the Jewish Quarter we were treated to a Flodni a yummy pastry. She even helped make a reservation for our evening meal in the neighbourhood.She gave us enough historical background of the genesis of this country through the difficult years to contemporary times. My group of 4 enjoyed not only the tour but also the personality of our guide. Thanks again to Bridget.

Best personal tour. My parents and I recently did the personal tour in Budapest with Barbie and we loved the tour. We learned so much about the the city and got to see so many amazing buildings, churches, statues...we even had a fabulous snack in the middle of the tour! Barbie even gave us great suggestions for what else we should do during our time in Budapest! I highly recommend their tours!

You Can Mess Around With The Competition But Why Bother, This Is The Best. We have been fortunate to enjoy guided tours around the globe and we always make an effort to find the best wherever we go. So this is it; Budapest Locals is the best, nothing more to say. For sure no one knows everything about anywhere, we all keep learning, but the attention to detail, interest in what the tourist might be interested in and care to provide a tailored tour of Buda and or Pest is unrivalled. Our guide was the delightful Bridget, economist graduate with a flair for tourism and a passion for all that Budapest has to offer. Amazing value for money and an insight to Budapest we might never otherwise have had - thank you Anita and team.

Come hungry in Hungary!. My husband & I just finished the Insider's Budapest 8-hour tour. We can both confidently say that this was money & time spectacularly spent to get the most out of Budapest. As we stayed on the Buda side, we opted to visit sites on the Pest side during the tour. Our tour guide, Barbie, was extremely flexible, kindly starting with breakfast because we had not eaten yet. Barbie was very personable and full of information! We could not have asked for a better time. Anita, who facilitated the scheduling of the tour, was easy to work with and gave great suggestions for places to visit that would not be covered on the tour. We had more food than we could eat & it was all delicious. In short, we would recommend this tour - or any they offer - to anyone visiting Budapest! Plus, we were given a bag of paprika, which was a huge plus!

Unforgettable 1 day tour experience in Buda and Pest. What a great morning to start and meet our lovely tour guide Gaby who has so much knowledge about the historyOf Buda and Pest. My wife and I chose a full day tour before we embark to our Viking cruise. Having Gaby as our privateTour guide was definitely the very best way to tour Budapest. We felt that we are visiting a local friend that has a passionand interesting information about the amazing history of Budapest. Thanks Gaby, we would highly recommendthis unique tour to our friends and family and by the way the food is delicious.

Good personal tour. We had a 2 person day tour around Budapest with Bridget. Perfect guide which is flexibel in the programming to suit our interests and show + taste all the good parts of Budapest the day before visiting the F1 GP at Hungaroring.

An Excellent and Insightful tour. We heard about Budapest Locals from our friends who had visited Budapest the week before we went . We were recommended to do the walking tour with Barbie of Budapest Locals . We emailed Barbie from Vienna and got a quick response to book our tour for July 7th .Barbie was a delight . She met us at our hotel at 10;00AM sharp ,greeted us with Hungarian chocolates and off we went to Explore Budapest .Our family ,my wife , my two 20 year old daughters and myself had a wonderful day ! We went to The Heroes , Memorial Square ,explained about all the Hungarian kings and their history ,the Turkish bath ,climbed the Cathedral ,ate the Best pasteries I ever had ,went to the City Market --an awesome experience -- where we had goulash and listened to a gypsy band ,went to the ruins bar in the Jewish quarter ,crossed over to Buda to tour the Castle district .... until 7pm . Barbie was great ! Spoke perfect English and really enchanted us with her city of Budapest . Would highly recommend Budapest Locals to anyone visiting this beautiful City as the starting point of your stay . We stayed on four more days and would visit places she recommended and it was great !

"Sunshine on a Cloudy Day". I wish I could give ten stars! I set up the reservation online and Anita got back to me very promptly with a few different options based on my travel itinerary. I chose to meet with Bridget on the same day that I arrived. Anita set the whole thing up and communicated often via email to ensure things ran smoothly. The tour was fantastic. Bridget was very knowledgeable about the history of the country. I became acquainted with the train and bus system while getting a feel for the layout of the city. Bridget even borrowed an umbrella from a local merchant for me to use when the rain started halfway through our tour! The tour itinerary is flexible and can be structured around what you prefer to see and do....although I let Bridget choose---as this was my first visit--- I highly recommend booking a tour with Budapest Locals......

Gabrielle was a great guide . Great day with Gabrielle touring through Buda and pest. She was very knowledgeable and shared a lot of great information with us. Great overview of the city and made the remainder of our stay easier to navigate through. Top notch. Stop for strudel was a bonus!

Absolutely Wonderful!!!!!. Gaby was Bust Wonderful, very knowledgeable, charming, and fun. Every penny was worth it. She took us everywhere we wanted to go, she made everything so easy. We just loved it.

Wonderful afternoon with Barby!. We only had a few hours before our Viking River Cruise was to begin but we wanted to see a few sights and get a feel for beautiful Budapest, and wow, Barby really delivered!! We learned a lot about the history of the city, traveled by public transportation, went up the St. Stephens Cupola and tasted some delicious strudel! It was a wonderful few hours that our whole family enjoyed! Koszonom Barby and Anita, we can't wait to try the recipes you sent us and hopefully visit Budapest again someday! We highly recommend Budapest Locals!

Hot in the City. After a personal recommendation to take a private tour with Budapest Locals, it was a delight to be guided by Gaby through the beautiful city of Budapest the afternoon of our arrival. We chose the Hidden Gems Tour which took us through a wide selection of places from an Art Nouveau building, around the dome of the Basilica, and into one of the eclectic ruin bars in the Jewish Quarter. Not only is Gaby good-humoured and excellent company, she has an extensive knowledge of the city and its history. The tour laid a perfect base for our stay, with the extra service of Gaby and Anita keeping in touch with us each day of our trip, and following up any bookings we needed. Absolutely recommended!

The most delicious tour!. Bidget was an excellent guide. She was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly, showing us all the hidden gems of Budapest's cuisine world. It was such a personal tour, uniquely created for myself and my friend. We had the freedom to do more or less if we wanted. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a great introduction into the robust, colorful and delectable world of Hungarian food! Anita was most excellent in setting everything up. Thank you both!

Amazing experience!!. We had a fabulous time with our tour guide Bridget! She was very kind and knowledgable making our tour very memorable! She gave us many options to choose our tour from which enable us to make the best decision for our family. We were given a personalized touch by a hotel pick up as well as tickets for transportation and local delicious treats. She also helped us with additional plans and reservations in the area. We strongly recommend this tour. ❤️Magyar (Hungary)

Great introduction to Budapest!. Chose Budapest Locals based on the reviews on trip advisor, and they lived up to the praise!. We had planned the Insider's Budapest tour with Anita weeks in advance of our trip. We got there a day before and realized there will be rain and thunderstorms the next morning. Decided to check with Anita the night before if we can start our tour an hour or two later. She responded quickly to say no problem at all, pick your time! That was a relief. Met our guide Barby the next day and began our fabulous day in this pretty city. She was great company, very friendly and knows her city well. We covered a lot in a full day tour. They buy you lunch, included in the price and a great introduction to the local cuisine. Loved our coffee and desert break at a local cafe, again included in the price. They even buy you water bottles during the tour. She introduced us to all the local means of transportation. Both Anita and Barby have let us know that they're available for any tips or help, eg restaurant reservations etc, even after the tour and I'm dying to try a few Hungarian recepies Anita has shared with me. This tour was worth our time and money and I would recommend it to all.

The best Budapest tour!. We had a wonderful tour through Budapest. The tour is unique and personal. It's a one of a kind tour. My boyfriend an I have been walking around Budapest the whole day with Barby. We could tell Barby our personal preferences and desires. Barby could tell us everything about the history of the city and the local food and she was very good company! We booked this tour very last minute and that was not a problem at all!

Wonderful Budapest experience. On our first full day in Budapest we met Bridget at our hotel to begin our tour. We chose a full day tour, and she gave us history, local insight and background of many of the sights and landmarks in the city. We sampled food and drink, traveled the Metro and did a lot of walking, which was good since we consumed so many calories!We are a couple in our 60's, and she had the right of amount of rest stops planned on our walking portion of the tour. We sampled strudels, and saw one being made. We sampled a lot of different food at the Great Market. We saw both Catholic Churches and Jewish Synagogues. We ended at the Jewish Quarter and a Ruin Bar. Bridget was always checking with us to see if we wanted to see anything in particular, and was quite willing to tailor the tour to our requests. She was personable and made us feel quite comfortable with her. I highly recommend her and her group of locals. Even after our tour, Anita emailed us with recommendations for the remainder of our stay.

Terrific tour with an enthusiastic Local. We booked with Anita via email and Gabrielle showed up to our hotel right on time. They assisted with a few restaurant suggestions before we arrived so we could garner reservations and we were guided to some fabulous local dining spots that we would not have otherwise have found. Gabrielle did a great job introducing us to the local culture, tram system, etc. which made the rest of our trip much more manageable. Stopped for streusel and a coffee and hit all the highlights with insights and tips along with a great historical perspective of all the changes politically and socially through the years. Overall great day! Highly recommended as high touch service.

Beyond excellent!. We chose Budapest Locals primarily because of the unfailingly stellar reviews here on TripAdvisor, and the reviews were spot-on. We had Brigitte as our guide, and I can't say enough about what an excellent job she did and what a pleasurable experience it was from beginning to end. Her condensed history of Hungary at the Heroes' Square was worth the price of admission. She was personable and extremely knowledgeable, and went out of her way to make sure we were getting what we wanted out of the tour. Our entire group was very impressed. Anita was also fabulous and extremely responsive in coordinating the tour and answering questions. I can't imagine anyone could go wrong booking with them, and judging by the other reviews I'm not alone

Uncovered a new culinary world. Bridget was our guide, and our expeditionary team was our usual family of 4 with 2 kids aged almost 14 and 10. We met Bridget where we were staying, she was armed with a 24 hour transport pass and off we went to a number of destinations. We started with some Strudel and I personally was delighted to learn that Strudel need not be sweet, it can be savory. We sampled cabbage strudel, sour cherry, cheese (kind of like a ricotta), apricot, poppyseed and more. We then went on a tour of the major Cathedral (St. Istvan), and a walk through the Jewish quarter. This was food tour + general tour and orientation to Budapest. We went to the Great Market, had some incredible pickles, Goulash, Amazing Langos, Fried Sausage, untried sausage, etc. I know it sounds like a meat fest but we had one near vegetarian and one non beef eater in the bunch, and yet everyone was happy. We went to a fantastic bakery where we sampled half a dozen desserts, and finished up at a "Ruin" bar. This was a great tour and Bridget was lovely. I plan to try some pickle recipes when I get home. For those of you considering doing the tour, I point out the following. 1. There is some walking, but in my opinion not too much--very reasonable. 2. I have come away with a new appreciation of Hungarian (Magyar) food. If you have specific dietary restrictions, point them out, I am confident that Bridget or her friends can accommodate. That said, I would put aside your preconceived notions and instead, learn to say "Yes, I will try that." My guess is that if you are on a food tour you have figured out that you can learn a lot about a culture from its food, why deprive yourself of learning by saying no. I get it if it is a deeply held religious belief...3. This is a great way to see the city. Its also a great family activity. At the end of the day you can talk about both "what was the coolest thing you saw today, and ... what was the best thing you ate today"4. A tour like this will help you make the most out of your dining time in Budapest. I have nothing against Pizza and Doner Kebab, but there is so much to explore in this cuisine, it is nice to have an orientation.

"Budapest Delights Tour"--No better way to see Budapest. This group's high rating is well-deserved. Me and my wife spent the day with Barby on the Budapest Delights tour and had an absolute blast.Barby was a smart woman, extremely polite. She was willing to share her personal opinion on Budapest, which made it feel like a tour from an old friend. The food vendors that we visited knew her well and seemed to be more than willing to go the extra mile for her. Logistics were simple. She met us at our apartment at our desired time. If you are looking at a private tour in Budapest, just book this one now!

The perfect food tour. Our group of four did a walking food tour with Anita. I obviously expected to have fun, but it completely exceeded my expectations. Anita was excellent company and introduced us to food we probably wouldn't have tried on our own. (Pickled baby watermelon? Delicious!) She also gave us some really good advice for the remainder of our trip. It was a wonderful way to see the city and absolutely worth the money--I can't recommend this enough!

Personalized walking tour of Budapest. My daughter found Budapest Locals on line and we are so happy she did! Our tour guide Bridget was amazing. She customized the tour to our preference and walked us to see all the amazing sites! The Opera House, Heroes Square, the Parliament, the riverfront, Chain Bridge, even Liberty Square. Bridget was fabulous! Informative and interesting, funny and honest... We LOVED her! Thanks so much. You are awesome! Thanks for one of the real highlights of our entire trip.

Enlightening and Enjoyable Day. Our family (11 & 15 yo daughters) so enjoyed our tour of Budapest with Detty. She was very engaging and included the girls so well. Her grasp of English was excellent and her knowledge of the sites, history and culture was great. It was so nice to visit places and find out about the history from a Hungarian. She was very accommodating and developed the tour based on our interests. Detty took care of everything for us during the day. Anita responded quickly to all our questions and made setting up the tour via email easy. We are completely satisfied customers, and highly recommend Budapest Locals.

A wonderful Sunday in the park, and beyond, with Gaby!. Gaby met us (two senior couples from the U.S.) at 10 am at our hotel near the Opera and we began a thoroughly enjoyable tour on both sides of the river in Budapest. It was our first full day in the city and we walked, learned how to use the subway and bus to return to places we wanted to further explore the next day. Gaby began Budapest's complex history at Heroes' Square and wove more stories about her home country into her narration as the tour continued. We asked lots of questions which she answered thoughtfully. We especially loved strolling through idyllic City Park and past the baths, a few minutes observing worship at the Basilica of St. Stephen, the Strudel House goodies, then the magnificent views from Fisherman's Bastion and the Castle area. The tour made our visit to Budapest absolutely memorable! It was easy to arrange online and confirm details once we arrived.

Great intro to the city. We have been told by several friends and guidebooks that a private tour can really be worth it as an introduction to a city you don't know. We certainly found that to be the case here. Our tour guide was extremely friendly and professional and we got introduced to the city in an up close and personal way. When you look at some of the prices, realize that they include a ton of food and drink (more than 3 stops worth on our 8 hour tour). When you factor this in its quite the value. Highly recommended.

Fantastic way to see this beautiful city!. My Dad and I took a fantastic tour today with Bridget. She was on time and extremely knowledgeable about her beautiful city. We only had about 24 hours in Budapest and this was by far the most fun and efficient way to learn and see the city. Making the reservations via email was extremely easy and the Budapest locals team was excellent. I would highly recommend Bridget and her team again. Let her know what you're interested in and how much time you have and she will make it a delightful experience. Thank you Bridget.

Terrific overview of Budapest. Brigitta arrived right on time and took us to a local traditional coffee house where they make an amazing variety of strudels. She asked us what we wanted to see and do and then she formulated a plan for how we would spend our time with her. She showed us how to use the Metro and tram system, took us to the City Park where we got to see inside the Bath house. She showed us all the usual tourist spots that we could have seen on our own, but she was able to give us history and trivia that we wouldn't have known otherwise. She took us across the river so we could tour over there and at the end of our time with her, she left us to explore on our own. We felt like we knew everything we needed to know about Budapest. It made it easy for us to explore the city for the next few days. She also gave us great restaurant suggestions for traditional Hungarian foods and more hip restaurants which were great experiences for us. We all thought she was one of the best tour guides we'd ever had.

Fantastic tour with everything made easy!. My wife and I along with our 2 young daughters (9 and 11). Went on a Budepest Locals Tour with Bridget recently and we could not have asked for a better experience. Setting up our tour with Anita could not have been easier. We had an easy email exchange where Anita gave me all the information on the tour along with pricing which I felt was very reasonable considering the service you receive. Even after some delays where we had to change our arrival into Budapest, Anita and Bridget made it easy on us by adjusting their service to our revised schedule. The tour itself was very comprehensive where we blended some standard sites with things that Bridget thought we may like to see after getting to know what we wanted to do . Some tours can be rigid in their itinerary but this was not one of those tours, Bridget was very flexible and genuinely cared that we were satisfied with what we were seeing. The best part of the tour was how Bridget paid extra attention to our girls and was not afraid to communicate with them on their level so that they enjoyed the tour as much if not more then we did, she also really went above and beyond in trying to give us and our girls a true taste of the Hungarian culinary experience. Budapest Locals as a company is very generous in including all of that in the tour. Thank you Bridget! All in all this was a wonderful tour and the ladies of Budapest Locals are wonderful people. The service they provided us even after the tour was remarkable and very generous, answering any questions we had and always quick in giving us a suggestion to make our stay in Budapest the best it could be. We highly recommend Budapest Locals and we truly feel that if you are looking for a top notch tour group your search should end once you see how great a company this is!

Absolutely brilliant tour. We read lots of reviews and researched a lot of tours in Budapest and definitely chose the best! When I booked with Anita I mentioned that we were all really looking forward to a good days tour as it was my friends birthday. Bridget met us at our apartment with a small gift of deliscious local marzipan chocolates for the birthday boy! She asked us if we had any special requests of where we wanted to go and gave us a few suggestions too. We spent the next few hours travelling around the city on the metro and trams (all included in the price) Bridget's knowledge of local attractions and history was amazing and she really enjoyed showing us her beautiful city. She bought us water to keep us going and took us to a lovely cafe for drinks and an amazing selection of strudels (again all included in the tour price). The tour gave us a great overview of Budapest and Bridget told us what trains, buses and trains to get in the following days to enable us to see more of the things we wanted to see and do. The tour ran over by more than an hour but Bridget was fine with that as she was going home after we finished. We told her to go and leave us and we would make our own way back to our apartment but she insisted on taking us back. We all had a really fantastic afternoon with Bridget and can't recommend them highly enough. What we learnt on our tour enabled us to make the most of our few days in Budapest. Thanks so much to Bridget and Anita xx

Best choice of tour guide we could have made!. We were a group of four people who took a tour with Bridget from Budapest Locals today. Being here for two days before our Viking tour we wanted to have a tour that would take us to places other than where we would go on the included Viking tour. Bridget was not only very pleasant and patient, her English was excellent. We would not hesitate to recommend her. I noticed that Budapest Locals did not have as many reviews as other tour companies but I can assure you that it was only because they only started their own agency about a year ago. The quality of survive was GREAT. My favorite place was Liberty Square to learn about the history of the monuments - opposing Soviet and US as well as the Hungarian monument to those who died in WWII. Her explanation of the monument itself and the "protest monument" to honor those of Jewish decent who were killed by Hungarians as well as Nazis was very moving and interesting.I also liked that the tour included a public transportation ticket for 24 hours which we later used to go to the bath house. It was so easy to use the metro to get there after Bridget explained the route and system. P.S.The stop for strudel was yummy!

Fantastic Tour with great guide!. We selected this personal tour band on prior TripAdvisor suggestions. We tried others, but these folks were the first to respond cordially and promptly.Gaby was our guide and she was fantastic! She was exactly on time and was patient, informative, fun and really a gracious host.The tour was a solid 4 hours and we saw a great deal of the city. Being given a real understanding of the city, it's history and the people of Hungary was enjoyable. That it was given in such a friendly and easy manner made it all the better. Both my wife and I cannot imagine having enjoyed Budapest as much without Gaby's tour. I highly, highly recommend the tour to anyone!

Highly recommend this tour.. From start to finish this was a great experience. They certainly deserve their high rating. Booking was seamless and the tour was customized to meet our desire for food and to see city highlights that weren't covered by our previous day Viking tour. Gaby was a very well informed and delightful guide who met us promptly at our hotel and proceeded to show us the city sights, feed us well, and tell us about the city. It was a delightful day despite the cold weather. I contacted Budapest locals after reading many TripAdvisor reviews based on their positive reviews, their all cost included policy and group instead of per person pricing. Payment was at the end of the tour in a combination of Euros and HUF.

A fantastic experience of Budapest. We really enjoyed our tour of Budapest with Bridget. She was very capable of answering any question we had and gave us a great overview of both contemporary Budapest culture and historical context. She was very friendly and we definitely felt well looked after for the tour. We started the day with a strudel breakfast after being met right at the door of our accommodation, followed by a leisurely walk around one of the historical districts of the city. After a short tram ride we went to the market hall for a very fulsome lunch, then finished with cake and palinka. Even though Bridget had a well planned tour she was very happy to adapt based on what we wanted to see. We would highly recommend the tour and Bridget as a great way to experience Budapest in a personal, friendly, and contemporary way!

Great tour, awesome guide, and amazing food in Budapest!. I would highly recommend using Budapest locals. I picked hem because of the strong reviews and also because for the same price we were able to get a 5.5 hour private tour while other companies were group tours. This was the first time we did a food tour of a city and it was great. Bridget was our guide and we really enjoyed spending time with her. It was like walking around a new city with a friend. She was very personable and had was very knowledgeable about the city, it's history and of course the food!  She was flexible with our plans and while we ate strudels for breakfast (which were delicious) Bridget went over a rough idea of what she had planned for us. We actually had done quite a few of the things the previous day and she quickly made other suggestions to see where else we would want to go. The central market hall was great and we had a ton of different food to try, we couldn't even finish it all. Bridget did a great job explaining about the different types of cuisine and talking about the typical Hungarian recipes and ingredients. We had a great day exploring with her, and she gave us good reccamendations and tips on getting around the city and places to go as well. The follow up from Anita and the Budapest locals was great as well. She reached out to me while we were still in Budapest and offered to help us with anything if we needed it. She also followed up with a separate email with recipes of several Hungarian dishes as well. I would highly reccamend using Budapest locals and go as far to say it t was one of the best tours that I've done so far in all my travels. Bridget was a great guide and had a great blend of friendliness, warmth, professionalism and information.

Wow!! What a Wonderful Tour!. I am totally amazed at the amount of both Buda and Pest that were covered in one wonderful full day of wandering and exploration. Everything was covered, public transportation (which made it easier on later outings), coffee breaks and lunch. Anita shared her love for her city and shared her interest in cooking from helping us find "just the right" paprika to explaining about "Beigli" a walnut or poppy roll that is a traditional holiday treat. I have wonderful memories, but am so glad I can look back at pictures since there were so many things to see (like watching bakers make strudel.) Comfortable shoes are a must as is a camera.

Fantastic Family Day with Budapest Locals and Anita. Family travel typically is a 'do it yourself' event for us, but our trip to Budapest was most positively influenced by our decision to have Budapest Locals show us the way. Anita arrived on time and quickly established a rapport with my family, including two teen aged boys. Our plan for the day was clearly explained with maps and enough flexibility to allow us each to enjoy our unique preferences. Using the public transportation is an excellent way to see Budapest and Anita's made sure we watched her purchase our tickets and learned how to purchase tickets on our own. These daily tickets saved us money and time the following day. We selected the entire day tour (8 hours +) and ended very satisfied and informed (and well fed!). Anita's first-hand experience and stories of growing up in the area made the city much accessible and vibrant, especially when compared to the harsh history of the 20th century. She was a good source for me to learn more of the city's historical culture as part of my own newly discovered genealogy connection. It was as though we spent the day with an old friend. Anita's recommendations and logistical instructions for the following day when we were alone were spot on. We were able to see and do everything on our list and still had time to explore. If walking is not an issue in your daily life, I'd suggest avoiding hiring a private car / bus. The traffic and difficulty for parking would eat up your time trying to find your driver (as well as eat up money with the added expense). The trams and buses were not difficult at all after experiencing them first-hand with Anita. We stayed on the Pest side (near the main train station) and used Anita's recommendations based on our hotel location and map directions to explore the following day. The personal touch, public transportation and walking tour method is perfect for Budapest and I recommend Budapest Locals to help any visitor to this very fine city.

Great Tour with a Personal Touch. We did a two day tour with Barbie for 5 hours each day and it was amazing. The best thing we can say about the tour was that our kids (6 and 9) were engaged the whole time. Barbie was so knowledgeable about Budapest and talked about the history of the city like only a local could do. After 2 days we gained such a huge appreciation for the city and we could have never learned so much from just wandering by ourselves with a map. Breaks were timed perfectly and the places we stopped always had something yummy. We felt very comfortable with Barbie and our kids saw her as a big sister by the end of our second day. She paid close attention to what we liked so the tour never felt like it was a standardized agenda. We loved that we took public transportation to and from a lot of places (and a lot of walking in between) so at the end of our two days we really felt like locals. We really enjoy touring European cities with private tour companies and Budapest Locals was one of the best experiences we have had. We would highly recommend Budapest Locals to anyone interested in getting to know the real Budapest.

Friendly, funny and very informative. If you're interested in the secret side of Budapest, then Budapest Locals is for you. Our lovely – and glamourous – guide, Anita, took us down hidden passages, into gorgeous art-nouveau cafes and around obscure neighbourhoods as she told us the history of Budapest. At times it was funny, sometimes it was moving (the "Shoes" monument by the Danube is very poignant) but it always interesting. And – and this is the best bit, kids – Anita fed us with coffee and strudels and schnapps along the way, all included as part of the price. Seriously, book with a tour with Budapest Locals, it's money very well spent – though you might have to go on a mini-diet when you come home.

Best Possible way to see Budapest! Budapest Insiders Tour with Bridget.. This tour was the highlight of our sightseeing time in Budapest. Packed into a very busy day, it gave us an amazing understanding of the history and culture of the place from a local perspective. Bridget was our guide, she was fantastic! Informative, really interesting and also very genuine and generous in her approach. As well as having a very detailed understanding of the history, she shared her own perspectives and stories which were really interesting. Conversation was interactive and we felt very involved versus being talked at. We visited all the key places of historical interest , as well as some other interesting highlights such as morning coffees and strudel at a well known local strudel house, Hungarian lunch at the food markets, and Palinka shots at a Ruin bar later in the day ( totally optional but we were keen to taste!) Such a good mix of everything and great value for money. We also got great advice on how to manage public transport etc for our remaining days. Can't recommend Bridget highly enough!

Lovely tour of Budapest! An excellent value!. My husband and I only had 1.5 days in Budapest and wanted to efficiently see and learn as much as possible in a short time, so we booked the full-day tour with Anita. We were not disappointed. Anita met us at our apartment in the morning and then showed us many great areas of the city, taught us how to get around on the tram, and let us try lots of tasty treats. Overall, it was a great tour. We felt like we were wandering the city with a very knowledgeable friend and saw and learned so much. Considering that we had a guide for a full day, got totally stuffed with delicious Budapest favorites, and had free transportation, the tour was an excellent value. I'd highly recommend this tour and Anita to anyone visiting Budapest!

Wonderful tour! A great overview of Budapest.. We booked the 4.5 hour tour and it was perfect! It was long enough to see the highlights of the city, but didn't wipe out the kids (ages 7 and 10). Anita, our guide, is absolutely brilliant! She is very knowledgeable and easy going. Our kids just loved her. Also, the Strudel House was a fun afternoon treat were we got relax and talk for a bit.

Great Budapest tour. This was our first trip to Budapest and we booked the 4.5 hour tour based on the glowing reviews in Trip Advisor. Our guide Anita met us at our hotel and gave us a fantastic tour of this beautiful city and its main attractions. This was a great thing to do on the first day of our holiday, giving us a general overview, a practical insight into how to get around the city, recommendations for restaurants and help in planning the rest of our stay. Anita is interesting and knowledgeable and gave our sightseeing an historical, political and social context which was fascinating. Not just boring dates but a real insiders view! Highly recommended.

BEST Tour Ever! Can't recommend enough!. Whether it's your first visit or 20th, we highly recommend a tour with Budapest Locals. We spent the day with Anita who is way more than a tour guide, we truly felt like her guests. She showed us the 'real' Budapest and tailored our day to our interests. Her knowledge is astounding, she gave us a great understanding of Hungarian people. Another bonus, Anita taught us how to navigate public transportation and marked up a map with the places we went and other sights we should see including restaurants/cafes to visit. Thank you so much Anita!! XO J&B

A GREAT way to start our vacation in Budapest!. We booked a tour with Budapest Locals based on the feedback we had read on Trip Advisor. It was absolutely the best and smartest thing we did on our trip. Anita met my family at the apartment we had rented on the day we arrived and spent the afternoon showing us Budapest. She provided so much history, showed us many of the famous sights and even how to get around using the buses and metro stations. It was such an amazing and informative tour. Halfway through the tour we stopped for strudel. About that same time it stopped being a tour by a guide and became a new friend from Budapest showing us their city. She was genuinely interested in learning about our family and ultimately sent us several Hungarian recipes that my daughters were interested in. It was an amazing day and a great way to start our adventures in Budapest. Thank you Anita! – Scott, Staci & the girls

Excellent 4.5 hour tour of BP. Anita was very kind enough to take me on a 4.5 hr walking waking, bus, train and tram tour of both the Buda and Pest side. Before the trip, Anita was welcoming and polite when arranging details over email. Her English is excellent. Anita picked me up from my (airbnb) apartment on time. Anita is very knowledgeable and combines interesting facts with accurate historical detail to give the perfect tour. Anita is adaptive to tailor the tour to your needs. Conversation flowed easily and I felt relaxed yet at the same time enthused throughout the tour. I would highly recommend Anita for any individual or small group (up to 3 people max). The "private" part of this tour is crucial as the one-to-one focus makes this tour more involving and more fun than a group tour.

Budapest guiding: excellent service all round. Anita and Gaby proved excellent tour guides for our group of 30 English school children and 4 teachers. Liaison beforehand was very good and our walking tour of the Jewish District was superb. They really got the pitch right for the pupils who enjoyed the quirkier sights too such as the ruin pub we popped into (not to drink I hasten to add!). We also benefitted hugely from Anita guiding us on our Danube Bend day tour. Again, she suggested some really good activities and sights for the group and made the whole day a real success. If you want a very friendly, personal yet totally professional service, you won't go far wrong with Budapest Locals. Many thanks

Great start to my vacation with Budapest Locals. My vacation to Budapest began with an excellent tour organized by Bridget and Anita at Budapest Locals. I discussed the tour itinerary with Anita over email, who was very helpful answering my general questions about the city, and went on the tour with Bridget. The tour included an excellent breakfast at the Strudel House (All food, drinks, and 24 hour subway ticket were included in the tour price), a visit to Liberty Square, Heroes Square, photos at the top of St.Stephen’s Cathedral, a walk in the Jewish Quarter, Vajdahunyad Castle, samplings of paprika chicken, langos, cabbage, and sausage at Central Market Hall, and a shot of palinka at a ruin pub. Bridget was not only very knowledgeable about the cities history, with excellent stories about many of the statues and buildings we passed, she also had great ideas of places to visit and eat for the rest of my stay. Compared to the group tours/ free walking tours that I took in the other cities I visited during my vacation, the tour by Bridget was by far the best. By the end of my tour I had a great overview of the city, along with a full itinerary of what to do/ where to eat for the rest of my trip. I highly recommend Bridget, Anita, and Budapest Locals for anyone who is planning a trip to the city.

Wonderful Tour. Recently took this tour with Anita, we (myself and mother) did the Insiders tour which is roughly 8 hours, a pretty full day. I was a little nervous an 8 hour day of touring might be tiring but it was really lovely. There was no feeling of being rushed to see everything in a short amount of time and could go at a leisurely place, opting to spend a little more or a little less time at particular sights. Anita is incredibly knowledgable and accommodating. Organizing the tour was easy and she responded to emails promptly. I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Budapest, no need to do a free walking tour if you choose her as you will cover everything and more in greater detail!Also the food we tried was authentic and delicious, missing the Strudel and Langos!

The best way to start your Budapest holiday. We had a fab tour with Anita. It lasted 4 hours, maybe slightly more and she showed us some of the great sights and eateries of Budapest whilst giving us great insight in to the history of this fabulous city. I highly recommend taking a tour as the company is so easy to deal with; the booking process is easy, the price is fair and the guides are knowledgeable and friendly. I feel that a walking tour is the best place to start as you get to understand the history of the sights that you are visiting and you can pick areas that you would like to revisit. Also, there's nothing like the recommendations of a local. Anita made many suggestions for sights and eateries to try and as we still had 2.5 days of our trip remaining we were able to visit many of these. Thank you so much for a wonderful tour and helping us make the most of our time in your fabulous city!

Great Budapest walking tour. Anita was our tour guide. She was knowledgeable and informative about all the places we visited. She gave a great tour including the "tree of life" and the Jewish section of town to the House of Parliament and heroes square. We saw several churches with a tour of the cupola and great picture taking opportunities. The lunch at the market was incredible and the goulash was great also. We had streusel of all sorts with coffee. A lot of great food and great stories with historical backgrounds to go with them. A totally wonderful day.

all the best of Budapest in 4 hours!. Thank you to Anita for a fabulous tour of Budapest! It was 4 hours of non-stop top sights, history and invaluable local knowledge with a break in the middle for the best strudel we've ever tasted (make sure you try them all!) Anita was friendly, very knowledgable, easy going and great to talk to. In addition to the wonderful tour she gave us some amazing recommendations for local food to try and a great navigation lesson for the public transport system. In fact she pretty much planned our itinerary for the rest of the trip and even called the river cruise company to amend the day tour we had to a twilight tour as it really was the best time to see the city lit up beautifully - thanks so much for that Anita! We bumped into her the next day whilst she was giving a gastro tour and it was like bumping into an old friend. We are so pleased we took this tour.

Great time in Budapest with Barbara. I’ve spend 4 days in the amazing city of Budapest and I can totally recommend a tour with Barbara. She knows everything about the city and she shared all her knowledge about the history and architecture of the sights during the tour. I was really impressed by the beautiful buildings in Budapest so it was more than helpful to have had a guide who was able to explain the stories behind the buildings. I definitely loved the view from the castle and Matthias Church but I also enjoyed the famous Chain Bridge, the Heroes' Square or the Great Market Hall where we bought typical and delicious products from Hungary. If you want to know where the best places for food next to the Great Market Hall are, Barbara knows the answer and will tell you about it whether you want a lovely sweet snack, have a coffee or go out for dinner. Don’t miss the traditional goulash soup during your stay. Barbara was very keen on giving advice about public transporting as well and bringing her guests to places where they can go on with their journey. Always very friendly, she made her guests feel more than welcome. Moreover she helped to organize tickets for a tour of the Budapest Parliament which I definitely would recommend. The parliament is just amazing. All in all, I definitely want to go back to Budapest – also to go to one of the baths Barbara was talking about.

An Excellent Tour and Great Advice!. Anita was our guide and she did an excellent job! Lots of walking, public transportation, good history and a stop for the best Streudel we have ever had. She took care of all the costs as part of her fee and it turned out to be the best thing we did in Budapest. We highly recommend Anita for a private tour.

Top marks for an amazing insight into Budapest and its delicious cuisine!. For us, this tour tops all private tours we have done in any city, and we have done many. What did it for us was the perfect combination of history and food. If you want to get to know a city fast and well, this is certainly the way to do it. Before our arrival, Anita was in frequent contact to ensure that she planned the perfect tour for us. She also gave us advice on trains to Vienna and booked the river cruise for us which saved us a lot of time queuing. Anita came to meet us at the hotel at 11am and we immediately felt at home in her company. She spoke to us about our itinerary then took us to the strudel house where we tasted an incredible selection of strudels - delicious! She also gave us a welcome gift of paprika which I will use to make goulash soup. We enjoyed the snack stops during the sightseeing which was a great opportunity to refuel and taste the local cuisine. Public transport was included in the price and the ticket that Anita bought allowed us to travel until 11am the next day. We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to the market where we ate even more. Anita, knowing that I like baking, bought me ground poppy seeds which are hard to find in the UK so that I can try making some of the delicious cakes at home. When we got home, she sent me a number of easy to follow recipes (she also works in a cookery school). Whilst in Budapest we did encounter problems with a certain taxi firm and Anita helped us tremendously, this was 2 days after the tour! I cannot thank Anita enough for making our visit to Budapest so special. We can't wait to return and will recommend Anita to our friends!

Budapest Tour. I had an absolutely amazing time with Gaby. She was highly knowledgeable and knew every corner of every street, including history. Had a lovely day and would recommend to anyone visiting the area. After the tour she also assisted in acquiring tickets from the train station. What a help!!! Gaby thanks for the amazing tour of Budapest.

Brilliant introduction to the City of Budapest. This was a fantastic way for our group of 6 to find out what is great and worth visiting in Budapest. Anita was easy to deal with prior to arrival and turned up on time at out hotel as planned. She took care of passes for travel, and her introduction to the geography and use of public transport saved a fortune (and was quicker) than getting cabs.The history of the city is fascinating (and traumatic too), but her knowledge was detailed and entertaining. She also had a sense of humour, and showed us most of the sights and places of interest (highlighting ones that we could see in more detail later).Finally, even after the tour (which included a lovely coffee and pastrie break), she stayed in touch and booked a river boat cruise for us. To cap it all she sent some simple Hungarian recipes for us to have a go at when we got home.Cannot recommend highly enough.

Budapest at a glance. Fantastic tour we had yesterday. Annita the key person in Budapest locals was outstanding. From the very first day I have contacted her to agree the tour details was such an informative and pleasant. It was a must tour for us in Budapest as a visitors first time for just 3 days and annita managed to show us the real flavour of the city, with its hystory, culture, people and hidden things that we feel like part of the story. Even the advices, recommendations she gave us was really helpfull. Definitely recomend to take the tour in Charming Budapest all you need is to relax prepare yourselve and enjoy the story of the city.

Great food with many stories and a lot of history. I've done four European food tours in the past four months, and this one was definitely the best. Our guide was extremely helpful and knowledgable, and she artfully blended information on Budapest and important monuments while directing us through public transit. I don't usually care for the sweet pastries that filled a lot of the trip, but they were quite good. I judge all other food tours from this one: a guided tour through a city, interrupted by stops for local delicacies that have their own stores.

Not to be missed. If you are visiting Budapest and you have a passion for discovering local cuisine while learning about Hungary's history then stop what you are doing and immediately book a tour with Budapest Locals. Anita met us at our Airbnb flat and guided us through several cafes, shops, bars, markets and historical sites. The sheer volume of food was impressive. I'm a big eater and this tour challenged me. We donated some of the leftover food to some homeless folks in the subway station and we STILL had leftovers to take with us. Delicious Strudel, cakes, sausage, pork tenderloin, langosh, pork cracklings, cheeses, spreads, pickles, stuffed peppers, stuffed cabbage. You name it, if it's Hungarian cuisine, we probably ate that too. To make it even better, Anita would pay for everything on the spot, and basically bring everything to us -food, beers, palinka, whatever we asked for. This tour is maybe one of the best values I've come across in my travels. Very very impressive. The historical insight was also wonderful. Hungary has a long, interesting and complex history that Anita explained effortlessly. Absolutely fantastic. Do it. You will not be disappointed.

Brilliant! A highlight of our trip to Budapest. Planning a trip, I have decided to include a city tour in our short-stay program: Budapest has such a rich history to discover. And I am so happy I have chosen Budapest Locals! Even before we arrived I received enormous support from Anita. She was very helpful, attentive and just nice to deal with. We really did not feel how time passed: a nice walk, interesting stories and in-depth knowledge of history of Hungary. It was a real pleasure. Anita is really a very nice company and a great story-teller. We both appreciated how the tour was designed and customized for us. Overall - I can only recommend. From first contact to the end of the tour - was simply amazing. Thanks!

Fantastic day!. We enjoyed the one day insiders tour. A combination of history,architecture and local sights we wouldn't see on our own. We stopped along the way for hot wine ,strudels ,local cakes and "langosh"(Anita had them prepare vegetarian for us)We really enjoyed the day!Hope to be back soon!

So much better than a "standard" tour.. jó napot . . .. . . one of the expressions I learned from Gabriella. I felt so special with her personalized treatment. Recovering from a sprained 73 year old knee, she kept the walking to a minimum, but still saw a lot of the essentials for a first visit to Budapest. Since I enjoy public transport , the trams, buses and metro were part of the fun. (I even followed Gaby's suggestion and rode the no. 2 tram the next day) And the stops for strudel and then the meal in the largest market hall I have ever seen were timed perfectly. (Beware of the spicier peppers!) A whole floor dedicated to pickled anything. like pickled "baby" watermelon! And don't miss Buda. As Gaby told me, those who don't live in Buda wish they did.And the stories go on. Hippos have their own spa. Ice skating . . . . A delighful day - could not have been better. Thank you Gaby and Anita.

Excellent guide and top tour of a fascinating city. The 5-star TA reviews are spot on! We spent a full day with Gaby showing us Budapest on the Insiders' Tour. These ladies offer a different, personalised and definitely "insider's" experience, which we completely recommend. Anita organised things well through email and followed up afterwards (including some recipes), both very professional and friendly. Gaby was a real star as our guide. She is lovely person who gave us the best private tour we have had in a number of places in several countries. It was thoughtfully different from usual mass tours without being restrictive or too quirky.She has a delightful personality and coped with aplomb with our attempts to navigate overly icy streets, adjusted the tour accordingly while never making us feel rushed, and always made all 3 of us feel as though we were walking and talking with a companion and friend, all in excellent English. She showed a great knowledge of her city and gave us much information and many insights, and answered all our questions, often with a personal flavour being a "local". But she also obviously has a real passion for her city, its culture - and its cuisine - and conveyed that as well. The lunch stop at the Market, the 2 cafe stops (strudel and cake) and drinks at the ruin bar were all great (and delicious) and well timed for those not used to walking all day. Her selections in each case were delightful.The tour itself was well structured to cover many major sites from Heroes' Square to the Castle & St Matthias and made very good use of public transport - allowing some time in less touristy aspects of the city. Since Gaby picks you up and returns you to your hotel, each tour must be individually tailored around a common core. No leaving you to wander around town trying to find, or get home from, some business location! The cost was reasonable considering it is all-inclusive of food, entrance fees and transport as necessary, while extra maps, notes and suggestions for the remainder of our time were very helpful.If we return to Budapest we would include another Budapest Locals tour (or 2) at the top of the to-do list. Thanks again Gaby for such an enjoyable and memorable day!

What a fantastic day... A must if visiting this wonaderul city!. We have just returned from our Budapest Delights tour with Gaby which excellent. The food places visited were fantastic and we got to taste and learn about wonderful Hungarian food. I don't think we will be eating tonight. Gabys knowledge on Hungarian history and of the historical buildings we passed was brilliant. My son and I had a super day, one which I would highly recommending for your first day in Budapest as it combined fantastic food with a city walking and tram tour.The starting time was flexible. We started the tour at 10am and returned to our hotel at about 4 pm. Gaby met us at our hotel and also walked back with us. Anitas email correspondence in organising our tour was prompt and efficient.We loved the personalised tour. Many thanks for an excellent day in Budapest.This is a must do tour

Excellent walking tour of Budapest. Despite the rain, I had an enjoyable time walking through the streets of Budapest and listening to all the stories and facts Anita was telling us. She was Informative and passionate about the city she lived in since her childhood when Hungary was still under the communists. It wasn't just a tour with city statistics but one with personal insights human interests. I also loved the fact that we could travel on local public transportation as well as walking from one attraction to another. She watched over us carefully to ensure our safety. The tour ended in a popular pastry shop where she introduced us to a wonderful cake with our coffee. I only had an afternoon and I wish had more time as there was so much to see. So if you have more time, I would highly recommend a full day in Budapest with Budapest Locals.

Wonderful tour of Budapest!. Our New Year's in Budapest was perfect, with this tour being the highlight We very much enjoyed our custom 6 hour tour, which was a combination of walking, tram, and bus, accompanied by professional, knowledgeable, and friendly commentary about the history and stories of this beautiful city. In 6 hours we hit all the highlights, as well as interesting "off the beaten track" areas. We very much enjoyed our tour and time in the market, sampling indigenous favorite foods, while learning where they come from and how to make them back home. We had delicious delicacies, some quite adventurous, and we loved them all. We were also provided helpful advice and suggestions of what restaurants we might enjoy, and where the locals spend their free time. We very much recommend Budapest Locals.

A fantastic day. Just returned from a New Year break in wonderful Budapest. As we were there for a short time, decided to make the most of our time with a Budapest Locals tour. Anita met us at the hotel and entertained us for the next 6 hours. We opted for the Budapest Delights option and were overwhelmed with the amount and variety of food and drink provided as part of the tour. Anita is a superb guide with a huge knowledge of all things Budapest - art, culture, religion, history, transport even football along with a great sense of humour .Would recommend anyone visiting Budapest to take a tour with Budapest Locals, you wont be disappointed.

Essential first day in Budapest!!. We booked the Budapest Delights tour less than 48 hours before arriving to Budapest. Anita responded to our email and questions and was able to accommodate our short notice booking. Barbara was our guide and met us at our hotel, a very friendly, knowledgeable lady who was an absolute pleasure to have as our guide for the day. We started at 9:30am and finished after 3:30pm. We had the most memorable day, visiting a lot of the iconic sites and landmarks on our journey to some of the eating destinations. To say there was plenty of food is an understatement, we were so full that we took the cakes we couldn't fit in home. This has been the highlight of our trip and we feel the perfect start to explore such a fantastic city. Thanks again Barbara you were terrific!! Two very satisfied customers.

Excellent relaxing well-paced tour of Budapest. We had booked a 4 hr tour with Anita ahead of our trip. She was everything others have said - relaxed, nice and very knowledgeable. I had meant to book a culinary tour but I asked someone else to book it and I forgot to tell them the culinary part so we just got a regular tour which was great. She was very flexible and modified the tour since we had walked around and seen many of the sights already. She had a driver and took us all over, had arranged a Parliament visit and also a visit to Matthias Church. What a beautiful city! She also sent us some classic Hungarian recipes - awesome perk!

Local tour with anita. Highly recommended.We travelled around pest with anita- it was a great day, sight seeing was full of anita's fun activities and fun to know facts about the sights.Anita is a joyfull interesting tour guide, she made our tour - unique, fun and we learned alot about budapest.Can't imagine our trip being as wonderfull with out her! ממליצה בחום לפנות לאניטה- בחורה מקסימה, כייפית, מלאת ידע מעניין ורלוונטי לדעת על הא רים השונים.מספיקים בכמה שעות איתהלראות, להנות, לחוות, לצחוק ולבלות בכל המקומות המומלצים.חד משמעית שווה כל שקל - אנחנו עשינו החלטה נבונה כשקבענו איתה - כיף גדול!!!

Brought Budapest to Life ...... Anita was an amazing guide and we fitted in more in 8 hours with her than we would normally discover in three days ....... She grew up while Hungary was still under Communism and shared her fascinating insights and perspectives while we discovered the history, food, way around including the best strudel & ruin bars, with lots of tips to ensure we made the most of the rest of our time in this wonderful city.

Excellent . Fantastic tour with Anita who really know how to make you feel comfortable and in a very relaxing way,where she took the time to explain everything.I really can recommend her because she ha a lot of knowledge about Hungarian history and tell it in a very passionate way.5 stars from me Kenneth Thomsen0359

Anita is an excellent guide, fluent in English and really knows the city well. We want to highly recommend Anita and Budapest Locals - one of the best private tours we've tried. On her website there are a number of suggested tours, priced in Euros. She is not able to take credit cards, so make sure you have cash (We paid in Euros but she's happy to take Florint.) We were having a three-day visit to Budpest, so I contacted Budpest Locals to arrange a full day tour - "Budapest Insider" a full day - or 8 hours.
