As this is a private tour, we were able to customise the itinterary and Anita gave us a number of options. We exchanged a few emails before we arrived and Anita was able to suggest a few things to the day we arrived and when to plan to visit the spa Szechenyi Baths.Anita met us at our hotel and was very friendly, very informative and very very knowledgable about her city. The tour price included entrance tickets (where required), lunch and also one-day travel passes on public transport. After being shown around by Anita, we were quite confident to travel around on public transport ourselves for the rest of the trip.We were shown around most of the "top 10" places from our guidebook. Walking or taking the train as necessary. We were also taken to local cafes where we tried out local food (that we would probably not have dared to pick ourselves.) We finished off in a "ruin bar." Anita had also recommended a river cruise for the previous evening, but as we hadn't gone, she booked us on the cruise that evening - another great recommendation.

The Best Tour Guide In Budapest. What a wonderful overview we were given of this delightful city! Not only did our guide provide an in depth history of Budapest but was also proficient in the cuisine. Anita described how to use the delectable paprika and where to buy the best brand. Not only that, but she asked if anyone was interested in the Hungarian recipes using paprika, to let her know and she would email recipes to us from the culinary school she is associated with.To my amazement and surprise, I just opened a very nice email from Anita with some fabulous recipes with pictured instructions.Anita was a terrific guide and made our stay in Budapest even more remarkable.

A great tour. Anita of Budapest Locals is a terrific tour guide. She arranged a schedule that was perfect for the time we had. All transportation, fees and expenses were covered by the tour fee. All I had to do was to look at all the great sites she took me to and listen to her expert understanding of the area. Budapest is a very interesting city to tour with many wonderful things to see. The best way to do it is with a personal tour, by Budapest Locals. I cannot recommend the experience enough.

personalised tour of Budapest - outstanding. We contacted Anita and left the itinerary choice to her. We are well travelled and like to see interesting but not to touristy things. What we got was a day out in Budapest with a friend, a guide, a historian, an encyclopaedia, a person who loves food and her home city and someone who knows just about everything about Budapest. We also met someone who is interested in other people and who loves intelligent conversation.Trust me, when, not if you choose Budapest locals, you will have the best day of your visit to the city.At the end of our tour Anita gave us an itinerary of suggestions for the next two days we were there for and delivered on her promise to send us some Hungarian recipes.her best piece of advice was to visit the Buda side of the river and to try the Spa in the City Park (take your swimming costumes) - oh, and visit the Market. thank you once again Anita for a fantastic day in Budapest..

Best Tour In Budapest, Don't Miss it!. This Is a private tour with one guide that takes you to many stops to taste different types of Hungarian special foods and Drinks! Our guide Anita was wonderful ,she picked us up at out hotel in Buda and was prepared with public transportation passes for us for the next 24 Hrs. She spoke perfect English! We started at a strudel house relaxing over coffee and my favorite hot chocolate with whipped cream while we tasted many types of strudels. We even got to watch the strudel being made. Next we ventured to the grand Market and Anita selected many Hungarian specialties for us to taste. Being a Saturday the crowded market would have been really hard to navigate,but she found us seats and went about getting us food and beers! We wrapped up our leftovers to take home.We went to another location for wine tasting, and also to an amazing local bakery where we were able to sample a platter of cakes and pastries (my personal favorites). Our last stop was one of the ruin bars in the Jewish district where we toasted with a shot of Palinka. This was my third trip to Budapest and we were having dinner with some of my relatives (my mother was Hungarian),that evening. Anita went over the menu with my husband,since this was his first experience and told him what would be a good choice.This is the way I like to see a city and get a personal touch and feel of the people. Anita was wonderful and helpful in giving us information about the city and history about the areas as well. Plus getting to taste local foods is always a plus. I cook a lot of Hungarian foods and this was a wonderful way to introduce my husband to the country and for him to understand the hungarian culture. Bring a camera,wear comfortable shoes. This tour took 5 hours and we loved every minute of it! Don't eat anything before you go!!!!

See Budapest with a local. We would thoroughly recommend taking a tour with Anita (one of two 'Budapest locals') at the start of any visit to this charming city. We spent a day with Anita and it gave us an in-depth look at the city, the main tourist sites and a number of the less frequented places as well. Anita really knows her city and she gave us plenty of information in an interesting, amusing and knowledgeable way. The day passes all too quickly but, at the end of it, we were a good deal wiser, we felt able to find our way around over the rest of our stay, including using the buses, metro and tram, and we had sampled some wonderful local food in cafes, bars and the Central Market. Luckily we had a healthy appetite but even so we needed a doggy bag at the end!It is difficult to imagine a better way to get to grips with a city, so we were really pleased we had decided to avoid the standard group tours and given Budapest locals a go! We hope you do the same - we're sure you'll enjoy it as much as we did!

An excellent experience. Anita was a wonderful hostess and the tour was fabulous. Not only was the tour great, but Anita went out of her way to help with any further needs or requests during our visit.

A Day with Anita Barta - Perfect!!. We had a fabulous day with Anita as our guide. She is informed, energetic, enthusiastic, charming and fun to be with. She picked us up at our hotel at 9 a.m. and deposited us back at 5 p.m. The day literally flew by, filled with the sights, history and incites of her city and country. We traveled the subway and street cars, ate some great food of Anita's choosing - she even shared some recipes for using the paprika I bought. All in all our day with Anita was a wonderful start for our 14 day river cruise. Merta Trumble

Budapest Locals. Anita Barta took us on an 8 hour tour of Budapest that could not have been better. She met us at our hotel. She had already purchased an all-day transit pass for us. She tailored the sites and pace to our interests and abilities. During the tour, she showed us very apropos photographs of historical scenes and provided a narrative that put sites we visited into context. She took us to a fantastic place for lunch where we watched strudel being made. We ended at the Market where she bought us samples of a variety of Hungarian dishes, all included in here standard fee. Anita is very warm and personable. We had a very informative, delightful day touring the city Anita loves. Ed

So much more than a food tour!. I can't imagine a better tour or tour guide of Budapest than Anita. She picked us ( 2 adults in their 50s and 4 in their 20s-30s) up at our hotel to show us her city and provided a wonderful, very large, cross section of Hungarian food. Along the way to restaurants, a ruin pub, and the market, she described the history, political and cultural changes ( so many!) of her city and country. One of the nicest parts was that she was honest - she expressed her opinions in a humorous yet straightforward manner and used personal anecdotes - very unusual and appreciated in a tour guide. We only want to return to Budapest to find out and explore more. She showed us how to manage the subway system, gave us sound advice on the baths and other activities, and answered the myriad of questions we threw at her. She also has been available to us for questions since the tour ended. Wonderful start to our Danube vacation.

Great memories. Sweet Gabriella took us on a wonderful tour of this amazing city. She covered everything from breakfast(loved the place)to the central food market, historical buildings and a small winery.The tour is complete and very enjoyable. So was our guide, Gabriella was very warm, friendly and knew everything about the city. A good way to get a first glance at Budapest before exploring on you're own.

Very informative tour with a delightful guide. Anita was a very well informed guide who had a fantastic sense of humour. Her sensitive approach to the German occupation, the Ghetto and the soviet years was like a breath of fresh air, full of optimism for the future whilst acknowledging the past and it's impact on Hungary. We had a wonderful time and both my wife and I whole heartedly recommend Budapest Locals as the only way to really see the city

Wonderful Day. We had Gabby as our guide for the day. She picked us up from our hotel and as we were doing another tour with our river boat cruise, we asked her to take us to the attractions that we would not be visiting on our other tour. She was able to change our itinerary on the spot and we walked and used the local underground and trains to criss-cross Budapest. She has an amazing knowledge of her city and we conversed about many subjects regarding different sites; she a very comprehensive memory. She made sure she took us at our own pace and my favourite place was the local market and market hall where she fed us the local food and specialities. We loved this tour and it is a day which we will never forget.

No better way of getting to know Budapest. 4 of us had a personal tour with Anita for the day. The great thing about this tour is that you get to see all the main attractions in about 6 hours but at the same time get a fantastic overview of life in Budapest with a few local treats along the way..

Very interesting and helpful. Anita was a great guide, very interesting and informative. She also took us on the subway , showing us how to use it, this was invaluable! A must for any visit to Budapest.

BUDAPEST TOUR. Excellent tour. Friendly and knowledgeable. Well worth the cost - all entry,fare and food costs included. I would recommend this tour at the start of a holiday in Budapest since it will give you a good feel for the place.

An Awesome Tour of Budapest with Gaby. I am not in the habit of writing reviews but when good things happen and you have an enjoyable experience I feel it is important to take the time to do so.My wife and I and another couple had arranged for a 3 day stay in Budapest prior to a Viking Cruise on the Danube. Looking to arrange a tour of the city we checked on Trip Advisor and found some good reviews of tours with Anita. After contacting Anita via email, she advised she could not do a tour herself but her colleague Gaby would be available. Arrangements were made for Gaby to meet us at our hotel and as arranged, Gaby was there to greet us. What followed was an awesome 4 hour tour of Budapest that Gaby customized to our requests and did so in such a friendly, informative and knowledgeable manner. Her love for such a great city was evident and only enhanced by the wonderful way she shared it with us. We hope she enjoyed it as much as we did. Thanks Gaby and cheers to our drink in Ruin Bar.

Amazing day with Barby!. We were in Budapest on a girls weekend, and are so happy that we had booked this tour. Barby spend so much time with us, was so patient and friendly, and showed us so much of the city. We ate and drank so many amazing things, it was the best way to get acquainted with the city! I would highly recommend a tour with this company! She was very punctual, professional, and yet so much fun! Thank you so much!

More than a food tour. My husband and I came to Budapest by train. I had been in contact with Anita by email since I was a little concerned about the situation at the Keleti train station. I had also heard that sometimes it's hard to get a taxi from the station. Anita, who wasn't able to take us on our food tour, because she was already booked, arranged for Gaby to meet us at the train station on Saturday when we came in and get us a taxi. Our food tour wasn't until Monday, but there she was when we got off the train. It was such a relief to not have to worry about how we were going to get to the hotel. On Monday, Gaby met us at our hotel and whisked us away to a marvelous 5 1/2 hour food tour. We started with a tour of the market. Gaby purchased several items for us to taste. From there we went to a wine bar and had two delicious wines with a cheese plate. One white and one red. We also had 3 different pieces of cake at a pastry shop. Afterwards we went to the Jewish Quarter and a very interesting little place called a ruin bar where we had a shot of palinka. She also took us to see the Opera House and St. Stephen's Basilica. The whole time Gaby explained the history and customs everywhere we went. This was so much more than a food tour. I highly recommend Budapest Locals and Anita and Gaby. They will take care of you.

Anita is wonderfull. We really enjoyed our half day tour with Anita. She packed a bunch of exploring in a short time She is very sociable and does a nice job of providing a local perspective., on the sights, and history. Our favorite part was the tour of the food market, and sharing some local favorite foods with her.

Fantastic food tour with Barby. Barby took my girlfriend and I on an amazing culinary tour of Budapest. She turned up exactly on time at our hotel, for the next 5 1/2 hours we travelled around together visiting a whole host of locations around the city eating the delicious things it had to offer. These ranged from langos (fried dough with cheese), to the Hungarian cake of the year to palinka (fruit brandy) not to mention cheeses, wines, sausages, goose and various pickled vegetables! One piece of advice I'd echo would be to NOT eat before doing this tour. You will be stuffed by the end. I’d highly recommend this tour to anybody visiting Budapest, it was an absolute delight.

Hidden gems tour with Gaby. Our tour with Anita's assistant Gaby was wonderful. She met us at our hotel and we did a part walking and part tram tour. Gaby was very knowledgeable about the history of Budapest and Hungary. We had originally scheduled our tour for two people but found another couple on our boat that wanted to go with us and she was most accommodating. We enjoyed the market and all,it's wonderful offerings, the climb and or elevator ride to the top of St. Stephen's for a wonderful view of the city. A walk by the Parliament building and a tasty treat at a street side cafe. We would highly recommend this tour to oother. Gaby even bought us tram tickets to go to the Jewish district on our own the next day.

Great tour of Budapest!. We arranged a "Budapest Overview" tour with Anita while visiting Budapest with friends. What a great tour! Anita not only took us to a lot of the Budapest attractions, she also taught us how to use the public transportation system, took us to a strudel place for a variety sampling, and gave us a history lesson on Budapest and Hungary. I felt as if I was touring with a college professor, so thorough was Anita's knowledge of the people and events of historical Budapest. If you are looking for a great tour operator while visiting Budapest, look no further than "Budapest Locals". It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

Budapest Locals is highly recommendable. We were three friends that did the Budapest Delights with Gaby and we had an amazing time. Gaby picked us up at our apartment in the morning (what a service) and took us to the St. Stephens Basilica where we went up in the dome and enjoyed the view. Afterwards we went to a Strudel place and sampled different variations of this delicious pastry. We went to the Food Market, where Gaby bought different samples for us and explained about the different Hungarian specialities. We had a snack lunch here where we tried some different dishes. All was excellent and there was plenty of food, Gaby took care of everything and we did not have to worry about a thing, afterwards we went to a wine bar close by, had a cheese plate and some very nice local wines. From here we went to a ruin bar, that was so interesting and we would not have been able to find it ourselves. On the way we passed the Synagoge and had a great discussion about Jews in Budapest during the 2nd World War. Gaby was so patient with and had answers to all our million questions. This was the best part about the day, that we got a insider view on life in Budapest. We can highly recommended doing this tour for anyone wanting to get a better understanding of life in Budapest and Hungary, the culinary side and otherwise, A big thank you to Budapest Locals and Gaby for giving us such a nice experience,

Fantastic experience!. We found Budapest Locals through Trip Advisor. Anita was great in responding back to our enquiry, and made organising tours absolutely hassle free. We decided to have two tours with her - Hidden Gems and Budapest Delight. They were both wonderful - Anita was very informative, and offered great suggestions and advice on other things to do and places to eat. Thanks Anita for welcoming us to Budapest - and highly recommend Budapest Locals to anyone who is visiting Budapest!

Excellent and informative tour. Anita is an amazing tour guide. My friend and I had 2 scheduled tours with her and we were totally amazed by her hospitality and massive knowledge. She also gave us lots of pointers on other places we could visit, eat and shop on our own. 2 thumbs up for the tours run by Anita.

Epicurean Tour With Gabriella. My husband and I scheduled a tour with Budapest Locals to coincide with our Viking River Cruise. We only had a few hours before our ship sailed and we felt this was THE best use of our free time. Gabriella met us at the dock and we walked a couple of blocks to the Market. This is a 3-story marvel that is packed with vendors stalls, shoppers and tourists. We could have easily spent the entire tour there, but after sampling Langos, roasted goose, pickled garlic and Hungarian beer, we walked a short distance to a lovely little wine shop where we sampled "Bulls Blood" and a variety of cheeses. We were surprised at the differences in taste/texture of the goat cheese, in particular. Afterward, we should have walked to the next attraction, but in the interest of time, we took the tram to the Jewish Synagogue and on to one of the most interesting places we saw on our trip: a "ruin bar". Our tour of Budapest was very special to us as Gabriella shared with us a little history, stories about her family and gave us a flavor of what life is like in Hungary, She was a delightful companion and guide and we could have spent hours more sharing stories with her. Unfortunately, we had to cut our tour short and get back to the ship. We felt we had a true "cultural immersion" with Gabriella and were the envy of our shipmates when we shared our excursion experience over (a very light) dinner. We recommend skipping breakfast and lunch before taking this tour and, above all, pace yourself! The food is delicious, and portions are large. A follow-up email included Hungarian recipes and the name of the wines we had sampled. We plan to stay in touch with Anita and Gabriella in hopes we can show them around our part of the US one day!

Absolutely fantastic experience. I found Budapest Locals through TA and the reviews were spot on! Anita was amazing! She is so passionate about Budapest and Hungary that it is contagious. She met my husband and I at our hotel and then we travelled using public transportation for the whole day. We went to a strudel place and sampled a large variety of flavors and all were delicious. Then off to the Central market where we learned the difference and importance of paprika, visited pickle shops, sampled a variety of other Hungarian specialties, such as, sausages, salami, cheese, a special fried dough and stuffed cabbage. Next we were off to a wine tasting. Then to try cakes and lastly to a ruin bar in the Jewish quarter. While traveling to each spot Anita showed us landmarks, statues, important buildings and their relevance to today and the Hungarian people. The tour is all inclusive so you never reach your hand in your pocket. If you are visiting Budapest, then you MUST take a tour with Budapest Locals!!

Budapest Delights. Anita Barta from Budapest Locals showed us the local Budapest eateries. Her knowledge of Budapest was fantastic and showed off her lovely personality. We were taken to a Cafe to sample Strudel. We took public transportation to see St. Stephan's, were told the story behind Gresham Palace, and went to the Marketplace where Anita pick out items to eat that were way beyond what I would have picked but very delicious.We tasted wine and had some cheese and then went to Auguszt for pastries. Anita made the day fabulous. My wife and I would use her again when we return to Budapest.

A walking tour with Anita. We are visiting Budapest with friends and found Anita at Budapest Locals. Our tour was interesting, informative and completely enjoyable. Anita brought the city to life for us and was a fount of information on history, politics, culture and food. We stopped at the Streusel House for delicious strudels and a latte, which is not to be missed. She is very accommodating and was happy to adapt the tour to our interests. We would highly recommend her. A definite hit for all of us.

Outstanding guide in Budapest. Anita Barta from Budapest Locals took six of us on an all day tour of Buda and Pest. She is incredibly knowledgeable and informative and kept us interested and excited throughout the day. She took us to the typical tourist spots, but also to some out of the way places including stopping for the best strudel in town. Her fees were reasonable and although she usually uses the hop-on, hop-off bus, we paid a little more to have a private driver. It enabled us to see and do a lot more. We all had a fabulous experience and would recommend her highly.

Walking private tour. Excellent. We had such a great time . Anita was so interesting also not on a hurry to finish the tour , very interested in knowing our lives too and felt so comfortable . She also incorporates how the locals live and go about Highly recommend this !! Thanks Anita

tour of Budapest with Anita Barta. It is with great pleasure that I write this review for our new friend Anita Barta. My husband and I were lucky to have had an opportunity to meet Anita when she showed up at our hotel to give us a wonderful city tour of Budapest, her home and a place that she has so much passion for. The day was brutally hot out, but that didn't stop Anita. She purchased a transport ticket for all of us and we hopped all around the city and saw the sights. She is so incredibly knowledgeable, but what impressed upon us was her warm heart and her desire to keep us happy and comfortable throughout the day. We never once were bored or disappointed. We never once needed to reach into our pocket for anything, she took care of it all. She is an absolutely lovely woman and I would highly recommend contacting Anita if you're looking for a great tour when in Budapest

Go to Budapest just for this. I can not say enough about Budapest Locals. From the time I reached out to them I was impressed. Anita responded quickly and was able to accommodate my request to break up their long day tour into two. I knew I would like the city when I arrived, taking this tour made me live it. I spent two afternoons with Gabe getting to know Budapest. She was such a delight! She treated me as if I was her personal guest, not just a tourist. We strolled around the city, getting to know each other while she taught me about her home town. I have 3 days left here, and I'm really going to miss her. I feel like I made a friend. At one point I mentioned I wanted to take a cooking class so I could go home and teach my Hungarian Grandmother a thing or two. Later that night I had an email from Anita introducing me to a cooking class I could take with one of her partners. Can't wait for my cooking class!Thank you ladies for a ask the great memories! I wish I could give you more than 5 stars.

Amazing Guide for Budapest. I had the privilege of working with Anita who showed me and opened my eyes to Budapest like no other tour I had previously experienced anywhere. Prior to my arrival she communicated with me to learn whether I had a preference as to what kind of experience I hoped for. I told her that in addition to her tour she might otherwise provide, I was particularly interested in the food, as I like to cook. She provided me what would have been her usual comprehensive tour ( the history, the culture, the important sites, a perspective on how the history has impacted the people) and then went on to provide a culinary tour as well. We explored markets (and shopped), the local cuisine, stopped at typical restaurants, and sampled the wonderful "street food." She also showed me how to be adept with the local transit system, and made specific suggestions catered to my interests for the day I would be on my own afterwards. Anita is incredibly knowledgable, organized, kind, patient, flexible, interesting and interested. I had a particular interest in the Jews of Budapest, and I was stunned by how much she knew about Judaism, in addition to her depth of local Jewish culture and history. Anita could write books, not only of her home town Budapest, but also on what it takes to be an awesome guide.

Top Notch Budapest Tour. Last week my wife and I took in a 5 hour private tour of the Budapest with Szolt. The tour was incredibly informative and educational. Since Szolt is a university trained English and history teacher, his depth of historical knowledge and ability to articulate it contextually was unmatched by any other tour I have been on. Meeting up and communicating with the company was extremely easy. They focused the tour on exactly what we wanted to see while providing many options and constantly checking-in to ensure satisfaction.If you are headed to Budapest, do not hesitate to use this tour company. They are top notch!

Best local tour we've ever taken!. We usually book a private tour in every new city we travel to, but this was by far the best we have had. Anita customized our tour based on both our interests and my knee problem. I was afraid I would not be able to last on a walking tour, but Anita paced the tour so that I lasted for 8 hours! I loved her sharing of the history of the country - not the least bit boring - and I felt we ended with a true understanding of the various events that led to today's Hungary. That sounds boring, but it absolutely was NOT. In addition, we saw beautiful architecture, including the most incredible coffee shop which was formerly a ballroom, parks and monuments that gave a very real appreciation of the city, and wonderful, views! We saw breathtaking views from the copula of St. Stephan's church, and marveled at the cleanliness and efficiency of the underground metro. We tasted several marvelous versions of strudel, learned about the different ways to use Hungarian paparikas, and sampled a huge array of pickles, sausages, and even goose. We were very surprised when Anita purchased all the food we ate over the course of the day saying "it's included in your tour." Our visit to the market was a highlight, but I have to say that the entire day was spectacular. I wish now we'd booked 2 days. There was so much left to see. By the end of the day, we felt like we'd known Anita for years. I have never been so comfortable with a guide. Consider this a bucket-list activity!

Great Budapest Tours. Anita was amazing, she took us to many great places that were off the main tourist thoroughfare. We had lunch at the market and enjoyed a variety of Hungarian meats and dishes. The Jewish area was pretty cool and we were able to try authentic Hungarian strudels. We saw the baths, Heros square, parliament and the opera house. I would highly recommend one of these tours, we gained a tremendous insight to local Budapest cultures and history.

Fantastic and informative gourmet tour of Budapest. Booked this tour with Anita on strength of previous Tripadvisor reviews. We are a foodie family of five with three late teen and early twenties children and the tour did not disappoint. Anita is charming and speaks perfect English and as a teacher at a cookery school in the city is extremely knowledgeable on all things culinary. The tour is fantastic and although mainly walking uses the excellent Metro system where necessary. highlights include watching strudel being made, eating local delicacies at the famous city market and tasting some great wines. Anita mixes the culinary aspects in with the historical and the tour includes a moving visit to site of the Jewish Ghetto during the Nazi occupation. To complete her excellent service Anita has already emailed us detailed recipes of some of the dishes we tasted and talked about during our tour.

Private tour of Budapest with our guide Anita Barta. Great 1st time private city tour of Budapest for my husband, 14 year old daughter and I. We were picked up at the airport in Vienna and driven in a new and comfortable van to the Gellert Hotel to meet Anita. Anita was wonderful! Her knowledge of the both sides of the city, historical information, and Hungarian culinary knowledge was superb. When we told her that we were from Cleveland, Ohio, she even informed us that many Hungarians had immigrated to Cleveland during the communist regime era. She took us to many sights (Heros park, the zoo and public thermal swimming pool, the market where we sampled meats and turo rudi, even a metro station which was so immaculate!) We drove down famous streets to admire Hungarian architecture. Our favorite stop was Castle Hill which where we enjoyed the view of the Danube River, Parliament and the wonderfully preserved medieval town. When our tour concluded, we said goodbyes to Anita in the shopping district and she recommended some great restaurants for lunch. Afterwards, our driver took us back to our hotel in Vienna. We would highly recommend Anita Barta as a private tour guide and thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Budapest!

Private Budapest Tour!. We had a great private city tour with Anita which was great. She speaks perfect English and really gave us a good understanding of Hungarian history. Our four hour tour turned into even longer as we were having a great time. Anita had a 24 hour transit pass for us and we went to Heroes Park, Jewish Quarter, stopped in a Ruin bar for some great lemonade (different than US version), then stopped for amazing strudel, st Stephens Church, and the waterfront. As we did this the first day of our trip, we then understood how to use the transit system and where to go. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

MUST DO this amazing food tour in Budapest!. Anita gave us a fabulous food tour of Budapest. All the food, drink and transportation was included in the price. The portions we were given were so generous that we even had food left over. When we went to the market Anita bought some food there for us to eat and what we had left over she packaged it up and gave it to a homeless person we saw in the subway. Very impressive and so considerate. She is very knowledgeable about the history and was able to answer all our questions. Anita walked at a comfortable pace and we didn't feel she was ever trying to hurry us. I think the tour even went longer than it was suppose to. Totally worth the money! I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND her.

Don't eat for 24 hours before this tour!. Culinary exploration often defines a city for me and our Budapest experience fast-tracked this glorious Eastern European capital to my list of fave global foodie destinations. Anita is a fantastic guide - unbelievably knowledgeable (of course), passionate about sharing culinary tips and advice, and just a great person to hang out with - and eat with (although we definitely did most of the eating!). I'm used to thee-hour whirlwind tours, which are fab but this was a marathon of edible discovery and the absolute highlight of our fur-day sojourn in the city. Anita, thank you thank you thank you!

Family Trip. My family and I recently returned from an amazing vacation in Hungary. Although my husband grew up in Budapest, he decided to hire professional tour guides to show us his homeland and to give us richer explanations of what we were seeing. Anita was our favorite. She arrived and was ready to go with sites planned out that would interest all of us. She was prepared with interesting games, pictures and questions. She presented the horrific history of Hungary’s past in the most sensitive manner that enabled us to reflect and remember, but still see the beauty of the country today. I am pretty sure that we’ll make future visits to Hungary and when we do, Anita will be the first and only tour guide we contact.--From our Daugther: “I’m 7 years old and I think Miss Anita was fun, nice, smart and caring. Miss Anita made it the best trip ever. Thank you Miss Anita.”

See Budapest and Make A New Friend!. August 5, 2015 One of the nicest thing about taking a personal guide to explore a new city is the chance to meet someone who lives there! You see the city through their eyes. We found a perfect guide when we chose Anita Barda. My husband and I were wrapping up a Vikings River Cruise by spending 2 days on our own in Budapest. What a treat having a personal guide! Anita was interesting, knowledgeable, and fun. We mixed the tour between food and history. She took us to the market and purchased samples of local fare....as well, as helping us buy paprika to make goulash soup at home. (She even emailed the recipes.) Everything she chose for us to see was fun. We'd seen many of the sights (Castle Hill, Heroes Square, etc.) with Viking. We saw the Market, Ruined Bars (witnessed a hail storm), had strudel, and wine all covered in the cost of the tour. One of the nicest things she did was plan our itinerary of the next day....down to buying a 24 hour Metro ticket for us and showing us how to use the transit system. She prepared us for a day on our own. You really got two tours for the price of one. Last but not least we feel we made a friend with Anita. She is a very caring and friendly person. Her rates were very competitive! WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND ANITA BARDA!

Personalized Tour par excellence!. We were two couples that completed the gastronomic tour with Anita. She was fabulous! The original tour includes wine and schnapps tasting. Three out of the four tour participants do not imbibe so she restructured our itinerary to accommodate our preferences. She incorporated historical and cultural information into our tour. The price of the tour includes all the food and drinks that we consumed plus a full day transportation pass. Anita also recommended places to shop and eat that were not "touristy." She is a delight!

Return to my Home Town. We recently spent 10 days in Budapest. A little background about us: my wife and I are in our early 40s, my daughter is 7, and our niece who tagged along for the trip is 15.I was born in Budapest, but this was my first visit back since I moved to the U.S. as a teenager in 1989. I speak Hungarian fluently, but I decided to look for a professional travel guide to ensure the best possible experience for my family on a tight schedule.Our time with Anita was the highlight of our trip, and I can honestly say that I would rate her knowledge, communication, attention to detail, kindness and flexibility as a 10 on a scale of 1 to 5!We did the Insider’s Budapest tour, and Anita was amazing. She even split the schedule in 2 half days since our niece was not feeling well on the first day.Anita is extremely knowledgeable about Hungarian history and current events as well. She is super attentive to her guests’ needs, and she can alter the route on the fly to accommodate everyone’s interest.My 7 year old daughter enjoyed every minute of our long site seeing walks because Anita made it fun and educational on every level.This won’t be our last trip to Hungary, and we can’t wait to catch up with Anita again!Family from South Florida

Tour in Budapest. On July 27, 2015 Anita Barta was our guide on the trip "Do as the locals do" with Metro, tramways and walking. We went to the market hall and were invited to taste local products. Afterwards we saw part of the city. A nice experience with a very knowledgable and and excellent English speking guide

City tour. I very much enjoyed the tour with Anita. She is very professional and has extensive knowledge regarding the history of not only Budapest but Hungary as well. Her command of the English language is excellent.

Truly a delightful experience for a foodie!. My friends and I booked the 'Budapest Delight' tour with Anita this month. We were in Budapest for five days and for me, the highlight of the trip was the tour with Anita. The entire experience was fantastic! We started the day at the Strudel House sampling different flavours, followed by a trip to the local market where Anita talked about the history of the place, the products sold inside by locals. Then she bought us lunch purchased from the different stalls - the food were all fresh and delicious! The tour started at 9:30 and we finished at 5:00 PM. We had plenty of food to eat, tasted some great wines from different regions in Budapest and ended the tour with shots of locally produced schnapps at the Ruin Bars which was the perfect end to our day. The entire tour will satisfy the history buffs since Anita is very knowledgeable and the foodies will be delighted with this tour. Great value for money coupled with Anita's charming personality. This is one tour that you should not miss when in Budapest!

Fantastic budapest guide . Highly recommend Anita. A nice mix of history, discussion of Hungarian culture and stopped into great shops. We stopped for strudel at her favorite bakery, went to the market for a traditional breakfast, Anita pulled various delicacies from various vendors and we sat fir an eclectic Hungarian meal. All great!!

Thank you Anita!!. Our family spent 4 hours with Anita 2 days ago and it definitely was not enough time. We wish we had more time. Anita is upbeat, knowledgable, patient (even in record heat) and fun. We walked, trained, ate and laughed together. We would have never found all the hidden sites in such a short time without her.

Wonderful experience- learned so much!. Went to Budapest on a trip with my family and we spent the afternoon with Anita exploring the Pest side of the river. She was a fantastic guide with lot's of knowledge about the history and facts of the area. She purchased locally grown food that is popular in the area for us to try at a farmer's market. I would recommend this to anyone looking to explore the wonders that Budapest holds. Fantastic experience overall!

Fantastic tour--a must-do in Budapest!. Our group of four friends absolutely loved spending an afternoon with Anita! Highlights of the "Budapest Delights" tour included a trip to the market to introduce us to the local cuisine and personalized recommendations for the rest of our trip over wine! Anita also helped to orient us to the city with information on sights and history as we chatted our way across Pest.Fun, friendly guide; excellent service; and delicious food--HIGHLY recommend!

A fantastic private tour of Budapest!. Since we only had 2 ½ days in Budapest, we had decided to hire a private guide to maximize our time. We couldn’t have chosen a better ambassador for the city than Anita! I had read review after review on TA to find the person that best fit what we were looking for; many thanks to the TA community for so many honest and accurate reviews!We booked Anita’s 8 hour tour, which, due to scheduling issues, was split into 2 days (this was, in hindsight, a wonderful solution, since we were fresher the second day). After she bought the public transport tickets (and explained the system), we started with a tour of the market, which is unlike anything I’d seen in size, scope or variety. She bought us many different types of food to sample, which made us more comfortable later understanding the different food choices. From there, we headed back to the Jewish quarter, near our apartment, to wind up Day 1.On the second day, we covered everything else in the city. She explained the history of the city/country, had a very interesting example of the language, gave insight into the days of Communist rule….all while travelling to the various landmarks around Budapest. We had a tasty strudel stop, combined with a wine tasting, which provided a nice break. Anita was very accommodating with our preferences, as well as adaptable when the tour couldn’t proceed as she wanted due to the shutdown of major transportation routes in the city for the Gay Pride parade. But that didn’t affect our enjoyment of the tour, and in fact, added a different dimension that we couldn’t possibly have planned!Anita’s written and spoken English are fantastic, and she was very responsive on email. Anita clearly has a passion for her city, her profession, and for people. Post tour, she forwarded me some Hungarian recipes that I look forward to trying. She was most definitely the highlight of our trip to Budapest!

Love every minute. On the way back from Switzerland we stopped in Budapest for two days. We found Budapest Locals through TripAdvisor and could not been happier.Anita was engaging, knowledgeable and fun to be with. We've seen all the major sites of Budapest and it was actually much more: eating, chatting, strolling in a a very easy-going mood.If you do one thing in Budapest, book with Budapest Locals!!

A scenic adventure through Budapest.... The tour was easy to book and Anita was very accommodating in tailoring the tour to my interests and needs. I genuinely felt at ease and in touch with the city and it's hidden gems with Anita's guidance. A perfect way to get up close and personal with a beautiful city with so much to offer. I highly recommend this tour and would like to say a big thank you to Anita who was fabulous!

Must do tour, absolutely incredible!. Anita was an incredible tour guide through Budapest. Not only did Anita take us to some fantastic restaurants and introduce us to some tasty traditional Hungarian food she explained to us the history of the Buda-Pest city history. Anita really opened our eyes not only to the culinary but cultural aspects of the city and it was the best way for us to start our time in Budapest. I would suggest that anyone do this tour!!

Excellent tour with Budapest Locals. We had an excellent tour with Anita from Budapest Locals. We had a morning tour the day after our arrival and found this to be an excellent introduction to the city. Anita was knowledgeable and interesting. She shared her knowledge of the city, its culture and food with us. On any future trips to Budapest we will certainly spend some time with Budapest Tours!

Informative day out. We booked a 5 hour tour on food and history with Anita. She collected us at our hotel and took us to the Local Market where she explained all the different types of food, and brought samples of many foods for us to try, it was like a banquet. Anita took us around many places giving us a history lesson and answering all our questions. We felt very relaxed and at ease as though we had known Anita for years. Suggestions for our next day in Budapest were also given and written on map. Would highly recommend Anita and her tours :)

Like spending the day with a friend...... We just recently returned from Budapest. We booked a tour with Budapest Locals and were promptly met by Gabrielle at our predetermined location in the city. What a joy! It was literally as though we had met a friend for the day. She transitioned us into the city with her unparalleled knowledge of Budapest's history combined with her warm personality. We had a lot of questions about the "mechanics" of Budapest and without her assistance we feel as though that there might have been some hesitation on our part to just jump in sight unseen. We didn't feel as though we were tourist but more like honorary Hungarians in her presence. She taught us how to manage the mass transit system, informed us of great restaurants, showed us incredible sights and taught us some basic phrases in Hungarian that would allow us to feel and be more pleasant tourist among the locals. I can't say enough nice things about "Budapest Locals" ...you will NOT be disappointed with your choice to book with and spend time with both of these young ladies during your stay in Budapest.

Great food-tour with our own guide. We had a fabulous morning with our guide Szofi who was very knowledgeable and showed us a lot of nice sights and eateries accompanied by interesting stories about the city. We tasted different Hungarian food and Hungarian wine as well. This was a very special experience and we learnt a lot about Budapest. And they're cheaper than the other companies we checked...

Best introductio to Budapest. My wife and I and two friends spent a wonderful day with Anita, who owns Budapest Locals. We were on a Viking Danube River cruise and spent three days in Budapest to start the trip. I was so fortunate to find Budapest Locals via Trip Advisor. Anita is simply wonderful. She understands the history and the elegance of budapest and she conveys it beautifully with passion. All of us felt that this was the perfect introduction to Budapest. We asked Anita to plan a tour that took us off the beaten track to where the locals go and to give us history and cultural insights into the city. Anita took us around Budapest using the subway and trams, helping us to familiarize ourselves with the system while showing us and explaining to us some of the culture of the city. We even went to a wonderful strudel shop, to the main market where we bought things for lunch and ate them at the market, had a wine tasting, visited the Opera House and other significant sights, saw an amazing coffee house, went to the Jewish center and to a ruins bar..... It was all very wonderful. My wife and I want to go back to Budapest and tour with Anita again.

best day of our entire trip!. My husband and I had many wonderful experiences during our 10-day trip through Prague, Vienna and Budapest, but without a doubt the 6.5 hours that we spent with Anita was our most favorite. We did the Budapest Delights tour, which focuses on the local cuisine. We thoroughly enjoyed all of the food and drink that Anita introduced us to, and it was more than we could eat (all included in the price). However, this was more than just another food tour. We learned so much about the rich culture, history, politics and people of Hungary. We came away from the tour feeling like we had experienced the real Budapest vs the touristy Budapest.We had never done a private tour before, and I was a little bit nervous about not having the buffer of being in a group, but I need not have been worried. Anita was a wonderful host - extremely easy going, very open and authentic. And she constantly went out of her way to ensure that we were enjoying ourselves. She even helped us map out the remainder of our trip with sights to see and restaurants to try, and responded to several emails we sent her afterwards with questions.I wish I could give her more than 5 stars!

Anita's Budapest Walking Tour. During our recent trip to Budapest, I had the great privilege of spending 4 hours with Anita Barta on a walking tour of the downtown area. In three words: It Was Incredible! I learned more in her 1 tour than any of the 3 I took in Budapest; and, as a matter of fact, more than I learned in my entire 15 day visit to 6 countries in Central Europe.Anita is quite knowledgable, engaging, humorous, forthright and extraordinarily well-spoken. I have read a considerable amount of literature about the Holocast (by the way, I am not Jewish), but I never understood it from the deep human perspective as viscerally as I did after Anita's trek through the Jewish Ghetto of Budapest. I still remember, vividly, the stories she related of the human beings that suffered under this horrendous and oppressive occupation by the Nazis.There were many light moments as well. We sampled the coffees and pastries at a wonderful coffee house, we visited the Opera House and we learned an incredible amount about the people and the history of this fascinating city. I came away with a much deeper understanding, and appreciation, of the city and its people than anything I experienced on the "drive by" City Bus Tour.I can not recommend Anita's Walking Tour any more highly. She is probably the most informative, interesting and engaging guide that I've ever had the pleasure of touring with before. Try it! I guarantee you will not be disappointed!Submitted by James B. Hendrickson

A perfect tour. If you like being in a tour group of 50 being herded around the "must see" sights then this is NOT the tour for you. If, however, you want to spend hours chatting, eating, walking and "tramming" (is that even a word?) around Budapest with an engaging, informative and interesting woman then this tour is an absolute must. Anita is an owner / partner of this company and a great experienced guide. We took the Budapest delights tour. I won't list all the places we stopped or all the different foods we tried. I don't want to spoil the surprises! Suffice it to say that there was plenty of food & drink. Can you find cheaper tours? Sure. But do not be put off by the price of Anita's tours. It is a tremendous value. Everything was included .... All the food and drinks ... even a 24 hour metro pass. It's truly a hassle free, no pressure tour. Anita is so welcoming and engaging that you really feel that you're just hanging out with a good friend who is showing you her city. She's very good at what she does. When walking or riding between stops she easily chats about some of the history and what we were going past. Just the right amount of information and not at all a boring memorized recitation of facts. So, not only did we get a food tour, we also got a mini city tour. Also along the way she writes things on her map for you to do and see in the rest of your trip and willingly answered my endless questions. As she got to know us a little bit she even made some restaurant recommendations that are probably not in any guide book. I wish I could give this tour more than 5 stars. If you have the chance, book a tour with Anita. It really was a highlight of our trip. I certainly hope we are fortunate enough to participate in another of her tours in the near future.

Anita is a great guide. We did both the Buda and the Pest tour with Anita, the tour guide, and we enjoyed both very much. She knows a lot about every place and she always has very funny facts and annecdotes to tell. We learned a lot about Budapest and Hungary while listening to her stories. She never didn't rush the people and she always gives time enough to take pictures. At the end of the tours she offers herself to answers any questions we had and she gives good tips for the rest of the stay in the city. I would kindly recommend this service.

Educational conversation with Anita.. Anita took my group on a walking tour on May 10th, 2015. I really appreciated the conversational type of format that Anita, our guide, employed. Definitely the best way to learn. We were encouraged to ask questions as we walked and this allowed our guide to address many of our individual interests. Not the standard tour, lots of anecdotes and personal experiences. Top notch, would highly recommend this company for a walking tour.

Terrific local guide to Budapest. Anita Barta of BUDAPEST LOCALS (budapestlocals@gmail.com) is a wonderful English-speaking guide to the city. She is 30-something, articulate, knowledgeable , energetic and eager to show visitors the best her city has to offer. However, she also listens to requests: in our case, we wanted to enjoy the Szenchenyi Thermal Baths, and Anita taught us to use the metro, bought our tickets, accompanied us to the Baths, arranged for our changing cabins and rental towels. Earlier she took us to the Central Market for a sampling of delicacies. Highly recommended!

Perfect way to enjoy Budapest!. Seven friends and I did the “Budapest Delights” tour with Budapest locals as we are all foodies and love to try new food. Our guide Anita picked us up in front of our hotel and took us to two different cafés with typical cakes and pastries, the big market hall, an excellent restaurant where we had a wine tasting and to one of the famous ruin bars. At the market hall Anita showed us various Hungarian specialties which we also later got to taste together with beer and snaps! As we walked through the city she pointed out different important buildings etc. and told us about Hungarian history and traditions. Anita shared personal experiences from her childhood which was very interesting. She also gave us tips on restaurants and cafés that we visited during the rest of our stay in Budapest. This was defiantly one of the highlights of our stay in Budapest and we had such a nice time with Anita who is very friendly and knowledgeable. The trip was supposed to last 4-5 hours but in the end we were so surprised to find out that 6 hours had already passed. Thank you for an amazing day Anita!

Great Job, Anita!. Our experience with Budapest Locals was Excellent! Anita provided very insightful descriptions during our walking tour, and maintained an excellent rapport with our group. We highly recommend this company for anyone who wishes to gain a colorful picture of Budapest.

Do as the locals do a great trip. WE did a "see Budapest as the locals do" trip.It was wonderful a trip on a public bus to the local market a visit on the underground to a wonderful coffee and cake housing all the while being informed about the local history in a humorous manner.She was charming and answered all questions frankly.It was interesting to have in depth discussions about communism from someone who lived through it.

Highlight of Budapest trip. Anita Barta of Budapest Locals treated our foursome to a fabulous food excursion of the best and variety of Budapest foods. Included was a strudel house, visit through the local Central Market, a chic wine bar with 4 different tastes, a fun trip to a funky ruin bar, and stroll through Jewish Quarter with taste of flodni, a complext layered dessert treat! Anita exceeded the expectations of our group; her unexpected gift of paprika, and the recipes she sent were such a pleasant, positive reminder of her care and our memories of Budapest. You can confidently book her prior to your visit; you won't be disappointed!

Delicious Budapest highlight. Easily booked a private tour for four online, from home in US, before traveling to Budapest. My emailed questions were quickly responded to, which impressed me, including a follow up email the day before to confirm the tour and meeting location. Public transportation from our hotel in the Castle district on the Buda side, was convenient and Anita met and lead us on our city food tour. The sights, stops, and the food on this tour with Anita, were the highlight of our entire trip! As a professional tour guide working in Los Angeles and San Francisco, I can attest to the professionalism, expertise, and joy of food and Budapest that Anita shared with us. I am happy to say that this week at home, we prepared chicken paprikash and beef goulash using Anita's recipes, and the beautiful spices she gifted us on this tour. A wonderful experience for those looking for a fun, delicious, urban experience, that you will never forget.

"Anita is a marvellous guide". My wife and I took a Danube River cruise with Uniworld from Passau to Budapest from April 2 to 11, 2015. Anita was our group's guide during a bus and walking tour of Pest on one side of the river, then Buda on the other. The tour is an included excursion with Uniworld. Not only is Anita deeply knowledgeable about the city (or cities) and related history, but she is pleasant, engaging and quite lovely. The information she imparted was interesting and relevant. Anita is a chef as well and we are looking forward to trying some recipes she emailed after we returned home.~RThomson

A Great Day! Well Worth the Expense!. I actually almost canceled the tour, since we had purchased hop on hop off bus tour passes and I wasn't wanting to spend the additional money for another tour. I am so glad I didn't cancel. Anita picked up our family of five (two adults and three children ages 12, 10 & 7 years old) at our hotel at 9:30 am. She did not drop us off back at our hotel until 6pm. We saw everything that I had wanted to see in Budapest plus more. She was very willing to adapt the tour to our families wants and needs. She went out of her way to include the children and make sure that they were ok with how everything was going. I highly recommend booking a tour with her.

brillant Tour. Two years ago we visited Budapest and one of our many highlights was a city tour with Anita ,(she was then working for another company) her enthusiasm, knowledge & friendliness made this tour so enjoyable. As she has now set up her own company we wish her well and would definitely recommend this new tour company to anyone thinking of visiting Budapest, a magical city.

A must-do for newcomers to Budapest!!!. We had a wonderful experience on this tour with Anita, and it was excellent value. We also had the advantage of ending it at an information point where we heard about a great Mozart concert!! What a wonderful day. Thanks and good luck with the new venture.
A 'must do'. Seeing Budapest with Anita is definitely the way to go. She makes the city, it's beauty and it's history come alive. Highly recommended.

What a wonderful tour!. Anita was an incredible tour guide. I enjoyed my tour of the highlights of Budapest. The knowledge and passion that Anita displayed made my visit to Budapest incredible. The next time I visit Budapest, I would include a tour by Anita!

Friendly, informative and fun!. Anita is an amazing tour guide on so many levels. Not only is her knowledge of the city and the history of the country excellent, but she is also friendly, kind and personable. If you are after a unique look at Budapest then I would highly recommend a bespoke tour with her. I especially loved her insider knowledge on where to eat, drink and the best paces to enjoy a thermal bath. Much, much better than the guidebook suggestions I came across...Anita certainly deserves 5 stars!

Amazing experience. We just got back from our trip to Budapest and I must say our walking tour with Anita was completely amazing! She took us to so many places and with her knowledge of the history of Budapest she kept us interested the entire time.This company is 5 stars in every sense.Thank you Budapest Locals!

The best way to discover Budapest!. Anita was a delightful guide, very personable and very knowledgeable about both the history and current story of Budapest. Her knowledge is comprehensive including where to eat (we had a delicious cafe experience!) and where to find entertainment.

Best Tour- Amazing Value. Anita was an amazing tour guide. After visiting over 20 European countries and going on countless walking tours, the bar was set high. Anita exceeded our expectations! She was very knowledgable about Budapest's history and culture and gave a wonderful summary at various stopping points throughout the tour. The Strudel House stop was a big hit with the group and the entire stop was included in the price. Anita even brought traditional chocolate treats for us to try. At the end of the tour Anita gave us great attraction and restaurant advice for the rest of the trip. The overall tour was by far the best value available. I would recommend booking a tour with Anita as soon as you arrive in Budapest and she can tailor it to what your group wants to see.

The blue Danube. We can warmly recommend Anita's tour to anyone visiting Budapest.The vast background information made it all a worthwhile experience her helpful guidance came a blessing in this historic town. Thank you. Ferdinand R.
Great time.. Thanks to Anita we had great time in Budapest.She knows great stories about the city and she can recommend great restaurants.it was a blast.Thanks Anita.

Awesome walking tour of Budapest!. We did the 3 hour general walking tour with Anita on our first day in Budapest and it was the perfect introduction to the city. Anita was a wonderful guide, sharing a great mix of insights, anecdotes and history - with an impressive command of English. I felt she went well beyond what she needed, making sure everyone in our group of 6 had customized advice for places to visit. I loved the coffee and strudel stop as well. I would highly recommend this tour, especially in the beginning of the trip as it gives the perfect overview to this beautiful city!

Our unforgetable Budapest tour!. Our family visited Budapest last summer, it was our first visit there, and we were lucky enough to have our professional and friendly guide Anita Barta through a walking city tour, she made our visit really amazing and unforgettable! Anita is very knowledgeable about Hungarian history, culture and heritage, she showed us the very impressible and charming sides of the city. Besides, she gave us valuable recommendations and tips about the places we should visit. But most of all, we were really touched about her kindness and thoughtfulness when my daughter got sore feet, Anita asked her colleague to bring her own comfortable shoes to my daughter – just like a big sister, such a great person that my daughter still talks about her heartily! We enjoyed our stay in Budapest very much thanks to Anita, she made Budapest even more beautiful with its great hospitality, kindness, and warm-heart! We will certainly visit Budapest someday in the near future, and of course we would very like to have Anita as our friend and guide again, therefore we would highly recommend Anita if you once visit Budapest!

A visit we will never forget!. In summer 2014, me and my family decided to visit a big city we have never been to before. Budapest was the next stop on our map and let me tell you, that was one amazing pick of a city we did there. We had perfectly warm weather where we enjoyed walking with a cold drink in our hands for hours while we discovered the beautiful city and its remarkable ties to history. That was indeed with the help of our great local guide Anita. She spoke English fluently and organised her descriptions of the different local places and buildings very well. She knew Budapest to its heart and it really felt like a book was read out loud. Anita was also very friendly, kind and she answered our questions with pleasure. Never has a city given out such a soothing vibe to me. Great weather, beautiful architecture, nice locals and delicious food! But that only comes as a package if you get to know the city really well. Me and my family have Anita to thank that for. We will come back to Budapest for a second visit for sure!
Passionate. Anita has a love for her city and its rich history. Whether she is guiding a few people or a group she gives her best.

A great way to know and love the city. My wife and I went on a small group tour with Anita when she worked for another tour company in the summer of 2013. We had one of the best of many walking tours we have taken, riding the subway, stopping for delicious cakes and coffee, and covering a vast amount of geography and history. Anita was cheerful, knowledgeable and a fine guide, Now that she has moved to a new company we wish her the best.

Perfect Intro to Budapest. My husband and I took a Night Stroll and Boat Cruise Tour with Anita in September 2014 and were really happy we did it our first night in the city. We spent two hours walking the city with Anita and four others (good group size) and it really set us up for the rest of our two days in Budapest. Anita was very personable, funny, and answered every question we threw at her about the city and growing up in a Communist country. Her restaurant recommendations were great and the mid-tour stop for fresh strudel has me dreaming of Budapest as I type!

Personal & passionate introduction to Budapest!. It was our first visit to Budapest, so we decided to take a walking tour to discover the city. We didn't only get to know the city, but also one of its friendly local guides. Anita was very knowledgeable about Budapest and Hungarian culture in general. Moreover, she spoke English fluently and she was able to answer all of our questions. She gave us great tips about restaurants and places to go.We were fond of her personal approach. Her stories were very passionate and inspired. The city is very beautiful and thanks to Anita we saw some unique places which we didn't see in our guidebooks. The delicious goulash we tasted at the end of our tour was the icing on the cake!We would like to highly recommend Budapest Locals for a great, local tour around the city.

WOW. In DEC 2014, we spent 4 days in Budapest. it was a remarkable experience and one that was truly memorable only through using Anita. We were surprised that without a guide , Budapest was overwhelming and quite hostile. Anita was very well read, equipt to deal with our many requests, stop overs and has a personality that is friendly and fluid. From the synagogues , local markets, bars, book shops, historic sites, Anita was a master on all. She comes highly recommended. VISITORS FROM SOUTH AFICA

Highest possible rating. Budapest is a fascinating and beautiful city, and the best way to see it and learn about it is on a walking tour with Anita. We explored both sides of the river last November and she was not only well informed with lots of great stories, she is also a very delightful person and a true professional. It was a most memorable day and I felt very fortunate to have had her as a guide. (Be sure she takes you to the "Simple Garden" ruin pub!)

Anita is an excellent tour guide!!. We spend two days touring with Anita. She is one of the best tour guides we have ever had! Her knowledge of the city is incredible. She is a native Hungarian and grew up there when the country was under communist rule. Her insight into every aspect of Budapest - from its history, it's cultural sites and it's hidden gems - is unique, vast and personal. She is also prompt, speaks excellent English and is genuinely excited about showing and sharing her wonderful city to others. Don't miss out on a tour with Anita or any of her colleagues - it will be time well spent!!

smart chic savvy guide. In fall of 2014 we used Anita as our guide for 2 days in Budapest.Her knowledge of history, current events, restaurants,and sites to visit was superb. She is well educated, prompt, responsible, professional, and very courteous.She is also a gourmet cook.Her prices are reasonable and she is very energetic.You cant go wrong with her.

Best Budapest experience!. We spent half day with Anita walking around Budapest.Terrific experience: lots of fun, delicious food, great stories, beautiful places and the best tourist guide ever. Not a tourist guide actually; a true friend, very open, warm and nice.Strongly recommended.

A great day with Emily. After a last minute decision to use a private guide for the day, the concierge at our hotel connected us with Emily. We had a fabulous day with her. She arrived punctually at our hotel in her roomy Mercedes van, plenty of room for the 4 of us. She navigated the congested streets of Budapest with ease, all the while telling us where to look and explaining what we were seeing. We saw all the major highlights of the city that we wanted to see. Her knowledge of the history of Budapest was terrific. We felt as if we were traveling with a friend, who had similar interests to ours. She shared some of her personal experiences growing up in a communist country, which was fascinating.She recommended a great restaurant for lunch, the New York cafe, and even got us in there although it was fully booked.I would highly recommend using her as your tour guide. You will NOT be disappointed.

emily was the best guide. Emily was the best guide we ever had. She was very knowledgeable about all the points. Spoke great english. The van was clean. The River cruise found her for us to take us through the jewish section of Budapest. After that we hired her privately for a day to take us through the city.

Our best tour guide yet. We hired Emily for a four hour tour of Budapest and feel it was money very well spent. Emily is very knowledgeable, her English is excellent, and she spoke with just the right tone and at the right speed so that my partner, even though he has hearing difficulties, was able to understand everything she said - even while she was driving. Recommend Emily highly.

Budapest-The Exceptional Experience. When I read the reviews of Emily Guide, I thought it sounded good. She and the tour were outstanding. We were on a river cruise and we read what was offered in Budapest for tours. It was underwhelming. We informed her of what we were to see and she tailor-made the tour to capture the whole city. It was amazing since when we passed by the sights that Emily's had shown to us on her tour we knew so much more about the history and significance of the each one. I would totally and without any reservation recommend Emily as a guide of a city we both fell in love with. She is also witty and fun to be with

Excellent two days with Emily Private Tour Guide in Budapest. Emily was very quick on getting back to me as we arranged the tour of Budapest. I was only going to be there 2 days. You could arrange to have a car pick you up at the airport and take you to your hotel. She arrive on time for the tours each day. I took two 5 hour tours. I was able to see a lot of areas and she knew the ends and outs of getting around the city. It was fantastic, tailored towards what I wanted to see and do. We were fortunate to have great weather in October and I thoroughly enjoyed the trip. I stayed at the Hilton in City Center and a little plug for that... if you are a Hilton member all your meals are included in the club if you want. Emily was knowledgeable of the history, spoke excellent English, and even gave me a discount as I was the only one taking the tour. We also visited the artist city close by. She moved at my pace -- where I wanted to spend more time we did. I highly recommend her! Very reasonable prices.

A personal tour of Hungary. My husband and I hired Emily for a full day tour of Hungary and an afternoon tour of Budapest. We thoroughly enjoyed our tours with Emily. She was friendly and very knowledgeable. We travelled through the northeast part of Hungary through plains, mountains and vineyards. Very beautiful. Emily also has little known secrets of her country that she is willing to share with her guests. Thank you Emily for a beautiful and memorable experience!!

Great Tour Guide - the only way to see Budapest. My wife and I used Emily for private tours for five days in Budapest from half day to full day tours. Overall, she was excellent. She showed us the top sites while tailoring the tours to our needs. Showed us many things that we would have missed by ourselves plus saved us a great deal of time. Getting around Budapest is difficult with so many one way streets and heavy traffic. She recommended some great restaurants – DunaCorso which was close to our hotel. It was a perfect restaurant to have a leisurely Hungarian meal outside with a great view of the Castle District and watching the world walk by on a beautiful night. The Hungarian music was great. On our last day, she drove us to Vienna and gave us a overall tour of Vienna. We highly recommend Emily for tours as her knowledge of history, art, and culture was superb. She can find her on Tripadvisor “Emily Guide – Day Tours”

Great Tour Guide!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Emily. She's extremely knowledgeable about the city and the history of Budapest Hungary. She even gave us a few pointers on how to get around the city as well as some of the long tourist queues. She helped us book restaurant reservations and we loved her suggestions. Emily is just an all-around pleasure. We strongly recommend her.

Thank you very much !. Me and my daughter (14 y) did 2 tours with Emily last week. We did the evening photography tour and the jewish tour. Emily brougth us to the most beautiful spots during the evening. Pictures are amazing. My daughter loved it. The jewish tour was very interesting,We would have missed a lot of interesting points and facts if you didn't had shown/told us. Her english is perfect and as she talks so beautifull it was good to understand for my daughter ( who had only one year of english lessons). So absolutely no problem if your english is no too good. We had an amazing time with her !! Also thank you for the tips you gave us and dropping us off at the market after our tour!! Ina

Emily is a fantastic and passionate guide. . We used Emily for a full day tour of Budapest, Jewish quarters and transfer via Bratislava to Vienna. The only adjective to use is brilliant. You cannot fault Emily's knowledge. She uses her own transport which is great. She maneuvers her Vito with ease. She reads her group well and sprinkles her history facts with anecdotes. Emily gas a contract with the Parliament and we avoided long queues at this must see attraction. In the evening she took us to a Chadra which was delightful. Emily us highly recommend. She even chimed in on one of travel sayings... On and on and on. We will definitely use her in the future.

Wonderful Private Budapest Tour. We are a big family of 12 with 4 seniors (one needed wheelchair assistance), 4 adults that could snap photos like there's no tomorrow and 4 kids that do what they do best, being wild. Emily knew her city well. For instance, our 4 year old urgently needed to go to bathroom at last minute notice, Emily was able to take her to a nice cafe just in time. She minimize our walking time, and being in Europe with cobble stone roads and steep hills, we never felt wheelchair was an issue. The whole tour was very relaxing and we hit plenty of spots to take great photos. Last but not least, per our request, she went out of her way to help us arrange dinner, concert and for us to be picked up afterwards. We all had a great time. She is definitely the Guide to go to in Budapest!

Emily gets our vote!. We just returned from a fabulous Danube River cruise, first spending 3 days on our own (with another couple) in Budapest. We were lucky to have found one of the best private guides we've ever had the pleasure of using in the many years we've been cruising. Emily is such a knowledgeable and personable person, we felt like we were being shown around by a trusted friend. She included in the itineraries interesting places that are off the beaten path, not normally shown by other guides, but we're so glad she did! Her husband drives a most comfortable van, and provided prompt and efficient transfer for us and all our luggage from the airport to our hotel, then a transfer to the river boat when it was time to join the cruise. Emily was just fabulous as a guide for three tours we arranged with her. These included a Jewish Heritage tour, a nighttime folklore dinner show (which was so much fun, and such great food!) followed by a nighttime "lights of the city" tour, then a full day Danube Bend tour. Emily is also totally flexible and patient, waiting for us when we wanted to linger, and taking us to a bake shop for that wonderful Rachel's Flodni, a delicious pastry that we had been advised to make sure we try when in Budapest. We have been recommending Emily to all our friends, and have no hesitation in recommending her on this board.Sam & Eileen

Budapest in all its glory with Emily!. We are a fa-mily of five. We had a late afternoon arrival on our first day. Emily picked us up from our accommodation at 6:30pm and started with our tour. The timing was perfect as we saw Heroes' Square lighted and unlighted. We saw all the grandness of Budapest that night--St. Stephen's Basilica, the Parliament, the bridges. She shared very valuable and detailed information about the places we visited in her clear and perfect English. She would repeat the names of places and bridges to make sure we know one from another. The second day, we spent with Emily, too, to see the mummified hand at St. Stephen's Basilica, the Michael Jackson Memorial, the Buda side (Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, the Royal Palace area, to eat the Rose ice cream (a novelty!), to visit Szentendre town including the Microscope Museum (another novelty!). We found our 1 and a half day packed with all that we needed to know about Budapest. We relaxed in Szechenyi Baths on our last day, with no worries whatsoever that we were missing out on other Budapest sights. Thank you, Emily, for the complete and interesting tours of Budapest!

Superb Private Guide in an amzing city!. Emily is a superb guide to the city of Budapest. Her tours are not "canned" or scripted. She is very flexible and can craft your tour to your desires. We opted for a half day driving/walking tour to get acquainted with the city. The Castle District, the grand market hall and the public baths were the highlights. Emily does more than just point out the sights...she knows and shares the fascinating histories of each place. We were 3 couples and everyone agreed that this tour was special and surprisingly inexpensive given the value we received! Emily's vehicle accommodates up to 7 guests.

Emily is the best!. My husband and another couple from US booked Emily's tour while in Budapest. She picked us up from our hotel and took us to all the city sites. Well known sites and ones we did not know, which was a bonus. Emily was one of the best guides we have ever had. She is extremely knowledgeable of the area and culture. We are so happy we booked this tour. She also gave us suggestions on great restaurants and other things to do while in the city. You will not find a better guide. I highly recommend Emily.

Amazing time in Budapest and Vienna with Emily. We were a family of three adults. We spent two full days with Emily one in Budapest and one in Vienna. Emily is a lovely, clever, informative lady who enabled us to have the best time. She collected us from our hotel and tailored our tour so that the particular things we wanted to see were included, she pre booked tickets to Parliament, the river cruise and Gellert Spa so we did not have to queue. She gave us lots of information about the city and its history and culture it was fabulous. We then all went to Vienna, I had asked Emily to find us a typically Austrian restaurant for lunch as it was my birthday and she found a great one.
