Vienna was wonderful, she drove us around first so we could take pictures then we stopped for a short tour seeing hidden gems before going to the Palace. She also took us to a fabulous cafe for coffee and strudel. We would highly recommend Emily to get the most out of your trip she will happily tailor your tour to your interests. Thank you Emily for giving us the best time.

Great with the little ones, learned a lot. Our group of 4 adults and 9 kids ages 1-12 had a great time with Emily on a 5 hr personalized walking tour for just our group covering the following:Fisherman's Bastion Matthias' ChurchRoyal PalaceFunicular down to Chain BridgeWalk across the DanubeShoes on the Danube monument Parliament St. Stephen's CathedralEmily gave great explanations geared towards kids and adults, she came into all the sights with us to explain the history and importance of what we were seeing, and she was so patient and helpful to make sure we could go at the right pace for the kids. She also showed us a couple neat hidden gems and shared some interesting tidbits along the way. She knows her stuff!When I travel with my family, I prefer a small group and a local guide, and Emily delivered! Superb job!

A day in Budapest with Emily. Emily was amazing! She completely guided us through an entire day in Budapest with extreme knowledge of the city. Our family of 4 Adults and 2 Children enjoyed every one of the venues that Emily shared with us about her city of Budapest. We were going on a river boat cruise with Tauck Bridges and knew we would not have time to see the city as we would like to so we contacted Emily and she suggested how we should spend our one day before the River boat cruise. We would highly recommend Emily with a 5 star rating.

Wonderful countryside. Tour!. We were a group of 6. Emily picked us up from our Viking ship and brought our luggage to our hotel. Then off to Herend. We choose to see Hungry's countryside and arts. Herend is amazing hand painted porcelain. We started out by drinking coffee from the porcelain then we went into the museum and had a tour. The drive to Herend is quite long but Emily filled the time with her amazing knowledge of Hungarian history. She is a professor at one of Budapest's universities. After Herend, we went for lunch on I the peninsula of Tihany. We had amazing food. We then walked to Lake Balaton to take photos. I would say Emily is a wonderful guide who knows so much.

AWESOME Tour Guide - Emily!. We hired Emily to take us on a 1 day tour of Budapest. We booked her months in advance and kept in contact with her, discussing sites and interests we wanted to see/do. She customized a complete tour for us to include EVERYTHING on our list plus more! She even was able to pick us up at the airport and take us back for a small fee.She was outstanding! Her English was perfect and her knowledge of Budapest and it's rich history was taught to us when we visited each site. She went into just the right amount of detail in explaining the site, building or landmark. She knew just where to go and was very 'creative' in her abilities to get us into places most tourists would never know about. She took us around in her Mercedes Mini-van and some parts by foot, depending on what we wanted to see. We enjoyed our tour with her so much, we hired her for another half-day so we could do/see even more sites. If you don't get her for your visit to Budapest, you'll miss most of what the city has to offer. She also gave us recommendations for places to eat and things to do on our own time, once done with her tour. If she did not have the answer for something we wanted, she would contact her 'tour guide friends' who would quickly respond with the answers so we never needed for anything. Absolutely amazing. I could not recommend her more - she was the BEST guide we have ever had! A+++++++++

A great tour!. Our tour guide, Nina, in Prague recommended Emily to us - and I am glad that she did. We had an 8 hour tour scheduled, but we broke it up in two days - which was a good idea. She picked us up promptly at the train station and took us to the hotel to check in. From there, we began our tour of Budapest. Her English is perfect - and she had so many interesting facts to give to us. She also recommended an excellent restaurant in which to eat our first night - and even took us there so that we wouldn't get lost.

Budapest insider. We came to Budapest with organized tour and on our first day we had a standard overview of Budapest. Second day was free to explore this interesting city, and we hired Emily as our guide. She was able to give us a custom tour covering small side streets, mansions of the past, Jewish quarter, making of strudel and coffee as local have. It was a day to remember, with Emily adjusting to our interests as the day progressed. Thank you Emily for a wonderful day in Budapest.

Emily is a wonderful guide. We have just finished two long days of touring Budapest and the surrounding area with Emily, and it's been a terrific experience. She knows so much, and freely shares her knowledge and time! Our days were long and packed full of things to do. Day one was a tour of the city sights, and day two was the Danube Bend tour. We especially enjoyed wandering around the artists' town shopping! Tonight we will have one last trip with Emily, to experience a local gypsy dinner and show - I am sure it will be fun. By the way, Emily gladly suggested restaurants for us in advance, and then made all the reservations. So helpful, as the best ones get booked up well in advance!!

Great private guide for Budapest (and Vienna). My wife and I spent three nights in Budapest, then drove to Vienna for further 3 nights before moving on to Prague. We engaged Emily as a private tour guide.Emily is an exceptional guide, friendly, knowledgeable, flexible and reliable. She arranged our pickup at the Budapest airport. We toured for 5 hours with her in Budapest one day, which was very enjoyable. (don't miss the Parliament buildings tour).She made suggestions for the rest of our stay which we pursued on our own (walking and using public transit in Budapest is fun and easy). Then Emily drove us to Vienna and gave us a half-day tour there. She was just as knowledgeable about that city.Emily has been very helpful in translating some old Hungarian documents and letters from my wife's family - an added bonus.Emily was a highlight of our trip to central Europe.

It was a great experience, with a very nice, kind and professional Emily. We were 8 persons, we took 4+1 (Parliament) hours tour - Emily was very prompt, explained us everything, in a perfect and clear English (spoke rarely so everybody could understand). She knows a lot of things and was a great tour - with a van and also walking - she gave us some other options and adapted the tour upon our choices. I was in Budapest many times before, but this one....Emily made it memorable. She likes what she's doing and we could see it with our own eyes. We recommend Emily tour with all our heart.

Simply the best!. Emily is everything you want in a tour guide. You have the benefit of her undivided attention and extensive knowledge of her home city as she takes you to many amazing places. Our visit to the Parliament building and lunch at the fabulous New York restaurant as well as the view from the Citadel were some of the highlights of our brilliant day! Thank you Emily for a perfect tour of Budapest!

Money well spent to learn about Budapest. Every penny was worth it.. We booked with Emily for a private tour of Budapest and we were extremely happy. The wealth of knowledge, and her passion about Hungary's history, and personalized visit made every penny worth the private tour with Emily. She is very professional and so flexible to make sure you have the best tour. We will definitely highly recommend her to any of our friends that goes to Budapest... and will contact her on our next visit.

Romantic Night Tour of Budapest . Emily picked us up at our restaurant and made sure we had some unforgettable views and picture's of us and Budapest by night. She was quite critical of the pictures she took, so we ended up with great pictures. Highly recommended.

Budapest with Emily is fun and interesting. My wife and I just spent two glorious days in Budapest with Emily. Prior to our visit, Emily provided us with wonderful suggestions and ideas for our limited stay. She is extremely knowledgable, fun to be with, professional and prompt.Budapest is a wonderful city and I only wish we would have spent more time in Budapest and less time in Vienna.

5 stars guide, superb service !!!. We are a family of 4 (with 2 elderly parents). I just have to praise Emily. She is very professional, very knowledgeable and speaks perfect English. By the way, Emily can speak 7 languages and works a lecturer in the local university.She is very patient and never rush us even though we were running late. She never appear in a hurry despite already exceeded her time. She gave us plenty of tips and explained thoroughly all the local culture, history etc. We joined 4 of her tours:1) Budapest city tour at night2) Budapest city tour full day3) Half day to Szentendre4) Full day from Budapest to Vienna Her Mercedes MPV is very comfortable with large windows, therefore very easy for us to have clear views of the city. In conclusion, very friendly and knowledgeable tour guide, beautiful city and very reasonable pricing. Highly recommended. Will definitely contact Emily again if we were to return to Budapest in future. You won't go wrong with Emily guide. :)

Wonderful personalized tours. Emily took care of every detail of our week in Budapest. She is pleasant, practical, well-informed, punctual, etc. She tailored our routes to suit of interests and our stamina. We would recommend her to any considering a trip to Budapest... and we would suggest that ANY trip to Europe must include time in Budapest (with Emily).

Great service. I found Emily on Tripadvisor and contacted her by email prior to our visit. She always responded quickly and provided lots of information and answered all my questions. She met my group of 6 and helped coordinate another group of 6 when our Viking River cruise ended in Budapest. Then she took us on a private tour of Parliament, the Jewish protest memorial & St Stephen's Basilica including a viewing of the mummified hand which was requested by someone in our group. She didn't stop with the information, or taking us to eat ice cream hand dipped and shaped in a rose, or the quirky ruin bar. After 4 hours she dropped us off at the train station and helped us with our luggage to locate the platform and train that we were booked on. She then made sure our other friends were also on the way to meet us on the train. We were very impressed with Emily's great professional and friendly service. The Mercedes Benz van that she used was comfortable and could fit all our luggage. Thanks Emily for making our short stay in Budapest a great experience.

Excellence is Understating It. As arranged, Emily's husband Gabor fetched me from Vienna for a transfer to Budapest. On the way there, we made a short detour to Bratislava for a quick visit to the city's historic town centre and to see a pretty blue church. Very smooth journey. The same evening, Emily joined us for a night tour of the city, for fabulous night views of the Danube, and buildings along the Danube on both the Buda and Pest side of the city. Subsequently, I had a day and a half of tours with Emily to cover sights in Pest that were some distance from where I was based and to places where only a local would know. On all tours, Emily was very patient with my frequent stops to take pictures, stops for souvenirs and to mail postcards. She has a great love for her city and will keep you informed of its history and present situation. Where buildings or monuments have symbolic figures/symbolism on them, she will explain them to you - something you will rarely if ever find in even the best of guide books. Emily has a great personality and you will feel completely at ease during tours.

Two pleasant half-days. I spent a very pleasant two half-days with Emily while on my tip in Hungary. We are a family of four adults and Emily's van was very spacious and comfortable.For the 4 hour Art Nouveau/Parliament tour, we started in the morning. Besides getting an overview of the center of Budapest (this was our first full day in the city), we saw most of the notable Art Nouveau buildings. Several times we took short walks to take a closer look at the Museum of Applied Arts, the Geological Institute of Budapest, the Royal Postal Savings Bank, etc. To break up the Art Nouveau with some gothic architecture, we went on an hour-long tour of the beautifully gilded Parliament building. It was an hour well-spent. Emily dropped us off at the Great Market Hall where she helped us buy some foie gras and gave us tips on what to buy where.Our next trip with Emily was our transfer from Budapest to Vienna. With suitcases all safely loaded, we had a nice drive to the border where we had a rest stop. We spent 3 hours driving and walking around Vienna's old center to get a sense of the city. The stop at Hundertwasser house was a highlight. It was freezing, but we persevered. Emily took us into the Cathedral, which is free to see inside (up to a point) and gave us some background on the massive palaces, like the Hofburg and the Opera House. Due to time constraints, some of the more out of the way points of interest, we checked out later by ourselves.Emily was a very pleasant and cordial guide. Kusunum, Emily, for getting us safely to Vienna!

Professional and Awesome!. Emily was everything we could have asked for and more! She picked us up literally right in front of our hostel and drove us right to the coolest attractions in the city. She was very informative too, telling us all about the history and popularity of places. She also brought us to places that weren't even in the guidebooks! Thanks for the secrets Emily ;) We did a 3 hour tour and it was PERFECT to see everything we wanted to and more!

Budapest Private Tour. Emily was by far our favorite guide in all 4 cities we visited over December. She took our family of 4 to some of the most interesting places for us to experience in our 5 hours with her. She was incredibly informative and balanced just enough walking and driving so we were completely intrigued. She hit every place we wanted to see and more. I would highly recommend Emily regardless of how long you have in Budapest. She will make Budapest a city you will not forget.

Wonderful Tour. I contacted Emily via email several months before our visit to Budapest. As we were going to be there a day before our 2 week Tauck cruise and tour, I explained the places we were to visit with this company. Emily planned her tour to coordinate with the additional 2 days we were going to be in Budapest. She recommended and included the guided tour of the Parliament which was very worthwhile. The following day when our Tauck tour began my husband and I realized that had we not taken the 5 hour tour with Emily we would have missed out on several important sights. She took us to not only the highlights of the city but to some lesser known places such as a ruin bar in the Jewish section, a Monument to the Jewish Genocide which had been erected just this past year, and a restaurant where you can see how strudel is made. Upon her recommendation we had dinner at this restaurant the next evening. Our tour was a combination of driving and walking and Emily always found a parking spot! Emily was very knowledgeable in a delightful, friendly manner. I highly recommend contacting her for an individualized tour in Budapest.

An incredible two days. Emily was our private tour guide for two days in Budapest. For much of the trip her husband was the driver and made it easy on us. we thoroughly enjoyed Emily and were so impressed with her local mannerisms, her tremendous knowledge of Budapest and the surrounding areas, her spirit, her drive. We loved the city and we loved Emily. She pulled no punches and answered honestly our questions about WW II and the Hungarian Nazis even though it did not paint her city brightly. She arranged all the tours, the only request we had was the Jewish Quarter. We were amazed at her knowledge of the Jewish religion and the history of the Jews in Budapest even though she is not Jewish. She had a beautiful baby girl and by the end of the two days we felt like family with her. I can't recommend her more highly.

Guided Tour of Budapest. Emily was a fantastic guide. She has lived in Budapest all her life and works at the university. She is very knowledgeable and during our 4 hour tour of all the main sights, she also made several suggestions of things for us to explore further during the rest of our stay. All her suggestions were fantastic ... tea shops, spa's, museums ect. She arranged for us to do an internal tour of Parliament, which was realy worth a visit and, with her husband Gabriel and baby daughter Laura, they drove us all over the city. It was a total pleasure and we would highly reccommend Emily to anyone wanting and real insight into Budapest and it's history and culture.

Great time in Budapest. Our party of four had two tours with Emily. The whole day (7 hr walking tour) & and a 4 hr Jewish Heritage walking tour. Emily has excellent English, great knowledge of Hungarian history & the most important she is very friendly & easy to get along with. I would definitely hire Emily again.

A Wonderful day in Budapest!. We booked Emily for a full day of sightseeing in Budapest having arrived the night before on a river cruise. There were 6 of us and we wanted a more extensive tour of the city since our time was limited. We were not disappointed! Emily showed us "her city" which included a Parliament tour. She is a great tour guide, extremely knowledgeable, very friendly and will tailor your tour to what you desire. We returned to our ship very happy knowing we had booked with the right guide. Emily is the best!

Great tours with Emily. I booked 2 tours with Emily prior to arrival in Budapest. Our party of 4 ended a river boat cruise in Budapest and I arranged for Emily to pick us up from our boat, then take us around the city in a vehicle for a 6 hour tour that included walking around as well, then she dropped us off at the Apartment we stayed at for 4 nights. Additionally, I also booked her 3.5 hour night tour to view the amazing city from many locations . Both tours were outstanding. Emily is incredibly knowledgeable about the history, culture, politics of Budapest and Hungary. Her English is impeccable and she was just a pleasure to be with. She drove the very comfortable van herself to so many sites, many not on the beaten path. She took us to a great strudel restaurant and pointed out lots of great eateries around the city. She even made reservations at restaurants and attractions for us, as well. I highly recommend Emily as a private guide; you will not be disappointed.

Excellent private tour. Had private 4 hour tour with Emily. Excellent English and very knowledgeable about history (over 1000 years) and buildings and politics. Has contacts which allow avoiding queues. Modern van for seeing a very good range of sights, even in rain.

Good overview tour of the city. I would recommend booking the night tour on your arrival. It is a gives you a beautiful perspective an on beautiful city. We followed that with a half day tour that included the parliament (which you shouldn't miss). Emily is very accommodating to things that you are interested in. However Budapest is a big city so it is difficult to cover much in 4-5 hours. Emily was helpful in suggesting things that we should do during the rest of our stay and helped us understand the metro system which makes accessing points of interest in the city very easy.

Emily is Great!. We hired Emily for a one-day tour of Budapest in early September and were very well satisfied. Emily is a highly experienced guide, friendly and open, very knowledgeable about the city and well-attuned to visitors whose time is limited yet wish to sample the best of Budapest. As others have commented before, touring with Emily was like having a friend show you around the city. She showed up at our hotel promptly and efficiently got us around a variety of locations.For those of you who may be in Budapest at the start or end of a river cruise, Emily is well acquainted with how they operate and can easily make her tours compliment what the intro tours the cruise lines offer.You will not be disappointed if you choose Emily as your tour guide. Thank you, Emily for a great tour.

Great Guide.... Emily was extremely knowledgeable and delightful. She went the extra miles to drive to Vienna from Buda to get us across the closed boarder issue. She gave us terrific recommendations for dining. Bottom line... you made our visit most memorable. And we enjoyed meeting Ms Laura... so cute. thanks.

Emily is Wonderful!!!!!. Before we left on our vacation we thought it would be a great idea to hire a guide to show us around Budapest the day after we arrived. We had never hired a guide before and WHAT A GREAT IDEA IT WAS TO HIRE EMILY ! Emily picked us up promptly at 10am at our B&B and gave us a thorough and informative tour of the city. We chose the 4 hour driving and walking tour of the main sights in Budapest w a special request to see 2 of the bath houses! The tour was not rushed, we had plenty of time to wander, ask questions and take pictures! And we saw the entire city!! And to our special delight Emily's husband Gabrielle drove and they brought baby Laura along so it felt like we were "family!" Emily is very intelligent, friendly & sweet and she shared her special knowledge of Budapest's architecture, history, Communism, people, language, and stories with us! Emily also teaches at the University and is a wife and mother! She is very professional and yet it was like we were running around the city with a good friend! She never rushed us. It was 'our' tour!! We learned so much and after the tour we were able to choose what sights to revisit in the next few days in Budapest and what other things we wanted to do. We chose to go to the baths one day , to get massages and facials, to go to the central market and to do a dinner opera and folk dance cruise on the Danube River. We enjoyed Emily so much we hired her to drive us to Vienna ( our next destination) and to give us a 3-4 hour tour of Vienna! This was such a great idea since we were leaving Budapest during the refugee crisis and the trains were backed up and booked solid! Having a private driver made life easy. Cars were being stopped and searched at the border of Budapest and Austria and there was a 3-4 hour back up of traffic. Luckily Emily knew the back roads and avoided the back up . We made it to Vienna, had a lovely tour of the city and even stopped for lunch. If you want a tour guide, call Emily. She is a lovely person and will show you all the sights and she will fill your head w great stories and the fascinating history of Budapest! Thank you Emily from Patti, John and Sasha!!

Excellent tour guide with airconditioned van. We did not intend to hire a private guide in Budapest, however, when we arrived it was 97 degrees hot, so at the last minute we decided to try to look for a private guide, hopefully with an air-conditioned car. We arrive in the evening and I emailed several top-rated guides that I found on tripadvisor, hoping one would be available. Emily was one of several who replied, however, she was the only one with an air-conditioned van, so we went with her and we were so glad we did. She was a fabulous tour guide, very knowledgeable, very clear speaking, extremely friendly, and her van gave us a much needed break from the sweltering heat.Additionally, we were in Budapest during the migrant crisis and planned to train to Vienna the very day Hungary shut down the train system. Fortunately, Emily was willing to drive us even though, again, it was very last-minute and she didn't have day-care for her baby. We did not have lodging for an extra day in Budapest, and we had prepaid for our lodging in Vienna, so Emily really save us. She drove us to Vienna with her baby, giving us a history lesson the whole way. We feel fortunate to have found Emily and highly recommend her as a tour guide.

Do this first.. I regret that we toured with Emily on our last full day in Budapest. I think it would have been far better to have done this first because she gives you such good insights on what is special about the city. Emily is interesting, very knowledgeable and friendly. I don't think you can go wrong here. We were lucky that she was available on one days notice. We learned a lot from her, she even gave us a little quiz at the end to see if we had been listening, so pay attention!

Wonderful Guide. Emily was a wonderful guide for our family trip -- a group of 9 of us traveled to Hungary to visit family and see the sights. Emily took us on 4 different tours around the country during our 10 days there, and she truly made our trip a special and memorable experience. We wouldn't have had nearly a special time without her! Highly recommend!

Smart and great fun. We met Emily by chance and couldn't have found a better guide. A native of the city and a college professor, she showed us all the important places and those that few get to see, while putting each in historical and contemporary perspective. Budapest is a gorgeous city with an ugly past and a political present that could undo much of what’s currently good. Emily showed us the new monument in Szabadság square, erected in the middle of one dark night, which many commentators see as an attempt to sugar-coat (if not completely rewrite) the part Hungary’s leaders played in the Nazi take-over of the country. Around the bronze and granite monument, families and friends of Nazi victims have laid out photos and personal effects of some of those who lost so much to the Nazis and to those who invited them into Hungary. After a day of seeing Parliament, Matthias Church, the New York Café, two beautiful spas, and even a ruin pub, Emily made sure that we understood the potential, at least, of a dark side of her well-loved country that could rise again if people choose not to be vigilant. Excuse me. I don’t want to give the impression that the day dwelt in darkness or even in history lessons. Such isn’t at all the case with this fascinating and entertaining young woman. We had an amazing day, filled with laughter and unexpected joy in a city full of people who do such things as spend the day playing chess while sitting in a hot-spring-fed spa pool. We just got the whole story of Budapest and came away aware that there’s so much more to it than the shining lights of Castle Hill and Parliament and the connecting bridges, as beautiful as they all are on a warm day and night in August.

Like traveling with family from Budapest!. We had a wonderful experience with Emily, her husband, and her beautiful baby. We felt like they were our family and they were taking us around to show us their city. She is very knowledgable about all aspects of Budapest and we enjoyed our tour tremendously. We also hired her to transfer us to Vienna and give us a tour of Vienna too. She gave us a great day tour of Vienna and dropped us off at our hotel. Our hotel in Vienna was a little hard to find and she came in with us to make sure we were in the right place. Just like family. I think anyone who tours with Emily will learn a lot and have a lot of fun.

If you do nothing else...do this. I was holidaying on a budget and this personal tour was a real extravagance for this trip. It was worth every penny and more. Emily and her husband collected us from our hotel in an air conditioned spotless people carrier and took us on a tour of Budapest at night. Her knowledge of the city and of Hungarian history made my stay in Budapest. It gave me a huge (and unexpected) interest in Hungarian history which made the trip even more poignant for me. Her pride in her country was evident. She's lovely, professional and easy to be with. I don't think I could recommend this trip enough tbhAfter the trip not only had we seen the sights but we had personal recommendations for ice cream shops, trams, other places to visit and were fully orientated geographically so that we could explore the city easily.I know I would not have seen as much and from such great vantage points as I did on this tour. I have one regret: I went on the tour after a long hot journey stood on a train, poor sleep the night before and the tour was so enthralling that when it came to an end I was too dozy to get money ready. I handed over the due amount but would have tipped far more because we all enjoyed it so much. For this omission I feel huge regret because I'd really like her to know how much we loved it. I spent a lot of the next day trying to work out how I could get money to her. So Emily, if you're reading this I'm so sorry I didn't, because it was the highlight of my trip to Budapest.I will be back one day and hope to rectify it then with another tour!

excellent tour experience. We hired Emily for 2 tours, we are a family with two teens (17 & 15) and we all equally enjoyed thectime we spent with Emily. The first day we spent over 7 hours covering all of the sights of budapest. I cant think of a single sight we didnt see. The pace was relaxed and we travelled between each attraction in an air conditioned van which was much needed in the 34 degree heat!Emily spoke perfect English and we enjoyed spending time in her company. The next day she collected us from our apartment with her husband Gabriel who drove us. We also got to meet her beautuful baby Laura who came along for the day. This day we opted for the Danube bend tour and again the itinerary was well out together and we loved seeing more of this beautiful country. If you have a budget for this type of tour I cannot recommend Emily enough. I will definitely book her again the next time we come to Budapest.

The Best. My wife, sister, a friend and myself had just finished a 9 day choir mission trip all over Europe and had decided to extend our trip with 3 days in Budapest. We hired Emily, whom we have worked with in the past, and had yet another spectacular visit. As always Emily is knowledgeable, thoughtful and resourceful and made our visit a complete delight. We toured some of the places we had seen before (my sister's first visit) and some we had not seen. In particular the Jewish district tour was interesting and poignant. Emily was so knowledgeable and respectful throughout what was a very difficult tour. Of course Baby Laura was beautiful and we also had the privilege to meet Emily's husband, Gabriel who drove us to several of our destinations. If you want the best in Budapest Emily is your guide.
The Guides are quite Informative. Me and family took the private guide tour the guides are quite informative and take you around the must visit places....keep up the good work guys....
Good. A very informative and proffesional guided Tour that gave US an interesting understanding of the beatuful City and its history

Two days to remember . If you're looking for a guide that is knowledgeable, personable and exciting, look no further. Book Emily! We spent two wonderful days that were rich in history and culture. As a special treat we were introduced to baby Laura who we fell in love with. The Great Synagogue and its Tree of Life is a site we will never forget. As a honed professor she made all the sites and sounds of Budapest come to life. It felt like we had found a new friend in a new country.Her husband, Gabriel, is an excellent driver and a welcome addition to the team.We are seasoned travelers and recommend them highly.
Guide in Budapest. We had a good guide, Nora Margitta, for one day in the city. We certainly recommend her. www.jewishlife of Budapest.hu/en/

Budapest. Just back from a 4-day tailored group tour with Emily (and Agnes). Both are superb guides ! We would definitely recommend them to any one looking for guided tours in (and around) the fascinating city of Budapest.

Private tour of Budapest. We recently traveled to Budapest for a 2 day stay before departing on a Danube River Cruise and contacted Emily several months ago to help us make the most of our short stay. She is extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic and flexible. Our flight arrived 3 hours late and she made sure we saw The Jewish Quarter the day we arrived as planned. The following day we spent the whole day together seeing Pest, the breathtaking vista from Buda, and the Parliament to name just a few. She used the short time we had efficiently and educated us as best she could on the country she loves. We hope to return, spend more time in this beautiful city and to book Emily again.

Budapest with Emily. We visited Budapest last weekend and had a private tour with Emily. It was a last minute booking and Emily managed to squeeze us in. It was a great tour, with all the important sites and very interesting details narrated by Emily. She has a knack of having an interactive discussion and story telling, which makes it even more interesting for the tourists. I would highly recommend Emily for her guided tour services.

Sissi palace with Emily. I visited Buda Pest last weekend . I went with a friend who knew the city well. Friends had recommended Emily to us and we asked her at short notice to take us to Sissis Palace about 45 mins. We both thought that Emily was a superb guide in every way. Emily was efficient,knowledgable extremely helpful and with true command of English. We also arranged aboat trip through her and her reastaurant recommendations were very much appreciated. No hesitation in advising visitors to use Emily

Fantastic private tour with Emily. Just back in from a wonderful 4-hour private and tailored tour with Emily! We had emailed her several months ago, and sent her our wish list of sights we wanted to see while in Budapest (which she made some great additions to!). I can't thank her enough for the fabulous experience we had today. We covered quite a bit of the best sights on the Buda and Pest sides, including Matthias Church (amazing!), the best view of Budapest from Gellert Hill, two of the baths, and many more awe inspiring sights. Would highly recommend hiring her services, and will definitely book her again on any return trip we make :)

An absolute must!!. I apologize to Emily for taking 5 months to write this review! I would not feel right if I did not share my thoughts on what an amazing time I had. Emily was so knowledgeable and I spent an entire day touring all that the lovely city of Budapest has to see. I was a solo traveler and Emily and her husband picked me up at the train station when I arrived from Vienna. She was so accommodating and first took me to check in at the Corinthia and get my bags up to my room. After that her husband was our driver as we stopped at countless picturesque sites of both Buda and Pest. The entire time she filled my head with the history, culture and current condition of the Hungarian city. I could have not imagined a better tour guide. She even had lunch with me at a little excellent cafe and took me on a tour of the Parliament. She was so personable and spoke excellent English, I felt like I was visiting a college friend from my past! One warning, she is a professor so do expect a pop quiz at the end of the tour! Thank you Emily for the outstanding experience!!

A private tour from Anna Gorgey in Budapest. The only way to see Budapest is with a private tour from Anna Gorgey. Anna is insightful, intelligent, warm, informative, fun, and tailors the tour just for you. She speaks excellent English and has a wealth of experience and knowledge. She loves Budapest and knows and understands it well. You will fall in love with this great city through Anna's tours. We did two day tours with her both driving and walking. She also gave to us great restaurant recommendations and even was kind enough to make reservations for us. Over all a superb experience with Anna!And nothing to dislike !!!

Fabulous two days of touring with Emily. Emily went above and beyond what many of our tour guides have done in the past. She made arrangements for our pickup at the airport and delivery to our hotel, things only got better from a great start. Having been raised in Budapest, her knowledge was never ending. She showed us everything we had on our list and many other sites. A very unexpected treasure was the hospital in the cave that was created in WWII. She made reservations at restaurants for us, recommended her favorite dishes at the restaurants and followed up to make certain we were pleased with the food. Her Budapest at Night tour was exceptional as well. She a lot to be proud of in her beautiful city and it shines through.

Emily had to cancel but made perfect substitution. We were sorry that Emily had to cancel a tour we had set up but we're delighted to hear of the most happy reason why.! I will not post in respect to Emily.s privacy. However Emily had arranged for a most perfect replacement guide Joseph who was courteous, extremely knowledgeable, professional and answered our questions and tour desires. It is a testament to Emily.s skills as a professional guide that she emailed me twice to setup and then doublecheck to see how things were going.Emily , all my best to you on your happy occasion . We will pass your name over to friends and will see you on our next trip to Budapest!

Emily - An Outstanding Tour Guide. My wife and I engaged Emily's services during our visit to Budapest on April 12 and 13. We contacted her based on the strong recommendation of friends who had used her as a guide late last year. Emily was a superb guide, exhibiting high degrees of knowledge, professionalism, and flexibility in meeting client needs! She tailored our tours to meet our specific requests and special needs (limited walking). We highly recommend Emily to anyone seeking a quality tour experience and will not hesitate to use her again on our next trip to Budapest.

Great tour guide!. We spent the day with Emily recently on our visit to Budapest. She was excellent!! A great wealth of knowledge and very helpful. We would definitely recommend her to anyone looking for an in depth history and tour of the city. Two days after our tour she sent an email to us followed with some answers on trees and plants we had asked. Absolutely unexpected but very appreciated. Thanks!!

Lovely Time in a Lovely City. My sister and I booked Emily at the last minute for a four day visit to Budapest in March.Emily was responsive, informative, enthusiastic and fun to be with.Our first tour with her was a night tour of the city which shouldn't be missed as the city is beautifully illuminated and looks like the jewel it is. Emily not only gave us a historical perspective but helped us with our camera exposures so our photographs were very professional! Emily's English is impeccable. She speaks six languages and is an academician. She is truly professional, always on time and even puts up with shopaholics, always putting her client's needs first. When she was unavailable, she was able to provide an equally talented colleague and even found a guide for us in another city that was also excellent. We spent our days not only seeing the sights with Emily but discussing history, politics, culture, and "connecting'" as friends, She suggested we do the Sechenyi baths which were quite an experience and one that shouldn't be missed! All our tours involved some form of eating and there was never a disappointment regarding any of her suggestions. We did a walking tour of Budapest, went to the lovely town of Szentendre and went to Godollo Palace as well as the Lazar brothers ranch to see the horses perform. The ranch was my only dissapointment this trip as I thought the horse show considerably amateur in production and the experience very "touristy".. The horses were however beautiful as were the other animals on the ranch (especially the Hungarian Puli) and the country side was lovely to drive through.I would definitely recommend Emily as your guide in this beautiful city. She will extend herself for you and you will return home with a new friend as well as some lovely memories!!For Emily: I hope you and Laura are doing well. Kisses to her!!

Memorable customized family tour of Bupapest sights. Booked Emily this past March for a customized family tour of specific sites I'd wanted to visit in Budapest and she did a great job of not just driving us to these sometimes far out locations (ie. Communist statue park or Memento park and other buildings with unique architecture) but of really spending time and effort in showing not just us adults but also my two small kids, the history and ideas behind these monuments. She then also drove us to the Children's railway in the Buda mountains where we rode a nice engine down and got off to a midway point (Janos hill) where got off, hiked a bit then hopped on an open ski lift ride down the town of Zugliget at the bottom of the Buda hills with fantastic views of the city from high above! She gave us very clear and specific instructions on how to wander the streets of outer Buda upon leaving us at the end of our tour and we thoroughly enjoyed seeing yet another part of Budapest where everyday folks live (Zugliget). Booking her from start to finish was easy and she always replied quickly to my queries, arrived on time and kept even the kids engaged all throughout the tour. Highly recommend booking Emily for any visit to Budapest even with small kids since she can tailor fit the visit to make even these small minds captivated by this gorgeous city.

Amazing!. My husband and I had an amazing experience with Emily. We chose an all day tour on our first day in Budapest because we wanted to see as much of the city as possible. It was the perfect way to get a feel for the city. Emily was incredibly knowledgable and informative and she tailored the tour to highlight the things we were most interested in. She took her time explaining the different sites and answered any questions we had. I HIGHLY recommend booking a tour with Emily!

Contact Emily for Budapest Tours. Last year, my wife and I spent two days in Budapest prior to a Danube cruise. We had Emily as our tour guide and we were very impressed and pleased with her services. Emily had her colleague meet us at the airport and took us to our hotel. She recommended that we see Budapest by day and night which we did. This was a great recommendation because the city is magically transformed at night. After meeting Emily, we felt we were in good hands because it soon became obvious that she was very knowledgeable, warm, welcoming and loves her country. We had a four hour tour of the highlights of Budapest that afternoon during which time she took us to the main iconic spots both in Buda and in Pest. She was very versed in the social, historical and cultural importance of each location and she explained them in impeccable English. This enlightening tour ended at a relaxing riverside restaurant recommended by Emily along with some suggestions for local dishes to try. For the following day, she suggested a list of places (with directions), some that we had visited before, that we could tour at our leisure. This we found very useful and enjoyable. Emily was very flexible in accommodating any special requests that we had. For the night tour, we revisited the places we had been to during the day, along with some others that we requested, and were thrilled by how the city was transformed by lights. It is also beautiful during the “blue light” period.We found Emily to be very organized. She is not only knowledgeable and passionate about Budapest’s historic sites and monuments, but she takes great pride in imparting her knowledge of the history, culture, politics, geography, social norms and nuances.TO EMILY…..We had an enjoyable time in Budapest. We learned a lot about your city. You even tested our knowledge of what you had shared with us...and because you were so good, we passed with flying colours!!! We could not have asked for more in the short time we had. THANK YOU!!We would not hesitate to recommend Emily!!!

Best Tour Ever. Emily and I corresponded via email for a few months before we actually arrived in Budapest because I was checking out the various tour guide options listed on TripAdvisor. Emily was extremely responsive and followed up with me on a regular basis to see if we had made a decision about what we wanted to do. We were slow to decide exactly what we wanted to do or when we wanted to take our tour because we had to wait for some other schedules to be announced. By the time we decided which day would work for us, Emily was booked, but she sent her colleague Nagy Gabor. He was by far and away the best tour guide any of us have ever had. He custom-designed the tour based on what we'd already seen and what we wanted to see and what we wanted to learn. He was a wealth of knowledge. He even brought with him a seven-minute 1932 American video about Budapest which he showed us in the Basilica. I can't speak highly enough of Gabor (aka "Gabriel,") Definitely a 10 out of 10! We paid 75 Euros for a three hour tour for five of us. This was an EXCEPTIONAL value.

All the reviews are true -- Emily is a great tour guide!. I won't repeat what all the other reviews have sufficiently captured, but I will reassure anyone reading that it is all true. Seriously. Emily is a wonderful guide! She is reputable, reliable, honest, multi-lingual, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and friendly. She was extremely easy to work with via email to line up the tours and get pricing info.We booked two (2) full day tours with her and the time flew by. She helped us with reserving a Danube boat tour as well in advance of our trip. She was a great resource sharing her firsthand knowledge of Budapest's history and culture. She gave us interesting insights and showed us various sights that didn't come up in my own research. We wouldn't hesitate to use her again if we ever return to Budapest and finish up all the sights we didn't have time for.

Don't see Budapest without Emily!. My husband and I came to Budapest about five months after my parents did. They had a fantastic time with Emily and suggested we use her, as well. From the moment she picked us up, she was enthusiastic, engaging and beyond knowledgeable. She speaks many languages and is clearly very bright and talented. She showed us all the important sites in Budapest, along with some other sites we were personally interested in. There is no way we would have been able to see even half the things she showed us on our own. She answered all of our questions and was a delight to be with. Do yourself a favor and

Best Budapest Tour. We were introduced to Emily thru our tour guide in Prauge. We were interested in a two day tour of the historical, political and cultural sites in Budapest. Emily was a terrific guide with outstanding knowledge of the city, past and present. We were able to see all of the sites and Emily was able to get us in the attractions quickly and efficiently. Her explanations of the facts was extraordinary. Emily was very personable,enthusiastic and just fun to be with therefore making our visit to Budapest that much more worthwhile. We would highly recommend Emily for an informative, educational and fun tour of Budapest.

Budapest tour. I read about Emily on the Trip Advisor site, and contacted her for guiding us around Budapest. She was absolutely excellent. Everything she told us she would do, from someone meeting us at the airport, to getting tickets to the Parliament building, to seeing the choirs sing at The Bacillica ( even asked her very nice husband to save seats for us as parking was difficult) she did. She is, as a doctoral student, extremely knowledgeable and fluent in several languages, including English.She made our time in beautiful Budapest extremely enjoyable. I would love to have her as a guide again.Diane

Fantastic!!!. We contacted Emily to arrange a full day tour of the Danube Bend area of Hungary. My parents were arriving separately from us, and after talking with Emily, we decided to use her airport transfer arrangements as well as book the tour. She also advised when quoting us what we should consider tipping the drivers (which we found a helpful guide).Firstly, all the airport transfer drivers were great - friendly and helpful, and also knowledgeable and willing to offer advice and suggestions (which was great on the arrival transfers!).Secondly our tour was great! The price would have been the same had we done a bog standard tour. The tour date was changed a couple of times (due to our total ignorance - we booked our tour for the long weekend that celebrates Hungary's National Day), but despite it being a massive holiday, we had a great time, and no troubles with anything being closed. Emily constantly kept us up to date with any changes via email. Her knowledge and passion for her country is outstanding, and really shows when she is talking about places and history. She is a lecturer in wellness management, and speaks 6 languages fluently! I also must mention our driver, Stephen, who also spoke perfect English, and was most helpful and friendly. During our day tour, I felt like Emily made small changes as my Mum had problems doing a lot of walking (she very recently hurt her back) - but it never felt like we missed anything. We also felt that we were taken to a couple of places that the big tour companies might have missed.We highly recommend Emily, and all of the drivers she used for a truly wonderful experience!(We would also recommend the full day Danube Bend Tour too)

top notch. We did a tour of Jewish Budapest with Emily and were very pleased with this tour. She took us to all the important places and was very informed about everything. She was patient in answering our questions and navigated the tour well. We highly recommend Emily.

Three OUTSTANDING days with Emily!. We were a small group of 6 (3 couples) traveling together. We arrived in Budapest on a riverboat, and Emily had a driver meet us to take us to our hotel. Then we were off on a tour of the Jewish area followed by a tour of the interior of Parliament. Emily was extremely knowledgeable and eager to share her rich understanding of her amazing city. The next morning we headed out to tour the famous cafes and thermal baths. We were so impressed with Emily's ability to navigate the city and know just the right things to show us. The last day was just my husband and me. Emily picked us up in her car and we headed out of the city to Szentendre (St. Andrews), the town of artists. We spent a wonderful day walking around the small town, enjoying the history, artists, and shops. Emily seemed to know everyone! A highlight of our trip was watching Emily salsa dancing on a street corner 'meet up' of other dancers later that evening (we surprised her). She is not only an incredible tour guide, but also a phenomenal dancer. I most highly recommend Emily! After the time you spend with her you will know the city of Budapest inside and out, plus you will feel like you have a new friend.

Incredible Emily. We just returned from 4 days in Budapest, 3 touring with Emily both in and outside of Budapest. I am so glad I made this choice for our group. She made every arrangement from our train and airport pickups to traveling with us to each and every venue. No part of our trip was ever left to choice. Very knowledgeable, funny and engaging, a pure joy on our Hungarian journey. If you are looking for a guide with that caring and personal touch, choose Emily.

Couldn't Have Been Any Better, Top Notch Tour!. Emily met us at the dock after our river cruise and we were off touring Budapest. I think we saw everything there was to see. We toured for two days and then she made arrangements to take us to the airport. It was a complete package. Emily was charming, knowledgeable, punctual, professional, speaks six languages, born and raised in Budapest, knew everything about its history and even teaches other tour guides. She took us to places that only the locals know about. She seemed to know everybody which allowed us special access to some of the most interesting places. Book early because I'm sure she will become even more popular.

Outstanding Guide. We spent a couple of days with Emily, first on a Danube Bend tour and then a half day city tour. She was simply wonderful. Emily speaks English well and has a great sense of humor. She is very well versed in the history of Budapest and offers a lot of interesting tidbits that no guidebook provides. She also took us to a few interesting places that we wouldn't have been able to find by ourselves, like the Catholic university campus designed by Makovecz. Emily's value showed when she got us into a Parliament tour even though we were late. If we ever find ourselves back in the wonderful city of Budapest, we wouldn't hesitate to call up Emily again.

The Best Guide Ever. My wife and I spent two wonderful days with Emily touring Budapest and then the Danube Bend. She was sensational. She took us to all of the wonderful sights that we wanted to see, and added little gems that we might otherwise have missed with other guides. She was extremely flexible, and understood (often intuitively) what we did or did not want to visit. Her English is terrific and, in addition to the information and knowledge that she shared with us, we had many laughs together. It was like travelling with a good friend. We would not use anyone else as a guide in Budapest and Hungary.

Great Guide for Hungary. I spent four days with Emily last week in Budapest and the area outside the city. She was wonderful. She was responsive and helpful with her emails in advance and had an English speaking driver pick me up from the airport which was great. Emily was prompt and flexible. She was extremely well versed in the history and culture of Hungary. Her pricing was more than fair for the value she provided. She was a pleasure to be with and really helped me and my friends navigate the area. I really cannot say enough good about her. She was everything you would want in a guide. This is the only person I would use in Budapest and the surrounding areas to show me around.

Brilliant. From the first moment to the last , Emily was a superb guide . She took into consideration that I was ill and if she could have driven into a particular sight she would have . We had a informative, entertaining and never boring tour from the Parliment , Heroes Square, the Castle district /Old City, the Bascilica , the thermal baths , to the Citadel , etc. She managed to get us right near all the best spots and we were not over loaded with info . Plus she took me to an amazing Ruin bar in the Jewish quarter which I had never experienced . It is a bar in a derelict building and all the chairs and tables , etc are made from discarded items . I highly recommend Emily as she is experienced, kind and a professional tour guide .

Professional with great organization!. We had a few days with Emily, all of which were both informational as well as fun ! Emily is very knowledgeable As well as accommodating! We saw everything we requested and more.I highly recommend her services!
great tour. Just finished a 4 hour classic tour of Budapest with Emily and had a great time. She is informative and very pleasant company. Would recommend her highly

Best in the business!. My husband, daughter and I booked Emily for two days - a Budapest city tour, including Parliament, and the next day, a trip to Lake Balaton and the Herend factory. We cannot say enough good things about her. She is very personable and her English is so good that Americans will never have to ask her to repeat herself. She picked us up in her car at our apartment exactly at our scheduled time. The first day was a combination of driving in the city and walking, depending on the location. The second day was out of town so more driving but plenty of walking to stretch our legs at the lake and the abbey. She was very thorough with explanations and left us with things to do circled on our map for the following days that we were on our own. We even had a little quiz at the end of our second day and she was such a good teacher that we passed with no problem! You will be very happy with the quality of your tour if you book with Emily!

Excellent Budapest Tour Guide. My wife and I visited Budapest and could not have asked for a better tour guide. Emily arranged our rides to and from the airport which worked out perfectly. She gave us a great 3 hour overview tour of the city. She knows all of the secret spots to go and introduced us to so many wonderful things to see and do. We also toured the Jewish Quarter with Emily, and she was extremely knowledgeable and interesting. She was fun to be with and we would recommend her if you are looking for a high energy guide who knows her city and its culture well. She is really excellent!

Exceptional. We spent a day with Emily, her knowledge was exceptional, however what made the day special was her warmth and friendliness. She tailored our schedule to accommodate our limited mobility, and she had a knack of finding car parks in the most impossibly convenient locations.It felt more like a friend of a friend rather that a tour.The day was flexible, and it was obvious she was committed to maximising our experience in Budapest.She even assisted with confirming our forward travel bookings from Budapest, which was happily offered by her.Would highly recommend

Everything you could want Guide. My husband and I used Emily for four weekends in a row this July. I often chose to go to out of the way areas, and Emily really did her homework for us. She came prepared with information on the places we wanted to see, and suggestions of her own. Emily really made it her business to get to know exactly what We found interesting and what We needed to enhance the tour/trip. The fact that she is multilingual came in handy many times. She is a friendly, informative, and enjoyable person whom I would highly recommend for either a short city tour, or a long tour of any type.

Terrific Guide!. Emily spent the best part of a day with me, and we left no stone unturned. She shared her love of her city. Anytime something came up that perhaps she hadn't planned, she easily detoured around it we kept on going. It was a great day!

Best Hungarian Guide. Emily is outstanding. She is full of knowledge, with a super attitude! She sure made our time together a fun filled knowledge based experience. We wanted nighttime vistas for photography and Emily made it happen. We can highly recommend Emily for your Budapest enlightenment.

Great guide. All I can say is WOW.. We decided to get a guide for Budapest at the last minute and lucked into Emily. Perfect English, easy to understand, great knowledge of Budapest and the sites. She was well prepared and has a delightful personality. I recommend her without hesitation as a guide.

Absolutely Fablulous. We were a small group consisting of a couple in our seventies and our adult son, traveling to Budapest for the first time.Emily arranged for our airport pick-up/drop-off as well as our pick-up for 2 days of Formula 1 racing. She personally gave us a 5-hour driving city tour and a 2-hour driving city night tour.Everything was perfect. Everyone was on time and waiting for us. Every price quoted was reasonable. Every restaurant she suggested (from a small local restaurant specializing in homemade Hungarian cooking to the most fabulous gourmet cuisine) everything was wonderful. Emily was extremely knowledgeable, entertaining and helpful. She is great, she made our first trip to Budapest a very special memory.Thank you so much!

Excellent tour guide. My husband announced he had booked a private tour guide for two of our five day trip to Budapest. I was not very happy at the thought of a third, unknown, person on our trip. I could not have been more wrong. Emily was brilliant, answering any questions, showing us places the larger tour trips could not get to. My husband had recently broken his foot so could not walk far. Emily adjusted our trip to accommodate him as much as possible. We had a half day tour of the city and then a whole day tour visiting the surrounding countryside. I can not recommend Emily highly enough. Julie Heron

Wonderful.. Since I found Emily here on trip advisor, while planing my trip to Budapest, I truly believe, that other travelers should hear about our experience with her. She was truly amazing. Not only answering the emails quickly and with efficient information, but also managing our pick up and transfer to the airport. Her offered tours were of so wide range, that we even decided to go for 2 of them and both were fantastic! She really knows what to show her guests and it felt like we were her friends that she was just showing around with open heart and bag full of information. I could go on and on about the tours, but I think you have to make your own experience with Emily. This is truly the best way to see the beautiful Budapest.

Excellent Tour. Emily has given us a wonderful tour of Budapest. We really enjoyed the Budapest and her tour tremendously. She is an excellent guide and make the tour very pleasant, fun and very interesting.

Seeing Budapest with Emily. Emily took my wife and I on an 8 hour full day walking/ driving tour of Budapest. She is an excellent guide. Being a college professor, linguist, business and history lecturer, she has all of the background to present an insightful in-depth picture of her native city.emily is very personable, her English is excellent. Her tour was flexible and she easily made changes to accommodate some of our personal interests. She was very pleasant, easy to get along with. She constantly offered to take photos of us at various sites and vistas. Her command of the history of Budapest was impressive, including details of the Jewish ghetto and Grand Synagogue. The day went all too quickly and we covered a lot of ground. Emily gave us tips on activities and sites to pursue on our own, as well as restaurant recommendations. All in all, a wonderful, informative , memorable tour. Highly recommend Emily. Just be prepared for the test at the end of the day!!!!! (We passed!!!!!!!). Bravo, Emily!

glen and hazel. An excellent day with Emily getting picked up and dropped door to door great hope to see you next year hazel glen and pista daroczy it was wonderful to have some one speak such excellent English and her knowledge of history and Bunapest is so fantastic she should be proud of herself.Well done Emily.

Superb Day Tour!. We scheduled a 6 hour tour with Emily in early May....prior to boarding our Danube River cruise in the afternoon. We could not be more pleased! Emily met us at our hotel promptly at 8am then proceeded to take us to the Budapest highlights. We expected to be using public transit, but to our pleasant surprise, she has a very nice sedan. She was gracious, friendly.....with perfect English. We never had to ask to have a photo taken....she just offered at every stop. The tour turned out to be 7 hours, finishing with a great, relaxing lunch in a 5 star restaurant. At the end of the tour Emily took us to our hotel to pick up our bags and then dropped us at the Intercontinental hotel to meet our cruise. No suggestions to improve this experience.....could not have been better!

Emily is superb!. Emily gave our family of 5 a wonderful walking tour of Pest. We learned so much from her about Hungarian history and culture, and she truly enhanced our visit to Budapest. She efficiently navigated us through the city on foot and by bus and subway (based on what we wanted to see) and we were able to do so much more with her than we would have be able to on our own (particularly because our time was limited). When our walking tour was over, she gave us suggestions for what to do/see next and recommended a wonderful restaurant for lunch. She was also very accommodating when we had to reschedule for a different day due to flight complications, even managing to reschedule our Parlaiment tour. Highly recommended! Thanks Emily!

Great for Families. We just returned from Budapest for a weekend trip, and our 3-hour city tour with Emily was the perfect way to kick-off the trip. She tailored the standard itinerary to accommodate our interests and time, providing interesting commentary throughout our time. She is extremely knowledgeable about modern and historical Budapest and it definitely showed throughout the tour. She was particularly accommodating for our two young children, arranging for car seats ahead of the tour!

Emily is the BEST tour guide in Budapest. We just came back from our trip to Budapest and Emily did an excellent job for us, a family of six. She arranged everything from airport transfers, 8 hrs city tour and all the way to Vienna tour. She is so friendly, good in communicating via emails, speaks very good English, easy going and just PERFECT. The restaurant she brought us for lunch was the BEST restaurant in Budapest ! We can't thank Emily enough for her service and we highly recommend her. You won't be disappointed !!

The Reviews Are True -- Emily is Excellent. We just returned from a trip to Budapest and Prague with our two adult/teenage children. Emily guided us through Budapest for three days. She was reliable, intelligent and interesting. She has an incredible wealth of knowledge as to all of the sites and history of Hungary/Budapest. Her restaurant selections were spot on; her english was excellent and she made it all very interesting. All of the reviews you are reading a 100% accurate. I could not recommend her more highly.

Emily is the BEST. My husband and I were lucky enough to spend two days with Emily on November 2 and 3, 2013. Her knowledge of everything in Budapest is phenomenal. Her English is excellent. She was with us as we toured both the city and the countryside. We did a Parliament and Jewish heritage tour as well as a Danube Bend tour and a Folkloric dinner followed by a night tour of city which was beautifully illuminated. All in all if you are looking for the best then Emily is the guide you should choose.Alice and Ed

Terrific!. Found Emily on Trip Advisor using key words Private Guide Budapest. She promptly replied to my email inquiry with suggestions as to what to see along with cost. We chose a 4 hour auto tour and she showed us most of Budapest's highlights in that time. She spoke perfect English, drove safely and knew just where to park. She answered all our many questions about Budapest and Hungary. At the end of the tour we took her suggestion to see Parliament the next morning. She arranged tickets on line, picked us up at our hotel, drove us to Parliament and then got us past the long line right into a tour group that was just starting.Highly recommended. Much better than any cruise tour we have taken (typically groups of around 30)...and less expensive.

Seemed like touring with a celebrity !. My wife and I have found private local guides to be an excellent resource to enhancement our visits in foreign lands...after reviewing the multiple glowing tripadvisor reviews...we chose Emily. Not a mistake!! Emily moved us about the city effortlessly and seemed to find a prime parking spot left for her at each stop. With considerable personal charm and obvious passion for Budapest, Emily provided excellent and easily understandable information at each stop.  Emily's intellectual gift becomes quickly apparent after a few interpersonal exchanges and quality of information provided at the stops. (In addition to her college level teaching, she recently has been awarded a postion in Germany to continue her Doctor of Philosophy requirements). She expressed her multi-lingual skills as she graciously aided a Spanish group at the Parliament ticket office. Emily was warmly greeted by a colleague or friend at literally every stop of the day making us feel as if we were touring with a "rock star". Though we didn't get to experience first hand, Emily loves dancing and must know every club dancer in Budapest--I am unaware if she offers a "dance club" tour. Several of the police or other attendants encountered seemed to know Emily and/or let her do whatever she desired in respect to getting around a barricade, double parking, etc., which proved helpful on several occasions. Since we had 4 AM wake-up next day for early departure flight, we had decided to not attempt a "night lights" tour, however Emily readily accommodated a 1 hour night tour shortly after sunset.  We readily recommend Emily as a delightful companion and guide for a wonderful tour of Budapest.

excellent guide,friendly and informative.. Emily made our 8 day stay in Budapest most interesting and enjoyable.She speaks excellent English and was efficient and punctual. Among the highlights, of the tours Emily arranged for us was the trips to the horse ranch, the Sissi palace and the Hungarian Parliament building. Emily also arranged a luncheon with a private family who gave us some real insights into the lives they and their grandparents, led during the tragic history of Hungary over the last 100 years.It was a most fascinating afternoon. I can highly recommend Emily as your private tour guide when you visit beautiful Budapest.Max Strahan Sept 2013

Excellent guide, excellent value - Memories for a lifetime!. Emily was amazing. As two professors from the U.S., we were looking for cultural immersion without the crowds. Emily did not disappoint. Excellent service, and I learned while talking with her that she is a teacher herself! She picked us up from the train station (with a sign waiting for us) at 5pm and then brought us on a tour of the city with excellent historical knowledge (and local knowledge of when/where to get the best pictures in the evening). She then met us for breakfast the next morning and brought us on a tour of the semi-exclusive Hungarian Parliament that she reserved for us prior to our arrival. She then arranged for transport for us to the airport, which was prompt and efficient. I can't imagine you will find Emily to be anything but delightful.

Excellent Private Tour With Emily. My husband and I did a private tour with Emily that started in Budapest and then went to Szentendre and then back to the Jewish Quarter in Budapest. Emily did an excellent job. In fact she is probably the best tour guide we have ever had - and we have had many. She is extremely knowledgeable and ready to share her experiences. She had a wealth of knowledge about Hungry and of all the places that interested us. I would highly recommend using Emily on your next private tour!

Never got to tour with Emily. I debated if I should even review Emily. Emily ended up needing to cancel. She came to the hotel early about 830, the morning of the tour and let us know, explained the situation and told us she had a replacement. While I very much appreciated that and we learned a lot with Kristine I would have appreciated more advance notice. So I could have decided if I wanted to go forward or not. When Emily came back later that evening for payment she went through the map places to see and reviewed the tour we went on. All of which I appreciated. She said she tried to stop by the hotel the day before, but we were out. She could have emailed to let us know since all prior communication was via email. I am only disappointed because I can not really review Emily's tour since I was unable to take it.

Budapest tour was great. Our Canadian family of four used Emily on a 7 hour day tour as well as an evening tour. Having her with a vehicle/driver are a must to thouroughly explore the city. The sights are relatively close with a vehicle but a bit far to do by foot. She helped us organize a folkdance show and cruise prior to our visit. Emily has a deep knowledge of Budapest and obviously has done many tours. She understands well the sights that tourists want to see and adjusts her tours to the group. My 13 and 15 year old sons were happily entertained.

Great private guide!. My husband and I had only one day and a half to spend in Budapest and we wanted to see it all!!Emily was great organizing the visits so we could see the must see places, adding her personal favorites so we could feel a little of the town's local flavor .We took 2 half day tours and one night tour that was spectacular!Emily is reliable, friendly, professional, and I highly recommend her!

Reliable, helpful, friendly guide. Emily was recommended by a friend who went to Budapest last year and she more than lived up to our expectations. Prior to our trip, I made a lot of enquiries from her, asked her for help to secure bookings for concerts and restaurant reservations, and she was always responsive and provided good suggestions. We did a 3 hour afternoon tour of the city and were very pleased that we covered not only the main sights, but she also brought us to other interesting places not covered in the usual itinerary. She took us on a tour of Parliament, a really worthwhile visit with beautiful architecture. We highly recommend her if you ever visit Budapest. She is highly experienced, and even teaches tourism at one of the local institutions. In addition, she was accomodating, accepting payment in US$ at a fair market exchange rate when I ran out of Euros. Thank you Emily for making our visit a pleasant and memorable one. Pat

Fantastic!. Well....what to say!Our first visit to Budapest and we wanted to get an overview and see the main sites as we only had a few days there.Emily is a fabulous guide! We had a great time touring the city over 4 hours, and we highly recommend that you book Emily if you intend to visit Budapest.Clive and Nancy

Emily went above and beyond for us. We wanted more than the typical river cruise city tour so I hired Emily for a 4 hour afternoon tour of the city. It was one of the best decisions that I made for the trip. There was just my husband and myself and Emily made sure that we saw places all over the city. She ordered tickets for us for the tour of the Parliament building which my husband says is the most beautiful building he has ever seen. His expertise is commercial construction. I talked to many others on our cruise and no one else had the privilege to tour the Parliament building. I could go on and on. We went to the top of Liberty Hill and this is the only place where you can get pictures of both Buda and Pest and Margaret Island in the center of the river. We went inside the Szechenyl Spa and pools. We loved the time we spent with Emily. Her knowledge and enthusiasm make her the perfect choice to make the most of the time you have in Budapest. We love, love, love Budapest and we hope to travel back there someday.

Budapest City Tour with Emily. Emily provided a private tour for my son (17) and me. It included transportation to and from the Hungaroring race track for Forumula 1 practice and qualifying. Emily was a sport to do this and had a great attitude about providing the experience on a hot and crowded day. We let Emily choose the Budapest sites to see and we enjoyed our day tremendously. My son is a history and architecture buff and Emily took extra care to show and discuss various sites. In addition to the tour we had a wonderful coffee desert at the New Your Cafe and outdoor dinner by the Danube. We enjoyed our day tremendously. Emily is a wonderful host.

A great way to see Budapest and surrounds. Emily provided my wife and I with two tours. The first was a half day driving/walking tour of Budapest and the second was a full day one to the countryside. Our half day tour included a tour of the Parliament and the full day tour ended with a ferry ride down the Danube. Both tours were very enjoyable. Emily is a very engaging guide who is extremely knowledgeable about Budapest and about Hungarian history. On the half day tour we saw all of the major sites in Budapest and stopped at numerous ones to get out of the car (which was of a type like a Toyota Corolla) and have walk around to see them close up. This was a very efficient way of seeing everything. Throughout the tour Emily explained everything that we were seeing along with the historical background. If you are looking for a great overview of Budapest, I would highly recommend this tour. The full day tour of the countryside was outstanding. We saw a number of places that you would just not see if you were travelling alone or on an organised tour. For example, we went to a small university with amazing architecture. We also went to more conventional sites such as the largest basilica in Hungary and the artists’ town. All the while we had interesting conversation and commentary with Emily. In the artists’ town she was able to arrange a demonstration of how some of the handcrafts are produced. At the end of the tour she got us on to the ferry to return to Budapest. Throughout both tours Emily was informative and interesting. I would highly recommend her if you are coming to Budapest.We also arranged our transfer from the train station and then to the airport through Emily. These both worked very well.The rates for the tour and transfers was much less than those I saw advertised by larger firms.

An Excellent Introduction To Budapest. Emily provided my wife, my daughter, and me a wonderful introduction to Budapest during a lone day tour. She is full of knowledge very interesting and adaptable to our requests (Jewish and non-Jewish sites), she is nice to be with and showed us Budapest the way we could never do by ourselves.Emily also arranged for our transportation from the airport to the hotel, and gave us voucher to avoid the line in the spa. She gave us advice on how to plan out the rest of our stayEmily was a pleasure to work with in organizing the trip before we arrivedHighly recommended!!!

Shes a super guide!!. picked Emily from Tripadvisor. Shes a Budapest Professional. We hired her for a group of 15 pax. for a city sightseeing and parliament visit for a five hour tour. There she was at the fixed time with the vehicle. She took us around, had a nice ice cream stop where they make lovely ice creams like roses (do ask her this). She has all the knowledge of the city and has answers to all our questions. She is also very clear in her english (in Hungary its quite difficult for people to understand english). Just go with her!!!

Emily was great. We were referred to Emily by Nina , a wonderful guide we had in Prague. Emily took us to all the major sights encouraged us to see Parliament, which was worth it We were with my mom who is in her mid 80s and Emily managed to accommodate all of us She also organized a great art nouveau tour for us. She knows her stuff for us I without waiting on lines. If you are in Budapest use Emily

Thanks Emily!. Had a great day with Emily. I only had one day in Budapest and she took me around and showed me as much as we possibly could (including snagging tickets to Parliament even though it was technically closed for a public holiday!) She even helped me plan out the rest of my day after I left her. She is smart, knowledgable, and would definitely use her again or recommend her.
