Our guide was Attila and he was a nice enough person and we had good conversation with him, this review is not a personal vindication against him (seems many other people liked him from other reviews) but rather a statement of facts from our actual experience which for which we paid very steeply and were quite disappointed. We booked another private tour in Budapest the next day and thankfully it was wonderful so I would recommend considering other companies rather than this one when booking your Budapest tour, else you can be out of a lot of money with no real value.

Private tour of hidden gems. My wife and I like to spend part of our first day in a city on a private tour so we can get organized/oriented to the city quickly and then take our time focusing on the sights or activities that interest us. There are plenty of tours available but we choose this one to get a perspective on some of the more off the beaten path locations. It was a cold and windy day so our guide brought his personal car (a 1957 Opel) rather than walk us through the sites. Very grateful he did as it made our tour much more comfortable and enjoyable. We made a good choice of the tour options as we say all the most popular sites on our own plus found some hidden gems we never would have seen.

Balazs and Peter and his Trabant were AMAZING!. Europe has stunning architecture and such a rich history. Even though you think you can see it on your own via hop-on-hop-off busses, trust me: you need to see it via a private tour. Balazs arrived at our hotel on time and completely catered the tour to our needs. Despite challenges with fog (unusual for this time of year in Hungary), he kept us entertained and engaged. He and Peter (our Trabant owner and driver) were complete gentlemen. Don't think twice about it! It may be a little more expensive than big-group tours...trust me, it's worth it!

Fantastic Trabant and Wine Tour. My fiancé and I booked the Trabant tour in the morning which then continued into a wine tour in the afternoon. Our guide Balázs was waiting at our hotel with his prized Trabant which was already attracting admirers! From there we had a personalised tour of Budapest, skipping the areas we had already seen and including sights that only a local would know. This is the real advantage of the tour, you have a local guide who can taylor the tour to your needs. Balázs is a genuine enthusiast with an encyclopaedic knowledge of Trabants. He also knows how to drive one, and treated us to some amazing videos of him driving one of his collection on two wheels! After the tour of Budapest we drove into the countryside to a local wine producing region. Here we were given a tour of the cellar from our brilliant and knowledgeable host. The wine tasting was brilliant, with some excellent sauvignon, chardonnay and local varieties. This was followed by an equally wonderful lunch before being driven back to our hotel.I couldn't recommend this company enough, they have the knowledge and skill to provide a brilliant, bespoke tour. The Trabants are great fun and a practical way to see this beautiful city. If you're a petrol-head it's a must. The wine tour complements the Trabant tour well and both the food and wine were better than I expected.

Christmas Tour. Andras meet us at our hotel and for 6 hours he entertained us (family of four - 2 teenagers) in the best possible way - a private organ performance, making chimney cakes, heritage expert explaining the Hungary Christmas culture - to name a few. Nothing was to much effort for him - I will defnitly recommend any tour with My Personal Budapest!

STUNNING AND INFORMATIVE IMMERSION INTO HUNGARIAN CULTURE!!. Our tour was called "The Soul of Hungary." The seven of us spent a full day with András both learning about and experiencing Hungarian culture and cuisine. Walking shoes are important and the walking is gentle in slope and pace. I took many pictures and encourage anyone else to bring a camera. András was very willing to discuss sensitive political issues without offending anyone. His fluency in English is excellent. There were three parts that stand out for me. The first was the presentation by a young PhD student on the history of Hungary in a Communist-era cafe. It was well-paced and used multimedia presentations to good effect. Following that we did some sightseeing that was tailored specifically for us based on what we had already seen. The second was a meal with a local Hungarian family. We enjoyed traditional food and Christmas cakes. The other was a private concert for our group by an ensemble of 5 Hungarian Gypsy musicians, who were excellent. There was nothing that I did not like. When I plan my next trip to Budapest, András will definitely be my guide of choice.

6 Hour personal Tour Guide with Trabant. We had a tour guide called Balazs who was great and catered the tour for us on the day making changes to accommodate what we wanted to see. The Trabant was lovely and a great way to see the city!
Christmas Tour. Excellent Christmas Tour with MY PERSONAL BUDAPEST. Andras is very knowledgeable and kind. Definitely worth doing.

ABSOLUTELY SPECTACULAR TOUR OF BUDAPEST WITH BALAZS!. My husband and I had a truly amazing tour of the beautiful city of Budapest with Balazs. He was entertaining and quite informed and we loved driving around the city in his vintage Trebant! He and my husband enjoyed talking about all of Balazs' various cars, as my husband is an antique car buff himself. I especially loved the Art Deco coffee shop that we stopped at to rest and have some coffee, wine and dessert. We are still talking about our tour with friends and we highly recommend booking with them!

The Best!. This is THE tour company for Budapest. 100% recommendation!My wife and I just finished our half day tour with our amazing guide András and our sweet and savvy driver János. They picked us up at our Air BnB, gave us a quick intro to the cute but dependable communist era Trabant, and we were on our way.About 3 hours of the highlights and lesser known elements of Budapest, András had a wonderfully personal touch that mixed his own experience with excellent historical and cultural facts about Budapest and Hungarian life and culture. Totally filled with knowledge, we took the drive out to his parents house where his mom had a DELICIOUS Hungarian lunch prepared. His sweet parents made us feel so welcome and we had a lively conversation with all five of us contributing. We were stuffed with all of the delicious local food.András helped prioritize the rest of our trip (this is our first full day in Budapest) by taking the time to go through our check list. He really was above and beyond in every way. He clearly loves 'his city' and it's been the highlight of our entire European vacation (including Paris and Prague).

Danube Bend Tour. Our day spent with Atilla was one of the highlights of our entire vacation! He showed up at our somewhat difficult to find hotel exactly on time, and spent an entire day seeing a more rural side of Hungary. We threw pots at the ceramics studio, something that I never expected my husband to agree to! The lunch we enjoyed at the quaint little restaurant was one of the best meals we ate in our 11 days (take that Viking River cruise chefs!), and I will be forever trying to duplicate it. The weather was the only downfall of our day, but I'm pretty sure Atilla wasn't responsible. We really enjoyed talking to Atilla about food, history, and current events in Hungary. I would love to return to Budapest some day, and will definitely book another tour with Andras and Atilla.

Hungarian Soul Tour. We spent a wonderful day with Andras! This custom itinerary included a terrific balance of history, general sightseeing, cultural immersion, and a glimpse into typical Hungarian family life. In addition to Andras, the other lecturers and musicians who part of the program were excellent! We had an excellent driver and a luxury van and the lunch prepared by his mom and served in their family home was outstanding! We highly recommend this tour and appreciate the thought put into the program, the accommodation of the needs of our group members and everything Andras did to make sure we got the most of our day! My sister left her good sunglasses at their home during lunch and he even deliver them to our hotel the next day! We can't wait to return to Budapest and connect with Andras for some more wonderful experiences...or to welcome him to the U.S.!

A splendid day with Andras. We were two couples from Bergen who spent a lovely day in Budapest with Andras. He is very knowledgeable and fun to be with. I will really recomend the chrismas tour with Andras it was something quite special. A personal guide who knows the city and the traditions was very instructive and fun, and the orgel concert was amazing. A fantastic day in a lovely city. Thanks we will contact you next time in Budapest.

Great Experience. My Wife and I spent a lovely day in Budapest with Mr. Balazs and his Trabant classical car. thanks for his well planed tour and the delicious lunch made by his mum. highly recommend, A+++

This is a must!. We were 2 couples from Norway having the best choice of sightseeing in Budapest with Andras & Co! We started with the fabulous Trabant-tour around Buda and Pest. Impressive knowledge and passionate guiding combined with the lovely Trabant cars really made this a memorable experience. After ca 3 hours we parked the cars and went for our Christmas tour by underground, bus and feet together with Andras. We visited the Christmas-marked and baked a traditional chimney cake, private organ concert,visited hidden places, historical monuments and much more. We also learned about the Hungarian Christmas traditions. Fantastic tour that we'll definitely recommend to everybody going to this beautiful city!

Wonderful way to discover Budapest. Our group of 13 took the Hungarian Soul tour with Andras prior to our Viking River Cruise. This tour was the best we had our entire trip. We met Andras downtown and walked to a local coffee shop for a historical review of Hungary. It was good, but inside the cafe were other groups that made hearing difficult. Next we boarded a small bus for a driving tour that included many stops that were not included in the Viking itinerary I previosuly provided Andras - some timely planning and customizing! We drove out of the city for lunch at his parent's house and were served a wonderful meal, along with some real conversation with his parents. Next we drove to a local meeting facility and were treated to a great performance of "gypsy" music by a group of professional musicians that are talented enough to perform anywhere. We ended with a visit to a "ruins" bar and a walk back to our hotel - a full day to be sure.My main complaint was the time we spent on the bus. If this tour included less "bus time", I would give it 5 stars for sure. Also, I would recommend you keep your group to 6 or 8. Without electronic headsets, it was sometimes hard for everyone to hear Andras.

My Personal Budapest lives up to its name. We started our first visit to Budapest with a private tour by Balázs. This was the best 6 hour overview we could ever imagine. Balázs, who is a native of this beautiful city, knows its heart and its history and personalized his tour to meet our interests. I could not imagine a better nor a more personable guide. The firm is very responsive to inquiries. In every regard, this was a first rate experience.

Balazs and his Trabant rocked!. Fantastic and unusual tour, definitely not your typical tourist event. Charming Balazs was so passionate and knowledgeable about Budapest, Trabant cars (all cars, really) he could answer all our questions. Great personalized tour of the city, then lunch at the house of Andras' parents (he's who we booked the tour through) and then a piano concert at the apartment of retired Hungarian piano master, Adam Fellegi. The whole day was well organized, educational and really special. Can't recommend this highly enough. We were able to have three people in the car since Balazs was able to act as driver and guide.

Balázs Ackermann is most knowledgable!. My husband and I had a great tour with Balázs....he picked us up in his beloved Trabant which made the tour so unique. We went around for three hours talking about the Hungarian history and anything else we choose to discuss. Balázs was eager to accommodate any whim, question or destination we desired. He was so adorable, I'd come visit Budapest just to do another one of his tours. He was also very helpful in helping us decide what to do with the rest of our rainy Sunday afternoon. Thank you so much Balázs...you left us with a wonderful memory of Budapest.

Memorable birthday trip. Can't recommend Balazs, our guide, highly enough. He made my birthday a memorable one. We booked the tour with the Trabant vintage car, which is a spotlight of the city. The tour was well planned with lots of cultural knowledge. We had lunch at Balazs's parents' home, and they got me a birthday cake! It was a lovely tour with personal touch. I'll tell that to all my friends who plan to visit Budapest in the future. Thanks Balazs!

Hidden treasures with Atilla. Husband, myself, daughter and partner spent a bright and lovely morning walking around some hidden treasures with Atilla. Saw some amazing things that we would of never just come across and he had organised special entry to places we would of never of entered. Finished in an old shopping mall with a fab book shop and super coffee shop. Wouldn't hesitate in recommending.

The BEST way to learn the most about Budapest.. András was our personal tour guide for our group of six (6). András took us on the Hidden Gems tour and it was wonderful! I've experienced the Free walking tours but with My Personal Budapest tours you're not fighting to hear the guide along with 20 + others. András grew up in Budapest and has a detailed knowledge of the history and culture. His English is extremely good and he is very patient, friendly and funny. We found it to be a unique and fulfilling tour and would highly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to experience Budapest in a more intimate way.

We had an amazing day on the hungarian soul tour. We booked this tour as party of 12 adults. We had an extremely enjoyable and busy day with our guide Andras. We started the day in a coffee shop and had an interesting and informative talk from a local historian which really helped us to understand the history of Hungary. We then toured the city in a comfortable mini bus and visited the main sites of interest. We then went to the home of Andras parents for a home lunch. They made us very welcome and we had a delicious home cooked meal.We then went to a concert hall and has a private concert which was surreal. Amazingly talented ensemble. We ended the day in a ruined pub in the old Jewish quarter. Overall a full day with lots of wonderful experiences.

Trabant Heaven. We enjoyed a fantastic day in the company of Balász in his Trabant where he showed us the sights of his wonderful city. The conversation, information and friendliness of this intelligent and passionate young man made the day our high point of an excellent first visit to Budapest. We were celebrities for the day in the Trabant with fellow tourists taking snapshots of the car making its unique noise whilst nipping through city traffic. After our tour we enjoyed an excellent meal in Balász's home with his parents who were so hospitable, friendly and interesting. If you intend visiting Budapest in the near future ensure you pencil in this incredible experience.

Wonderful day in Budapest.. We had a superb day in Budapest with Balász, who took us around the city in one of his classic Trabant automobiles. Balász is passionate about his cars. The Trabant is a remnant of the communist era, and was manufactured in East Germany needless to say, we got plenty of attention as we drove through the city streets. Balász is a knowledgeable tour guide, and quite personable. His English is wonderful. We visited several of the most important sites in Budapest, as well as some of the hidden gems, that we would never have known about otherwise. We also visted the town of Szentendre, which is quite quaint. For me, the best part of the day was having a typical Hungarian lunch in his parent's home. They were so gracious, and the meal was delicious. I would highly recommend the tour, and would call András and Balász again when I visit Budapest again.

Hungarian Soul Tour. Had a wonderful day with Andras, touring the city of Budapest including a wonderful lunch with his family in his home, a enjoyable concert by gypsy musicians, hidden gem areas and more. Would highly recommend.

Finding our Family History. We hired András to take us and my parents to Mor - my paternal Grandfather was from there and we knew virtually nothing about his life growing up. We had no expectation (I mean, how much can you find when you start with nothing?), but András went out of his way to help us, making contacts and doing research, and we were blown away. In the end we found Grandpa's original birth certificate, family home, and school. A local even did some research into our family name and built a family tree for us! It was a truly incredible experience and once that myself and my parents will never forget. András passion for his country and helping others learn more about Hungary is obvious (and contagious). Highly recommend!

Hidden Gems ... personal, interesting and unique. Our day with Attila started with a pickup at our hotel in a Soviet era (1980's) car. This may seem like an odd and uncomfortable choice (well, it was) but for two American's, quite a cool experience. With no power steering and frequent re-starts, Attila made it look easy driving around the city. We were really fortunate to have a sunny day, so were able to make use of the newly added sunroof :) Attila was really pleasant and ensured we had a great time. There is so much history in Budapest, it's impossible to get bored hearing about their rich past. We hit a number of major spots and of course the "hidden" ones as well, with our last stop being the most unique. Overall a really interesting day with a local and avoiding all the mass groups from the river cruises.

Decidedly good tour. We spent a very enjoyable day with Attila. He picked us up at our hotel right on time. We tried our hand at throwing a pot at an artist studio and explored the little town nearby. Continued onto the wine region and had a most enjoyable lunch in a wonderfully quaint setting. Might be our best meal on the trip.

Intimate, interesting and indelible!. Androsz and Balasz delivered such personal experiences in Budapest. We can all find the highlights ourselves via the internet but what makes travel truly memorable is a window into the culture, its people and the history that shapes its society. Our first day was spent in memorable little Trabant cars, a throwback to East German engineering. This would merely be silly except for the fact of the loving attention given these classic "peoples' cars of communism" by young Balasz. These cars generate so much local goodwill and nostalgia, Balasz is so knowledgeable about them, and we got the added bonus of his Dad as additional driver and window into local society. They provided lovely guidance into out-of-the-way corners of local woods, street foods and Estergom's beautiful cathedral and overlook. That was great fun! Andras then showed us his own Budapest. We got the "Soul" of his city first with a concise exposition of Hungarian history and then a peek into some more contemporary events like the failed revolution against the Russians. We also got a taste of quirky Art Nouveau architecture and things like an old casino now housing a very modern cafe. Top of the list, though, was the intimate meal with Andras' parents! That will NOT happen on the big bus tours, obviously. A real family, a real traditional meal, real local plum brandy! What's not to like? This is a five star experience delivered by five star guides. Really worth EVERY forint we spent. Thanks A LOT, Andras, we loved every minute and thirsted for more!Mariette, Stephen, Lynnette and Han

Absolutely the highlight of our trip!. We chose the trabant tour combined with Hidden Gems. Our guide, Balazs... pronounced like Booolash :-) was absolutely brilliant. So knowledgeable, so enthusiastic and passionate about the city and his beloved trabant. Truly not to be missed. We took the tour on our first day and spent from 9am until 3pm with him, fantastic way to see the city and really get a feel for places you wanted to visit again with more time. Lots of more unique places and tons of history. The car was brilliant and so many other tourists were keen to take photos every time we stopped! Cannot fault the trip or Balazs in any way at all, don't hesitate to book this!

Hungarian Soul Tour. This is a tour not to be missed. A glimpse into Hungary historically and a view of the popular and not so well know sites as well. A traditional Hungarian meal in a lovely home hosted by a delightful couple was certainly a highlight of the day. Andras was a very charming and informative guide. A day well spent!

Wonderful tour company!. Very good tour! Atilla speaks very good English. There were 8 of is in the group. The bus was comfortable and very safely driven. We went to lunch at a private home which was excellent, then went on to a private piano recital by a professional pianist. A wonderful day with lots of information. Highly recommend this tour company.

Budapest Soul Tour - What a wonderful experience. There are a number of reasons that my wife and I believe the Budapest Soul Tour was one of the best ever. 1. The history presentation from Hungary's beginning to present day. 2. An interesting minivan tour to excellent sites. 3. A wonderful lunch in a Hungarian family home. 4. A private Gypsy music concert. 5. An excellent walking tour to see many "Hidden Treasures" of Pest. We have had great experiences with private guides in Scotland, Egypt, China, Russia, Finland and Mexico. We believe the Budapest Soul Tour to be one of the best tours we have ever enjoyed. We would suggest this tour for anyone that wants to learn the soul of Budapest.

Only way to see Budapest. We did a night tour with Balazs who did a fantastic job. His car is quite the attention grabber about town and he is proud of it. The weather was not ideal but we were kept comfortable. The city lights were great. Go see Budapest at night when the crowds are gone.

Budapest. Out of a 21 day vacation through Central Europe our 2 days days with Atilla our private guide, utilizing his vast intimate knowledge of Budapest, we were able to visit not only the popular sites but also the lesser known places. His ability to accommodate my wife's request for a special venue, beyond her fondest expectations, was totally a 10.0!!Of all the tours (15 ) from Prague to Amsterdam, many of which were superb, "My Personal Budapest" was the best.

My Personal Budapest Tours was THE BEST. We started our 16 day tour of Central Europe in one of the most beautiful cities in all of Europe. The city itself, along the Danube is just wonderful. It is worthy of the time and effort to visit this city, one of the greatest ones in Europe. We have been to Paris, Madrid, Lisbon, Rome, Lucerne, Vienna, Venice, Malaga, Granada and Milan among others. It ranks right up there with the best. However, for us the highlight was to be able to photograph it at night. In looking for a tour that would accomplish this I corresponded with a guy named Balazs for some time and he assured me that he would do everything possible to make the tour exactly what we wanted. My partner is quite good at night time photography. Originally I had planned for us to just spend one day in Budapest, coming by boat from Vienna. But he had read, and rightly so that Budapest is the most beautiful city in Europe to photograph at night. So Balazs, our guide picked us up in his Trabant, an East German car. He is very proud of his unusual automobile, which incidentally he restored himself. Anyway, I get side tracked. He met us at the Iberostar Hotel at 7pm (He was actually a little early) and the first stop was Vajdahunyad Castle and Hosoktere or as we would say "Heroes Square". He thought it important that we see this important landmark, even though it wasn’t yet quite dark. From there we ventured to the Parliament Building, among the most beautiful found anywhere, up to the Matyas Church, to another hill to capture the whole of the cityscape and finally to St. Stephen’s Basilica. Along the way he pointed out the Opera House, the Secret Police Museum, the Chain Bridge, etc. He loves his country and gave us an interesting perspective on the changes that have taken place since the fall of communism in his country. He is an enterprising young man with big dreams, a wonderful personality and a love for his country and city. This tour was truly the highlight of our time in Budapest, but it was not the only highlight as we enjoyed the people, the food, the spa and the monuments, especially the Shoe Monument along the river very much. We didn’t know much about Budapest before going except that it was very beautiful. It is that, but it is so much more. We enjoyed our time there very much and would encourage others to journey to see it as well! If you do though, make sure you hook up a tour with Balazs at My Personal Budapest Tours!!!!

Budapest Soul. we went on several private tours on our trip to Prague, Vienna and Budapest. This was the best ! We loved having a typical Hungarian lunch with Andras's parents and the Gypsy Ensemble was excellent as well. It wasn't your typical site seeing tour. We would highly recommend this tour

One of the most unique touring experiences ever!!. My wife and I were very happy with this tour. Balazs was our host/driver and was very knowledgeable about the city and surrounding areas. Touring the city in the old Trabant made for a unique and fun experience. Balazs easily adjusted our tour plans the morning of pickup to exclude places we had toured earlier in the week. This flexibility made the most of our time to tour other cool places. The Hungarian lunch option was absolutely amazing! We met Balazs' parents Janos and Maria who welcomed us to their home and served us an excellent meal with great beverages. We shared a lot of laughs with them. We thought the lunch experience would be too awkward but after meeting the parents it was totally relaxing and one of the better parts of the day. Janos even treated us to a sip of some fine Hungarian fruit liquor - very nice! As a bonus, Balazs drove us back to the city in a different vintage car, an old 50's Opel. What a blast! Balazs is a truly talented and personable young man who has great love and passion for old automobiles (even fixing them!). I give the tour experience an A+++. I still want to have dinner and breakfast at Janos and Maria's house!!

Amazing experience, great guide. We enjoyed everything about our day with Balazs and would highly recommend booking a day with My Personal Budapest to anyone interested in learning about the major sites and the wonderful people of the city. Our day consisted of Trabant tour, the Places Left out of the Guide Books tour, and Lunch with a Local Family. It was truly an amazing day and the highlight for was getting to know Balazs, his parents, and Adras over lunch. If you do anything, book the lunch! It sounds a little weird to go to someone's house you have never met, but you will feel like an old friend within a few minutes. The food was great and the conversation was better....we were able to ask about life under the communist system from someone who lived it, learn about the changes that came with the fall of communism, and here from the 20 something kids about life today. The personal stories from locals are so much better than the stories in a guide book!

Wonderful Budapest with Attila!!!. The 3 of us fell in love with Budapest thanks to Attila. He was friendly & knowledgable and so much fun to be with. The 1st day he showed us Hidden Budapest for 4 hours (wonderful!), & then took us on a full day tour the 2nd day outside to Szentendre, the artist colony, & introduced us to the incredible MicroArt Museum. Then we were off to Esztergom & King Stephen's Basilica. Wow---we want to go back & spend more time with Attila! One of our best tour guides ever.

Introduction to Budapest - sightseeing . A group of friends from Norway wanted a good start on our 4-day Budapest miniholiday - a general overview that we could build on. Andras was a very friendly and knowledgeable guide who gave us a just perfect blend of history, Budapest today and interesting/ relevant places - partly by "walking and talking". In very good English. We actually did the 3 hours sightseeing en rute from the airport to the hotel. Convenient. Perfect. Big thanks to Andras!

Very nice way to be transported. Instead of taking a taxi or an ordinary bus from the airport to our hotel, we chose to combine the transport with sightseeing. That was a very good choice. We were 8 friends from Norway visiting Budapest for the first time. Our guide András took us on a very personal 3 hours guided tour from the airport, and we had a lovely trip with information, history and advices until we finally were transported to the hotel. His english is excellent, and we were all very satisfied and grateful that we chose this tour.

Couldn't think of a Better Way to see Budapest!. Had an absolutely wonderful time touring Budapest and its environs with Balazs of My Personal Budapest Tours. The first day was in a vintage communist car called a Trabant and it was great driving around the city while attracting the attention of many locals who remember having those cars. The tour to all the city attractions was very informative, personalized, and Balazs was terrific. He is extremely knowledgeable, professional and caters to whatever you would like to see---in other words, he is very flexible and tries to make every tour a little bit different by gearing it to what his clients tastes are. The city tour was followed by lunch at his home with his lovely mother doing the cooking. It was fantastic!!! His mother is a great cook---several different types of h'ors d'ouevres accompanied by wine, beer and some Hungarian liquor was how lunch was started. This was followed by a most delicious tomato soup and baked chicken with potatoes and vegetables. The meal ended with a layer cake that looked wonderful but I was too full at that point to continue eating. After lunch, we resumed our tour with the hidden gems of Budapest which included some ruin bars, interesting neighborhoods and a bit of shopping. This tour was well paced and very enjoyable. I would highly recommend it. Day two with Balazs was out into the countryside in another vintage car to the Danube Bend and the town of Szentendre. Beautiful scenery and the artists' town of Szentendre is very interesting and full of charm. He then brought us back to our hotel to drop off packages (from shopping we had done) and dropped us off at the wine festival near the Palace (which was incredible with over 200 vintners). He didn't have to do this as the tour had concluded but he is just such a kind, wonderful person who wants all his clients to enjoy the most they can in his wonderful city. Balazs has a lot of passion for both his city and his business. I don't think you could ever go wrong hiring him as a guide in Budapest. We really enjoyed Budapest and our time spent with Balazs was one of the reasons why. Book with him or Andros---you won't be sorry.

Great way to see Budapest!. All of the reviews are right! This is a great way to see Budapest. The Trabant is a fun car and Andras and Balazs are delightful and very knowledgeable about their city. We also had a delicious lunch at Balazs' home. They certainly live up to their name: My Personal Budapest.

Do not wait .. Book now!. We've had two tours, one with Andras and one with Balazs L. Simply our best days in Budapest.We did the hidden treasure tour with Balazs L. He took us on a walking tour to various places and told us many little stories of these places. We particularly like the ruin bar (and there was the freak market going in that day when we visited), Jewish ghetto wall, and the morning coffee break at the local cake shop, tasting some beautiful traditional Jewish cakes.He has also taken us to some secret hidden spots like the cafe inside the book shop and the roof top bar with 360 city view. Before he left us for the day, he also helped us plan and showed us many other places to visit on the map. We have enjoyed the few hours we spent with Balazs L.The next day we were supposed to do the Danube Bend with Andras. He emailed us a few days earlier saying the weather forecast might be bad so he suggested to stay in Budapest. After a few emails, we decided to push our tour a few days later. I think it's the best decision we have made. The three towns Szentendre, Esztergom and Visagrad are beautiful in their own ways. The most enjoyable would have to be the ceramic workshop with Gabriella. She is friendly, personable and really patience with us making a mess of the clay. We did not want to leave her workshop.But the most special has to be Andras' secret spot. We promised him not to mention as it won't be a secret anymore. But what we could say is that this spot would not exist if the river level is high! When we were there, it was exceptionally low. So we were very lucky to share the experience with Andras.I could not recommend any higher My Personal Budapest to anyone visiting Budapest. You will not regret it.

Great day in Budapest?. Really enjoyed this tour! My boyfriend and I booked this tour extremely last minute and they were very accommodating for us. Our tour guide, Andres, was very knowledgable about Budapest and we really enjoyed all of our conversations with him. We did the hidden treasures and winery tour with him. The hidden treasures portion of the tour was a nice way to see parts of the city other tours would miss. The winery portion was also very nice, but it takes more than an hour round trip to get to the winery. It was a nice way to see outside of the main city area and we enjoyed our time (and the wine) there. I definitely recommend this tour! Thank you Andres for a great day!

My Personal Budapest Tours. After reading the reviews I wrote this company requesting information, I heard back immediately and decided to take a chance, I booked 2 days of personal tours. Our guide Balasz picked us up at our hotel and took wonderful care of us. We are unable to do much walking and he adapted the days to our needs. We loved our lunch at our guides home, prepared by his parents! It was delicious! One little point, the Trabant car is small and a bit hard to get in and out of, and no air con, but then driving around in it was also a lot of fun. Just a warning for larger folks or those with limited mobility.

Cool new way to see the sights of the city. The Trabant tour was pretty cool way to see the sights. Not to mention Balazs ( the name was a tongue twister for us ;) was a friendly, pleasant and informative guy to have as our guide for the day. He obviously loves the car, with 6 in his family! Loves Budapest with all his knowledge and his family pitching in for tours, he gave us an insight into everything Hungarian.Even though Andrassy Avenue was closed off the day we visited Balazs made sure we didn't feel as if we missed too much. We soaked in all the sights including the hidden ones like the Simpla pub, the cool cafe and the Central market. It was a day well spent and we would highly recomend it.Balazs is a really lovely person and after awhile it was more like taking a tour with a friend.

Make the Most of Your Time in Budapest. Because we often have limited time in unfamiliar destinations, we’ve learned the value of working with a great local guide. Online planning can give you an idea of the sites you’d like to see, the restaurants you’d like to visit, or the things you’d like to do. But a local guide will have a much better grasp of when those sites are open and how to skip the lines, which restaurants cater to locals, and how to transform your plan into an efficient, leisurely itinerary. Clyde and I knew we wanted to see the standard sites, but how do these fit together? What’s the best order to see them in, based on their opening and closing times? Is there a time of day when these will be less crowded with river cruise tourists? And how do you get from A to B?To get answers to these questions — and to make the most of our limited time in the city — we contacted Andras of MyPersonalBudapest.com. While he was already booked up for the day, he connected us with his associate: a smart, knowledgable young man named Balazs. (Say “Buh-lawsh.”)Balazs meets us at our hotel (swooping in on his motorbike) and joins his friend, Peter, who brings along his Communist-era Trabant car. After admiring the tiny two-stroke engine and a hot wired air-conditioner that would make any hacker proud, we drive off to see the sights.Balazs and Peter’s tour takes us through all the right neighborhoods, with stops for photos and walks and excursions at all the right places: the Chain Bridge, Castle Hill, the Matthias Church, the Fisherman’s Bastion, the zoo. Along the way, we notice how Peter’s Trabant delights everyone we drive past, from locals (who still feel a nostalgia for the cars) to tourists (who have never seen anything quite like it). Peter’s car makes everybody smile — including us. At lunch, Peter drops us off in the Jewish Quarter, but Balazs stays with us, taking us to a Sunday market in Budapest’s best-known ruin bar, a tasty lunch at Karavan (a block of food stalls), a stroll by the Tree of Life at the Dohany Street Synagogue, a walk through Heroes’ Square, a visit to a controversial monument (with a magical fountain), a photo op outside Parliament, and a tour through St. Stephen’s Basilica. It’s a fact: Balazs makes every minute of our day better. He’s smart. He’s flexible. He has a dry sense of humor. He’s easy to be with, so you feel less like you’re on a tour and more like you’re just hanging out with a local friend. He knows Budapest in the way only locals can know it.Could we see all these sights on our own? Of course. But we couldn’t see them as efficiently as we see them with Balazs, who gets us from A to B as smoothly as possible. He also gave us tips on how to organize our next day — confirming my choice of the Rudas Baths as the best way to Budapest’s bath culture and reserving a scenic sunset cruise on the Danube for us.Balazs also has a gift for mixing conversation with quick, natural little stories about the history of each place. Instead of lecturing, he brings up significant dates and important facts in a relaxed and casual way. He also shares his personal history: his memories of the Communist period, his family’s life in Budapest, and what it’s like to live in Budapest every day with his wife and two kids.So we see Budapest — and we also see Balazs’ Budapest, through his eyes. And that’s something you can’t get from any crowded river cruise bus tour or any guide book. Put this personalized tour first on your list of things to do, and you’ll feel right at home in Budapest for the rest of your trip.

Lovely day visiting the Budapest Country. My husband and I spent a lovely day last month touring the Budapest countryside with Andras Novac. We took his tour of the Danube Bend and loved our time in Szentendre, Visegrád and Esztergom. We especially enjoyed our visit to the ceramic studio while in Szentendre where we actually had a chance to try our hands at it. Andras was a great tour guide and we would recommend him to anyone looking to tour Budapest.

Exceeded Expectations!. My sisters and I go on a “sister trip” each year and this year we selected Budapest for several days. We always like to experience the local life and culture everywhere we go so in Budapest we selected Andreas to take us outside the city for a day. It was an unforgettable experience. From a short drive through the beautiful country side; a leisurely walk thought the old town of Szentendre; visiting a local artist and trying out the pottery wheel; and finally a stop at a local winery which included a tour of the vineyard/wine cellar and a light lunch with wine tasting. The owners also shared their amazing story of how they established themselves in Hungary. Andreas was a wealth of information and adjusted the pace and tour to our needs. We highly recommend his services, you will not regret it!Anja, Diana, and Tessa from Holland

Trabant tour with Balazs around Budapest.. Balazs our tour guide was a refreshing and energetic young man. His Trabant car was his pride and joy. I am no car buff but even I did not escape his enthusiasm for this car. As we were driving around Budapest people were taking photographs of us and admiring this small car zip through the traffic. Balazs is proud of his Hungarian heritage and enjoyed taking us around the city. We saw some beautiful places but he is only too happy to take you where you want to go.We had the great pleasure of having lunch with Balazs at his parents house we had a lovely home cooked meal made by his mum. It was a meal " made lWith Love. It was lovely meeting his family.This trip has given me a hunger to return to Budapest. I highly recommend this tour.

Enjoyable Budapest. Andras made our trip to Budapest very informative and enjoyable. He is very personable and knowledgeable. We really felt we experienced the best of Budapest while getting to know the history of this wonderful city. We highly recommend his services.

Very Enjoyable and Informative. Andras made our introduction to Budapest very enjoyable and informative. He is a wealth of knowledge and really enjoys his work. My wife and other couple felt that the tour to a rural vineyard was one of the best. We appreciated the personalized service. we will recommend Andras to our friends.

Trabant tour. Had a fantastic tour of Budapest by Trabant with Atilla. A really pleasant and well informed guide for whom nothing was too much trouble. He clearly loves his job and his city but most important makes it all so effortless because he is so personable and friendly. In a Trabant you see the attractions and are the attraction. Much more fun than going in a posh western car - we can do that any day of the week.

Wonderful two days with Andras. Our group of six people took two all day tours with Andras(Andy) from My Personal Budapest..Both days we were picked up at 9:00AM, one we walked or took public transportation, the other in a van. First day we combined the Hidden Treasures and the Culinary Tours. We really enjoyed walking through this beautiful city, seeing the beautiful architecture and learning history about the different neighborhoods, something you would not see on the typical bus tours. During our walk we stopped at a coffee house. For lunch we stopped at a restaurant where Andy ordered six different dishes that all of us were able to share. After more touring we stopped at another restaurant for dessert of many delicious tasting strudel dishes. The next day we took the van on the Danube Bend Tour. Our first stop was the beautiful town of Szentendre were we walked and saw this quaint little town, saw several different sights including the church and Miniature museum, and again stopped for a quick drink and food in a coffee house. Because the rain prevented us from Andy's Plan A, we switched to Plan B and went to Esztergom to visit the cathedral after we had lunch. Prior to our visit inside the church we went over the border into Slavakia for a panoramic view of the basilica. Since Andy is a native of Budapest his knowledge of the city and countryside was so informative, that we learned quite a bit. He is friendly and personable and we all felt "at home" with him. Thank you for an experience we all enjoyed and will remember.

Very Fun Day!!. This was a very unique and fun way to see Budapest. Balazs is a great tour guide--very passionate about Budapest and the Trabant. We wanted to do the Trabant tour, Hidden Gems and lunch in a private home. Balazs had a conflict so created a modified version where we got the highlights of all 3. The lunch with his parents was a highlight of our trip. Balazs has a way of connecting with people so you really felt that you met a knew friend by the end of the trip.

excellent experience. Excellent tour, enjoyed the visit to the Hungarian home for lunch and the trip in the Trabants. Balázs and Yanosh were a joy to hang with for the day. Only recommendation would be to have more time walking through Budapest as well or couple this tour with a walking tour as we did not make any stops to tour central Pest or the Castle district on the Buda side (both of which we did on our own but a guide would likely have made it more enlightening). Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Budapest.

Tribant tour with Attila. Our first tour of Budapest was a general sightseeing tour with Attila. He rented a Tribant convertible with driver (the Tribant is from the communist period) for the tour and it was great fun driving around Budapest in the Tribant. We were like stars waving at everybody. The tour itself was quite informative and very good overview of Budapest.

Best Tour Ever!. My mother and I took three to us with Balazs Ackerman in one day: the Trabant tour, Hidden Gems tour, and lunch in a private home. The day was perfect. Balazs arrived at our hotel at least 1/2 an hour early; therefore, when we went down to the lobby we did not have to wait at all for his arrival. He was very enthusiastic and had well spoken English. The tour was customized to our wishes. Budapest is a wonderful place to explore, but I would have to say our favorite part of the day was the time we spent having lunch in a private home. The house was immaculately clean. The host and hostess were very warm and friendly. The food was all made from scratch and so delicious! My mother is very picky and this was not a problem. I just emailed ahead and explained the only types of meat she will eat. We just recently returned to home and my mother tells everyone how wonderful her day with Balazs.

Great private tour. First full day in Europe, so it was great to have someone push us a little as we adjusted to the time change. Attila was a great host. We did the Trabant tour, hidden gems and a private lunch outside the city. All day tour was worth the price and showed us where we wanted to concentrate the rest of our time in beautiful Budapest.

A fantastic day with a wonderful guide. We booked the trabant tour, home lunch and hidden gems tour. Balazs was fantastic and made us all so welcome, including our 5 year old. The car makes the travelling even more special as it attracts attention as you're driving around.We took the tour on our first full day in Budapest and it gave us a great mix of the top sites and places that we would never have found on our own. Balazs was very informative and is obviously very proud of his wonderful city. We had chatted about the education system and compared it with our daughter's and Balazs even took us past his old school and pointed it out - helping to really make her part of the day and involved.If you are at all nervous about the home lunch then don't be. You don't feel like an intruder but are welcomed as friends. The welcome from Balazs' parents is so very warm, the food fantastic and taking a drive out of the centre of the city is really interesting. They had even kindly prepared a child-friendly back up meal in case the more traditional food wasn't so appealing to our daughter.After Budapest we were visiting other parts of Hungary and Balazs gave us hints and tips on places to go.I cannot recommend these tours highly enough and they will be the first recommendation that I make to anyone I know that is planning a visit to Budapest.

Travelling solo? Jump in Trabant!!. A combination of the Trabant tour and Hidden treasures was a great way to get to know Budapest. My guide was Balázs, and he was amazing. While he drove my around the city with his Trabant, we discussed the Hungarian history, economy, and education systems. We were on the road for almost six hours and I felt like I was in Budapest with my local good friend. He shared funny and interesting stories with me, and offered excellent ideas for future Budapest visits as well. Private tour is a wonderful idea to anybody - and for a 50+ lady, traveling alone and willing to get to know the city very well in a short time, it is absolutely great!

Excellent Custom and Private Budapest Tours. Attila helped my mom and I create a perfect itinerary for our stay in Budapest! Attila was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable of the area. We did the Hidden Gems and, also, the traditional city tour in their famed Trabant. Attila went out of his way to accommodate our needs. We recommend this private tour!

One of the highlights of our 6 week tour in Europe. We met with Balàzs in the morning and our day was simple perfect. The ride in his awesome little Trabant, the places he took us and the family lunch where a great experience. Me and my friend Nelly felt very blessed to get to know him and to see a little bit more of the real Hungary through him and his family. Thank you Balàzs! You know now you have friends to visit in Costa Rica!

Andras is the best!. We took the day-long tour with My Personal Budapest's Andras. It really was a personal experience. He showed up in the famous Trabant and we toured all the big sites, with all the history and stories we could absorb. He has great English and is easy-going. Then, the highlight of the tour was a lunch with his parents in their home. They were so gracious and we had a nice long conversation. In the afternoon, we went on his "Hidden Gems" tour and it was fantastic. We saw so many places out of the way for tourists and we could tell he felt at home in all of them. We stopped for breaks and enjoyed the coffee houses. Andras was so patient to answer all my questions. He is the best.

Have Andras show you around his city!. It wasn't till after our first two days in Budapest on our own, that I looked up MyPersonalBudapest for private guided tours. Next time we come here (and we'll definitely be back) calling up Andras will be the first thing we do. I sent an email inquiry about the tours we were interested in, and the time we had remaining for our stay. He replied saying that as we had already visited a lot of the nearby sights that are a must for any visitor, he suggested that we take the Hidden Gems tour for one of our excursions.Andras promptly met us a the scheduled time, and off we went on our walking tour. We walked, and used the tram and subway to visit many interesting and intriguing sites: a beautiful secluded park; a cafe decorated with actual furnishings from the Communist period; another elegant and ornate cafe that served as a hangout and meet up spot for writers and poets years ago; a hotel's rooftop terrace with SPECTACULAR 360 degree views of the city; Liberty Square where you can find an American President strolling up to meet you; an art nouveau building with intriguing decor inside and out; a little known spot with the last surviving portion of the wall around what was the Jewish Ghetto from WW2; and a final stop at one of the famed 'ruin pubs'. Our second day, to a winery in nearby Etyek, was equally fun. Andras picked us up in his car for a 30 minute drive outside the city. We were met by the owner of a family run vineyard in the countryside. It was a perfect day, sunny and picturesque. Inside a contemporary tasting room, we gazed out at the vines, while sampling 5 wines and enjoying cold lunch platters of meats, cheeses, tomatoes and bread. The owner shared how his winery started, the joys and challenges of the business, showed us his wine press, and cellar where barrels of wine were aging. All along the way to these various sites, Andras provided a wealth of information and fun facts. As your tour progresses (and it won't take long), you'll feel more and more like you're with a friend, not just a guide. Andras has a very easy going personality, and a great sense of humor. His knowledge of Hungarian history is evident as he describes the sights, and relates the various political events and circumstances in his commentary. One thing you will definitely be aware of is his pride in, and love for, his city. Let him share that with you, you will be pleased.

Amazing Experience. We found this company on tripadvisor and thought it looked good, but it truly exceeded our expectations. We did the Trabant tour, combined with the Hungarian lunch and the hidden gems of Budapest. Balázs, our tour guide was wonderful. He was knowledgable, and a true pleasure to spend the day with. We drove in his own, impeccable Trabant and were celebrities! People took pictures of us everywhere we went. The highlight was certainly the lunch. Balázs Took us to his parents' home and they were so welcoming and kind. The lunch itself was the best food we had our entire European vacation! Fenom. Mary is an amazing chef and wonderful hostess. It was an honour to be welcomed into their home. I highly recommend this tour to anyone and everyone who visits Budapest.

BEST Tour of our entire European trip!. I concur with each of the reviews that have been already posted. I can not say enough good things about Balacs & this tour. DO NOT MISS IT.It is everything you would expect from a tour and more. It absolutely was a PERSONAL tour. The trabant is way fun and we want to DO IT AGAIN!!I am hungarian & my husband and daughter had not yet been to Budapest. Balacs makes me proud to be Hungarian! He even helped me find my mothers apartment & the park that I played in from a photo,which I did not think would be possible.Please BOOK this tour.

Highlight of our time in Budapest. My husband and I had a wonderful day with Balazs, touring all over the city in his very comfortable vintage automobile, which drew lots of attention wherever we went. His parents were lovely hosts and made us a delicious homemade lunch. We would highly recommend this tour.

Customized, personalized tour couldn't be beat. We did a combo of the Trabant and Hidden Gems tour. It provided a wonderful overview of Budapest while also taking us to spots we'd have otherwise missed or been lucky to stumble on to on our own. Balazs was our driver and guide, he was knowledgeable, friendly and obviously enjoyed sharing his city and wonderfully maintained Trabant.

Trabant is a great tour!. My family of 4 took the 3 hour Trabant tour with Balazs (bel-aj) and his father. We had to take 2 cars since there were 4 of us. My husband was interested in the history of the Trabants and they were a unique and fun way to see the city, garnering many stares and smiles from passerbys.We stopped at a traditional Hungarian coffee shop and enjoyed a drink with Balazs and his father who continued to educate us on Hungarian history. They were both very well versed in the historical aspect of the city and country and pointed out many points of interest to us.The only negative was the radio system between the 2 cars was not working so well. Balazs narrated between the 2 cars and we couldn't hear him well in the second car. He did say they were planning to upgrade the system.

A great way to get acquainted with the city is the "hidden treasures of Budapest tour". Andras is a wonderful resource. He will not only show you the hidden treasures of Budapest, he will give you information to guide you thru the rest of your visit.

Amazing tour of Budapest. I booked this tour on the recommendation of friends. We were visiting Budapest with my 81 year old mother for my daughter's graduation from dental school. The tour was perfect. Andras, our guide met us outside of our hotel to begin our day. We drove to the major sites with wonderful commentary and information on the way and my mother was able to walk around the locations without problems. There were many opportunities for photos and further information as we walked through each site. We then drove to his family home for an authentic Hungarian lunch with his parents. We were warmly welcomed and enjoyed a delicious hungarian meal. After lunch, we were driven back to our hotel location. We highly recommend "My Personal Budapest Tour" with Andras.

Trabant Tour with Balazs!. My husband I booked the Trabant Tour with My Personal Budapest. We were not disappointed! Balazs is a an extremely knowledgeable young man, licensed as a guide in Budapest. He is also owner and extremely capable driver of several East German-made 2 stroke engine Trabants. The authentic simplicity of the transportation enhanced our tour of Budapest. We highly recommend My Personal Budapests Trabant Tour with Balazs.

Teenagers and Trabants, the perfect tour. Balazs and his father were waiting outside our apartment with the two Trabants to begin our tour, which starts with the engines, literally! What a unique experience to see the sites from these heritage cars. We were given thumbs up and photographed along the way, probably just as often as we shot pictures as tourists. We were grandparents traveling with our two teenage grandsons, ages 14 and 15. The Hungarians love these cars, but no one as much as our young enthusiastic guide: Balazs. We did the Trabant tour and Hidden Treasures with him as well as lunch at his parents home. It was a privilege to leave the city for the 'suburbs' and see how the locals really live. We felt warmly welcomed and enjoyed the lunch. Balazs is a licensed guide and knows Budapest well.

Best tour you can do in Budapest. My husband and I booked to do a full day with 'my personal Budapest' and we were not disappointed. We were driven around the key sites in the morning in Bollange's Trabant then went to his family home for lunch followed by going out in his other vintage car (an Opel) in the afternoon for the hidden treasures tour. Bollange was a fantastic guide, despite it being almost 35 degrees he managed to make the tour really fascinating and personal to what we were interested in. It was really good to be able to speak to him 121 about Hungarian history, culture and also hear first hand how Hungarians feel about communism and their more recent history. The meal at his home was really tasty and his mother and father were very welcoming. I would definitely recommend doing this if you have any interest in history, culture, hidden gems or vintage cars. A great day out and well worth the money.

Really hidden treasures tour. Lot of hungarians know well about Budapest historical background, but only few of us know special details about this magical city. That's why I was amazed when András showed me some really hidden, interesting places. One of my favourite moment was to see the remainder of ghetto wall from the Second World War. Never been this memorable place before. I couldn't imagine what happened exactly in the ghetto in those times. Andras helped us to remember when he read some quotes from an old article. Anyway... was searching for me. Got stuck in the moment for a while. That was only one moment from a Hidden Treasures Tour selections in Budapest. András's guiding is impressive, interactive, he knows a lot about memorable places, history. Absolutely recommend!
Hidden Treasures of Budapest/Szentendre. Attila was very knowledgeable and a pleasure to be with. We saw interesting and unusual places. I would highly recommend.

Best tour of our trip! Thank you Balázs!. I was in Budapest (and then traveled on to Bratislava and Vienna) with 4 friends for my 50th birthday celebration, and we chose the Trabant tour and private home lunch from My Personal Budapest. Andres confirmed everything via e-mail (and suggested some other things we would also enjoy) -- very easy.This tour was definitely one of the highlights of our entire trip! Balázs was our guide, and he and his father drove the 2 Trabants that took us around Budapest. We had a wonderful morning seeing the sites and we learned a great deal about this beautiful city. Everywhere we went, people would point and admire the cars, and even stop to take pictures with them. The Hungarians love their Trabants!The visit to the private home for lunch was awesome -- Andres' parents are very sweet and welcoming, and the food was truly incredible. The entire group talked about this special lunch for days afterward.We all loved every moment of this unique tour. I have no hesitation recommending this company. I only wish we could have stayed longer in Budapest to take a few more of their tours.

Excellent Trabant tour in Budapest. We were 9 adults on a private tour with 3 Trabant cars. As we were picked up at our hotel the fun started straight away. 3 Trabants waited for us, and so many people stopped and took pictures. The cars are just excellent, we were having so much fun, laughing and taking pictures of each other and The highlights of Budapest. We were the attraction and people were taken more pictures of us (the cars) than we were taking of the attractions. Highly recommended.

Trabant tour of Budapest. Our driver, Balazs arrived promptly at our hotel at the appointed hour. Since there were 5 of us his father was with him to drive one of the two Trabants. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable about the history of Hungary. We started at Heroes Square with a lecture about monument and points of interest surrounding the area. From monuments to churches to coffee houses we were thoroughly delighted. We enjoyed driving through the city in the cars, with people taking our picture and waving as we went by. After touring both Pest and Buda we were off for lunch at a "locals" home. We were warmly greeted by the couple at their home and made to feel as if we were eating at our own home. The table was beautifully set and the food was magnificent - as was the wine! Thanks so much for a fun day and great overview of Budapest!

Trabant tour. A highlight of our recent trip to Budapest was the private Trabant tour. Balazs was an awesome guide/driver with an excellent knowledge of local sites and history. We had a group of 5 with two cars (Balazs' father drove the second car). A great and personal way to see the city. The tour ended with an authentic Hungarian lunch in the home of Andras' parents. They and the food and wine were delightful. Would definitely recommend this and would do it again!

Great Morning with Attila. Attila met us at our hotel to start our hidden treasures tour. We saw amazing sights that are not on any tour schedule. The wall to the original ghetto that is still standing from WWII, a "ruin pub" that is so unique and amazing, but I am not sure we could find it again, that I would love to go for drinks and music. We also saw a very interesting Secret Gallery with works of art I have never imagined possible. Attila told us stories of different times in the history of Budapest and Hungary, that no one has told us before. We ended near our hotel at a beautiful care for coffee and more tales of Budapest. A great tour and a great way to spend a morning. You will see sites not on any tour guides list!!

Danube Bend with Andras. This was the best day I had in the Budapest area. Andras was very informative, comfortable to be with, and attentive to our wishes. We loved Szentendre, so he allowed us to stay and shop longer. The marzipan museum was unbelievable. We were lucky to see the world renown artist at work there. We also enjoyed a youth choir rehearsing at the Church in Ezstergom. Our lunch was one of the best we've had during our week long stay. We opted to take the boat back to Budapest and Andras purchased the ticket and got us on the boat. Finally, he gave us a lot of great tips on places to go and eat the remainder of out trip. This is well worth your time and money.

A Great Concept. We arrived a day early in Budapest before taking a river cruise...The cruise program included a day of major highlights (Palace, Hero's Square, etc.) so we wanted to see the real city and people who live in it. This tour ("Hidden Treasures of Budapest") was perfect and Attila was a great guide...Highly recommend--This is "getting local flavor" at its best.

Experience Budapest with Balazs and his Trabant. We spent our first full day in Budapest with Balazs. He met us at our hotel and started showing us the Hidden Treasures. We found a beautiful park not too far from our hotel (we found it again on our own two days later) in the City Center Pest. In the JewishDistrict, he showed us the remains of the wall with the barbed wire on top that imprisoned the Jewish people during the war. Balazs also drove us around in his Trabant which was a fun way to travel. It was so interesting to hear the personal stories of life in Budapest throughout the years and learn the history of the country. We had also scheduled lunch with his parents, Janos and Maria, at their home on the Buda side. They welcomed us into their home where Maria had prepared a delicious meal. She is a very good cook and also bakes a wonderful cake! Janos served us some wonderful Hungarian wine and we also tried some local fruit based liquor. It was a very memoriable day and an excellent way to start your vacation in Budapest!

Tihany, Balatonfüred and Kali basin countryside and wine tasting. We stayed in Köveskal village at Kali Art Inn and booked a full day tour with Andras to experience the surroundings and to try the excellent local wine. Andras gave us interesting insights into Hungarian history and culture and the Balaton region and last but not least he took us to a local wine yard to test their excellent wines and to learn about local wine production. We can highly recommend the guide services provided and also to stay in the countryside and explore the surroundings of the Kali basin with its small villages, beautiful nature and wine yards.

The Ultimate Way to See Budapest. We booked this tour primarily because we were a little unsure of the Budapest and as an added bonus we really wanted to travel in a Trabant.The booking process was simple and hassle free all questions and emails were answered promptly - we met Balazs as arranged at our hotel and after sharing his enthusiasm for Trabant cars with us we had a great day out with him. Balazs' guiding skills are excellent - he was happy to tailor our day out to cover areas that really interested us and his love and enthusiasm for Budapest was clear to see. Balazs clearly loves what he does and our day spent with him was the best day of our trip. He showed us a beautiful Art Nouveau café for a welcome morning coffee as well as areas of the city we would never have found on our own - and we shared a great lunch with him too.His unique car attracts a great deal of attention, is a fun way to travel and I would always suggest that everyone spends a day with Balazs to get the best out of a trip to beautiful Budapest!Thank you Balazs!

Don't see Budapest without Balasz!!!. We booked a daytrip to the countryside well in advance and was impressed with Andras' prompt e-mail responses. When he informed us just before the event that Balasz would be our guide for the day, we were somewhat disappointed. But it all turned out to be the best tour we ever had on our extensive travels! Balasz is an exceptional tourguide: young, enthusiastic, energetic, intellegent, knows his city and country very well, has a delightful sense of humour, has very well informed and balanced opnions about anything and everything (including his Trabants!). We forgot something in his beautifully restored 1965 Volvo, and this created the opportunity to meet with Balasz and his family again. Not only did we spent a most informative and enjoyable day with Balasz in countyside, but also created special fond memories by meeting and spending time with his family.We highly recommend without any reservation to book a tour with Balasz - you will be guaranteed to experience bountifull joy, laughter and having lots of fun whilst taking in the magnificent sights that Budapest has to offer.We are already planning our return trip next year. Our trip to Budapest and the surrounding countryside, and especially meeting Balasz, was a life enriching experience.

Hidden delights. Attila was a great guide with a very funny sense of humour. He was able to tailor a personal tour for my family including my mother and father who are in their 80's and can not walk far.

My personal Budapest. We had an excellent tour of the surrounding countryside and especially enjoyed the personal attention at the pottery exhibit. Our guide was very informative and spoke excellent English.I would highly recommend this type of tour

The road less traveled. We enjoyed our leisurely walk through the streets of Pest where the visitors rarely venture. We saw an amazing panoramic rooftop view, got a taste of local flavours along the way, and especially interesting was the opportunity to find out more about the city from an educated and informed resident, one to one. A lovely introduction to Budapest, thank you Andreas!

Hidden Treasures and lunch. This tour of the Hidden Treasures of Budapest was amazing. We visited a beautiful rooftop terrace to view the Budapest skyline and visited treasures we did not know existed!! Stopping for a coffee in an amazing cafe was also special. We spent the remainder of our tour at Andreas"s parents home for a delicious Hungarian lunch. We felt so fortunate to spend an afternoon with this wonderful couple and Andreas. The lunch was wonderful and the conversation and laughs will be remembered. We arrived strangers but left feeling like friends. This tour was the highlight of our trip to Budapest.
Budapest lovers. Bestest trip, bestest spa, bestest roomates, we were amazin? Also the trip was adorable, definitely i will come again, and use again boat :)

A day that i will never forget. My friends and me had a great time in Budapest with Andras. The hidden treasure is a truly memorable, and fun trip to partake in. I have been to Budapest before, its a beautiful city, but it has so many cool places that only locals would know, and not necessary in the "tour books". If you are looking for something truly adventures and unique i definitely recommend this trip. We have gone to an island on the Danube (via a tiny boat :) ), to hidden 300 years old mysterious libraries downtown Budapest. And we even got to see Budapest from the top of a roof. Real unique experience, truly fantastic trip. Andras speaks real good English, he is very polite, knowledgable, loves Budapest, and seems to have lots of joy from showing us all around. Reliable, prepared, and funny.

Great day with My Personal Budapest. Had an all day tour with Andras (Trabant/Home Lunch/Hidden Treasures Walk) and had a great day. We were rock stars in the Trabant (great way to see the sights); had laughs with his parents; and were locals-for-day as we walked the city streets. We saw, walked and ate too much - but that is how we like it. Andras is a caring, articulate guy with a wealth of knowledge who not only introduced his city, but also the wonderful hospitality of Hungarian people. We were only in the city for two days, but time spent with him has left a lasting impression that we wish to return some day soon to further explore city. Awesome guide (and his parents are just as wonderful too.) Thanks Andras!

Simply the Best. My husband and I had an amazing time last week with Attila. We took tours on two days and were blown away by all we saw and did. The Trabant tour was so fun--Peter was our kind driver.We also did the hidden treasures tour and had the pleasure of listening to Adam Fellegi play beautiful music on his grand piano. Attila delivered much more than promised. We also had the pleasure of eating lunch prepared by a lovely young couple in their home amidst vineyards. If I could give this tour a higher review, I would. Thank you Attila, for making our time in Budapest so fun and informative!

Private Tour with Trabant Cars. What a great tour in Budapest!!! If your looking to add a little fun adventure to your trip you need to book the Trabant tour with Balazs. He is a very personable guide that speaks very good english. We enjoyed seeing the sights of Budapest while riding in style. His father was a good driver and told us great stories about the history of Hungary. We had a great lunch at Andras parents house which was a fitting finish to a great tour.

Private Budapest Tour with Andras. While visiting Budapest prior to an April Danube river cruise we wanted a private city tour that would give us a better appreciation of the history and customs of the Hungarian people than would be available from the group excursions offered by our ship. The "Hidden Treasures of Budapest" walking tour guided by Andras more than met our expectations and was one of the best tours we have ever been on! Andras is charming, well spoken, agreeable, patient, and very passionate and knowledgeable about Hungary and its culture. In 4+ well-paced hours he showed us Karolyi Garden and Palace, said to be the prettiest small park in the city; the lovely baroque University Church ; two beautiful historic cafes (Central, and Alexandra Book Store); the infamous Ghetto wall from the Nazi era; a fabulous panoramic view of all of Budapest from a private roof top; the amusing Szimba Kert ruin pub; and Freedom Square with its architecturally interesting Stock Exchange and Hungarian National Bank buildings, and Soviet Monument ( with a life-sized statue of Ronald Regan pointedly added recently, nearby!) As a finale, Andras invited us to his parents house outside of the city where his delightful mother and father treated us to a full gourmet dinner! Clearly, the "Hidden Treasures" tour was a highlight of our Budapest visit and we enthusiastically recommend it.

Tour of Budapest and surrounding area. Andras Novak - Tour GuideMy husband and I went on a private tour to the Danube Bend ,Szentendre, a beautiful little artist town, a nearby island of the Danube , and the general surrounding areas. Andras provided us with a wonderful day and intelligent commentary and conversation. He showed us the areas that were beautiful as well as discussing the heart and soul of the people.By The end of the day we had a real feeling and understanding about what and who Budapest is . We had a great day, and a lot of fun with a superior guide who we will hire next time we are in Budapest.

Historical 1956 Revolution Tour. Attila was terrific. He was able to provide valuable information and arrange an interview with a person who was involved in the 1956 revolution. Attila's humor, knowledge, attention to detail and flexibility made our experience in Budapest unforgettable.

Our Favorite Memory of Budapest. My sister and I just returned from two weeks in Europe. We visited Paris, Budapest, Krakow and Prague. My sister can post her own review, but I don't think I'd be out of line by saying that our day with Andras, the owner of My Personal Budapest, may have been the highlight of the entire trip.We spent the entire day with Andras. In the morning, Andras met us and we went on a highlight tour of the city in a Trabant driven by another guide's father (Balazs' father). We were able to get a good overview of the city, and it helped us plan our remaining time in Budapest by getting the truth about what attractions were worth our time and money. We were able to take items out of our later days' itinerary because we covered it in the first tour. Andras also answered every question we had about life in Budapest (the education, healthcare and political systems). The Trabant was eye-catching - it was fun to see other tourists take pictures of the little car. And we were able to see the engine and learn about how it ran, which was fun for me as a novice car enthusiast.Highlights of the morning tour were the Great Market Hall, in which Andras recommended certain sausages and baked goods, the view from the Citidel, a quick look at the Gellart Baths and Opera House, and a coffee break at the Alexandra Book Cafe (you must visit this! We went back again for the excellent coffee, food and the ambiance in the room!).Then we went to Andras' parents house for lunch. What a lovely meal! His parents are wonderful hosts and very kind and considerate. My sister was hit very hard by allergies on the day of the tour. She was miserable and a little embarrassed by her coughing and streaming eyes. Andras' parents couldn't have been more kind - they made her take calcium right there at the table, and sent her home with more calcium and other recommendations to help her survive the allergy/asthma attack. Our meal started with a liquor. Then we had juice and appetizers. We sat down to a meal of vegetable soup with fresh veggies. We then had beef in a game sauce over pasta. This was served with a bottle of white wine from Hungary. This wonderful meal was followed up with cake for dessert. This was our favorite cake by far in Hungary - we tried the other two cakes Andras recommended later in our trip, but the cake served by his mother was our favorite. I had coffee, and all the water we could drink. We talked about our itinerary, with Andras translating. It was just a really special part of our trip, and probably our best meal in Hungary!The afternoon was spent doing the Hidden Treasures Tour, which was wonderful. Andras took into account what we had seen on our first day, and was able to add in a stop to a wine store to recommend certain wines and liquors, and we did go back and used his advice for both the wine store and foods we had to try. We saw a ruin pub, and an art deco cafe (buy a dessert to go - we were so full from lunch that we didn't and we regretted not taking some cake home for later). We saw the last remaining bit of the old Jewish Ghetto wall. Andras showed us how to use the tram, which we used for the remaining part of our visit. I can't even describe properly what a great day we had, or capture the experience in words. It was a wonderful day, and if we had more time in the city, I would have scheduled another tour, such as the music tour and wine tour. Andras is currently developing a new tour, regarding the Hungarian Soul, which we would do when we return to Budapest. Although prices are quoted in Euros, it's done simply as a reference point for tourists. Payment can be made in Forints. For reference, my sister and I are age 44 and 46 respectively. I'm a severe introvert and do not typically seek out such a highly personal tour as meeting strangers is not in my comfort zone. But this was an amazing experience and I cannot stress how glad I was to have done it. And I think the price is more than fair for the experience, and think it's actually low in price for what you get. This was an all day tour, after all, complete with the best meal you'll get in Budapest! Andras' love for his city and his willingness to talk openly about all aspects of life in Hungary, and his personal connection with his guests makes this a must-do for anyone visiting Budapest. DO NOT PASS UP THIS OPPORTUNITY! You won't regret it!

Hidden Treasures Tour. My favourite part of this tour was seeing the insides of three different styles of cafes.
