Also, Andras was able to take us into places that we couldn't/wouldn't have gone on our own. He definitely showed us some true hidden treasures in Budapest. He also helped us to track down some food items that we had heard about but couldn't find in our grocery store and did some additional research for us after the tour to find a restaurant that served a dessert we wanted to try. The price is a bit hefty but I don't regret it. I would recommend these personal tours to anyone who wants to see more than typical tourist.

Attila was an amazing tour guide!. Attila took us to really interesting places that no one else had access to and he was very knowledgeable. He recommended restaurant, bars, locations and answered all of questions. I would highly rate this tour. At one point I saw a beautiful dessert in an old painting at a shop Attila took my friend and me to and I asked about it. On top of telling me about the dessert, he took us to a wonderful little dessert shop that sold the dessert and bought one for us. We did the hidden gems and the wine tour. I would highly recommend both but the wine tour was my favorite. The shop owners were amazing and friendly and I am taking two bottles home with me.

Like being hosted by a friend. My sister has shared her review of our family's tour below but i'd like to add my two cents as well! We did two tours with Balazs, his dad, Yellow Trabant, Cream Trabant, and Red Opel - a short city tour (approx 3 hours) as well as a tour to the beautiful Danube Bend (approx. 8 hours)What really stood out for me was getting an insider's view of Budapest and being brought around Budapest like we were family friends of our guide, Balazs. We talked about everything - from studying in Budapest, to dating (We learnt that Trabants are chick magnets) and his father was very humorous and accommodating as well.Although the cars are vintage, they are extremely well maintained and restored by Balazs and at no time did we feel unsafe or uncomfortable in the car.Thank you to Balazs, dad and three cars for hosting us so well. It was the best guided tour I have been on and I highly recommend it!!

Great tours!. We went on both the hidden treasures and the Danube bend tours. Both of these tours were phenomenal! Our tour guide Andras was a Budapest-born local who knew the city inside and out. The hidden treasures tour not only showed us a ton of "off the beaten path" locales but also contained a lot of very interesting history. The highlights of the walking portion were definitely the last surviving piece of the Jewish ghettos (in a gated community!), a ruin pub, and going to the historic coffee houses. The second part of a tour was a lunch at a Hungarian family's house. Here we had a wonderful lunch prepared by our hosts complete with wine and dessert! It was excellent and gave you a great taste of Hungarian home-cooking.We also went on the Danube bend tour with Andras. We visited three towns along the river where we could sample local cuisine and arts, walk through historic streets and churches, and pop into Slovakia for a picture! This day-tour was a lot of fun and had us in the scenic countryside of Hungary. The tour started with visiting a local ceramicist where she gave a demonstration and allowed us to work the wheel to make a bowl if we wished. It was really cool because it was a manual machine rather than an electric one. We also saw the largest church in Hungary and learned a lot about the history of the countryside as well. Each town has a unique history and it was great to learn about how the people lived in that region. The views of the Danube were breathtaking as well. We also were able to visit some mini-museums in the last town.We really recommend each of these tours to anyone visiting the country. It's a great opportunity to see and learn about Hungary from a local!

A day with the Trabant King of Budapest!. We had booked the Trabant tour and the Hidden Gems tour with My Personal Budapest. Our guide was Balasz (not Gulash), a very enthusiastic and knowledgeable youg man with an extensive knowledge of the city and even more of Trabants and (communist) oldtimers. Balasz tailored the trip so we didn't revisit the places we'd seen on foot the previous day. Being driven around in a Trabant the size of a big cookie tin through the bustle of Budapest was a real hoot. Balasz is an excellent driver (visit his Facebook page and be surprised...!) and he knows the little cars inside out, we never felt unsafe. He gave us some interesting and good stories at various sites. We then had lunch at his parent's place - they are both very friendly people and his mother had cooked up a nice and traditional meal. For the afternoon, we switched cars to a very pretty Opel Rekord from the 50ies (I think), restored by Balasz himself and even more of an eyecatcher. It was a beautiful sunny day and we enjoyed every minute, visiting a few places off the beaten path. Balasz then dropped us off at a place of our choice. We heartily recommend the trip for Balasz' knowledge of the city, and if you are even a little interested in old cars, you'll come out of the trip as a Trabant-expert.

The best tour I've been on. Out tour guide was very good now name was Attila like the other famous Hungarian. He had a great sense of humor and was very knowledgeable. The 1962 car was a hit and we did draw a bit of attention. We saw the normal tourist spots then had lunch with George and his wife three courses which were sensational. We them went and saw some hidden treasures which you don't normally get to see. If was theb best tour I have been on everything was fantastic We even saw the redbull planes fly under the bridge in front of our hotel. Very good worth every cent.

Excellent Private Customized Tour. Our guide, Balazs, led us on the "Hidden Treasures" tour, as we had already visited most of the major sites of Budapest through our Viking River Cruise tour. Balazs showed us so many interesting out of the way places in the city and customized the tour per our requests. We rode on the subway & tram to various locations and stopped for coffee in a quaint little cafe. Balazs has an excellent knowledge of this wonderful city and we so enjoyed seeing the small flea market, alleyways, ruin bar, unique buildings, Jewish district and learning about the history & background of each. And we loved to learn about his Trabant, of which he is very proud. There were so many wonderful photo opportunities throughout the tour. We highly recommend My Personal Budapest and especially Balazs!

Wonderful tour!. With only two days to spend in Budapest, we decided to take a private tour for the first time ever. It was a fantastic experience! Balazs is an engaging young man with a wonderful knowledge of Budapest, its history and the most interesting places to see and go. The highlight was driving in his 1966 Trabant, an East German era car which drew smiles and waves everywhere we went and it's much more comfortable than it first appears. This was a great way to get an introduction to both the Buda and Pest sides of the river in a short amount of time. Highly recommended!

Very Personal Tour with Wonderful Guides. I took a family trip with my parents, husband and two adult siblings in late April 2015. Based on good Tripadvisor reviews, I decided to book the Trabant (3 hours) and Danube Bend (8+ hours) tours with My Personal Budapest. The tour company was very accommodating, explaining that our group would have to be split into two cars (the vintage cars in which we would be travelling understandably cannot hold many people) and that a radio connecting both cars would ensure that everyone would be able to hear the guide. In most cases, you would be picked up at your door but because we stayed in such a central area with a busy, narrow road and no parking in front of the building, our guide, Balázs parked very close to where we stayed and we walked about 2-3 minutes to the waiting cars. This wasn't a problem at all, as it was ridiculously close, the weather was glorious and the walk took us by St Stephen's Basilica, which was just behind our accommodation.Balázs acted as our guide on both tours and his sheer enthusiasm and attentiveness was commendable. Balázs knowledge of the history and streets of Budapest (and the surrounding countryside) was impressive and he took pains to accommodate our little group's disparate interests and personalities. Whilst my siblings and I are easily accommodated, my mum has a bad hip and cannot walk far; my dad is abrupt and accentric, with a tendency to wander off on his own; and my husband has a short attention span. Balázs periodically checked to see if my mum was okay when we were walking around and kept tabs on everyone to ensure that no one got lost (people wandering off on their own, lagging behind to window shop or visiting restrooms). The tours were mainly memorable because we had a more personal, tailored introduction to the historic city. Balázs shared some local anecdotes and jokes, told us how locals live, explained Hungarian politics, showed us the neighbourhoods surrounding Budapest and gave us a thorough yet concise run-down of Hungarian/Budapest's history. We also travelled around in beautifully restored and maintained vintage cars - a Trabant and Opel. These drew admiration from many pedestrians and drivers alike and added a different dimension to our experience. It was also clear that Balázs was married to his cars! :)Although we were mainly driven around during the tours, we also had stops at scenic spots and places of interest, allowing us to take photos and have a closer look at various monuments/buildings/areas. It was perfect for mum especially.Balázs' dad acted as the second driver and also chipped in with little snippets of information about Budapest etc from time to time. He was a real gem, making hilarious statements and observations as we went along. Case in point - when we pointed out the Liberty Statue and asked about it, he noted that it was the "world's biggest bottle opener". So, not a fan of it, then. He was also a real old-school gentleman, as he made a point of helping all the ladies in and out of the cars and holding the door open for us (my husband would get out of the car and skip off like a lamb in spring, happily oblivious to anyone struggling with bags and heels behind him).Specific comments on the two different tours are as follows:1) Trabant Tour- At 3 hours, it's gives a brief overview of all the main sights and is perfect as a quick way to see the city, if you only have a couple of days. - I felt that it was a little too short to cover much in a fairly spread-out city with so many sights, like Budapest. As we had 5 days, I would've booked a longer city overview tour if it were an available option. I understand from Balázs that the company is considering the provision of a full day tour of the city, which I feel would be a better option.- Please note that you will not be entering the museums and cathedrals on this tour, so plan to do this on a different day, after you get the lay of the land from this tour. When we visited St Stephen's Basilica, we paid 200 Forints each to enter the church. We tried to see the mummified hand of King Stephen but it was housed in such a dark corner and the hand is so small that we couldn't see anything. You'll have to pay another 200 Forints to light up the reliquary for 2 minutes. Although this isn't much, we disagreed with the principle of it and just waited 1 minute for someone else to pay the fee (at which point, the group of tourists hanging around the reliquary started furiously snapping away on their cameras - no flash photography, of course).2) Danube Bend Tour- Simply amazing views. Highly recommended. Very relaxed trip for people who want to see very charming little towns with interesting architecture and the beautiful outdoors.- We got to visit Slovakia (very briefly) on this tour and to take some amazing photos. We also visited the largest cathedral in Hungary (Esztergom Basilica) - another breath-taking building; we were spoiled for choice!- There were sufficient water and restroom stops on both tours, so we never felt uncomfortable for a minute.- Lunch is not included on this tour but Balázs suggested that we could all have lunch together at a little cafe in Szentendre (a must-see), to try langos, a popular Hungarian fast food. It's a fluffy, deep-fried bread with optional toppings of sour cream and/or cheese and garlic spread. Langos is surprisingly light and not too greasy, my entire family enjoyed it. It was simply delicious, cheap and very filling!**Note: Although prices are quoted in Euros, this is just done as an easier reference point for tourists. Payment should be made in Forints.**Note: The vintage cars are a fantastic way to travel but you should know that they are 2-door and small, so it may not be as easy for senior citizens or bigger-sized people to get/fit into them. My family and I are small South-East Asians and my husband is 6 ft 2 inch, of a regular build. My husband was comfortable, sitting in the front passenger seat while my dad and I sat behind. There was just enough space for us, with our various bags and professional cameras. The experience of riding in these cars is incomparable though!Overall, I would recommend My Personal Budapest and Balázs (and his dad!) in a heartbeat. We got to know Balázs and his dad personally, while enjoying the sights and sounds of Budapest and the countryside. For us, it was the personal touch and human connection that made this entire trip memorable. We will definitely call on My Personal Budapest for future guided tours in Budapest.

Knowledgable, interesting and accommodating guide. Scheduled this tour prior to my knowledge of a tour provided by our river cruise. Therefore a big part of the scheduled tour was already seen by us. Andras was quick to do a little revision of our tour and provided an excellent and interesting tour. I believe he included some the hidden treasures tour in our tour which was an added plus. His knowledge and love for Budapest is definitely reflected by his tour. You definitely get one of the city's best tour guides. We were really happy and enjoyed the tour immensely. The car, Trabant, it was fun and kind of exciting looking at all the people snapping pictures etc. but just be prepared for a very cramped ride. I enjoyed riding in the car and all of the gawkers were fun to watch but cramped. So just be prepared for this. Some have said it to be comfortable, I would not say that just fun and exciting. Budapest is a lovely city and Andras shared his knowledge. Fun day.

A First Rate Experience. Last week my wife and I took the Trabant and Hidden Treasures of Budapest tours with Balázs as our tour guide, and we had lunch with his family. We could not have had a better or more rewarding time. Balázs is an engaging young man with an encyclopedic knowledge of Budapest and Hungary. His family is friendly and gracious, and his mother is an excellent cook. If you are looking for a traditional private tour in a luxury sedan or van, then the Trabant tour is not for you. If you want to learn about Budapest and have a lot of fun doing so, then the Trabant tour is just the thing. Our tour with Balázs was both very informative and very entertaining.

Three great experiences.. Recently we had the pleasure of enjoying three tours with My Personal Budapest. Trabant tour: Our guide, Balázs, met us our first morning in Budapest in his Trabant for the Trabant tour. After getting an overview of the Trabant we headed out for a tour of the city including the Buda and Pest side. This was a great tour that allows you to get an idea how the city is laid out and what areas you may want to revisit. You also have several photo opportunities of the major sights. One of the best parts is observing the smiles on people's faces when they see the Trabant. Balázs is an energetic guide that provided us with a brief history of Budapest, a very helpful lesson on the Hungarian language, and other interesting facts throughout our journey. He also provided us with helpful restaurant recommendations at the conclusion of our tour. By the end of the tour we concur with his statement that you start off as guide and guest and end as friends.Szentendre and Hungarian lunch:On another day Atilla picked us up at our hotel for a tour to Szentendre and then to András’ parents for a Hungarian lunch. Szentendre is a quaint town where we visited the marzipan museum, learned to make pottery which was a nice change of pace for us, and a unique artist’s gallery featuring the smallest pieces of art we’ve ever seen (Atilla was very excited to show us this gallery). We also had time to pop into a few stores to shop. Atilla graciously translated for us as we talked and chatted with shop owners.We then continued to Gizi and George's house (András’ parents) where we were warmly greeted. Gizi fixed a delicious lunch for us, which we enjoyed over great conversation of food, family, pictures and travels. Throughout our lunch we felt like we had known them forever. I truly recommend joining them in their home if possible.Overall we were pleased with My Personal Budapest and recommend them. The set tours are a great way to get started. They are adaptable to requests and likes also. For instance, Balázs asked if we liked coffee to which the answer was yes, so he took us to one of his favorite coffee shops, since the Grand Market was closed that day. Communication was reliable with András while planning our tours. He was helpful in assisting with our requests.

Two days in Budapest via Trabants!. We had the city tour on our first day, and the tour of the Danube Bend on our second day. It was great and memorable. The Trabants were surprisingly comfortable, like sitting on your living room couch! Balazs and his father were very passionate about the history of Hungary, and we couldn't have any better storytellers than them.

A Wonderful Day in Budapest. My wife, daughter and I joined Balazs Ackermann for the Trabant Tour, home made lunch and Hidden Gems tour in Budapest. The day began with a Trabant Tour of the the historical and cultural sites in Buda and Pest. We then had an amazing home cooked meal at Balazs' home in the countryside with Balazs' mother and father. And, we finished the day with the Hidden Gems tour. This tour was the highlight of our wonderful trip to Germany, Austria and Hungary. Balazs is an energetic and engaging young man, and his knowledge of Hungarian history and culture are absolutely amazing. His morning Trabant tour was the perfect introduction to the city, and his hidden gems tour in the afternoon was marvelous. We wandered through the back alleys of Pest, seeing some amazing sites, including the remnants of the wall the Nazis built to create the jewish ghetto and an introduction to the Hungarian Parliament. We paused for coffee and pastries at a quaint little coffee house off the beaten path. By the end of the day, we felt like Balazs was a member of the family. I would be remiss, however, if I did not say that the highlight of the day was the amazing meal his mother and father prepared for us in their lovely home. Mrs. Ackermann's hungarian cooking was as good as my grandmother's, and Mr. and Mrs. Ackermann made us feel so very welcome and comfortable in their home. I am so pleased we had a chance to meet and spend time with them. For those who may be apprehensive about visiting the Ackermanns in their home, throw off your inhibition. You will not regret it. I can't say enough positive things about this tour.

So much fun!. My family and I used my personal Budapest two days while we were visiting Budapest. Day one we went on a winery tour with Attila and it was a wonderful afternoon. On our way there he told us about a lot of Hungarian history and once there he introduced us to our very lovely hosts at the winery. We enjoyed the day and our time with Attila. The next day we went with Balazs and his dad in their Trabants. Which are really fun retro cars. Besides the cars being fun we went on a 3 hr tour of the city. Balazs was so informative. We stopped at a number of places so that we could take pictures and enjoy the scenery. It was a really great way to learn about the city. Highly recommend this tour company on a trip to Budapest!

Two lovely experiences - a fine tour and a lovely lunch. We booked back-to-back tours – “The Hidden Treasures of Budapest” with “Atilla the Hungarian” and “Hungarian Lunch in a Hungarian home.” We enjoyed them both immensely. The former is not a replacement for an introductory tour to Budapest – it is exactly as described, a chance to visit interesting places that are off the beaten path. Atilla was the perfect guide, very knowledgeable and adaptable and we enjoyed some great private views of the city. The latter tour was an exceptional experience – we were warmly welcomed into the home of Andras’ parents and treated to the warmest hospitality and some great cooking. (I will be swapping some recipes with his mom!) It was a unique way to get “close and personal” with some very lovely people and experience a scene from daily Hungarian life. Don’t miss this “tour” if you can possibly arrange your schedule to take it in. We met Atilla immediately after taking the stunning Hungarian Parliament tour in the morning and then set out after the Hidden Treasures of Budapest. After that, Atilla drove us out of the city center to Andras' parents home and our lunch was actually in mid-afternoon. We left there quite full and mellow!

Great if your only staying one day in Budapest. Attila showed us the highlights and it was a perfect way to see Budapest when it is cold and you only have one day. He customized the tour so we were able to visit the Strudel Bar ( get the cherry and poppy seed) and see a Ruin Bar. I was also able to get a little shopping and it was perfect since we had the car to carry the souvenirs.

TOUR AND LUNCH IS A MUST. We were a group of 6 and were picked up on time from our hotel to start our tour and lunch. This was going to be our 7th and last trip to Budapest but after our tour with Andras we realised that we have only just scratch the surface of Budapest and would definitely come back and do another tour with Andras .He was able to show us some wonderful sights and the meal at his parents house was a delight.

Fantastic Trabant City Tour with Balázs. We booked our Trabant Tour of Budapest by email with Balázs Ackermannat Personal Budapest Tours.Booking was nice and simple. We wanted a tour from 4pm - 7pm on the day we arrived. Balázs said this was no problem and offered itinerary suggestions and quickly answered all my questions and also suggested restaurants for us. Booking was confirmed by email and payment agreed to be made after the tour in local currency. Balázs gave us a warm welcome and explained all about his love for Trabant cars and Budapest before we set off in to the city. The car is great fun, and gets lots of admiring looks and smiles from people in the streets. It's pretty small, although I am 6' 2" and I managed to last our 3 hour tour without too much discomfort.Balázs was full of interesting information and facts. He also gave us an insight into young peoples thoughts and views in this metropolitan area of Hungary.He took us high up on the Buda side to watch the sun go down and see all the lights come on either side of the Danube and along the bridges. His tours are very flexible, just let him know what you would like to do and he will arrange it for you. Highly recommended, we enjoyed every minute. Thank you Balázs, you are the 'King of the Streets' in Budapest

A good day!. We booked Andras via email before our trip. Unfortunately circumstances changed with our booking but he was very understanding and ensured our day went really well. An early start from our Hotel and we went on a car tour around Buda and Pest, stopping off along the way to take in the views . Having never been to Hungary before the ensueing commentary about it's history was interesting and welcoming. Following the car tour we carried on to his parents home for lunch. This was a touch of genuine Hungarian hospitality which included home cooked Hungarian fayre and very enjoyable company, thank you.The afternoon took in a walking tour of Pest visiting places we would have just walked past! Like the Ruin Bar ( we visited this again the next day!), again with a full commentary of the area and its history. The walk to the Jewish Quarter was very humbling and to hear the full of history of what happened was very thought inspiring. This tour gave us a brief insight into Budapest and enabled us to use the remaining time we had there to explore places recommended to us by Andras.A well planned and organised tour which we recommend.Thank you Andras!

Best Day in Budapest. Our Danube Bend tour was the highlight of our Budapest stay. Balasz was so informative and personal at the same time. He tailored our day around the charm of the 3 towns and beautiful scenery with fun stops for authentic langos. We had so much fun we booked a tour the following Friday with Atilla for the Hidden Treasure tour. The art and history stops never would have been found on our own. I recommend to try either tours to add to your experience.

Unforgettable experience of the town from a different viewpoint!. Balázs took care of us in a marvellous way! We reallt felt spoiled and VIP-guests!He was waiting just outside our hotel at perfect time with two shiny and irresistable Trabant!! The tour was great, Balázs knowledge of the town and the historic background of Budapest is amazing. We asked and asked and he kept on - with no hesitation! - delivering precise and clear answers! He offered us an extra stop for a coffe at a great traditional Art Nuveau-cafè and then at the end of the tour drove us to a nice restaurant!A great experience which made the day and the vacation! Highly recommended! Thanks Balázs!! You arew really BEST!!

The perfect insider's guide to Budapest. Andras Novak provided us with an absolutely wonderful and personalized tour of Budapest. My two adult sons and I were visiting for three days, and I wanted a guide who would both take us to the city's "hidden treasures" -- the smaller places that aren't on the standard tourism maps -- and point out places and activities that would be fun for two recent college graduates on vacation. Andras gave us exactly what we wanted. Budapest has a slew of amazing cafes, and he took us to a great sampling -- the retro '60s, hipster TaskaRadio; the historic Central, and the magnificent cafe atop a bookstore that feels like a cathedral. We got a great look at some of the city's most distinctive buildings, including an exclusive rooftop view from the President Hotel; walked through the Jewish quarter; at lunch at the Central Market Hall, and visited the city's first and possibly best "ruin bar" -- the edgy, grafitti-covered Szimpla. We went back to Szimpla at night -- unforgettable.Andras gave us great pointers to the must-see tourist sites, Castle Hill, the Citadella, and gave us a rundown on the city's main swimming/bathing spas. He gave us great insight about culture, history and politics, and what it's really like to like in Budapest today. The tour was great fun in itself, but Andras also made it easy for us to get the most out of our other two days in Budapest. As a result, we had a wonderful time the entire trip. You can only scratch the surface in three days If we go back, I will most certainly take one of Andras' other tours.

Travis-tour with Andras. This was a great way to experience Budapest and you couldn't do better than Andras!We got to see all the highlights of Budapest and even stopped at a fun Art Noveau coffee house.Dinner at Andras' parents house was a wonderful experience, dinner was excellent and the conversation nice. We left with a warm feeling for Hungary and the people! I highly recommend this for any first time visitor or even someone who wants to feel more a part of Budapest!

Great tours. My teenage son and I really enjoyed our two tours (the Hidden Treasures of Budapest tour with András, and the Danube Bend tour with Attila). They not only took us to interesting places (like the castle in Visegrád), but they gave us the opportunity to ask lots of questions about Hungarians, their history, and their unusual language. Attila did lots of translating for me because he knew I was trying to pick up some new words, and he joked around with my son and kept the tour from being dull. It was a relief to not have to figure out where to go, first of all, and then how to get there. We'd been in Budapest last year and had already visited several of the typical tourist destinations. But having personal guides and interpreters made this second trip of ours so much better. If we return to Budapest next year, we will want to go on more of the tours they offer. Don't hesitate to go with this tour company!

Trabant Tour: absolute fun tour!. We went with a group of 8 on the Trabant Tour which was a great experience. We were divided over 3 cars and although not all the very friendly drivers spoke english, we were given walkie-talkies to communicate with one another which worked well. Our guide Balasz was extremely passionate about the cars and Budapest, drove us around this beautiful city, stopped for coffee on our request and dropped us off in front of a reataurant of our choice. It is an excellent way of getting to know the city in an authentic way with such lovely people. Highly recommendable!

Great Tour. My family and I (wife, boys 16 and 11 years) visited Budapest and based on Trip Advisor reviews, we decided to take the Trabant tour. In short, the Trabant tour was a highlight of our trip, ranking up there with a fish festival and opera. The tour was a perfect blend of touring the city, learning the rich Budapest history, and getting acquainted with with our charming guide Balaz and his father The Trabants were the perfect quicrky car to tour the city as the entire family felt like celebrities because of all of the pictures that were being taken of the cars as we toured around. My only regret is that we took the tour towards the end of our visit.
Excellent Trabant Tour. Great Trabant Tour with a very Knowledgeable and intersting Guide ! Andras showed us all around Budapest and it is worth it it ! I would really recommend this ! Youssef

Authentic and Special. My family and I (group of 5) visited Budapest in early February for only 2 days. To make the most of our time and see and experience all that we could we chose the all day tour starting with a driving tour in the Trabants, breaking with an authentic Hungarian home cooked meal at Andras's parents house, and finishing with a walking tour. The entire day was wonderful not only because of the beautiful city and interesting tour but also because of the personality of the guides András and Balázs. In András's words "we got to be friends for the day". We did not find the all day tour to be overwhelming. I would suggest scheduling the tour at the beginning of your trip in order to get acquainted with the city and learn about the sites that you could revisit later. I thought the price of the tour was very fair. All correspondences with András before and after we clear, quick and personable. By far, the highlight of the day was lunch at Andras's parents house, his parents are absolutely lovely and adorable and the food was FANTASTIC! I highly recommend this tour because you will get more than just a tour of the wonderful city of Budapest, you will have a special and authentic Hungarian experience.

Well worth it!. My wife and I had a memorable and enjoyable day touring Budapest with our guide Balazs. His classic mode of travel (Russian Trabant in the morning and his 1957 Opel in the afternoon) were head turners throughout the day.While a "Hop On Hop Off" would provide you an overview of the main sights of the city, I strongly suggest splurging a little for this trip that you will talk about for years to come. We chose the Trabant tour with lunch at Balazs' parents in a suburb 15 miles from center city and an off the beaten trail tour in the afternoon. Highlights included ghoulash soup and other authentic dishes with his very friendly parents, listening to Balasz share his passion and knowledge of Hungarian history and of course the cars. Friendly, professional and fun. You will not be disappointed.

The highlight of our trips to Buda and Pest. We came in December, it was chilly, we were tired from flying and more than a little bit curios as to how we were going to see these great cities in only 2 days and then Balázs and his father pulled up in their Trabants.The crazy looking communist era cars caught more attention than if we had been zipping around Budapest in Italian sports cars. I'm a big guy, 6'4" and even though it was a challenge getting in and out of the tiny cars once I was in I was comfortable.Balázs was an awesome guide and a fun guy who loves his city and took us to the spots we needed to see and then he dropped the real knowledge on us.The dude is a stunt driver who is well known for his ability to drive those Trabants around on 2 wheels, the videos are crazy, his stories are entertaining.Don't hesitate to take this tour, you have the opportunity to enjoy a great city quickly but make sure your guide keeps all 4 tires on the ground while you are in the car.

Amazing Day. We had such a great tour of Budapest with Balázs and his cool Trabant! His knowledge of the city was top notch and having lunch and drinks with his parents was definitely the highlight of the day. His mother cooked one of the best lunches I've ever had, that soup she made.... Wow!! Over all this is a great way to see such a beautiful city, learn about Hungary, and get to know a great Hungarian family. This was my first private tour and from here on out I'll never do a group tour again! Thank you again Balázs and My Personal Budapest!!

Great way to see the city. Thanks Andras - we had a blast. My wife and I took the 3 hour Trabant tour and found it to be a great way to see all the major sites of the city. The tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and shared the right level of information. Highly recommended

loved it. We tend not to be interested in going on guided tours but a friend recommended Andras and so we booked with him we decided to do 3 tours which was the whole day Andras picked us up at out hotel for the Trabant tour ,unfortunately the trabant was not available that day so we went in Andras car which was perfectly fine (and we got charged less)Driving around Budapest is highly recommended as we got a jist and feel of the entire 2 cities in one morning From the lovely and clean Market to the wonderful castles and winding roads on the Buda side ,to a quick peek at the famous Hungarian Baths and more .It was a quick and concise history ,economy and geography lesson that didnt get too boring !!For lunch we did the next part of our tour that was fabulous ...we went to his parents house in the suburbs and his mother made us a wonderful lunch and some great wine According to me this is priceless ... people from different corners of the globe getting the opportunity to meet and exchange stories . They were more curious about us and our life in India haha it was a happy afternoon . post lunch we went for the hidden treasures tour that was nice the roof top ,the ruin pubs and the coffee shops such an enjoyable and a great tour .love it Andras keep it up

Fantastic tour of Budapest!. Our family of 4 (with kids 13 & 19) absolutely loved our time with Andras and Balazs! I honestly can't imagine having a better time then with those guys. We did the Hidden Budapest, Christmas tour, Danube Bend, Trabant and lunch with Andras's family. All of it was terrific! We spent a total of 11 days in Budapest and having the time with these tours made our trip rich in experiences that we will not forget. I appreciate how knowledgeable these guys were! Both my kids came away with great memories and both want to come back to Budapest. We had a great time riding around in the Trabants and now everyone wants Balazs to find us one to send to the states:)

Christmas in Budapest. We spent a delightful afternoon with Andras with his Christmas tour. The tour included a private organ concert and a lecture from a young lady from the cultural center on the Christmas traditions of the past. It is always a special treat to tour with Andras as he really enjoys showing you his beautiful city!

Only way to enjoy a place. Andras took us to Szentendre and to a Hungarian lunch with his parents. What a treat that was! We "threw" a pot (although my granddaugher's pot was much better than mine!), enjoyed some Hungarian snacks, learned about Hungarian history, and ate a fabulous lunch. We felt like special guests at his parents' house. Only too soon was our day trip over.

Christmas Holiday in Budapest. Exceptional, Andras and Balazs are exceptionally good guides,- the Trabants, the places we went to, conversations about history and cultures, good choices for places to eat .... it was all top quality. Balázs and his father drove us to a variety of sites in the Trabants. Traveling around in the Trabants was remarkable. The cars are beautifully maintained and quite comfortable, though small which is part of the historical experience. However, driving in the small, two cylinder cars gave me an appreciation for the life in Hungary during the years of Soviet control, as contrasted to my life in the US during the same period of time. The Trabant tour, part of which was going to the park of Soviet statues and monuments, was a lifetime memory. Balázs and his father were so friendly, very polite, and the conversations spanned a thousands years from the begining of Hungarian history to the present. We loved the Trabants and Balazs. I would recommend this as a great part of our trip. We also toured Budapest on foot with András. Budapest is a beautiful city, and Andras took us to unique sites, historical coffee shops, and unique cultural experiences which we would never have experienced without him as our guide. That was all on foot. Then, we took a day with Andras and toured out into the country side to eat great traditional Hungarian food, take back street tours of little towns, see historical sites, and share time with artist friends of Andras, and again have a day full of great, friendly, conversations about history, culture, and just laughter and good times.  I am so thankful to have Andras, and Balazs as our guides. I will remember them and their parents kindness for decades.

Trabant and Hidden Gems tours. Balázs was a great tour guide for our stay in Budapest. We took the trabant tour and the hidden gems tour back to back with him. It was a full day of history and walking - with 2 kids (13 & 11) and in the cold weather, he kept us all interested and did his best to accommodate whatever we wanted to do and see. He was very thoughtful and I would highly recommend My Personal Budapest.

This is a "not to be missed". We just got back from our Buda and Pest tours as well as "Hidden Gems". We loved the cars, Balazs, our tour guide, his dad who drove the other car, the places they took us, hit every highlight and just being in our own group. This is a "not to be missed" tour if you have one day or many. If you are doing a tour contact My Personal Budapest as they communicate right away with emails and are very clear on pick-up and the timing. Very professional but feel like you are part of the family.

Budapest tour . Atilla our guide showed us the Danube bend, Trabant, hidden treasures tour!We had a wonderful time in Budapest!Atilla was funny and entertaining.He made it a point that we enjoyed our stay in Budapest.Thank you Atilla, you're the best!

Atilla is the guy!!. Our tour guide was Atilla. At first I thought that he was was a very serious guy. But as we went on with our tour, we found out that he was such a funny guy!! We were with him for 2 days. On the 1st day we had the Danube Bend tour. We went to Estergom ( & even went across to Slovakia where the view was magnificent). He also took us to a hill where the view of the Danube was breathtaking even w/ a light rain.On the morning of the 2nd day, we had the Trabant Tour& on the afternoon, we had the Hidden Treasures.Touring with Atilla was really fun and not boring at all. I am pretty sure you will enjoy and appreciate Budapest with him.

A great feel for Budapest. Budapest strikes me as a city spread across a fairly wide area, with attractions in both the Buda and Pest sides - both with differing feels. Unless you have a car, public transport touring is slow and whilst the metro is easy, it doesn't go everywhere. András was our guide and it was his parents who hosted us lunch. We took a half day car tour followed by Hungarian lunch, then a "hidden treasures" half-day tour the following day. His knowledge reflects his love for this city and wandering with András around back streets, café haunts, Turkish baths and quiet gardens added to our experience of how local Hungarians relax. Of course the car tour allowed us to see sentinel attractions, including the castle and the markets. Some were seen driving past, others we walked past, and major sights, we toured through. Other museums (e.g. National Gallery, Hospital in the Rock and House of Terror), András encouraged us to go by ourselves due to time constraints, which we did later. It was an excellent way to experience Budapest in 2 days and we enjoyed the hospitality of his family at the lunch. His mother cooks traditional dishes very well and whilst András' English is excellent, we enjoyed conversing with his folks who were surprisingly interested in live outside Hungary and were happy to share their insights into life in Hungary in the past and today. Unlike bus tours, or hop-on-hop-off touring, this private tour offers insight and a personal experience. Highly recommended.

The ABSOLUTE BEST guide in Budapest. On our European 16 day multi-country journey we had only one whirlwind day to spend in Budapest, so we contacted Andras to show us his city. My only regret is that we didn't spend two or three days touring with him. He showed us ALL the major sights of Budapest, gave us a great history lesson and explained the culture of his people while driving us around the city in his car. I don't know how he fit so much into such a short period of time. He picked us up from the train station at 10:00 a.m. and dropped us off directly at our train station at around 5:00 p.m. I can't believe we were able to see so much and do so much in only 7 hours! He is fluent in English so language was no problem at all. If you are ever in Budapest, the absolute BEST thing you could do is retain the services of Andras as your personal guide to explore this wonderful city. It was definitely the highlight of our entire trip. If I ever return to Budapest (and I surely hope I do) I will be sending Andras an e-mail to arrange for his wonderful guidance.

Excellent tour and guide. We had a wonderful tour with Balazs. It was a combination of the Trabant tour and the "Hidden Treasures" tour, and it gave a terrific overview of the beautiful and interesting city. Balazs is enthusiastic, knowledgeable and personable. Budapest is more spread out than, say, Prague or Vienna, and so riding in the Trabant was a fun and efficient way to get from area to area. This was an terrific introduction to Budapest.

Tremendous experience. We planned on arriving two days early for our Tauck river cruise, and wanted a personal tour that would give us insight into the "real" Budapest and surrounding area with its history, culture and people.After reading the very good reviews on Trip Advisor, we contacted Andras and booked the Danube Bend and wine tour. It was exactly what we wanted. We strolled the streets of Visegrad, Esztergom and Szentendre. We met Gabrielle a local pottery maker, traveled to the Etyek wine region and tasted wine with the owner of the family owned vineyard. We experienced the "real" Hungary with a very special guide.What a tremendous experience---- perfect in every way.Thank you Andras.

If you are traveling to Budapest, don't miss this tour. I was attracted to this tour by the positive reviews on trip advisor and was not disappointed. The hidden treasures and the dinner with the Hungarian family were especially wonderful. Driving around in the Trabant was great fun. Don't miss this tour

A special and unique way to see the best of Budapest. Attila organized a wonderful day for us. In the morning, the four of us got off our Viking cruise and met Attila and Balazs and his father with two Trabants soviet cars. Wonderful ride around both Buda and Pest. Then Attila took us to a great Hungarian restaurant to try things we never would have tried - delicious. In the afternoon, a wonderful walking tour of the unbeaten path of a Budapest ending at a ruins pub for a beer.Thank you Attila and Balazs for making the end of our trip special. Ask Attila to plan your time in Budapest!

Highlight of the holiday. We booked 2 tours for 2 mornings, both with our knowledgeable tour guide Balazs. The tour by Trabant was first class, you very quickly get an overview of Buda and Pest and see parts of the town we wouldn't have got to on our own. In the Trabant you become the attraction and many tourists have photos of us as we parked up to look at an attraction. We also took the hidden treasures tour which showed us some of the "off the beaten track sites" including a beautiful "retro café", Gaudi-like café and a Ruin Bar that we might not have ventured into on our own. Well worth it. Many Thanks Chris & Katharine

A very special guide who can show you Buda and Pest in the most unique ways possible!. We had such a difficult time choosing between the tours Andras described on his website so we picked 4 of them to fill our 2 full days in Buda and Pest. First, we did the driving tour of the city sights in the Trabant car. That was an amazing way to see the cities and feel like you were part of its history. Next, we did a walking tour of the hidden gems and saw parts of the city that most visitors to the city couldn't find on their own. Absolutely, lovely. The next day, we visited two potters' workshop in a nearby city called Szentendere, where we had the opportunity to use the potters wheel and make a bowl! Way cool! Due to rain, we adjusted our plans and did some fabulous shopping in Szentendere where Andras was able to direct us to the best merchants for what we were looking for. A trip to the miniature museum was also a great find where we saw the smallest bottle of coke and other objects of art that can only be seen through a microscope. Andras was professional, informative, sensitive, and very personable and we thoroughly enjoyed these 3 tours with him. The last tour was so special and made us feel as if we truly felt like a native there. Andras' parents, who are warm, charming people, welcomed us into their home and shared a traditional, delicious home-made meal with us. That really made our trip complete. We highly recommend you have Andras show you his cities for a truly unforgettable experience.

Best 2 days of a 3 week trip. My husband and i booked a private tour with Andras for his tour of Szentendre for one day, and a walking tour of Hidden Treasures of Budapest. Both days were a delight! Our tour guides Andras and Balazs were knowledgable, personable, and excellent tour guides. The best. We would give them 6 stars, if that were possible.

Perfect way to see Budaphest and learn about it during a short stay.. My husband booked this tour, and at first I was against it, because it seemed expensive. After spending the day however with this very knowledgeable tour guide who was also a collector of old Trabant cars, I can't rave enough about it. I loved every minute of it, and I really. Feel as if I left the city with a great understanding of its history and present. We saw so much, while driving in the Trabant, and on foot. Our tour guide was young and seemed very hardworking and knew a lot of the country's history and it's present situation. He took us to see the main sites, but also some unique sites and views from hidden places. I definitely recommend this tour to everyone wishing to see Budapest in a short time.

Enthusiastic locals justifiably proud of their beautiful city. Budapest is a very beautiful city with much less graffiti and garbage in the streets compared to Paris, Vienna or Prague. This was our second trip to Budapest as the brief glimpse we had at the end of a river cruise last year left us wanting more.We did the trabant tour - communist era 2-stroke vehicles - which took in the major sights and included lunch. Highly recommend this tour. We had a party of 6 so the guide and half the group were in one car and the commentary was delivered by walkie-talkie. The next day we did the hidden treasures walking tour which took in some interesting places and sights. Some of our party were elderly so this tour was a little arduous for them but the guide was very understanding and eager to please. They will custom-design an itinerary to suit. They were also helpful with other suggested sites to visit ourselves including the "hospital in the rock"

Hidden treasures. It was a wondeful day with the stuff of My Personal Budapest. Our guide was/is fluent in english and german as well, which made the communication very easy. We travelled through the capital of Hungary and saw special places from really special angles which probably some of the residents of Budapest can't. I can only recommend this programm, but only if you have at least one day for this wonderful city!

"Hidden treasures of Budapest". „The hidden treasures of Budapest” tour (with Andras) was simply unforgatteble for me. I was working in Budapest for several years but I didn’t tought that there are so many interesting and beautiful places in the city that I didn't know before. I was amazed at the sights that we saw from the roof terrace of a hotel or from the „Gül Baba” statue. I will never forget the stories I heard from Andras standing at the jewish ghetto. I got a lot of new experiences from Budapest that I recommend this tour both Hungarians and foreigners. I'm sure you'll enjoy it!

Hidden treasures of Budapest. We had a wonderful and exciting tour on Saturday. I saw places what I've been planning for a long time to visit or some that I even didn't know about after living many years in Budapest. We visited the Várkert Bazár, the tomb of Gül baba, had an overwhelming view from the terrace of Hotel President, went to the Hospital in the rock, and we closed our tour by walking to the Jewish quarter - we even saw the last remains of the wall of the former ghetto. It was a perfect program for a sunny October Saturday. :-) Thanks, Andras!

Great tour of Lake Balaton. We were in Budapest at the end of a bicycling trip and engaged Andras to take us on a day tour of the Lake Balaton area. This was a great tour and we saw this scenic area with Andras' excellent direction. He knows the area and enjoys showing the hidden gems of his tours. The highlight was a stop at a local winery for a wine tasting and a lunch of authentic homemade goulash. I would recommend this tour highly and feel that Andras' personal touch is the difference that separates this tour from others.

Andras is great!. Our tour of Budapest highlights with Andras and his driver was wonderful; exactly what we wanted to get our visit to Budapest off to a terrific start. He was knowledgeable, easy to understand, and amenable to our desire to keep moving and see as much as possible in the four hours we had with him. If we had allocated more time there, we would have gone with him up to the Danube Bend. Everyone in our party of four Americans agreed that his tour was a highlight of our trip.

Wonderful Day in Budapest. Attila was a great guide. We enjoyed our day. The hidden treasures of Budapest was really unique and enjoyable. We also did the wine country tour which further enhanced our experience with the people of Hungary.

Great way to get acquainted with Budapest!. On the recommndation of my brother, we also took 3 tours with Andras. We did the morning Trabant tour,Hungarian lunch, and an afternoon to see off the beaten path sights. Andras was very informative of all things Budapest, and his love for the city is evident. We were whisked around the city, dropped off and picked up at sights that would have taken much longer to get to and see. Andras was very knowledgable about the city and Hungarian history. It made our tour that much moremeaningful. He recommended lots of places for us to see throughout the week. We throughly enjoyed our tours.

Indeed personal:)). My German friend and me signed up for a tour with Andrew. Although I live in Budapest ( I am Hungarian;), I saw places I have never seen, and heard stories I have never heard..vaooo...I wanna do it again:))))Big Big Big thank Youuu Andrew:)))

What a fun ride!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Balázs in his Trabant. It was so much fun getting picked up in that car in front of the Four Seasons--we were the center of attention, forget about the Maseratis and Jaguars! And while the car ride and the attention it attracted was fun, it was Balázs who made the experience. He is a charming, informative, insightful young man who was a pleasure to be with. He showed us the main sights, adjusted the tour for our interests, and provided an excellent overview for our first day in this magical city.

A genuine personal experience. Balázs was an incredible guide, always ready to tell interesting stories about Budapest. We did the Trabant tour and the homemade lunch. Riding on an old beautiful car was incredible but nothing compared with sharing a delicious meal with his parents. The food was great and the atmosphere superb. We really felt like having a Sunday lunch at home.

Personal, engaging and really enjoyable. We took a half-day tour with Andras around Budapest, and this was a such a great way to see this beautiful city. So much better than joining the mass-tourist groups and following the well-worn tourist trails. We were in a car so could zip around the city seeing the things we wanted to see, and stopping at the places only the locals know about. We learnt a lot about the rich history and culture of the Hungarians (Andras know the history so well and makes it interesting!), we laughed a lot!, and it was such a fun and engaging afternoon. I would definitely recommend this as a great way to see Budapest.

Far exceeded our expectations!. Our final stop after visiting Germany and Austria was Budapest. Happily we chose Andras to show us the part of Hungary we would not have seen if we stayed in Budapest. We started our day with a visit to the artist village of Szentendre. There was an opportunity to try our hand at pottery. Laszlo, the potter, made it look so easy, but you needed coordination and strength. He guided us through the whole process and we each made a creation.The highlight for me was dinner at the home of Andras's parents. We were warmly welcomed and treated so well we didn't want to leave. Our meal of chicken paprikash was outstanding. I had requested that meal since my Hungarian grandmother made it for me. Andras and his parents were helpful in showing me on a map the town where my ancestors came from, Nyiregyhaza. What a thrill to see my maiden name in print. I highly recommend My Personal Budapest Tours. It was a day I will always remember.

The best trip to take in Budapest. We did the Hidden Treasures as well as the usual tourist spots. They turned up promptly at 9am as they said they would and although the Tribants were a little cosy they certainly drew a lot of attention and were a fantastic way to see Budapest. As there were 6 of us we had two cars and a walkie talkie was set up between the two cars so we could hear the commentary from the front car. Nothing was too much trouble and they completely catered for us all - he was still asking us at 7pm if there was anywhere else we wanted to go! Definitely good value for money. Borash was very knowledgeable and his enthusiasm and passion for his home country was infectious. We had a fabulous lunch and they even got us a bottle of champagne as they knew we were there celebrating a birthday. Nothing was too much trouble and we all agreed that it was the best day of the trip. Would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to see the sights of Budapest without having to endure huge tour groups and want to do something a bit different

Great personal tour of Budapest. My wife and I did a personal walking/public transportation tour with Balazs. He was prompt, catered to our interests and we had a great 4 hour tour of the city. He took us to off the beaten path sites that we would have never seen with a tour group. This is the way to see Budapest. He explained the city and sites as we walked. We had a coffee and pastry and he told us about the history and culture of the city from many aspects. Great tour!

My Personal Budapest made our two days in Budapest pecial.. I can't say enough about the wonderful tour my wife and I had with Attila and My Personal Budapest! We took a tour consisting of Ten Hidden Treasures and lunch. We were met right on time by Attila, our tour guide, who did a fantastic job showing us his home city. We were in Budapest to start a Viking riverboat tour the next day and I wanted a more thorough overview of the this amazingly beautiful city, and I got exactly that and more. Thank you Attila...if I could rate this tour higher than a 5, I would.

Best tour we took in Europe!. My daughters and I and three of our friends just took the Budapest tour with Andras and it was GREAT! We have been touring Europe all month. This was our final tour before heading home, and the girls all said it was their favorite tour of the whole trip. We enjoyed the tour of the market and all the main sights. But without a doubt our favorite part was the traditional Hungarian lunch in his parents' home. The food was delicious and the company delightful. His parents are just adorable and were so welcoming. I highly recommend that you take this tour when in Budapest. I know that it was the one thing we will remember long after after things we did have faded from our minds.

Andras was the perfect fit for my mother and I. My mother and I went on a trip through old Europe. We had two days in Budapest one of which was spent with Andras. He has a terrific English, very patient with my mother and I who have varied interests, and patience for both older and younger people. Very fluent in all aspects of history, politics, and tourism. A very kind, smart, good looking young man that makes everyone feel at ease. He took us to many, many stops and spent as much time as needed at each. The tour moves at your pace and what you find of interest. He also invited us to some events that his friends were doing in town.He has a lot of current and historical knowledge and will immerse you as much as you wish. Well worth the money.

An inside view of Budapest. We are realy tired of the steriotype organised tours , so we thought that we should try something different and we made a very good choice! We took The hidden treasures of Budapest and every place we visited had something to offer. We saw places which are not even in the guide books and would not have known about otherwise, I would certainly recommend this tour to anyone who is interested in getting the real feel of a city! Andras , who was our guide was very knowledgeable and informative. The tour is mostly walking ,so wear comfortable shoes!

A taste of Budapest...looking forward to next time. My friend and I spent 3 brief days in Budapest during a recent visit to Europe and Attila, Biloj and Andras were instrumental in making it our time in their city one of our highlights. We spent half a day riding around in a Trabant catching the major sites along with having an animated discussion about cars, Communism and daily life in this beautiful city. The afternoon was spent in Etyek having a leisurely lunch and touring a family-owned wine seller and enjoying a small wine-tasting. Overall, it introduced us to the diversity of wine regions and wine-tasting in Hungary as well as a brief slice of history. I wholeheartedly recommend this company during your next trip to Budapest.

Excellent Walking Tour!. After some deliberation, I chose My Personal Budapest Tours from reading the tripadvisor reviews and emailing other tour companies. I was not sorry. Balázs was our walking tour guide while we were visiting Budapest on July 1st. It was three generations - my mother, sister, myself and my daughter. So we were all at different levels of health. He was able to accommodate any changes and paced the walk according to my mother's ability. He met us at a location of our choice.Balázs was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. We asked for the Hidden Treasures tour which for us included three different districts of Budapest all done by using the Metro, the street cars and trams! He handled all of the tickets/admissions for us so we didn't have to do anything. It was great to see things off the beaten path.We especially liked the view from the top of the President's Hotel! I'm so glad that we spent the time with Balázs. He was so pleasant. We even ran over time but it was no problem.I would highly recommend touring with Balázs!!

No better way to see Budapest. The first day I arrived to Budapest I spent walking & getting lost on my own. My only regret is I didn't arrange my person guided tour with this company my first day so I could have seen more of the city. I was only in Budapest 2 days. I opted for the Trabant tour & the hidden treasures tour. I highly recommend both to get a better idea of the city. I wish I had time to visit the countryside as well. My guide Balázs was very friendly & knowledgable. He showed me where to buy local souvenirs. I can now walk away with a great memory of Budapest. You will have so much fun riding around in the cute tiny vintage car! Don't hesitate to book a private tour with this group.

Perfect ending to six weeks in Europe. On June 27 we spent a full day with Andras doing both the Danube Bend Tour and the Winery Tour. We could not have enjoyed a day more: beautiful countryside, charming villages, a delicious Hungarian lunch at a recommended restaurant, stunning views from high above the Danube, a visit to the elegant basilica in Esztergom and great wines and a delicious cold plate following wine tasting in the cellar of a family run winery. Throughout the day, Andras kept the pace suitable for our seventy plus year old bodies, patiently answered a myriad of questions about his country's history and culture, showed us places off the beaten tourist track and, with a great sense of humor, put up with my husband's teasing. If we are fortunate enough to return to this lovely old city we will definitely be booking more tours with My Personal Budapest.

Trabant & private home lunch. Do Not miss this Golden Opportunity. a unique, delightful experience. How many have seen a Trabant much less toured Budapest in one? :) Balazs was outstanding as our guide/driver and the family we ate with were most charming-The food was excellent. Nice neighborhood away from the city center. we ate, visited, discussed families, viewed their garden. we learned more about the people of the country and it was the highlight of a week long trip.Balazs was willing to adapt the tour and did so with grace. He took us to the Market and to the only remaining piece of the wall built around the Ghetto. we asked for off the path experiences and he delivered with enthusiasm and a smile. Very knowledgeable and fun to spend the day with.

Great Tour!. We had a wonderful time with Balazs in the Trebant as we drove around Budapest - what a unique and wonderful way to see the different areas of the city. He had lots of knowledge and information and obviously loved his Trebant! It was definitely well worth it and we thoroughly enjoyed our tour. We would really recommend this way of travelling around Budapest. Thanks Balazs!
We enjoyed together;). A guide kindly explained about history, politics and economics, anything else what I want to know.:D

Private tour. Thank you so much to Andras for this special experience we shared in Budapest. We asked for a customised tour to take us to the place of my grandfather and grandmothers villages. First we went to Budakalasz where Andras managed to find a distant relative and the original shop sign our grandfather used for his business, we found information we did not have before on our family tree, this was very very special. Next we travelled to Dunabogdany to the place my grandmother lived and the church they were married in. Finally to a special spot by the danube where we spread their ashes into the river, a place we are sure they enjoyed together. Thank you so much for this wonderful day we will never forget!

Highly recommended tour of hidden Budapest: they have the keys!. We booked two tours with MyPersonalBudapest: hidden places walking tour and a typical Hungarian lunch with a nice Hungarian family! That palinka was really good! Our guide Attila was very, very nice with us. He even had a gift for my wife when I said it was her birthday!About the hidden places walking tour it reminds me the film La Grande Bellezza: Attila had the keys of secret places in Budapest we would never be able to get into!And the lunch with the Hungarian family was the highlight of our stay in Budapest: we felt as if we were at home, living in a nice Hungarian home, having a nice time with our hosts, while eating a typical homemade food. And the dessert... Definitely a must in Budapest!

Great personal tour. Booked a full day tour. The personal Trabant tour was great way to see Budapest, skipping places we’d visited the previous day, visiting places we wanted to see and being taken to places we didn’t know about. We got some fantastic pictures and tour guide information helped bring the history to life providing a greater appreciation of the sites visited. It was a special treat to be taken on tour by the Hungarian Stig; some may know him as Attila, others may call him Goulash and some simply call him Bob. But to us, he will always be known as Balázs. The man who taught himself to ride on two wheels on a Trabant. Yes, he’s a self taught stunt driver folks. Then it was off to the hungarian family lunch which tasted fantastic and was matched by the hospitality. I had two portions of everything and couldn’t get the seat belt to fit when I returned to the Trabant, lol. Secret tours was last and held in store a couple of wee hidden gems. We will treasure the tour and our fantastic time in Budapest. A special thank you to Balázs and András (+ mum and dad) for a great day out.

A bit disappointed. When you book with one of the tour operators that are highly rated on Tripadvisor, most of the reviews are about the owner/founder of the company. When that person isn't available, you need to be careful. We had a tour with a guide that was not the owner. He was perfectly acceptable, but just not with a personality that would rate 5 stars. Also we traveled out of town to the Danube bend in an old Volvo that he had personally restored and was justifiably proud of. It was a beautiful car, but just wasn't big enough for 4 Americans to travel in comfortably. On the other hand, we did the piano concert in a private apartment, and this was superb.

Great way to see Budapest. Three couples went on the Hidden Treasures of Budapest and then had lunch at the home of our guide's parents and then had a private piano concert at the home of a classical pianist. We couldn't have had a better time and we got to meet some fantastic Hungarian people. Thanks, Andras for the wonderful day that will be forever kept in our memories.

Excellent Tour. Our tour guide Attilas was knowledgeable and brought us to the less tourist parts which was really interesting. He answered our many questions about Budapest that we wouldn't have known just touring around the area. He took us to a hotel roof top so we could see the unique neighbouring building and other various views. I would definitely recommend this company.

Personalized tour in Budapest. We have chosen the culinary tour and the hidden treasures of Budapest. Both were great, we loved the hidden treasures ( indeed a nice alternative way to see the city) and we enjoyed very much the local cuisine. Our guide ( Attila) was very friendly and knowledgable and we felt very well taken care off. We would totally suggest the tour and My personal Budapest generally, we got the feeling that everything is well organised, thought out and planned with love for the city!

BEST tour company in Budapest!!!. Book a full day with this company and what an excellent choice while in Budapest!! Our private tour guide was Balazs & he truly was amazing!!! Very knowledgeable, witty, professional and just FULL of information. We booked 3 tours: The Trabant tour, which took us ALL over Budapest in his personal Trabant, lunch at owners parents house & Hidden Treasures tours. The lunch which was hosted in Andras' parents house was extremely special! His parents were the perfect hosts and we ate like Kings!! The food was all prepared by his Mother and was just delicious! Then Balazs drove us around Budapest showing us "hidden" treasures of the City that we would have NEVER known about, this was really magnificent. Balazs just made our time in Budapest memorable.. Thank you again Balazs for making such beautiful memories of my time in Budapest.

A very enjoyable day. We spent nearly a day with Andras and had lunch with his delightful parents. Despite the number of times he must repeat various facts he seemed very keen to pass on everything he could to us. And he also asked us questions, which endeared people in our group to him. We had already been on a communist tour so Andras had the added complication of avoiding places we had been but he did this very well. We saw some places little seen by tourists, tasted some thermal water (horrible) and discussed the state of Hungarian football in great detail. We also a lot of Budapest and understood so much more about it.Andras took us to lunch at his parents house. This was absolutely lovely and far from feeling awkward we felt very welcome. The food was also very, very good. His parents even took part in some surreptitious marketing activity I'm carrying out for a friend.If you are coming to Budapest I thoroughly recommend getting touch with Andras through his website. And do lunch with him and his parents!

BEST Day in Budapest!. Our tour guide - Balazs - took the 2 of us on an AMAZING journey in his Trabant, showing us the major sights, lunch in a Hungarian home, and hidden treasures. We couldn't have had a more enjoyable day! Honestly - Balazs is such a pleasure be with - he's extremely knowledgeable, pleasant, informative, and fun! We loved riding in his Trabant - he's so proud of it, and we can understand why - it's a living piece of history!! Lunch was superb and was the highlight of our day - very delicious food, great company, and lots of laughs.If you're coming to Budapest - please please don't miss out on this opportunity to experience a tour of a lifetime, that was made even more special by our guide Balazs! A true ASSET to My Personal Budapest tours - Thank You Balazs!!!!!!!

What an Experience. We spent a full day with Andras the founder of My Personal Budapest. Andras takes alot of pride in his city and does an excellent job of showing it off. Our group of 6 did the Hidden Gems tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. We walked/drove to some very interesting places that the big tours did not go to. We had a a traditional Hungarian lunch prepared by his mother at his parents home which was excellent. We ended our day with a private piano concert by Adam Felligi in his flat. What a moving experience this was. We would highly recommend My Personal Budapest whether this is your first visit to a beautiful city or a return visit.

great guides and excellent organisation. I booked 4 trips with Andras for a group of 8. We did Hidden Gems which took us to very interesting parts of this beautiful city by walking, trams and metro! We did the city tour and hungrarian lunch the next day by minibus and whilst it rained very hard we had great fun and a great lunch! We all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! My friends and I were very impressed by our guide for those tours Balazs Levey. He was very knowledgable, spoke excellent English and was great fun! The next day we went to Danube Bend with Andras and really enjoyed the trip. Andras adjusted the day to suit the weather and us and I was so glad I found my personal Budapest! A huge THANKYOU to Balazs and Andras for organising everything so well!

Excellent Tour. Our tour guide was Attila who had extensive knowledge of Budapest and took us to less known areas. It was interesting seeing the Budapest sites most people doesn't get to see. He answered our many questions and took pictures of us at the various locations. He met us at the prearranged hotel, we took the tram and subway at various times during the tour. At the end he gave us his tram pass to use the rest of the day. Overall we enjoyed the tour and Attila's company, we would recommend this tour to others.

Outstanding way to see unique behind-the-scenes sights of Budapest. For several months we had been in ongoing email contact with Andras and had booked two tours back to back -- the walking tour and the lunch in a private home (his parents' home). So we were a little concerned when he wrote that a family wedding would take him away from the city when we were there -- and also mean no lunch at his parents' home since they too were attending the wedding. Of course, we understood completely that family comes first. In any case, there was no need to worry. His colleague Attila took over our walking tour and he was an outstanding guide -- low-key but very knowledgable and with a good sense of humor. We loved going to places that we never would have found on our own, or even with the average tour guide. Several were open only to this tour operation; e.g., a rooftop with spectacular views and a private palace owned and lived in for centuries by the family of Hungary's first president.I had been to Budapest several times before but this was the first visit for the other three family members in our group. For all four of us, it was a very special experience. We highly recommend this tour group for a unique look at a remarkable city -- whether you are a first-time visitor or here after repeated stays.After the tour, we treated Atilla to lunch at Diszno (Pig Bistro), a restaurant recommended to him by Andras, and it was excellent (see separate review). Again, we never would have found it on our own.

Wonderful tour, highly recommended to anyone!. Our family of four did the hidden treasures and wine tour of Budapest through my personal budapest. Our guide really went out of his way to show is everything on our "to do" list as well as show us around some of the hidden gems that we would otherwise not have found.We have worked with many tour agencies in Europe and this was the most accommodating and friendly tour yet!

My Personal Budapest- Great Experience. Even though I found this company on Trip Advisor literally days before our trip, I was able to book a tour. We were lucky to have Attila as our guide, who was kind enough to tour us even though he was on the mend. Attila met us at our hotel on time as promised, and we planned a custom tour based on our wish list as well as his recommendations. He gets an A+ for getting me into a Budapest Fire Station, where I wanted to take pictures for my husband. Not only did he get me in, but they gave me a tour. My husband was really impressed with the pictures and information I got from the firefighters. One of the best highlights of the tour was the private rooftop visit with a view of the Treasury. So beautiful, and there is no other way we would have ever known about this. Attila also navigated the intense traffic and parking challenges with ease. He was also kind enough to sit through lunch with us at the New York Cafe, which is not to be missed. We were able to see all the items on our wishlist. The pricing was an excellent value, and my travel companion was ready to book another tour, since she was staying longer and meeting other friends. I would highly recommend My Personal Budapest to anyone wanting a personalized and enjoyable visit that will educate you on this beautiful city! If we are lucky enough to visit Budapest again, we will definitely set up another tour. And we hope that Attila comes to visit us in San Diego!

Best way to see Budapest. We only had a couple days in Budapest and this personal tour was exactly what we needed.We started with hidden treasures tour with Balasz and couldn't believe how much attention his car attracted! He was extremely knowledgeable about Budapests history and people.We finished the tour with lunch at Andras parents house. It was a great meal and they are very gracious hosts. Balasz was a great interpreter. This tour is a must do.Susan and Anthony from Boston.

Personal tours in Budapest. We had a free day after our river tour which ended in Budapest so decided to book a private tour and get out of the city. After reviewing a lot of reviews, we went with My Personal Budapest and were not disappointed. They offer a variety of tours but we opted to go to Szentendre, outside Budapest, then to visit a small wine producer (they call this a "wine cellar tour" but I think the title is a bit misleading). Our guide Attila was knowledgeable and good company, spoke excellent English, and provided a great deal of thoughtful commentary and history about a fascinating country. Arrangements were easily made by email, and everything ran very smoothly. Our guide had a good idea of where to go ad what to do during the day but was flexible and accommodated the occasional whim that we had. It was a very good day.

Scargasmic:). Hands down the highlight of our Eastern European trip! Andras was a fantastic guide in the Hidden Gems tour and his family was a delight to have lunch with. This is a MUST DO if you are visiting Budapest!

Andras brings Budapest to Life!. We arrived in Budapest late in the day, and compared to Vienna, the city was much more spread out. Our time here was limited, so we had booked a tour with Andras, and so glad we did! He took us on a city tour, followed by lunch at his parents' home. What a treat! She used paprikas to add a different and delicious flavor to the food. Her strawberry torte, yum. His fathers garden was lovely as we'll. next was the Hernyak Birtok winery. This was a great change of pace from the city. The owners are beautiful and hard working. They believe in quality over quantity, and you can taste that belief in their wine. See review. Andreas' knowledge, along with his pleasant, easy manner mad our day one to remember!

Absolutely marvelous tour. Andras took our two traveling couples on a tour of Budapest that we will always cherish. We chose the three-hour city tour of Budapest, followed by lunch at Andras' charming parents' house, and ended with an out-of-town winery tour.
