It was clear we should have planned to stay a few days more in Budapest. It is a charming city and Andras' love of his home city made us appreciate it all the more. Knowledgeable about Budapest and Hungary, Andras' presentation was entertaining and kept us chuckling at his sense of humor. We saw so much more than we would have ever found on our own. The Hungarian lunch Andras' mother fixed was delicious! She identified it as stuffed cabbage but I would have characterized it as a soup with shredded cabbage, wonderfully seasoned broth, and lamb-pork meatballs that melted in your mouth. The strawberry-whipped cream-cake for dessert finished off a terrific authentic Hungarian meal, making us feel more like company than tourists.The family winery we toured was about an hour-and-a-half drive out of Budapest. As the miles of rolled by, we were delighted by the countryside. Valerie, the wine-maker, told the story of how the family bought the land and began their winery after the Communists left. After educating us on what it takes to make a good wine, she gave us samples of five different wines to taste. We sat on the winery patio, sipping excellent wine, eating locally-made cheeses and other treats, while gazing at the rolling hills of grape-vines. As enchanting as Italian vineyards or Sonoma in the U.S., this is a place not to be missed.When we think of Budapest, it is this wonderful day that comes to mind. Do yourself a favor and book Andras' (or his colleagues) for a unique experience you can't get anywhere else!

Great tour company. We just finished a great 2 day tour with My Personal Budapest. My favorite parts were the lunch at a typical Hungarian home, and the Danube Bend tour. For the lunch, Andras's mother cooked a big meal and served it to us in her home. The food was really good and she made extra for me since I'm a vegetarian. It was much more interesting to be a guest in a real family's home than to go to a typical restaurant. The Danube Bend tour was also great - we visited an old castle which you could walk through and see amazing views of the Danube. We liked the other parts of the tour too but these were our favorites. I would recommend My Personal Budapest to anyone visiting the area.

Perfect way to see/experience Budapest. We hired them for our short 1 day stay in Budapest and were completely happy with the result. We requested a combo of hidden treasures and culinary delight which lasted about 6 hours. Our guide Balázs was great to point out the historic places and also give us a real feeling for the present times. From a secret rooftop helipad view, to a coffee at an Art Nouveau bar, we really got a feel for the city which could not have been possible on our own. And the food was delightful! Really reccomend to use them on your visit to Budapest, you will not be disappointed! It was really nice to have one price for the tour/travel passes/food.

9 wonderful hours in Budapest. We chose to book the three tours, which included lunch and the hidden treasures, along with the city tour. Balazs was our guide, and he knew a lot about the history of the city. Nine hours is a long time to spend with a complete stranger, but he made the time go by really quick. We saw a lot, and he adjusted some stops to accommodate our needs. We saw so much, that we see no need to do our other planned tours. The lunch at his parents house was wonderful. The appetizers and meal was good.... But the Apple Struedel for dessert was absolutely wonderful.... It could be served in any 5 star restaurant. Balazs and his family were very welcoming, and very enjoyable to be with.... Book this tour... You will not be disappointed

My Personal Budapest - Hidden Treasures Tour. This tour lives up to its name. We had a great tour with guide Attila (the Hungarian). The tour featured a number of places we never would have found on our own, including a rooftop view of a wonderful Art Nouveau ceramic tile roof in a nearby building, a visit to a "ruins pub" (where everything is decorated with recycled items), and a look inside one of the palaces in the city. We did most of it on foot, which gave us a chance to see lots of side streets and learn unexpected facts about the city.

Amazing time and experience in Budapest. My wife researched some tour guides that covered not only the popular destinations, but the off the beaten path destinations. We lucked out big time with Andras from My Personal Budapest. On day one we did a tour in [2] old Trabants that were in mint condition. The drivers were a father and son duo that made us feel right at home. Touring Budapest in these unique classic cars made the tour that much more exciting. Andras was well versed in Hungarian history and did an excellent job of keeping the tour on a level that was interesting not only for my wife and I, but also for my 23 year old son and 21 year old daughter. One stop on the tour was to the Marketplace where we tasted some excellent Palinka and strudel. Day two we did a walking tour to see some off the beaten path spots that you would not find on your own. For lunch, Andras took us to a friends home for a home cooked Hungarian meal. Upon entering his friend's apartment, we were immediately made to feel like family. I can not stop raving about the delicious meal that we ate. My kids are picky eaters and they both loved it. At lunch, our host had offered us home made Palinka that was out of this world.What more can I say, Andras is the real deal and will and will make you feel right at home in Budapest!

Fun way to see the city!. Booked a few months before our visit with Andras and had expected to have 2 trabants as some need a driver and guide and there were 3 of us and no way would 5 of you fit in a Trabant! When we were met at our hotel bang on 9 oclock I was delighted to find we had only the one, and what a fab little car it was. Balasz (pronounced bollarge), a 24 year old expert in these cars who has rebuilt several of these old vehicles proudly showed us the one he was driving that day, talked about how it works and showed us the engine and explained how he had done it up. He was so enthusiastic and engaging, lovely start to our day. We had booked 2 tours, the general tour of Budapest for the morning and the hidden gems. After a busy day I dont think we left anything out - he took us everywhere - spas, old buildings, ruin pubs, fantastic lunch cafe with good local food, castle area, parliament area, Jewish area, all the bridges. The whole time telling us about these places and their history. Highlight for me though was to go onto the roof of an hotel and see the view of the city from their helipad. You would not find that on most tours! Such a unique way to see the city, I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone. High praise for Balasz, his great little car and his unending energy and enthusiasm.

Fun and Informative Tour of Budapest!. I contacted My Personal Budapest via email a couple of days prior to arriving in Budapest. Andras replied via email within 2 hours and we were able to set up a day long tour of Budapest. Balasz arrived at our hotel right on schedule in his expertly maintained Trabant. We set off on a morning tour to see the highlights of Buda and Pest. Balasz is an amazing tour guide with a fun and witty sense of humor and expert knowledge about his beautiful city/country. His English language skills are impeccable! He shared a tremendous amount of information during our tour and even took us for coffee at one of his favorite cafes. We had booked the winery tour for the afternoon. The vineyard was about 30 minutes outside the city and traveling through the beautiful Hungarian countryside in the Trabant was definitely a real treat! We were greeted at the winery by the owners and made to feel right at home as we sampled wines from the vineyard and a enjoyed a wonderful spread of tapas prepared for us. It was a wonderful way to be introduced to the beautiful city of Budapest and I highly recommend My Personal Budapest Tours!

Experience Budapest at it's best. In April 2014 I and my companion-both retired educators-had an open day from our river cruise trip and booked a full day with Andras (mypersonalbudapest). If you want to relive your days of riding in a vw bug, the Trubant tour is just the thing. Ackerman is the owner and driver and a very engaging young man. We then had lunch at Andras's parents' home. They are delightful and gracious people and Andras Mom is a terrfic cook. We spent the afternoon on a walking tour with Andras showing us the Hidden Treasures of Budapest. If you want to go off the beaten path, experience the real Budapest and stay off the "touristy" sites, Andras is your man. You will find yourself on a helipad atop a hotel;viewing the remains of the ghetto wall from WWII, in coffee houses with Art Deco museums in their basement. He is well informed, organized, loves his Budapest and wants visitors to learn about its history. Without a doubt our day with Andras and Ackerman was the highlight of our two week Viking River Cruise.

The highlight of Budapest !!!. It's very hard to come up with superlatives that have not already been said, however I will try. We took the Hidden Treasures tour with Balasz, in his Opel, and it truly was amazing. Balasz is a very personable young man, who displays incredible knowledge and love for his country (and cars). He showed us truly amazing gems that we never, never would have found on our own, which made Budapest and her people come alive for us. Hands down favorite for me though was the lunch with Andrasz's parents, who are the loveliest and most gracious hosts. The food was amazing and Balasz was perfect as the translator. We exchanged many stories about our families, children and cultures. We met as strangers but left as friends. Please, please, please give yourself a gift and take this tour as an opportunity to learn more about a country and her people than you will ever learn from a museum. Scott and Liz from Boston.

Hidden Treasures tour is Awesome!!. We booked both the Hidden Treasures tour and the Trabant tour of Budapest and were so happy we chose those. Balazs was our guide and showed up in the most beautiful car nicknamed "Chick Magnet" and for good reason. Before arriving I had emailed Andras because my father has mobility issues and can't walk long distances and he was so helpful and accommodating. Balazs made our tour interesting and fun! Our favourite tour however was the Hidden Treasures I'll leave it to My Personal Budapest to show you but definitely the highly of our trip!! Even our lunch in a traditional Hungarian restaurant was fabulous and Andras and Balazs made arrangements for them to have a birthday dessert ready for my boyfriend. Top notch service and a truly memorable experience!!! Thank you!

A Wonderful Way To Spend The Day. We can see why this tour is rated #1. Attila was a great guide. He was on time, informative and accomodating. If you want to see what Hungary is like outside of Budapest, this is the tour for you. We took the Danube Bend tour that included stops in three towns, lunch and beautiful views of the Danube. We will recommend this company and tour to all of our friends and family.

MypersonalBudapest.com. Our trip to Budapest was wonderful but made "personal" and special with the weekend tour with My Personal Budapest. Our guide, Balazs Levay was great and very knowledgable ! We were picked up in a military style Trabant car skillfully driven by Peter to see the sights in Buda and Pest. We made pottery with Gabriella & Laszlo and felt the love of their craft. Not to be missed was the visit to the winery for tasting with Vali - a gracious host indeed. The weekend was truly an authentic and special experience and one I will not soon forget.

Great Day All Around. My husband and I loved our day with Attila! He was not only knowledgeable, but very personable as well. We spent the morning doing the Hidden Gems Tour (and were shocked to find ourselves having doors unlocked in the president's house, just for us!). It was a great morning and we saw so much. We then spent the afternoon doing the wine and lunch tour -- unparalleled success! The vinters were so nice and we couldn't have asked for better wine, food or company. I would highly recommend Using My Personal Budapest to anyone who is in Budapest. We had an unplanned extra day and wish we had signed up to do a third tour with Attila!

Something you cant miss out on. Who would want to drive around in a plastic car with less horse power than modern mowers. YOU DO! Forget the pre-packaged bus tours and phone Apps, the personal tour we had with Balazs was extraordinary. It started outside our hotel where the Trabant was parked next to a Maserati and a BMW, yet it was the little Trabant that received all the attention from the passing crowds and with good reason. The car was immaculately maintained and very clean on the inside and riding through the streets of Budapest in this was an experience in itself. Balazs took us to some of the lesser known sights of Budapest and apologized that he couldn't show us anymore because we were scheduled to fly home that same day. If we had known we would have been doing it a day earlier. Our guide's English was excellent and his demeanor was so chirpy it made you feel secure and happy at all times. His access to some of the areas of the city was incredible and we got vistas that were unparalleled. A better photographer would have had a field day. We took as many photos as we could. The knowledge of the city was superb and he was able to answer every question. In conclusion I would wholly recommenced this experience and would love to see this kind of service replicated across other cities.

Budapest in a fresh and unconventional way. I really liked our tour with Andras! The tour through the Jewish district was very exciting and the home lunch made me feel like I visit a good friend - excellent Hungarian kitchen and wine.I warmly recommend to discover the beautiful city of Budapest with My Personal Budapest, you will like it :)

Perfect Intro to Budapest!. We are fairly experienced travelers and don't usually take a formal tour, however, we knew very little about Budapest and decided to hire András for our first day in the city. We are REALLY glad we did!Everything about the day was perfect! András took us on a tour of the hidden sites in Budapest and pointed out many other interesting spots along the way. This allowed us to return to what interested us in the following days. He then took us to lunch at his parents' house. His mother prepared an amazing Hungarian meal and we really enjoyed their warm hospitality. Finally he took us to the Etyak wine region where we toured the Hernyak Winery and sampled their wines which included another amazing plate of local cheeses and cured meats. The quality of the wines were a nice surprise! We are frequent visitors to the Napa & Sonoma regions and enjoy finding and drinking small batch premium quality wines. We did not expect to find such amazing wine in Hungary and now we wish we could find these wines in our part of the world. It seems that Hungary keeps most of it to themselves.We highly recommend starting your first trip to Budapest with a tour from András and even if it is not your first time he still has much to offer. If we get the opportunity to return to Budapest we would hire him again and challenge him to provide another unique tour experience.

Deservedly ranked number one.. Whenever my husband and I go to a new city we like to have a personal tour with a local guide. This ranked definitely amongst the best. Andras made us feel at ease as if we were old friends and took us to little out of the way places we would have never explored otherwise. Extremely knowledgeable about the history of the country and city, he was modest to a fault and taught us the facts in a way that we are still recounting to friends back home. Although we tended to ask a lot of questions and going off at various tangents, not only about the tour but about Hungarian life in general, he kept the talking and walking flowing very well. Three hours passed like three minutes and we would have loved to have spent more time with him, but as we couldn't, he gladly pointed out further areas of interest on our map and recommended some other things to do. One of which is to try to get lost in Budapest, a recommendation we accepted as we stumbled across some wonderful children's craft festival in the castle district and the lovely Olympic park by the Parliament. I would thoroughly recommend this tour company for a genuine, quality and personal experience.

VERY GOOD TRAVEL AGENT. We visited Budapest with five friends and we enjoyed the services of a very efficient and nice travel agent, Andras, who along with one of his colleagues, Balazs, showed us their city with efficiency, pleasure and knowledge. The first day Andras took us in a nice small van on a tour of the city and then we had a nice lunch in the house of his lovely parents, who cooked for us and showed us what Hungarian hospitality is like. The second day we visited the two interesting towns of Szentendre and Esztergom on the Danube with Andras and the third day his colleague, another interesting and knowledgeable young guy, Balazs, took us to a tour they call "the "hidden treasures of Budapest". He took us around in one of his collection antique cars, an Opel Olympia. The tour was really interesting, but Balazs himself was even more interesting with his passion about his collection of 8 antique cars he talked to us about. After spending three days with these guys, we felt we had seen a lot of Budapest in a very enjoyable, comfortable and pleasant manner. Andras was very prompt and efficient during all our e-mail exchanges and until all details of our tours were arranged.

A great, customized tour. The best part of our trip!. I was travelling with three friends and we booked a tour with My Personal Budapest. Our tour guide was Andras, and he was a perfect guide. We spent a full day with Andras and covered a lot of stops, including the old Jewish quarter, Gellert Spa and Gellert Hill (wonderful views), walks through a few different areas of the city, and visit to a winery in nearby Etyak. Andras took us to his parents' home for a traditional Hugarian home-cooked meal. His parents were wonderful, and the food was great, the most enjoyable meal of the entire vacation. He then took us to a small family owned winery a short car ride outside of Budapest (Hernyak Winery). If you like wine I absolutely recommend this part of the trip, as a wine lover who has traveled to numerous wineries in California, Spain and Argentina I never expected Hungarian wine to be this good. The wine tasting included with a plate of wonderful locally made cheeses and meats. Andras also gave us a number of other great recommendations that kept us busy for the rest of our time in Budapest. If you're considering a tour like this I think it is best to schedule the tour at the start of your visit to Budapest as it will help you get oriented in the city and give you plenty of great ideas for the rest of your trip.

Fantastic way to see and learn more about Budapest. Balazs was great! Was a great experience driving around Budapest in his beloved Trabant. Had a great knowledge of the city and went out of his way to make sure we had a great time and saw everything we wanted to see and all those hidden gems the city has that you won't see on those other tours. Excellent tour.

Excellent job!. Balazs was excellent today. He was knowledgable, funny, and very friendly all day. Constantly checking to ensure we were having a good time. He did a great job do mixing the popular with the "hidden treasures", which was most appreciated. Thanks again for a great day!

The highlight of the trip. My husband and I were in Budapest for business but had the opportunity to take a tour through the Jewish District with Andras, as well as a visit to his parents' home for a home-cooked meal. Andras was a great tour guide; his tour was thoughtful, showing us some sights only locals would know. He was very knowledgeable and professional while still very enjoyable to spend time with. The visit to his parents' home for lunch was the highlight of our trip; it was a special experience that we will not soon forget. His mom made an incredible meal cooked with love and the atmosphere was comfortable and friendly. We would very highly recommend taking a tour with 'My Personal Budapest' and take advantage of the opportunity to customize it according to your interests.

Tour of Jewish quarter and lunch in a Hungarian home. Very original and informative tour of the synagogue and Jewish quarter of Budapest. The following day a truly wonderful home-cooked meal in a great home setting. An unforgettable experience. Each dish was delicately and subtly flavoured and very different to the average meal you have out. Abundant and fabulous.

Tremendous Trab-antics!. What a splendid end to our four day break in Europe this was! Balazs bought along not only his surprisingly quiet and comfortable AOX for our 3-hour ride, but also the most beautiful weather! :-)Our pick up was prompt and Balazs's passion for, and knowledge of, Trabants (and indeed all things vintage) as well as for Budapest was evident from the start and infectious.. ! I'm not really one generally for looking inside car engines but I even found that interesting!Balazs told us and showed us how he had 'pimped' AOX to include a unique sun roof, horn and easily lifting front seat to enable minimal effort in getting into the back seat ! The subsequent tour was funny and fascinating! We learnt a great deal and despite our Brummie/Midlands accents, I think Balazs learnt a little from us too! His English was better than a lot of English people I know!! Balazs also tailored the tour for us after we advised him that we wanted to incorporate an element of the 'Hidden Budapest' tour. He took us to a wonderful coffee house which we would never have found otherwise! When we eventually arrived at the Hungarian home for the traditional meal which formed the 2nd part of our booked tours, we had only just over an hour to sample the delights and hospitality here. This was entirely our fault and I think on reflection we should have asked for a an earlier hotel pick up ! We loved the food and the experience however, and the airport drop-off afterwards was an excellent value-for-money extra which was very much appreciated and much more fun than a mini-bus or taxi transfer !!Our thanks go to Balazs, to Andras and to Andras's parents for making the day so memorable!! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend MyPersonalBudapest to others, and I do hope the trip to Budapest wasn't my last, as I'd love to try some of the other tours they offer.

Super! Super! Super!. Balazs arrived at our hotel to pick us up for a 3 hour tour of Budapest and for a typical meal with an Hungarian family followed by a transfer back to the airport. He arrived on time and from the moment we met him, we felt at ease and his passion for his Trabants certainly showed. Balazs was extremely knowledgeable and was the perfect guide. He also had a fantastic sense of humour and we laughed throughout the day about various things and learned so much about Budapest. We cannot recommend My Personal Budapest enough. The meal with the Hungarian family was a wonderful experience also. The arrangements beforehand were dealt with efficiently and we feel that the service they provided was exceptional. Thank you so much Andras and Balazs for making our time in Budapest such a memorable one!

A great tour with Balázs. I walked outside my hotel on Saturday to find Balázs and his very clean and shiny Trabant waiting for me. He was extremely friendly and once he found that I was a fellow old car enthusiast he was delighted to show me his car and all the clever modifications he's made to it to make it safer and more usable.As a tour guide he was both highly knowledgeable and very engaging. I learnt a lot and saw plenty that I would never have found or had time to see on my short visit otherwise. We stopped and walked around the market, baths, square and castle district so it wasn't just 3 hours in the car. The car was also superb, Balázs is a great driver and it was a great demonstration of the Trabant.It made my visit even better and I can highly recommend the experience!

Superb guide. Andras was brilliant. Easy to deal with beforehand, met us on time at hotel, showed us really interesting sites including some we would never have found ourselves, and got the balance just right between telling us about things and also having more of a conversation. Also got us where we needed to be on time, took us to some nice places for coffee etc and was good on when we could visit other areas we had not had time for. His English is superb too. Really excellent overall.

Was really hidden Budapest. So often tours that say they show non tourist sites do nothing of the sort but this fulfilled all promises, including a private piano recital and some really interesting art work. Highly recommended.

Great Day Trip To Budapest. We took a day trip to Budapest from Vienna after finding Andras on tripadvisor. He and his driver showed us all the major sites, we had a very nice lunch, visited two of his favorite cafes for tea and coffee. We were very pleased with the tour, the service, the competence. We loved riding around in the Trabant antique car. We highly recommend Andras.

Highlight of trip!!!. So glad I came across this private tour on trip advisor! It was the highlight of myself and my partner's trip. We booked 3 tours in one day. First we met our tour guide Balazs at our hotel and he introduced us to his fabulous Trabant retro style car which we would be travelling in for the first part of the tour! Such a cool funny looking car, felt like we had been transported back in time ! He gave us the lowdown on the history of this car and also that he restores them in his spare time.so nice to see his passion and pride for something that he loves to do and also that he could make a living from it!We went to the five main attractions, he parked up, we walked around took pictures and spoke about the landmarks. After he took us to a beautiful cafe for coffee with antiques adorning the walls and ceiling! That was pretty cool.Would never have found otherwise. Then it was on to our second tour of the day where we met with another tour advisor Attlia, as we were being taken to a charming little arty town north of Budapest called Szentendre! We were thought how to make pottery first, then we walked the cobble lock streets of this gorgeous town admiring the old churches and houses while Attila spoke about its history. He then took us to a marzipan museum! This was the business! Later he took us to an authentic Hungarian restaurant where we ate smokin hot goulash! We barely came up for air..! Another jazzy looking interior. After all that it was time to drive back to Budapest and get ready for our dinner boat cruise on the Danube! A four course meal with live music so relaxing and perfect to finish our busy day. Although we were still full from the goulash so we practically rolled off the boat on our bellies lol Big Thanks to Balazs and Attila for the wonderful day on our private tour! You made our trip :) Love love love Budapest! Hope to return in summer time next!

A fun day. We spent a day with Andras just before Christmas. I don't think he has a lot of families with young children use his services but he was kind and helpful with the children and even spent a lot of time holding the baby :-) We couldn't recommend him more highly.

Not just the same old tourist attraction tour.. My husband and I spent three days in Budapest before hooking up with our cruise up the Danube. The Christmas market in Budapest was in full swing and we loved walking and touring the city landmarks and attractions on our own but we did spend one very enjoyable afternoon with Balazs from "My Personal Budapest". It was our favorite time as Balazs took us to many behind the scenes places that tourists do not frequent. Our tour included both walking and public transportation to get from place to place so except for the fact that my husband carried a camera and we kept looking up at the buildings we felt like we were blending into the culture. We started out on a helopad with a 360 view of both Buda and Pest and a view of a gorgeous tile roof that could not be seen from the street. We covered numerous sites including the last remaining portion of the Jewish Ghetto wall from WWII and a unique ruin pub. Balazs was knowledgeable, personable and was a pleasure to have as a tour guide. I highly recommend this tour company and especially this tour for a unique experience to anyone visiting Budapest.

A tour in a Trabant. What a great way to tour Budapest. Out guide, Balazs, arrived in his own Trabant and what he doesn't know about this little car is not worth knowing. He took us to all if the major locations and demonstrated an intimate and extensive knowledge of Budapest, it's history and it's culture. Balazs is also a very personable young man who had our comfort in mind and recommended places to eat and drink. His English is excellent too. I would highly recommend this tour and do it early so that you can plan places to visit and explore. Tganks BalazsP

Great time in Budapest. After 30 years I returned to Budapest. My wife and I were fascinated by the city, which has recovered the splendor of old times. It has the perfect combination of beatiful location, impressive buildings and plenty of attractions and cozy restaurants to enjoy a perfect weekend. But the best choice was to meet András, who, during a full day, showed his beloved city with true passion, excellent knowledge and very good sense of humour. We really felt like being guided by a friend . We took the combination of Trabant Tour ( great fun in the smallest car you can imagine), Hidden Treasures ( you could never find the atractions he shows) and Home Lunch ( great food at the home of his lovely parents). It was a wonderful experience, can only reccommend this tour and we will for sure trust András in a future visit to Hungary.For Spanish visitors, András does not speak Spanish, but his English is perfect and very easy to understand, even if you are not fluent in the language.

Budapest. We had a great time in Budapest, Hungary with 'My Personal Budapest , private tour'.Our guide was very nice and well informed about all the main attractions.We highly recommend this company to other tourists to Budapest.

Best Private Guide I've Hired. András is a very personable and enjoyable guide. His love for his city, and his deep knowledge of Budapest was apparent as we walked from site to site. We booked both the Hidden Treasures and Tastes of Hungary tours. András picked us up at our hotel, we were five minutes early downstairs, but he was waiting for us. He gave us an overview of our day and then we were off. A lovely breakfast in a spot we never would have found on our own, with fresh coffee, then we were off for many hidden gems, a huge lunch, a river cruise, and the best strudel I've ever had. Throughout the day he suggested other things we could do on our own as well. All of this was included in the low price of the tour. He was FANTASTIC with our boys ages 14 and 11 and involved them throughout the day. When we come back we will definitely book another tour with András.

We had a great time that no one else who we joined traveling with in Budapest could compare with this unique experience.. Atilla was really personable, knowledgable and fun to be around. I felt more like a friend was taking us to see the sites. We had the pleasure of seeing Budapest and Szentendre from a personal perspective. I especially enjoyed Atilla's sense of humor. The car is fun, but very small - I would recommend comfortable clothing to help getting in and out. I wore new jeans that did not have much stretch and my left leg went numb for a bit until I could stretch out (I'm 6'3").

Awesome. Did two tours in Budapest - Trabant in morning and off beaten path in the afternoon. Following day we did morning tour of Szentendre a carming small town. The total of three tours gave us a great feel for the city and we were able to see tons of sights.

Loved the city and truly enjoyed our private walking tour with Balázs. My husband and I stopped in Budapest for just a couple of days. We had set up a walking tour with "My Personal Budapest" just a few days in advance and were very pleased with the prompt e-mail communication from the owner of the company András. We hope to visit Budapest sometime in the future again for a bit longer period and we will be sure to check back with Andras for other tour opportunities. I would recommend this type of personal tour over a group tour if you are able to arrange it. Balazs seemed to know his city well and we really enjoyed of the beaten path tour with him. I give this tour company an A+++

an absolute must. brought budapest to life.. We did the Trabant tour in the morning (Balasz was our driver... I'm sure I spelled his name wrong, but he was knowledgeable and fun). The cars themselves are a peice of history and it was the perfect way to see the major sites of the city. Then we did the lunch in a hungarian home; they were hospitable and the food was TO DIE FOR. She is a fantastic cook, loved all the paprika. Afterwards Atilla took us walking "off the beaten path" to see some hidden treasures of the city. All in all, everyone we encountered was friendly and smart. It's a beautiful city with rich culture and history. You wont be disappointed.

Terrific day with András. We booked András for a full day (10-5) tour, encompassing Szentendre and the wine region, and into which he graciously incorporated a bit of sight-seeing within the city as well. András was prompt, very pleasant, completely fluent in English, and very gracious. He seems to enjoy his work and meeting new people, and he is quite knowledgeable about the city, surrounding, history, etc...We were a group of 5 with some varying interests and András was great about being flexible with what we wanted to do, our schedule within the day, and different levels of interest in museums/shopping/sight-seeing etc... He was a very gracious host. In addition, the people with whom he set up our wine tasting were completely delightful - that afternoon was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.I thought his price was very fair, and while he accepts only cash payment, he can take euro or forint - which made things a little easier for those of us carrying more than one type of currency.I would wholeheartedly recommend him and absolutely would use him again if I'm lucky enough to return to Budapest.

Hungary personalised.... We were very happy with our day tour around Lake Balaton, including wine tasting at the Hernyak vineyard in the Etyek region on our way back to Budapest. The early fog cleared for us to enjoy coffee on the lakeside and lunch in Tihany. Andras is an exceptionally pleasant guide and was comfortable to answer any questions. For us, this gave us great insight into the past, current and future situations faced by Hungary. We could read a history book about Balaton Fured, but our enduring memory is imagining the happy reunification of German families there who had been tragically torn apart by the communist regime (Hungary was the only country that East Germans could travel to during the cold war). If we are able to travel to Europe again, Hungary would be top of our list to revisit. Thanks Andras!

Great Tour with Andras. We had a great full day tour of the Danube Bend with Andras. He was extremely knowledgeable and interesting and customized the tour to our wishes. We visited 3 towns....Szentendre, Visegrad and Esztergom and loved all of them.Andras was very professional and also extremely friendly. He was especially great with our autistic son who had an immediate and special attachment with Andras. Andras is a very patient and terrific individual aside from being a great tour guide.Thank you for a great time. We absolutely recommend Andras and his tours and would book his tours again without any hesitation.

Budapest personalized for us. We chose My Personal Budapest tours from Tripadvisor based on so many positive reviews, and we were very happy that we did! András met us at our hotel and we started the first day with the delightful Trabant tour. This little car is very special and the owner/driver Balázs was eager to share details about it. A very unique and enjoyable tour. We had already seen a few of the main sights so András was quick to customize our tour so that we visited different places, including several spas - we even had a chance to taste the spring water. Our afternoon was a walking tour of hidden treasures of the city such as a "ruin bar", a trip on the Undergroud and some wonderful coffee salons. András took us to some excellent restaurants serving delicious local cuisine, and he recommended numerous places to visit on our own the next day. Two days later we met again to take the Danube Bend tour which was so much more! We enjoyed a visit with a lovely ceramics teacher and tried our hand at making a pot. András drove us through the beautiful countryside to Esztergom and the day was completed with a private piano concert. We would highly recommend András as a tour guide.

A great day in Budapest. We had a fabulous day of exploring Budapest and wine tasting in Etyek with Andras. We booked the Hidden Treasures tour and saw the city in a way we would have been unable to on our own. Helped by beautiful sunny weather, we spent a wonderful afternoon at a local winery. The tour, the tasting and the conversation were top notch. Perhaps we will be lucky enough to get Andras to take us around the next time we are in Budapest. Erin & Leslie

Trabant Tour. I booked this Trabant tour some time before being in Budapest, something I wanted to experience after my first visit to Budapest which I didn't know about at the time ! Had a brilliant/great time exploring the amazing city, we stopped of at various places/point of interests all over the city, Atilla my tour guide very friendly, knows his stuff, very professional and funny he is like a great friend, very helpful too ! A real people's person ! along with his driver of the Trabant ! And the attention got from the Trabant, wow ! :) If not for being in England, working and not much annual leave left, i do this all over again next week ! There is next year when I return and try out other tours offered ! If not for limited time in Budapest I would of tried out another tour ! Besides regretting not staying extra day or 2 would I have done this any other way this time ? Hell no, exceeded my expectations in a positive way ! Very highly recommended tour !

The best way to learn about Budapest. Our group of four was recently visiting Budapest for the first time, and wanted an introduction to the city. The reviews of MyPersonalBudapest were enough to have us book two tours with Andras. Without repeating what everyone else has said, I can vouch for the truthfulness of previous reviewer's sentiments. Both the highlights tour in the Trabants, and the hidden places tour, were fantastic. More important for me, and the rest of our group, was the chance to see the sights through the eyes of a native, one who obviously loves his city and its people. I found the tours to be a refreshing change from the usual colored-umbrella-following crowd.I recommend Andras highly, and without reservation.

Helped me make the most of my brief stay. András was a magnificent tour guide. I only have a brief period in Budapest and András really helped me make the most of it. His knowledge of the city is amazing and his enthusiasm is infectious. I strongly recommend him.

Truly personal, personable, unforgettable!. I contacted MyPersonalBudapest because i wanted a guide before beginning a river cruise. I knew my riverboat, , a new experience for me- would show me the main attractions the following day. Upon my arrival, Attila met my train from Prague,helped with my bags, bought me a doughnut-like pastry whose spelling i cannot replicate, and reassured me that he had checked my riverboat's location, and we could therefore begin discovering the Budapest tourists do not ever see... Unless they have wisely booked MyPersonalBudapest.  I had added and changed some requests prior to my trip, as i wanted to see the Great Synagogue ,which would be closed for a holiday the following day. Attila swung by theJewish quarter and even though I was not able to see the inside of the synagogue, he gave me a glimpse, something my tour did not deliver. We shared lunch at a wonderful art nouveau cafe, explored Alexandra book store's three levels and secrets, and at my request even stopped at a great shoe store whose brand is hard to find in US.  When I return to beautiful Budapest, I will call on MyPersonalBudapest again to efficiently discover more. Thank you so much for the memories!

Andras is the best. Andras is very passionate about his job and gives you a tour filled with interesting and knowledgeable information. We had a great day with him and I recommend anyone of his tours...He also answered questions and was very helpful with suggestions...Thanks Andras...

Great fun in a Trabant. We requested this unique tour shortly before our trip to Budapest. Fortunately Andras kindly accommodated us. Thus, this past weekend, Balasz and his trusty Trabant met us at our hotel. We were very impressed with this young man! He is very personable, knowledgable, and able to discuss many different topics in excellent English. We learned so much about Budapest and Hungary from Balasz. Since we were new to Budapest, we followed the itinerary planned for us; however, we liked how Balasz adjusted the itinerary according to our interests. The tour was a good balance of riding in the Trabant and stopping to see sights. Balasz handled the little Trabant masterfully even in heavy traffic - we felt safe at all times. We were delighted with the high quality of the tour, and unique experience of seeing Budapest by Trabant!

Great Tour!. My husband and I took the Wine Cellar tour, and the Danube Bend tour. We don't usually go for guided tours, but I am so glad we did this one! It was wonderful to drive through the countryside surrounding Budapest. Absolutely beautiful! The beauty of the places we saw was exceeded only by the friendliness, humor, knowledge and energy of our guide, Attila. Even before we were out of the city limits of Budapest Attila pointed out Roman ruins, slowing down long enough for me to quickly snap a picture. At each stop along our route Attila not only showed us points of interest, but also told us the history of the place. The last stop of day was at a family owned winery. This was icing on the cake! The meat and cheese platter was a perfect end to the tour accompanied by the best white wine I have ever had. Thank you to My Personal Budapest, and Attila in particular, for making our trip to Budapest the high light of our year....his was the best anniversary present my husband and I have ever given each other!!

Great experience with Andras!. Andras organized a customized tour for my family (including my 93 year old grandpa!) while they were visiting from Budapest. He was incredibly helpful and responsive throughout planning for their day. From here, my family was continuing on a river cruise and had a tour of the standard Budapest highlights built into that trip. Andras made sure that they saw a different, more personal side of Budapest and everyone raved about his knowledge of the city. He also was incredibly thoughtful of my grandpa, cognizant of his somewhat limited mobility but not letting it influence what sights the group saw. I would absolutely recommend him for your visit!

Two super tours with Andras. There were four of us and my sister has difficulty walking so Andras arranged a van instead of the Trabant to take us through Budapest. He was excellent and showed us the best of Budapest while giving us the history. This tour ended at a little restaurant where we had lunch. I took his suggestion about the "pleated potatoes". I'm a foodie and I NEVER would have ordered this on my own. Absolutely delicious!! Cannot believe how good it was.Next, my friend and I did The Hidden Budapest Tour. This was the best. You have to do the overview tour, but if you have the time, also take this one. I think my favorite place on this one was the ruin bar. So incredibly cool.And the Danube is really blue - especially in Budapest. Loved the city. Thank you, Andras!!

Personal private tour with Personal Best. We had arranged a day tour with ANDRAS while in Hungary. He did a amazing job taking us to Kislang where my Grandmother had been born and lived until immigrating to Canada in 1925. We never would have found this tiny village on our own. Also he had completed some research for us and when we arrived he spoke with the woman at the town hall, she pulled out a record book and found my Grandmother's birth record as well as the age of my Great Grandparents, when she was born. It was a wonderful, heartwarming experience for me. Andras also had organized taking us to Lake Balaton as well as a small vineyard in Etyek. Both experiences left us wanting to see more! Thanks for the wonderful day. If we could suggest anything it would be to slow the tour down a bit, not moving as fast for us older folk:) smelling the roses is more important. Also carrying some water for the ride as well. good luck and see you soon!

The funnest and most unique way to see the amazing city of Budapest.. This tour was excellent. We took the trabant and hidden treasures tours. They were both excellent and a lot of fun. Our guide was Attila and we enjoyed spending the day with him very much. Balazs was great too! Both had great personalities and were very accomodating. The trabant was such a unique way to see the city. The sights on the tour are very interesting and give you a good flavor of Budapest. It was wonderful having your own private guide as well. Would definitely recommend these tours. Good value too.

Best vacation day!. We arranged a tour with "my personal Budapest" which turned out to be our best day in Hungary, so far. Attila, our guide, was friendly, funny, and very knowledgable. We went to Szentendre and really enjoyed the little town, then tried our hand at throwing a clay pot. Gabriell was a great teacher and it was really fun. We also went To Visegrad, Esztergom, and Etyek. I really recommend the wine tasting at the Hernyak Winery. Very friendly, great food, and as someone who is not a wine drinker, it was excellent! Highly recommend this tour and recommend Attila as a guide.

Thank you, András.. We had a great time with András in Budapest last Friday.He is a really good guide, with a lot of knowledge about his City.The communication and the quick answers on our requests before we booked, was highly appreciated.We decided on a 7 hour tour, with car. Started out on a local marked and had breakfast. Then we had a great guided tour around the city for 3 hours, an extremely nice lunch ( we went back to that restaurant), and continued our tour until four o'clock.It was a perfect start for the weekend trip. After the tour we knew how to spend the rest of our time in Budapest.His ability to accommodate us, and his flexibility was perfect. Great value for the money!

Fabulous Budapest Guide. My husband and I were recently in Budapest for a day following a river boat cruise and decided to use a private tour company to try and see things other than the major attractions we had seen the day before with the cruise. Our guide was Attila and we spent a most enjoyable 6 hours with him. We did the Hidden Treasures tour and the Hungarian Lunch tour back to back. Attila spoke wonderful English and not only showed us many "hidden treasures" but also was able to explain the history, culture and geography of his country so we finished our day with him having a much better appreciation for where we had been and what we had seen. The day with Attila was a highlight of our three week trip to Europe. We would highly recommend him as a knowledgeable and entertaining guide for Budapest.

Fabulous Day in Budapest!. We recently went to Budapest for a weekend break from London. Never having been to the city, and with only two days to spend, we wanted to maximize our time and see/do as much as possible. After reading the reviews for MyPersonalBudapest on TripAdvisor, we decided to book a full day out - the Trabant tour, the home lunch, and the Hidden Treasures tour.Balazs picked us up from our hotel in the Trabant, which was very convenient and great fun! We spent the morning exploring the "main" sights of Budapest. We peppered Balazs with a LOT of questions about the history of Budapest, past and present, and were very impressed with how knowledgeable he was! Not only was he knowledgable, but he was also very personable. We really enjoyed hearing about Budapest from a local's perspective, discussing the differences between our cultures, and generally just having a laugh!! It was a gorgeous day out, so Balazs was able to put the top down on his Trabant. This was really fun!We then headed out for the home lunch. The hosts were fabulous, welcoming us into their homes and sharing some DELICIOUS Hungarian food with us. We got to meet others who were on Attila's tour, and had a delicious lunch full of laughs with our tour guides and hosts. We really enjoyed this, and could barely get fit back in the Trabant after lunch because we were so full! We thought that the homemade lunch was a great break between the morning and afternoon tours, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, the delicious meal, and the great company. In the afternoon, we continued on with the Hidden Treasures tour. We went to a variety of sights, relaxed with a coffee in a really neat coffee shop with Communist-era decor, took in some great views, and had a really nice afternoon. Overall, Balazs was a fantastic tour guide. We felt that the tour was well worth the money spent, and commented many times throughout the day how grateful we were not to be on a generic bus tour with 60 other people crowding to hear the guide talk. The personal touches were absolutely fantastic, and we really felt that we came away with a much stronger sense of Budapest, it's people, and it's history.Thanks for a very memorable tour!

Hidden Treasures tour well worth our time. We spent a few hours with Attila, walking and taking public transit around Pest side. He showed us the "hidden treasures" of the city, where typical tour groups may not get to visit. Because of such, it made it that much more memorable. We enjoyed having Attila as our guide. He showed us cafes, museums, bookstore, art gallery, and more. It was raining the morning we had his tour, and we had to miss one stop where one could see the beautiful rooftop of a former bank. To our surprise, as soon as we got back to our hotel, he was already on his way to bring us some refund money because we missed that place. We appreciate his honesty. He also said he had a transit day pass for our family when we first met in the morning. But we already had our pass, and forgot to ask him for his so we could use it the next day.

Intelligent, fun tour. In a city where there is no shortage of tours, this one is very worthwhile and enjoyable. The Trabant tour is very fun. Andras spoke intelligently with information about Budapest I thought he would not know. I also had a great deal of fun talking with Balazs about his pride and joy, the Trabants, and also about 60s and 70s muscle cars of which he was surprisingly knowledgeable given his young years. I also did the culinary tour and enjoyed Andas' selections of delicious meals and snacks. His hidden treasures tour was also very worthwile, and because of my time limitations we weaved that tour into the others for an entremely enjoyable and informative tour. I highly recommend this tour. DO IT!

Fun and informative. We spent a busy 6 hours with Andras and enjoyed every minute of it. We got to see the highlights of the city, get some history, and taste local cuisine accompanied by personalized explanations. We also travelled in a Trabant which was a unique and fun experience - Balazs was very keen on his car and eager to tell us all about it.

Two great days in Budapest. We had two separate tours with My Personal Budapest. The first day, we took the Trabant Tour with Andras. This quirky little car was an attraction itself! Andras showed us the highlights of Buda and Pest, but most impressive was his historical knowledge and deep appreciation of Hungarian culture. I felt as though we not only had a guide, but someone who truly loved his city and heritage. The tour ended with a delightful in-home lunch with Agi, who prepared a lovely traditional meal. The second day, we took the Danube Bend tour with Attila. The visit to the three villages was a perfect counterpart to the tour of Budapest. Atilla was also very well versed in Hungarian history and added so much to each site, castle, ruin and church we visited. I think any of the tours offered by My Personal Budapest would make your visit to Budapest even more special.

Trabant tour with excellent guide. This was just the best way to see Budapest - 3 to 4 hours in Trabant with excellent tourguides. I believe we saw what we wished for and had some good recommadations on Café and Restaurants. We made 3-5 stops on the tour.

A Perfect Day in a Beautiful City. My husband and I spent a wonderful day with Attila, traveling by Trabant while eating our way around the city. Our guide was so very knowledgeable and passionate about his city - his answers to our questions were very thoughtful and appropriately personal. We came away from the day with such a wonderfully positive feeling about Budapest and its future as well as having a need to learn so much more about its' past.

A Perfect Two Days in Budapest!. Andras was recommended so highly on Tripadvisor that I felt we could try two days touring with him...now I wish we had spent the week! However, if you can only do 2 days, I would highly recommend combining these two days as we did for a perfect Budapest experience. Andras, and his trusty driver, Bolesz, in his vintage (and immaculate Trabant), took us all over Budapest to see the major sights the first morning. WIth the open top of the car we were able to enjoy the beautiful buildings all around us. For lunch we had booked his special "lunch with the locals" and that couldn't have been better! Excellent food and a nice chance to relax with local Hungarians. (However, if you are a cook, Agnes has her own tour that would take you to the market to shop, then you return to her apartment to cook the food...next time!) We returned to our hotel anticipating the next day's trip to the countryside...what a fantastic day it was! As usual, Andras had booked perfect weather for us. We drove to their large lake, Lake Balaton, which is a beautiful blue with assorted resort villages dotting it all over. However, he took us to what must have been the most beautiful town to sit for a coffee next to a marina, then walked along the shore, saw their famous Cardiac Hospital, and then continued on to the peninsula village of Tihany where I could have spent quite a few hours. We saw the Benedictine Abbey, bits of the village, and then continued on to the Istvandy winery which was the perfect end to the day. Andras had arranged our lunch and wine tasting which was wonderful in every way...we didn't want to go home! Andras was the best, most personable, private guide we have ever used. His knowledge of history, architecture, music, etc. and where to take you to allow you to feel the heartbeat of Hungary is superb. If you can have two days with him, do the city tours (whatever ones you want) but make sure to visit the countryside for a day, too. The two days combined gave us a great appreciation for this country.

Great !. My husband and I booked Andras from home before setting out on our 23 -day river cruise. He met us at our docking point near the Chain Bridge and spent 3 hours showing us the Hidden Treasures of Budapest. He was very well informed, very fun to spend time with and made our short time in Budapest very special. The walk made us feel up close and personal to this most lovely city. I Highly recommend Andras.
Great one on one adventure. Lots of sights that were very interesting. Went to the wine tour and was fantastic. Great people and service

Great variety of activities. We did so many great things on this tour and I highly recommend it. Prior to the tour I emailed with Andras to discuss what we would do. I had wanted a food tour, but no need to schedule it, there was so much good food included in the tour that I never expected, that it really was a two day food tour in addition to everything else. We did a two day tour. The first day we saw some important sites in Budapest, including the Szechenyi Baths, Chain Bridge, Buda Castle, Citadel, and more. Later we had lunch in Andras' family home. This is an experience you can't get anywhere else. Not only was his family lovely and gracious, but the food was very enjoyable and plentiful. From there we went to a lovely winery where we were fed again. The winemakers were a husband and wife team, their presentation was personal and informative. I will never forget that experience as well. The second day we saw off-the-beaten-trail sites in Budapest: good views, hidden ceiling paintings, the Ruin bar (another highlight, we had the bar to ourselves and the whole place is full of hidden works of art and other ingenious things), and more. Later we walked around ourselves and realized how close all these things are together, but without a guide it would take a lot more time to see so much. In fact, most of the highly rated things on Trip Advisor seemed to have been on our tour. The day started at a fascinating local market with a beautiful meat and cheese plate but we didn't expect it so we'd already eaten breakfast. My husband had a coffee he described as the best he'd had in his life. We also had lunch at a restaurant Pesti Diszno, which turns out to be a restaurant written about in the New York Times with excellent Trip Advisor reviews, we tried three soups (my husband and I shared two) and three main dishes, all very tasty and typically Hungarian. We then had delicious warm pastries at First Strudel House. All of these snacks, admissions, and transportation were included in our tour, which I didn't expect.My only hesitation for giving five stars is that Andras, who is pictured, was not our guide. He is the A list and I didn't realize we wouldn't have him. We had Attilla, who was thoughtful and attentive, he just lacked the gift of gab that you would expect a tour guide to have. Several times I felt that he didn't seem to have enough information to impart and that it was more a string of facts rather than story telling. Several times I felt the conversation got too involved in our jobs and finances, subjects I found especially uncomfortable because of our respective countries' financial disparities. We did really like Attila, and we certainly learned a lot about Hungarian life from him, I just think there's some room for improvement.I highly recommend using My Personal Budapest, though I think the company's name and promo photo may be misleading. This was an unforgettable tour.

Fantastic Experience!. We did both the Trabant city tour and the Danube Bend tour during our time in Budapest. Balazs and his Trabants were a lot of fun, and our guide, Attila, showed us many sites around the city that we might have otherwise missed. The authentic Hungarian lunch was excellent.The Danube Bend tour on our second day was spectacular, and we really enjoyed the wine tasting at the Hernyak vineyard. Andras, our guide, was friendly and knowledgeable. His tours are a great way to experience Budapest and Hungary, especially for those who have never visited before.

Dinner with Local Family. Our group of 8 had a delicious dinner at the home of Andras Novak's parents. (Andras picked us up in our hotel lobby as it is about a 30 minute drive.) The menu was traditional Hungarian food and Mr & Mrs Novak were gracious, delightful hosts. Andras was very well informed on every topic that came up for discussion and we all felt as if we had new friends at the end of the evening. I will recommend this dining experience to all my clients who are travelling to Budapest.

MyPersonalBudapest the Best. On our recent trip to Budapest we took two tours with MyPersonalBudapest, the Trabant and Hidden Treasures Tours. These personal tours were the best we have encountered anywhere. The personal service and friendly atmosphere made it very special and our guide Attila showed us some interesting places in Budapest we could not have seen otherwise. The lunch in a Hungarian home was a highlight with the food and hospitality special. I would recommend these tours to anyone visiting Budapest. You simply won't find better.

Great way to see Budapest in one day. With our tourguide Atilla we went through all the public and less public highlights of the city. In the morning in an excellent Trabant and in the afternoon in a car. Even though the weather was not too friendly, our tourguide was and we had a very good day!

Great Culinary + Main sights + Hidden Gems Tour. Small Improvement for Larger Groups. We took this tour during one of the hottest days of the year in Budapest (101F) - and still enjoyed it very much. So, yes, that's how good it is.We combined the main sights + culinary tour since it did not make sense in my opinion to try to squeeze the main sights tour between breakfast and late lunch. I strongly recommend you do that since everything flows better. We had breakfast at a local market and already started talking about Budapest history, recent events, etc. Then we went for the main sights tour. Everything was covered and questions answered without rush, at a very relaxed pace.One small improvement suggestion for larger groups. We were in two Trabants (cars) and used a radio to communicate between stops. But the radios used are not very clear and the group in the second car sometimes would not properly understand the guide's observations. Therefore clearer radios or some other solution would be better for larger groups.All in all highly recommended.

Absolutely the best tour of Budapest.. Our city guide met us at our hotel, which was extremely convenient, with his immaculate Trabant car. My son and I thoroughly enjoyed Balazs, a Trabant fanatic, showing and telling us the history of this great Eastern European car. We then took a fantastic tour through the streets of Budapest and stopped off at many great attractions including Heroes' Square, the Parliament Building, the Great Market, Spa Baths and the Fisherman's Bastion to name a few. Balazs knew so much information and it was extremely interesting to see his collection of photos that he had brought, showing Budapest many years ago. Going around the City in the Trabant was a fantastic experience and had many other city tour groups checking out our tour! Balazs was so informative and an awesome guide - this is definitely the best city tour we have ever taken. If you are visiting Budapest do not miss this wonderful experience.

Great Tours of Budapest. We had a great day with Andras combining 4 tours into one full day of touring around Budapest. We started with the Trabant Tour (Andras met us in our hotel lobby which made it very easy for us), having a driver also meant Andras was able to talk to us about the sights enroute. Next was the Hungarian Lunch at his parents house which was very authentic, great food and such lovely people! The afternoon sightseeing continued with the Hidden Treasures tour before a Cruise on the Danube. We highly recommend these tours. Andras also helped us purchase a 72 hour pass for the metro and was happy to accommodate any requests including stopping at a Currency Exchange so we didn't have to find one later. The personalised tour means you get to ask the questions about what you are interested in and run at your pace. A great day that we will never forget!

Fantastic off-the-beating-path tour. Attila gave our family of three, including a teenager, the "hidden treasures" tour. It was a wonderful way to see what most tourists don't have the opportunity to experience, as the company has made plans in advance to gain access to these places. Attila was very attentive to our comfort, as the day was very hot and he gave attention to walking and standing in the shade when available. He also instructed the tour in a comfortable pace so that we never felt rushed and were able to enjoy everything at a more relaxing pace. Attila's tour especially captivated our teenage daughter's attention. I can highly recommend this tour, especially for those interested in a more leisurely and eclectic tour.

We are so glad we took the tours!. My husband and I were on holiday in July 2013 in Budapest and hired Andras and company for five tours - The Trabant Tour, The Hungarian Lunch in a Hungarian Home, The Hidden Treasures of Budapest, The Danube Bend Tour and The Winery Tour. Each tour was unique, personable and definitely well worth it - our favourite was the Winery Tour. We combined it with the Danube Bend Tour, which we did first, and then finished with a late afternoon tour with a tasting of five wines and a scrumptious cold plate on the stone patio deck overlooking the vineyard - a memory to last forever!THANK YOU

The best way to see Budapest. We took a Trabant tour of Budapest and the Hidden Gems tour of Budapest with Balazs. He was a total delight but most importantly he gave us 2 wonderful tours of Budapest. He was very knowledgeable and as a result I feel like I came to appreciate Budapest on a much more intimate level. I also felt like we were able to see and do so much more than we would have been able to on a big tour.

A really interesting and educational day. We spent a great day with Andras in June. For the morning we did the Trabant tour, and in the afternoon the Hidden Treasures. Andras also kindly arranged a private concert in the home of an excellent concert pianist. Throughout the day Andras answered our many questions in excellent English, with patience and humour. After telling him we were interested in bakeries he re-shaped the day to take in some of his local favourites, translating for us, and guiding us on some of the delicious products for sale. This was entirely above-and-beyond our basic requirements, and showed that he is very willing to go the extra mile for clients. The Trabant was a great attraction, and our driver was a charming man. Despite being rather tall people, we all fitted in easily enough. The personalised piano concert was the highlight for my partner. We could request any classical music we liked and have it played (without notes) before our eyes. Very impressive. Andras's knowledge extended from current affairs to history, politics, architecture and more. We would highly recommend his company for a real insight into this fascinating city.

The best way to explore Budapest and the Danube River towns. My husband and I just returned from a two week trip to Amsterdam, Prague, and Budapest. The two days that we spent with Attila from MyPersonalBudapest were among the best days of our trip. I began by emailing Andras to create itineraries for two days. Initially, I wanted to tour Budapest on Sunday and do the Danube River Bend Tour on Monday. Andras suggested that we switch our tours around as many places such as the Great Market in Budapest are closed on Sunday and we'd miss out. After several emails, our days were set.On the first day, Attila met us at the apartment which we were renting. He was prompt and arrived in his personal car which was clean and well maintained. At first we thought Attila was a bit reserved and quiet, but we were quite wrong (in a good way!) He spoke perfect English and had a great sense of humor, offering us terrific insights into the way of life of Hungarians. Attila taught us a great deal of history filled with anecdotes along the way. Clearly, he has a great love and pride of his native Hungary.We took off to do the Danube River Bend tour and Attila was kind enough to search for an ATM for us on the way, even standing nearby and watching as we used the machine. Our first stop was Szentendre. We arrived early in the morning, just as everything was opening, with few tourists around. Attila asked what kind of art we enjoyed (as this is an artist's town) and took us to the shops that reflected our interests. We enjoyed the winding, narrow roads and Attila's explanation of why they were built that way. (I'll let him explain that to you.) The shops were lovely and Attila was patient as both my husband and I took a multitude of photos and browsed to see if there were items which we wanted to buy. We went into a beautiful old Serbian Orthodox church and Atttila explained the customs and history, while giving us tips on Hungarian pronunciation! We then went into the Szabo Marzipan Museum, which was quite interesting! (All tickets were included in the price that Andras had set.) From there we went on to the town of Visegrad, where we saw a castle and breathtaking views of the Danube and the river valley. Next, we traveled to Esztergom, where we visited a stunning cathedral. Below the castle was a restaurant where we ate a delicious French lunch (as it was Bastille Day). (Lunch was at our own expense, which had been explained previously.) As it was Sunday, there was a mass in the cathedral and Attila told us that we must hear the organ play, but he was not certain when it would begin. As we walked outside, admiring the view, Attila repeatedly checked inside for us to see when the organ playing would begin. He ushered us in right on time and it was indeed splendid. I'll also add that Attila was quite helpful in showing my husband and I spots to take the best photos from. It was an informative, relaxing day that we just loved, and we would recommend this the Danube Bend tour highly. We almost took a bus tour and are so glad that we did not. Oh, and we even drove into Slovakia to see the view of Hungary from there! Very cool!On the next day, Monday, Attila met us again at 9AM and brought us around the corner to where Balazs had his Trabant parked. What a lovely young man and what a fun car! He actually made the top into a convertible by himself. Balazs gave us a great explanation about the history of the car model and my husband had fun looking at the engine with him and comparing it to the Volkswagen Bugs that he had long ago.The morning was spent with Balazs driving and Attila guiding. The banter between them made the ride even more fun. We saw great sights (you can read about them in the previous reviews - I had read all 180 of them before booking this tour, which Attila found hard to believe, but it was true!) and once again, Attila was a wealth of information and so pleasant to be with. We never felt rushed at all.We went back to Attila's car, said goodbye to Balazs, and then hopped back into Attila's car for a drive to the countryside to have lunch with Andras's parents. They were lovely, welcoming us with Palinka and appetizers, and then serving a delicous lunch of vegetable soup, Lecso (stew) and roasted chicken, followed by raspberry cake.We headed back to Budapest, dropped off the car, and took public transportation to see the Hidden Treasures of Budapest, including a ruin bar which I requested that Attila take us to. I'll add that I had mentioned in my email to Andras that I was a bit concerned about too much walking due to a foot injury, and Attila offered to drive us for the afternoon tour to lessen the walking that we'd have to do. Fortunately, that was not necessary, but Attila's kindness and concern were evident. The Hidden Treasures tour was fun (we were a bit tired by then but we did enjoy it) and we saw places that we never would have found on our own. Andras clearly has good connections, even enabling Attila to get us into a famous mansion on a day that it was formally closed!By the time we were dropped off at our apartment at day's end, we felt like we had made a good friend and were sorry to say goodbye after our two days! I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting the delightful city of Budapest. Best regards to Attila, and I do hope you find what you are looking for. ;)

Great Way To Get To Know Budapest. My friend and I spent the morning with Andras on the Hidden Treasures tour and it was one of the highlights of our entire trip! Andras is extremely personable, great English, and being raised in Budapest, a true understanding of the city. Highly recommended!

Com oito e com oitenta - With eight and eighty. My mother turned 83 in Budapest and this trip was the perfect way of celebrating it. Our guide Balazs gave us a personalized city tour made of historical references but also full of fantastic stories and happenings that my 10 years old son enjoyed, such as the fountain that stops when you command our the shinning bolls of a statue horse. He also was attentive, understanding and we feel like visiting with a friend, not like tourists. The impression was completed by our lunch in a Hungarian House. We were most welcomed and the food was delicious. My son is skinny but ate a lot. My mother and our hostess, Giselle, don’t speak English, and even so we had a brilliant and alive conversation.Budapest and MyPersonalBudapest gave us memories to treasure.

Excellent Guide for Hidden Budapest. We had a n excellent tour with Attila walking around Budapest seeing parts that you might not generally see. Probably my favorite part was walking into one of their famous "Ruin" bars which I probably would not have done if not for this tour. My daughter had to change her travel plans at the last minute and this company was nice enough to rearrange our tour and move the day from Saturday to Sunday! The day was exceedingly hot and we wanted to show my daughter the Castle Hill area and Attila was nice enough to drive us up there (not part of the tour). After doing one of the larger free tours we were glad that we made the commitment to take smaller personalized tours such as this one for the remainder of our trip in eastern europe!

Great personal tour. Tour was wonderful, as was our young driver balazs.he loves his car, city and job so nothing is too much trouble. He took us to a wonderful cafe which had not been on the itinerary but we chose to skip the central market hall as we had already been there. He gave us lots of tips on other things to do whilst in budapest. Thank you sooo much will recommend to all our friends

A must do !. I am not even sure where to start this review - if I could rate it above Excellent I would. Balazs was waiting for us at the hotel on our first day in Budapest. After explaining the details of his Trabant, we piled into the car and were off ! There is no finer way to see the city then with a local tour guide who was charming and very attentive. After seeing the sites, we booked the hidden treasures tour for the afternoon. It is amazing what you can see if you are not trying to figure out where you are on a map and what to do next. Balazs lead us around. It was a great day and truly the highlight of our trip. Thanks Balazs for making the day so memorable and special ! If traveling to Budapest - use this service - you will be smiling for weeks with great memories !

Lots of fun! Great tour and great tour guide, Balazs. I was a little worried at first when I read all of the great reviews of andaras and then found out we would have a different guide because he was busy. Fears were unfounded as BalazsI was exceptional. Great knowledge, inquisitive, fun, caring, warm and friendly. I love taking personal tours because you can have great conversations about the region, culture, history and of course, restaurant and other recommendations. These guys are great. The trabant tour was so fun and the sights memorable.

The People Factor. We chose My Personal Budapest to experience life in and around Budapest in a unique manner and we were certainly not disappointed. Only a few moments after meeting Andras in out hotel, we felt comfortable in his company and eager to embark on a custom-designed tour of the Danube bend, complete with a wine-tasting in the afternoon. The people you meet on this tour - including, of course, Andras - are what makes the day so memorable. We will never forget shaping our first clay bowl under the expert guidance and encouragement of Gabrielle. Smiling, vibrant Gabrielle. Every moment spent with Andras - strolling through the cobbled streets of Szetendre, gazing at the flooded Danube from a scenic overlook, or simply driving from place to place - was filled with open, intense, and sometimes even philosophical conversation. In itself, a rarity in these days of superficiality. Yet again, during the wine-tasting, the encounter with Valerie was so genuine. Filled with admiration for what she and her husband had created in less than 20 years following their escape from Serbia, we felt moved by her tale. Another person along our way whom we will always remember. I mustn't omit the mention of the delicious cold plate we were served, the good wines we tasted and the exclusive hilly location of their vineyards. It was a day - and three very special people - to remember!

Best Tour in Budapest!. This is by far the BEST tour I have had so far!!! Honestly, Andras has given me such a fresh view of Budapest...My husband and I were in Budapest for less than 2 days in May. We had arranged 3 tours together with Andras: Trabant tour in the morning, Hungarian lunch in a Hungarian home, and The hidden treasures of Budapest. The total cost was 220 euros. I initially thought it was a little pricy, but trust me, at the end of the day, I felt it was totally worth it!The tour with personal, had a very nice pace, and was tailored to our interest. The Trabant tour was fun and took us to a lot of places that would have taken too long to get to by foot. I particulary loved the lunch because it was intimate and really gave me a sense of how locals live their lives. Not to mention that the lunch was so yummy because it was made by a lovely professional chef! The afternoon walk tour was relaxing. Andras took us to a lot of local places that tourist would have never discovered. Additionally, we were able to ride the subway and the bus, and take a little break here and there in the market or charming cafteria.What more can I say? If you ever consider a tour in Budapest, this is it! You won't find anything better than this. Perphaps I will go back for another tour with my family some day...

The Guiding Light. Sometimes, what’s left out of travel guides is more interesting than what’s put in. That’s what Andras Novak specializes in, and he delivers it faster than Domino’s.
