We then went to the home of Agnes where she prepared a traditional Hungarian lunch, initially we were unsure about this but the meal was lovely and had even prepared a vegetarian option for me,again we were immediately put at ease by Andras and Agnes and we had a nice and relaxing lunch. Andras then took us on the metro to visit many more sites with the hidden treasures tours, they were certainly treasures as they were things that you would not have found on your own,the market,ghetto wall, ruin pub and many more.These tours are a must and definitely value for money. I can't wait to visit again with my family next year and I will definitely be organising one or two of the many tours that "mypersonalbudapest" tours offer. Thank you again Andras for a truly wonderful Budapest experience.

An excellent experience in the Danube Bend with Andras. My wife and I had just arrived in Budapest following a 2 week river cruise beginning in Amsterdam. Honestly we were a little "local guide tired out". However, we booked Andras for his Country Side Tour of the Danube Bend and Etyek wine tasting on May 15, and had a great time. We visited the charming little towns of Szentendre, Visegrad, and Esztrogom, had a fanastic lunch in underground the restaurant operated by the church in Esztrogom. Andras combined a great mix of the present, historical, and local flavor for a great day. We finished the day with a wine tasting in Etyek with a cold plate dinner of Hungarian delights. It was the best tour we had during our 3 weeks in Europe. We would certainly recommend to anyone spending time in Budapest to book a tour with Andras Novak.

Beautiful Budapest. We spent a very memorable afternoon with Andras showing us the fabulous sights of Budapest, from Castles to Markets. Andras and his driver Bolash, and the amazing car were great fun and made it a very special visit for us.

The highlight of our time in Budapest. My mother and I recently spent a day touring Budapest with Andras - what a memorable day! Andras customized the tour for us so that it covered some of the tourist highlights of Budapest along with some of the city's hidden treasures, followed by lunch at his parents' home.Andras was very knowledgeable and we immediately felt at ease with him. He provided great information on all the sites we visited and even modified the tour as we went in order to better accommodate our wishes.While the whole day was wonderful, the absolute highlight was having lunch with Andras and his parents. Being of Hungarian descent, we loved the food and the company. Andras' mother cooked a meal that was just like what my grandmother used to cook, and I know my mother enjoyed the Hungarian conversation (do not let this deter you though - Andras also speaks perfect English). We truly felt as though we were among family and were sad to have to leave! This isn't like the cookie-cutter bus tours that you see all over Budapest. This tour was personalized and even better than we had imagined it would be. We highly recommend that you book a tour with Andras if you are interested in seeing the real Budapest.Thank you Andras and family for a wonderful and memorable day.

Don't Miss This Tour!. We also were part of the river cruise group who spent the day with Andras. He was a marvelous guide! His English was excellent and his professionalism and charming personality only added to an already great experience. Andras' knowledge of his country's history helped us to appreciate this tour even more. The lunch with his parents was very enjoyable. The food was wonderful and the hospitality even better. We felt so welcome in their home. Every aspect of this day was planned to ensure that we experienced the best of Budapest. If you have only a short time in Budapest, be sure to spend it with Andras to get the very most from your visit to this lovely city!

Best of the Best. We just returned from a magnificient river cruise from Budapest to Passau with an extension in Prague. The entire trip was outstanding but - the highlight of the entire two weeks was the day we spent with Andras in Budapest. We could not have asked for a more pleasant and knowledgeable guide. Andras customized a tour for nine of us which was full of information and attractions from 9 am to 10 pm. Had we been smart, we would have booked a second day with him although the information he provided us with on the first day did enable us to navigate well on our own the second day. The lunch served by Andras' mother was the best food we had throughout our trip and the hospitality of Andras' father could not have been more welcoming. The evening tour and dinner at a winery outside of Budapest provided another wonderful meal and the opportunity to see some of the countryside outside of Budapest. I have been reaping the benefits of travelers by reading through Trip Advisor information for years (I found Andras through Trip Advisor) and never thought I had any thing excellent enough to fully recommend. So, for my first post on Trip Advisor, if you are going to Budapest, be sure to include Andras Novak in your plans. www.mypersonalbudapest.com Ellen Stephen, Greer, SC: Ken Baerwalde, Ft. Mill, SC

The Best Tour You Could Ever Wish For. My wife and I booked a tour with Andras. We couldn't have asked for a better tour and had a fanstatic time. Andras was a man of faith, intregity, and professionalism and had a vast and deep knowledge of Budapest, ranging from the 100's to 1,000's years of history, to the Nazi's, to the Communist, and then onto more modern times. Andras met us at our hotel right on time and arranged for a trubant (sp?) to take us around. If you're like me, you may not know what a trubant is, well, it's a east German car. It's very tiny and was a blast driving around Budapest in to see all the major sights. Andras' driver was excellent and knew how to manuver around the city in such a way where we were never delayed and it was truly door to door service. He would drop us off at a site and when we were done, he would be waiting for us, so we didn't waste any time waiting around. We spent the entire morning driving to all the main attractions on the Pest side and then onto the Bud side of Budapest. The architure and vibe of the city is magnificent. We really only had one full day to see Budapest and it is quite spread out, and Andras took us places where we would have never been able to see on our own (from a time perspective, as well as just not knowing where certain things were). Some of the highlights of the tour included the Opera House, Parilment, City Park (where the thermal baths are a unique experience in and of themselves), we drove by mansion after mansion on the Andrassy Bouvlvard, visted a very grand, quaint, and charming coffee house, the Bud side castle or palace, the beautiful cathederal, Fisherman's Banstion & the Citadell (where the view of Pest was breathtaking). We couldn't have had a better time. That was only the morning part of our tour. Around 1PM Andras took us to his parents house for lunch. His parents were warm, loving and simply delightful and made you feel right at home. The lunch was excellent. We started off with a Tarragon Chicken soup with dumplings (we each had at least 2 - 3 bowls of it because it was so good), baked chicken and roasted duck with a nice sauce, paprika potates that were out of this world, and purple cabbage. It was authentic and wonderful lunch. Then it was out to the garden for some homemade apple strudel. Everything was top notch and we just fell in love with his whole family. Then it was off for the treasure hunt. I hadn't really thought about what it entailed, but when we left his parents house he they gave us a questionaire and Andras drove us back to Bud and had us go out and expolre the city on our own for severl hours and meet back up with him at the coffee shop we went to in the morning. The treasure hunt took us through Bud and Pest and we learned more and more about this beautiful city. We ended up on the bus, trams, and the metro. By the end of the treasure hunt we felt like we really knew our way around city and really got to experience it. After we met up with Andras at the coffeeshop and talked about our adventures, he then took us to a Ruin Bar (because I wasn't really sure what one was, but had read a bit about them in some tour books or on-line). We'll it was a great way to end the day because it was one of the most eclectic and unique bars I have ever been to in my life. It had a lot of art and fun stuff througout the place. It is hard to explain so you'll just need book a tour with Andras and experince it for yourself. Our day with Andras was probably one of the most enjoyable days of our vacation and believe me we went to some pretty amazing places througout Poland, Hungary and the Czek Republic. If you're going to Budapest make sure you book a tour with Andras because he'll make sure you have the best time of your life!! It was simply amazing!!! Doug Hope & MariluzArlington, Texas

Wow wow and once again WOW. I was fortunate enough to have the opportunity to go overseas with my wife on her business trip to Budapest, Hungary.So once I knew where we were going I jumped on the net and started looking for things to do and places to go as anyone might do.I was so lucky to find on Trip advisor “MypersonalBudapest” with András Novák who was a saint from heaven. He took all the trouble out of organising my trip in Budapest. He was courteous, professional and extremely knowledgeable and of course he made my experience a very fun and exciting one.Being South African I didn’t want to do the normal touristy thing by being a number on a large bus and herded along like a bunch of sheep. I wanted a one on one tour with someone who knew his country and would show me places that aren’t on the normal touristy routes. Let me tell you guys was I in for a wonderful surprise. He blew me away with the wealth of info in and around Budapest. He took me to places I would never have seen or heard of. I had two days of awestruck beauty in and outside of the city and learned so much of the history with all the information from András. I would recommend András from MypersonalBudapest any time as he is willing to go the extra mile for you on your trip to Budapest.Many ThanksMark Assante

The very best way to see and understand Budapest. My Personal Budapest offer a personal guided tour. You are presented with options and you choose what you would like to see and do. Andras, the owner and our guide was fantastic in helping us select the options. My wife, our son who studies in Budapest at Central European University and I did the two day tour with Andras. On the first day we toured Budapest in Trabant cars; had lunch in a Hungarian Home and then a Piano recital by Hungarian piano master Mr. Adam Fellegi in his home. The second day in the morning we saw 10 Hidden Treasures of Budapest and then went into the countryside and did a tour of the Danube bend. These were two full days but what fun!The Trabants were a hit wherever we went, the lunch with Andras' parents was wonderful and his parents made us feel like family. The piano concert by Mr. Fellegi was moving and unbelievable as he played his Steinway piano.The second day was equally wonderful - we saw Hidden Treasures that our son didn't even know existed and the Danube Bend tour was great and a wonderful opportunity to see the countryside.I can not say enough good things about Andras and My Personal Budapest. I highly recommend Andras to REALLY see BudapestElbert48

Andras arranged and gave our friend a free birthday cake!!. This tour gave us a different experience, something out of the norm. Basically, the tour was tailored to our needs. Since we joined the segway tour already, which covered the inner pest area, we then asked Andras to arrange for us to see Buda areas instead. During the morning, we went to castle hill, margit island, galert hotel and spa, fisherman's bastion, and mathias church, also saw the budapest palace on the way up the hill. Then we had lunch at Andras parent's place (his mom cooks delicious hungrarian cuisines!), it was our friends birthday, so we asked if andras could arrange for a cake and we will pay him, however, he said it was free of charge, and a gift from them to us! How lovely. Then after that we opted for the 10 hidden places to visit which are not mentioned in the guide books. Overall the experience was good, especially the lunch, the BUDA visit in the morning was a bit rush as we wanted to see a lot in a short hour, Id say skip margit island. And visit PEST area with Andras would be a better option rather than doing the 10 hidden places. Some places we visited was a bit draggy, however we loved the cafes visit, very unique indeed. And the tour guide who was with us (Attila, a friend of andras) was very good, he dropped us at the shoes of danube and waited for us as requested (he worked over time!) - this place is a must visit, especially towards the evening when lights are lit up - breathtaking! Thank you Andras and family!

An excellent tour of Budapest that left nothing out. Our tour of Budapest was one of the best private tours we have had on our journey through Europe. András was knowledgeable and personable, relaxed and confident. From the ride around the city in his friend Balaz's Trebant through the walking tour of the city to the magnificent meal with his parents at their house, this will be a tour Rick & I will not forget in a hurry. We would highly recomend András's tour to anyone who wants to learn about Budapest and see things not normally seen by the standard tourist. Thanks András, we wish you every success and do hope one day you will visit New Zealand to see our part of the world.Sheree K

An amazing day in Budapest. We met Andras on a snowy morning in what was once the Jewish center of Budapest. We were in the city from Philadelphia to visit our children who are living in Budapest for the next two years. From the beginning, we could tell how knowledgeable Andras was. He took us to the former Jewish ghetto and surrounding sites. We also discussed resent Jewish life before entering the grand synagogue for a separate tour of the sanctuary and the museum. While the snow and cold somewhat limited our "outside" walking, it did not hinder an otherwise great day. We took every advantage of the tour, including a wonderful "authentic" Hungarian lunch with Andras and his family. We were made to feel as if we were old friends - terrific food and interesting conversation, with Andres serving as guide/son/translator, shifting roles as required. After lunch, it was back in the car to resume the tour. The afternoon provided us with a rich experience, as the weather improved enough for us to take full advantage of all the major sites in the city - including some that were hidden from the regular tourist stops. at the end of the day, we were returned to the home of our children, much richer and wiser in the ways and culture of the city.

Winter Magic. Andras is a knowledgable guide, his English excellent and the feel for what is attractive to see in the city is great. You cannot get this on the city tour. Excellent combination of touring in the car and walking. Coffee shops are beautiful. Great introduction to the city with a personal touch.

An Enchanting Day in an amazing City full of history and culture!. Our time spent in Budapest covered both parts of the city with an excellent friendly and knowlegeable guide who gave us a one day overview of the important key sights. We also stopped along the way for personal interest and had time for taking photos, shopping and had a delicious lunch in a lovely restaurant. Budapest is a great bargain for travelers and even in January there is a veil of beauty that is cast over this beautiful city. I felt safe and can recommend this tour to everyone based on my experience. We definitely plan to go back in the future because of everything Budapest has to offer.
Great Time!. We had a great experience in Budapeste! The City is amazing, and this tour perfect, because mixed knowloge and some fun! I loved!
The BEST in Budapest!. We had a wonderful time and learned so much about Budapest and the history of Hungary. We hope to come back in the near future for a longer time. Thank you Andras.

An Amazing Tour. My husband & I took a "Retro plus Tour" with Andras Novak the second day we were in Budapest. Not only was Andras personable & knowledgeable but he introduced us to amazing places in Budapest, that we later visited again on our own. At lunch time, we enjoyed a delicious Hugarian meal with his parents. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone looking at seeing the 'real' Budapest.

Don't miss a tour with Andras. Sadly I only found out about Andras the night before I was leaving for Budapest. I quickly dropped Andras an email with our hotel contact information and when we would be available and hoped for the best. Well, as it worked out...I did get the best....Andras! With our limited time Andras put together a driving tour around Budapest and got in more than we could have ever hoped for. I was traveling with someone who has difficulty walking and instinctively Andras arranged the tour to meet a limited walkers needs. We learned, we saw , we enjoyed! My only regret was that we missed having lunch at the home of Andras parents. We had already booked a tour through our cruise line, our mistake...we had already learned so much more from Andras...and we missed a great meal. Don't make the same mistake we did....do all of your Budapest tours with Andras. The price is reasonable, the service is outstanding and you get so much more for your time and money. Not only will you see and do things with Andras that you will never get from a tour bus, he also sees to your comfort and safety. A street vendor was being too pushy to buy their wares and Andras stepped right in and told them in a firm but polite manner to back away. The climbing on and off of a tour bus got old quickly, Andras with a private car and door to door service is the only way to go. In the end, we felt we had more of a feeling for Budapest than another 8 days filled with cruise line tours in 3 more countries. The difference was because of Andras. He really is the best.

Our Best Day In Budapest!. My wife and I came to Budapest only for a short weekend to celebrate the new year. With limited time, we wanted a tour that would show us the sights (obviously!) but also give us the best impression of everyday life in Budapest. Andras provided all that and more. We booked two half day tours. Day one, we were taken to see the local sights and the "hidden treasures" of Budapest. This was all great. But day two was what really stuck with us. Andras met us early and took us to Szentendre, a beautiful artisan village on the Danube Bend. We visited a ceramic shop in the home of a local family. This was no ordinary tourist stop. The couple there were warm and inviting, and after a brief demonstration on the pottery wheel, they gave us an opportunity to try it for ourselves. It certainly wasn't as easy as it looked and I soon found myself making a mess of things! But after some more encouragement and patience on their part, we were each able to produce a somewhat acceptable ceramic dish. Great fun and some good laughs. After this we took a stroll through the village, with Andras giving us a brief history of the area and also stopping at the local Christmas food carts to explain the foods available and the traditions behind each. Interesting stuff.The highlight of our day (actually our trip) was stopping at the home of Andras' parents for a traditional Hungarian lunch. Again, this was no ordinary tourist stop. Andras' parents graciously invited us into their home (on New Year's Eve, no less) with a warm greeting to go along with a few glasses of palinka. Think of it as a Hungarian grappa....burns going down but warms you all over! After this, we settled in for our lunch. My wife and I loved the restaurants in Budapest, but this was BY FAR the best meal we had during our stay, made all the more pleasurable by the warmth and kindness of Andras and his parents. We were told that it is different each time, so the only thing you need to know is that it was all delicious!After lunch and a great dessert, we said goodbye to his parents, and Andras returned us to our hotel, where we promptly cancelled our NYE dinner reservation as there was little chance we could even think of eating for the rest of the day! Also, a half day tour turned out to be from around 9am until after 3pm, making this an excellent value as well. Most places, this would constitute a full day. Excellent, excellent experience, and not to be missed if you find yourself in Budapest.Andras, thank you for providing a truly memorable experience and give our warmest regards to your parents. "Boldog uj evet!!!"

Wonderful time in Budapest. The best way to go around a city is with a local! We enjoyed so much every moment of it! We ate a marvelous food at Andras's parents, the vineyard he took us to is great, the ride on the trabant was very funny! We highly recommend!!

A wonderful day to remember. We just returned from our family Christmas trip to Europe. We had never been to Budapest and hired Andras to show us around his city. We had a wonderful day. Unfortunately the weather did not cooperate as we had hoped (it limited our views) but it was still incredible.Andras is full of information. He speaks english very well and was thorough and easy to understand. He covered a lot of ground with us during the course of the day. Our favorite moment being when he took us to his parents home for a home cooked hungarian lunch.his parents welcomed us with open arms and served us on of our favorite meals of the trip. his mother doted over us to make sure we ate enough. With a 20 & 22 year old sons who came with us she wanted to make sure they got 'enough'. :0) She is a fabulous cook and we had such a wonderful time.The afternoon was filled with a walking tour and we covered a lot of ground. I cannot think of a better way to get a 'feel' for the city than to hire a local guide. I highly suggest Andras.

Tour that you must do to really know Budapest. Last weekend we had a Budapest tour with MyPersonalBudapest.We have arranged a Trabant tour (pritty funny staff), a home made lunch (the food was very good and the family is very nice and full of hospitality), and a hidden treasures of Budapest tour (we realy saw that you will never see usually) with our guide Andras.His tour and the time together helped us to understand more about the Hungarian culture, the local life of the city and the connection between past and present day in Hungary.His tour was more an educational city, and cultural tour flavoured with a personalized character than "just" a sightseeing tour in "group under umbrella".As we were searching for personalized tours and experiences with longer-lasting travel memories, his tour proved to be a right choice.If this is the case for you too, we fully recommend for you to contact him!

The best way to experience the real Budapest!. We LOVED our time in Budapest with Andras! We spent two days together. The first morning we did a tour of the city in a Trabant. Andras' friend provides the car and acts as driver. His enthusiasm for his car was evident and it is such a quirky car that it even attracted the attention of locals!After getting a bit orientated with the morning tour we then headed to Andras' parents for lunch. We were greeted so warmly and really treated as special guests. They are such a charming and delightful couple - it was an honour and a pleasure to visit their home. And then there was the food, wine and palinka! Andras' mother is a wonderful cook - we enjoyed lunch immensely. In the afternoon we did the city discovery tour which had us on and off public transport and in and out of local cafes and shops seeking help from locals with our 'tasks'. This was a great way to experience their friendliness and willingness to help the 'tourists'!In the evening Andras saw us onto an evening cruise along the Danube - so beautiful at night!The next day Andras took us to Szentendre where we met the loveliest couple who gave us the opportunity to try our hand on the pottery wheel. It was heaps of fun and afterwards we had a stroll through the gorgeous village. After this it was back to Andras' parents house for lunch again - an absolute highlight and it was with real fondness we said good-bye to them.Our last few hours with Andras were spent at a family run winery outside of Budapest. Our very engaging hostess explained about winemaking in Hungary and what they are working to achieve with their winemaking. We tasted a delicious selection of wines and had another beautiful meal here. Andras was a great guide. He was very knowledgable but delivered information about the history and life in Budapest in a relaxed and conversational way. It was really like touring around with a friend of a friend. He made life easy for us. He met us at our hotel each day. He was considerate and flexible about our itinerary. I think anyone who wants to experience more than just the main sights of Budapest and get a real feel for life in Budapest should organise a tour with My Personal Budapest.

Absolute must do for visitors to Budapest. The free walking trips are a great way to see the main tourist attractions of central Budapest but Andras provides a very economical way to see and experience life in Hungary away from the city centre. My wife and I are retired folk from Australia and we were on our first visit to Europe. We hired Andras for one and a half days and we had the most amazing time. On day one we drove to a small town outside of Budapest called Szentendre where we experienced a hands on pottery workshop before wandering around this pretty town renowned for its art and craft production. We then drove to his parents home for a wonderful traditional Hungarian lunch - his Mum and Dad were great company and the food was excellent. The day concluded with a visit to a winery where we were provided with a very informative tour of the property and feted with numerous wines to taste along with some sumptuous food. Day two was a half day walk around parts of Budapest to visit places that are not listed in the tour books or covered by the walking tours. We finished with lunch at a very traditional Hungarian cafe that most visitors would not find.Andras is a great guide and will formulate an itinerary to meet your wishes. He is extremely friendly, very knowledgeable and reliable. An absolute must if you want firsthand experience of Hungarian life.

Absolute highlight of our 14 day European vacation - don't miss this rare and wonderful touring opportunity!. This is an absolute must while visiting beautiful Budapest. Andras provided a rare and wonderful touring experience we will never forget. He is a charming young man that made us feel like we were visiting Budapest with an old friend. His knowledge and passion for the history, culture, and architecture of the area was amazing. He customized everything to meet our requests and exceeded our expectations in every way. The tour ended with a delicious meal at his parents home and it was clearly evident where Andras gets his wonderful charm. His parents were so relaxed and welcoming, it felt like family dinner. This was truly the highlight of our trip. Thank you Andras for a very unique and personal way to experience lovely Budapest.

Professional and friendly tour guide. András is very professional tour guide: answers quickly to emails and was punctual and knowledgeable during our tour. He gave us a brief but concise history of Hungary, and brought us into the life of a hungarian by sharing well-chosen stories about the people and country. His unique tours show you a beautiful glimpse of Hungary you would never see or know otherwise. András is highly qualified in his line of work- he took me and my boyfriend through Szentendre, the Danube bend, Visegrád, Esztergom and even Slovakia. Each city had its own charm and had particular attractions to see. All the cities shared a picturesque setting, welcoming a more relaxing pace from the hustle and bustle of Budapest. La piece de resistance of the day was the wine tour in Etyek. We were taken to a private estate of a family run vineyard. The family was very welcoming and friendly. They explained everything from how they produced the wine, to shipping it out to restaurants- all while making sure our wine glasses were never empty. This particular vineyard had a Michelin star restaurant buying their wine, so you can imagine the high quality of wine. After a tour of the wine cellar we were brought up to the kitchen which was cozy and elegantly decorated with vintage Hungarian decor. Sitting by the fireplace with a glass of fine wine in hand, enjoying tasty salami's, cheeses and homemade bread was an experience which will forever stay in our memories. Thank you kindly to András for his carefully chosen tours of a hidden, understated Hungary.

A surprising and unique experience. Andras delivered everything that he advertised regarding the hidden treasures of Budepest. . Beautiful architecture, ( art nouveau) unique coffee houses, and a wonderful homemade stuffed cabbage lunch . ( we were hesitant on this one, but it turned out to be one of the best meals of our vacation- and a true taste of Hungary) This was our last stop and it was great to do something other then the traditional tourist sightseeing. We would definately do it again!

A very interesting tour with an enthousiast guide.. We visited Budapest with a group of 14 friends. Our tour trip took 4 ours. We looked for the 10 hidden treasures of Budapest. Our Guide Andrasz was a very friendly and enthousiast person who informed us very completely about those treasures. The trip was by bus, metro, foot and we were able to find out a lot about the impressive history of Budapest.
Make your Budapesttour with Andrasj. Andrasj is born in Budapest and knows his way to the hidden beauties in Budapest. He is a nice guy wit a good knowledge of the English language as well.

Fabulous Personal Tour of Budapest. Andras with My Personal Budapest took us on a wonderful tour of Budapest. We selected a tour that included lunch in a Hungarian home as well as one called the Hidden Budapest. Lunch was at an apartment on the Buda side. We had a great lunch with fun people and great conversation. Then we left on a tour exploring the parts of Budapest not seen on the usual tours. We walked, rode the Metro and the tram to discover all the places on the Pest side that we would have never known about. Andras is an excellent guide who is passionate about his hometown and is extremely knowledgeable about all things Budapest. Andras picked us up at our hotel and was prompt and on time. Wear your walking shoes and bring your camera on this not to be missed tour. We can highly recommend this entertaining and informative tour.

A different view of Budapest. A more personal tour of an interesting city.. If you are sick of seeing the normal everyday sites, I would definately recommend these tours. We did the Hidden Treasures of Budapest and the Treasure Hunt city discovery tour. This was a great way to see the city. We visited places you would not normally see on a regular tour, cafes, buildings, historical sites. It gave us the opportunity to see the "real" Budapest. We had a traditional Hungarian lunch followed by the Treasure Hunt tour, were we were the tour guides. On this tour we needed to ask for information about many of the "tourist" sites we visited. This gave us the opportunity to meet some of the local characters and find out informtion you would not be told or read in the guidebooks. If you are thinking of doing tthe Treasure Hunt tour, leave yourself plenty of time to complete it . This is a different tour, but one where you get to see and feel and hear about the real Budapest.

Best ever tour. We took the half day Retro Tour in a Trabant. What an adventure it was cramped into the back seat. We stopped several times at tourist attractions to get an overview of the city. We then had a walking tour where we were given the opportunity to see very special places that not all tourist get to experience. András is very interesting & attentive to your requests. Great value.
Good times in Budapest with Andras!. Andras is fun to be with and has an excellent background in the history and architecture of Budapest. This was a great way to see Budapest!

Outstanding Day in Budapest. After a one week river cruise on the Danube we had decided to spend a few extra days in Budapest at the conclusion of our trip. We are so glad that we did or we would have missed one of the highlights of our trip. My husband and I along with 2 other couples met Andras for a walking tour followed by lunch at his parent's home. The food was outstanding and we were made to feel right at home. After lunch we headed to the wine country for a delightful afternoon sharing some great Hungarian wines. We would all highly recommend this tour.Kay Clancy Saint Charles, Missouri

A memorable day in Budapest. I recently travelled to Budapest with a group of friends and family members and considered hiring a local private guide. After experiencing some difficulties finding a reliable guide, I found MyperonalBudapest and its guide, Andras, through Trip Advisor. My mission was to make an effort and organize this day in Budapest so that the group members would have fond memories for many years to come. I wanted to immerse in the Hungarian culture as much as possible in the time available. Following a number of emails we worked out an itinerary to suit everybody in our group. I requested Andras to take us through parts of Budapest by foot and/or public transportation to better interact with the locals. Andras embraced this idea and furthermore, he suggested that he combines it with a point-to-point drive in 4 Trabants in their original condition. Our morning started at 8:00. Andras, very punctual, meeting us at the hotel, and using the public transportation took us to the private studio of Mr. Adam Fellegi, a famous Hungarian pianist. I had previously requested Mr. Fellegi, via MyperonalBudapest, to take us through Franz Liszt’s artistic life with relevant fragments of his creations from his early years through his mature period as a composer. Mr. Fellegi, who is a charming individual, surprised us with having an opera singer, Mr. Jekl Laszlo join us in his studio to further emphasize Liszt’s contribution to opera. Toward the end of our engagement, Mr. Fellegi played at our request a number of pieces, including Gershwin’s Rhapsody in Blue, without any previous preparation. The experience we had was great, to listen to an internationally renowned pianist, in his own studio, playing anything we would ask. After the Liszt musical lesson we boarded an air conditioned van and were taken to a typical Hungarian home where we were served a traditional, Hungarian lunch. While in the van, we were given a brief Hungarian history starting from the original settlers in the Pannonia Valley all the way through the Austro-Hungarian Empire, communist era, and the latest political changes. The lunch was delicious, home made pastries, the traditional palinka, home made gulyas and local wine to match the food. The desert was a delicious cake and fresh fruits. One of our group members had her birthday on that day, and was pleasantly surprised by having been served a birthday cake along with the Happy Birthday sang in Hungarian.Following the lunch we returned to the city center and started our Trabant experience. For the following 3.5 hours, we were shown the highlights of Budapest: architectural marvels, cultural edifices, a beautiful café, and the way of life on a typical weekday in Budapest. The car is a hallmark of the communist era. I thought it was a great idea to go back in time and see the communist Budapest in a typical communist era means of transportation. The car drivers were all very friendly and knowledgeable of their cars. The experience turned out to be another highlight of the day.The Trabant journey ended at the Danube Palace Theatre where the young members of our group, engaged into a traditional folk dance class hosted by two professional dancers. It must have been one of the most enjoyable activities of the day, both for those directly involved in the dance class as well as those observing the dancers. After 1.5 hours of hopping, jumping, and beating boots, we attended a show performed by professional dancers; a live illustration of historical and modern times Hungarian folk dances, choreographed by the same couple that taught our younger members. At around 10:30 pm we finalized the day on a night cruise on the Danube with dinner.  Andras was a exceptional tour guide. He organized the various meetings with the people involved in the various activities, purchased our public transportation tickets, arranged for food, purchased the show tickets, the boat tickets, took care of ALL organizational details. There were no glitches; everything went smoothly. We did work out all the details prior to our meeting via emails. Andras definitely knows how to manage a day, and as such, all activities planned did happen. Overall we had a great day and really enjoyed our time in Budapest. Andras representing MyperonalBudapest was not only a great guide, but his knowledge and organization skills truly made the difference. I, and everyone in the group, highly recommend him.

A Day in Budapest. We all had a wonderful day in Budapest with Andreis . It started out around 9 am . We had Andreis tour us through the city t,on foot, taking us to parts of the Budapest we would never had seen alone.We then had a wonderful meal at the home of his parents who were very friendly & made you feel right at home. The finale was a wonderful drive to the wine region of Aklac. A tour of the family run vineyard & wine tasting accompanied by a cheese & sausge plate.. We were driven back to our hotel right on time. My husband & I enjoyed the experience to the fullest.

Well worth the cost.. What a great experience. Just our guide, Andras and the 2 of us. Andras gave us an insight into the history and the people of Budapest we would never have known about and would not have learnt from a larger tour - not to mention being driven around in a Trabant (very cosy)! A more friendly, intelligent host you will not find. We had lunch with a friend of Andras at her flat which was very filling and great fun. We were so glad we did this tour and recommend him very highly if you are looking for a more intimate experience of this beautiful city.

Wonderful personal experience of Budapest. We only had three days to visit Budapest and decided to start our stay with a one day personalised tour presented by our guide Andras. The day started with an exciting tour in a Trabant, drawing a lot of attention from other tourists and being photographed by several others. We found the tour to be most helpful to get an understanding of and to experience life in Budapest, giving us time to revisit some of the sites on the other days. This was followed by an excellent and tasty lunch and then for me personallly the highlight: a visit to a winery at Etyek, about 25 km from the city. We were hosted and introduced to the winery's wines by the owner's wife at the most beautiful setting. All this was made possible by Andras, with an excellent knowledge and easy going nature, which led to a wonderful experience of Budapest. We can without hesitation and unconditionally recommend MyPersonalBudapest to anyone who would like to not merely go on a guided tour, but to get a glance of and personally experience Hungarian life.

Hungary 2011. Andras:My thanks for a very moving and educational tour. Our family is Hungarian and living in Los Angeles, Ca. We knew my grandmother was the cousin of a famous Hungarian military hero Pal Maleter and had a goal of visiting his grave. We arrnaged with Andras to pay our respects to his grave and Andras made it possible for us to do so. He made the trip enjoyable, funny, and educational as well. After the gravesite, we went to see the new statue of President Reagan in Liberty square near the parliament. Later, we walked around and then stopped by a cafe for a bit. Afterwards, we saw the old apartment where my father grew up in Buda. It was sentimental to see the building he once lived in. Then, we went to Memento Park to see the old communist statues that once stood in and around Budapest. We had such a great time and Im glad I found him here at TripAdvisor. Our plans were not something most tourists would want to see but ONLY through Andras was this tour made possible.Thanks again Andras and we hope to see you next year as we travel to Budapest.

One in a lifetime experience. We were privileged to attend a private piano concert with our incredible guide Andras Novak in Budapest. We visited the artist's home and were treated like special personal friends during a one hour concert performed by the incredible and world-renowned artist Adam Felligi. His keyboard mastery of Liszt, Chopin, Mozart.....and, just for us, Gershin and Scott Joplin, were mesmerizing and gave us so much to appreciate and discuss later. I didn't know exactly what to expect when I booked the concert, but everyone in my family agreed it was one of the major highlights of our trip to Budapest and Vienna. This is a must-do experience.

Wonderful guide to a beautiful city. We had less than 72 hours in Budapest, one of us visiting for the first time, the other had been as a student 25 years ago. Encouraged by a great experience in Sarajevo and Belgrade with an outstanding guide Zlatan Ilic http://alturl.com/ce4yi we decided a personal guide was a must if we were to see anything of the Hungarian capital. When we first made contact with Andras we listed our 'must sees' as well a run down on what we both like to do when we visit a new city. He promptly came back to us with a tailor-made itinerary, this started with a decidedly-different city tour with us being whisked off through the narrow lanes of Budapest in a communist-era Trabant. With his colleague Balazs at the wheel we spluttered back and forth across the river Danube stopping at one breathtaking sight after another. Three hours later Andras drove us to his parent's house in the suburbs where we enjoyed a delicious, traditional Hungarian lunch prepared by his mother. Mrs Novak, now a successful businesswoman, gave us a first-hand account of her country's transition from Communist rule. Chatting to her gave us an insight not normally enjoyed by tourists. Part of Andras's 'unique selling point' is that his tours are a little 'quirkier' than the others. That afternoon proved the point: we could barely take in all he showed us. Starting with an Art Nouveau cafe and museum we moved on to the city's Jewish Quarter (great for photography) stopping to enjoy the traditional Flodni cake at Rachel's Bakery. The next stop gave us a chance to catch our breath in the famous Ruin Pub, now a standard bearer for underground culture. As he walked us back through Budapest's 8th district to our hotel we were struck by his stockpile of anecdotes as every building, monument and business seemed to inspire yet another one. A truly remarkable day! We would recommend Andras to any traveller who wants to experience Budapest!Robert Mullan Liz Russell www.robertmullan.com

This was the best, most complete tour I have ever been on.. I went to Budapest with friends with no expectations and very little knowledge about the city or Hungary in general. I am so thankful that we signed up for this tour. With the small group we were able to see so many different areas and we learned things at each spot that we would not have on a larger tour. Andras was a fantastic guide and he explained aspects of Budapest's history that show the knowledge and love he has for the city. I really enjoyed hearing about the history of the city and the devastation but also the perseverance of Budapest. I also never realized how affected the Jewish community in Budapest was hit during the persecution and was moved by the synagogue area. I also thoroughly enjoyed the winery. It was so beautiful to be able to see the crowded city and then in a short drive to also see the countryside that was just incredibly beautiful. My favorite part of this tour though was getting to spend time with local people from the Trabant drivers, to lunch with Andras's mom, to the owner of the vineyard. We had a very short time in Budapest but I left feeling like we had a very complete trip and I learned a lot about the city and had too much fun doing it!

A fun day in Budapest. We had a very enjoyable day with Andras seeing Budapest. We started off with a city tour in a Trabant....be aware that the car is REALLY small, but it was a lot of fun! Afterwards we went to a winery outside of the city and had a personal wine tasting with the winemaker. We even got to taste some wine right out of the barrel. Excellent wine and a really neat experience. Budapest is a beautiful city and this was an excellent way to take in all of the city sights and also do something more personal.

Absolutely Outstanding. I am a law student studying in Ireland for the summer. My friends and I were looking to book a trip in Europe for the weekend and my father recommended that we visit Budapest. We booked a tour with Andras and it was all that we could've asked for and more. Andras really made and effort to get to know us and tailor the tour to our personalities. We saw the "must see" sights in the morning and went to the hidden gems in the afternoon. He took us to the law school as he knew we were law students. After a whole day, he got to know our personalities and showed us a pub that he knew we would like that was also a pub unique to Budapest. The most outstanding part of the tour was the personal connections we made. The homemade Hungarian lunch was delicious and the hospitality was even better. Seeing the architecture and historical sights of Budapest was wonderful, but being immersed into Hungarian culture is what made Andras's tour truly unique. Initially, we were supposed to do a wine tasting but the wine makers had to cancel. Andras knew how much we were looking forward to it, so he arranged with the wine makers to do a tasting before our flight. It was not the most convenient time for Andras but he made arrangements to make sure we were able to make our flight on time. It was a great way to end our trip (again, superb hospitality) and we were so grateful to have such a great tour guide. I had no idea what to expect from Budapest, but it totally exceeded my expectations- in large part because of Andras. He made our holiday an absolutely outstanding one.

Wonderful Day. What a great time we had.we customised our day, starting with the Trabant trip to the Major sights, we had a lot of fun in that,we then transfered to another car for a trip to Szendendre, where we had a visit to a ceramic place and had a go at making a dish, it was so good.The lovely Andras and his lovely driver of the Trabant (sorry can not remember his name)were so helpful so much fun and excellent tour guides. we recommend this trip to all as it is something we will remember. it was record breaking heat when we were there and they still had big smiles on their faces.Many Thanksand will hopefully see you both againJohn And Anne-Marie

Loved it!. You can't go wrong taking a tour with Andras. He is so friendly, intelligent and helpful. I think we had a crush on him. ;-)The tour is really special. We loved the Trabant tour.. just know that the car is VERY small. But it was such a different experience and it was soo fun to watch peoples reactions when we were driving around. Lunch at Mom and Pop's house was the highlight. AMAZING! They were so nice too.. we wanted them to adopt us. They really made us feel at home. I feel lucky to have had such a unique experience. I will no doubt recommend this tour to anyone who visits Budapest. Thank you so much Andras and sorry for waiting so long to post the review.. We had the greatest time! H+K

Super tour!. My husband, daughter and I have just come back from an amazing trip to Austria, Slovakia and Hungary and I have to say, our day with Andras was one of the highlights. We are very interested in history and in seeing things from a local perspective and Andras more than fulfilled our expectations which were high based on the feedback given here by others. The Trabant tour was very fun, and as others have expressed, we felt like we were the tourist attractin at times! Lunch with Andras' parents is a must do. We were taken into their home as guests and felt like we had made new friends. Hopefully they will contact us if they ever make it to Norway :) The tour to Szentendre was very nice and Andras never made us feel stressed although we aren't the quickest of tourists...taking about 500 pictures! I highly recommend this trip...you will never forget it!

Holiday Highlight. My "MyPersonalBudapest" tour was shared by my husband and 21 year old daughter and customised by email to suit our interests by Andras. This was our second visit to Budapest, so we opted for "10 hidden treasures - things not found in guide books" which were varied and fun, particularly with Andras to chat with on the way. The Art Nouveau cafe was interesting, the Central Europesn Jewish cake was good, the fountains were fun, the pub in a ruined building was zany and the remnants of the ghetto wall very moving. Andras parents were great hosts for lunch, and it is always good to get out of a city centre and see what it is really like yo live there. With the help of the Hungarian / English and English / Hungarian parts of the dictionary, we all found we could talk about anything, and felt like we had made new friends. Perhaps when you visit, Andras's mother will be trying out the Scottish gingerbread recipe we have since sent her. The next morning we had the pleasure of visiting Mr Fellegi for a concert of Liszt, Bartok, Chopin and Bach all played with not only skill but Hungarian fervour. My daughter is a pianist and post-graduate music student, so we had arranged this as a treat for her, but all three of us enjoyed it very much. It was actually rather sad parting with Andras. like others, we felt we had made a new friend. The cost of the tour was not unreasonable for what was provided. Andras is knowledgable, well organised, flexible and very good company. his tours are well worth a go.
Excellent and informative. Andrass was a great guide around the many splendid sights and his parents were great hosts at lunch his knowledge excellent and the itinerary perfect

most satisfying day with Andras. I travel a lot, and when I get time from work to explore a place that I have never been, I want someone local to show me around. This experience did not disappoint. Andras Novak is an enterprising entrepreneur with a personal touch, and he has named his business well. After customizing my tour via his website, he contacted me to make certain that my selections were going to meet my needs. We modified my first selection, and as a result, the second half of my day was spent at a beautiful family run vineyard about 45 minutes out of Budapest. My work colleague and I did his "best of" tour, and it was perfectly fine for an overview of the city. We saw all the top sites, and it gave us enough to know which places to visit on our own. Budapest is spread out, and it would be difficult to walk all the sites, so Andras's driving us around was the way to go. We were treated to lunch my his most delightful parents, and with an excellent menu, the conversation was very pleasing. His mother is a wonderful cook, and we teased her that she is becoming world famous on TripAdvisor! His father was a gracious host, and the warmth of their home made our visit unique. I have never been invited into someone's home as part of the tour, and I certainly enjoyed. After a leisurely and delicious lunch, we headed to the country for a great wine tasting. Glasses were filled with Sauvignon Blanc, Cuvee, and Pinot Noir, and we got some great lessons on the local varietals. I came home with two bottles, too! All in all, I recommend MY PERSONAL BUDAPEST for the traveler who wants to learn enough of the city without doing the standard tour guide stuff, and for someone who wants a personal, local connection. I was glad I stayed the extra day before returning home to the US after by business meeting.

It was like having a friend show you around!. I found this tour here on Trip Advisor. After reading all the reviews, I emailed Andras. I explained that we had children and their ages, 6 and 11. I explained what I was looking for in a tour. He was very fast at returning my email and had sent some ideas for me to look over. After review, I sent my choices to him. Everything was scheduled and a price was agreed.The day of the tour he met us at our hotel on time and was very excited to meet us and show us his country. We started out on the Trabant tour. The lttle cars were so cute. My children just loved them. The tour took us all over from the Gellert Hill, Castle District, Around Parliament and Central Pest. There were many stops for sight seeing and photos. When we would stop and get out of the Trabant cars everyone would be looking, because the cars are so neat. My husband said, he felt like he was part of a tour. It was really cool.After the Trabant tour we headed for Andras home for lunch. We were greeted by his parents upon arrival. They were so kind and made all of us feel welcome. The luch was wounderful. We had chicken soup, Hungarian chicken paprikas, home made noodles and Hungarian cake. Everyone one had seconds it was so good. After coffee on the patio we departed to our next adventure.We were on our way to a ceramic workshop near Szentendre. Laszlo and Gabriella the owner of the shop showed us around and then the kids got involved in making bowls. They both did such a great job. A thank you to them for the gift that they share. We then drove to the little town of Szentendre. After arriving and walking around we purchased our memories and headed back to Budapest after walking along the Danube. Such beauty in this part of the world.We had a little time available before our river boat tour. My family and Andras found a nice spot near the dock to sit and rest. Andras helped my husband chose a nice glass of red wine for him and a white for me. We talked about everything we had just experienced and thanked him for showing us Budapest. We will be returning in the fall and doing the wine tour without the kids. :} Thank you, see you soon Andras!!!

Es lohnt sich, András zu buchen. We met András on a sight-seeing-tour by bike. He was our Budapest guide. Although he talked English because of some other British clients we could ask questions in German. His knowledge of both languages is marvellous (much better than my English). We learnt a lot about Hungarian history and he showed us the most beautiful and interesting buildings and explained the different architectural styles. We also had a look at some romantic places. After this tour next day there was time to visit our favorite places again and spend some more time in locations of our special interest.We (4 Germans) booked an excursion to the „Danube Knee“. András showed us the small artisan town Szentendre and the biggest cathedral of Hungary in Esztergom, where the first king of Hungary was crowned. We could feel that András is proud of his country and he loves it with all its changeful history. One high-light was a wine tasting in a small vineyard in Etyek. Our host showed us their cellar and explained a lot of wine-making. They offered a little delicious snack and of course several different wines. The taste was great. We enjoyed the day with a really good and engaged guide András. Thank you for a beautiful trip in your home country.Claudia and Jürgen

A busy delightful day. My husband and I had a tour with Andras and had a wonderful experience. We started the day with a tour of Budapest in the Trabant car. Then we had lunch with his mother and father. His mother was so welcoming and my goodness could she cook! We had soup, duck and a cake. The duck was so good! After that we went back to Budapest to find the 10 hidden treasures of Budapest. That was my most favorite part of our trip. I love seeing the things that most people don't take the time to notice. We then traveled to make a piece of pottery. We weren't really very good at it but we had lots of laughs and memories to take home. Andras was very knowledgable and passionate about his home of Budapest and it surely made us fall in love with the city. I can say that Andras made our time in Budapest very enjoyable. We would recommend anyone to take a tour with Andras.

EXCELLENT!. We spent 2 days with Andras. Excellent guide. Very knowlegdeable. Spent the first day touring Budapest. We got to see so much and had a lot of fun! Second day--toured outside of Budapest. Again--organized, fun, interesting. Andras paid careful attention to what we wanted to do and provided an excellent selection and schedule each day. We truly enjoyed lunch at his family's home.

Fantastic experience!. Words can not begin to describe our feelings after such two great days spent visiting and experimenting Budapest and the Hungarian country side, in such a friendly way. Let us try to describe our 2 days tour:  We (my husband and I) started the first day visit with a Trabant tour. Andras was waiting for us in our hotel, and our first impression was that he is very reliable, professional and well educated tourist guide. The young gentlemen who was providing the Trabant was very enthusiastic about his car, and we could see that he was taking much care and pride in maintaining the antique in good shape. We went to the castle and Andras explained us lots of interesting facts about the Hungarian history. After they took us to a tour around the city, and a stop in a very nice café which is an Art nouveau furniture museum at the same time. As an industrial designer, I found this visit quite interesting, to see all these different kinds of rare furniture.  Then, Andras took us to his parent’s home, which was a lovely home located in a residential neighborhood. I found it nice to see how it looks like outside the city center. Andras’s parents made everything to make us feel like at home, and let me tell you how much we have eaten as if we were kings! I wish I could have seen Andras’s Mom cooking, so that to learn some of her secrets!  After, Andras and his father brought us to Szentendre, where we visited the lovely village. Afterwards began some moments that I will never be able to forget! We went to a ceramic workshop in Szentendre and met with some very friendly people (Gabriella and Laszlo), who were patient enough to teach us the basics of pottery making; my husband and I both had the opportunity to try a ceramic piece of art each. It was such a sensual and technical experience! We had so much fun trying to do our ceramic piece! It is a pitty that we live so far away from Hungary as we both felt that we could become good friends with them!  We ended our day with a private piano concert, in a famous pianist’s appartment, Mr. Fellegi. This was, in my opinion, a MAGIC moment, something I will still remember when I will be an old lady (!) It is hard to explain the feeling of being «inside» the music and not only listening to the classical music on a CD or the radio. Mr. Fellegi really made us feel comfortable and we were in the right atmosphere to enjoy the piano concert.  The second day was even more unforgettable: Andras and his father took us to the city of Eztergom, we had the opportunity to cross the Danube to see Slovakia, and we also visit Hungary’s largest church, which is on top of a hill with a beautiful view on the Danube and Slovakia. We also had lunch in a great restaurant (here my husband will recommend the Transylvania soup that is incredibly tasteful and delicious!)  We visited the country side and we ended our day in a vineyard. I believe this was my husband’s favorite part! The lady, Vali Hernyák took the time to explain us about her familly’s winery business and made us taste many different wines (all very - very nice!) We could see how much love she puts in her art and we very much appreciated the time she spent with us. We also had a plate of local home-made cold cuts and cheese (again, incredibly delicious with the last wine we have tasted). Again, and sorry for repeating myself! we felt that we could have become good friends with this lovely lady and husband as we share the same vision of work and life.  Everyone we have met with Andras were friendly and warm in a genuine way. We feel that we have some friends now in Hungary and almost a familly there!  Not only that, but we were never rushed through the events and location, giving ample time to enjoy the activities in a tailored fashion. Also Andras was very organised and everything run smoothly during the 2 days.  Needless to say at this point that we highly recommand the personnal tour provided by Andras and let us tell you that it is worth every penny invested.  Regards from Canada,  Caroline and Françoys  P.S. We read an other comment on this site that we can barely understand! The car that was supplied to do the tour was a Corolla in very good condition, and pretty recent. Why would some members of TripAdvisor use this site to put down in an exagerated way some facts? Opinions are opinions but facts should be based on reality, so that Trip Advisor can continue to be a reliable tool.

This is a tour well above and beyond expectations!. As a frequent solo traveler, I have often found standard group tours to be impersonal and uniform. Admittedly, I am a tour guide and that sometimes makes it hard to concentrate on the tour & not the tour guide’s technique. After reading previous reviews, MyPersonalBudapest seemed to exactly fit my needs and wants. I contacted Andras and arranged for a personal two-day tour, including airport transfers.My two day tour went by quickly... almost too quickly. Looking back, I realize that I never felt that I was on an actual tour. It was, as if, a trusted friend had invited me to visit Budapest, then proceeded to show off its greatest attributes. Andras provides a warm and gracious welcome to Budapest’s best charms... the food, history, architecture and most importantly the local hospitality. On the first tour day, I was greeted by Balazs, a Trabant owner/driver. The driving tour was wonderful with Andras giving details on what we saw, explaining the history of where we were, plus we stopped several times for better views and history focus. Balazs is a very sweet, friendly man who kindly (and humbly) answered all my Trabant questions, allowing me to check out the engine, and even told me about his weekend stunt driving activities. Yes, I am somewhat fascinated by older cars.Afterwards, Andras & I visited Szentendre where local ceramic artists introduced me to molding clay into functional art. I never imagined that I would actually touch the clay, not to mention make something! It was hard work, but a really fulfilling experience. I may have to sign up for classes in the future. The first day ended with the local pub night, which was a lot of fun. We were joined by a few of Andras’ friends, which only made the experience more authentic. What’s drinking at the pub without a few friends? We visited three distinctly different (non-touristy) pubs & I never felt out of place or even noticed... excellent. The second day began walking around the city, as Andras pointed out hidden treasures not mentioned in guide books. I particularly liked this part of the tour; because I’m pretty sure I would not have found these places. After lunch we visited Etyek, spending time at a family run winery. Instead of listening to a lecture or presentation, there was a conversation explaining what they do and what they hope to do. I was introduced to how the family produces their wine, the different ages of their vines, the makeup of the region’s soil & their future foray into brandy making. I left Etyek much more knowledgeable about the Hungarian wine making process, with a great bottle of wine and a full stomach. On both days, lunch was a meal brilliantly cooked by Andras’ mother. Andras’ parents are a welcoming, funny and engaging couple. Upon entering the house, I was greeted with hugs & plum palinka (yum). The excellent food was served at the family dining table surrounded by family photos and books. Afterwards, coffee was enjoyed out on the terrace while soaking up the sun’s rays. On the second day, Andras’ mother could not be there, but she thoughtfully prepared the meal before leaving for the day. Andras’ father was wonderful as he presented & served his wife’s efforts. Just imagine visiting an aunt & uncle that you haven’t seen in a long time, and being welcomed with home cooking and good conversation.Because I opted for a personal tour, Andras offered to include or substitute places/activities, depending on my preference. I declined as I was perfectly happy with the agreed upon tour. I would not have changed a detail of this unique Budapest tour, except maybe to add another day. MyPersonalBudapest provided me with fabulous memories, well above and beyond my expectations. I can easily recommend taking this tour & I whole-heartedly encourage other Budapest visitors to sign up for this one-of-a-kind experience. Andras is the perfect host to introduce the wonders of Budapest.

Rich, unique experience - we just loved it!. We are very experienced travelers and have high expectations when we use our (precious) time to discover a new location. Budapest has been on my 'travel wish list' for years, and for this reason, I wanted this trip to be perfect ... and it was! A couple of weeks before our arrival, I had a long E-Mail exchange with András regarding the preparation of the trip - we finally choose a quite rich program : Day 1: We started with a city tour was very interesting and gave us a first overview of Budapest and the places to see. The 'Hungarian' lunch was delicious and it was very interesting to visit a genuine Hungarian home (OK, the trip was a bit long, but finally worth it). Finally, a treasure hunt made us raise our heads and notice funny details we would never have discovered alone …Day 2We started at 9 with an Art-Déco tour in two vintage cars (a Citroën Traction from 1954 as well as a Rolls Royce Silver Spur) - this was just gorgeous, and we discovered numerous partly incredible treasures - with very competent guides (we had almost a ratio of 1:1 between guides and tourists ;-). We then had lunch in what András called the "best pancake bar in town" - this was not extraordinary, but correct. In the afternoon, we enjoyed a relaxing tour on the Danube and then headed to the climax of the stay: a private concert given by a famous Hungarian pianist at his home. This was gorgeous, especially for me as an amateur pianist - and we were so pleased that we invited the pianist to play for our friends when he will next come to Switzerland - which will be in two months. If you are looking for a way to "deep dive" into the Hungarian Culture and the architectural, cultural and social heritage of Budapest, then I can recommend András without any reserve. Although some of the reviewers find that the trip is expensive, I do not share this position - we came back with tons of beautiful images and interesting information - and this is something money finally can't buy! Thanks András, we really enjoyed our discovery of Budapest!

Andras is awesome. If you're trying to take a day tour of Budapest and really see what the city has to offer, definitely go with this tour. You start off with a great view of the city, get to see all the famous historical sites, and learn a ton of information from a native Budapester. The best part is.. for lunch you actually go to his parents house and get a home cooked meal! That alone makes it worth it, you can't get something unique like this unless you have family there or know someone. In the afternoon, you play an Amazing Race style game where you run around Budapest gathering information about different landmarks and hopping on busses and metros in the process. It forces you to interact with the locals while learning cool stuff, and the competition is also a lot of fun. Nothing like seeing your friends running in the distance towards the bus you caught in the nick of time. The day ends with a night cruise, which gives a whole different perspective on the city. I wish they would do this kind of thing in more cities..

Food, wine, sights and sounds...MyPersonalBudapest showed us all of them. I just wanted to write and say thanks for the excellent tour you arranged for us in June. Having never visited Budapest, or Hungary for that matter, my partner and I knew little of it apart from what we had read but many websites focussed on the city's obvious USP's (unique selling points) like the cave system and the spas and less so on the wonderful hospitality and the sights and sounds of the contrasting areas of Buda and Pest. Many websites also concentrated on restaurant reviews, however we found a gem that most people never know about, unless they had contacted you. Our second stop on our tour, if you recall, after visiting the beautiful riverside town of Szentendre was for a genuine home cooked family meal. At that point I knew we'd booked something truly special that a large tour operator could only wish to replicate, and fail. Not only was the food delicious but the hospitality was amazing and we left feeling very full!All of the travel was taken care of which was fantastic and we were given plenty of opportunities to explore the town for ourselves. you found the right balance between being a tour guide and letting ourselves wander. You also organised our cruise of the Danube and took us to a fun ceramic making session where Alexandra and I still argue about who made the best plate. For the record, it was me! If that wasn't enough we also had time to squeeze in a visit to a family vineyard where after sampling lots of wine we were able to sit, eat and reflect on a great four days in your country.So, to us, the people are what made Budapest the great holiday it was and we would like to thank you Andras. Best wishes to your family also. I thoroughly recommend you and mypersonalbudapest to anyone who's looking to do something different on their vacation and have completely unique stories to tell when you come home. Please feel free to use my comments on your own website and I wish you the best of luck for the future - until we return for more.Kind regardsKarl & Alexandra

personalized tour guide in Budapest. If you are interested in a personal tour in Budapest, look no further...whether you are traveling with children(we had three children ages 3. 7, and 9) or with elderly we had my mother age 75, My Personal Budapest tours provide a unique and personalized service that you will not likely find anywhere else. We are Americans who have lived in Europe for three years, traveling to many countries, Budapest has always been one of those cities that we wanted to check off but was afraid it may be too adult. Are worries were unfounded with this service as Andras personalized our tour to make it fun and enyoyable for all ages. I highly recommend his service. He and his family who cooked a homemade hungarian dinner for us made us feel like family and provide with an experience of a lifetime. Thank you Andras and best wishes with your company, I know you will do well.

An unforgettable winter experience in beautiful Budapest!. Our group--20 of us from Singapore looks back very fondly on our time at Budapest with Andras! Andras is a very patient and dedicated tour guide who had time for everyone in the group and who made sure that everyone was comfortable and enjoying their trip. I have requested a specially tailored itinerary to our needs and wishes months before our trip and Andras was the only local guide that rendered very detailed advises and assistance in all ways to make sure that our trip is an enjoyable one not restricted only in budapest but other leg of our europe trip as well. And everyone enjoyed the programme to the fullest--kids and adults alike! He made sure we got to see, taste, smell and feel the best of Budapest in just 4 days. Andras was also very knowledgeable and passionate about spreading the Hungarian culture, history and way of life, and it was extremely enriching and truly eye-opening as we learnt about Budapest and Hungary from him. It was really an unforgetable experience to have lunch at his house, where we had the rare chance to taste true Hungarian cuisine and to interact with his parents to get to know the true Hungarian way of life! Not forgetting his mother, a true warrior, during the snow war with all the kids. They really enjoyed it! All in all, it was a most memorable and enjoyable time in Budapest with Andras, and definitely a very unforgettable stay that captured the essence of Budapest!

Great way to experience the real Budapest. This is a very nice tour. Our guide, Attila, was prompt, and very helpful and knowledgeable. The Trebanta cars that use were a fun way to get around the city. A half day is plenty to see all the sites. Lunch was excellent at our host’s home – real nice lad named Marta - and it was cool to see how real residents of the city live. And we enjoyed the thermal baths as well, which was the last top. All in all, a superb way to see Budapest, despite the cold weather. Excellent service!

The true essence of budapest!. We were blessed with many opportunities to see, taste, smell and feel the best of Budapest in just 4 days. We especially loved having lunch at a Hungarian home, where we had the rare chance to taste true Hungarian cuisine and to interact with his parents to get to know the true Hungarian way of life! All in all, it was a most memorable and enjoyable time in Budapest with Andras!

A perfect way to discover authentic local ambience. Andras provides valuable service for visitors to Budapest in a most original and passionate way. Reliable, helpful and very implicated we had been taken in charge after he perfectly understood our expectations. I am not complicated and so looking only after pure and authentic local ambience at reasonable but affordable price that can save us time and disillusions. Andras managed on a 2 day notice to understand how different my expectations are. We asked for more city aspects than only the main general attractions and to have a tour in a way we can get the flavour of the past years including underground, gastronomy, ethnical, cultural and night life. Andras managed in 24 hours with 2 Trabants and a magnificent timing to bring us in places you can not even imagine. And the most appreciable was the lunch that his mother prepared in their house. Thank you to all his family and friends that supports him to organise the poetic way of looking at Budapest. We recommend to everybody interested to see through Hungarian eyes this third capital on the Danube.Maryse and GeorgeBelgium

Unique, Unforgettable almost feel like a local!. We were looking for a tour to familiarize ourselves with Budapest and its sites but wanted to feel we were visiting family who was showing us around. Andras delivered just that. We contact him prior to arrival to arrange the Trabant sightseeing tour with the lunch at a Hungarian Home. The Trabants are very unique. People could not help look at us in these little weightless cars. They drove through very narrow streets even backroads we are sure the tour buses can't. The drivers who own the Trabants actually collect them and race them on 2 wheels! Amazing. The tour was at a great pace and reduced quite a bit of the walking which waas great for us. My friend Marta had just broken her foot and removed the cast right before the trip so she was concerned she would not be able to see everything or keep up walking but Andras kept the pace and the cars really made it all work. Make sure to share with Andras as much as possible about your interests so he can make additional suggestions for a truly unique experience. The Lunch was amazing and felt like we were part of the family. We kept comparing the Bean Goulash Soup we had at the home but none was better! As we toured with Andras, we shared about our love for wine and our interest to visit a local winery. He was so good to immediately check into it and he made arrangements with Hernyak Winery. I was left speechless once we arrived and tasted the wines. They are all handmade and the winemakers are so personable and friendly. We ate in the vineyard and remember the sun going down and the dining table getting dark just lit by the light of the fireplace... we could have been there exchanging stories for hours! Simply priceless folks.

A wonderful day!. We had a wonderful day with Andras on 23 October. My husband had recently had surgery, so we could not do a lot of walking. However, Andras crafted a full day. 3-hour Trabant tour of the city, a marvelous meal at his parents' home and an amazing private concert of Hungarian composers by a concert artist in the pianist's own home. The music was the perfect end to a delightful day, and the meal and the music certainly put us in touch with a more personal view of Hungary and Budapest. The Trabant ride was spectacular (and tight!) for those with an interest in historic cars...driven by true Trabant lovers and collectors. The day was indeed expensive, but the personal nature of the tour AND the private concert made it worth every penny.

Individual and personal tour - as it should be. This tour is definately recommendable - András, the guide, was higly comitted to deliver a satisfactionable tour. The tour started with a tasty Hungarian Lunch at András' parents house - very charming people. The Budapest tour afterwards was tailored as I had spent a day in Budapest already - which is a great advantage over a standard tour. Only one issue: Fans of super luxury cars will definately not like the tour - as it is done with a Trabant. All others will for sure enjoy that nostalgic vehicle - as I did!

What a great tour. I have contacted Andras and he arranged a Trabant tour according to our schedule. Balazs was our driver and came to pick us up at our hotel. The tour was great. There was another couple in another trabant and Andras was giving us all information by walkie talkie. The tour last 3 hours and it was worth every cent!! We highly recommend this tour if you are looking for something off the beaten path. This is really unique and so much fun. Thanks Andras!Michèle - Paris - France

Exactly what we wanted, at very short notice. We have just returned home from a wonderful trip to Budapest - what a beautiful city! We contacted Andras after arriving in Budapest and he very willingly arranged, on very short notice, a personal tour of the highlights of this wonderful city. He went out of his way to show us things of interest that we would have found difficult to visit ourselves without a car. He has a very obvious passion for his work and for the city and country within which he lives.
