Our visit to the beautiful artists' village of Szentendre was wonderful, but my personal favorite was having fish, chips and local beer at an outdoor restaurant sitting right next to the Danube. This was obviously the real Budapest, and not a place that tourists would ever know to visit.

Great Experience.....especially if you like something different.. My wife and I had a tour with Andrej today. He is genuine and enthusiastic about Budapest. It shows. The history is a given in broad strokes, but the details that matter to me are in the interchange of questions about culture, people, and issues of today. Facts cannot be easily forgotten, but to me the most memorable and endearing way to know Hungary is to take a trip with Andrej. Lunch with his parents is a true highlight. They too are warm, sincere, and genuine. The food is homely. It is a personal and unique experience. The 'treasure hunt' of the second half of the tour is an independent interactive questionaire. The 'treasure' is in walking a city, learning the facts, and meeting the people. Great idea. This the reward of an experience that will leave an unforgettable memory in our hearts and mind.

A historical way to see a historic city. Riding in the Trabants around Budapest was an incredible way to see the city. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and through the use of 2-way radios, our large group was able to hear all the history of the city as well as communicate with each other. The Trabants are very unique and were quite the show stopper throughout the city. If you are looking for a unique way to see this amazing city, there is no other way to go. I've been fortunate enough to travel all across Europe and go on many different tours of cities. This is by far the best experience of a tour I've ever had.

Adventurous day in Budapest.. The tour was a great way to spend the day! We had a lot of fun riding in the trabants. Andras has a wealth of knowledge regarding Budapest's history and was able to point out interesting buildings while on the way to stops. I would recommend this ride to any travelers that are looking for a day to learn, relax, have fun and enjoy a little adventure.

A must do for your Budapest adventure!!!. I've been to Budapest three times and Andras gave the best tour! He reserved Trabants for my group of 16 people! He had walkie talkies for each car so we were able to have some fun communication the entire tour along with all the historical information! We hit every site in style and was able to walk around and enjoy everything! The best way to see the city and have memorable footage! Sooo worth it!!! DO IT!

Best Experience Yet!!. I have been to Budapest 3 years in a row! And never experienced and had such an amazing time until I went on this tour! We had a group of 17 and there was 6 trabant cars waiting to take us around the city! Our team split into each car, and each car had a walkie talkie radio, to communicate between the cars, and to hear facts and history about the different places we were driving too. It was a blast, people in the streets where staring, taking pictures, filming, and waving!! We got to stop at all the hot spots in Budapest! And the drivers were amazing too!!! If a fun unique tour of Budapest is what you want, then GO FOR THIS ONE!!!!!

Trabant Tour - A Truly Unique and Fantastic Experience. We recently had a chance to experience the beautiful sights of Budapest on the truly unique Trabant Tour. This tour in the authentic Communist-era vehicles was perfect for our large group of 17 travelers looking for a differentiated way of experiencing the city. Andras did a fantastic job of providing insight throughout the tour, and his provision of two-way radios also made for fun and informative dialogue between the multiple cars. The sight of our six Trabants together was quite a sight, and often drew the attention (and pictures) of travelers throughout the city. I highly recommend this tour for both groups or individuals looking for a fun and unique way to experience Budapest!

What a fabulous way to spend a day in Budapest!". What a fabulous way to spend a day in Budapest! Andras and his family provide a unique opportunity to discover the city -- its history, culture, food and enterainment. The tour definitely lives up to the "personal Budapest" title. This all day adventure includes a fabulous Hungarian meal prepared by Andras' mother and served in their home. You will enjoy the "big picture" view of Budapest: walking through the shops of Fisherman's Bastion and stroll along the Bastion itself with its specatular views of the river and city. You will see Castle Hill along with other spectacular views of Budapest and the Danube River. Wear your walking shoes. Bring your camera. Prepare for a memorable day -- up close and personal in Budapest.

Excellent Day Tour with Eva!. We are firm believers in engaging the services of a local guide when we visit cities for the first time. A good guide can immerse you in the history, imporant sites and local customs in a way a guide book can not, as well as customize a tour to your interests. Eva surpassed our expectations. She introduced us to "hidden" Budapest as well as some of the top attactions of the city. And we enjoyed a meal together! Kudos to Eva and Zoltan for making our arrangements.

Full day tour with Zoltan on 10/24/16. We had great communication with Zoltan prior to our arrival in Budapest. Having grown up during the Cold War period in the US, my husband and I were interested in learning about the effects Communism had on those living in Hungary. Zoltan picked us up promptly at our hotel and took us to Memento Park in the outskirts of Budapest. We walked among the huge statues and monuments there as Zoltan explained each one, told us personal stories and memories and made it very real for us. A very powerful experience.We traveled back to the city and enjoyed a delicious lunch at a local restaurant in Buda while we continued to share our thoughts and experiences. Love his 25 year old Land Rover!We then crossed over to the Pest side and began a slow, enjoyable walking tour starting with the Memorial to the Revolution of '56. We stopped at St Stephens and so many less conspicuous spots as Zoltan shared his wealth of information and stories. We ended our walk in the Jewish quarter and enjoyed a drink in a ruin pub. Such a great day of sharing information and friendship. Thank you, Zoltan!

Zoltan's tour of Budapest. Zoltan's Budapest tour, tailored to his clients, reaches beyond the physical aspects of beautiful Budapest to the heart of Budapest. My husband and I had taken formal and typical tours of Budapest twice. This was a tour into the soul of the city. In a manageable walk, Zoltan identified so many places of interest that we would never have noticed - an indescript building, a peculiar opening in the ground, an ironic confluence of signs. We have used the services of personal guides throughout the world. This was one of the best.

Beautiful Danube band country side tour. Our friend Helen booked the Danube band whole day tour with Zoltan on Oct. 28.He picked us (six of us) promptly at our hotel. Off we went to the country side of Budapest. Professor Zoltan gave us lessons on history, politic and human nature of Hungary. He is very knowledgeable,and friendly. He also introduced us to local food and drinks. The tour was an enjoyable one. Thank you Zoltan.

Budapest tour with Zoltan. We were a group of 3 couples who toured Budapest for a day and a half with Zoltan. We first met Zoltan after our long overseas flight and he was friendly and very accomodating. We wanted to see the Jewish quarter before the Dohany Street Synagogue closed for visitors and Zoltan made sure we were able to get there in time. On the way over from our hotel, we stopped informally at different buildings as Zoltan is full of knowledge and acquainted with so much of Budapest's history. In addition, he wanted us to really get to the know situation in Budapest presently and he talked a good deal about the current state of politics and economics there. On the lighter side, Zoltan took our group to a ruin bar and some of us sampled the traditional Palinka drink. After that half day tour, Zoltan took us to a local restaurant for dinner where we experienced great traditional Hungarian food! The next day we spent a full day with Zoltan, seeing many of the great sights/views on the Buda and Pest sides of the city. We also sampled many forms of transportation including the tram, subway, & bus. Zoltan had stories about every subject and once again we enjoyed a very good local lunch with him. At the end of our tours with Zoltan, we all felt we had a good grasp of Hungarian culture and we were appreciative of Zoltan's breath of knowledge about all things Hungarian. Thank you Zoltan!

Budapest tour. Zoltan was outstanding. We had a most informative and enjoyable day with him walking and talking in Budapest. His depth of knowledge about the political situation as well as what people are really thinking was fascinating. We stopped at places off the beaten track to taste local foods and drinks and to talk about many interesting topics. Our 7.5 hours together flew by. Our only complaint was that we weren't there long enough to spend another full day together! We highly recommend Zoltan. Really excellent day.

Zoltan's walking tour of Budapest on 8.10.16. Zoltan gave our group of five an excellent 4 hour morning walking tour. It was great to have so much information on the background to the country including the soviet occupation, the present political situation as well the art and buildings in the city. Thank you very much Zoltan

Very informative and fun day!. Our experience with Zoltan was great. He communicated with us prior to our visit, and picked us up at our hotel as planned. We so enjoyed his history lesson of the Communist regime in Hungary and the political situation that exists today...very interesting! We spent the whole day with Zoltan, so we were able to enjoy lunch and continue on the tram to the Buda side which is very beautiful and quite different than Pest. At last we toured the Jewish quarter and a very unique ruin bar. It was a day we truly enjoyed and would recommend.

Zoltan our brilliant tour leader. We spent a full day with Zoltan earlier this month during our family visit to Budapest. He arrived on time and was immediately charming and friendly, After chatting to the four of us and getting to know each other better, we walked around the Jewish Quarter. Many activities (including a morning shot of brandy! and a trip on the Subway). Each and every place that Zoltan took us too was interesting and enjoyable. He was also incredibly informative. He was relaxed and patient as we asked questions, stopped for breaks, and kept up with him! We would all definitely recommend Zoltan. He played a big part in our family holiday. He taught us a lot about Budapest and its history. Thanks Zoltan!

Walking tour of Budapest. Our guide was Zoltan who was entertaining, interesting and very well informed. He took us on a tour of the beautiful art nouveau buildings in Budapest as well as the main sights in Pest. We had booked him for three hours but he was with us for four and bought us a selection of fruit brandies at the end of the tour. Great to have some insight into life and politics in Hungary as well as the history and buildings.

ROCKHOPPERS INCREDIBLE. Voltan set up an incredible tour with Kalliope. Kall was super knowledgeable and catered our tour based on our interest (architecture and design). She gave us the back ground of past and currently politics. She mixed fun and humor with architectural styles and history. We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 hours exploring the city with Kall.Thank you lady. We highly recommend your tour services!!!!

Wonderful experience!!. Zoltan took us on a wonderful trip around Budapest. Showing us wonderfully interesting, beautiful and absurd sites in the city. He was extremely knowledgeable and a wonderful story teller. He took the time to get to know my wife and I and our interests and tailored the tour to us. His broad interests, experience and training meant he could easily and knowledgeably discuss any thing that came up during the afternoon. You will not regret any time you are able to spend with him.

Superlative Budapest Tour Experience. Kalliope introduced us to Budapest on two half day tours. She is delightful, energetic, and a wealth of information. She was able to tie the history of Budapest into the current political milieu. She took us places we would never have seen on our own. We felt she introduced us to the culture of the city. Best of all, she is intelligent and politically astute. We feel we left Hungary understanding much about the current political scene and how that ties into the current world scene. Kalliope made Budapest come alive for us! She is terrific!

Outstanding Experience!. I'm an American and have lived in Budapest for 10+ years. I had 2 American friends coming to visit me and I decided that we would all benefit from having a guide who grew up here and has lived through the social and economic changes the people of Hungary have faced and face today, and who could tell us about their experiences as they experienced them and continue to, first-hand. Enter Kalliope! (sp?) and the "Classic Tour." She told us about the history of what we were seeing, interspersed with antidotes from the past and from her personal experiences. As others have commented, this wasn't a tour with a prepared script or strictly prepared route. She arranged our route according to our wishes and abilities (one of my friends was recovering from foot surgery, not able to walk a lot on the cobblestone streets of old Budapest) so we walked through the castle district, the Citadella and Hero's Square at a leisurely pace. We learned a lot and laughed A LOT. I highly recommend Rockhoppers if you want to get a taste of the "real Budapest," both what happened before now - going back to the settlement, and the bizarre political situation that's happening now.

A memorable day. My husband and I were ending a Danube River cruise and extended our stay in Budapest so I could try to visit the villages where my grandparents were born.Our neighbor recommended Rockhoppers after using them as a private guide for 3 days in Budapest last year.Well, about a month before we left the States,I got in touch we Zoltan and we set up the date. It turned out that the little jaunt I expected would actually be a 3 hour car ride out to the western part of Hungary, and back. But, he was game for it, and so was I.Zoltan is a former university professor, so his knowledge of all things, and all things about Hungary in particular, is extensive. We had a lively discussion about politics, culture, travel, and folks in general on the way out to my ancestor's villages. I was a bit apprehensive about spending that much time in a car, but he made the time fly.He is truly an excellent guide. As well as a great person.The best part of the day was that I met a woman to whom I'm related! We were checking out the cemeteries in the villages, hoping to find my great-grandparents' graves ( over 100 years old…it was a long shot). This lady visiting graves at one of the cemeteries heard me tell my husband that I found a family name. She came running over to me, chattering in Hungarian ( i know 4 words). Zoltan stepped in and started to translate. Turns out, her great-grandmother and mine were sisters. We spent several hours with her as she took us around to visit the family homes. She told me a little about our connections, and Zoltan was there to sort things out and interpret for us.Wonderful day. We spent a total of 9+ hours with him. He was as charming at the end of the day, as he was at the beginning. ANd after 6+ house of driving for him. A total treat to tour with. Bonus:After arriving home, I received a phone call and email from my cousin and her daughter ( who spoke a very little English). I contacted Zoltan and he graciously offered to call her back and make sure she knew I wanted to keep in touch. He also offered to translate emails for me. Great guy. But he's Hungarian, so what would you expect?Dont hesitate to book him or any one else at this site.PS -ask him about Absurdistan….

Very informative and fun.. My wife and I booked a full day private tour. After finding out that Zoltan was not going to be our guide, we were a bit apprehensive, but Kalliope turned out to be great. As a Budapest native who is quite opinionated, she was both knowledgeable and interesting. We learned a lot more than the superficial facts at the major tourist attractions. After speaking with people we met who took a regular tour provided by their river cruise, they were jealous. We highly recommend Kalliope.

Insights about Budapest. We were 4 friends who spend a good part of our friday together with Zoltan.We had asked for a special tour and we got what we asked for and more.Being a small group - it was more of a dialog where we could asked questions and get detailed answers.I highly recommend you try it and remember to tell if you have any special intrests in Budapest. Zoltan is there to show you around.
Amazing knowledge - more than you dare to expect... We met an amazing guide, who took us through the history of Hungary and Budapest. Worth every second, can only give my warmest recommendations..

Fascinating, humorous and eye opening.... Zoltan was our guide - fantastic experience. Using wry humor, intelligence and interaction with us, we spent an enlightening, engaged and super interesting day. Also we had some great cuisine and local Palinke (brandy).I highly recommend to anyone seeking in-depth knowledge, some off-the-tourist map sightseeing and interesting conversation as well.Thank you Zoltan!

A peak at the real Budapest. We had a most interesting day in Budapest with Zoltan. Zoltan takes the time to find out what you want to see before starting your tour. We had already done a bus tour on our river cruise and wanted to gain some insight, one on one, with a local. Zoltan is interesting, knowledgable, entertaining and irreverent, which is just our style. From the statue of Ronald Reagan to schnapps at a local bar, we came away from this tour feeling that we had caught a glimpse of the real Budapest.

Awesome experience. I took a kind of last minute trip to Budapest. I didn't know much about the city, and felt the best way to learn would be get a private tour from an experienced local. Zoltan was just that. I got a little lost trying to find him in the beginning of the trip (long story haha) but our time together was great. I learned so much about the history and culture and he pointed out things I would have never noticed. I didn't feel like one of the tourists in the huge crowds. It was very personal and Zoltan is very easy to communicate with. All in all, it was a great experience and I highly recommend this tour.

Guided tour of Jewish Quarters. We were a group of 9 persons who had a 3 hour tour of the quarters round the big synagogue. Zoltan was a fantastic guide: gave us interesting facts, moving stories and personal anecdotes. We saw well known monuments but also hidden gems. He could answer all our questions.

Amazing Budapest experience with Zoltan!. We visited Budapest with two children. Zoltan was our guide for two half-days. We met in the morning and toured for 4 hours for two days. He made sure to show us all that we were interested in while also paying attention to how much walking the kids could take. When he noticed they were getting tired, he proposed using the bus, tram, metro and we all had a fun learning experience without getting exhausted. I highly recommend Zoltan. He is knowledgeable, caring, energetic and really passionate about what he does. As importantly, the dining suggestions he gave us were exceptional!

Stick with Zoltan for an authentic feel of Budapest. Zoltan picked us up in our hotel lobby, and we chatted for 20 mins so he could get a feel for what we wanted to see, which was non-touristy, historical sites of the city. Like other reviewers said, he started off with a stop at a bar for brandy shots, which was great because it was cold and raining. Now warm and tingly, we set off to get the backstory of the various sites in the city, on both sides of the Danube. He helped us navigate the train and bus systems and he gave us a personal account of the different tensions tearing at this city in the last several decades. He also shared some colorful commentary of medieval Hungarian folklore to give a sense of how the city came to be. We loved our tour with him and it felt like hanging out with an old friend showing us his city. Highly recommended.

Kalliope was great!. We spent the day together starting with getting picked up at the train station and getting a valuable lesson about the Metro!! That alone started out our day great. She shared with us favorite Hungarian treats, St Stephens Basicila, Fishermans Bastion and St Matthias church. So many historical and architectural details you can only learn from a local. Her enthusiasm and love of her city was contagious. We spent nine hours together and would do a local tour again!!

Zoltan was the best tour guide ever. I had the best time with Zoltan. It was like meeting your old college buddy who moved to Budapest. We instantly hit it off. We meaning the whole family including my wife, and three teenage daughters. We started out the morning with some brandy. I am not a big drinker but that was a great idea. We stopped at several bars thoughout the day for more brandy. Zoltan is very intelligent. Not a superficial tour guide. Quite intellectual and opinionated which was terrific because I got a real good understanding of Hungarian political history past present and future. So easy going and genial. He took us to a really good Hungarian restaurant. I would definitely spend another day with Zoltan if I ever return to Budapest. Thanks for the great time, Zoltan!

A wonderful way to experience Budapest!. My family of 5, including 3 teenage girls who are not easy to please, took a full day tour with Zoltan and loved every minute of it! Zoltan picked us up at our hotel in the morning. Before we left the hotel, he provided some interesting background on Budapest and asked us about our interests. He then tailored the tour to our interests and spent the day taking us to many of the magical sites in the city and some more out of the way places. We travelled on foot, by subway and by tram, which prepared us well for traveling around the city on our own the next day. It was a great way to see Budapest and by traveling with a local we were able to experience some out of the way places and understand the history of the city while enjoying the sites. We also had one of the best meals of our trip.I enthusiastically recommend taking a tour with Rockhoppers. My entire family enjoyed our day.

An authentic and genuine tour. My family and I enjoyed a wonderful guided tour of Budapest second to none. Zoltan met us in our hotel lobby and took us on a 4+ hour walk around both the Buda and Pest sides of the city. While we certainly saw some of the popular tourist destinations, Zoltan guided us through several less traveled areas providing historical context and fascinating backstories all along the way. He is very engaging, down to earth, and extremely knowledgeable with a great personality. I would highly recommend Zoltan to anyone seeking a genuine, authentic and friendly tour of Budapest!

Zoltan and Kalliopé. This review should have been written eight months ago, with the delay largely a result of my repeated attempts to capture in words the impact of Zoltan and Calliope on nine 10th and 11th grade students and their adult sponsors in November, 2015. When one student responded to a question about the high point of the trip, his one-word answer said it all: “Zoltan.” As students reviewed for this spring’s AP European exam, they acted out Kalliopé’s kinesthetic descriptions of art styles we encountered during our introductory Budapest tour; this memory of what we heard, saw, and learned is extraordinary. Zoltan and Kalliopé made history come alive as they shared their experiences and responses. Zoltan’s personal stories of life during the last decades of Hungary’s 20th century history and the rapid changes and challenges of the 21st century captured our minds and imaginations, allowing us to go beyond surface explanations, see connections between the past and the present, and look at the individual and human side of this wonderful city.  After six visits to Budapest and loving the special people and places to which I return, my trips will not be the same in the future if we do not include Zoltan and Kalliopé. For all the reasons mentioned in other reviews, I recommend Rockhoppers very highly. Zoltan’s prompt communication, his understanding of the personality of people and groups, his flexibility and responses to our schedule, his personal interactions with group members—all combined to make this an experience that I hope to repeat for years.

A wonderful way to spend a day in Budapest!. Our family of five just completed a full day tour of Budapest with Zoltan, and it was wonderful! Zoltan was very knowledgable about the history of Budapest and Hungary and lead us to some great places we never would have found on our own. He designed the tour based on our interests and was game for any suggestions we had, making the day much more enjoyable than it would have been with a pre-set tour. Zoltan was gracious and fun and really made our first day in Budapest memorable. I recommend you book with Zoltan if you are looking for a comprehensive and interesting tour of Budapest.

Engaging and insightful tour of Budapest! Zoltan was a fantastic guide!. My slightly road weary family of four ended our time in Europe in Budapest. I had arranged for a half-day tour with Zoltan. We secured the tour a few months in advance, and the communication via email was prompt and thorough, At the appointed date and time, Zoltan met us in the lobby of the Budapest Marriott. He had studied up on our family and our interests (provided to him in advance via email) and met us all by name, Following a brief introduction and overview, we headed out into the city.Realizing our time in Budapest was short, Zoltan adapted the tour to visit the spots of greatest interest to my family. He also helped us to navigate the transit system - which went quite smoothly! He provided a balanced approach of historical perspective, along with the current issues of this historic city. The pace of the waking tour was perfect, and he was careful to gauge his audience. He incorporated some stops along the way - for example, we visited a market (one of the smaller ones) and enjoyed a snack to re-energize the my always-hungry teens (and maybe us adults, too!). He also helped us locate a delicious lunch location to end the informative tour. We so appreciated the personalized tour provided by Zoltan, along with his dry sense of humor and his insight into his beautiful city!! We highly recommend Zoltan and Rockhoppers Private Tours!

Aquincum Museum. Friday 3 June 2016We met Zoltan in the Corinthian Hotel Lobby in Budapest. This is the third time that we have met Zoltan over the past six years. We drove to Aquincum where Zoltan gave us an indepth history/walking tour of the old Roman ruins under the motorway. (Most people do not know that the ruins are there!). We drove to the Aquincum Museum which is very impressive. Outside we walked around the extensive ruins which cover a huge area which is only partly excavated. Among the ruins there are so many Roman baths which were excavated in order to show how they were constructed. Also there are a number of Roman sarcophagus on the site. Aquincum is 2000 years old and built by the Roman occupying forces. We highly recommend this tour with Zoltan giving an insight into the Roman occupation of this region.

KALLIOPE ROCKS!. We scheduled two different tours with Rockhopper Tours - one Food & Wine Tour with Kalliope, and a History/City Tour with Zoltan the next day. Our tour with Kalliope was just amazing. She is such a friendly, exuberant and knowledgeable guide - she knew so much about not only the history and culture of the city, but also put together a marvelous sampling of traditional foods, wines, and liquors of Budapest. We had a delightful time wandering through the streets of the city and sampling the cuisine - a wonderful way to get to know any city! It was clear Kalliope had spent time putting together our itinerary and setting up the wine tastings and the fare at a local restaurant. It was fun just getting to know such a sparkling personality. The next day, Zoltan was unable to meet with us due to his car breaking down. He arranged for his colleague, Eva. Eva was really good, taking us all around the area, using public transportation, explaining more of the city's history and culture. We learned a lot and appreciated her kindly jumping in to take us around at our own pace, answering so many questions. Rockhopper is recommended - they seem to have an endless amount of knowledge on all topics, and were very flexible in helping us with negotiating in the marketplace, finding our way around, and generally helping us get the most out of our limited time in Budapest.

Zoltan is one of the BEST. I unreservedly recommend Zoltan for a personal tour of Budapest. Not only is he personable and witty but his knowledge of Budapest's history and culture is unsurpassed. The hours flew by. We are already planning our next trip!

Wonderful tours. We booked 2 tours with Zoltan:1- Walking tour of Budapest (half day)2- Danube Bend (full day)As the tradition goes, the walking tour started with a shot of Palinka. Zoltan covered the historical highlights of Hungary and also covered some hidden details along the way, and discussed the political situation. We really appreciated hearing someone local talking about the communist era, and the political development of the last 25 years. Having read the TripAdvisor reviews, we knew what to expect (not quite a traditional aseptic talking tour, but rather a colorful depiction of things). We did see most of the Pest sides highlights during the walking tour. The tour ended at one of his favorite restaurant on the Buda side (for fish soup).The Danube Bend full day tour was quite different, driving in his old authentic LandRover. The day was quite relaxing and full. We stopped at Szentendre, Visigrad and Esztergom. The tour was well paced and relaxing, and were given some moment alone to stroll in some places.Thank you Zoltan !

Hot Day in Budapest. My family booked a full day tour with Rockhoppers. Timea took us on a well organized tour of the Budapest. Even though it was unusually hot (well over 90F), we had a great time. The city is beautiful and easy to get around on by walking. Timea made sure to look after each of the six of us and our differing interests. The city is easy to move around in and we saw a lot in one hot day. For a group of our size booking a private guide was more economical than booking with a big tour, and a lot more fun.

Jewish quarter walking tour.. An excellent walking tour for our family of 2 adults 2 teenagers, with Eva. The Jewish quarter was beautiful and interesting and Eva showed us many places we would not have found on our own, she also tailored the tour to out requirements. Highly recommended.

Half day tour of the Pest side of Budapest . We scheduled a half day tour with Zoltan with no set agenda. We had a brief meeting before we set off to discuss our interests and left it up to him what to show us. Information and entertaining, especially the palinka at the ruin bar. We especially enjoyed the "behind the seines" local information.We highly recommended him.

Fabulous Private Tour in Budapest with Zoltan. We had a wonderful day touring Budapest with Zoltan. We learned a lot about the history of Budapest and Hungary that which we have missed had we not had the tour. Highly recommended to book a tour early in your stay in Budapest with Zoltan.

Hungary Revealed. My wife and I spent a full day in Budapest with Zoltan. If you are looking for a traditional tour guide reciting endless, dry, historical trivia, then Zoltan is not for you. If, on the other hand, you would enjoy spending a day engaging in stimulating conversation with a new friend who is bright, insightful, sometimes cynical, outspoken and with a dry sense of humor, and if you would like a relaxed pace with opportunities for excellent food and drink, then I would strongly recommend that you arrange to meet with Zoltan. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Zoltan and hope to see him again on future visits to Hungary.

Danube Bend Tour. We had a great day out to the Danube Bend with Zoltan. He's very informative, patient and considerate with seniors, and generous with his time. We visited Szentendre (had the best Langos in Budapest, we were told), Visegrad and Esztergom and ended the day with a lovely dinner at a restaurant of Zoltan's recommendation.

What a fantastic day in Budapest!. My family (6 including two grandparents and three teenagers) spent a fantastic day touring both Buda and Pest with Zoltan. He did an incredible job showing everyone the sights. As it was our only full day in Budapest, he did a great job visiting the "must do" places and the off the beaten path spots. Our lunch in a local fish restaurant will certainly be the highlight of our tour. We are still talk about the fish soup! His pace was perfect. Slow and leisurely, but somehow managed to see two times more than if we were sprinting! You can't go wrong with this company.

An absolute must for insight into the real Budapest . We gave Zoltan the broad request of providing us insight into the culture and day-to-day life of Hungary including both the recent history and happenings of today - less of the 'touristy' stuff and he delivered above and beyond! In only a half-day tour we were provided with many pieces of the complex puzzle that makes up Budapest, Hungary and countries beyond. We were exposed to truths about the past & present which left us emotionally charged and with such great insight into this side of the world which is so different to that we call home. We hardly ventured far from our accommodation in the inner city but the conversation that continued as we strolled the streets, saw some of the sights, learnt the public transport system and enjoyed some local Hungarian delights at the market, cafe and restaurant was priceless and not something you could gain from any research done on the internet nor through your typical tour guide. We walked, chatted, laughed, ate, drank and listened so intently as everything was so interesting, not only that but Zoltan was very generous in providing further information about other activities to do whilst in Budapest and also offered further information/readings for the topics we discussed. Highly recommend going on a a rockhoppers tour - we could have easily done a different tour each day of our trip we enjoyed it so much and feel we got a lot out of it that we'll carry with us for life.Happy travels :)

City walking tour. Zoltan took us around the city and gave a wonderful tour with a lot of inside secrets of the city and many unconventional areas that typical tours would never take you.He knows pretty much everything about the city and most to all of our questions were answered in great detail.

Half day tour -- real insight. Zoltan took us on a private half day tour, with a focus on communist era history. Very entertaining and full of insights! Much more than the average tour. Told the real stories. Corresponded in advance about our preferences and was very flexible on the day. Has very strong opinions from a political perspective, refreshing compared to the average whitewashed tour descriptions ... Overall, highly recommended.

Superb Budapest Jewish Tour with Zoltan!. We were on our first visit to Budapest starting off a European river cruise. Neither of us had been there before. We booked with Zoltan for a 4 hour walking tour of the Jewish quarter. He corresponded with us regarding our preferences before our arrival, and gave us tips on what we could do on our own-Parliament tour, Shoes on the Danube, etc. He met us at our hotel and chatted first-then we set off exploring 3 synagogues, the jewish quarter, ruin bars and all sorts of hidden spots accessible by knowing keypad entry codes-Zoltan had them memorized. He is an iconoclast, a raconteur, a former university professor, and a great guide. My wife and I were both very happy with our choice.

Full day tour with Zoltan Nagy. My wife and I had heard about Zoltan from a friend who had visited and toured with him in the past. I knew we were in for a good time filled with interesting bits of history, art, politics, food and of course abundant local drinks. We opted for a full day which for us lasted about 6 hours. Zoltan is a treasure chest of information on just about any topic related to Hungary, the surrounding countries and even Mongolian-Chinese cultures. He will gladly share with you anything he knows about....especially his love for good palinkas! We mostly walked through town and crossed to Buda for the remainder of the tour. There we hung out at a local favorite bar (Palinkas) and ate at another local favorite eatery of his which was of course delicious. The day seemed to go pretty quickly filled with all of the places and stories of Budapest and its people. We would recommend him to anyone wishing for something a bit different and off beat on their tours. As a comparison we had another city tour included in our river cruise which covered a lot of ground but was no where near as fun. Thanks Zoltan for a great day!

Best Value - See More & Do More!. We were going to be in Budapest for four days and wanted to make the most of our time in the beautiful city of Budapest steeped in history. After doing some research on the Internet we decided to engage the services of a private guide and selected Rockhopper Tours and did not regret our decision.We sent an email to tours@hungarnet.hu and Zoltan, owner of the company replied and put us in touch with one of his colleagues, Kalliope Barkidzi. What a gem she turned out to be! Our initial contact was through email and told her what our interests were, about ourselves and level of physical abilities and set up the date and time to meet in Budapest. She met us at our hotel and briefly we met and charted our course based on our interests and her suggestions for the next 5 hours. She was a wealth of knowledge, extremely enthusiastic, very passionate about her beloved city Budapest, where she was born and raised and not to mention spoke fluent English. We did our sightseeing with her on foot or public transport. By the end of 5 hours with her we had seen so much of the city, learned a great deal about its history, people, culture and became so well versed with public transportation that the following days on our own we were able to find places on our own without wasting too much time figuring out routes to get there.I would strongly recommend engaging services of a personal tour guide for anyone going to Budapest as a tourist. You will never get the details and fine nuances on one of the large group tours where you are herded from place to place on a bus. Kalliope was worth every penny!

Wonderful tour. I have recently returned from Hungary where I introduced my granddaughter to the wonders of Budapest. The trip was memorable because we once again used Zoltan Nagy as our tour guide. Zoltan, a former college professor, brought to life the history of buildings, took us to private locations which required knowledge of keypad codes, and regaled us with the history of Hungary, including the beginning of communism in Hungary. All in all, over the course of two half day tours, he brought to life Budapest and Hungary for my granddaughter and of course me, as a returnee. He is not to be missed!

Great Budapest Tour. We had such a great time with Zoltan out in Budapest. He took the time to find out places we would be interested in and explained everything very well. There were other tours we took around europe and his was definitely the most informative and interesting. It was like just seeing a new place with a friend who has lived there his whole life.

Personalized Tour with a Friend. I entitled this review as such as that's the best description I have of Zoltan. He will customize an itinerary to your own taste and the "tour" was less of a tour and more of a stroll through Budapest with a knowledgeable friend.We opted to visit the Jewish quarter and it was a welcome change from the tourist trail. Along the way, Zoltan provided historical context of the country as a whole, the city of Budapest and of course the individual neighborhoods we visited. We peered in alleyways we ordinarily would not have access to which gave good insight into what life was like here. He would point out details all around us that we surely would have missed on our own. He was never short of a good anecdote and his conversation was easy and relaxed; always talking to us, never at us. Again, it was like walking with a friend.A short visit to a "ruin bar" proved to be a fun intermission and resulted in leaving on shaky legs from a healthy sampling of delicious Palinka, Our tour ended in a well chosen local and casual restaurant where I ate what was my best meal in Budapest.Zoltan clearly loves his country but he's also not shy about providing his opinion on the good, bad and ugly of Budapest and Hungary. I found this to be the most refreshing part of the tour as I prefer to hear a realistic perspective rather than a sugar-coated tourist spiel. I can't say enough good things about Zoltan and highly recommend booking a portion of your vacation in Budapest with him.

Best way to discoer the real Budapest. My wife and I had an amazing private full day tour with Zoltan in Budapest. He is extremely knowledgable and just super fun to hang around with. Not only do you see the typical spots but you also discover the less known places away from tourist tracks, learn a lot about the history and have wonderful drinks along the way. Highly recommendable, super entertaining. Could not have been a better day!

Great Day in Budapest. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Budapest led by Zoltan. I really appreciated that he took the time to learn a little about us when we booked the tour. When he met us in the hotel he spent some time telling us about himself and Hungary's history. We walked all over the city and really got a view of sites as well as the progress Hungary has made since the end of World War 2 and the fall of Communism. It was interesting hearing Zoltan's opinions, coming from someone who loves his country, but is also an intellectual and a realist. In addition to all the places we went, we had lunch together and tasted Palinka. This tour was a great way to see the city and understand its history.

The Most Interesting Man in the World: Hungarian Edition!. It struck me halfway through our tour who Zoltan reminded me of: the character from the widely popular Dos Equis advertising campaign. Not only in appearance, but also in charm and attitude! I'm not sure Zoltan knew what I was talking about when I mentioned it, but I hope he took it as the compliment it was intended to be. Zoltan escorted my husband and I around Budapest for a half-day tour (lasting about 6 hours) and opened our eyes to the beauty and tragedy of this former(?) Communist city. From the landscape (hilly Buda versus flat Pest), to the architecture (utilitarian Communist versus fanciful Gothic), to the government (Democratic in theory, Communist-like in practice) and beyond, the Hungarian capital is a study in contrasts. It would be too easy to dismiss Budapest as just another "pretty" central European city without Zoltan's guidance. To do so would be a shame as you would miss out on all of the comical absurdity (Absurdistan indeed, Zoltan!) that gives this city (and its people) its charm.I like to include a Pros and Cons list in my reviews, so it is...Pros-Fast response time: Zoltan replied to all of my emails quickly-Individualized: Zoltan works very hard to tailor each tour to what the individual/group is looking for. He asked us a series of questions to tease out information about our personalities, likes/dislikes, travel goals, etc. and used this to personalize our experience. For example, knowing that I am a nurse, he was sure to include little bits of information about the state of health and health care in Hungary.-Private: a private tour is private? What? This may be stating the obvious, but we have been on private tours in which the group size was limited but not truly private. While I enjoy the dynamic of small groups, it was a treat to have Zoltan all to ourselves. -Relaxing: Zoltan walks at a leisurely pace and is very patient. He encourages you to stop and explore, take pictures, ask questions, and really notice your surroundings. This, more than anything else, was what I was looking for as my life is too busy, rushed, hectic, etc. -Value: you really get great value for your money. I cannot emphasize this enough. Spending the day with Zoltan immediately felt like spending the day with a dear friend. There is no agenda, no script, no visits to souvenir shops where the tour guide gets a percentage of the profits. What you pay for is a private tour. What you get is an educated, intelligent, kind, patient, funny, compassionate person with a genuine commitment to providing a quality experience. Cons (here's where it gets ugly!)...-None. That's right, none. I do most of my research before trips on TripAdvisor. I have booked all of the tours I have been on based on reviews from this website and have yet to be disappointed. My husband and I are pretty easy to please so we often struggle with finding something to put on our Con list. Zoltan made us feel like VIPs and the only regret I have is not spending more time drinking and eating with him! Take the tour, tip Zoltan handsomely (he has a very hungry son in college!), and enjoy your stay in Budapest!Pictures will hopefully be added later when I finally upload them to the computer ;-)

Guided tour just as you want it. We just had two fantastic days with Zoltan as our guide, filled with stories of Budapest, past and present. There is a story at every corner if you so want from this wonderful city – the beauty, the ugly and the absurd. We did see much of the ordinary splendor but as much the hidden beauty. We tasted local food and beverage and we got excellent recommendations to what and where to eat. Now, I am sure that you will not get the same tour as us because it really felt like a trip composed for us, with love for his city by a true expert.

Wonderful Tour to Highly Recommend. Zoltan went above and beyond to ensure we had the best private tour of Budapest. (Which we did) Highly recommend anyone visiting this beautiful city to book Zoltan, you won't be disappointed!

Couples. We recently took a full day tour with zoltan. It wonderful to take detailed tour with a local.He was funny, knowledgeable and did not gloss over some of the more difficult parts in the history of this country.We had done a lot of reading prior and had numerous questions s of which were answered in full and very patiently.We left having a full experience of this beautiful cityThis is the type of person who puts the run of the mill bus tours to shame!&

Zoltan was one of a kind and a great guide. We really enjoyed our time with Zoltan. He was learned, opinionated and eager to share his knowledge and love of country. He is not the standard guide--he likes to talk and give his opinion. We really enjoyed and appreciated that. We had a group of 8 and he accommodated all of us. We saw a lot, by foot and Zoltan's "classic" vehicle. We saw Monument Park and other sites relevant to the Communist history, as well as the Jewish Quarter and some of the other more typical sites. He was accommodating and gave us some good choices to eat. Overall, we use private guides often and would rate Zoltan very highly.

Extremely informative and interesting. We booked a walking tour with Rockhoppers some time before our trip to Budapest. Our guide Zoltan met us at our hotel and gave us a background to the history of the country and interesting facts about the city. He then walked with us around the Jewish quarter and eventually up to the castle area. He was most happy to tailor the tour to places we wanted to visit and was very knowledgeable about everything was asked him about! He spoke extremely good English and was most interesting and informative. He also gave us lots of helpful advice about where to go and suggested places to eat, the walking tour was very good value and I would have no hesitation in recommending.
A wonderful day with Zoltan exploring Budapest. Great tour!! Zoltan provided wonderful insights into the city and culture of Budapest. I would highly recommend this tour.

Wonderful Day with Zoltan Seeing the Jewish Quarter. My family spent 5 days in Budapest recently. For a city steeped in Jewish history I was a little put off by how they swept the once vibrant life of the Jewish community away. Before we met with Zoltan the only time Jews in the city were mentioned was on the Hop On Hop off bus where the Pest Ghetto was described as "where 70,000 Jews survived during WWII." That was the only mention on a 3 hour bus ride. The next day we had our private tour with Zoltan who met us at our hotel. He helped us understand the so much of the history and attitude towards Jews in Budapest, Pre and Post WWII. We did alot of walking, which for our young 3 and 4 year old children was a bit hard, but Zoltan was amazing with them! He also pointed out lots of things the children could even find interesting! I highly recommend him for anyone looking into a tour of Budapest! He was truly 5 stars!!!

The many faces of Budapest. Our family spent the better part of 4 days guided by Zoltan during our trip to Budapest last week. We felt so fortunate to experience the city from a native's point of view but also from one who possesses an objective perspective. Zoltan showed us many of the usual sites (as we requested) but enhanced the experience with antidotes, stories and supplemental info that informed our experience. He also showed us some lesser known/visited places and helped us use our time on our own to best advantage. He did a great job of getting to know our family and reading our interests. Travelling with Zoltan was like hanging out with a favorite (foreign) uncle! If you are fortunate enough to find yourself in Budapest, be sure to book some time with Zoltan!

Great guide. We had a fantastic day. The guide was very knowledgeable, he took us to places off the beaten track that as regular tourists we might have missed. Excellent day would highly recommend Rockhoppers. lots of information, fun, coupled with an excellent traditional lunch

Fantastic !. Every year i take a group of friends on a mystery trip. This year was Budapest. I always try and arrange a tour of some description to ensure we get the best from our trip. I booked a full day tour with Zoltan, and this was the best thing we did ( and we did loads of great things ). Zoltan met us at our hotel, and started our tour from there, taking in all the local sites, history and interesting facts about our temporary neighbourhood. Very informative and interesting- and unbiased !! We also managed to fit in a coffee, Palinka ( though we won't be doing that again ) and a fabulous meal in a restaurant in Buda.If i return, i'll be giving Zoltan a call. Top bloke, fab tour, made our trip. Thank you.

Great Zoltan. Ahmad &Abeer. There is nothing more beautiful than finding a friend instantly when you visit a new country. That was Zoltan, a great guide who knows every rock, corner, date and the story behind it. He was so informative and knew exactly the right things to do. He showed us the beautiful Buda side of the city, introduced us to beautiful comic painter over fishermen bastion, and shared with us the myths and historical stories of Buda Castle. Budapest would not have been better without Zoltan.

Fun and informative tour of Budapest. For our weekend in Budapest my boyfriend and I wanted to learn more about the city so booked a half day tour with Zoltan. He was responsive and helpful from the start. He asked us about our interests in advance so he could tailor the tour specifically for us, and made the day fun and very informative. I definitely recommend booking a tour with Rockhoppers to get the most out of your visit to Budapest.

Must see part of Budapest. If you have a free day or half day, my sister and I highly recommend Rockhopper’s guided tours. It is a tour that is eye opening and does not gloss over aspects left out by other tours. After hiring Zoltán as our guide for the day, we developed a new appreciation for Budapest, and we experienced an excellent glance into the culture of Hungary. Zoltán was very knowledgeable, kind, and entertaining, and he constantly strove to provide a tour unique to our interests. He worked and researched prior to our tour to tailor it to our curiosity. Our trip to Budapest would not have been same without Zoltán. It is a must do part to introduce you and your loved ones to Budapest. Our tour started strong in a bar with an ounce of pálinka to keep us warm on a breezy morning. We then wandered through and around the sights of Pest, Zoltán telling us stories, jokes, and history, and he even granted us "behind the scenes” access to some of the sites. He would answer any question about the region past or present. We strolled through the city at a good pace taking stops here and there to sample pálinka and in a market to sample some delicious sausage. For lunch we stopped in an authentic Hungarian restaurant in Buda that served excellent food, and afterwards we continued to explore the castle and fisherman’s bastion. Zoltán provided an integral part to our enjoyment of Budapest.

Simply fantastic!. We've been in Budapest just for a few days and for the fact that we've never been there before we wanted to get to know the city by a native guide so we took Rockhoppers - and this was definitely the best decision we could have made! Our tour guide Kalliope is a very funny person and absolutely passionate about the city and the entire country. Her knowledge on Hungary's history, culture and politics is enormous. The tour - which took about five hours - primarily included sights of the Classic tour and was supplemented by Kalliope with other places which were interesting for us. So 'as preparation' for the tour you'll have contact with your guide by email to communicate your wishes and interests. At the day the tour started she picked us up at our hotel and took us directly to the next underground station where we bought a 24-hours-ticket for Budapest's entire public transport (simplest and cheapest way), with which we reached most of the tour's spots. The rest we did by walking. Everything was well-organized! To sum up, I'd like to say that if you really want to get to know Budapest, do it with Rockhoppers! You won't be sorry!!!

Amazing, informative tour with Zoltan!. My boyfriend and I had the best time/tour with Zoltan in Budapest. We did a half-day tour with him on our first full-day in the city and we learned so much. It was a perfect basis for our trip. He's honest, generous, spontaneous and shared delicious palinka with us. If you book, have him take you to a favorite spot to eat. Definitely recommend booking a tour with Zoltan for your time in Budapest city!

Touring with Zoltan. I have recently had the pleasure of two tours of Budapest led by Zoltan Nagy. Zoltan, a former college professor, not only brought to life the history of the various buildings we visited or passed, but also was able to describe Budapest and Hungary as it was, is and what he thought might be coming. I took two half day tours-one of Buda and one of the Jewish quarter. In each of these, we gained entrance to various private places which, without him, I would have passed by and never known what was behind. Zolan is a delight to be with and,when asked, will give recommendations of places to eat and he is very accurate in his descriptions. I will be returning with my granddaughter in April and have already lined him up for tours to introduce my granddaughter to Budapest.

Great way to see Budapest. It was my first time to Budapest and I was only going to be there for a couple days in between a trip to London and Copenhagen. I hired Zoltan for a full day tour. He asked me what I was interested in (history, culture, photography) and arranged a nice itinerary at a pace that was comfortable for me. I wasn't trying to see every tourist site in the city, but wanted to get a feel for the city, the people and the history. I had a great time. It was more like hanging with an intellectual friend. I got see parts of the city I would never have seen otherwise and I also got a feel for the culture and history. I definitely recommend Rockhoppers if you're looking for something a little different than the usual tourist fare.

Fantastic walking Budapest walking tour. Great half day walking sightseeing tour led by Russian speaking guide Marina! We saw Buda, St. Istvan Basilique, and many parts of the Budapest in between. Marina well balanced historic details with present day life of the city and allowed us to truly enjoy the tour. Recommended experience!

Exceptional . Visiting the hidden jewel of Europe for the first time requires a tour guide equal to the task. Zoltan met and exceeded everything one expects in terms of insight, quality, intellect, humor, and wisdom. I left the city after touring with Zoltan with a complete and fulfilling sense of the culture and history the country possess. I am so thankful to have had the opportunity to learn under Rockhopper Tours, and am 100% sure anyone else will have the same experience.

"I'm too old to lie". We had two wonderful guides, Zoltán and Kalliopé, and they were brimming with knowledge of the city they call home. What I really enjoyed is how Zoltán said he was "too old to lie." This was a testament to his no-nonsense style. He did not wish to exaggerate and glorify the history and culture of Budapest like some other companies do with scripted and sugar-coated tours. Instead, he gave factual, insightful, and even critical comments of the city.

Zoltan made our trip. If you are going to tour any part of Budapest and are not an expert in Hungarian history, then you must get toured around by this company. I was in charge of a group of High School students and we had Zoltan as our tour guide. We had 3 days of touring around and used Zoltan for 2 of them. On the third day the kids asked where Zoltan was, and were seriously disappointed that he wasn't with us for the third day. I can't think of higher praise to heap on this company than that. In every sense, Zoltan colored and made this a trip that the kids will remember for the rest of their lives. On a personal note, he single handedly has made me fall in love with Budapest and the Hungarian people. I will travel back here again and again in large part because of this touring company.
Jewish/Communism Tour. A wonderful tour, extremely knowledgeable and interesting. Covers alot of material and tells the truth regarding the history.Would definitely reccomend

"Jewish/Communist/Royal Tour". The tour of all districts of the city were suburb. The extent of detail from clearly experienced guides led to an insightful and interesting tour that enlightened me on much of the grand city that is Budapest.

JEWISH TOUR. My friends recommended taking a tour with the Rockhoppers in Budapest.It was a great event to participate on a tour by “Rockhoppers for locals”. I only knew about two synagogues in Budapest, and I was taken to five! All of them are absolutely different in style, decoration, and all of them are unique. We really learnt a great deal about life of Jewry in Hungary – both in the past and present, and obviously the Holocaust.The guide has a great knowledge and he sometimes used some spice called humour.SahinBudapest – Tel Aviv

JEWISH DISTRICT OF BUDAPEST. This was not my first time I visited Budapest, but the first time me and my friend wanted to explore the Jewish district of the city. Having contacted with Zoltan previously in email, he designed the itinerary for us, and it was an amazing tour. Sneaking into old houses where before 1944 Jews used to live, taking a look at the last section of the Ghetto wall, flodni, the Hungarian Jewish pastry, an excellent restaurant …. Everything.I recommend it to everyone interested in Jewish life and history in Hungary. AzamSt.Petersburg

Jewish tour in my own city, Budapest. I am not from Budapest, however I've been living here for more than 10 years, but in those 10 years I have not learned so many interesting things about the city than in that few hours I spent on a Rockhoppers Jewish tour with Zoltan. We even had the possibility to visit the old Jewish ritual bath, the mikveh. Thanks for the experience and for all the valuable information about my city!

Jewish District tour. Rockhoppers offered a Jewish District tour for local inhabitants of Budapest. Me and my sister tried it, and it was just a great time! We were taken to a service at a small synagogue, and also visited the largest one in Europe. We got to the last section of the Budapest Jewish Ghetto in a hidden backyard, we learnt about the innovations and cultural miracles of the district before WW II.And after all, it turned out for us that Jews were here in the territory of present Hungary several centuries before the Hungarian arrived in here from Asia. A lot of information that we had no idea about. Warmly recommended for other locals and foreigners, too!Emily Watts, London, UK

LEARNING ABOUT MY OWN HOMELAND’S BEAUTY. Living not too far from Budapest, I often enjoyed the grandiose buildings in the city from the turn of the 19th and 20th centuries. It was last year that I was recommended to take a chance with a local tour-guiding group called Rockhoppers. Then we were taken along the Castle District. Now, their guide – Zoltan – opened a special world with amazingly ornate decorations made in the Art Nouveau style. Beside the famous and spectacular Museum of Applied Arts, he took me and my friend to downtown Budapest, and took me into houses (I wonder where he got the entry codes???) with some precious gems known only by the inhabitants of the house. Beside Mucha in Prague, Gaudi in Catalonia or Klimt in Austria, Hungary had its own giants, among others Lechner and Lajta. We visited several amazing buildings designed by them, and we ended at the National Gallery of Art to visit paintings by Rippl-Rónai. Every minute of the tour worth the price!

A Tour at the Jewish District. I love Budapest, it is my own town. Recently, I tried a tour for locals offered by Rockhoppers team. Me and my wife – not being religious - were curious about the Jewish religious life of the city, so we decided to take a chance with the Jewish District Tour.The result: SURPRISE! It was a 4 hours long adventure deep inside of the Jewish life in Hungary, and a „presentation” on Holocaust. It is a must for all!

Amazing insight to Budapest. We had the pleasure and privilege of spending an amazing and interesting day with Zoltan. His insight to the history of Budapest was both intriguing and illuminating. He was honest and delivered what he promised. He listen to our interests and tailored the tour to our needs. He was extremely helpful with detailed emails prior to our visit. He has extensive experience of living in Budapest and supplements this local history with an awareness of the world through his travels. He is passionate about sharing his knowledge of his homeland. He has a good sense of humour and was generous with his time.

Great Perspective. We enjoyed a great afternoon with Zoltan, who offered his unique perspective on Budapest, its history and current conditions. This is not your "canned" "politically correct" tour. Zoltan is open and honest about how the citizens of Budapest have been affected by their unique history. Honestly, we could have sat and talked to Zoltan all day.

Post River Cruise in Budapest with Zoltan. Just spent 2 days in Budapest on customized trip I had arranged by email with Zoltan Nagy.He had gone above and beyond to meet my expectations and arranged a special tour of Dreher Brewery and Martonvasaar . He had researched family history and made contacts for me that I would not have done on my own.His humour, knowledge and organization was exceptional. We were immersed in the culture and thoroughly enjoyed our time . I would highly recommend Rockhoppers and especially Zoltan to anyone wanting a superior tour.Dale Szalay

Tour of Budapest with day trip. We were in Budapest for only four day and used Rockhoppers Private Tours. Kalliope Bakirdzi was our guide and she was wonderful. She speaks multiple languages and is very knowledgeable of the city. When she speaks of Budapest you can really feel her love of the city. She gave good recommendations of places to eat and places to go with our free time. I would definitely try to get Kalliope if she is available.

Knowledgeable and experienced. We were in Budapest prior to the start of a river cruise which included a city tour of Budapest, so our itinerary was customized to avoid overlap with the river cruise city tour.Zoltan mixed commentary about the various sights in Budapest with deeper insights. For example, we saw some venders at a temporary local Hungarian goods fair in the square next to the the St Stephens Basilica, which also had folk music and dancers. Zoltan pointed out the vendors had another agenda that they were pursuing. We listened a few moments to the event’s spokesman who expressed xenophobic apprehension about goods from abroad.Zoltan’s intent was to present an unvarnished picture of what we saw, a sort of “warts and all” approach. The downside of looking at things in too realistic a way is that this prism can make things appear stark and foreboding. Zoltan mentioned dark political forces at work on the left and right and seemed weighed down by the lasting effects of Hungary being on the losing side of the two great wars.Zoltan’s commentary was informative and discerning. He was taking cues from our interests and disinterests at various sights and near the end of the tour added an off the beaten track sight, an unadorned Catholic church inside caverns called the Cave Church near the Gellert Baths which my wife liked a lot.

Zoltan is very knowledgeable, interesting and has a good sense of humor! . We visited Budapest in July and it was 100 degrees, truly miserably hot and humid. Zoltan managed to make our day and a half tour interesting and entertaining enough that we enjoyed it despite the heat. Zoltan is very willing to work out what you would like to see and do, which allows you to tailor the tour to your specific interests. He is not your typical "here are the sites of Budapest, aren't they wonderful" tour guide. He will give you historical perspective, editorialized, if you ask, which we did. He will tell you about life before and after the revolution. We sought a tour that could give us a taste/picture of life in Budapest, with some key sites included. In a day and a half, we knew we couldn't do justice to all there is to do and see in Budapest. We trusted Zoltan to choose some interesting places to see and spend time talking to us about Budapest now and in the past and how he sees its future. We walked down many streets, with Zoltan's commentary. We spent time in both Buda and Pest, and learned some of the differences. We travelled by bus/tram, subway and foot. It was fun seeing the city from those venues, and we liked experiencing the modes of transportation for most people who live and/or work there. Both were quite efficient. Zoltan's knowledge is both broad and deep. He is a thoughtful and perceptive intellectual. In fact, he predicted some of the events that have occurred in Hungary since July. If you want a tour that hits all the usual sites, with the typical hype, Zoltan and Rockhoppers may not be right for you. However, if you are interested in an intellectual perspective of Budapest from a knowledgeable guide who looks at the city and its past and future from the perspective of one who has lived there for many years, we would recommend you try Rockhoppers.

great tour with Zoltan. 4 of us took a tour with Zoltan on Sept. 18/15. All of us really enjoyed the tour. Zoltan is fun to be with and is very knowledgeable. We had a great tour, customized of course. We learned a great deal about his country and countrymen and the history of the country. If in Budapest make sure you obtain the services of Zoltan I am sure you will be quite pleased as all 4 of us were. It is without hesitation that I highly recommend him as a tour guide of Budapest and surrounding areas. when I return there is no doubt that he will be my guide again.

Great surprise!. I've never ever thought, that we'll find such a kind and cultured guide as Zoltan. He was so funny too. He knows everything about history and arts. We'd spent a great time with him (me, my husband and our teen children), and hope next year we'll have possibility taking a tour with him again not only in Budapest, but go to the countryside too. I sincerely recommend him for everyone.

Danube Bend Tour. This is a one of a kind tour. The kind you should take if you want to really 'get' the pulse of a nation. It's not a tour just for the pretty places but also for history and current affairs. Zoltan was our guide and was a super find. He is well informed and a lot of fun. One of the highlights of the tour was that it didn't feel like a tour. We set the pace. There was never any rushing. All questions were answered and we really got to live the moment. Do the tour if you want to see the charming countryside and get a peep into the conscience of this great country.

A truly personal view of Budapest. We enjoyed a full day of touring Budapest with Zoltan. He shared his personal insight and knowledge to give us the "unvarnished" history of a fascinating people and place. Something fun and new around every corner. No hesitation in giving Zoltan our highest recommendation. By the end of the day we had made a new friend always to be remembered.

Educational Tour. Zolton was our guide for the Danube Bend Tour. We had a lovely time exploring the countryside outside of Budapest. It was nice to get a flavor of the towns surrounding Budapest, and the Roman ruin museum was quite interesting if you enjoy history.There's so much to love about the tour, but my favorite part of the day was dinner in the evening. Zolton took us to a delicious Hungarian restaurant (the restaurant was also a winery, which is always a bonus). The setting was lovely, the host was very welcoming, and the food was memorable (and very reasonably priced). I highly recommend ending your tour with a stop at this restaurant.Zolton was a very gracious host the entire day. As other reviewers have mentioned, Zolton will give you a flavor of the true Hungary, and he won't censure the history or current state of affairs. If you're looking for a tour guide to give you a genuine insight into Hungarian culture, Zolton is your man.

Excellent tour . Zoltan met us at our hotel as prearranged via the Internet. He tailored the tour to our interests. We have a long family history in Hungary and he brought us to many sites that were extremely interesting. He tailors his tours to what you are interested in and is very intuitive regarding this. He is extremely informative but also fun. We thought his prices were fair. If you want something that isn't the same old every day tour but has special out of the way places and unique interests then Zoltan is your man. We truly enjoyed his tour!!

Best Guide to Budapest Ever. A Budpaest native, Zoltan is an incredibly knowledgeable, urbane, incisive, and humorous conversationalist (we spoke English) who knows Budapest deeply and with great insight. Four of us walked with him through the Jewish Quarter for three hours, and were amazed at his breadth of historical and current awareness--he sees the city in a sophisticated and entertaining way. Best of all he had lots of "insider" tricks, so that we entered buildings and churches that others just walked by. He is flexible about his itinerary, and ready to show you what you think you want to see, but in doing so he opens up all kinds of new discoveries you were not anticipating.

Wonderful tour of Jewish quarter!. Our half day tour of the Jewish quarter was enjoyable and informative. Zoltan quickly assessed our interests and energy level. He is extremely knowledgeable and an excellent guide. We all wished we had more time for further walking tours with him! Highly recommended.

A great Budapest guide. We very much enjoyed our half day with Zoltan as we walked all over Budapest. He was both knowledgeable about the city's history and culture and truly engaging. Also loved spending time with him in one of Budapest's ruin pubs. He was definitely one of the highlights of our visit. Randy R.

the perfect guide!. Zoltan was relaxed, hugely informative, entertaining and took great care to tune in to our particular interests. We spent an unforgettable morning with him exploring Jewish Budapest that included history, politics (past and present), stopping in a farmers market for snacks and atmosphere - all mixed with laughter and even some impromptu song. He is the ideal guide!

Thought-Provoking. It took me some time to pick out a guide from TripAdvisor because I hoping to find a guide that would illustrate to us what a modern Hungarian mindset might be resemble. Lots of the top rated guides in Budapest seemed more "entertainment" oriented and therefore, I felt, perhaps staged (?) too much for the tourist crowd. Rockhoppers' guide Zoltan was thought-provoking and definitely had his own ideas on the Hungarian people and politics. He has a unique perspective as an older gentleman who has had the opportunity to leave Hungary but chose to stay. He presented everything quite subtly though, in a way that just made you think about it and pay attention. I would say that it would help to know a bit about Hungarian history to pick up on this, or it could easily get lost on you.We did the Budapest Classic Tour, but I think the specialty tours would be even more interesting with Zoltan.

Nice 1/2 day tour of Budapest. We took a 1/2 day tour with Zoltan which we enjoyed very much. We really enjoyed learning about the current affairs of Budapest & Hungary & the history of the country. He showed us interesting building architecture and pointed out things we never would have known or seen on our own. He also introduced us to some local foods & drinks & recommended baths & restaurants. We would have loved to have a longer tour but our time ran out far too quickly in Budapest. We highly recommend a tour with Zoltan to help enrich your knowledge of the city/ country.
Haifa, Israel. Excellent. Knowledge, personality, atmosphere and for chats too... Took 2 tours, for 2 days.1st was in Budapest2nd was outside the town.

Communism tour. Zoltan was not available so we got Kalliope. Despite the freakish heat, we enjoyed our tour. Kalliope was a fountain of information having lived here during the Communist era. Also chatted about current politics in Hungary, very interesting.

Special tour with Zolton. We had a great time with Zolton. We had a day tour with him and learnt so much about Hungary. We talked about culture, politics, history, modern life, different ethnics etc.. many many interesting topics. We could ask anything we wanted to know and he answered all our questions very thoroughly. His tour made our stay very interesting and special. He also suggested us different drinks and food to try out and pools and restaurants to visit. He took us to his favourite restaurant at the end of the tour and it was the best local food and wine and at local prices too. It was really like visiting local friends. Thank you, Zolton!
JewishLifeOfBudapest. My fantastic walk in the Salgótarján Street Jewish Cemetery with the fantastic guide Nora MARGITTA is unforgettable.A very big THANK YOU, Nora, again!

Wonderful Tour Experience with Zoltan. I was fortunate to have Zoltan as my guide for two days in Budapest, July 2015. What a rewarding and memorable experience! I'd recommend Rockhoppers to all who are adventurous and looking for a unique tour experience in Budapest - a great city to visit, by the way, and not overrun by tourists, even in the middle of summer. Over the two days with Zoltan, the back story unfolded of Hungarian history, politics, intrigue, and personal stories, including events involving the Nazi occupation, the Communist regime to follow, and contemporary events. I provided Zoltan a list of sights that I wanted to see, and we built these all into the schedule, as well as many more places. He is very flexible in planning the tours, and yet there was also a lot of spontaneity during the tour, with stops at surprising places, such as the fabulous indoor market, the Chapel of the Cave, and the Hilton Hotel in the Castle district, which contains a little known museum, and ancient ruins from a historic church. We stopped to watch a political march at one point, explored parts of the labyrinth that were not accessible via any tourist map, and on the street met a 10-time Olympic medalist who is an acquaintance of Zoltan's. I also had a chance to ride in his one-of-a-kind Land Rover, which was an experience in itself. I had guided private tours 1-on-1 in 4 European cities this past July, and the Rockhoppers experience was the probably the most unique and memorable - in large part due to Zoltan's incredible knowledge of Budapest (he grew up in the Castle district) and willingness to share insights and personal stories. You can look forward to a tour that exceeds all expectations, and some surprises, and a glimpse of the real Hungary, away from the facade of a traditional tourist company that wants to show just the sanitized version of Budapest. The best of the best in tour experiences! By the way, I recommend the Kempinski Hotel Corvinus in Budapest as your base of operations - terrific in all respects!

Zoltan, a great tour guide every serious traveller is looking for!. Zoltan is not just a good but great private guide that guarantees a great tour in Budapest.He takes time to get to know us, try to understand our interests and reasons for visiting Budapest and discuss the options before we even get on the plane.He would give us a brief introduction/history of the points of visit and answer our questions during the car ride so that we have a basic understanding of what we were going to see. He is flexible and open to modify the itinerary to best fits our interest. One thing I like is that Zoltan never rush us.Zoltan is really a children and senior friendly guide. We were with a 9 years old daughter and a 65 years old grandpa who doesn’t speak English at all. My hubby and I appreciate very much that Zoltan pays equal attentions and care to all of us.
