I love to see the picture of Zoltan sitting down with my daughter on the staircase inside the Mosque and talked to her and answer her questions. Just like grandpa and grand daughter. A lovely picture in my mind that I will not forget. Zoltan also wait patiently for us to translate the information to the elderly. Thank you very much again Zoltan!He told us not just the basic historical and cultural background of the attractions, but the good, the bad, and the ugly. Talking to Zoltan is like talking to a teacher, a friend, and a full-of-experience grandpa. He also recommend what is truly the best places to eat and create a travel experience that you won’t forget. I’d wholeheartedly recommend Zoltan as the best tour guide ever to all my friends and family.

Personal, informative & engaging. My wife and I had a half day tour with Zoltan in mid July.Rather than reiterate the many positives already listed in existing feedback, I'll keep things brief.Think less of a business / customer relationship and imagine you are visiting of friend who has moved to another city and you are being shown round by that person. If you want to be a passive observer who will be read a scripted list of dates, places and events then book something else.If you want a personal, informative, engaging & quirky insight into a city then I can highly recommend Zoltan.

Jewish tour with Nora-AMAZING. Contacted Zoltan who was not available. No worry he put us in touch with Nora. WOW.Not only is Nora knowledgeable she has a great personality and we felt completely at home walking the Jewish Quarter with her. She gave us history and personal insights.She knew half the people we met on the street. I felt we got the back story as well as the standard tour. Thank you Nora.

Excellent walking tour with Zoltan!. We totally enjoyed our walking tour with Zoltan this last Sunday morning. He picked us up at our Four Seasons hotel and we set off to explore the Pest side - Parliament, Liberty Square, etc., and then via bus, Castle Hill for the last part. Zoltan pulled back the curtain and shared lots of interesting facts, perspectives, and stories about Budapest and Hungary - past and present. Excellent English and easy personality - a highlight of our trip & one we'd highly recommend!

Great Two days with Zoltan. We enjoyed two great half day private tours with Zoltan. I loved his saying if there is an open door we go in and see what there is to discover. This is a kind of tour that you can not get with a large group. And that is exactly what we did. Of course we saw the keys sites and key facts. But it was the spontaneous moments that we will remember long after the facts are gone. This type of tour is perfect for learning the "history" behind the facts. We enjoyed his depth and breadth of his knowledge.

My second trip with Zoltanb. 5 years ago My Husband and I went on a tour with Zoltan and loved every minute of our adventure! Just recently I took my mom and sister on a trip to Budapest. I have Hungarian roots and my mom has never been to the place that her mother and family was from. I knew I had to get Zoltan involved. Of course he never disappoints! It was like hanging out with an old friend! He told stories and we drank Polanka. What an amazing experience for her. I would recommend this tour if you want to know about the real Budapest. He doesn't disappoint.

Rockhopper's Jewish Budapest tour. Take the Rockhopper's Jewish Budapest tour! We were lucky to have Zoltan Nagy as our guide. Personable, entertaining and committed, Zoltan was very enlightening about the subject matter and his country. He provided great insights that we certainly would have missed on our own. Highly recommended!

Experiencing True Hungary. One day tour was organised at end of a River Cruise on the Danube. Zoltan did not disappoint! He is truly knowledgeable and informative. As he stated at the start of our day, we would not be having the sugar coated candy tour of Budapest! If you want the standard tourist guide, Zoltan is not your man. If you want to spend time with a warm, genuine person who shares his infinite experience and knowledge with you, then Zoltan is the one. He takes time to understand what interests and excites you. You will visit places not on the map and experience the real things of Budapest. You will come away with a friend in the city and a genuine insight into a wonderful, beguiling City. There is so much history to understand, that we will definitely return. Thank you Zoltan, it was a pleasure to be in your company.

Opened up Budapest to our group. Kalliope guided us through the Budapest highlights and at the same time we got her personal perspective on both the sights and Hungarian history and politics. She took the time to answer all our many questions! I appreciated that she gave us her first hand account of life during Communism and post-communism, which made the tour so much more interesting to our group.

Jewish quarter with Nora Margitta. She was amazing! She is truly knowledgeable, knew her history and anecdotes.She is a lovely person and picked us up at the hotel. We walked with her and she had the codes to enter certain private buildings so we could see part of the ghetto. She even showed us the only remaining wall of the ghetto, which would have been impossible without her.She explained a lot and did it in a way that truly explained Jewry in the past and in the present. We could have gone to the synagogues by ourselves but it wouldn't have been the same.She took us to a farmers market and even bought us a bit of cheese tasting so we could enjoy some flavors.She has made or visit to Budapest become the highlight of our trip.

Tour with Nora. I had a half day tour with Rockhoppers, this was easily arranged : after an exchange of emails with Zoltan , Nora would be my guide. We had an interesting and informative half day tour covering most of the must - see sites plus some other sites of interest- it was very much worth it and gave me a really good introduction to Budapest as well as some better ideas as to what to do in subsequent days.Nora was very good , giving lots of details ( especially historical) . I enjoyed the day and I really liked Budapest.

Two days in Budapest with Zolton. We had an incredible experience with our guide for two days, Zolton. He is a very interesting person, very intelligent with a rye sense of humor. He shared his knowledge of history and politics as we walked around the streets, alleys, and ruined bars of Budapest. Our experiences visiting the old communist statues was unforgettable. There wasn't a question he didn't answer or a story he didn't tell. He is a lovely man and as he said, we left as friends. I highly recommend Zoltán Nagy for a guide if you want an unforgettable experience in Budapest.

Private tour...with added Absurd!!. A really great tour - very varied and nicely tailored to our interests.Zoltan was extremely knowledgeable and was able to show us things that we would never have seen on our own (without straying from the main sights).We particularly appreciated the tour of the Jewish Quarter and learning about the rivalry between Reform and Orthodox Jews. We also had the opportunity to try the local Schnapps (at 10am!!) which was...strong!! Zoltan also suggested a very nice place for lunch and joined us for a well earned bite to eat.I would definitely recommend this tour to friends, family and anyone else who's taking a trip to Budapest.

Relaxing Stay in Budapest. It was a very relaxed tour. If you want something casual, with some information but not an overload of information and history, then this is the tour for you. He definitely knew his city and the streets very well. Good experience overall.

Tailored private tour with extraordinary insights about the Hungarian experience. I travel a good bit, and almost always arrange for a private tour when I visit a place for the first time. Friends of mine recommended Zoltan's company based on their experience with another guide a few months ago. Zoltan was incredibly knowledgeable, insightful, flexible, and focused on making sure that my expectations for my tour were met.After meeting up, Zoltan asked what I was interested in. I'm not sure my answer was coherent, but I tried to convey that I was incredibly curious, interested in history, interested in modern Hungarian life, not interested in religion, and that I would be keen on having a tour that didn't focus on the typical list of places that one must visit. In short, my request to Zoltan was, "Show me what you love about Budapest. Show me what you hate about Budapest. I want to hear interesting stories and get a sense of the place."Without much more than that, we set afoot and walked the city. I got great history lessons, learned bout Hungarian politics, discussed demography and sociology, saw interesting sites, and spent a fun time with a cool guy and got a glimpse into a life well lived. We also had coffee, Hungarian disgestifs, and an adventure in the West End mall trying to find an adapter for an American electrical plug.In short, I got exactly what I wanted. My request may have been unconventional, but Zoltan delivered. After a half day together, I left feeling like I'd scraped the surface of Budapest and Hungary and I wanted to know and experience more. It was the kind of introduction that will set me up for a lifetime of visits and learning, which is so much more valuable than just ticking the tourist-trap boxes.

A Friend In Budapest. You know when you visit a place for the first time and you have a friend that lives there you get to see the city that only the locals know? That is what you get with Zoltan. Don't get me wrong, you get to see all the "normal" sights of Budapest, but woven into your time are stories and experiences that give you a more grand and realistic view of this amazing city. Zoltan is brilliant and has lived to see the many changes that have occurred so his knowledge of the people, architecture, and history was spot on. We ate in restaurants that were amazing but local and inexpensive. We saw how the everyday people live in this city. He helped us navigate the subways and buses and by the time we were to leave we felt like we had a grasp of the city thanks to him. We spent 3 days with Zoltan and it was by far the best experience of all the cities and tours we did.

Big birthday in Budapest!. We booked Rockhoppers on the basis of the reviews on Tripadvisor and the tour did not disappoint. This was a special trip to celebrate our big birthdays! We specifically requested Zoltan as we did have an inkling that he would be able to handle 7 sexagenarian women - and he definitely could. We benefited from a personalized tour with someone of a similar age (!) who was very charming and knowledgable. As it is tailored to your interests, you will benefit most if you have some ideas of your own to contribute and he will accommodate your requests and your questions (we had many). Budapest is a wonderful city and Hungary has a very fascinating, if troubled and mixed up history so it is definitely worth spending a bit on getting a real insight into the good, the bad and the ugly. Other tours in Budapest tended to rely on the automated headphone commentary in a range of languages but nothing beats the personal touch. There was no clock watching and we definitely got more than the ‘half day’ we expected. Wonderful weather helped to make this the highlight of our short trip for sure.

an excellent "view" of Budapest!. My husband and I toured Budapest with Zoltan - I agree with many of the reviews here in saying that we were both educated and enlightened about Budapest past and present. We cannot say enough wonderful things about Zoltan - he is a character to be sure, with a warmth and sense of humor that made spending the day with him such a pleasure. If you do even just one guided tour while in Budapest, then Zoltan is your man...

The absurd and wonderful side of Budapest. Zoltan's communist era tour brought the memento park to life and we were so glad that it was part of the tour. Zoltan explained the meaning behind the iconic statues and we watched the wonderful public information film on how to inform on your friends and family - an absolute gem and well worth the trip out there. Zoltan will educate, enlighten and bring out the cynic in you. If you are looking for a conventional tour of political Budapest, then this is not the tour for you. Our 14 year old loved it too and it is the perfect tour for children studying history at GCSE and A level.

Far better than any conventional tour of Budapest. We learned so much about not just the troubled history of Hungry, but also the absurdities of the past and present political system. If you are looking for a conventional tour of historical sites, this is not the tour for you but if you want to learn the truth about Hungry past and present, Zoltan will make sure that you don't leave the country without a cynical but humorous impression of both the communist and the post communist eras. We felt truly educated about a country we knew very little about. We trailed with a 10 year old and a 14 year old. Our 14 year old found it particularly interesting since Zoltan's tour is a wonderful complement to GCSE modern European history.

Don't miss this Fantastic opportunity!. Zoltan and his colleagues are incredible guides. We have traveled our whole lives, including to Hungary previously and not ever experienced a better deal. The price of their wonderful service and personal attention is well worth it. We learned more and saw more in a day than we imagined possible. They are proud of their country, very knowledgeable, great communicators, and they make it a point to be open and honest about Hungarian history and society. After a day with Kalliope, we had a plan for the next few days that was perfectly tailored for us. The next time we are in Budapest we will take advantage of their service and get one more level deeper into one of the world's great cities. We can't wait!
The amazing Zoltan. Entertaining, informative, slightly irreverent and hugely enjoyable! Highly recommend a Zoltan tour!

Amazing Day Learning About Communist Era Hungary. My wife and I were in Budapest for several days, and spent half a day with Zoltan and his amazing Communist Era tour. This was certainly one of the highlights of our trip. Zoltan is so polite and knowledgeable about the history of Hungary and Budapest during the Communist times because he lived there during it and could provide a great personal perspective. We enjoyed the trip out to the communist memento park on the outskirts of the city in Zoltan’s rugged and well traveled Land Cruiser. He is able to provide great insight into what was happening in the country during the Communist Era as well as the political and ideological thought of the country today.It is clear Zoltan loves Hungary, and loves telling other about its history. Around every corner of Budapest, Zoltan was able to point out something significant and historical and was able to tie everything together throughout the day. We ended at a fine restaurant for lunch where we were able to decompress and talk about our time. It would be easy to spend an entire day with Zoltan, but if you’ve only got half a day, I’d highly recommend spending it with him and learning more about Hungary’s rich history and future.

Superb. My wife and I spent a half day with Zoltan and without a shadow of a doubt it was the highlight of our short break in Budapest. Zoltan imparted his knowledge of not just the history but also the architecture, politics and some insight into the dichotomy of the people in Budapest. It was a pleasure spending time with him and extremely informative. i cannot recommend him highly enough and the next time my wife and I visit Budapest we will make sure to spend more time with him.

Insightful stories. Our Communist Era tour with Zoltan was an informative and thoroughly enjoyable 4 hours. He picked my husband and I up in the city and we travelled out to Memento Park in his Landrover, then to a number of sites in the city. His explanations and insights helped us gain a much greater understanding than if we had visited unaccompanied. Zoltan was able to share his wealth of knowledge on the history, architecture and politics of Hungary in a way that was always intriguing. It was great to discuss our different cultures and the influences that had shaped our lives and societies. Really glad we did the tour with Zoltan.

Best possible afternoon in Budapest. Zoltan exceeded any and all expectations. He met our family of 4 at a location of our choosing and immediately found a hidden gem for a super traditional and delicious Hungarian lunch. We then proceeded to spend the entirety of the afternoon exploring the Castle Hill and learning everything there is to know about Hungarian history, politics, geography and more from Zoltan the master. It was 5:30pm and time for us to say goodbye before we could say "goulash!" Zoltan's raw honesty about his nation's highs and lows is rare in the tourism/hospitality industries -- and refreshing! We recommend Zoltan to any tourists looking to make the most of a short -- or likely long -- stay in Budapest or wherever Rockhoppers does business!

Oustanding, extremely pleased!. We had the opportunity to have Zoltan as our personal guide for a whole day and it was a fantastic experience! Zoltan is a very cultured man, with a very interesting perspective of the country and its history. His wide range of knowledge make his tour guide quite insightful. His rich accumulation of data and knowledge plus his openness and his despise for boredom make his tour guides unique, tailored and entertaining. We recommend it deeply and encourage those who like unique, quality experiences to contact him.

Zoltan Rocks!. We spent four days in Budapest, but we were feeling we didn't know anything about the city and Hungary in general. Zoltan helped us with his encyclopedic culture, and showed us what he loves to call the absurdistan. We enjoyed a lot the full day we spent together and even with a terrible freezing wind he continued his tour and he reinvented it many times. If you like to spend all day long in museums he is not your man, but if you like feel the real flavours and the real mood of the country you visit, than Zoltan is the best in town. Moreover he helped us in planning tours for the other days in Budapest, which we appreciated a lot. We loved the catfish, the Rover, the hidden clubs and every single shot of palinka. Thank you Zoltan.

Great Introduction to Budapest. This tour was a highlight of our trip. Zoltan is an exceptional guide. Not the usual generic tour but personalized and informative. You get an authentic feel for the culture - past and present, historical and political. We started at our hotel and had a walking tour of Pest followed by a subway/bus ride to Buda Castle area. We saw the main sites as well as some extras not seen on more conventional tours. We ended our tour tasting some excellent wines in the Faust cellar. We highly recommend Rockhoppers.

A different way to see Budapest. We have done many standard tours in other cities which include the routine sites and stories but our tour with Zoltan was different. He is a qualified guide but his tour is quite unconventional. Yes, we went past the main sites and got the stories but he also included his personal views on the history, politics and culture of Budapest and Hungary, having lived through the Communist era and seen many changes, so we had a chance to think about things beyond the typical glossy guide book views. It was more like being shown around by a close friend, especially when we stopped for tea and palinka (clear flavoured brandy). If you want to see the usual sites and get the usual stories, this is not the tour for you. If you want to be shown around by a true Budapest character, then give Zoltan and Rockhoppers a try.

Jewish Quarter. I grew up in Budapest in the 70s and 80s and I'm slowly introducing the city to my young adult children who grew up in the USA. Zoltan certainly made the tour very interesting for all of us. I have to admit I learnt a lot of new things about my own birthplace that I never knew before.He is good at adjusting to your interest, space etc. His knowledge is widespread and his sense of humor warms you up even on a cold day...

New impressions from an old city. This was a tour where I had access to places that I could never got otherwise. Although I knew the places, I passed there a thousand time... But did not know about them, and did not get in ... Now I did.... And the mood, the atmosphere was amazing!Thank you for both tours!

An unusual adventure. It is a very unusual adventure to take a walk with Zoltan in the 7th district. It gives you the feeling as if the mid-ninetieth century were all poured on you. This is the area where the Orthodox “penguin” lives together with the colourful youngster, the Arabic kebab maker and hairdresser and also the noisy Gypsy. It is the most exciting part of the city of Budapest. There is everything here from the dance schools to the theatres that a city may need. When you turn to the Dob Street, the past falls on you: every courtyard inside is at least 150 years old! Let’s don’t forget that the last 150 years included everything that the history of Hungary could include. Zoltan speaks about every house as his own old acquaintance or friend. The story that the peripheral Jewish sites slowly turned to prosperous areas together with their architectural miracles that had been first destroyed by the German and later by everyone that ever appeared there…. The major streets are beautiful now, but when you turn to side streets, you will be encountered with the bullet-holes from 1944 and also 1956. You will shed teardrops when walk to the playground of Klauzál Square where the mass graves used to be, and where there is a playground for little kids and also dogs now. This is the area where my grandpa and grandma used to live, this is where the dead corpses were transported by horse carts, and where the charity kitchens cook the menu for the homeless on weekends.

Tour in the 7th district with Zoli. I live in Budapest. What’s more, right in the 7th district! Practically, only two blocks away from the places Zoltan showed us during our tour. However, he knows about secrets that I had no idea before.... It seems that he knows here everyone...And not only everyone but every house, every gateway. He knows the name of the architect that constructed it, who used to be his lover right that time... what did he had for dinner the day when he drew up the planes of the building.He sometimes hunted some people that spoke instead of him, and we got the history and the tales.... the real tales....The place where I am living became live and colourful...Thank you for the enjoyment. I feel jealous for the people who will go with Zoltan in the future

Great Walking Tour With Eva. We hired Eva for a half day walking tour in English. She showed us around a huge portion of the Pest side of the city. Eva gave us a lot of insight into monuments and memorials in the city. She was also able to recommend places to go and to avoid for the rest of out time in the city. She was a great tour guide and we would highly recommend using her services.

Good way to see the city. Had 2 half day tours booked with Zoltan. Day one was spent in Pest. Informative and interesting but maybe just a tad too personal in terms on political views. Day 2 was to be in Buda - unfortunately felt ill and had to cancel. Covered a lot of territory in 4 hours and learned so much of Hungarian history.

Best way to experience Budapest. A small group of us visited Budapest and scheduled a day tour with Timea for a Budapest tour. She gave us a tour based on what we wanted to see and our interests. She new a great deal of Budapest's history and was keen and eager to answer any questions we had. We also enjoyed walking around the castle area and learning about the architecture and history. Timea has gone out of her way to fill our needs and requests and was very professional. We had lots of tours through Europe on our 3 week trip but Timea's tour was the best and the most memorable.

Exciting and authentic tour in the Jewish district. I had to chance to participate in one of the walking tours with Zoltán. Although I live in Budapest, he could show me a pretty new aspect of the district with really exciting stories and sights. We got to some of the hidden part of the Jewish quarter, since he (and his small groups) are very welcome in places where you couldn't enter individually. I highly recommend his tours to everybody who wants to know more of the history, culture and secrets of the city - and get prepared for the Hungarian pálinka shots as well! :)Thank you for the tour!

Old Jewish quarter of Budapest, synagogues. It was a cold and dark autumn day when we gathered at the beautiful Opera house of Budapest and met Zoltán Nagy, our professional guide. It was not easy to wake up as early as He advised us, but it was worthy.We had a professional guide, with wide range knowledge about the everyday life of the Jewish community of the former and present times. We visited hidden romantic and less romantic parts and hoses of the town. We visited living and abandoned sacral places and synagogues. Zoltán was full of stories and historical pictures, and funny jokes as well, because the jokes helped the community to survive the hard times and soah. This was a god time to meet the rabbi and to talk with him, to get acquainted with the spirit and use of tfilin and the micvas of the religious people. We met with really nice and good men who live for and with their old and wise traditions. At the same time they didn’t spare energy to explain us every little fragments of this beautiful and interesting part of the town with its secrets and history. It worth us to visit the richly ornate synagogue of Kazinczy utca, and give your ear to the stories of the old warden. This was a four or five hours walk and visit, but we didn’t feel the cold, fatigue and hunger, just enjoyed the time, the company and the excellent guide of Zoltán. Do not hesitate to choose him and ask to drive you into the secrets of our marvelous capital!

All day, all night. After an incredible day spent in the Zoo, Zoltan was our tourguide to see Budapest at night from the top of the Castle. He shared absolutely unknown stories to me - shame on me as a "Budapestoise" - and he was great in asessing the needs of the group. I wish we could learn History in class like that! Thank you, Rockhoppers!

Budapest in half a day. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Zoltan. Especially the start of the tour with shots of 50% palinka!!! We saw many interiors of buildings we would never have seen. Beautiful and ornate and amazing. Zoltan was very knowledgeable and an excellent guide. We did the half day tour, and we finished in a very traditional Hungarian restaurant for goulash and Hungarian beer. All in all these tours really help you get a feel of the city. We will be back xx

Fall in love with Budapest. Zoli made our European Ashoka Team fall in love with Budapest. I’m personally from Hungary and I know the capital quite well, but Zoli made me discover several new stories in an enjoyable, funny way. Loved it and fully recommend to both Hungarians and foreigners because he is an excellent up to date guide with deep knowledge.

Robert Gex, Seattle Washington. Jewish Quarter Tour. If you want to see an unfiltered look at Budapest, sign up for a tour with Zoltan. My wife and I took a 6 hour walking tour of Pest and the Jewish Quarter and it was like no other tour I have been on. Most tours have a script and a checklist, Zoltan does not believe in this and tailor makes the tour for your interests. We wandered around in so many inner courtyards , where the domestic side of the Jewish quarter life is seen, with the red marble staircases, limestone and brick foundations, and inner balconies. The synagogues come to life not as just a tourist destination but a living breathing experience where the breakfast dishes were still on the table at the school overlooking the temple. Zoltan grew up here, he knows this area as only a local can, with humorous anecdotes about what you see. His level of knowledge of history , architecture, and culture is truly amazing. No topic, including politics ( if you so choose) is off limits. The experience is not rushed, but with several stops to sample the local food and drinks such as palinka (Brandy). I have traveled all over the world and been on many, many tours in my life, Zoltan redefines what a tour should be. It is obviously his passion to share his knowledge of Budapest and Hungary with you, and it becomes infectious. If you want to take a tour of Budapest, book Zoltan!

Timi-- Best part of our Trip!. My husband and I booked a trip to Budapest in October 2014, and had a tour set up with Zoltan. When Zoltan later emailed us and told us he was actually unavailable that day, but we'd be in good hands with Timi, I was a little bummed- Zoltan's tours sounded wonderful, but we trusted his recommendation. Timi showed up at our hotel on time, and quickly helped us get our bearings around the city and public transport. The tour was above and beyond what Eric and I asked for- she took us, at our request, to one or two of the popular (albeit touristy) spots, but more often to areas you could tell were near and dear to her heart that showed the real people of the city- Jewish historical sites, beautiful walks with locals strolling, fantastic restaurants. We took another private tour later that week in Prague, and while good, it made us appreciate Timi's tour so much. She never once made us feel like tourists, but rather as friends that she wanted to share her city with. Prime example- after meals at 2 great restaurants (her recommendations), I shot her an email asking for one more. She went out of her way to make a reservation. When we arrived that night (not having checked our email through the day) the hostess regrettably informed us that they were all booked... but Timi had asked the hostess to pass along a message that she'd made ANOTHER reservation at a place down the street. We were floored- she went so out of her way! Needless to say, we can't wait to go back. She made our trip so memorable! Thanks Timi!!

Amazing Budapest with amazing guide. We decided to make a weekend trip to Budapest. However, We were a little afraid we will not get to know this city in such a short time. Luckily, we booked a guided tour!! Our guide Marina told us so much about this city, in few hours she took us to amazing places, we even tried some traditional Hungarian food with her! I highly recommend her as your future guide, she does not miss anything and make your short stay unforgettable.

1-day trip in Budapest. I had a 1-day guided tour with my friends in Budapest. I liked it very much because our guide, Marina not only took us to the most important places but told us stories about Hungary and also showed us interesting places where tourists generally don't go.

Classic Budapest. My husband and I just visited Budapest (we're from the US) and scheduled a half day tour with Zoltan for the "Classic Budapest" tour. He actually gave us a tour based on what we wanted to see and we're interested in. It was fascinating learning of Budapest's history and tumultuous past. He doesn't sugar coat anything and tells you how it is which I appreciate. We enjoyed walking through the market to try sausage and palinka. We also enjoyed walking around the castle area and learning about the architecture and history. He left us at a wine tasting cellar which we also enjoyed. I highly recommend Rockhoppers and Zoltan!

Great tour, no standard boring talkshow but a Great story teller who tries to capture the interest of the Group.. Awesome tour that lastest far longer than expected. The guide was very flexible and really tried to capture your interest, so no standard script but tailor made! A must do

Statue park, city walk. We had an awesome time with Zoltan and his wife. Really got to see the city thru diffenrent eyes and had a peek into Hungarian/Budapest life we would otherwise never have seen. Zoltan speaks perfect English with a big dose of humour and we were sorry the day came to an end! A must do!

The communist tour. We were with 13 guys for a bachelor party in Budapest. So I booked this tour. It looked very promising on trip adviser…….. and hell IT WAS.Zoltan our tour guide first toke us with 2 cars out of the city to a privet owned park full of historical monuments . After that we went to a local bar, a must see too Szimpla Kent. After the bar we did a tour of the city. Normally we were going to eat at the Szimpla but Zoltan toke us to a restaurant outside the city. I recommend everybody who goes on tour with Zoltan to make him take you there you will love it.Zoltan Is a guide that has a lot of knowledge of the city and knows the little thing you would not get in a normal tour. Great tour and a super guide Loved it Thanks Zoltan!!!

Zoltan is the best. We took a tour with Zoltan and honestly, he is absolutelly the best guide I have ever seen at work. As a tour operator from Prague I have seen many guides, but this man is incredible... Zoltan brought budapest and hungary alive in front of us like no one other..... 5 of 5 without question. Thanks a lot man

Great tour!. My sister and I booked a 6 hour walking tour. We thought 1/2 a day was too short and 8 hours might be too long. It was great! Our guide Aliz showed us all around the city and pointed out things we would have otherwise just walked past and hardly noticed. I highly recommend it on your first day to get a good lay of the land, idea of the history and use it to plan what things you want to go back to on the rest of your trip.

10th wedding anniversary. We booked a private tour as we were only in Budapest for 4 days for our 10th wedding anniversary and wanted to see as much as possible.Our guide Marina was excellent, very knowledgeable, humorous and could not have been more helpful. Budapest is a beautiful city and with Marinas help we certainly had an amazing time. Thank you Marina for being part of our special anniversary.

Budapest walkingtour. We booked this tour at the day we arrived. We had a great time with Zoltan. Zoltan speaks about the Hungarian history with a lot of humor. The day that we have booked Zoltan for a private walking tour it was a rainy afternoon, but the tour was excellent. We liked to travel around with the public transport. We had some Coffee stops and national drinks, to get warm and at the end of the tour, Zoltan advised us a nice restaurant for the evening. Zoltan is the best guide in Budapest we think. It was a very nice experience to walk with Zoltan through Budapest and see the highligts of Budapest. For us it was a good start of our weekend Budapest! Thanks!

Everything you ever wanted to know about Budapest - and more!. My husband and I booked a personalised tour through this company for our first day in Hungary, largely based on the outstanding Trip Advisor reports we had read. We were so glad we did!Zoltan was our guide and we thoroughly enjoyed his informative, witty and comprehensive explanations of so many different aspects of Hungary. He really brought Budapest to life for us. There’s nothing he doesn’t know about the place!Because we were the only ones on the tour, we were able to move at our own pace and choose where we wanted to go as we went along. We loved this flexibility. It was good to get an overall picture of the city before we branched out on our own over the following days, so later we came back to many of the places we had visited with Zoltan and they made more sense thanks to his stories.We highly recommend Rockhoppers Tours for your visit to Budapest.

EXCELLENT TOUR. Highly recomended to anyone who wish to learn about the past and present of Budapest. We booked for two, half day tours with Zoltan and he took us to places we would never had gone with group tours. The tour was personal, casual, knowleageble and entertainning. Not only Zoltan took us to main attractions but he also took us to places for locals. We were able to mingle with the locals which was what we wanted. We felt like he was part of the family. The tour was versatile which allowed us to cover our vast interests. We are experienced travelers and this tour definitely was one of the very best. Thank you Zoltan for making this a perfect vacation and for the plum liquor and warm cherry/poppy seed strudels you treated!!!!!

Budapest classic with Timea. Myself and my wife travelled to budapest in the afternoon on Wednesday and I had already booked the budapest classic tour with rockhoppers, first through Zoltan and then when we gave the date with Timea who would be our guide, so we set out at 10am on the Thursday with Timea. We had been emailing back and forth for sometime about our likes and dislikes and any question I asked was responded to promptly and politely, timea also had many recommendations for things to do and see whilst we were in the city. She arranged to meet us in the lobby of our hotel (palazzo zichy) which made things a lot easier and also meant that we could learn things we didn't know through the area which we were staying.I can't speak for my wife but as for myself I was quite nervous about meeting someone in person who I had only communicated with through email but Timea soon put me at ease, it was like we had know her for some time.One of the best things about the tour for me was that we would just stop and go into random buildings in which we wouldn't usually stop and we would get to see what local people did day to day, which having a Hungarian grandfather I never knew; was nice  I had requested to learn about the hungarian uprising and sure enough Timea could show me key buildings involved and tell me stories about it, truly the tour is customised to each individual and as per my wife's request we were able to stop in a tiny hidden coffee house and try some unique draft coffee, we also stopped in gerbaud and looked at the lovely cakes and chocolate to which later in the holiday we returned and bought a selection. Throughout the tour which was structured excellently and flowed perfectly we saw many of the main sights if not all, not bad for a half day tour, these include the great synagogue, St Stephens basilica including going up the tower to see all of budapest (an amazing view.)We also saw parliament, matthias church, fishermen's bastion, chain bridge and vaci utca and others I'm sure. Another important part of the tour was the use of public transport in Budapest.Included in the price was a 24hr travel pass for use within the city limits which Timea had bought with her and so we were shown how to use the metro and the bus system which most definitely helped for the rest of the holiday and gave us tremendous confidence.Like I said previously I was impressed with how the tour flowed, even when we made stops here and there we still finished the tour on time and right where was agreed at the start which was on the buda side by the royal palace.Through my time with Timea and stay in Budapest I was able to learn a few hungarian words which came in handy when on Friday morning we left budapest and travelled to kecskemet for a brief football related stop, I eventually felt confident enough to try and speak a bit of it at times.Trying to remember every detail of the tour is hard as we saw a great deal and learned a lot of information but as I had requested we visited a small local market on the tour and stopped here for some excellent but filling lángos, which we loved.I'm sure I've missed something out but it's early morning so forgive me but in conclusion we greatly enjoyed our budapest classic tour with Timea and when we return to the beautiful budapest I shall request another tour with Timea as our guide.Thank you so much Timea

Zoltan is Great.... I booked a full day tour with Zoltan as I came up just for the day from Vienna on the train. Prior to the tour, Zoltan answered my emails promptly which was appreciated. Additionally, I found his tour pricing very reasonable.Zoltan is a little older than some tour guides which I specifically wanted for Budapest because he had lived during the Communist occupation and I wanted to hear from someone who understood that time.He was waiting for us at the train station when our train pulled in late. The day of the tour it was raining which I wasn't crazy about but when you only have a day to see the city, you suck it up. Zoltan had an umbrella for me which I much appreciated.We spent a fair amount of time in the Jewish quarter with Zoltan. One thing he does is show you the good, the bad and the ugly. I felt I got a real view into Hungary not a whitewashed one. A motto he has is - if you see an open door, Walk through it. Many times we were in a neighborhood and we'd just walk into a building to see what the architecture was like and/or chat up the residents. We went into this old-time barbershop that the owner's father had owned from the '40s - it was cool.He brought us to a wonderful Jewish restaurant in the Ghetto that had fantastic food. I had duck breast with pumpkin risotto, I wanted to lick the plate. Needless to say my plate was clean.He took us to a market and I got 2 of these wonderful little leather Hungarian coin purses that you can hang on a purse - mine is on my computer bag which were 10 Euros each. I only regret that I didn't buy more of them as I have had compliments on them already. We saw the American Embassy, the Cave Church as well as other goverment buildings and monuments.It was a full day by the time Zoltan dropped us off at the train station at 6:30 PM.My husband and I enjoyed our day with him and I highly recommend him.

Exciting, friendly,helpful. We were two couples in our fifties from Tel Aviv,coming to Hungary for four days. We planned to see Budapest and also visit a cemetery in a small town in the eastern part of the country where my family used to live decades ago. At Rockhoppers, we first got in touch with Zoltan, and then with Marina. They were helpful already via email, suggesting how to organise our trip and making the necessary arrangements with the car and the driver. But the time we met Marina personally, we felt we were already good friends. Our tour in Budapest was absolutely personalised and exciting - we saw both "must see" sights and those hidden from superficial view and fitting into our areas of interest. We loved the beautiful countryards of residential buildings, small art galleries and local market.We also got excellent advice on the best places to do shopping. All in all, it was a blend of practical help and exciting guiding.

Weekend in Budapest - Great experiance. We have never been to Budapest, but we will definitely come back! We spent two wonderful days here. Our guide Marina took us around in the city and in the Jewish Quarter.Very polite and knowledgeable, she talked about the city and the country's culture in a really entertaining way. It was not only dry facts but lots of stories, which flew us back in time and make us really feel the place. We went to the Museum of Fine Arts too, where we found out that Marina was also an art historian. I can only recommend this experiance yo everyone

Excellent personalized tour. As a group of six, we decided that a personalized three-day tour of Budapest was the best way to see and understand the city and its history. What a great decision! Zoltan showed us a side of Hungary that we would NEVER have seen without his expertise. We collectively recommend him to those who have inquiring minds!

Saw so much of Budapest!. We had a walking tour with Marina and she was right on time. She started out a little quiet but there were 8 people in our group so I am sure it was a little overwhelming. She warmed up quickly throughout our tour. Budapest is quite a spreadout city and she did a great job of covering a ton of ground. She was very accomodating to our wants and didnt hurry us along too much but kept us on pace. Her English was very good and we never had an issue understanding her. She did a good job of keeping us together which can be tough since we were all stopping at different times to take pictures, buy drinks, etc. She dropped us off at a great place for a late lunch and reccommended some ruin bars and how to get there. We loved Budapest and I would reccommend this personalized walking tour to get a feel for this city!

Personalized tour from the best!. With very little notice, Zoltan developed a customized site-seeing trip around various places in Budapest based on our interests, not a pre-determined list of places. Our group, though small, consisted of family aged 14-70. Every one of us raved about our experience with Zoltan. He has forgotten more about this incredible city than most will ever know and was able to bring the city to life for us in a way that a large group tour simply would not have. In addition to being informative, his sense of humor made the experience even better.When deciding where to go with him and what places we should explore on our own, he was very careful to listen to our interests and guide us to places we would have missed otherwise. And, due to our limited number of days in Budapest, we was also incredibly insightful directing us away from sites that would not be as pleasant of an experience overall. From site-seeing, to restaurant recommendations, to transit-travel to bringing this historic city to life, we highly recommend Zoltan's services!

Very, very interesting..... Zolton was not the kind of tour guide that points out every architectural detail or fact about every building or art work that we passed on our tour. Instead he provided an overview of the complicated and often confusing political history of Hungary. We especially found interesting his perspective on Hungary's role during WW2 and the post war Communist era. Zolton is passionate about history, politics, food and drink. He was very generous and we got to try local sausage, cheese and a Hungarian Brandy (at 10 am in the morning!). This was not a fast paced tour where we got to see all of the sites in a day, rather it was a leisurely exploration of the cities' cultural and political history. Both my husband and I feel like Zolton gave us a great gift in better understanding a country that we had previously known nothing about.

Tour with Marina was good but not as expected. We booked a tour of Budapest with Rockhoppers for our group of 8 based on the glowing reviews of customized tours (mostly by Zoltan). We booked months in advance and typed up a summary of our interests as requested for the custom tour. A few weeks before the tour we were informed that our tour guide would be Marina. I looked on TA and did not see her name mentioned in any Rockhopper reviews so I wasn't sure what to expect. Marina met us at our hotel which was very nice. She was a little quiet and serious for our group but warmed up to us a bit as the tour went on. She was accommodating when we wanted to stop at a Gelato place we had heard about and she showed us a lot of Budapest in a small amount of time which was great. She is very knowledgeable about the city and we did enjoy the tour.I don't feel that the tour was customized to our interests, however, and since that was such a big part of the glowing reviews on TA I was a bit disappointed. I feel we would have gotten the same tour with any decent tour guide in Budapest.

Tailor-made tour without the sugar coating. Zoltan was most responsive in planning our tour by email, long before we arrived. We wished to see Memento Park, the Jewish Cemetery and the Jewish section of Budapest. He met us at our hotel a few minutes early and we were off in his well worn Land Rover jeep.Zoltan is a retired professor of Asian studies,a recovered introvert who took up being a tour guide just four years ago. He has a fascinating lineage, much like Hungary itself, and he's a bit irreverent, but a most pleasant and nonchalant manner. Leaf through his website and you will get a good feel for Zoltan. He informed us of the vast contradictions of a country of assimilated people who are searching for a Hungarian identity. Hungary is a democracy that is becoming less democratic. Unfortunately, the right wing anti-semitism is once again rearing its ugly head. The nation that has recently reduced its mandatory education requirements, with a Premiere who prefers the governing style of China, Russia, Azerbaijan and Turkenistan and has refashioned the recently adopted Constitution numerous times to suit himself.This is not your typical rushed tour, but a chance to stop and smell the "roses" and indulge in the local wine and plum brandy with the locals. He helped us navigate Budapest's public transport and finished our tour with a stop at a ruin bar and finally an impromptu stop at Liberty Square, where you can learn the entire history of Budapest and see its revisionist history first hand.Zoltan's deep dive into Budapest will keep you thinking and provide you with a most unique experience.

Kalliope---wow. This is a guide you must meet!. We spent a day with Kalli and were impressed at every turn---her knowledge and spirit for all things seemed limitless, while she intrigued, informed, humored and well-guided us from mid-day to well past darkness. We started with our request to be driven to Szentendre and guided there, though with no specific target. Kalli soon understood our general interests and we went immediately to fascinating churches, galleries, Margit Kovacs ceramic museum and other special sites, watching folk productions and a surprising percussion ensemble on the central square, and sharing a special pastry stop mid-day. It is hard to adequately describe how impressive and wonderful her guide services were. She kept adding and adding to our day, and back in Budapest near twilight took us to the best sites of Buda overlooking the Danube as darkness fell, explaining site after site we had only seen via riding the hop on/off bus tours: the Citadella, castle, Gellert mountain and even a private peek into the famous Gellert baths, all narrated with expertise and again, a seemingly endless depth of knowledge and delight. Multi-lingual, multi-national, multi-talented; you will not be disappointed in your tour with her.

Stop researching a guide for Budapest---just schedule with Zoltan!. Massively knowledgeable, interesting, irreverent native and mature historian, past university academic, edgy and supremely accommodating. Zoltan manages his guide business of hand-picked seasoned guides who are from many well-versed backgrounds in just the way you would want. He was also our guide. He is on time, on topic, on task, on internet (email/text-responsive), and can arrange anything. For those who have no pre-conceived ideas or plans, there are specific tours described on his site which will nevertheless be individually specialized. If you have interests or sites already selected, he will happily accommodate these and provide an exceptional day, adding to your plans. (we requested to start out-of-town at the Herend factory and Balaton Lake region, and ended with his added suggestion of a night walk of the Budapest Jewish quarter, synagogue and ruin bars; all terrific). Zoltan's manner is pleasant, humorous and calm, yet brimming with info; he is as happy to entertain you, as you will no doubt be entertaining to him. You can't go wrong, and we speak from years of guided international experiences!

Budapest with Nora of Rockhoppers. We did two half-days with Nora this week. Based on TA reviews, we contacted Rockhoppers for sightseeing in Budapest. The replies from Nora were timely and enthusiastic, with lots of useful information about tours and activities in Budapest. Nora turned out to be punctual, reliable, and accommodating. Her tours were informational but somewhat dry. We enjoyed seeing many sights with her, but only wish there was more "sparkle" in the tours. Overall, this tour was average or better. Note: the amount of money she thought we owed her was different than quoted. However, she fixed it down to the actual amount due when we presented an e-mail confirmation. No problem there!

Our fourth day with Zoltan. During our 2013 visit to Budapest and while spending “Three days with Zoltan”, we realised what a fantastic tourist destination the Hungarian capital was. No wonder we decided to include Budapest once more this year while visiting one of the neighbouring countries.Well, who was the first person to know about our second visit to Hungary? Zoltan, of course!This time we had a “real Hungarian” rather than a “tourist” experience in mind. We asked Zoltan to let us know about any Hungarian celebration /festivity that would be on the calendar during July in or around Budapest.Zoltan immediately sent website information of the “International Palace Games” presented once a year in Visegrad. We bought tickets on the internet for the opening day of the Games and booked our seats on the hydrofoil from Vigado Square in Budapest. Zoltan agreed to meet us in Visegrad.We reached Visegrad boat station at 10h30. It was heart warming to see Zoltan (with his cap) sitting like a sentinel on a rock wall with his trusty Land Rover parked close by.Zoltan helped us overcome all the logistical problems during our day in Visegrad. The weather was not quite what we expected. We left Budapest in a drizzle and although there was no rain by the time we reached Visegad, the temperature and humidity was quite high!The “Palace Games” would only start at 14h30 and we had time to drive uphill and visit the Citadel. We wandered around the museum to see what life was back in the early days of the kings. From the top we had the best view of the Danube Bend. (During our 2013 visit we could only see the Citadel and Danube Bend from the deck of our cruise ship.)Back down in town, Zoltan parked his Land Rover at the café where we enjoyed lunch. From the café we strolled along the streets lined with stalls selling crafts and food. Actors walking around wearing Medieval costumes made a huge contribution towards a wonderful historic carnival atmosphere. Zoltan as our personal historian-tour guide and interpreter-translator made the “Palace Games” an even more memorable experience!Zoltan walked his usual extra mile: We had to catch a bus from Nepliget station early the next morning. Zoltan immediately made arrangements with a trustworthy taxi-friend who met us at 05h15 at our accommodation. Zoltan also made a phone call to the office at the bus station to obtain certain information.Late afternoon we headed towards Budapest. On the way we made a stopover at the Schieszl Restaurant. Excellent wine from their own cellar complemented our Hungarian meals. Zoltan arranged a quick visit to the restaurant cellar and kitchen. We insisted using our multi-day public transport tickets and Zoltan dropped us at a HEV train station.Thank you, Zoltan, for a perfect day – summer downpour and all!Back home we found an email sent by Zoltan and added to it an album full of pictures! What a pleasant surprise!

Such a great day with Zoltan. My husband and I recently had 3 days in Budapest and knew nothing about it. We were so excited to learn about the history and see the city and knew that a walking tour would be exactly the way to go about it. After reading the reviews we booked a day with Rockhopper and got to spend our time with Zoltan. Needless to say we were thrilled. The best thing is that he spent time before (via email) and our first 1/2 hour getting to know us and what we wanted to accomplish and then he made a fantastic plan for our day. The history, the wine, the sites were wonderful and his knowledge and spin on all of it made it the perfect way to see it all. If you are looking for a fast paced cookie cutter tour, this is not for you. We feel like we made a new friend in Hungry and we are excited to return and see other sites in the country with Zoltan. Thanks for an awesome adventure in "absurdia". See you soon!

Not your normal walking tour!. My wife and I met with Zoltan while travelling through Budapest in July. The price of the tour is not cheap, but its money well spent.Zoltan personalised our tour based on your likes and dislikes, and his knowledge was unbelievable.Would highly recommend this tour to anyone that visits Budapest!.

Don't Miss This Opportunity To See A Different Side Of Budapest. We are a family of 5 who had already done a day with one of the hop on, hop off bus tours and were on the fence about doing this because we had already seen much of the city and weren’t sure a tour like this would hold the kids (14, 12, and 9) attention. We were very glad we decided to take a half day walking tour with Zoltan. He took us to many “off the beaten path” places and did a great job of holding everyone’s attention by explaining the history of Budapest/Hungary, helping us to sample local foods, and helping to us to understand what life is like for the people of Budapest. I would highly recommend this tour.

Excellent Guide. I spent a day learning from Zoltan while traveling in Budapest in July. His stories, perspective, and guiding style were top-notch! As a teacher, I had many questions about Hungary's past government and economic system which were thoroughly answered with great stories! I hope to return again, and hope to have another guided tour. I highly recommend their services!

Amazing tour with Kalliope!. Booked this trip based on tripadvisor reviews and it was fabulous! Our guide, Kalliope, emailed us beforehand to find out what our interests were so she could tailor the tour for us. She was incredibly knowledgeable about Budapest and gave us insightful history and context every step of the way. We got to see the main tourist sights, learned the subway and tram systems and heard some fascinating stories about Budapest. Her love of the city was infectious and we loved our tour! She even spent extra time with us afterwards to give us ideas on other "must sees" we could go see on our own. Loved this tour!

Fantastic, fabulous walking tour of Budapest. I am in Budapest for the first time with my best friend, and we were looking for a tour to help introduce us to the city and Hungarian culture, to get oriented. We had SUCH a great experience with Kalliope from Rockhoppers Tours. As a native of Budapest, her knowledge of the city and Hungarian history and culture is amazing. We went all over the Pest and Buda sides of the city, saw tons of sights and got oriented to the public transportation system and some basic Hungarian language skills. Kalliope very generously helped us plan the rest of our stay in Budapest at the end of our tour. I can't recommend her highly enough! We had a wonderful experience and hope you will, too!

Zoltan delivers the best of Budapest with a personal touch. Our experience with Zoltan could not have been better. Three couples began planning a September ‎visit to Budapest in May and we communicated with Zoltan several times throughout the process. He ‎never failed to answer our emails promptly and addressed every question we had ahead of time, ‎regardless how trivial. Once we arrived in Budapest, Zoltan did not disappoint. He was delightful - ‎always on time and knowledgeable of the area, its history and culture. He honored our preferences ‎while also suggesting several things that only locals would know about. Most of all, Zoltan was fun. He ‎made sure that we didn’t just see Budapest – we also experienced it in a unique way. We never really ‎felt like tourists there. Zoltan is a seasoned professional who understands the importance of the ‎personal touch. He sincerely cares about every detail of your overall experience in Budapest. Hiring ‎Zoltan was the best decision of our trip.‎

Eva Kleyer - a top-guide. Eva guided us during 2 days through Budapest. She is a great tour guide with almost encyclopedic knowledge about the history of Budapest and very good communication skills. also in English. She told us the stories behind the attractions of her beautiful city.Delivered beyond her assignment through helping us with unforeseen challenges and with recommendations and bookings for other elements of our tour. Eva interacted very well with our diverse group.She made our tour more than 'a' tour.Highly recommended if you need a quality tour guide in Budapest!Big Wheel alumni tour

Budapest in Hungary, Kosice in Slovakia. On our second visit to Hungary in June 2014 we have again engaged Zoltan Nagy the guide whom we met two years ago.This time he drove us to Szentendre, an interesting village north of Budapest, and on to Visegrad, an ancient ruined castle overlooking the Danube. He told us the history of the places which we found very interesting. Next day he took us to the Herend Porcelain factory, North of Lake Balaton and also to Veszprem which is a very old historic town prominent in Hungarian history. We recommend visiting both places allowing a full day.The following day Zoltan drove us to north of Hungary and across the border to Kosice in Slavakia where we stayed the night. The next day we visited St Elizabeth Cathedral and the crypt. Inside the crypt is the tomb of Ilona Zriny and Ference Rakoczi II (Mother & Son). We also visited the Rakoczi Museum which is a replica of the house Prince Rakoczi lived in whilst in exile in Turkey. Note: this museum is closed on a Monday. Kosice was one of the highlights of our visit and we would highly recommend a visit to this interesting old town.We then drove to Eastern Hungary to Sarospatak where Zoltan left us for a few days while he himself returned to Budapest. We visited the Rakoczi Museum castle (impressive) and House of St Elizabeth museum. The St Elizabeth Cathedral was closed for renovation. Comenius Kollegium of Theological Studies Library is also well worth visiting.We returned to Budapest by train where we met Zoltan who drove us to Esztergom to St Paul’s Basilica. On the way we turned off to a small village where an ancient monastery stood. Only the foundations remained in a very pleasant setting. St Paul’s Basilica at Esztergom is huge and very impressive. We also visited the big underground crypt. We had lunch in the restaurant complex associated with the Basilica, built with brick arches/domes. Estergrom is ‘breathtaking’ and well worth visiting. Allow one day to enjoy the town as well.We highly recommend Zoltan Nagy who is a professional guide for his expertise and knowledge of history. Zoltan was formerly a Professor in Ancient Studies at the Budapest University and has also published books on Tibetan Buddhism.

Great trip in Budapest with Zoltan. We were fortunate to get in touch with Zoltan just few days before our trip. He was very responsive and arranged our itinerary based on our interest. We travelled with two boys and Zoltan made sure that they have a great time in Budapest as well. First day we travelled in countryside of Budapest in his own vehicle. He explained to us history of Budapest, present situation and make us experience local feast. Next day we asked him to take us to not so touristy places and he exactly did it. He was always on time, always looking after our comfort and making sure that we have a memorable trip. I give Zoltan five stars. Thanks Zoltan for showing us good time in Budapest.

Rockhoppers and Zoltan is a must if you visiting Budapest!. We are a family of 5 from Canada and we spent 2 days in Budapest at the end of August.Based on the reviews on Tripadvisor I hired Zoltan as a private tour guide to see some of the major historic sites of the Hungarian capital. Let me tell you we were NOT disappointed for sure. He met us at Hosok plaza where we parked our car and we spent 5 hours walking around the city and also used public transportation to get around town. Zoltan is very knowledgeable about the hungarian history and Budapest itself and speaks excellent english. The tour itself was very relaxed and enjoyable. At the end of the day he gave us directions to the hotel we stayed at and guided me back to the car. I would highly recommend Zoltan to anyone visiting Budapest, you won't be disappointed.

Rock On Rockhoppers!. Thank you TripAdvisor reviewers! Your reviews about Zoltan and his merry group of tour guides was so correct. We spent 2 and 3/4 wonderful days with Zoltan and his associate, Kalliope, walking through Buda and Pest and then going out of the city by car. Zoltan is exetremely knowledgeable about Budapest and its surrounds. What came across most to us was his own joy in exploring not only the city but the countryside outside of the city. My husband and I both like immersing ourselves in the cities or towns we travel to. Zoltan and Kalli provided the best of both worlds, immersion with a lot of laughs and fun. It was truly a highlight of our trip to Eastern Europe.

Zoltan is Excellent! Budapest is a must!. Zoltan, was absolutely great! He met us in the Train station and spend with us almost all the day, I think we walk all Budapest that they, he was an excellent guide, he gave us a excellent view of Budapest in one day, my family and I really enjoy the patience, company, the stories and his point of view. He was great with my to children 13 and 10 year old. He is the best! If you go to Budapest you must book a tour with him. I really liked Budapest is a place worth visiting you must stay 2 days to enjoy everything! Hope to come back!

Three days with Zoltan in Budapest and countryside. Six of us from US spent three thoroughly enjoyable days with Zoltan in May. Zoltan speaks excellent English and has great recommendations for restaurants. He provided wonderful insights to the hungarian history and modern Hungary and it's developing democracy. From enchanting walks thru Pest to towns outside of the city upto the Danube Bend he gave us a full day. He was always clever earnest and charming and took extra effort to make sure all 6 of us were included in every discussion. Of all the guides we had on our 16. Day European tour Zoltan was the best.

Second Fabulous Tour with Zoltan. Back in July 2012 we spent two days with Zoltan touring Budapest and we were so impressed that we hired him again on July 15th. This time, we asked Zoltan to take us to Eger, a city about two hours outside of Budapest. Eger is known for its wines and beautiful landscape. I asked Zoltan to come up with an itinerary for my family that included my wife, two kids ages 18 and 20 and my mother. Once again, Zoltan came through with an amazing itinerary that included Eger and Lillifured. Given that my mother was travelling with us this time, he hired a driver to take us on this full day tour that began at 9:00 AM and lasted late into the evening. Taking a tour with Zoltan is like traveling with a friend. He is interested in giving you an experience that will not soon be forgotten. Zoltan is a tour guide that does not look at his watch to make sure he is finished at 5PM, instead ends the tour when we covered all of our sites. And in our case, was very late into the evening. During our trip to Eger, we visited a place where they smoked fresh trout, which was absolutely delicious, visited a castle, and had dinner at a remote town that I can't recall but was delicious. The sites were incredible and breathtaking with beautiful waterfalls, and countryside that is some of the nicest I have come across in my travels. Once again, Zoltan went out of his way to make our trip to Hungary amazing. The kids enjoyed his company and conversation as did my mother. I miss Hungary and the family already misses Zoltan. We look forward to going back to Hungary again and most certainly will use Zoltan for a third time. We will once again toast with Palinka and a cold beer.

Excellent!. If you go on a tour with Rockhoppers, be it either the place where you were born or another where you have never been before, you will be surprised and find a new and unknown world. I went with my friends to the Castle area of Budapest that I had thought that I knew well enough. I was mistaken. Zoltan from the Rockhoppers introduced my into a completely new area! Hard to believe, but 90% of the info was new for me. I fully recommend it!

Amazing!. This is a woefully overdue review! We travelled to Budapest last year for our one year wedding anniversary and we still regularly reminisce about our time with Zoltan. We spent two fabulous days with this wonderfully intriguing Hungarian. Full of random facts about everything, this is the way to see Budapest and Hungary in all it's glory from a man full of enthusiasm and humour. Not only will he revel in the wonder that is historical Budapest but he will also be brutally honest about its failures and darker side. He quickly tailors the tour to suit your interests and personality and by the end of the two days we felt like I had known him for years and were catching up with an old friend. Boring tourist cattle mart this is not. Individualised, bespoke and from the heart this is. We love you Zoltan! We promise to come back soon, Jo and Steve Phillips

Fantastic Walkabout. The only way to see Budapest. Insightful, intelligent, warm, informative, fun, and tailored just for you. Zoltan loves his Budapest and knows and understands it well. You will fall in love with this great city too. This isn't just another tour company.

A great day with Zoltan. We, my wife, my teenage daughter, and my parents, just returned from a wonderful week in Budapest. One of the highlights of our trip was the tour that we had with Zoltan. This was a tour about life under communism, but it proved to be much more.We began with a ride to Memento Park. The statues were essentially prompts for discussions about the communist regime, the Arrow-Cross years, contemporary politics, art, the creation of a politically useable past, and daily life in Hungary. Lest this sound ponderous or boring, let me clearly state that my 16 year old daughter and my skeptical father, found Zoltan to be a wonderfully engaging, funny, and informative raconteur. This was not a tour, but an extended conversation with an interesting and thoughtful man that included Palinka and sausage. We returned to the city, specifically, Liberty Square, for more interesting and disturbing discussions. The square is currently the site of some contention over the construction of a monument memorializing the occupation of Hungary by Nazi Germany. There is a counter and impromptu monument documenting Hungary’s direct role in the Holocaust. Seeing the juxtaposition of these starkly competing histories, in a square that was so vibrantly alive with locals, dogs, and tourists, really underscored the problem of living with one’s past.

Rockhoppers tours are great!. My husband and I just got back from a vacation in Hungary and Zoltan gave us a great tour of Memento Park and part of the city by the American Embassy. We especially enjoyed getting the personal views and opinions of a native who lived through the communist era. He was happy to answer all our questions and we plan a return visit and will definitely book another tour with Zoltan. You will not be disappointed if you book with Rockhoppers.

super!!. We had a tour with Zoltan at the Castle region of Budapest. A place that we know well since our childhood. It was an introduction that none of us expected to receive. A friendly group of 15 people, and every one of us was astonished with the information we gained during the tour. All I can do is recommending Rockhoppers!Katalin, Budapest

Great toddler friendly tour. We travelled to Budapest with my three year old daughter, Timea customized our tour to perfection. We spent the morning going to the Children's railway and chair rail with my daughter loved. She even found a local owned restaurant that had a kid play area. In the afternoon we walked around the Pest side getting information on the city and visiting everywhere we asked. She even was great about a last minute change and let us finish in front of Parliament for a late tour there. If you like to customize your own plan and have an idea what you want to see this is the company for you.

Zoltan gives a good tour. Zoltan Nagy gave us a very informative afternoon tour of Budapest. It was a great way to get an overview of the city and learn a great deal about the history and about the current political situation. Zoltan has a very relaxed approach and is always trying to ensure that he was telling us about the things that we were interested in. Meeting us at our hotel, he took us to a nearby Turkish café for lunch when he learned that we had just arrived and had not had a chance to eat. We effectively started the tour following lunch. The tour is a tad pricey for two people, but it definitely gave us the overview and history that we were seeking. Our tour including our lunch break was over six hours.

Nicest Tour Ever. I figured that it must be nicer to view Hungary through the eyes and ears of someone then, reading a book to find the sights. My first private tour in Europe and it was well spent hanging out with Aliz. She made our tour as if I were walking the streets of Budapest with a friend. We had a nice combination of walking and taking Hungary's public transportation. She took me to the places I wanted to go to and more. Don't get me wrong about tour guide books, they helped me tailor my tour with Aliz. I wish there were more tours available like Rockhoppers, elsewhere.

A very different experience!. We spent a great evening with Zoltan visiting the Roma ghetto and then Gypsy village just outside of Budapest. Our guide Zoltan was very knowledgeable about the history of the people and was happy to answer questions and share his experiences. Although unsure how we would be received the community welcomed us with open arms-literally!, and it wasn't long before we were up and enjoying a night of dancing and singing! Our traditional meal was very tasty and it was a pleasure to spend an evening with such friendly happy people. Thank you Zoltan for providing this experience.

Excellent tour in Budapest. We had a great time with Zoltan in the last couple of days! We were most impressed by his scope of knowledge and wide honest perspective of the country, which is very interesting and refreshing for private tours. Zoltan was very client focused and was sensitive to what we would like to do and see at our pace. Although we saw a lot in the two days, we did not feel overwhelmed because he provided a lot of breaks and we felt like we were with a friend. He was flexible with his time and accommodating of our needs and pace and ended up spending long hours with us everyday. He was patient in answering our questions and giving us interesting information and perspectives but also allows us time to reflect and be quiet. We also loved the restaurants he took us to...excellent food and service! Thank you, Zoltan! We will definitely look for you again when we return to Budapest!

Wonderful Guide. My husband and I visited Budapest for the first time.Zoltan was our full day tour guide. We combined walking and public transportation.He was an amazing guide... friendly, professional and so knowledgeable of the different sites. We visited the Jewish quarter and went into some of the old Synagogues. Everyone knew him and mentioned that we were so fortunate to have him as our guide. He spoke of the past, present and future of Budapest and Hungary in general.HIGHLY Recommend this company and ESPECIALLY Zoltan.Ina R.

Excellent guide service. Aliz was my guide for a four hour tour using a combination of walking and public transportation. She was very professional, personable, full of a lot of interesting anecdote's about Budapest and Hungarian history and, of course, knowledgeable about the more famous sites. She was able to easily tailor the tour to my interests. She also offered a lot of useful information about things to do, restaurants, etc, when the tour was finished.

Amazing and personalized!. Zoltan gave us a fantastic tour of the Jewish quarter with little pieces of "off the beaten path" history along the way. His knowledge base is overwhelming and the tour was incredibly informative, thorough and personal. We would really recommend this for any traveler coming to Budpaest who'd like a unique and individualized experience with a fantastic guide!

Great Guide. We just had a great tour of Budapest with Kalliope. She is extremely knowledgeable about the city, the culture, and the people of Hungary. It was such a delight the first day that we hired her for the second day for an additional tour. After doing the Classic tour, she put together a compilation of various sites - the Jewish Quarter, some Communist housing, some bus travel, a stop for a snack, a "ruin" bar, etc. The 2-3 hour tour ended up being almost 5 hours as there was so much to see. We spent about $225 for each tour and felt it was worth every penny.

A tour for the eyes and the mind!. My husband and I had a wonderful time touring Budapest with Zoltan over a period of two days last month. He provided great insight into Hungary’s storied past and present and the character of its people. Zoltan not only showed us the many sites but provided content for their significance. Many of the places we toured were not on the typical tourist route. Zoltan is also a great raconteur and we very much enjoyed his company.

a day and 1/2 with Zolant Nagy. We spent a day and 1/2 with Zoltan and had a great time. He is incredibly knowledgable. trip included going to two different unique restaurants that were very very good. his grasp of history of History. we did not get just the party line as to Hungarian History. we took buses, light rail , subways. we did walk a lot . we also went to a little town in the country side that was a lot of fun to see and be in. we have used a number of tour guides and found him to be one of the best. Also his costs were reasonable.
Best private tour. We were in Budapest at 25. april 20014 with Zoli as a guide in Budapest. I can recommand this tour. The tour was one of the best in my life.

Excellent introduction to Budapest. Zoltan takes the time to understand what is of interest to you and then weaves that into a really nice walking tour. A drive to the Monument Park illustrates how the government has preserved the Soviet Era's public art, which was often destroyed by others. If you want a thoughtful tour with discussion on many topics, this is a tour for you!

Ottoman's Budapest with Zoltan. Recently we have participated to an Rockhoppers tour, where we went along Budapest’s Ottoman monuments. One of the most enchanting part of the program was the visit of the not yet open Racz Bath, which is waiting to be opend since it’s restauration. With the help of Zoltan we could look around the whole building, which will become one of the wonders of Budapest. Rockhopper’s tours I suggest to everyone!

Great introduction to a fascinating town. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our very informative tour of the city thanks to the exceptionally pleasant and very knowledgable guidance provided by Alice. She couldn't have been nicer and was very professional. She effortlessly guided us on an extensive circuit utilizing public transport to supplement our walking?We would recommend her and Rockhopers to our friends.TIM and Judy

The way that all tours should be.
