Zoltan provided me, and my wife, an excellent insight into Hungary's background, personality and daily life.it was a really enriching day, and we were able to see spots that I would never know that they existed, even with Tripadvisor (and other sites) help.There were several highlights but my favorites were the visit to the Ruins bar and market, where we can see the creativity of the Hungarian at work, and the fact that we could visit internal, private patios, and see a secret (and more quiet) part of the city.I would definitely recommend Zoltan to everyone that is visiting Budapest and does not like the standard "everything is beautiful" tours, and prefers to know the highlights and low-lights of a country.

Extraordinary walking tour in Castle district. We had a wonderful and sunny afternoon with my friends and Zoli in the Castle, and I thought before, I knew it, but I came to realize that I dont know anything! Zoli is humorous and cool, and he knows every little and interesting places and stories about the past but there is no doubt about he's living here and now. Everything what you should see and hear about Budapest!see you next time in The Rudas Thermal Bath! Thank you Zoli!

Awesome tour of Budapest. After a 7 day ski trip in Saalbach Austria, I took a group of 15 on to a 3 night stay in Budapest. We were initially welcomed into the country by Calliaopie from Rock Hoppers tour group. After getting to our hotel she gave us 15 minutes to settle in then gave us a breif discussion of customs and things we could do while there. She set us up with an eveing cruise of the Danube with all its lighted spendor from the buildings along the shore. She met us the next day for a 3 hour walking tour of the city which we found to be enlighting and informative. So much to that point that she continued on with us for 4 more hours. Her love and knowledge of all things Budapest past and present kept the morning/afternoon interesting and fun. If you are ever thinking of siteseeing in Budapest be sure and set up a tour with Calliopie of Rockhoppers,

Best Budapest Tour. This was a walking tour. Our guides took us everywhere! We took the subway, streetcar and bus all over the city. Whenever we wanted a break, we would stop for a coffee or strudel. Full of history and knowledge. This was the best tour I have ever been on catered to your tastes!

Awesome. Definitely spend your first morning/day in Budapest with Rockhoppers. Take the Rockhoppers tour. It will give you a great lay of the land, and sites worth seeing in Budapest. We had Kalliope as our guide and she is a star. She gave us so much context, insights, and history of all that we saw on our tour, I felt like a local by the end of the day. It was fun and informative. 2 thumbs up.

Great tours in Budapest. We took the Rockhoppers tour in Budapest. I can't say enough about how great they were. Both Calli and Zolton were very informative and both were extremely personable, just great people. Highly recommend

Interesting walk around the Castle. My classmate organized an afternoon tour for us, Zoli was our guide and he told us many stories during our walk. I live in Budapest, but he could tell me a lot of new things about the city, its history and showed us lovely places.

End of February 2014 Visit. I recently booked a tour with Zoltan whilst in Budapest for a short visit at the end of February 2014. I had a fantastic half a day with Zoltan, whose knowledge and passion for the city is amasing and infectious. I arrived knowing absolutely nothing about Hungary or Budapest and this was certainly not the case after my tour with Zoltan. Zoltan showed me the city and introduced me to a plethora of sights and stories that I would have otherwise missed. It was not like ordinary mainstream tours but more like spending the day with an old friend. I walked away having had a history, politics and language lesson amidst interesting conversations and relaxed wandering. The tours are tailored to individuals and the email correspondence prior to my visit was great to discuss what I would like to see and know and this was certainly taken into account during the tour. I would most definitely recommend that anyone visiting Budapest to take this tour and I hope to visit Budapest in the future and that Rockhoppers are still taking tours!!!

Wonderful time in Budapest. After skiing a week in St. Moritz, a group of twenty-seven finished up our holidays in Budapest. After a welcome by three guides from Rockhoppers, we were divided into small groups. It was a wonderful idea as we were all able to hear our guides and ask questions. No following the lady in the pink parka with an umbrella for us. We started our 3 hour city tour with a trip to an interesting watering hole for a taste of local brandy. Our guide, Zoltan, was charming and extremely knowledgeable. He took us to see the sights and was able to tell us about history, local politics, gypsies and was full of fun and energy. In addition, he took photos which he emailed to us. We were having such a wonderful time that Zoltan agreed to stay with us for the day. The following day Rockhoppers arranged a boat tour on the Danube and Eva explained to us the sites that we were passing. In addition to the tours, Rockhoppers recommended restaurants and even located a tack shop for me. If I ever return to Budapest, I will contact Rockhoppers to continue seeing the many sights in Hungary.

Slow, dull, and unpleasant. Our group booked a 3 hour tour with Zoltan, but his slow pace caused the tour to extend for an additional 3 hours. For some unfathomable reason, Zoltan seemed to focus on talking about Hungry's political failures and the country surge in neo-Nazis groups (I later learned from others that this may have been intentionally exaggerated). Our group was mainly Jewish, with me being one of the exceptions as a Black person. Upon beginning the tour, Zoltan recommended that we have a shot a Palinka, a Hungarian liqueur; when we all agreed, Zoltan seemed surprise by my acceptance and made it clear that he thought that I, the only Black person in the group, was Muslim and therefore should not be drinking alcohol. After nearly three hours and barely half way into the tour, half of our group decided to leave early and did not stick around for the end of the tour. The one bright spot was Zoltan's assistant, Ava, who had given our group a shorter tour the day before. Ava was extremely pleasant and professional. Individuals would be better served getting a guide book and walking around Budapest at there own pace.

The only way to see and experience Budapest!. I was part of a group of 27 spending 3 wonderful days in Budapest following a ski trip to Switzerland. I can't say enough good things about Zoltan, Eva and colleagues. We divided into smaller groups to explore the city, seeing highlights in both Buda and Pest; we traveled like natives using the subway and bus system and getting a real feel for daily life; we talked politics, learned about the city's history and economy, and where the youth are going; my group enjoyed a brandy to begin our day, sitting side by side with working people. Our guides spent the entire day with us and then, beyond the call of duty (as well as contractual understanding), accompanied us to a restaurant to help interpret the menu and recommend dishes; joined us for an evening boat ride on the Danube, and escorted us to a neighborhood church for a chamber music concert. And Zoltan became our documentarian, taking pictures and posting them on Facebook. Don't miss the chance to your the city with Rockhoppers!

Impressive guide and fascinating tour. I'd read about Rockhoppers online, and contacted them re. a tour (I was in the city on business). Kalliope Bakirdzi was the guide, and I can honestly say that she is one of the most knowledgeable guides I’ve ever had the pleasure to be on a tour with. The tour, Memories of the First Greek Diaspora of Budapest, was highly informative; Kalliope has researched the subject in depth, and is also gifted at imparting the information--no easy feat: It’s clear that she has a background in communications. I recommended this tour to a friend living in Hungary, and a Greek acquaintance holidaying there. Both were highly enthusiastic about the experience. A must for anyone with Greek roots in Hungary.

Truly excellent tourguide. I took the Communist Budapest tour with Zoltan after spending a few weeks exploring Hungary on my own; the experience was revealing, like having a veneer peeled back and suddenly understanding the workings underneath.Despite being challenged to stump the guide, and having some education on the topic, I couldn't come up with any question that Zoltan couldn't answer. Even more impressively, he could show me things that I had passed by many times in a new light, and for what they were- I could see the city in the whole new way by the end. He clearly has deep personal knowledge of this subject, and of the city, easily the best tour I've ever been on.

A day's comprehensive tour of Budapest. In November I was in Budapest for a couple of days. It was a visit which proved to be extremely invaluable. My guide, Zoltan, arrived at the hotel and took a few minutes to discuss the day's itinerary. It was insightful as it prepared me to anticipate the day's activity. We began in Budapest for a tour of the historic center followed by a tour of the Jewish Quarter. The city's history and the architecture of its buildings left a impression that I still recall today after all of these month's. In the afternoon we took a drive to the countryside which enhanced my experiences of my day's visit as well. It added to the experience so I gained a perspective of Budapest's surroundings. Lunch at a neighboring restaurant in the countryside was a surprise; the meal and restaurant's setting were authentic. On a separate note plan to a concert at the Opera House; the building is incredible.

Excellent guide, wonderful tour. I was alone visited Eastern Europe and Budapest end of last year, the last station is Hungary and I had Dora(Dori) as my guide in Budapest for 3 days ,very amazing tour i had,and she has so much knowledge about the history of Hungary and Mongolia, high understanding what i needed, very kind, friendly and very helpful, provided a lots of helpful information like the good accommodation，recommended amazing Hungarian restaurant ,fun bar and so on.Amazingly she even could speak Chinese to explain the history of every sights when i could not catch up with my poor English. She knew that i love small villages and she arranged a very nice day to a small village neighborhood to Budapest, I love it.Thanks a lot Dori, surely i will highly recommend you if i have any friends to Budapest

Wonderful tour of Ottoman Budapest. Zoltan gave me a wonderful, relaxing and informative tour of the Ottoman sites in the city. He is the only guide I have ever had that made me feel like a friend more than a customer. After an initial overview over two glasses of palinka, we walked around Buda. He took me in buildings, pointed out places of interest and talked with me about not only the past, but the present times of the country as well. I could ask questions about things I had seen during my time here, but could not understand on my own. I highly recommend his tours. They are given by a man who loves the city yet, acknowledges the good and the bad of it's history.

Very good tourist guide. We met in the castle in front of the National Dance Theatre. In the first minute I felt that he is a good tourist guide. I told him, what are my interests. After this he told me only that kind of stories which were interesting for me. He was very helpful and understood that I'm very tired. So he took me to a tourist cinema, where I could relax a bit while we were watching a 3D movie. He knows the city very well, I think he is a very good choice.

Zoltan terrific guide!!!!. I been budapest with my husband and my mother in law and i can tell you, we were very grateful to have the excellent company of zoltan. He is very nice guy, he know a lot about budapest history and also he understand what really want, i meant he really care about what we want to do, see, try, etc.. Honestly we really had amazing time in budapest and we wish have a little more time... thanks a lot!!

Rockhoppers Tours A+ - Zoltan Terrific Guide. My wife and I just came back from a long weekend in Budapest and we were lucky to have both sunshine and the excellent company of guide Zoltan from rockhoppers. Zoltan, early sixties, a former professor in Tibetian and Mongolian cultures - is deeply knowledgeable about all things Hungarian- history, architecture, current political scene, pre/post Soviet life etc. We hired Zoltan for a walking tour of Budapest focused on architecture (as the city has many art nouveau, art deco, and baroque buildings). As we zigzagged through both Pest and Buda our architectural tour included a vista to a great Ruin Bar for some palinka, a very interesting tour of the former Jewish ghetto (a great matzo ball soup), walks through back alleys that took us into 19th century courtyards (Zoltan either knows owners or somehow has security codes to get in), discussions about current social and political issues in Hungary (of which there are many ). I have no hesitation in giving Zoltan my top marks and highly recommend him as a guide- at the end of the day its as if you spent the day with a very good friend who knows a lot about a lot. In terms of some style attributes Zoltan is a very good listener. We first sat down in the morning to talk over the day and after he got some sense of our interests he filled in our itinerary. The pacing was leisurely but after a day with Zoltan we felt we had a much better understanding of not only Budapest but modern Hungary. What also makes the day truly enjoyable is Zoltan has an excellent sense of humor and a real talent for telling a story. We had lots of good laughs throughout the day and it was our view the Zoltan is not bored by his job- he gets energy from sharing his city and country with guests .Our tour was in English and from my perspective he is fluent. A very good trip significantly enhanced by the time spent with Zoltan from rockhoppers.

Wow wee. Spent a full day with Zoltan and had the best tour guide experience we ever had. He's very knowledgable and gives you a true yet humorous account of the history of Hungary . I would recommend him to anyone I know going to Hungary . He tailored our tour by asking us what we'd like out of the tour and gladly obliged .

Absorbing the Hungarian Culture. My colleague and I were in Budapest for a work-related trip and had the day Saturday to sightsee. Given the numerous positive reviews on Tripadvisor, I reached out to Rockhoppers to book a tour. We weren't disappointed. Zoltan was our guide and he started us off with an overview of the city and its history before hitting the street to see all the sites. Beforehand I had told him that I am interested in architecture and culture, and he didn't disappoint. We saw a mix of cultural and architectural landmarks, but also stopped in a Hungarian coffee shop for a pastry and coffee, and a ruin bar (an eclectic bar set in formerly abandoned 19th and 20th Century buildings). In the afternoon, we crossed under the Danube to the Buda side and went to Buda Castle, before stopping for lunch at a wonderful fish restaurant. We would have never known to find all the little delightful places Zoltan took us to and it was well worth it to have him with us. If I go back to Budapest I'll definitely use Zoltan again and will try one of the other unique tour offerings, like the Gypsy Village tour. Thanks again Zoltan for a wonderful trip!

Aliz is the perfect tour guide!. We stayed in Budapest for a week in January and wanted to really get to know the city, the culture and the people. To help us do that, we knew just a "regular" tour with many people, showing the same old sites wouldn't work for us. We saw the wonderful reviews for Rockhoppers Tours on here and knew it was the one. We contacted Zoltan (who in turn put us in contact with Aliz) and she immediately started asking questions about what we had seen, what our interests were, what language(s) we spoke, what foods we liked (one of us is vegetarian!), how long we were staying, etc. On the day of our tour, she met us promptly (the lobby of our hotel - what service!) and started right away with the tour. It was clear how much she loves Budapest and knows of its history and culture. She took us to the "off the beaten path" places we would never have stumbled upon on our own. She willingly (and without missing a beat), changed the route of our tour if something interested us more and we wanted to spend more time exploring an area or site. She easily answered our endless questions. She was invaluable in helping us navigate the wonderful public transportation system so that later that week, we felt comfortable using it ourselves. She even offered us pronunciation tips to help us in our attempt to learn the language. She was generous with her time (our tour ended up to be just over 4 hours when we originally thought only 3 would be enough!). She is indeed like a very gracious hostess who welcomes you into her city and never leaves your side during the entire tour. Although we don't have plans to return to Budapest in the near future, it is on our list to vacation again.

Poor communication and expensive. Having read all the positive reviews I emailed rockhoppers about organising a walking tour. The person who responded did not read my emails properly and quoted a price (160 euros!) which was way above any of the other companies. It may be the tours are good but customer service poor and too expensive.

Great Tour with Aliz Toka!. I traveled to Budapest for the first time over the Christmas holidays with my wife and my parents. We read about the Rockhoppers tour and decided it would be a good way to learn about the city, the culture, and the history. Our guide, Aliz Toka, met us very promptly and took us on a wonderful five-hour tour of the city. From St. Stephan's to Schezneyi Baths, Hero's Square, the Jewish Quarter and to Buda Castle. Aliz is an absolute pleasure and extremely knowledgeable about all things Hungary. Plus, she knows a great spot to stop on Buda hill for mulled wine when your feet get tired. If you are interested in educating yourself about Budapest, this is the way to do it! And Aliz is a fantastic guide!

Excellent Informative Tour. We did a walking tour with Nora on January 1 this year. We learned a lot about the history of Budapest and saw some amazing sights. Its was wonderful to walk the city with such a knowledgeable tour guide since our visit was so short.

One of the best tours I've ever been on!. Zoltan was such a pleasure to spend hours learning and discovering Budapest! His knowledge, sense of humour and personality made this one of the best tours I've ever been on. 6 hours just flew by. Thanks Zoltan, let me know if you're ever coming to Melbourne AU :)

Yes, Zoltan is a gem. We too visited Budapest as a family group: two adult young men and their middle aged parents. Zoltan was a treasure. He made sure that we all were well-served, paying attention both to the interests of the twentysomethings (Ruin Bar anyone?) and their parents. He shared his personal history with us, as well as his favorite haunts, including two wonderful lunch locations and a charming small town outside of Budapest proper. The recent reviews are all spot on (esp. the most recent, from one of my young men). If you want to experience the texture of the city, whatever facets of it interest you, Zoltan would be an excellent choice.

An excellent way to see Budapest. Let's just say that Zoltan is not your run-of-the-mill tour guide. He's an irreverent wellspring of information, jokes, and stories about Budapest's quirks and charms past and present. He will show you the main attractions, of course, but he delights (and distinguishes himself) in taking visitors to the unusual, but still important and meaningful, destinations. The guest's experience is always his focus, and he insists on adapting and changing the itinerary if it is not satisfactory.Caveat emptor: Zoltan isn't a guide for those who want to walk the tourist trails and then leave. But if you want to engage with Budapest in all its sights, sounds, smells, and tastes; if you want to eat (and drink) like a local; if you want to go at a more relaxed pace than the frenetic package tours, then you can do no better than to hire Zoltan. He merits, and gets, my highest possible recommendation.

Knowledgeable and entertaining expert on Budapest. In November we made our second visit to Budapest and arranged with Zoltan for a detailed tour of the Art Nouveau history of his fascinating city. He took us to places and explained the background and significance of what we were seeing that we would have never discovered on our own. If you are looking for a informative, insightful guide to show you not only the main tourist sites of Budapest but the "hidden" gems of Budapest you can't do better than Zoltan.

A unique tour of Budapest. Zoltan is the ultimate insider and a wonderful envoy for Budapest, past, present and future. He designs each tour the group at hand and is willing to be spontaneous if there's something to be seen in the moment. We toured as a family of four with two children (ages 8 and 10) and managed to cover quite a bit of ground both historically and physically. He tells colorful stories of life in the 20th and 21st century and like all Hungarians has a great sense of humor and great appreciation for irony. In just a few hours, we saw the Jewish quarter, dropped into a "ruin bar" for a farmers' market, road the bus with locals, saw the castle and major churches and were delivered to a favorite local spot for lunch. Zoltan is a wonderful guide, very flexible and full of colorful stories. Highly recommended.

An amazing time. I recently visited Budapest for a school trip and our teacher booked Zóltan as our guide. He was an amazing guide and our entire group loved him. He had immense knowledge about the city and made sure to take us where we were interested in. He provided us with interesting facts along the way and overall was a joy to have as a tour guide. I would recommend him to anyone visiting Budapest.

A teacher above all. I brought 14 high school students to Budapest for a conference, and hired Zoltan to give us a guided crash course in the city and its history ahead of time. He was perfect. All the accolades are true. He is emminently knowledgeable, erudite, and insightful. He knows his city, taught at the University, and witnessed communism and its aftermath. More than that, he was able to communicate the spirit of a place that is so different from our own. He also arranged all the logistics, from airport transfers to a roomy private van for a day trip to Vienna, for good prices. He is a teacher, above all, and a wonderful one. All the kids loved him, and he added immeasurably to our experience of Budapest.

Zoltan Nagy - Knowlegable, Insightful, Fun!!. Read a number of reviews on private guides in Budapest and selected Zoltan. My wife, 20 year old daughter and I recently spent three days there, and two of those days with Zoltan. Before we ever arrived in Budapest he asked for some information about ourselves, interests, desires, etc. so that he could tailor our time together. He arranged transportation to and from the airport to our hotel, and offerred suggestions for touring/activities to consider on the day we were on our own. Our first day was spent exploring the Jewish Quarter and learning about Jewish life and non-Jewish life in Hungary. And exploring is what we did as Zoltan was always on the look out for something knew that he and ourselves might want to see and learn about. Our second day we did a tailored "City Tour" that focused on the places and experiences that we wanted to see as well as some that we would have never thought about. Yes we saw many of the key sights, but we also stopped for snacks, drinks and conversations about life and politics; both historical and current. We had a great time with Zoltan while learning a lot about Hungary and Budapest. Skip the packaged bus/group tours and go with Zoltan. Thanks Zoltan! Jeff, Jennifer, Sarah

Best Value for my Vacation Dollars. Reserving tours with Rockhoppers was the best decision we made regarding our two-week vacation in Budapest. We booked a half-day Classic Budapest Tour and a full day in the Countryside Tour. From the moment he began engaging us via email prior to our arrival, to the evening drop-off after our last tour, Zoltan worked diligently to share his Hungary with us. We walked, we talked, we saw, we learned, we did. And we had fun. Zoltan’s easy personality, his quick wit and deep intelligence made the time we spent with him pleasant indeed. His willingness and ability to discuss all things Hungarian gave us a solid foundation for the rest of our stay. There is a reason Rockhoppers is rated Number 1. Zoltan Nagy really is the best guide imaginable.

Zoltan is the one you want!. Spent what was otherwise a very wet and cold half day in Budapest with the entertaining and erudite Zoltan. We took the "Classic Budapest Tour", but it was clear that after spending a short period of time with Zoltan, that he was tailoring it to our interests and personalized the experience for us. As a former professor, his knowledge of this stunningly beautiful city is beyond compare, and no doubt he showed us sights and shared experiences with us that are not available on any other tour. We were enthralled with his stories involving the Jewish Quarter ( he showed us the only Kosher pastry shop outside of Switzerland as well as inside the Kosher butcher shop) and regaled us with tales not only historical, but of the current political situation as well. At his suggestion, we had a "when in Rome/Budapest" experience, and shared a schnapps at around 11:00 am (it was, after all, very cold and rainy). Truly, we had never shared a moment like this with a guide, who clearly wants you to feel and experience his city as he does. We loved going to the Baths and despite the unfortunately miserable weather we had that day, Zoltan made the most of it and we saw everything and more, than we could have hoped for on this day. Go and Book this Tour NOW! You will regret not doing so!!!Thanks Zoltan! Pam & Sy, SF Bay Area

Taking you where the busses don't go!. After getting off a River Boat cruise, we extended our stay in Budapest for another 3 days. One of those days was spent touring the Jewish Quarter, and the outskirts of Budapest with Zoltan. The wealth of his knowledge, his great sense of humor, and his love for this city shines thru in your time spent with him We are active people in our late 50's and early 60's and found the pace to be great, the conversation lively, and the value of the experience worth every HUF. If your travels are taking you to Budapest, book some time in advance with this guy... you won't be sorry.

Excellent. Zoltan is great! We thoroughly enjoyed his personal experiences growing up in Hungary, the history of the country, the current state of affairs and his recommendations on what else to see and do in the Budapest. We would highly recommend touring with Zoltan.

Superb Tour of the Jewish Quarter in Budapest. Our group of 6 spent the day with Zoltan who was entertaining and witty. He has spent his life in the wonderful city and showed us places we would never have seen. His knowlege of the history of this beautiful city was tremdous. At the end of the day, we all wanted to spend another day with Zoltan and see some more. Zoltan is a fabulous guide and I recommend him without hesitation.

Wonderful tour of Jewish Quarter in Budapest!!!. Our guide Zoltan was a entertaining, charming, informative and very interesting guide. His knowledge and ease of sharing it made us wish we had more time to spend with him. We would highly recommend spending your day with him!!!

Great guide!. Zoltan is a personable, friendly guide who took us around, both the buda and pest sides of the city. He's knowledgeable and witty, and doesn't shy away from talking politics. I appreciated his candor, and he was able to help us find all the other things we wanted to do outside the scope of our time with him. I really enjoyed his tour, and I would highly recommend him to anybody else. He will figure out what kind of things you want, and accept you as a friend.

Fantastic Tour of Budapest and Szentendre!. Zoltan was extremely flexible when scheduling our tour. We emailed him a few days prior to arriving in Budapest and he fit us in for a day of touring Budapest, Szentendre, and a dinner at Schieszl. Zoltan picked us up at our hotel and from that point on we had a truly unique view of Budapest. Zoltan knows the ins and outs of the city and gives a unique experience providing honest insight and experiences you would not get with other guides. When we hit a storm of rain in Szentendre, Zoltan changed pace and took us to a medieval fortress with fantastic views. The best part of our tour with Zoltan was dinner with him at Schieszi. A small, family run restaurant and winery outside of Budapest where we were treated to a tour of the kitchen, wine making facilities, and the best meal of our trip. If you want a unique experience from an expert on everything Budapest, Zoltan is your guy!

A very special day in Budapest. My wife and I contacted Zoltan after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. We had asked for a half day tour of the Jewish section. He met us at our hotel promptly at 10am. We spoke for about 45 minutes in the hotel before we ever left. It was immediately obvious that he is well spoken, well educated, extremely knowledgeably and personable. It is also evident that he will share all information on any situation in Hungary regardless of the political impact. That is significant as it is obvious that he loves his country. We left the hotel and toured the Jewish section of Budapest. Zoltan was none stop enriching our visit with history and how it related to all parts of Hungarian life. It was such an enjoyable day for us. After the tour we had an enjoyable late lunch and we went our separate ways at about 6pm. We will always cherish our day with Zoltan and we look forward to returning and taking another tour with him. He is truly worthy of the praise he receives on Tripadvisor.

Amazing experience. I was one of a party of four friends from London and Zoltan teamed us up with four people from America who quickly became our friends through the expertise and warmth from Zoltan. The tour was of the Jewish quarter but he also took us to places off the beaten track that none of us would have found by ourselves. The day was informative and also great fun and was the highlight of our 5 days in Budapest.

Great tour with Zoltan. If you are looking for someone who not only can give you the history of the sites you visit but also an intellectual perspective on life today in Budapest, then you will love Zoltan. He took us on a tour of the Jewish Quarter and we saw 4 locations from a Chabab and synagogue to the Dohany Street Great Synagogue. It was a easygoing pace with much information passed along as we walked around the city. We learned a lot about Budapest and Hungary in general. Zoltan was interesting and knowledgeable and our son (26) who is is very interested in the political and economic aspects of Hungary was thrilled to be able to glean knowledge and discuss topics with Zoltan. I'm sure he can adapt to any topic and age group. We totally enjoyed out time with Zoltan and would recommend touring with him. I think you will be enriched by this experience.

Insights into Jewish life in Budapest. We had a great 1/2 tour with Zoltan, he not only took us around the city showing the major sights, but also gave interesting insights into the history and current political environment of the city and country. Zoltan was very friendly, easy-going and took time to answer all our questions.

A Special Time. My husband and I spent 1 1/2 special days with Zoltan, an excellent guide who really gave us insight into Budapest and Hungary that we could never have gotten without him. He was so personable and treated us with every kindness. We saw a great deal but at a casual pace, never feeling rushed. He was so engaging and open and treated us to many stories, both personal and about the country, from Hungarian history, the past and current political situation, to what life was and is like for the people of his beautiful city. We started the day at a "Ruin" Bar, with a drink and goat cheese...a place we never would have found without Zoltan. We walked through Pest and took public transport to Buda where we saw not only the usual sights, but went through the streets and into inner courtyards and stopped for some strudel. An afternoon trip to Szentendre was followed by a terrific dinner in one of his favorite restaurants. The next day he gave us a wonderful and informative tour of the Jewish Quarter. We feel we made a friend and thank him for our in-depth and personal tour.

Unique and Enlightening. We spent an entire day with Zoltan that ended with an incredible dinner in the countryside. He has a unique approach and definitely provides his guests with more than just a garden variety tour. We enjoyed every aspect of our day; an in-depth perspective on the legacy of Hungarian history, Jewish life and tragedy in Budapest, and activities like having a drink at a "Ruin Bar", and meeting his wonderful, engaging son. Definitely recommend, if you are looking for more than a just see the sites kind of experience!

Great day!!. Zoltan is an excellent guide who gave us a wonderful tour of the Jewish Quarter of Budapest. He deserves all of the fabulous reviews he receives on Tripadvisor! A tour with Zoltan includes all of the main sites and then many that are off the beaten path. He has so many interesting stories and is happy to answer any questions. We had a fun stop at a ruin pub for a drink and many more great stories. I cannot imagine a better way to tour the Jewish Quarter than with Zoltan!

Budapest and the Danube Bend. My wife and I spent 2 great days touring with Zoltan. We did old Budapest and the bend, with our requested emphasis on history, architecture, art and politics. Zoltan has good command of English and has traveled all over the U.S. so communication was not a problem. He has deep knowledge of Hungary and the advantage of being a native. He adjusted the pace to fit our needs and even searched out vegetarian restaurants to meet our requirements. He is easy going, has vast knowledge and a talent for sharing what he knows. He was able to customize the time to perfectly cover our requests at our pace. A great experience and a reasonable price.

A Day to Remember. I had an incredible day and into the night with Zoltan when he took my husband and our two friends on a full day tour of Budapest and beyond. He is so knowledgeable, kind and caring. He took us most of the typical places, but he also took us to places where we were able to see hidden treasures only known by the locals. He also introduced us to wonderful music, food, wine and handicrafts. I have travelled with many guides over the years, but with Zoltan I was travelling with a family member and it was fantastic! Zoltan thank you for giving us such a magical memories of Budapest!!!

A fascinating day. My wife and I recently did a day trip to the Danube bend with Zoltan, and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.Rockhoppers do personalised tours, so Zoltan likes to find out about his guests in advance so he can tailor-make the tour for them. Although he's a former professor, Zoltan doesn't lecture you, although there is something of a feel of a tutorial about a day spent in his company. His own thirst for knowledge and understanding remains unquenched, so it's very much an interactive experience. We learnt a lot about Hungarian culture and history, but were also inspired to find out more afterwards.We had the chance to sample some local food and drink during the day, and had an excellent meal at the restaurant he chose on the way back. As well as being hugely knowledgeable, Zoltan is a charming and witty companion. He aims to become your friend by the end of the day, and certainly achieved this with us.

Visit to Sarospatak Castle. On Saturday 9th June 2012 Mr Zoltan Nagy picked us up from our hotel Corinthia in Budapest at 8.00 in the morning to take us to Sarospatak in eastern Hungary about three hours drive. On the way we stopped in Matyo, a township where in the 18th century one of the Hungarian ethnic groups was formed. We visited their museum where many artefacts of domestic and cultural value are exhibited. We arrived to Sarospatak mid afternoon and had a late lunch in a restaurant.After lunch we went to the Sarospatak Castle, which construction took place in the 1640’s. We enjoyed the guided tour through the rooms and secret passageways, which were situated within the walls of the castle. The adjacent museum is full of paintings of the members of the Rakoczi family, the princes of Transylvania. Also, antique furniture was on display. There was much more to see, but time did not permit.Late afternoon we drove back to Budapest. We can recommend Zoltan as a professional guide. His knowledge of history and local customs is remarkable.We plan to return to Sarospatak in 2014 to explore this historical place which stays with one after leaving the place.

Bringing the city to life. Zoltan doesn't just talk AT you like many tour guides I've seen - instead, he truly engages his audience, staying attuned to them and tailoring the tour to their interests. The stories and histories of the city came to light as he described them, bringing to life places that a passerby may not look twice at. He is honest, friendly, entertaining and relatable, brimming with genuineness and humor. I would love to do another tour with Zoltan!

Two days with Zoltan. My husband and I toured with Zoltan on Aug. 31 and Sept. 1st. We began with a tour of the Jewish district. He is extremely knowledgeable about Judaism and the areas Jewish history. We walked around the neighborhood and he pointed out stores and restaurants and told us facts about them. He was able to use a code to get into a courtyard of a building to show us what it looked like. He talked about the gypsies and their history and how they now live in Budapest. We visited a farmers market that was located in a ruin bar and had a drink and cheese. We would have never found it on our own. We had lunch in a wonderful restaurant and ate local fare. The next day we left the city and went to the countryside. We had dinner at a wonderful restaurant that produced their own wine. My husband has a prosthetic leg and Zoltan was very mindful about how much he can do and the type of ground he could walk on. I left my sunglasses at the restaurant we went to for dinner and an employee called Zoltan to let him know. He brought the sunglasses to my hotel the next day. Leaving Zoltan was like leaving a friend. I highly recommend his tours. Make sure you try the Langos.

See What the Average Tourist Misses. Zoltan led myself and a group of my peers on a tour of Budapest's Jewish Quarter. For a group of 20 college kids, he was very engaging, had endless information and interacted with us well. We saw a lot of things "off the beaten path." We're spending 4 months here in Budapest and it is still easy to miss a lot of the city. Thanks to Zoltan, we saw some great sites, hidden gems and iconic places. You get a little bit of everything. Highly recommend.

Aquincum and more with Zoltan. I have traveled a great deal over the last 20 years and never hesitated to use tour guides when in a new place. Zoltan is by far one of the best guides I have ever journeyed with. My daughter-in-law and I had already been in Budapest for a week when we spent the day with Zoltan. He filled in many of the blanks for us about the history and beauty of Budapest that we had already encountered but not tied together. We spent the bulk of our time walking among the Roman ruins at Aquincum and that provided the perfect launching place to discuss the pre-Roman and post-Roman history of Hungary...but you should not think this is a usual recitation of a country's history! Zoltan's experience as a university professor gives him a perspective and "delivery method" that is unique among guides. He is entertaining, engaging and expert. He keeps his narrative moving and continually checks in to make sure you are interested and connected with what he is saying. He is versatile and authentic-meaning the picture he presents of his beloved country is real and includes an honest admission of its flaws and struggles as well as it glories. We look forward to returning to Hungary as a family and continuing our adventure with Zoltan!

Great tour with Zoltan. We booked a tour with Zoltan based on the great reviews he has on TA, and he didn't disappoint! Initially we were interested in getting out of Budapest to see the Danube bend, but the morning of our meeting with Zoltan, we asked if he would be willing to change plans and take us around Budapest instead. He was completely flexible, and said he'd be willing to do whatever we wanted. Zoltan wanted to know what we were interested in so that he could make the tour most meaningful for us, and would decide where to take us based on our discussions throughout the day. When he heard we hadn't been to a ruin bar before, he took us there and we had a great time sitting there with him and having a drink. He took us into buildings we would have never have known to go into by ourselves. He always had a story to tell about the building, the neighborhood, and the history and politics of Budapest. He's extremely adaptable, and made us feel comfortable and entertained. It was a great day, and we're extremely glad we got to see Budapest from an insider's eyes. It made for a unique and unforgettable day.

Enlightening historical Jewish Ghetto tour. Zoltan, a native Budapestian, is an excellent tour guide who has a deep knowledge of the cities history, more specifically its Jewish history. He is very approachable and enjoys answering any questions. I enjoyed visiting the synagogues as well as seeing how the Jews lived during WWII. His tour helped me realize just how realistic the war was for the Jews. He also taught us many interesting facts about the orthodox and non-orthodox Jews. If you have time for a 2-3 hour tour definitely go with Zoltan and this company! You won't be let down.

Tour of Jewish Budapest with Nora Margitta. My family spent a Saturday afternoon waliking tour of Jewish Budapest with Nora Margitta. We were on a Viking River Cruise of the Danube and wanted a more in depth tour. Nora met us right where our ship was docked and took us on an informative tour to the synagogues and the Jewish neighborhood. Unfortunately it was a Saturday, so we could not enter the synagogues, but Nora gave us a great overview of life past and present in Budapest. She also took us to a street fair and a crazily decorated "ruin bar". At the end of the tour we returned by street car and taxi to our ship, accompanied by Nora. She even stayed with us an hour more than scheduled. It gave us a much more personal view of the city and I would highly recommend it.

Zoltan at Rock Hoppers is the best friend to take you to the most memorable places in Hungary!. Our experience in Hungary was the most memorable part of our trip on the Danube! The places we visited, sights, sounds and tastes! I reflect upon it, just think oh what a perfect day...

Three days with Zoltan. As we left the breakfast room we saw a man with a greyish beard and ponytail. "Could that be Zoltan?" I asked my husband. "Well if it's him, he's way too early." answered Hubby. My eyes followed the man, but he got into a car with fellow travellers and drove off.The weather was perfect and Hubby and I decided to wait outside, sitting on a low fence wall. We saw someone approaching along the sidewalk of a quiet tree-lined street. We could make out a greyish beard with a straw hat hanging from his neck. He made eye contact and when he spoke, the calm, sensitive way I had grown familiar with through his emails, came through in his voice.It was through his emails that I learnt about his love for the city and country where he was born. His awareness of world news and history also came through. His knowledge and sensitivity towards classical and folk music touched me. He and his wife also take an active interest in gastronomy.On our first day in the new city he helped us overcome some practical barriers: together we walked from our hotel to the nearest ATM, which became "our bank" during our 9 day visit; he gave assistance buying our 7-day travel cards; he also familiarised us with public transport.We entered the Castle District through Vienna Gate and got off the bus. On foot Zoltan led us through the meandering little streets and across the squares pointing out small details that would have gone unnoticed without him. We often stopped to admire the beauty of the buildings. We listened to interesting facts and he added colour to the pictures with interesting little stories. Unexpectedly the carillon bells of the Mary Magdalene Tower started playing. What a pleasant surprise!Later we each took a sip of palinka from a bottle Zoltan had dug up from his bag. Following the palinka we enjoyed the cool drinking water from a fountain. Zoltan explained which fountains were meant for drinking water and which not. We never bought any bottled water in Budapest because tap water is also purified for drinking!Zoltan took us to the Roman ruins in the heart of a nearby hotel. It seemed to us he knew everybody and everybody knew him! He later took us to a small bar on a side street where we enjoyed some refreshments. From the way he spoke to the owners we came to the conclusion that they too had known each other for ages!After taking us to the best view point, he led us downhill through the Visivaros, where he grew up. From the Clark Adam Ter we walked along a street which covers a Roman road - one meter below. At a restaurant further down the street we enjoyed a real Hungarian meal - river fish!Later we took a tram across the Szechenyi Bridge. On the Pest side we explored the area around Szent Istvan Basilica and then took the metro along the yellow line. In Andrassy Avenue Zoltan took us to the Opera House, pointing out the unusual paving. He showed us where we could go for a guided tour of the inside of the building.We had an interesting look at the inside of a synagogue and strolled into a ruin bar - something we had never seen before! After a quick look at the Dohany Synagogue we made for the nearest metro station. We had to quickly open our umbrellas and by the time we exited the metro, rain came pouring down. Zoltan escorted us on the short bus trip back to our hotel.Two days later Zoltan met us at our hotel. We took the road in his Land Rover to Komarom, a small town about 100 km from Budapest on the Slovakian border. Zoltan drove through small towns while we listened to all the interesting things he had to say. In the background he had folk music alternating with classical music in the car's CD-player.We were heading for Fort Monostor, an elaborate fortification system on the Danube. Zoltan interpreted whatever the Hungarian guide had to say. It was also good to know what the Russian graffiti on some of the walls was about.All the buildings at the Fort are below ground level with thick layers of soil covering their roofs. We spent hours walking the labyrinth of corridors, the outside terrain and the three small museums. We spent a few nostalgic moments inside the bread museum before we left. Fort Monostor was quite a unique experience!We realized only afterwards that we could have run into trouble travelling to Komarom by train as some of the railway lines had been damaged by the flooding only a few weeks earlier.When we returned to Budapest Zoltan took a different road winding through the forests and farms of the Pilis Hills. It was a real bonus to see the Hungarian countryside.On our third day with Zoltan, he drove us to the Citadel. the history of the monuments and how the statues had been changed is quite remarkable. He took time to translate Hungarian and Russian inscriptions. He is master of several languages!We passed a few street vendors as we walked our way up. At one of the stalls Zoltan pointed out some articles that had been made from bracket fungi. I couldn't help buying one of the articles - very special!Our next stop was at Aquincum, the architectural remains of a Roman town. Zoltan knows the place like the palm of his hand. We welcomed Zoltan's comments on everything we saw because the site is vast and so are the displays inside the exhibition building. Zoltan made us see and understand much more in the available time. Visiting Aquincum is highly recommended!Zoltan made a special stop at the amphitheatre for a final Roman experience.Veli Bej was our final stop. Zoltan offered to show us exactly where the entrance to the bath was. As we walked through the door, he read a notice stating that it had been closed due to flood damage. Fortunately Zoltan knew exactly around which corner to take us so that we could take a picture.It was here that we said goodbye. His last words to us were: "Please, if you need me for any reason, don't hesitate. Phone me." On our second last day in Budapest I urgently needed a doctor. We first tried the hotel reception and a pharmacy, but with no success. At last Hubby decided to call Zoltan. Of course he knew a doctor not far from our hotel. He immediately phoned her and spoke to her personally to explain the situation. Next he spoke to the guy at reception, asked him to order us a taxi and gave the doctor's address. After a thorough examination the doctor prescribed medicine which we got from a pharmacy. Thank you, Zoltan, for walking the extra mile.We were able to visit spots where tour groups do not go and we were never rushed. Zoltan made a vast contribution to the tender feelings we gained towards a magnificent city as well as towards the Hungarians!P and M Johannesburg

Great experience with a first rate guide!. My family recently travelled to Budapest for our first visit to Hungary. We retained Zoltan to introduce us to the history and culture of Budapest. Zoltan was a superb guide. He does not provide a typical tour with a series of memorized facts and stories- even though he could do so if asked. Instead, Zoltan uses his encyclopedic knowledge of Budapest to create a customized tour that mirrors the interests of a particular group. We opted for two ½ day tours. Zoltan, however, spent more than 7 hours with us on the first day. The tour included a trip to the countryside in his Land Rover to enjoy lunch at a small resort on the Danube. The food and conversation were genuine. Zoltan clearly was well known and genuinely liked by the people that we interacted with on our tour. He led us through the Jewish quarter and the important sites of Pest on the first day of our tour. He framed the history of Hungary in a manner that helped us better understand the soul of the City. Zoltan was open to detours, distractions and occasional stops for beer, wine and more conversation. Yet, he was also comfortable with a faster pace if we so desired. On the second day, Zoltan brought us a light breakfast that included some of his favorite Hungarian sausage. We toured Buda using various modes of public transportation. Again, Zoltan had compelling and interesting stories about Buda and its history. When we needed nourishment, Zoltan drove us to a family owned restaurant in a typical neighborhood. He arranged a tour of the wine chambers in the facility. The restaurant featured some unique Hungarian brandies and wine that were produced by the family. After lunch, Zoltan insisted on driving us to a scheduled appointment on the opposite side of the city. He was patient, continued to provide insights into the community and had an intuitive sense as to what would be of interest to my family. Zoltan has a nice sense of humor and was very comfortable with people. Zoltan broke down the personal and cultural barriers and shared with us a truly unique glimpse of Budapest. Zoltan is a must for any one hoping to receive a great introduction to Budapest..

Excellent Tour with Ex-professor who does not treat you as a student. Aug 18th we had a 1 day tour of Budapest with my family (2 adults, kids 10 and 15). Doing the tour with Zoltan is an experience by itself. Former professor of Mongolian and Tibet studies (!), extremely knowledgeable about present and past Hungary. But at the same time the tour is not a boring fact reading - he doles only as much as you are willing to accept. Zoltan belongs to a very selected group of individuals with unique ideas and thoughts, but they are not forced on you. All of the above is coupled with a good sense of humor.Despite the very limited time we had, Zoltan was able to include selection of "must" destinations, as well as some of the less touristy spots, and a very good (+ affordable) meal in a non-tourist neighborhood restaurant.All in all, Zoltan is a highly recommended tour guide. Thank you for the great day in Budapest !Arie, Larisa, Daniel & Michelle

I have a long lost brother!!!!!. Two days ago, my wife and I, joined by another couple who are friends had the amazingly wonderful opportunity to spend a day with Zoltan. No disrespect, but after a couple of weeks observing chair covers and paintings of dead people in castles and museums....it was a great treat to meet somebody who wanted to give you a chance to feel the soul of his city. Zoltan did just that. First he postponed a trip with his wife for a day to take us on our tour. Judy, his wife was such a good sport, she even met us for dinner. He took us for a walking tour of both Buda and Pest....showing us interesting things from places in the Jewish Quarter, Serbian Quarter, Gypsey areas, and to a must see "Ruin Bar." We walked to the main market center, to a number of interesting landmarks regarding which Zoltan had encyclopedic knowledge and wonderful way of sharing that knowledge (much of which from his years as a professor). After about 90 minutes, we jumped into his car (local Gypsy music playing on his radio while we all were stamping our feet and sing out randomly). We were off on a great adventure to a small creek area in a fairly isolated location where we fed a great meal of grilled trout, fish soup, roasted vegetables...all fresh of the ground and out of the nearby river....just fantastic! Time then to go a little further outside the city and for walking a magical village where we saw a marzipan museum with the most amazing manifistations of Marzipan including a life size Michael Jackson, Princess Diana, and hundreds of other scenes from movies and cartoons...then to the (yes you have this right) toilet museum....to a pottery barn, weavers, and many other trades folks with wonderful products. We also got to check out the numerous local churches of many denominations and ethnic varieties...along with the smallest synagogue in the world. From there it was to an amazing castle fort from where we walked around and sawy antiquated items....and then spent time there watching the sunset over the Danube....finally dinner at a wonderful restaurant which has a 5 generation active wine cellar at which they offered us wine tastings and a tour of the winery, before setting us up in a private room of over 100 years of age for a delicious local dinner....what a treat! This was not the end of the night....no Zoltan wanted to show us the most beautiful spot in Budapest to view the splendid lights, bridges and monuments which line the Danube and the hillsides nearby. We also were able to walk the beautifully lit grounds with views that go beyond any description. Finally at 11:30 it was time for home after an amazing day with one of the kindest and patient people I have ever met. How to describe Zoltan? Real, kind, intelligent, caring, adventurous person whp is in tune with his audience....a fun loving person who makes you feel like you have been freinds for years and leaves tears in your eyes as the day comes to an end. I can only hope Zoltan and I can maintain an ongoing relationship.....he is my brother from a different mother!!!!!

Good tour. Very helpful guide.. Did Jewish tour with Zoltan. Went first to non tourist working synagogue which was a good start to the tour as it felt used and not just for show but still attractive. Then to the orthodox one. Then the ruined synagogue of those who chose neither side - octagonal and my favourite. Then the reform synagogue which actually has an organ and frankly a real air of altar at the front. Museum attached and of course the mass graves and the memorial garden for WWII Jewish victims and those who helped. Very moving. We also heard lots of stories about the houses in the Jewish quarter and finished up with a lovely Hungarian lunch at a restaurant out of Budapest complete with a tour of their cellar and some really throat catching fruit brandy. Lovely food and wine.Zoltan is an ex Mongolian studies lecturer so that gives you some idea that he is not the usual sort of guide. You do not get a totally rosy picture of Hungary but it is good to get balance. Zoltan was a good host and we enjoyed his company. We also appreciated the time Zoltan took to answer our queries at the time of booking and his suggestions of other things to do. Thanks for a great tour Zoltan.

Journeys with Zoltan. We did the Danube Bend with Zoltan and it was quite different to anything I expected after reading the reviews. Having a tour with Zoltan is as much about Zoltan as it is the destination. He is a warm, generous, good-humoured, intelligent but deeply cynical Hungarian. As a guide you not only see the surrounding countryside but have a real sense of Hungary as it is through a unique set of eyes. You will not get any of the hype or luxury that seems typical of most tours today. Instead there is an earthiness that those looking for bubbling enthusiasm may find a little flat. His humour is amongst the driest I have encountered. Zoltan knows Hungary well. He talks about its past and its people with informed authority. We travelled during the floods in Hungary and Zoltan was able to find back roads to each destination where bus groups had abandoned any sense of travel. We also visited a restaurant of Zoltan's recommendation and I have to say the meal was fantastic. I enjoyed talking with Zoltan as much over dinner as I did on the tour. It is these aspects that you get when you book a private tour with someone who knows where they are going. Zoltan also seeks to tailor aspects of the tour to the interests of his travellers. As there were only two of us (down from 4 because of the floods), the per head cost was very high. Considering Hungary as a value-destination, it was not cheap. If you were travelling in a group of five or six, the costs become far more reasonable. I would gladly recommend Rockhoppers but expect depth rather than frills.

Informative and Interesting. An excellent "Budapest City Tour". Our guide Aliz was extremely knowledgeable. This is effectively a one-on-one experience. I was with a buddy of mine and the two of us arranged a private tour.

A Real Professional Guide. I picked Zoltan @ the Rockhoppers from amongst the others listed on TripAdvisor simply because he made me feel confident that he could deliver what he had offered by responding to my initial enquiry in less than 24 hours on a Saturday; and providing an itinerary for my group of ten (aged 18 to 76) with links to the relevant sites containing detail information on the destinations to be visited; the rational for the proposed itinerary; a recommendation on restaurant; and a very reasonable quote. On the day of the tour, Zoltan was quick to develop a close rapport with all members in my group and made every one of us feel comfortable that we were in good hands. Zoltan was very knowledgeable but did not bore us with all the knowledge unless we wanted to. He was also a good listener and attended to all our needs. Schieszl Vendeglo, the restaurant recommended by him, served excellent food, provided great service and was very reasonably priced. We should have left a bigger tip for the boys had we not messed up with the exchange rate - what a shame. All members in my group were very much impressed with the professional standard of Zoltan and agreed that the tour was good value for money.

This should be rated #1: warm, wonderful, and boy did we hop!. We had an amazing three days with Zoltan! Choosing him over all of the other selections on Tripadvisor was no easy task. I wondered, "who is the perfect one?" Aside from the incredible and highly enthusiastic reviews he has gotten ( I am certain he should be number 1 on Tripadvisor)... reading that Rockhoppers are penguins, and penguins are my husband's favorite animal... I knew that Zoltan's company was for us... and we wanted Zoltan. On day one we toured the Jewish quarter, and we walked and walked and learned huge amounts! We toured Buda the following day; roaming around Castle Hill, steeping ourselves in history, but also getting informed about present day Budapest and Hungary. On our final day, we went to Szentendre, a spot we initially thought we'd skip, but wound up trusting Zoltan and went and LOVED it! At the end of our second day, we went to the outskirts of Budapest and had a wonderful dinner with Zoltan at Szeisl... and as others have commented, we were introduced to Palinka ( a Hungarian schnapps) which we enjoyed very much. When we finally had to leave Zoltan, I found I was saying farewell to a new friend. I hope to see him again in the future, and share another palinka! If you want a truly memorable and down to earth experience, provided by someone who spent most of his life as a professor of history....This is the tour guide for you!!!! Maybe he'll come to L.A. and give us a tour of our home!

A wonderful day along the Danube Bend!. Our day with Zoltan was first rate. Zoltan picked us up at our hotel and was very accommodating when we asked if another couple could join us for the day! Because we were in Budapest as part of a bigger tour group, Zoltan arranged a day that would meet our time requirements and it was perfect. All communication with Zoltan was efficient and timely. Zoltan is very knowledgable about the area, it's history, and shared many personal experiences. We stopped to see Roman ruins and a stork nest with baby storks. We visited several sites in the Danube Bend including Szentendre, Esztergom, and Visegrád, a small castle town in Pest County, Hungary. Zoltan took us to a beautiful little restaurant for wine tasting and supper and then drove us back to our hotel. On the way back, he took the time to stop at a site in Budapest that we wanted to see before our departure the next day. He was patient and accommodating and meet our every need. We had a wonderful day with Zoltan and will definitely book another tour with him if we are lucky enough to return to the area. Our day in the Danube Bend was one of the many highlights of our vacation.

We love Zoltan!. Without a doubt the best day of our holiday. We booked the Danube bend tour with Zoltan. He came to pick us up from our hotel in his LandRover. We went out to Szentendre and were treated to an 11am Palinka and beer before a spot of shopping and a tour of the village followed by a Langos. As well as being incredibly knowledgeable and funny, what we loved about Zoltan is he doesn't try to paper over the cracks of real life in Hungary. We found this to be very refreshing but might not be to everyone's taste. We went on to visit Visegrad castle before going to Esztergom Basilica- the most insanely huge and gorgeous church, where Zoltan helped us to find graffiti dating back to the 1500s. After that it was on to a restaurant out in the sticks where we were able to taste wine in the cellar, had yet another Palinka and some fantastic food in a beautiful setting. The whole day whizzed by and Zoltan was more than happy to adapt to our interests - not once did we feel rushed or bored. It was not cheap by any stretch of the imagination but worth every penny. We went back to the hotel stuffed with food and more knowledge than we could hope to gain in a week on our own. When we got back to England, Zotlan had put the photos he took on Facebook for us to see too- a really nice souvenir from a very memorable day.

One of our favorite days this summer vacation!. My husband and I visited many cities/countries this summer but our day with Zoltan was one of our favorite!Booking with him before arriving in Hungary was fast, efficient and friendly. We felt comfortable before even meeting him. We booked a day trip to Herend and Lake Balaton. We had such an informative and interesting tour at Herend. Even though we were on a guided tour, Zoltan had several tidbits to add and even helped the guide when she was stuck trying to explain things in English! We enjoyed good coffee and conversation with Zoltan at the Herend Cafe. We then went to lunch at a restaurant in the middle of no where - there is no way a tourist will get there on their own. It was barn style with wooden benches and we had such a great meal there! It was such an authentic and special experience!Afterwards, we walked around Balatonfured and tasted great wines. Thanks to Zoltan's knowledge, we tasted and bought some of the tastiest wines we've had in a long time. During vacation, people rush to see as much as possible and sometimes forget to slow down and soak in the beautiful surrounding. What we appreciated about Zoltan was that he never rushed us. He encouraged us to slow down, take our time and never made us feel like we were on schedule. Rather than trying to fit us in the schedule he had planned for us, the schedule was changed to fit our pace and our mood. It really doesn't get better than that!Most importantly, our day trip with Zoltan didn't feel like a paid trip with a guide, it felt like spending a day with a friend we haven't seen in a while. He was a pleasure to have conversations with, he was knowledgeable about anything to do with Hungary, he's got a great sense of humor and he's very friendly. I can't say enough to recommend Zoltan but I guarantee that you will have a memorable experience with him.Thank you Zoltan for giving us one our most memorable days!
Excellent. Really exciting, interesting and peculiar tour was that Zoltan gave us. The non-average way, paths where common tourists don't walk is humorous, full with historical curiosity.

The day of learning. Me and my husband stayed in Budapest for 3 days in the beginning of July, as a part of our European vacation. I read a lot of positive reviews about Rockhoppers and decided to book a tour with Zlotan. Unfortunately, Zlotan is a very busy guide and could only tour with us one day. However, those were the best 7 hours spent. Since we stayed at Kempinski, we started with the tour of jewish quarter and it was fascinating. Zlotan gave us so much information and knowledge about jewish life in Budapest that it would've taken us days to learn on your own. We took a bus to the old Buda town and spent hours walking narrow streets, while Zlotan gave us more historical information about churches, castle and everything surrounding us. We had the most wonderful experience and would recommend Zlotan, who is a former university professor, to anyone who is trying to learn about history and see the majestic sites of Budapest.

Really excellent tour. We went on the Roman history tour with Zoltan and weren't disappointed! He was incredibly knowledgable and took us to places we definitely would have missed if we were on our own, such as the ruins of the military baths under a motorway. Although the tour was focussed on the Roman time period we also learnt lots about Hungary and Budapest over the ages and what it's like to be in Hungary today, the politics, society etc. Zoltan is very friendly and engaging and the process of organising the tour was brilliant. I really felt that it was a tour tailored to us. I would definitely recommend Rockhoppers Tours and if we're back in Budapest we'll definitely want to book another!

Not Your Average Tour Guide. We Budapest for four days in June. We spent two of those days touring with Zoltan from Rockhoppers. During our first day, Zoltan treated us to a Jewish tour of Budapest. Zoltan is a former college professor with an inquiring intellect and open personality. He met us at our hotel and we walked to the former Jewish ghetto. Our first stop was a very small active synagogue run by Chabad. Zoltan has befriended the rabbi, the Roma cook and the rabbi's wife. As a result, we were free to spend quite a long time in this now vibrant old synagogue where Zoltan gave us an orientation to the often sad and tragic, but also optimistic history of the Jews of Budapest. From the Chabad house, we then traveled to many other important Jewish sites, including the Great Synagogue and the Synagogue at Rumbach Street. Along the way, Zoltan would stop as his fancy led him and he pointed out many stores and buildings that we would not have noticed without his expert guidance. We stopped for a piece of traditional Jewish cake and a beer at a ruin cafe and ended our first day with lunch at a non-kosher Jewish restaurant. The next day, Zoltan met us at our hotel and led us by foot across the Chain Bridge and then to a bus stop which took us to the castle district of Buda. Since Zoltan knew we were interested in the remains and remnants of the Jewish community, he took us along side trips to highlight Jewish sites even while in this area. Our tour was not rushed, but filled with little details that a larger group tour could not have included (such as the statute of a horse near a local college which has testicles shined bright by the eager students who rub it for luck during finals!) Zoltan gave us an excellent recommendation for dinner our first night and took us for lunch at a wonderful local restaurant on our second day. I highly recommend Rockhoppers Tours of Budapest. Since our visit, we have recommended Rockhoppers already to friends who visited shortly after us. They were also highly pleased. Although we were so glad that Zoltan was our guide, he assures us that the other guides who work with him are all as knowledgeable and interesting as he is.

Great Tour. Zoltan was very accommodating, entertaining and knowledgeable. We are a family of five, and Zoltan guided us on a great tour of Jewish Pest and old Buda. We only had a few hours when we arrived in the city before Shabbat. Zoltan arranged for us to see the highlights and to get access to a few out of the way sites. After rushing a bit, he took us to a Ruin Bar, where we could relax and hear more about what we had seen and the history. We were very, very pleased.

A tour guide experience like no other!!!. Simply put, Zoltan is the most unique tour guide I've ever encountered. He has almost encyclopedic knowledge of the history and culture of Budapest and Hungary in addition to insight into the modern day economic and political gains and struggles. He was incredible at reading our group's mood and interests and tailoring the tour to account for the things we would enjoy (and avoiding those we wouldn't). Zoltan has lived through many changes in Hungary's and Budapest's history and he isn't afraid to tell you the truth about what those experiences were (and still are) like, whether positive or negative.This is NOT a typical tour of the "sights" of the city, but rather an in-depth and extremely candid exploration and conversation. And make sure to request that Zoltan take you to a traditional Hungarian meal at a restaurant just outside the city. Zoltan is a perfect guide for small groups and those who are:- open and honest about the sorts of things they want (and don't want) to see and explore- curious enough to ask questions and interact with Zoltan- willing to sit and relax during the tour, have a coffee or beer- flexible in their itinerary; whatever Zoltan shows and tells you will be incredibleThis is not a tour for those: - looking to see as many "sights" as possible- on a tight and strict schedule- who don't want to interact with your guide and have a two-way conversationIn conclusion, Zoltan will answer any question you have, show you things you didn't know about, and open your mind to the realities (positive and negative) of historic and modern day Budapest and Hungary. I simply can't recommend him enough. I can only hope there is a "Zoltan" in the future places I visit.

Wouldn't change a thing!. We ended a fabulous two weeks in Eastern Europe by spending two days in Budapest with Zoltan. On our first day we spent almost four hours touring the Jewish quarter. His knowledge of both Hungarian and Jewish history was astounding. He was informative, without being boring. He was able to bring the quarter to life. He went at our pace, sometimes fast and sometimes more slowly, and he was able to determine fairly quickly what sights would be of interest to us. The second day we went to the Danube Bend, Szentendre, and Esztergom. We spent the entire day in the Hungarian countryside, going from town to town. Again, his knowledge of the region and its people goes back centuries. He navigated the region so easily that we were able to cover a lot of ground in one day showing us the most beautiful and historic spots, while still finding time for a beer and casual conversation along the way. We wouldn’t change a thing about our experience, and we recommend him highly.

Could not have been better!. We (2 couples) visited Budapest for 3 days and spent a day with Zoltan. It was our first visit to this beautiful city. We were interested in both the general sites and the ones of Jewish interest.Our first encounter with what I'll call "the Zoltan experience" was actually in the planning stages of our trip, as he gave us suggestions via email of what we might see on the day of our arrival, the day prior to the tour we booked with him. He was very responsive and customer oriented.The day of our tour, we met him in the lobby of our hotel, where we sat as he told us about the history and culture of Budapest. We found him to be extremely knowledgable as well as honest. This encyclopedic knowledge and his warm personality were on display throughout the day. We then spent the morning and early afternoon in the Jewish Quarter and, after lunch, the rest of the afternoon in the Castle district; we saw many of the sites in each. One of the impressive things about Zoltan was that he had no agenda other than to make sure we had an enjoyable and educational experience that fulfilled our own objectives. He did not hesitate to make recommendations when asked and they were invariably on the mark. I highly recommend Zoltan without hesitation. He is a credit to the city of Budapest.

Jewish Tour of Budapest. This tour was highly rated on Trip Advisor. Therefore it would be very possible to be disappointed. In contrast, we were even more impressed by the actual experience. We were able to go inside sites not usually included in other tours. Zoltan is a fountain of knowledge about Jewish and Hungarian histories. He gave us an unparalleled insight into the inextricable links between the two histories. As well the tour lasted 4 hours and was over far too quickly.

Fantastic tour with Zoltan!. We had a fantastic tour with Zoltan. Our group consisted of 4 seniors, 2 adults and 1 child, and Zoltan catered the tour to fit our group, taking public transportation to lessen the amount of walking required, taking things at a measured pace, accommodating our requests real-time, etc. He was very knowledgeable and passionate about Budapest, and was very considerate and easy to work with and talk to. Brought us to a nice local lunch place near the castle. Loved what he brought us to and described to us in Budapest!

By far, our most memorable day in Budapest was touring with Zoltan!. Our day with Zoltan was terrific! We spent the morning exploring roman ruins - learning about the ancient history of Budapest. Then toured a beautiful small town where we had an authentic Hungarian lunch. We ended the day sampling wines at a private hillside winery. Zoltan was a terrific guide, sharing his vast knowledge about the region & its culture. He is extremely personable & treated us like we were old friends. If you're looking for a first rate tour guide, you'll want to book a tour with Zoltan.

Great time at Aquaicum and the winery. Zoltan is a fantastic guide and I would recommend him without reservation, he is knowledgable about his city and country and he provide the highlight experience of our trip to Budapest!

Zoltan the Amazing. Our expectations were blown away by this tour. Zoltan seems to tailor his tours for each group and the one he created for us was great. We started on some Roman ruins under a highway overpass, next to a mall that was built over top of the ruins of what was the site of a Roman palace. It was a shocking juxtaposition. But it vividly showed Hungary's ancient past, its recent past and its present literally piled on top of themselves. Then to a more preserved Roman site and on to a small artist's village for more history and talks of politics and history and of course lunch. And finally to tour a vineyard of one of his neighbours in his village. As other reviews have said, Zoltan is warm hearted, easy to talk to, very knowledgeable and has a true artist's soul. Do not miss this tour in Budapest.

Highlight of our Budapest adventure!. Zoltan was a great host to our group of friends and is so knowledgeable. He took on us a great tour of Roman sites, and I appreciated his openness to my requests. His insights and views on life in Hungary at the time of the Roman Empire, and life in Hungary in the 80s and life in Hungary now, was very interesting. We constantly went off topic - which was just fine by me! Zoltan's sense of humour gave a light feel to what a times could be some very heavy topics. Ending off in a beautiful vineyard drinking wine in the late afternoon was such a fun time and we felt so welcomed! Thanks Zoltan - so glad we made the decision to meet you and spend a great day with you!

Zoltan is THE best!. Me and my boyfriend had so much fun with Zoltan and we learned A LOT! He is an open, heartwarm, patient, highly educated and knowledgeable person that is very easy to talk to. While walking around the Castle District we were talking about the jews, the ottoman empire, we discussed todays Hungary compared to other countries, we talked politics and religion, we laughed and even had a beer! I am having a hard time describing this experience because it was so unique and really special. From all the tours we took this was the one that really showed us the meaning behind the city and its important, colourfull history. The best way to get to know Budapest is with Zoltan by your side. Do it! I am higly recomending it! You are gonna get the best guided tour ever!!!
