Zoltan was incredible!. Zoltan took me on the most amazing tour I've ever been on. The tour was of Budapest's Jewish quarter and history. Zoltan is so knowledgeable and passionate about Jewish history and he didn't mind me persistently peppering him with questions. He showed our tiny group things that no one would ever get to see - for example, he knows the entrance codes to many residential buildings of people he's familiar with. As a result we were able to enter a private courtyard and see an original piece of ghetto wall. I'm writing this review a little late because my trip to Budapest was over a year ago, but this tour was unforgettable and I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Whatever you plan to do in Budapest, include a guided tour with Zoltan!. Travelled to Budapest with the company and we booked a two hour walking tour with Rockhoppers to get to know the city a little bit. Had we known before we went how interesting and fun it would be, we would definitely have booked more time. Zoltan came and picked us up at the hotel, started by telling us a little bit about the history of Budapest and it’s people. Then we went for our walk through the city and were told so many bits and pieces of both history and actualities you will not get anywhere else. He is such a nice man and you can really tell that he loves what he is doing. We had the best time, and he felt like a friend to us after just this short time. Think we all could have walked around, listened and talked with him all day!He also recommended a great Jewish restaurant for us to have lunch, Macesz Huscar, where we went after the tour was finished. So, do not miss the opportunity to book a guided tour with Zoltan when in Budapest. It definitely was the highlight of our trip!

Great Walk. Even better conversation. Zoltan may disagree but it seems he's had a not always easy life-long love affair with the city. I think this partly explains why he gives great tours and why he is able to offer so much depth. He's also of the vintage necessary to provide perspective on the city's history and its present. The other part I think is that he truly enjoys walking the city and obviously gets pleasure from discovering new things, meeting new people and hearing new opinions and ideas.  I was in town on my own and am very happy that I took a chance and followed the good reviews to him.

Personalised tour with a very knowledgable man!. My friends and I had an Ottoman tour booked with Zoltan on the first day of our visit to Budapest. I can honestly say that this was the most personalised tour I have ever been on; and what’s more it was with an amazing man who was extremely knowledgeable across a wide range of subjects. Zolton catered the tour based on things we were interested in, which he ascertained via email prior to the tour. Zoltan was very informative about all the places we visited but throughout our journey he also gave us an in-depth conception of the history behind the landmarks around Budapest. Zoltan is a very respectful, humble friendly guy who will make every effort to ensure your tour is interesting and honest; and he provides a genuine insight to the current affairs of Hungary. I particularly thought it was very sweet that Zolton made the effort to get to know us on a personal level by taking an interest in what we do, where we came from etc and he also told us of his family and his life experiences as a teenager.I would highly recommend any tour with Zoltan especially if you are looking for a personalised tour which is great value for money, informative; honest and with a man of great sense of humour.

GREAT TOUR!!!. Zoltan is a true Hungarian gent! He is a very knowledgeable man who tells you how it is. It was great to be in his company during this tour.As part of the ottoman tour we got exclusive access to see a Turkish bath from the 16th century that is currently being renovated and will reopen at some point in the future for the public when its complete. The architect Thomas is a complete genius! His work and the detail is truly spectacular, I will definitely like to come back to visit this bath when it opens. Not only did we learn about the Ottoman Empire in Hungary but Zoltan also covered a bit about roman Budapest and other aspects of Hungarian history which was really insightful. I would definitely recommend going on a tour with rockhoppers if you are visiting Budapest.

Zoltan's tour gave us a balanced opinion of Budapest. We can endorse the excellent reviews of Zoltan's tours that we read about on Trip Advisor. We feel our time with Zoltan gave us a more informed, and balanced opinion of Budapest than we'd received during our first days there. We booked his Jewish tour, and learned much about the history of the Jews in Budapest, but Zoltan also answered our many questions about the history of Hungary, the social and economic conditions both former and current. He's a wealth of knowledge and obviously enjoys this opportunity to inform visitors to add another layer to what the average tourist would see and learn in a few days. We wish we'd had more time to take another tour with him. Maybe next time! We have already recommended Zoltan to friends and happy to endorse him on Trip Advisor.

Best tour guide I have ever had!. I came across the Rockhoppers website prior to my visit to Budapest, and I liked the fact that it did not have a typical touristy feel to it. The reviews on TripAdvisor were so outstanding that I decided to contact Zoltan to take the Art Nouveau tour. From the very start, Zoltan was extremely detailed in his e-mails with me, and wanted to learn more about me so that he could tailor the tour to my interests as much as possible. He's a highly educated man with a great sense of humor and love for the city of Budapest. If all you want in a guide is someone to lead you to the major tourist attractions and make corny jokes, then this tour is not for you. With Zoltan, I felt that I got a wonderful overview to the Art Nouveau of Budapest as well as lessons in history, philosophy, and politics. We explored out-of-the-way places where I'm sure most tourists never venture, and we even explored a tiny museum devoted to the history of the Budapest subway system. I was having so much fun, but I didn't want it to stop. My only disappointment is that I did not have time to arrange more tours with Zoltan while I was in Budapest. If you truly want to learn about the soul of the city, then this is the tour to take.

The highlight of our trip!. Out of a full two weeks in Eastern Europe, our half day with Zoltan in Budapest stands out as the highlight. All good guides help you to understand the places you are visiting, but Zoltan was so much more. Out tour was of the Jewish Quarter, and he really provided us a window into Jewish life in Hungary, past and present. There were four of us, and we all came away with a much deeper level of understanding than we thought possible. We wish we could have taken Zoltan with us for the whole trip.

Unforgettable trip around the secret parts of Budapest. I really enjoyed the Zoltan trip in Budapest and I felt privileged about the information which i learned. I had possibility to visit several Jewish synagogues and it was amazing to gain knowledge about the religion beliefs. Moreover during this attractive trip i visited one of the most popular bars in Budapest with unique, handmade style and in the same time i tasted the delicious Hungarian palinka. Undoubtedly, Budapest due to the Zoltan Trip guide has a different smell, a unique taste and unrepeatable experience.Finally i want to highly recommend the Zoltan guide as one of the experience that everybody has to live. Thanks for all my friend.

amaizing tour. I really ejoyed the half-day tour in Budapest with my Albanian friends. During the tour we visited the Jewish Quarter, synagogues and one of the most popular ruin pub of the capital. Instead of historical facts we heard different stories about a multicultural Hungary which was more interesting than books present it. Zoltan is the best gide for everyone who wants to discover the real face of Budapest.

Outstanding Budapest Visit with Zoltan as our Guide. Loved our day in Budapest with Zoltan. Enjoyed the many sites of Budapest's Jewish Quarter, including street scenes, synagogues, and a wonderful visit to a "Ruin Bar/Market." Received in-depth knowledge and felt like we were with a long-time friend. Enjoyed our dinner at a local winery, too. Highly recommended for all visitors to Budapest!

Magnificent Rock hoppers guide !. I enjoyed really much Zoltan "s tour guide !His amazing stories makes Budapest more attractive.He is not just a tour guide he his more .I am surprised about all the information that i got from him.I was breathless hearing his stories about Jews culture .Actually he transmits impressive stories based on historical facts and details .Everything on his guide is special. He is amazing guy with deep knowledge that makes you love Budapest and its history.

Outstanding tour with great insights from a colorful local. Zoltan gave us interesting insights and stories on seemingly everything we passed by on our 1 day tour. Zoltan's flexibility and willingness to go the extra mile to ensure that my fiancé and I enjoyed our tour and overall stay in Budapest made all the difference. One of the highlights was the lunch we had in the garden of a local "non-tourist" restaurant. The food and drink were outstanding as was Zoltan's company and conversation. I would recommend Rockhoppers to anyone with cultural/historical curiosity that wants to get the most out of his or her time in Budapest.

A fantastic day in Budapest w/ Zoltan. We spent an amazing day w/ Zoltan. As a result - we left Budapest with a much deeper understanding of its tumultuous past...and the complexity of its current situation. His obvious love for Budapest, his deep knowledge of its fascinating place in history, and his strong feelings about the current political climate - all made our stay there incredibly more meaningful. Our day with him allowed us to go beyond the superficial, and appreciate the city on many levels.

Fantastic tour. Amnazing guide. Great Day!. "We arrived to Budapest on 2nd of May 2013 and we had just 3 days to get know this beautiful city. After doing some standard city tour and seeing main sights shortly, we would like to see "another" Budapest - to see it the way local people know it. And we must say Zoltan helped us a lot in this way. The full day tour he organized for us was great, and included Roman Budapest and Old Buda tour, which is quite rare sight for the tourists! We also visited beautiful Danube embankment, where we could enjoy very picturesque and beautiful views and seeing unusual sculptures. All the sights we saw were accommanied by very interesting stories about the Budapest history, Hungarian mentality, traditions of the local people. It is really important to say, that Zoltan is amazingly hospitable and hearty person. We had a great pleasure of the tour and spending this day with Zoltan made our stay in Budapest really special, so we do sincerely hope to come back and listen to his amazing stories again!" Valeria Gromovich and Maria Ulitina

Rockhoppers Rock in Budapest. We recently returned from our first visit to Budapest. We booked Rockhoppers for 2 tours, a Jewish and a classic tour of the city. Zoltan was our guide and he was amazing. His story telling interwoven with the history of Budapest kept us enthralled and the time flew. He gave his all to us not watching the clock;his goal was to ensure we understood Hungry's history beginning with the first settlers, moving through Roman times and end up with the current participation in the EU. If you are visiting Budapest for your first time, Zoltan is not to be missed!

Jewish Budapest. This was a great tour in the Jewish quarter of Budapest. The knowledge of Zoltán, our guide, about this part of Budapest was excellent and he could speak about the history, art and Jewish traditions very interesting and with humour. We met with local Jewish people and heard about their life and their religion. I enjoyed this tour very much and learned a lot.I recommend this tour to everyone!

Great tour!. I am a 55 years old teacher.I grew up in the jewish neigbourghood.( in those times nobody used this expression). Guided by Zoltan Nagy I got to places where I've never been to before, although I had walked by in my childhood every day. For me as a child the nude angel winged women shapes were weird on the house by the corner of the Wesselenyi and Kazinczy street, but now I know why are they there. I felt right, that something is not correct with them. If you want a guide who not give you the lexical data seasoned with some common curiosities and has a personal affection to the place then choose ROCKHOPPERS!Alma Sevcsik

Great tour ! Awesome guide!. I was on a tour in the Jewish quarter of Budapest. Zoltan, our guide took us on a very interesting walk in space and time. He spoke about history, art, traditions with great knowledge, understanding, told us humorou stories from the past and present and showed us old buildings, gems of architecture you would certainly pass if your were on your own. We even had a chance to meet local jewish people, hear about their everyday and religous lives and see the synagogue they regularly go to. I really recommend to everyone how wants a better insight and a few hours of fun!

Special Insights You Won't Find Anywhere Else. Zoltan is an incredible guide with a wonderful understanding of Budapest, it's history, and it's people. But what makes him so special is his ability to take you to place you would never find on your own. Our first day he took us to a wonderful restaurant outside the city where he introduced us to wonderful Hungarian dishes we would never have tried. (Have you had bone marrow soup?) The second day we had a great tour of the Jewish quarter where he took us to a number of open markets, some architectural gems off the beaten path, and a small operating synagogue. Zoltan is a kind and generous man who is focused on giving you an experience that exceeds your expectations.
Full of information. The guy is great! Gull of different information for all periods of Budapest history. I enjoyed the tour and recommend it to you!

Tour of the Jewish City in Budapest. An exciting tour with a knowledgeable and friendly guide - Zoltan Nagy - , many interesting pieces of information. Looking forward to other tours in Budapest with Rockhoppers.

The secrets of the jewish quarter. Me and my friends were on this excursion last November and enjoyed it very much. I'm living in the city but I'm keen on knowing more and more details, stories etc.. about the lovely Budapest.So we got to know lots of new information (why there is a statue of a naked woman on one of the building of Wesselényi street :) about the history of the jewish quarter, how it's developed or changed even in the last 20 years.Thank you very much!

Great excursion in the jewish quarter. We were on a very nice excursion in the Jewish quarter with Zoltán. Our toruuris guide told us very interesting stories about the old houses and the life in them. We got a lot of new interesting information, we became more clever. We had a very good time meanwhile we tasted delicious Jewish palinkas. We will never forget this unbelievable day!

Zoltan, thank you so much for this wonderful experience!. This half-a day tour in the Jewish neighborhood of Budapest was organized just for friends, and it was really amazing! I moved to Hungary more than 25 years ago, I had taken part in a number of tours in Hungary, but this tour was something absolutely special! It showed us various parts of Jewish neighborhood, including a number of synagogues (e.g., Vasvári and Kazinczy), historical buildings, streets, etc. The atmosphere was really great! I liked Zoltán’s personality and his stories, and the way he was telling them to us! I would say, everything was perfect that day! In fact, I think this tour could even last for the whole day (with a Jewish traditional lunch somewhere in the neighborhood)! There are so many other things which could be also showed and talked about! The only thing I didn’t like about that day was the weather! Zoltan, thank you so much for this wonderful experience! Anna T. Litovkina

objective and full of interesting stories. Decades ago there was a saying "Polak wegier dva bratanki" that referred to the traditional Polish and Hungarian friendship. This became an empty slogan by now and remained human beings here and also over there in Hungary. We decided to observe Hungary with Rockhoppers. If you don't want to fail, just do it also! We were taken to a lot of places in Budapest, a charming city with its good and not so good sides (non of them were hidden from our eyes), we were given an objective presentation- and with heart. Thank you!

A great tour with Rockhoppers. We had a great tour with Rockhoppers! We were intereseted in the jewish history of Hungary, and we got much more than we expected! We saw synagogues, but we were taken to places where there were not tourists, but the local Jewish community. We have also seen the hidden areas of the Jewish district and some other jewish places far from the center. Definitely recommended!Ava, Petah Tikva, Israel

Jewish quarter with an insider. My grandfather was born in Budapest and had ambivalent feelings when I told him I would take my family there. Back home I was telling him about our Jewish tour in the region and I saw tears in his eyes. He is a Holocaust survivor, who after the camp did not go back to Budapest. Presentation of our guide fully coincided with his stories of memories. He added some comments when we told him about our tour and he was very satisfied with our guiding himself from several miles away.

We had a tour arround Budapest. Hi . I was in Budapest last December with my girlfriend and it was really unbelievable .We paid a tour around Budapest. I like Hungary but after this tour definitely. Big thank for our guide Zoltan Nagy who extremely prepared like a professor. Hi knows many interesting stories of Hungarian culture and histories. Really thank you for it Wincent Ho

The way to make clouds disappear at the Danube bend!. From Sentendre town Zoltan drove us to the Vishegrad Castle on the top of the high hill. Alas, fog! Dense! No view at all!Zoltan told us to look at the exhibition, and then let's hope!In 15 min the fog disappeared and the beautiful curve of the Danube appeared!We concluded with one of the best restaurants we tried in our life!

I recommend his tours! BUCHAREST - BUDAPEST. People sometimes mix the name of Bucharest with Budapest. I live inBucharest, and went to see Budapest. I was curious about the city andhired a guide from Rockhoppers.We went as deep in the city life as can be, and Zoltan even took me toa Romanian (!) church in the centre of Budapest, where I felt myselfat home. It is in the middle of the Jewish District, and has a verypeaceful atmosphere. He also took me to a complex that had been builtby a Romanian lawyer, also in the Jewish area. Obviously, besideRomanian influence I was curious about the other elements of the city.It turned out that beside Hungarian, there were a lot of othernationals that added valuable things to the capital of Hungary. Allthese were presented by Zoltan, this fellow, who is kind of arenaissance man. I recommend his tours!

GYPSY. The gypsy tour began inside of the town, where we went to a quasi ghetto. We felt safe there with Zoltan, and it seemed that he had acquaintances among the local Roma people. We saw them spending their time on the streets and squares, we went in some houses, and then a surprise: the group went into a Land Rover and drove to the hills and forests. No roads, nothing, but after some 15 minutes the forest ended and we found ourselves in a small village at the pub, where Gypsy people gathered. We were offered some brandy, and stew, while the music played. In a few minutes we were dancing with the local people - until 11 p.m!!!

Remembering Budapest. A couple of years ago, I took a tour of Budapest with Rockhoppers and I was delighted by the experience. So, I decided to contact Zoltan again for a new tour and he took us to Szentendre. What a wonderful smell was coming to the hilltop in Szentendre... and after visiting the Roman ruins, one gets hungry (especially in Hungary, where food is delicious). So, we followed the guide downhill, on a narrow alley leading to a tiny garden, where they were selling freshly made 'langos', doughnuts and pancakes. It was a very nice addition to the tour of the place, which was... as expected, great. Because Zoltan not only knows the places very well, but he's also a very fun guy.Thank you, till next time!

Rockhoppers. I went to Budapest last time in 1989. So much changed during these years. Took a Classic tour with Rockhoppers now. Buildings were the same; everything remained the same, but the people. People became desperate and disappointed. The optimist feeling I saw on their face after the political changes then disappeared by now.Guiding, however, was exactly what I needed. I wanted explanation, answers to my questions, which I got.A perfect study tour for anybody who wants to go deeper down than the mass tours.Carl

Budapest - a unique combination of mainstream & offroad, of East & West, of past & present. A deepsighted insider's view and tour with a personalized itinerary. Zoltan and his colleagues uniquely combine mainstream general information about Budapest with the things his guests are interested in. He is an expert in history, art history, architecture and actual facts about Hungary. Such experience is not to be missed! Thank you.

My feet hurt!!!. We had a brilliant day with Zoltan. He picked us up at 10 a.m. and discussed what we might like to do then completely tailored the day to us. We saw so much i can't quite recall it all! He would've kept going all night as well if we had let him.We hopped in and out of his Land Rover Defender all over the city and out in to the villages. He showed us ruins under motorways, wine vaults in hotels, a castle, Heroes Square, a 'ruin' (a fleamarket with bars and food), hot springs and so much more. He was worth every Forint! Now our feet hurt and we are going to pass out in bed. Great day.

Great Budapest tour with Zoltan. We spent 3 days in Budapest to celebrate my husband's birthday. Zoltan, our private guide, made our celebration more special, hartful and one to remember. He is a very kind and knowledgable person and he told many stories about Hungary from different points of view while we were walking or driving or having lunch. He brought us to many hidden touristic places including nice restaurants and an excellent wine bar. Because of his guiding, we could touch and feel different parts of Hungary. His explanation and guiding really gave additional value to our visit. We saw many things we would not have been looking for ourselves in and around the city.

go, erasmus, go. I am an Erasmus student from Holland. Last week my friends and I went on a tour with Zoltan. It was the Jewish district we started, but we were also interested in some other spectacular spots in town. Therefore we asked our guide to extend the itinerary, which he did perfectly! Having left the Jewish region we visited Communist monuments, beautiful old and broken down houses. After visiting some pubs we ended up in a restaurant, where we were offered the tastiest food I had during my stay in Hungary!

The special guide. An unforgettable tour in the Jewish quarter – with Zoltan... I took my niece from Alaska with me and we were both amazed by our guide’s thorough knowledge of the Jewish culture and history in Budapest. He made this walk very special with providing „insider’s” stories, mentioning famous artists and their works originating from the area – thus making the tour so very enjoyable! He is not the „usual tour guide with the ever repeated facts and dates”. He is SPECIAL! Would love to do this again!

Budapest Tour with Zoltan. Zoltan did a bilingual English/Russian tour of Budapest for us, combining the Jewish Budapest tour with an overview of the city. This was an excellent tour and we had a great time. Zoltan knows the city, both the beautiful sites and the underrbelly. To top it off he took us to a nice restaurant off the tourist path, so we enjoyed a great meal at a very reasonable price. Highly recommended!

a local voice. I first went on a Classic Budapest tour with Rockhoppers together with a friend of mine from Finland. Then I decided to do some more tours by myself. Since we were all Hungarians, the tour was done in the Hungarian language. It was a great surprise for all of us, 6 people, all from Budapest! Places, houses that we can see daily became animated and filled with content, filled with stories that were new for most of us. I was told that Rockhoppers would do tours also for Hungarians, since they have something to show and say to local people, as well. I can assure anybody that it is true!Józsi bácsi, Budapest

My American colleagues. Hi! With the help of Zoli I took my American colleagues (2 Californian lawyers) to a small village near Budapest (Csobanka). It was a kind of absurd tour to the pub of the segregated Roma community ( worthy to discover their life and remember what is poverty in the heart of Europe.) The owner of the pub, and the local Roma "king" - with a real crown on his head(!) made my colleagues dance and drink like crazy. They had a great time and as they told me they could completely switch off contract law in their heads :))). I really recommend Zoli and his network to enjoy your time in Budapest. By the way, Zoli wrote a book about the ancient Tibetian medicine ... Fabolous, isn't it?

An adventurous trip to the Northern Hungary with my teenage daughter. We were with my 12 y.o. daughter in Hungary some time ago, and I felt myself indebted to the rockhoppers for the way we were treated and taken care of. Zoltan guided us around the villages and beautiful small towns of Northern Hungary, and in Budapest. My daughter is lively girl who would appreciate too encyclopedic stories, while me being in Hungary for the first time wanted to listen about the history and culture and multinational layers of society as much as possible. Both of us were satisfied - my daughter said it was real adventure, and my excurse to the different realities of Hungary could not be better and fuller! I m still surprised how the same person could make it so interesting for both of us, and make such a great contact with a teenager. The food recommendations on the road were the best, 'ethnographic' and not much expensive. Zoltan's personal humanistic approach to different people living in Hungary contrasts with what I had seen in Eastern Europe, and the trip to gypsy village shows that. It is a bit shocking, but I would recommend it to everybody who comes to Hungary. Fascinating experience!

Budapest. It took 2 years to get back to Hungary. We wrote a review on Tripadvisor then, and we felt obliged to write a new one! Due to our wonderful previous experience we took more tours with Rockhoppers. We learnt a LOT about Budapest and its history. It is very special! The information and especially its interpretation were convincing! Due to Rockhoppers Budapest became our favourite spot in Europe!Rudi, Dresden

A different perspective. I had contact with Zoltan on behalf of my parents for whom I was booking a tour. They are in their 70's and of all the places they were visiting in Europe, Budapest was the one I felt they would be most vulnerable.Zoltan was THE perfect addition to their trip. His communication with me prior to their trip, during their time with him and his follow up once they were home was prompt, warm and genuine.He certainly assisted in reducing my concerns about their travels as potential vulnerable oldies.People may view his pricing as expensive compared to the mass tours that are available, but I can assure you his smaller numbers, his flexibility, his depth of knowledge and his spontenaiety all added up to excellent value for money. My parents raved about him!

What was the Communism like?. I grew up in the time of the Cold war, and although we were told that Communists were devils, we were curious about them. When I first went to Europe I visited some of the former Communist countries namely Slovakia, Czech Republic, Romania, Bulgaria and also BUDAPEST² While in every other place I felt the hatred and denial towards their past, I was given a real view in Budapest. I was told about the way to survive those years from an eye-witness, who explained about all the skills that made people to live happy and optimistic, even if they had never had hope of the collapse of the system at all. I was taken around in the city and visited places where great events of the '56 uprising took place, and also sad places where people were tortured and had to suffer. A world with a Janus face, with a beautiful and also an ugly side. My guide Zoltan used to belong to the opposition then, and he can still use the skills he had to learn in those years. He did not judge everything of the Communist period, and did not praise everything that they are living in today. A fair presentation. The best somebody can have.

Jewish Quarter of Budapest. At last December (with my American relatives) I visited the Jewish Quarter of Budapest with Zoltan who is the guide of Rockhoppers. It was so cold but we forgot it because of Zoltan' s interesting, wise and sometimes funny stories. We saw many gems, many secrets. We learned a lot of the colourful and sorry history of the Hungarian Jews. I can suggest to try his sightseeing tours. You wouldn' t regret.Pavol Šalamon,Košice,Slovakia

Music in the car. We did the Danube Bend. Amazing views, amazing spots, funny and astonishing stories about Hungary. And a side info: ask the driver to turn the music on! (At the end we were presented it on a CD!)

visit to budapest. Well I did not know what to expect when I met Eva. I already had a good tour outside budapest visiting the beautiful gypsy horses.I spent half a day with Eva around Budapest. Eva was wonderful and she knew the areas very well and the history of every place we visited. It also rained but that did not faze Eva. A very professional guide and her English was very good.Sadly, i visited Budapest again in 2010 but the phone Number I had for Eva was no longer in use.i am sure i made freinds with Evea. and i won't hesitate to recommend her as a guide to all my friends.I met Eva in 2008. We still correspond by email up to now. Rebecca Mills Darwin Australia> I had to put a year/date because it is required.

BUDAPEST – FIRST TIME NOT FROM A BUS. We were 9 people, a group of old friends. It was the first time we had a private guide, and for sure, not the last! Keywords were: interactivity, friendliness, tailored to our personal interest and needs, and freedom of changing the program any time.

great guide. I came to Budapest with my family and booked Rockhoppers. We had a really amazing day! Zoltan showed us many interesting places and hidden treasures. He told us a lot about the Hungarian culture and history. It was much more than a simple tour in the city. After this wonderful day my family was sure that we'll come back to Hungary and see more of this country. I would recommend Rockhoppers.

Eva Kleyer, Historian and guide, Budapest. Eva is one of the most knowledgable and pleasant guides I have ever had. She is pleasant and attractive, and made my stay in Budapest memorable. Her English skills are outstanding. She was helpful in all regards, and I would not hesitate to book her again. My highest recommendation.
C. Perry MD
Colorado Springs, Colorado

rockhoppers is great!. this group is great. they communicate very efficiently and prices are fair. you tell them what you want and they can customize your tour. we were in Budapest one and a half days and wanted to see more than just the usual tourist areas. Zoltan was our tour guide and he was great. He is very knowledgeable and knows the ins and outs of the city. I would highly recommend.

PEARLS OF BUDAPEST ARCHITECTURE, ART NOUVEAU. Budapest is a pearl! Especially for an architect. The eclectic architectural complex of the city is awesome! I love art nouveau and it has its special touch in Budapest. Having Art Nouveau houses in the vicinity of 16th century Ottoman Turkish hammams...it is hard to believe. But this is Budapest --- where all cultures meet. You just have to experience it, and with a local guide you'll get deeer into the heart of the city. Ask for Zoltan as your guide, and he'll show you the pearls.Outi Karttunen, Ikaalinen, Finland

Hidden Treasures. I had an incredible tour with Rockhoppers. Even though I am a Hungarian I discovered a hidden side of Budapest thanks to Zoltan. I took part on his Jewish tour with my Irish friends and we all had a great time with him. Actually it were my Irish friends who found Rockhoppers' Tours on the net. Zoltan the tour leader showed us such places that I hadn't known about and I am sure many Hungarians don't know. It was really authentic, we had an insight of the local Jewish community's life and I learned a lot about our own history. He took us to places where not everyone has an access, where surely you could't go on your own as a tourist, nor as a Hungarian, like hidden synagogues in inner courtyards. We enjoyed the tour a lot and I can just recommend it to everyone!

Excellent Tour. We did not expect to get such a professional and deep tour in the Jewish history of Budapest. We took a look at some other groups that organise tours in the Jewish district, but their website and flyers limited to the big synagogues.And our choice proved excellent!We recommend it to anyone!

Great tour on Budapest Jewish heritage. Vienna and Budapest are close to each other, and I can say that I know Budapest quite well. I was curious about the Jewish Budapest and I was extremely satisfied the Rockhoppers people. I say fliers of some agencies that offered 1,2 or even 3 synagogues. Having some knowledge on the Grand Synagogue, I realised some tricks in the ads, I mean they enlisted the Grand Synagogue, the Wallenberg memorial garden and the Jewish Museum as independent sights, but they're at the same venue!We did the tour with Rockhoppers and we were taken to places that we had absolutely no idea that they existed! We were given a 'lecture', but not a boring one, on Jewish history of Hungary and Budapest, it was comprehensive and spiced with humour!I am sure this is the BEST JEWISH TOUR TODAY IN BUDAPEST!Zsoka from Vienna

Great time with Nagy Zoltan (Rockhoppers) in Budapest. We had a great time with Nagy Zoltan at Budapest this past November. I had made contact with Zoltan 5-6 months before our arrival for our group of 16 travelers. Using emails and phone calls, we arranged a 2 day program for the group to see the famous tourist sights as well as the Real Budapest.... he promised. Zoltan met us at our hotel as soon as we had checked in at about 9:30am. It was earlier than expected, and I called him at his home. He was a lanky, scholarly looking gentleman with grayish hair and a beard; wearing a John Lennon cap. He spoke fluent English, soft spoken, but passionate about his country. Day one was a walking tour. He took us on foot and by subway to a few major sights: such as the Fisherman's Bastion, Hero Square...etc. We also went to see a couple baths, walked the Andrassy Ave. We specially enjoyed the coffee and pastry in a very special cafe (Book Cafe) that was hidden on the third floor of a large bookstore. It has the most amazing and ornate Baroque styled architecture. We finished the day in a very nice local restaurant "Kaltenberg", where some of us had the best Fried Pork Knee in Budapest. Day 2 was by bus for a tour of the countryside and 3 towns outside of the city. The little town of Szentendre was interesting, and we all enjoyed their local fried dough "Langos" ...yummy. The locals like it covered with raw garlic, but I passed. By the time we got back to the Danube Bend, it was foggy and damp, and we were all tired and ready for dinner. Zoltan had to rearrange our dinner plan on the fly. We didn't get back to our hotel until after 9pm. Zoltan was a knowledgeable guide. He knew the city and her history well, and he was easy to talk to and very accommodating. He looked after us for 2 whole days; from 9:30am to 9pm, and our group was very happy with his services. I would highly recommend him to our friends.

Incredible Adventure and the Highlight of my Entire Trip to Europe!. If you're going to Budapest DO NOT miss out on the chance to take a tour w/ Zoltan & rock hoppers! Trust me on this. First off, Zoltan is one of the most warm, passionate, incredibly interesting & so-much-fun-to-hang with people you'll ever meet. Secondly, he carefully customized our tour to exactly what we told him our interests were: Art, History, particularly military history & good Food :-) From what I hear, other tour guides are formulaic. They give everyone the same tour over & over again. With Zoltan this was NOT the case. Over the course of the day, my dad, younger brother & myself went on an adventure hopping on trams, trains & then in his Land Rover to see, hear, touch & taste all of what Budapest is about.He shared with us intimate details of this incredible city, which we'd never find in a book and took us to places only the insiders know about. And I was amazed at how much we fit into the day. It would've took me a week to do all that we did in just a day's time, yet we never felt rushed. Do yourself a BIG favor and book a tour with Zoltan and you (and whoever you'll be traveling with) will be very happy you did.Happy adventures!

Fantastic Adventure. When I read the review from VL for a minute, I thought someone from my group wrote that review. It was spot on! We had such a fantastic time with Zoltan. I saw some of the less favorable reviews and Im sorry those folks didn’t have the same experience that we did. There was 5 of us, we have traveled all over the world and that past few years we have hired a tour guide for our trips. It’s a great way to get the “real” experience. We communicated with Zoltan via email prior to our visit. We defiantly wanted something more than the double decker bus (not that Im against them). We had two full days with Zoltan and we had a wonderful time. He has so much knowledge and he is willing to share his life story, which is incredible. We got to see nooks and crannies of the city that we wouldn’t have found without Zoltan. There are the obvious sights but you can do those on your own. He will take you to just the right spot, at the right time to see all the lights of the city light up and every bridge sparkle. In the past out tours typically ended before 5, not with Zoltan. The 1st day when we toured Buda & Pest we were with him until he walked us to a restaurant for dinner, around 7. He arranged it for us. The 2nd trip with him we were home closer to 8, after having one of the best dinners I ever had, at a restaurant that he had his wedding reception.We had such a great time and I would recommend him to anyone.

A unique view from an amazing man!. Zoltan was terrific! He gave us the perfect blend of the 'must see' and the 'off-the-beaten-path' views of Budapest. I appreciated his honest and complete perspective of the city. He took us to some amazing local places both in the city and outside of the main tourist area. We spent 2 full days with him and he went above and beyond both days to make our experience memorable, educational, and fun all at once. Zoltan has a great sense of humor and an amazing spirit. I would gladly tour with him again! His knowledge and experience provided us with an experience we would not have had otherwise. Thank you Zoltan for a wonderful experience of Budapest!

Good tour.. Three of us toured with Zoltan for half a day. He is very knowledgeable and a very nice guy. We found him a bit hard to hear as he's rather soft spoken. He was not as outgoing and animated as our tour guides in Prague and Vienna but he took us to a great place for lunch that we really enjoyed.

Insightful tours, unsurpassed service, engaging tour guide. Touring Budapest with Zoltan is for those who wish to walk away with an in-depth understanding of various facets of life in Hungary, instead of being mere sight-seeing tourists ticking the city off of their "Have Been There" list. Zoltan is not your run-of-the-mill tour guide – previously a university professor who had traveled widely, including Mongolia and Tibet, as well as spending time in US. A visit to his website shows the heart he puts into making the experience an interesting and informative one even before the physical tour begins (though the website is being overhauled since we last visited it early in the year). We were lucky to have him guide us personally, as he mentioned adding staff to accommodate his growing business. He said he had tried being a guide for those readily available free tours and found it very uninspiring for a number of reasons but particularly the almost non-existent or superficial interactions. Thus, Zoltan would be the perfect choice if you are interested in engaging conversations, honest opinion of Hungarian politics and life in Hungary, enlightening info, interesting insights and tales on all that you see. We signed on with Zoltan for four tours in three days: Buda side, Pest side, Danube Bend, and the Gypsy Village. The city tours involved a lot of walking, with frequent stops as Zoltan pointed out not just the major attractions but little easily-missed details and told us not just the key facts but interesting tidbits as well. We did take mass transit as needed, and for farther destinations, both Zoltan and his lovely wife, Judy, took us in their two Land Rovers in order to transport all 11 of us – a larger than ideal group size for Zoltan that he nevertheless accommodated well. Zoltan’s “negotiation skill” kicked into high gears when we arrived at the Basilica in Esztergom just as it was closing - a result of the ladies in the group having too good a time shopping in Szentendre - and the guard refused to allow us in. Not wanting us to miss the magnificent red marble room nor the mausoleum below, Zoltan worked his magic and got us in to see both. We were fairly certain that a “greener” tour guide like some of the others we had on the trip elsewhere would not have had the wherewithal to successfully negotiate our entry. A final testament of Zoltan’s personalized service – I had indicated an interest in the music that accompanied the various tour details on his website, so he left a compilation CD for me at hotel concierge on the evening before our departure. It also included songs he played in his car during our drives,from jazz to gypsy music, to the hauntingly beautiful Bing Crosby 1930's rendition of “Brother, Can You Spare A Dime”. The CD is indicative of the level of thoughtful, attentive, and personalized service that many talk about but few can truly deliver. Having gotten to know Zoltan a little over the three days, I’m sure he wouldn’t have it any other way.

Slow pace, not very exciting. We had booked a 4 hour tour with Zoltan but in the end we cut it short to 3 hours as we preferred to rather explore on our own. Unfortunately there was no click between Zoltan and the 3 of us (mom and 2 teenage daughters). Zoltan was very knowledgeable but very much into little details and less into those things that would have been more interesting to us as tourists. The weather was cold and our slow pace did not help. He is a kind person but you have to state upfront very clearly what you want.

Budapest with Zoltan. What can we say? If you want to experience Budapest with an intelligent, experienced, wonderfully cheeky and informative, obliging guide... look no further! We had a great day with Zoltan but unfortunately had to cancel our night tour (of the lights of Budapest) due to inclement weather... but it *was* our call! Zoltan was the most accommodating guide and went out of his way to make our experience special. If you are looking for a real Budapest experience with someone who has experienced other cultures yet returned to his origins... book a tour with Zoltan!

Zoltan made this trip unforgetable!. This is one of the best tours we had during our Europe trip. Zoltan was amazing, he showed us Budapest in an honest, fun way. We started early in the morning visiting Roman ruins which is what we wanted to do initially. However as the day went by, we decided to do other things too. I think the best part is Zoltan will accommodate to your schedule, and if you want to change the original plan along the way, he will make it happen with a smile. He also took us for a great lunch in a very nice restaurant and the food was fantastic.I really can't rave enough about Zoltan. Trust me, if you are going to Budapest, he is the best way to go.Oh, and he also have me a CD with music I thought was wonderful!

Amazing "tour" of Budapest. I've traveled in a much of Western Europe and wasn't sure what to expect in Budapest. I can honestly tell you as someone that has taken a few tours but also done many cities on my own that the "tour" with Zoltan was in a class of it's own. I went with a friend and the three of us really saw the city through his eyes. Not all glamorous but all amazing. I really feel like we got the whole story but best of all it was a great time while we walked. He told us so many amazing stories (and shared some fruit brandy!) and we couldn't haven't asked for a better introduction of the city. 5 stars doesn't even begin to do him justice. I don't have a single bad thing to say about the 5+ hours we spent with him.

Perfect. I spent my last day in Budapest doing the Danube bend tour with Zoltan, I had an amazing time on this tour and would recommend it to anyone. This tour is not just recycled information from a tourist brochure but the real Budapest presented from a Hungarian who has a passion for his culture and people in general. This is a must when visiting Budapest- thanks heaps Zoltan :)

Fantastic. We visited Budapest for 2 days on 21 August 2012. Zolton met us at our apartment and he was very friendly and outgoing straight away. We visited all the major sights listed on tripadvisor and Zolton explained the history of these sights making our 6 hour tour very interested and eager to learn more about this beautiful city.We were 3 x 27 year old men from Manchester who would have found the normal tours slightly boring as once you have seen one tour you have seen them all. Zolton contacted me before our tour and asked about us and wanted to know what we were interested so the tour good be tailored to our needs. This worked out fantastically as we couldnt have wished for more.At the end of the day Zolton took us to a beautiful restraunt that he recommended just outside of the city. This restraunt was fantastic and I would recommend any one who uses Zolton to definatly visit this tour.Zolton made our trip to Budapest and I would definatly recommend people to book with him.Quality

our time with zoltan. there were 6 of us ranging in age from 16 to 55 and we had very diverse interests. in prague we had guides that did not really understand how to keep the younger teenage boys interested. then, in budapest, we met zoltan. he was filled with interesting stories about the places we visited that were not just out of some textbook. i believe that his background in sociology (anthropology) really helped give a perspective that would not have been available from someone who just knew facts. his perspectiive is neither overly flattering or overly disparaging of the hungarians and it was refreshing to hear the stories of of the not so perfect history and current events of hungary. my husband and i travelled with my 2 sons age 21 and 16 and my older son's girlfriend who is 20 and my younger son's friend, also 16. between the 2 full days of sightseeing he arranged for the four younger members of our group to go kayaking with a friend of his and have lunch north of the city. they thoroughly enjoyed that break from viewing buildings. on our first day, where we viewed the jewish section of the city, he brought us to a ruin pub so we could taste pilanka ( local alcoholic favorite with a hint of fruit flavoring). i have some difficulty walking for long periods or very fast for that matter, and he was very understanding of the breaks i needed and never made us feel that the clock was running because i needed to sit and get a drink. in fact,those were some of my favorite times with zoltan as he has no problem regaling you with stories that are very entertaining. at the end of the second day of touring we had lunch ( which for zoltan means a meal at 4pm i tell you this for no other reason but so that you can make a very late dinner plan on the days with zoltan) and he took us to one of his favorite restaurants just outside budapest called schieszl borhaz and we spent a wonderful almost 2 hours dining ,tasting the pilanka and wine made on the premises and recapping the tours. we were sorry to part but ran to our computers because we want to share our experience because he deserves to be found.

Zoltan kept all six of us (ages 14-54) enthralled!. Thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Zoltan. He made Budapest so much more accessible with his wonderful knowledge of this beautiful city. He shared many stories and facts, about the everyday life of those who live there today, to the ancient Romans, whose ruins we explored. We topped it off with an amazing dinner.

very very nice day. Our tour guide was Marina. We spent a really nice and memorable day. When showing the classical sites, she also drew our attention to some very specific details you can learn only from a local who has a lot of personal experiences associated to these sites. At the end of the day we got to know to how many nations and events Budapest has been home - sinagogues, Turkish baths, Christian churches, and communist relics. We also visited a typical Hungarian market, a fantastic bookstore, and some really special coffee houses. In the end, we can say that we could both enjoy the privileges of being tourists, and get a taste of how it feels to live in Budapest. Igor and Katya.

Zoltan Made our Trip to Hungary Most Memorable. We booked a tour with Zoltan for a day and a half on July 16-17th for me, my wife and my two teenage kids 16 and 18th. Since I only had three days to see Budapest, I scheduled a pretty aggressive schedule for Zoltan to accommate. I requested Zoltan to take us to Szentendre, Visegrad and Esztergom, towns outside of Budapest and then to visit Heroes Square, Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Széchenyi Bath, and many other major tourist spots within this two day period.Let me first start by saying the tour with Zoltan had made my trip to Hungary most memorable. My last rip to Budapest was 38 years ago. I was born in the U.S.A. and do speak Hungarian somewhat and my parents were both born in Hungary and I wanted to show my family where their grandparents came from. Now let me tell you why Zoltan is such a great tour guide. Zoltan provided an honest perspective of Hungarian history and gives you the good and bad in terms of it's history and politics, which I appreciated. During our tour, Zoltan pointed out historic sites and personalized the tour so much so that we felt we were traveling with a friend, not a paid tour guide. At one point in our trip to Szendre, he pulled off to the side of the road and couldn't understand why. We got out of the Range Rover and he said look up. We looked up to find a huge Stalk nest on top of an electrical pole with mom and the new baby stalks in the nest. This was very cool to see. As we bacame more familiar with each other, we ended up listening to gipsy music and believe it or not began singing to it as well. We ate lunch at some places that he recommended and all were very good. I even tried some Palinka (peach liquor), and the kids ate Langos,palachinta, and Heck fish at various spots. We had so much fun with Zoltan that we well exceeded our time with him on both days. The first day we ended our day with Zoltan at 8PM and the second day, although was suppose to be a half day ended up more like a full day. Zoltan never looked at his watch to say time is up as he gave us his undivided attention. When I asked my two teenage kids, what they thought of Hungary, they mentioned that Zoltan made the trip memorable. Zoltan made this trip great. The chemistry between us was perfect. I really feel like I gained a friend and will definitely seek him out again if I visit Hungary. I thought the cost for the two days was fair. He has far exceeded our expectations. As a small memento, he burned a CD of Hungarian music for me to bring back to my parents to listen to, which was very thoughful. Thank you Zoltan for a fun, honest, and personal tour of Budapest. We will not forget our time with you sightseeing Hungary.

Zoltan the Great!. It was our first time in Budapest. We only had two full days to explore the city so we decided to book a half day walking tour with Zoltan. It was an extremely hot but thoroughly enjoyable day. In 5 hours, we explored the city (Castle Hill, Opera House, St. Stephen's Basilica, Matthias Church, Alexandra bookstore, etc...) while Zoltan enlightened us with the history and interesting stories of each place. We could have spent a whole day with Zoltan, but after 5 hours in the heat, we were ready to call it a day. Zoltan the Great, as we nicknamed him, did a fantastic job of showing us what was unique to Budapest.

A great way to tour Budapest. A most interesting day in Budapest with Zoltan. I can't imagine a better way to get a feel for a city and a culture with so much history than with someone like Zoltan; an adventuresome guy who has lived his life with gusto. He shares personal stories, political views, and opinions -- giving the tour much personality. We walked through the city, saw everything we could squeeze in, and finished with a fantastic meal at a local restaurant just out of town. We had our 12 and 15 year old daughters with us and Zoltan was very considerate of their attention span. We all enjoyed the day despite the 95 degree heat.

Okay. We had a day tour for both Buda and Pest. It was originally just for the two of us but had an American family joined us. Zoltan, of course, asked us before whether we were amenable to the addition and kindly cut down on the price. My sister and I are very used to walking tours, as we usually make a point of booking one for every city visited. This was probably the most we have ever paid for one. Not the best that we have every been on though, but probably not fair to compare one city to another or one guide to another. Zoltan showed us the local sights, the bad and the good. It was very sad to see the skeleton of an architecturally beautiful building being left to rot due to poor upkeep and private corporations. There's a lot of disappointment with the country's politics - but with the current climate, I don't think anybody could be full of praise for their politicians. My sister even commented that he seem to enjoy pointing out the bad things, which I guess says a bit. None the less, we walked around and saw a few things. Missed a few of the major ones like the basilica and the Danube, which was surprising. I guess he figured that everybody is already planning to go there, so maybe he focused the walk on less touristy areas. We had to remind him about lunch but I don't think 'lunch' was figured into the tour. He brought us to a cafe which served beautiful pastries though, which I enjoyed. He did recommend us a restaurant to go to after as well (I wanted to try the carp goulash), which I liked. Lots of the food recommendations are out of town which is not surprising, but a bit difficult for us to get to. I was a bit surprised that a whole day tour started at 10 and ended at 4 PM, especially for the price paid.Unfortunately, I did not get the whole 'unique and personal' tour that others had experienced. My overall impression was average. I have a feeling that we're probably younger than his normal clientele and he's maybe better off the beaten track and out of town areas. My recommendation if you only have a few days and is sticking to the centre of town is to get one of the free walking tours instead.

Great walk with good company. Our guide was Nora. We chose to do the Jewish quarter walk. She was really great in showing us all the treasures of this tour. We had a really pleasant time and can warmly recommend her and the company as they were really helpful and well organised.

There are guidebooks, and there is Zoltan. Zoltan was our personal guide for the day, and would probably have stayed with us for the evening as well. He talks softly and from the heart about the history and culture of the city - its good times and bad times. We just wandered through the city by foot, car, trolley bus, taking off the beaten track routes. We shared a wonderful lunch in a locals' restaurant in Old Buda. The next day the Hop On Hop Off bus was so characterless.

Unique experience tailored to your interests. We highly recommend joining Zoltan for a tour if you'd like to experience paths which will show you the city of Budapest from unique perspective and uncover historical facts which traditional tours will not even touch on. Besides that, Zoltan will tailor the tour to your interests and will definitely expand your knowledge even further. It's great to be accompanied by a guide who loves his coutry and is willing to share it with you! Truly interesting experience!

Off the beaten track. If you're looking for a "taste" of Budapest outside of the guidebook/bus tour experience, I highly recommend spending a weekend with Zoltan. If you're up for some adventure and have an interest in the heart of the people as well as visiting the remarkable sights of Budapest, hang with Zoltan awhile. He can tailor your time in Budapest to whatever specific interests excite you most. For instance I love history and we spent time on trail of the ancient Roman past. My husband enjoys wine tasting and we visited little local Restaruants where tourists don't go. Spend time over a Hungarian meal, discussing the past, the present and the future. Zoltan is more than well-informed, personable, and fun (try a 4x4 ride in his Land Rover around the countryside). Spending time with and seeing a place through the eyes of someone who lives there, makes the experience unforgettable. Thanks Zoltan.

The tour that makes you feel like a local!. So,I arrive...a solo, English speaking traveller with 4 days in Budapest and a keen desire to learn about and experience.....everything! I chose Zoltan as my guide, because a) of his excellent reviews and b)I figured that anyone who used such sublime music on their web site ,had to be OK! On Day 1 Zoltan introduced me to Budapest, We travelled by trusty jeep, by tram, train and walked....so I learnt how to get around, was given an historical view of the city, was shown some delightful 'off the tourist track' places ..like an amazing coffee shop that you arrive at through a book store.I also learnt not to copy his greeting to people as it is all relational and a social minefield! After Day 1, I felt at ease wandering around the city for the next 2 days and soaking in the numerous spas and hamams(Also useful to have local suggestions). On Day 4 Zoltan took me out of the city to Danube Bend to get a wider view of the history, some small villages and to see the beautiful countryside. This was rounded off with a visit to a spectacular local restaurant. Zoltan is a natural storyteller, has a huge knowledge bank and really seems to enjoy his job.His tours deeply enriched my experience of Hungary.

Perfect guide for Budapest. We were fortunate to have found Zoltan. We hired him for a one-day tour around Budapest and we covered an impressive amount of geography. We walked and rode public transport and while Zoltan was teaching us about the history of every area, building, monument, and street, he was also providing us with a fascinating cultural lesson about growing up in this historic and sometimes troubled city. Given the rich content of our day with Zoltan, we would say that his fee is reasonable, if not on the low side. We have run into other American tourists since our day with Zoltan and we have recommended him highly.

Authentic, knowledgable, unbiased, personal.. We spent 2 days with Zoltan and he is a perfect tour guide. By the second day he felt like a friend. Taking the time to get to know our interests, customizing the tour, and providing authentic experiences. A sure bet for anyone who wants to really get to see Budapest and learn about the people and culture.

A Wonderful Walk. Zoltan, the owner, went out of his way to join me for a walk around the parts of the city with me to introduce me to Water Town, the Jewish Quarter, and City Park. I was completely enthralled not only by how much Zoltan knew about the town but by all the sites he was able to show me that I would of never seen with anyone else. My favorite part was holding up to the challenge of tasting the spring water from the well in City Park that most tourists do not even know exists for drinking! Not only would I recommend a tour with Rockhoppers to friends and families but Zoltan would be the first person I would get in touch with if I was going back to Budapest!

Unique way to see the city by the Danube.... We are serious travelers, always in search of finding the "true feel" of the cities we visit. Followingadvice from this page we decided to let Zoltan, owner and guide of Rockhoppers tours, to guide us. Excellent tour guide, he can customize any tour preference for you. But most of all, an honest , knowledgeable person, who loves to be Hungarian and is very proud to show you his city. It is like being with a local friend, who knows all the insides and all the vistas!! A different, adventurous way to visit the most historical and important sites in the city. Highly recommended.

2 days with the "Indiana Jones" of Hungary. Seriously, the other reviewer nailed it by comparing him to Indy. We spent two days with him, 6 and 8 hours each day and worth every forint. His own history is as interesting as that of Budapest's. His intimate knowledge of the area was impressive, almost overwhelming, and he'll really help you understand all of what Hungary has gone through and currently is going through. He'll design the tour anyway you want, just give him your time frame and requests and he'll take it form there.The first day we spent in the city, first Pest - touring the Jewish Ghetto (where his "open door" policy is the best!), Széchenyi Baths and Park, Opera House, Heroes Square, Parliament, etc...Then onto Buda - hopping on the 16 bus to the Buda Castle, Fishermans Bastion, Faust Wine cellar, and so much more, all the while stopping at local restaurants (incredible lunch spot hidden in a book store that you'd never find on your own) and bakeries where everyone seems to know zoltan, and drinking Palinka along the way.The second day we hopped into his LandRover and went into the country. We first stopped at some ancient Roman Ruins along the way to Szentendre (great litte town of local artists where we knocked out a lot of gift shopping), Visegrád (historic castle with amazing views), and Esztergom (one of the largest basiicas we've ever seen), and then to a small village of 300 people, who were bitter at Americans for something we did in 1956! We then stopped at Scheizl for an absolutley unforgettable meal, where our waiter was also the fisherman who caught our dinner!You can tell zoltan really cares about his country and takes pride in his tours. We would not heisitate to recommend any of his services.

Two Days of Great Tours!!!!. I had read all of the reviews on trip advisor. I knew we wanted something a bit more personal for visiting the Danube Bend area. We got it with Zoltan Nagy (Nagy Zoltan for Hungarians). It was absolutely great! He was extremely knowledgeable. We were able to see more of the country side and to get a genuine understanding and feel for the Hungarian culture, history and people. He selected a wonderful restaurant for us to visit on the way back into Budapest. On day 2 we spent a lot of time exploring the Roman ruins in Budapest, lunch at a true Hungarian (no other tourists, just some construction) restaurant, the Holocaust Museum, Heroes Square, Széchenyi Spa. All in all, well worth our time and money!!!
"Legendary" - it is true. I have to agree with the one who wrote about the "legendary" guide Zoltan. We did Classic and Jewish Budapest tours with him. The best tours ever!

My Hungarian grandmother would be proud!. Hungary was the best part of our trip to Europe. I might be biased as I have roots in Hungary! We had the most wonderful day with Zolton! He was so kind to take us on a long tour of both the city and the country. We started our adventure going to Turkish baths and ended dancing with the gypsies and drinking Hungarian Moonshine! I felt very safe with Zolton and his knowledge of his country was truly amazing. You have to take this trip!!!!!

Beautiful Budapest Tour. We went on a tour with Zoltan.It was the Jewish Tour of Budapest. This "legendary" person made the tour legendary indeed.Knowledge, interpretation, enjoyment, Judaism, Hungarian spirit, history, actualities ALL WERE PARTS OF OUR ENJOYMENT! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED TO EVERYONE!

Would give this tour 6 stars if it was possible -- Book Zoltan now!. We went on a tour of Budapest with Zoltan last week. We had a very tight schedule that afternoon and he was on time and provided us with an amazing tour of the city in just 3 hours. My wife and I have previously been on dozens of these tours all over the world and can say without a doubt that Zoltan was one of the best experiences we have ever had. His tour was informative but not too formal and we felt like we were walking with a knowledgeable professor and friend. He really brought the history to life and we walked away with a much better understanding of the city and its history than we ever could have achieved on our own. It was a great introduction and we covered so much ground that it made the rest of our trip that much easier to navigate. His enthusiasm and passion really came through and we couldn't recommend his services more highly. Worth every penny. We just wish we had more time so we could have booked him again! Thanks Zoltan!

Strolling the city with a friend.... I spent a wonderful Sunday afternoon with Zoltan! I wanted to see things that were off the beaten track and I wasn't disappointed. We spent three wonderful hours walking in the city, from the Jewish ghetto to around the Opera and Zoltan showed me many buildings, details that I had completely missed when walking in those streets. He knows so much about the history of his city, every little details of this or that building and stories that you won't read anywhere. Plus he is a genuinely wonderful person. It felt like spending a Sunday afternoon with a friend, talking, laughing, having fun :) For sure if I go back to Budapest I will pay him another visit because he has tons of things to share and is very adaptable to whatever you're interested in. Highly recommend :)

Great personalised tour from a highly knowledgeable guide. This tour, is really great if you want to get to know, the real Hungary and Hungarians. Zoltan is really knowledgeable and highly entertaining. We prefer a more loose and unstructured type tour and he was one of the few guides, that could accommodate that and yet at the end of the day, we still felt, we got better insight into Hungarian lives than most other tours that just focus on tourist traps. Highly recommend.

A thoughtful, magical, and insightful tour!. Zoltan knows Budapest well. With strong interests in politics, religion, culture and languages, and history, he presents a dynamic and unique city with a fluid identity. My husband and I wanted to see things not listed in the guidebooks, things no tourist would find, and Zoltan was able to show us!- The courtyard of a gypsy apartment building with the largest fig tree I've ever seen- A small Hasidic synagogue with halls choked with the heavy, greasy smell of cooked fat and stocked with crumbling religious texts over 100 years old- A locals' indoor market lined with vendors enveloped in cigarette smoke- A wonderful Buda restaurant filled with Hungarian families and fresh foodMore importantly, Zoltan shared the story behind so many of the places and people he introduced to us. The depth of his knowledge and his enthusiasm to share it made our time with him one of the best travel experiences of our lives. I cannot recommend Zoltan enough! His prices are extremely fair, and you get so much more than a memorized, stamped-and-approved city tour. With Zoltan you get something real, something personal. He won't whitewash his responses, and he won't shy away from the hard questions. He truly is the thinking-person's tour guide! Please make some time with him - you will be so glad you did!

Excellent!. To Professor Zoltan NAGYDear Zoltan,We would like to thank you very much for the exceptional tour you have organized for us in Budapest (The Romans in Budapest).We were really impressed by your high professionalism and the love you are in city with, the easy way you provide difficult historical facts according to the interests of the listeners and their level. We were impressed by your fluent Russian as well as your respect to the culture and traditions of different nations, your knowledge of the history and the modernity. Especially, it is important to mention your ability to compare the cultural traditions of different nations, your tolerance and deep understanding and revelation of the common and special in the historical process.In general, your tour differs A LOT from the standard “city tours”, which unfortunately can easily make the impression of such a beautiful city as Budapest looking “standard”, toneless and faceless.In our opinion, only such creative approach, emphasis on its uniqueness, reveal of the City icon, the spirit of the place ("Genius Loci") may let the City to save its status and make it even higher in XXI century.Therefore your “multidimensional” view on the past and the present of the Budapest is not only interesting but obviously the only possible view in the new century of impetuous innovations and loads of the information.Once again, thanks A LOT for your interesting, unusual, authorial stories and walks in Budapest, which made the impression of the city so unique and unforgettable!Best regards,Prof. Fomenko Georgy, PhD in GeographyFomenko Marina, candidate of geographical scienceJanuary 2012

A wonderful tour, with a wonderful tour guide. Had one day with Zoltan in Budapest, after a few days of wandering around on our own. What a difference that one guided day made on our impression of the city and the trip. He was great... knowledgeable and charming. He showed us the city from an insider's perspective and gave us insight to the history, culture, and people of a remarkable city. This day was the highlight of our trip.

Unforgettable honeymoon!. Hi, Dear Rockhoppers! I've been in Hungary and I was using your extraordinary and very well tailored guiding around Budapest,... I have a lots of friend around here, and quiet a few people was asking about me from Hungary. My best young friends just married in last year in February, and no money left for a good, very special honeymoon.... I didn't hesitate and I offered for them a nice, happy, but very interesting journey and I recommended Rockhoppers, especially Zoltan Nagy,..:o)) When they came back to Southland, they were more than happy: their relationship just got tighter than ever before,.... Zoltan is not only a very good presenter, he's like a good psychologist, when he'd seen a little wave between this young couple, he found very quickly a perfect solution of it!.... Chris and Rene just loved rockhoppers and Hungary!

Tailored to our interests, interesting and thorough insight.. My boyfriend and I were headed to Budapest and wanted a tour that was relaxed and informative - this was just that. Zoltan was quick to respond to my email about a tour, and right away set up a meeting place and time. He came to our hotel and after a few minutes of informal "get to know eachother" conversation and going over what we wanted to accomplish and how much time, we headed out on foot. He was friendly and very knowledgable about Budapest and it's rich culture and history. We covered a lot of territory in 3 hours - by foot, subway and bus. Famous baths, monuments, elaborate coffee shops, the Castle, Museum locations, etc. Every stop had a story. I thought it was a great value for the cost. Seeing the city this way on the first day allowed us to have an understanding of how to get around Budapest and what we should focus our time on. It's a great way to see the city.

Brilliant day wandering around a fascinating city.. I did the Budapest Classic Tour with Zoltan. It is an excellent half day seeing the big tourist attractions, with many hidden delights along the way. Definitely do the public transport option, the walking is certainly not onerous - and the trams and metro are quaint and ridiculously efficient. Also I could easily then negotiate the city myself.
A lot of information, with fun, in a very friendly way. Friendly, informative,(with a lot of hidden secret), some 6 hours passed with fun, and without any minute boring.

Great trip. We spent the day with Zoltan in early December. First we walked thru the Jewish Quarter, and then did the Danube Bend tour. Zoltan was a wealth of information and knows so much history. Too bad it was foggy and we couldn't appreciate the countryside, but we had a great day anyway. This is so much better than being on a bus with a huge group. We highly recommend a tour with Zoltan!

Jewish Tour. While walking in Budapest, I met a small group of people in the yard of a synagogue. The guy that lead the group was telling the group very excitingly, so I joined them. We went to small and hidden synagogues as well, where there were no tourists but friendly rabbis and people. The day became much longer than I expected, but I am far from regretting it.

A Great Day with the Rockhoppers. We had a great day with the Rockhoppers. We only asked for a morning tour to see interesting places in Budapest, however, having lunch together, we decided to continue the day together. Zoltan took us deep in the life of the city - both past and present. The grey city on the grey day became vivid and colourful! Thanks!

Good tour that can accommodate anyone. I took this tour with my mother who can't walk very far. Zoltan was very accommodating and picked us up at the hotel and drove us around Budapest. He was very informative with interesting historical stories. I recommend this tour to people who would like a custom tour.

A brilliant day, spent with Zoltan, a very interesting man with a great deal of knowledge about Budapest and the surroun. Thirteen of us spent a brilliant day with Zoltan and his wife visiting places beyond Budapest. We stopped at various places along the journey to see wonderful views and had many many intereseting things told to us. We stopped at Szentendre, which is a beautiful and interesting place along the Danube. I could have spent more time exploring this place had time allowed, as there was much to see and do. Among other stops we visited the Castle at Visegrad with incredible views of the Danube bend. We then went to Esztergom where the massive basilica sits on the side of the Danube, We even had time to cross the Danube to the Slovak Republic to a little village where we had a beer!! The evening was spent with Zoltan and ths wife Judit at a lovely restaurant.Next time I visit Budapest I would certainly take another tour with Zoltan

THE ROMANS IN BUDAPEST. You find some pebbles and it turns out that they were stepping-stones of the Roman Empire. It is just all right when you find them in Italy, but to find them in Budapest, Hungary, is something unexpected!You hop in a Land Rover and at every stop there is something to see from 2000 years earlier!And before you get tired, you have a rest in a wine cellar tasting fantastic wines!Be sure to know the limit!

The best day of our trip!. The best advice I have is to email him- he will either add you to an existing group or offer a private tour. For us, we emailed asking for the same day as one other young lady- we three toured together with Zoltan as our guide. It was amazing!! He knows the history of the city, and has a story for a building on every block. We stopped several times for drinks and a break at our request, he even took us into a ruin pub for a palinka, and later had a glass of wine with us at Faust. I know that a normal group tour would not have been as accommodating, as open to our wishes, or as fun! There was a cheese festival in a square and we all went on for a look around. We popped in alleys and courtyards to see how real people live "behind the scenes". I was hesitant to hire a guide. When I emailed him I told him that I had planned to take the popular "Free walking tours". He assured me that he had worked for them before and would show us the same sights plus more. We are so glad we went with him. We werent rushed and left with a friend in Budapest. He is extremely knowledgeable, personable, and warm-hearted. He even offered to send us an info or links to information we may forget or want to explore further. I highly recommend a tour with Zoltan ! Any other info please ask.

trip to budapest oct 2011. my daughter and i visited budapest mid october 2011. we were not prepared for the beauty of this city and regretted that we only allowed 2 1/2 days to stay. after we spent one full day just walking around we decided to take a tour guide for the next day. we were so lucky to end up with a wonderful guide by the name of zoltan nagy. he is from budapest and loves his city, and that reflected in his approach to show us budapest through his eyes. unfortunately we had to leave the next morning, otherwise we would have taken another tour with him. my daughter and i have decided to revisit budapest in the near future and with the help of zoltan get to know that wonderful city to its fullest. thank you zoltan.

Great Experience with a Private Guide. We stayed in Budapest for two extra days following the conclusion of our river cruise. We had one day of tours from the cruise (Parliament, Market, and drive around Pest and Buda from viewing site). Later we explored the Buda side on our own. The second day we stayed in Pest and explored with less success. Our last day was with Zoltan for what was supposed to be a half day. We had a wonderful experience and saw so many sites that we would never have experienced on our own. Zoltan's knowledge is encyclopaedic. His English is flawless and idiomatic. His personality is warm, welcoming and his sense of humor is great. We visited sites we wanted to see - but didn't know existed until he took us there. I even learned how to use the subway which was a treat for me.
